text:
This place wasn't on my list of must eat here, but we were by the square, waiting to kill time before heading to the airport, noticed a pretty courtyard, so we decided to snack on some light appetizers & drinks. 

Service....blah....workers seem to be more interested in hanging out 

Drinks weren't strong. 

Charbroiled oysters, yeah these weren't it! Go to Felix's! 

Calamari was based and so was the shrimp 

Banana pudding, nothing to rave out. 

Like I mentioned it wasn't on my to do list, but it also wasn't good.

Excellent customer service, emmacutely clean changing rooms and bathrooms, live piano music on the weekends... I love this department store!  I love visiting the perfume ladies at the make up counter because they are very generous with their perfume samples.

Yes, the prices are expensive at Nordstrom.  But they have an excellent selection of designer brand labels and the clothes do occassionally go on sale.  You can find some great finds on the clearance rack!

My one major gripe: please rethink your clothing section names in the women's department. What does Narrative, Savvy, or Individualist mean?!  Just direct me to the Petite's department please!  I did find out that Encore means Plus Size, ha-ha... pretty witty!

I had a disappointing visit this Friday. I loved my experience last time but tonight was so lackluster. My stylist was nice but had to work both the register and style me due to the manager not coming in which meant I was sitting around a lot and the service took twice as long. I waited for someone to come back to finish my hair for around 20 minutes.

I think under these circumstances a discount  or free blow dry should be given as I didn't get the full level of service that the other clients did. It was not a relaxing or fun experience and I was disappointed. At this point I don't think I'll be back, though blo out isn't much better.

What the living bleep?.... Green hills Kroger has turned into a crappy Walmart. There are barely any people at the registers and the rest is self checkout. No bleeping thank you on the self checkout. Plus the woman who has been working this area is an ever living peace of work that is so bleeping  rude, tries to bully the customers; yeah just one horrible employee. So bleep you Kroger. Going to start shopping anywhere than this store. Oh did I mention that your rearrangement of the store does not make sense and is insanely frustrating!!!! I understand that we are in the midst of a pandemic but good gracious Kroger y'all can do a whole lot better than that. Improve, get better, hire more people, remove the bitch from the self checkout area, and get a clue by listening to this review and make the corrections to be the store you used to be.

Second visit to Philly with a must stop at Rita's and I even had a case of viral laryngitis!  I tried the Sour Patch Kids red and although it was REALLY sweet, the reminder of my childhood memories came to life with how precise this flavor is!  Love it every time!  And the staff is super friendly!

Tim fixed our 2004 Astro van. The brake lines were rusted. It was a project. It did cost more than estimated for just break lines but other things needed done so the cost was at the highest estimate. All good and they did the work in time projected.
Happy to be able to drive our van safely.

Cozy Italian spot located in Davis island. One of my favorite things about Oggi is it's a full 4 course dining experience with the entree. Nothing is absolute spectacular but I've never had anything I wouldn't order again. My favorite is their bucatini.

We've been to many swingers clubs around the world and this is far from the best
State laws may dictate some of the weird rules (we don't know) 
But single guys are restricted to one hallway of the play area and you have to "ask nicely" to be allowed in a room with a time limit imposed 
No cell phones ....... I friggin hate the "don't do as I do do as I tell you rules"
It felt like we were disturbing the staff in asking to be let into the main play area as they we all so engrossed in their phones........ and walking through play areas with phones in hand. 

definitely "ok" but could have so much more potential ..... weird ideas!!

Oh and the lady on reception -  never ever have I been met by such a miserable host ....... of you don't want to work there go get another job ma'am.

Clean and spacious room you would expect for the springhill suite. However, it's quite outdated. Different colors of wallpaper on different walls clash the green and gold carpeting that is also quite antiquated. The restroom is good size, with sufficient counterspace and mirror that is outside of the actual bathroom/shower area. The shower has a tub that was old and stained. The plastic shower curtain was due for replacement. The lighting in the shower was unusually yellow and just unpleasant for the eye. The wallpaper in there was also light green which made for a strange combination. We had a two queen bed and the TV was on the right side of one of the beds so one of the beds had nearly no visual to it. Mattresses comfortable. Free breakfast and wifi, free parking that is plentiful but poor snow cleanup outside. Staff was pleasant but nothing to boast about, I waited 5 minutes at the front desk for sign in and she apologized because she was filling up the coffee machine. Location is decent but we were here for family so didn't care for the city much, so can't speak for the location as much as others may be able to. 
Pros: clean, comfortable beds, free wifi and breakfast
Cons: outdated, strange layout, snow removal poor
Super yummy old school diner that is worth the wait. Lots of variety on the menu. Friendly servers and delish diner food.

Excellent service from start to finish with our window install!  The quality if the windows is fantastic.  Immediate decrease in cold air and noise.  8 windows installed in 5.5 hours in a snow storm in a pandemic by two guys who made sure there was no tracking on the floor, wore masks the entire time, and communicated everything throughout the process.  The whole experience has been top notch.  Oh and let's not forget the actual windows.  Super stoked with the product!!!  

Window deets:
U-Factor = 0.26
Solar Heat Gain Coefficient = 0.30
Visible Transmittance = 0.54
Air leakage = 0.3 (actually less than or equal to, but Yelp doesn't allow that...)

I was heading to McDonalds when I saw Hatties was open.  I thought I would give it a chance and glad I did.

Food was good, coffee is roast in house and direct from farmers.  The latte was a bit weak, but fine. The atmosphere could use a little work, but ever since it was a burger joint, they completely changed the layout. (making it a hard space to work with).

The people that own this place are great.  Customer service is down home and super friendly.  Free Wi-Fi to boot!  So, all in all, a nice local alternative.

A fantastic community including a walking trail, theater, and retirement community. Come here during the holidays and you'll be wowed by the Way of Lights.

If you drive to the far west side of the grounds, there is a fantastic view of St. Louis.

Decided to give it one more try ....it was worse than the first time. My daughter showed them a picture of a sage colored nail design and the manicurist started painting her nails a neon green, my daughter stopped her and said that it wasn't quite the color she was wanting. The lady replied in a very rude tone "Well you go get your color"..... listen, if I am going to drop $100.00 at a nail salon, I am not going to be treated rudely and that was the second time. Never again, and I would strongly suggest that you not waste your money either. My daughter was willing to pick her own color at the beginning but the lady said, she knew the exact color and to sit down..... I have a place in Greenwood that is amazing and I will continue to drive out there to be treated with respect, get what we are paying for and to pay an establishment that is top notch.... Orchid Nails at Greenwood Mall.... they are exceptional. We must be very spoiled.

I'm a Flying Saucer Monday Pint Night sort of gal.

This place has a FANTASTIC selection of beer. If there is one reason I would keep going back it would be for that.

Bait and switch from internet pricing. Offered a good truck at a reasonable price, but when it came time to do paperwork it was double the asking price. No explanation,  just said it went from $4970 $7500.  Negotiated price was $5900. Suffice to say i didn't buy the it. Perfect truck bad dealership.  SO PISSED OFF.

Carreta's serves solid Tex Mex at reasonable prices.

Portions are larger than average, and on our visits the chips always have arrived warm--a definite plus.  

Fajitas arrive sizzling as they should, with plenty of everything except tortillias.  I considered asking for more, but after a large drink and about a thousand tortillia chips, I figured I was good on the carbs for this particular meal. 

Beware the large marguerita. You might want to see the glass before you order it, as it comes in a round glass the size of a honeydew half.  It was a lot of alcohol, even for a Chopsley-sized individual (i.e., 6'5 and outweighing wife and daughter combined. And no, the daughter does not weigh eight pounds.  Though on one visit a decade ago, she actually did:  Following her first visit to the pediatrician at age 4 (days) across the street, her parents--who had solidly resolved not to expose her to the public "for a few weeks"--came out hungry and saw Caretta's on the other side of Veterans.  SO much for parental resolve and besides, we reasoned that "It will build her immune system".  The staff and other patrons were thrilled and a little shocked to see such a tiny one.

Just had the best massage of my life by Jaime! Also an amazing facial by Andrea! They are not afraid to spend a little extra time with you to make sure all your needs have been addressed. No up selling either. A very nice change from the other places around town. I loved this place and will definitely be back!

This has been my gym since 2007, and I go almost every day.  I usually swim, but I've also used the weight machines and taken yoga and spinning classes.  The staff is friendly and the new addition on the north side (completed in about 2015 or so) is big and beautiful.  If there is one improvement I would make, it's that the lockers would be repaired and cleaned - they're a bit dilapidated and some are broken.  But that's not a huge deal.  In general, a fine gym and a great location.
We love their pizza, and everything else on their menu.  So sad they relocated from the south side.

I took my sister here for the first time this past week to try their Saturday chocolate tour. Their tour is free and they give you two samples of chocolates at the end. It was interesting to hear more about how a chocolate factory works. The tour guide was friendly and knowledgeable. After the tour, you are able to extend the tour and try 5 chocolates in their tasting room for $5. I would highly recommend this. I absolutely loved all of their chocolates. They even made a banana chocolate taste good. In addition to the great flavors, I absolutely love the fact that they label their chocolates with a capital letter. I hate biting into a chocolate and not knowing the flavor of the chocolate. What a great idea!  

There are a few additional things worth noting. First, they have an oops wall where they sell their chocolates at a discount. I frequently come here and head straight to the wall where I pick up a $6 pack of strawberry-filled chocolates. Finally, you can buy a $5 reusable bag from them. Every time you come back with the bag, they give you a chocolate covered strawberry for free! Completely worth it!

The only downside to this place is their limited hours. I really wish they were open past 5 PM on weekdays. However, I believe their location on Chippewa has extended hours if you're dying for some chocolate past 5 PM.

Cute clean place!

Stylist Ashley Wilcher asked me what I was wanting... gave me a FANTASTIC wash and head massage. Then cut and blow dry and trimmed and framed me up.
We chatted a little, but it was VERY nice that she let me relax and enjoy some quite time... I had been a little stressed and tired, loved the quiet relaxation without the forced small talk... would have liked to chat more and get to know her a bit more... but maybe next time.

Ashley was also very informative about the products she used on my hair... I love this so I am able to recreate the look and or purchase/try new suggested products.

Salon 6... I think I have found my new salon!! YEAH!!!

First I should start off with saying that I'm not vegan so the lack of cheese is sometimes hard to get over in certain dishes. I really like cashew cheese though so I can still enjoy vegan food. 

I was looking forward to trying this restaurant but I felt the dishes were very hit-and-miss. We started with the empanadas, which were fabulous (not to mention a good-sized appetizer).  We then tried the street tacos, macadamia nut crostini, and the risotto. The street tacos were huge!! I liked the flavor but felt like the tacos needed cheese or something else a bit creamy to make them less dry (there was salsa but not enough in terms of volume or flavor). 

The macadamia nut crostini was the opposite - so creamy with the macadamia nut cheese that it was hard to get the crostini down your throat. The flavors were good but there was too much cheese. 

The mushroom risotto was surprisingly very good. I normally don't like mushrooms or risotto (too creamy) but this dish was very flavorful and not too heavy. 

We finished with the cheesecake and baklava. The baklava was better, in my opinion (cheesecake was just average).  

I think this place probably has some wonderful dishes but I don't think we ordered wisely.  I should have read some reviews on Yelp before dining here!

Terrible service and terrible food.  Upon entering the restaurant, I was immediately taken aback by how dirty the restaurant was.  It isn't a place you can go sit and have a meal.  Just a carry out restaurant with a few tables and chairs.  There was trash all over the floor, the tables and chairs.  Restaurant had not been cleaned in weeks and showed.  My son really wanted to order so we proceeded to the counter to order.  There was no appreciation for the customer or the money being spend.  Very caviler and borderline rude when taking order.  We ended up getting shrimp lo mein and honey chicken.  Both subpar and not worth any money.  I would NOT recommend this location.  Save your money.

Hands down this is one of my favorite spots for breakfast.  Let's start with the basics.  The restaurant is a nice size and has plenty of seating.  The service is always above par. Very friendly and attentive waiters and waitress. Let's move on the menu and food. First, I am a huge fan of breakfast and I can eat it for all three meals.  The menu is full of healthily selections that are more than just small bleep on the menu.  They have a variety of healthy options that include egg whites, healthy grains and fresh fruit to top of your selection.  The coffee is to die for.  I typically have the egg white omelette with Turkey along with wheat toast.  Do not sleep on this restaurant it is well worth the visit.

Ordering carry out burritos and margaritas was the best decision I've made today! We haven't had food from here since the pandemic began and it was SOOO comforting to have it again. I feel ashamed it took me this long! I really loved that i could place my order online - easy peasy. 

The margaritas were just as good at home as they are in the restaurant, but missing the lovey ambiance. My only regret was not ordering double the drinks. Burritos were massive! We both only ate half and are looking forward to leftovers tomorrow.

Really enjoyed the pizza here. As the other review said, it's similar to other build your own pizza places. I came in for lunch on opening day and had a pepperoni w roasted garlic. It is hands down the best thin crust pepperoni pizza I've had. They really piled on the pepperoni which is very important. I enjoyed the pizza so much I took my wife back for dinner that night. We ordered the Woody which is a ranch sauce based pizza w chicken, artichokes, and bacon. That was also very good. This will be my go to pizza joint in North Valley.

Awful. Absolutely the worst customer service I've ever had to deal with. The building I live in would be fantastic if not for the nonstop construction that has been happening since just after I moved in. Originally they were just fixing the windows, and there's a giant dumpster on one side of the building and a giant trailer on the other in the parking lot that constantly blocks the minimal spots available, but now there are extremely apparent structural issues in the building and Terrier has answered ZERO questions. They frequently pass emails back and forth in their office so you either don't receive any response or multiple unhelpful and unconcerned answers that never actually answer your question. At one point they even said the structural issues might cause them to move people around the building and then stopped answering all together. The owner, Laurie, has been rude over the phone multiple times and their business is very poorly run. DO NOT RENT FROM THEM. All their buildings are falling apart and all Terrier is interested in is money, not the well being of the people trapped in their rentals.

Stumbled into this cozy bakery and desert shoppe in St. Pete. Sampled the lemon cupcake and chocolate bacon (chocolate "swine" as the label read!), as well as the chocolate covered ginger candies. The cupcake was OK. The cake itself was delicious and moist. However, the frosting slid right off, was extremely sweet, and added little flavor wise to the cupcake. Their other selections seemed quite tasty, and when in St. Pete again, I will definitely be back to try maybe another flavor. The chocolate ginger pieces were quite tasty, and very different. A bit of sweet and spice in every bite. The serve their treats on little "silver" platters if you dine in, which adds to the quaint atmosphere.

Friendly service, decent selection of pastries and other items. Simple menu that's easy on the wallet.
The queso and guayaba empanadas are tasty and Colombian style.
I ordered the revueltillo with ham/cheese and it was good. Not fast food, fyi. Be prepared to wait.

Thai food has sooooo many options in this town. Food was pretty good but I wouldn't say it was worth all the hype I've hear around town. We got pad Thai, drunken noods, and spring rolls. All great but very plain.

This one of the best bbq spots I have ever had. The place wasn't busy actually it was fairly empty because it was storming out but I would think on a Sunday day it would be definitely pack. 

One of the workers recommended the Sweet and Spicy Turkey Melt so I got that and a side of fries with white cheddar cheese sauce on them. There is no words to describe how good that sandwich was. It has candied bacon jam, smoked tomato mayo, house-pickled jalapeños, swiss, on sourdough bread. Definitely come back for this. The fries were well cooked and seasoned perfectly. 

Also, got the fried ribs which were sauced in "the standard" bbq. These were very good as well. And let me not forget the service here. The people that served me were phenomenal. I recommend this spot to everyone who looks on this page.
The address is not correct on Yelp . It's take you to some greenhouse. La Crap de la Boise. We went home and made our crepes.

Dr. Dukes and his staff members are the best! My husband and I visited his office often for teeth cleaning and whitening during the year leading up to our wedding. Dr. Dukes and all the staff remembered us each time and we enjoyed keeping them up to date on wedding planning. Just days before the wedding, I (Nikki) felt a cold sore coming on and was surprised to learn that Dr. Dukes had a special laser that could be used to kill the bacteria and stop the cold sore from growing. His staff were able to fit me in for an emergency appointment an hour after I made the call. They even called back to check on me the next day!

Later that week, when we got married, we both had great smiles and were cold-sore free.

We could not be more happy with the entire office, staff, and care that we have received over the years. The rest of our family feels the same way. We all highly recommend Mesa Dental. 

Thanks, Dr. Dukes!

- Robby and Nikki Barthelmess

Metropolitan Lawn services
436 3rd Ave
Harvey , La 70058
504-912-0015

Hey guy and gals this is a very special review only because (ELITE COUNCIL BOARD MEMBERS), we want to give the businesses and the community the best of info on the businesses that make New Orleans and 
" Lu ezee anna'' great. We have just that. Check out what I mean.

I met with Metropolitan Lawn services, I was given three businesses to choose from , and I picked at random, Metropolitan Lawn Services.  I got a call from the secretary of the company named Martine ( ooooh I can use martine right now, ooops sorry I fell off track ) uh huh. I found out that Mr. Brown is 1 of 21 children, that his mother gave birth to. Him being one of the youngest, and all of his brothers and sisters turned out to be valuable contributors to america. What a Feat of His mother. 

Anyway Martine ( pronounced, Marteen )took all my info and and before 10 minutes had passed, Mr. Orlando Brown, owner, called me. 

We discussed my needs, what it would cost and we set up a time to meet. We met, He brought one of his best workers, named Sheldon, and the work started. I had requested flowerbeds to be turned over and weeded, my eucalyptus tree to be cut down or cut and trimmed ,my overgrown shrubs and plants to be groomed and trimmed, my crepe myrtles to be trimmed at the knuckles (as per Orlando, he told me to call him Orlando, nah, dat's right, uh huh) to remove the the elephant ears and weedy trees from my carport, to mulch and reset the edging with a different look all around two thirds of the house, to remedy my tuff barn roof that was damages by eta, to trim my hedges and to give my lawn and grass its normal treatment. He does more than lawn services.

I told my bosses at YELP, I was given Metropolitan as one of the three to use and I would give them the skivvy on my experience to, hopefully change the negative review this business got and metropolitan will get the accolades deserved.  Here goes, he, Mr. Orlando was on time, he had every move synced. His staffer Martine was there to advise Orlando of any info that couldn't reach Orlando quickly, she's a good secretary a sweetheart, and a people person.

Orland had every piece of equipment he needed to complete the job, he and Sheldon, had every segment cleaned up along the completion of the segment. Mr. Orlando is also a humanitarian. He has Sheldon who is a senior citizen  working,  who has somewhat of a pretty harsh past who is his right hand, as far as being dependable and capable,  While doing my job, Orlando had 70 0dd Yelp request pending a quote. That in itself speaks for his business capabilities.

What was the greatest part of this experience with Mr. Orlando Brown was the love for his wife and their future. That the job he does with his business secures their future and the  ability to hire young women from little opportunities, no matter what color, and young men with dreams of building their communities black and white and the knowledge of the usage of God's given earth. 

Hence, my experience was positive. Mr. Brown carried out every thing I needed, and he even allowed me to do my own thing ie., letting my plants and yard know that I was in the mix, my signature was on the job. That I dug into some things that I felt very close to, meant volumes to me.

Y'all  dat's how we roll heah in Na'U' Ally N'u'Awlins Y'all. Orlando Brown gives his best  no matter what level economically is your home.  I am as  happy as a bird on a conveyor belt of birdseed, huh, yeah I said dat, Call him y'all tell him where u heard about him, drop your  YELP APP it's free. I'm outta heah y'all, be mindful, prayerful and be safe.... "MO" Check out the pics as soon as the review is posted, so give it an hour.

I wish I would have done more research about Justin before taking our Border Collie there.  I assumed he would know what to do with a Border Collie.  My heart stopped when I picked her up and saw he had nearly shaved her.  We are hoping she won't develop a skin condition and that her second coat will grow as beautifully as it was before.

You really can't beat this place in any way.  Honestly the amount of stars are mostly because of the way they treat you in this place.  We were greated and sat down by the owner who joked with us and made sure we were taken care of before walking away.  The service (I can't remember his name!) was just as friendly and cracked funny remarks.  Its really nice to find a place like this that is 100% like every italian restaurant back home.  So many italian restuarants down here try to froufrou/bouge themselves, they loose that family oriented atmosphere & concentrate on food presentation over taste.  This reminds me of every restaurant back at home and I did not want to leave!   But the sauce, and my Chicken parm (insert five thumbs up here).  It was a nice breath of fresh air.

Nashville, consider yourself lucky that Melissa rolled into town. She will care about eliminating you acne just as much as you do. She helped clear my eternally clogged pores, and we had fun in the process. I also learned a lot of tips from her and the resources provided by Acne Specialists. Best of all, she made me glow on my wedding day.

Moonlight boba was a delightful quaint little boba tea shop. We tried the classic thai tea, the winter melon, and the lychee slush. All teas were super delicious and refreshing. The boba was so fresh! The scenery was a little dark giving an ominous vibe when first entering. Overall, the staff was super friendly and would definitely be back again.

Highly recommended, high quality practitioner. I've been to many chiropractors in the last 30 years, and Dr. B is among the best I've seen. I appreciate the different modalities he works into therapy, which has been really helpful speeding up lower back issues. It's really apparent he genuinely cares about his patients.

I had never been here before and met my daughter for lunch on Saturday. I ordered the spicy tuna nachos and spicy tuna donut. My daughter got a burrito. Everything tasted fantastic. The restaurant was clean and the 2 girls that worked there were friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed coming here to eat.

The most consistent pizza you'll get! Been going here for 16yrs! Same owners and same pizza quality! They remember our name and ask about our family! The calzones are on point and we LOVE the breadsticks!! Eat here!

The provider, Keyl PAC, Nasreen was extremely rude to me and my daughter.
My daughter injured her ankle and wanted to get an xray, just to make sure nothing was broken.   The provider tried to refuse having the xray taken.  She made my 16yr old daughter extremely uncomfortable and was even ruder to me, the mother of a 16yr old.  She went so far as to treat me as if I was not in the room.  When she tried to refuse the xray, I stated that the only reason for our visit was for an xray.  The provider then proceeded to make us wait an exceptionally long time for a simple xray.  The rudeness was constant throughout the visit.  The other staff members were pleasant and seemed embarrassed by her rude behavior.  This leads me to believe that my daughter and I are not the first patient that Keyl PAC, Nasreen has been rude to.  This behavior should be addressed.  We will never use this Next Care site again.  Hopefully, the other Next Care sites will have more professional providers.

Well these folks are finally back in business. After several weeks of closure and losing a couple of hired hands, they're chugging back along. Phone was ringing like mad, a few walk-in folks too (of whom I was one).  Same friendly young couple is still running it with extended family. Hubby was at wok tonight while wifey ran register and answered phone.

These folks have not lost a beat, either. They still don't deliver, but that isn't likely to change anytime soon. That, and a somewhat mediocre egg roll still leaves them at a good 4-Star rating. I'd say 4 and a half, actually.

Queen Bee got her usual Krab Rangoon. I don't see how she likes a plain old fried wonton skin with cream cheese and krab juice. She does, though: especially here. Same holds true for her own thought process  as I had the usual shrimp toast. Greasy, guilty pleasure that would make Forrest Gump proud. He'd also have to walk another 100 miles to burn off all those oily carbs...either that or keel over dead of a coronary after chowing down on these four bad boys!

Wonton soup still yummy; good broth and some scallion pieces complement the non soggy and pleasantly plump packages of porcine pasta pleasure. Egg roll crisp and decent sized for a FL take out joint. A lot of bok Choi and carrot; little pork. Eh...

Three items ordered to see if they still have it down in the old Doo Wok A Doo Department. General Tso chicken and also roast pork with snow peas. Last one was my go to pork fried rice.  Queen Bee likes the first as a rule and she LOVED this rendition. Pieces of real white meat chicken still a little crisp and packed a wee bit of good heat at the end.

Pork with snow peas also great! Generous amount of sliced pork, along with a nice load of tender, snappy pea pods, along with some bok Choi, water chestnuts, etc in a fantastic sauce. BTW: see those pictures I posted? Those were both the SMALL size!

Pork fried rice was jammed to the brim of the oyster pail. They got it just the way I like: dark, well done and with a load of bean sprouts.  Both of the owners are very receptive to special requests like this. I guess it helps that I know them and they recognize me. 

Last item is that they put up plexiglass at the counter, and even had a mike-and-speaker system installed. There's also a trap door for cash and a bigger one for food bags...no touching or close contact at all. Their small dining area is now totally blocked off by the tables, which are now used for paper goods, sauces and menus. Take it and go! Yay, China One!!!
This place is fantastic!!!! You have to see Kim, the owner. She is amazing, fast, thorough, and very reasonably priced.

Amazing location, tucked away and sitting on a lake. Ordered 2 burgers, the American and the Fire 94. For the American burger, the bacon was asked to be put on the side it was obviously cooked earlier and not reheated at all. Both burgers were served with brioche buns that were stale and hard. The fish nuggets that were served as an appetizer were delicious, it is a shame that the rest of our meal did not command the same performance. For the cost and the limited selection of the menu, I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
Awesome place after we were refused service at Longhorn steakhouse! We had a large party and they took us with no hesitation. Thanks again for being decent

My last hotel stay during my trip to New Orleans in November 17, 2019 was near the new MSY airport at the La Quinta hotel and suites here in Kenner.

I would have checked into this hotel about 2 hours earlier and enjoyed dinner in comfort, but I was delayed due to a late Amtrak train from Birmingham, AL to New Orleans, stopping in Meridian, MS where I was. It was so frustrating, but made it back after snagging an uber and arrived around 10pm to the hotel. I checked in right away and tried to get to bed right away, as a 7am flight out of New Orleans was on deck the next morning. I have enjoyed the La Quinta hotel brand whenever I get a chance, although sometimes in some cities, this brand can be a bit more pricey than normal. In this case, it was around my price range and it had an airport shuttle, so I can make my flight out of New Orleans on time. Prices per night hover around $75-$90 per night without the taxes and fees, which is reasonable for someone like me on a budget. The check in service was good and fast.  For the airport shuttle, since it was the first trip of the morning at 5am, we just had to be present in the lobby 10 minutes prior to departure. The front desk said sometimes the complimentary breakfast opens early for guests who leave early, but it wasn't the case for me. I eventually found something at the airport for breakfast. 

All in all, can't complain too much. The La Quinta hotel and suites here in Kenner was a good place to rest my head and it's close to the airport for a fast and easy exit. The overall experience here at this La Quinta hotel and Suites - New Orleans airport was nice, clean, and quick, especially when you have a 7am flight departure the next morning. Everything seems like a quicker stay when that happens. This La Quinta hotel and suites is located at 2610 Williams Blvd in Kenner and about 1.5 miles from the main terminal at the New Orleans international airport. Best bet would be to take the airport shuttle to and from the airport, but you'd probably need to call them when you're ready for pick up. Or if you want to get there sooner, consider Uber or Lyft at your discretion, although it'll be cheap, probably around $10. The La Quinta hotel and suites accepts major credit cards, which is always a good thing. They also check your driver's license for identity. They have a generous parking options here too.  There is public transportation options here too, take the Jefferson Transit or New Orleans Transit Authority bus from the airport, where there's a stop there and one on Veteran's Blvd and Williams Blvd. Take Route E-1.

For the most part though, my stay here at the La Quinta hotels and suites near the New Orleans airport was brief, but needed. The room itself was standard and clean. The bed was a king bed and it was quite nice to be able to get in a good 6 hours or so before waking up and scrambling to check out and make it to the airport shuttle on time. Everything worked properly in the room, although I did not use the television during my stay, nor the microwave or the mini fridge. I wished I did, but I can thank the delayed Amtrak train for not having to enjoy those amenities at the hotel. I did enjoy this one episode while waiting for the airport shuttle. This guest was pretty frantic about getting back into her room, trying to get her belongings, but the front desk staff was adamant about not letting her back into the hotel room, since she wasn't the one who made the reservation. I knew it was a liability and safety issue for the hotel employees, but its tough luck for this lady.  My heart goes out to the lady, but what can you do? Still, it was an interesting way to wake up on a Monday morning, that's for sure. I would recommend staying here, if you had a late arrival or early departure out of New Orleans international airport. Or if you're passing through the area and need a place, that's good too. The hotel is clean and comfortable and somewhat budget friendly, but safe. Quite nice for a getaway in New Orleans.

4.0 stars for the overall experience. 4.0 stars for the check in and out service. 3.0 stars for the prices, but 4.5 stars for the room comfort and the 6 hours of deep sleep.

Support local!

B

Drinks are good! Only reason I would go back is for the drinks. Food was okay. I had the Jack Daniels burger w fries. The onion rings on the burger were overcooked. I also had the garlic Parmesan wings. The flavor was good, but the wings needed to be cooked a little longer. We also had the birria burger. I was disappointed in that. The Birria meat was cold. Now the drinks... delicious! Jarri loco is a must have! Sooooo good. The mangoyada was good too. It's a nice vibe, small inside, they keep the music loud and sometimes has a DJ. They have a patio area and do karaoke some days. I went on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't too crowded. Service was still slow. Drinks was definitely the best part
Pretty good! Service was good and quick and my sushi was great! I order the Girl on Fire and the Alaska(a bougie California Roll) I would come back again.

Can't say enough about this location. They helped solve an issue that I have been trying to fix for a month. Angel went out of his way to help.

They make it feel more like a locally owned place than a corporate store.

What happened to the bagels here!?!!!  They taste like rubber.  So very disappointed we used to go all the time but the past 3 times were a huge disappointment.  The coffee and ice coffee are still good but if your looking for a bagel try someplace else. Terrible

A family member of mine who lives out of state and who has partial dementia due to Alzheimers signed a contract for some tree/yard work on her property with Strobert. She paid them a non-refundable deposit and made an appointment to have the work done. Two days prior to the appointment, another tree contractor stopped by and offered to do the work. She mistook them for Strobert, let them do the work, and paid them in full. Once we figured out what she had done, we contacted Strobert, apologized, asked if we could get any of the deposit back, or, if not, if we could simply use that as a deposit towards future tree work. We were told no, and the company simply kept her nearly $1000, despite not doing one minute's work. Yes, a signed contract is a signed contract, and a nonrefundable deposit is a nonrefundable deposit. But you know what else? Dementia is dementia, and karma is karma.

Joan Shepp is the most fashion-forward boutique in town and a worthy successor to the long-gone Nan Duskin and Toby Lerner shops.  Still miss them after all these years, but I digress. 

Joan's well-curated offerings span the gamut from the solidly avant garde like Rick Owens and Yohji Yamomoto to the somewhat more restrained designs of Phillip Lim to simple layering pieces.  This is unmistakably a high end boutique, but one can find lovely pieces at reasonable price points, too.  There is nothing wrong with being Holly Golightly at Joan Shepp, drawing inspiration from the beautiful offerings while hoping for a day when price is no object.  It will come!   I fondly recall enjoying my morning brew in front of the Walnut Street location's big picture window before the store opened and having that very dream . . . 

With a single long-standing exception (for 15 years, I have just cut a wide path around one miserable salesperson) I have always found the sales personnel to be incredibly solicitous and pleasant.  

The stunning new store fondly echoes Kirne Zabete, another one of my NY favs.  

If more Philadelphians wore Joan's clothing and fewer wore the "I have given up" offerings of Talbot's and Chico's, Philadelphia might someday land on a stylish city list.  Let's break up the monotony, people!

Since this hotel is right across the street from the Convention Center, we opted to stay here.  When I booked the reservation, I booked it for Wyndham.  Well upon arrival, we learned it had changed ownership and is now the Omni.  

The bellman, I believe his name was Chris, was the shining star of this overpriced hotel.  He was so helpful and attentive.  Upon checking in, we learned they just changed ownership that Monday (we arrive on Thursday).

The room itself was nice, as we were in the corner room that overlooks the outlet mall and convention center, so it's one of their largest rooms.  The problem, I soon discovered, is you could hear all the freakin' traffic down below.  So I went downstairs and asked the front desk person if I could have a floor fan delivered to my room.  You would have thought I was speaking Chinese or something because this guy gave me the stupidest look, then said they don't have floor fans.  What the hell kind of "upscale" hotel doesn't have a floor fan ... if nothing else, the maintenance people use them to dry wet floors.  I have NEVER had a hotel tell me they didn't have one.  He stated I could go buy one ... well no shit dude ... but I'm fairly sure I won't be able to pack that in my suitcase on the flight home!!

Flash forward a few hours ... we asked if they had bottled water in the rooms (even if I had to pay 3 times what it would normally cost to drink it) and the same jerk at the front desk tells me there's a vending machine on my floor.  AGAIN, I ask you, what the HELL kind of upscale hotel doesn't have bottled water in the room, whether complimentary or for purchase, and instead wants to inconvenience me by making me walk to it, especially if I want some water in the middle of the night???

My other complaint for my room is that the bathroom door isn't really a door, it's more like a sliding door you would find in an old barn ... not very private (I could look through the crack and see our bed) so if you're sharing the room with someone other than a spouse, they will hear all of your business while you're in there and you will feel awkward! LOL.

Overall, this is one of the WORST Omni Hotels I have ever stayed at on my travels and it simply was not worth the more than $300/night that we paid for it!
I had the Cuban sandwich today, my first, and definitely not my last!  A really really good sandwich!

Wish I could do no stars and that is such a disappointment since I'm a longtime fan and patron of the Margarita's in lansdale. This one was just an all around awful experience. 

Came on a Wednesday around 6:45 and it was not crowded so we were seated right away in the bar area. However, took more than 20 min for a waiter to come over. He told us his section was on the other side of the bar and wasn't told he was seated. It was now 7:02 which meant we could no longer before 7 to get the deal on margaritas. When I mentioned this the waiter said "I'm so sorry guys. I'll make it up to you. I'll bring you some chips. " I'm not an idiot - chips are free for all tables! Then took 10 min to bring our drinks overs and take our orders. Got the shrimp quesadilla appetizer which was the only redeeming factor of this meal. Great big juicy shrimp and corn with peppers and onions. It was delicious. The guacamole with it however was bland and completely flavorless. It was also quite brown from sitting out too long. Then came the entrees - short rib tacos and the taco trio. Both of our entrees were room temperature at best. The short rib was flavorful but dry and the white sauce on it was awful and a weird texture. The taco trio was nothing special - the chicken was dry, bland, and cold, the carnitas was the best one but also room temp. 

Certainly would never come back to this location.

Id Take a picture of my food but I eat it too quickly!What a cute please especially this evening on such a nice night . Well Here's a picture of the outside! Happy to see a cute place open up during this nasty pandemic

First time here with my husband on a Saturday night. Not crowded.  However Music on point.  Chill vibe. Nice hookah selections.  Very clean.  Glad they opened this spot up.  The only cons: I just wish they served alcohol and offered WIFI.  I will be  back
They messed up my steering column putting in a new ignition.  They were not willing to accept responsibility when they obviously did it.
From out of town and in need of a haircut and walked in here. Omid gave me a great cut and beard trim for an extremely reasonable price. Highly recommend.
Excellent service! Food was very good.  Waitress was very attentive even though they were very busy.

I was really excited about this pizza after reading a bunch of wonderful reviews. As I was skimming the menu the owner (I think it was the owner) was barking orders at his staff and extremely rude to his delivery driver. It wasn't pleasant to see and his customer service wasn't great either. I have no problem giving money to a reputable owner but I felt a little sad supporting his business after observing how he treated his staff. 

I ended up just getting a regular pizza because one was freshly made and looked delicious. I thought the pizza would hold true to the name of the store and actually be thin and crispy. However, it was your average pizza with the average crust that you see on most pizzas. I really enjoyed my pie with some hot sauce but was still turned off by what I had witnessed. Not bad pizza but I likely won't be back.

Felt very unwelcome here from arrival, during the stay and at checkout. Upon arrival, and before even getting out of my car I am mistreated by an overt aggressive security guard who is preventing me from entering the parking garage. He told me I need a pass. How could I possibly be in possession of a pass when I haven't checked in yet. He pulls me out of the driveway and radios for other oragatangs from their pretend police department who continued to harass me and created unnecessary drama. I finally am able to speak to the hotel manager on duty who apologizes for the rude behavior of the security staff led by Mr. Sharma(so?). Comped my 1st night dinner. Many elevators at this property were out of service which made for long waiting times. My room on the 11th floor had significant deferred maintenance with holes in the wall and burnt out lightbulbs in the bathroom. The blanket on the bed was soiled and had holes in it. No housekeeping service provided on Day 1. There are many, many lodging choices when staying in Reno. I do not recommend this property.

It's really pretty. The rooms are like apartments. I stayed for one night and went on a walk in the morning, and when I got back, they were cleaning my room before I checked out. So I couldn't get back in. I didn't have any stuff in there, but...that felt weird. Sat in the lobby for a while and waited.

Fantastic! I have been here to drink not eat but today we took the kids downtown to the arch and were looking for a lunch spot. Well the Broadway Oyster Bar delivered! It's a beautiful day so we sat on the patio, a great seating area. Our sons had a burger and a grilled chicken sandwich, there is not a kids menu, and they were very good. I had a classic, the lobster po-boy. It was delicious, but what really knocked our socks off was the special my husband ordered, the voodoo chicken sliders. It came with 2 huge breaded and fried chicken sandwiches, tossed in their voodoo sauce and with the spicy mayo. AMAZING!  And I have to mention the onion rings, not my favorite but they were huge and my husband loved them. A MUST TRY RESTAURANT!!!
I decided to come here after hearing good things about it! Tried their iced local honey latte with lavender and it was DELICIOUS!! The first sip I took, I literally was taken aback. Would recommend!!

Wish I could give 0 stars. THE WORST DOMINOS EVER. Extremely rude employees everytime. The employees seem like you are inconveincing them or they are partying listening to music. This business is a disgrace. There are mistakes every single time I order. Pizza is burnt, missing dipping sauces, icing, pizza toppings, just to name a few. There have been times they have "forgetten" my order. Highly unproffesional and horrible establishment. I wish they would remove this dominos and put an adequate pizza shop. I complain to domonis coporate constantly and nothing gets done. REMOVE THIS DOMINOS WORST LOCATION EVER PLEASE KEEP REPORTING TO CORORATE UNTIL ITS GONE.

My husband and I ate here for the first time after visiting Cheekwood. Nice atmosphere and lots of TVS to watch your favorite sports team.  We had great service even though the restaurant was short staffed.  Nowadays we just expect service to take a few minutes longer than normal at most restaurants.  Our server Cleveland was nice, personable, and attentive.  We both ordered a hamburger and fries and both thought it was one of the best burgers we have had in awhile.  The fries were also great and crisp.  We will make this a regular stop after visiting Cheekwood.  Hopefully they will open a Sam's Place in Franklin.

Eric was a great salesman. He took every one of my comments/questions in stride, and Jonah helped to make sure everything went smoothly. Everything was simple and straightforward, which is exactly what the car industry needs. 

Great job, all around!

Super disappointing visit/experience. The wait time is quicker than most places for Sunday morning (not always the lowest time but one typically moves pretty quickly). Date and I went to try it out because of good reviews but were disheartened by a super limited menu (definitely read it over prior to going, not the kind of place to just "find something"), especially when it comes to drinks. We each got the princess with an egg, both eggs were cold on our biscuits, one biscuit had an enormous chicken thigh, the other was about 1/3 of that. The chicken was also tough/rubbery in some bites for one biscuit and tasted undercooked on the other. Service was so busy/hard to get so we ended up just leaving after trying to down maybe half the food. Date ordered a Bloody Mary that didn't seem to have any vodka, as well; was mostly just mix. Really bummed out because this place is hyped up on social media. Wouldn't recommend spending money here, wish there was a way to be refunded. Not worth it in our/my experience.

Second time here.  First time was right before Covid shut down.  Another excellent experience.  Adamor our server was excellent and allowed for a relaxing celebration.  The food was outstanding.  The twin lobster tails were delicious as was the 10oz filet cooked a perfect medium.  The other entree was the king salmon.  Started with calamari which was excellent and highly recommend.  It had a sweet Thai chili sauce.  The the spice was very tolerable.  Finished with the signature carrot cake and a chocolate cake which were both excellent and would get again.  Overall great experience.  This is a great special occasion place

I would give them 10 stars!!!!!!!!  I take my car to Meineke in Broomall for everything (4 years and counting).  Great service, friendly, trustworthy/honest,  knowledgeable, ALWAYS on time for appointments, they will drop you off at home and pick you up, car always ready when promised, great work and fair pricing.  They saved me this morning and this wasn't the first time!!  My car wouldn't start.  I called and the owner came to my house, jump started my car, followed me to drop my child at daycare (to be sure I didn't get "stuck"), waited and watched my running car for me in the daycare parking lot and then followed me to the shop.  They had a new battery in my car in 20 min.  Where else can you get service like that?    Honestly, the best customer service I've ever had - each and every time.  I am a customer for life.
One of the best gyros I've ever had! It had a lot of flavor and tasted very fresh. Definitely my new go to!

This place has the best pizza in the area. For appetizers my favorite is the garlic wedges and meatballs. The carnivore pizza delicious with homemade marinara sauce. We also tried the pistachio and it was good my I personally preferred red sauce on my pizzas. 

I only gave this 4 stars because their menu offers coffee and cappuccino, but the server advised the machine has been broken for a while and they do not know when or if it will be fixed.  

* Owners -  Please Please Please fix or replace the machine as we love to have a nice cup of coffee after your amazing pizza!

Extremely rude female bartender. Literally rolled her eyes when we put in our order. Other rude and obnoxious staff members who were running quizzo. To top it off, my friend got food poisoning from our dinner.

They are fantastic! I thought I was only going to do a one-time clean but they did such a great job the first time that I remembered them months later. I hired them again as a birthday present to myself and they were just as great as the first time!

Two very punctual and friendly people came in and did everything from my dishes, to the floors, bathroom, bed, and every dusty crevice (the inside of a floor lamp). I would recommend them to anyone!

Thanks so much for helping make my birthday week restful and relaxing!

If I could give them a minus 0 I would  when the business was bought out
the new management became extremely greedy raise rents aggressively  also changed the terms that they no longer pro-rate days.  So if you give them notice that you're moving out and you're not out before the 1st they charge you for a whole month.  Even if you only had 9 days into the month.
I had been a long time renter and upon talking to other people they too were moving out due to the continuous rate increases.   The couple I spoke with had 3 units they didn't know either that they would not get  a refund for the difference of 9 days vs 30 days  they also were ticked off.

Hearty portions 
Well attended service 
Easy location 
Ask for the Ratatouille 
But beware of the mice around your feet

This was my second time in the salon for acrylic nails. I asked for a ombre French with 2 sparkle nails on each hand. Christina asked me if I wanted to try a couple of art nails. I said sure! Anyway by the end I was left with very cute festive nails. It was ok until she told me the price 85.00! With tip was over 100.00! Megan did my nails before. She gave me what I wanted and the price was affordable. Christina is the owner and very money motivated. The salon is kinda a rip off. Probably won't return :(

They butchered my bushes going on 2 months ago and they haven't grown back. they cut them down to 1in off the ground and they all turned brown. I tried too...i talk to my association and I was told that they were told by the company that their workers didn't know how to trim those type of bushes so they cut them to the ground. I tried to speak to the supervisor Ryan today ands he got very defensive and said it wad done properly and is going to cut the whole association's bushes down that low to add mulch. Instead of apologizing he just said it was done right. I would advise people not to use this company. Thet lack professionalism and knowledge. I posted photos.

Ashely is rude, condescending, and dismissive. She's out of her league as a manager. My order was placed at 11:44 am with estimated wait of 21-31 minutes. At 11:57 the tracker was updated to say that Paul had left with my food. At 12:32 I called the store to inquire about my order and delivery. I was advised that they had 5 delivery orders come in, Paul took 3 and then came back for 2. My food should be to me any moment. There was no apology, no admission of any fault. At 12:47 I called back and was told 1. They are very busy and people need to understand that 2. Ashley doesn't know why the driver isn't here yet. I was placed on indefinite hold by Ashley. During that time I called and complained to corporate customer service where I was informed that this is a franchise and my complaint would be forwarded to the appropriate franchise department. I then called my credit card company to despite the charge. While on the phone the delivery arrived and I was told by the driver "I just got the food." I then hung up the phone without a dominos since it was obvious after 20 minutes that Ashley wasn't coming back. I called again to let her know my food had come, it was cold, I had filed a complaint, and I'm disputing the charges. She laughed and said "you're just pissed because I put you on hold and your food was late. You're just pissed about pizza."

The food was cold. The customer service was unacceptable. And this franchise needs to either have some serious staffing adjustments made or they should cease to have a franchise license.

Pho Palace is one of my "go to" restaurants. Generally,  I order Summer Rolls, Shrimp Fried Rice and Pho every time I come here. It's always amazing and full of flavor. I've never been disappointed. The establishment is clean and the staff are all very friendly. 

I suggest trying the Lychee Drink. It's kept behind the register and comes in a can. But, it is amazing!

What a bunch of pushy sales jerks. Don't give them your license, it's how they hold you hostage. It was good up until the sales guy asked what kind of deal I was looking for. I told him and he got upset and acted like I slapped his mom. Then after asking for my license back a couple times I had to physically track them down to get it back. What a bunch of jerk offs. First time there and the last. FU La Mesa.

My husband and I took this tour 12 years ago and took it again on our 9 year wedding anniversary. It was great this time around cause we went on a Tuesday and it was just my husband and I on the tour. Our driver Kris was great, she was very knowledgeable of all the wineries we went to and also recommended a place for us to have our anniversary dinner which we did go to and it didn't disappoint. She also carried our purchase to the van, which was really nice and wrote a cute note on our lunch boxes for lunch. Would absolutely recommend this tour.

Flowers delivered today and what a sorry arrangment.  
Choice of flowers was ok but vase was wrong for size of for size of bouquet , flowers haphazardly thrown in vase, all askew. Rearranged entire bouquet and put in appropriate vessel. The grocery store bunch I just bought was head and shoulders over this thing.....and I am sure at considerably less cost.

My wife and I like this place very much. The people that own it got it together in what a true blue neighborhood pub and grill should be. We have always like the bar people and table waiters. the food is good to very good for bar food. The bar is well stocked and their are plenty of tv's for the sports crowd. We eat here 1 or 2 times a week. We don't personaly know that many people that visit here but I still feel like their good people. That says alot in this day and age.

My friends and I love to support local businesses and though we enjoyed the atmosphere (laid back, welcoming) the food was not worth what we paid. It's a pub - so it should specialize in beer and inexpensive (mostly fried food) right? Not so much. My Alaskan cod was way over-fried to black. And when my friend ordered the shrimp Alfredo, it actually came with popcorn shrimp!! (This shouldn't even be on the menu). And sadly, our coleslaw was so drenched with sauce that it was inedible. If we ever return, we will not be ordering food.

Food was pretty good but not something I would want to go back for. Beautiful restaurant and good drinks. Service was pretty bad. Waiting extremely long for everything, our server ignored half of the things we asked for (ie extra napkins) and our food came out in terrible order and all super late.

What a great hidden gem!!! Had an excellent meal here during our visit in Reno. The fresh pasta is superb! We had the fusilli and if you have never had fresh fusilli, you are missing out!! All the pasta is made from scratch in house. Honestly this competes with some of the best fresh pasta shops in little Italy. We needed with dessert and so glad we did, the tiramisu was delicate and authentic and when I learned it was also made in house I begged the owner to open up a spot in my hometown. Alas we will have to visit again in Reno to enjoy Pasta Fresca again!!

Was having water in the basement that looked like it was coming from a pipe. Loath to call water proofing people, I tried BCPH first, looking for an estimate. Sam came out and quickly helped determine the problem wasn't the pipe but another issue. He made suggestions about different ways it could be fixed, even though it wasn't them that would be handling that kind of issue. He was professional and timely. Would call again.

Expensive as hell, but reliable. Friendly and professional, overall. However, certain channels were deleted from my SiriusXM preset by whoever was working on my vehicle last time, and they didn't reset the service message either. Very disappointed.

Two people on duty but only 1 workstation. So, while one works the other wanders around aimlessly or goes to Starbucks nearby. When they are both in the office only 1 can actually work. Need more space to serve customers.

Everything about this place works.  I see others have not appreciated the non-traditional display of art but I found it quite refreshing and comfortable.  I like the quality and quantity of art you can find in one small place in the suburbs.  A must-see for all.

Something needs to be done about the use of cell phones in the men's locker room. I caught a man filming me while I was showering. I also caught two men filming/photographing men who were undressed.

The use of cell phones in the locker rooms is prohibited but when asking someone to stop they become irate. Apparently it is acceptable to break the rule.

Planet Fitness needs to take a stronger stance against this invasion of privacy by: 
posting larger signs about the cell phone rule; 
stress to new members that this behavior is unacceptable; 
and sending out an email to all clientele addressing the cell phone issue.

If you are using your phone in the private areas you are as guilty as the men who use their cameras. You are making it easy for them to go unnoticed.
--
The owner has told me that the comfort of the clientele is first and foremost.

I have brought this up with the employees at the front desk whenever there is an incident. Nothing was done.

This is more than an issue of the clientele feeling comfortable. How hard is it to put up a big sign and send a blanket email?

The pizza and staff are amazing here.  I travel for work quite a bit and don't often find places that I feel the need to stop in at over and over,  but this is different.  I stop in for lunch at least once every time I come to this area, if not more.

I must say, this meal was such a pleasant surprise! Omg; I have passed this place for the past two years of living here and not once stopping, and finally my curiosity got the best of me.

This is a true hidden gem! The staff was pleasant and accommodating.  The food was beyond amazing.  A little more seasoning and I would have given it a 5! Also the sunlight early in the morning is bad at every table. Other than that, I will now become a regular here. Great menu options and the "Waffle Taco" is so worth a trip!
Decent BBQ! Sometimes they run out--which might be a good sign. The staff are really great and their new location is really nice.

I heard rave reviews forever from friends at school about Momo dumplings, but it was so out of my way, that it took me forever to test them myself. One day, I was cat sitting on that side of town and decided, "what the hey, let's try it!" 

That day changed my life. Amazing dumplings, perfectly cooked crisp veggies, a bouquet of flavors and textures. Everyone has to try the yak dumplings and delicious samosas! My husband and I are always stuffed after leaving, but the food is light on the tummy, and I always feel energetic and refreshed after eating. 

The atmosphere is unprecedented in its hospitality-- I feel like family here, and service is always fast. Momo Dumplings is on my list to take any and all out-of-town visitors.

This was such a great experience - I'm gonna stay with this office for as long as possible. Everyone was sooooo nice from the beginning. There's even someone specifically for financial stuff who is awesome. They make sure you know exactly what you'll be paying vs coverage before they do anything. So no hidden random costs. Super easy to make an appointment too

Okay so I've never actually consumed anything there because I'm only 20 rn but I worked a couple months this summer right next to it, and we used some of their facilities. The staff is super nice though and the customers all come back often. However, the trivia nights are what really take the cake for me. Fun games, good times, and I can play along in my head while I'm working. Should I have been focusing on work? Yes. Was the trivia too tempting? Absolutely. Good vibes, good fun, and probably good drinks

My absolute go to place for wings! Why not 5 out of 5 stars you ask? Because the kitchen is just...inconsistent (as far as whatever chef is supposed to show up). The best I can tell you is that the chef is there generally from 6pm - 12am. But that isn't always the case. 

The last time I went over there (recently) the wings were most excellent and it happened to be around 11:45pm on a Friday night. 

Personally recommend the Lemon Pepper Wings and the Garlic Parmesan Wings! Will absolutely guaranteed take you to heaven!

This was our second visit and we may not come again.  First of all, they did not have our reservation and they also lost the reservation we had made for Mother's Day Brunch, so I made it again.  When we arrived for dinner, we said the people we are meeting will be arriving soon and please bring them to our table.When that couple arrived, the hostess told them we were not there and sat them outside. Until we finally called each other, we were sitting in separate areas unaware that the we were both there.  Servers from each area gave us different "specials" for the night.  Service was very slow and the meals were mediocre.

Service was great but the food was mediocre. Country fried steak bland....very bland. Gravy just flour and water. Needs seasoning on meat, gravy and potatoes. Biscuit was dry. Mac and cheese dry and flavorless.

Absolutely lovely! My partner and I went to Martha for dinner while visiting, and we loved it. We were able to get a table immediately. The ambiance was nice, with candles and plants all around. The menus are projected onto the walls, which is a creative way of circumventing paper menus! They also had a movie playing, which was a nice touch (not distracting, just playing in the background).

We both got the Matha Mi and cannot recommend it enough. A tofu banh mi served with kettle chips and homemade pickles. My partner remarked that he almost didn't want to finish his sandwich because he was enjoying it so much he didn't want it to end! I also got the Wanda to drink, which was delicious and refreshing. I'm sure we'd be regulars if we lived in the area!

We had four beautiful drinks made by Billy: Peekaboo, Fig get about it, Ancho and Drunken Elephant. After exhausting all the bars in Philly, Morea was such a pleasant surprise. Their food is great too: we had the Hummus plate and Ahi tuna and both were so fresh and delicious! I will definitely be coming back to try more drinks and food!

So this was my first time eating at this establishment. I ordered a salad that was incorrect. I shared this with the server before leaving and it was made the correct way. The salad was really good but I was disappointed after reviewing my bank statement. I  noticed that my credit card was charged $42.00. The salad was only $19.98. I woke up this morning to notice another charge of $39.96. The only charge should be $19.98 for the salad. I called several times today to speak with a manager and haven't received a call back. I was told that the manager wouldn't be in until 4pm. I decided to go to the restaurant to discuss this matter with someone in person. When I arrived I was told again that the manager was not in and they didn't know when he would arrive. I find it very strange that there isn't a manager or supervisor on site to speak with customers. 


The bartender came over to speak with me and stated that the message was passed along to the manger via text. I began to share the issue with my credit card being charged multiple times. I was told that the manager would be the person to call me back as they have " no access to the accounts". The bartender then became very defensive and rude as I began to say how this was unacceptable. He stated that I know you called "6 times" but it's nothing we could do. I thought that was very rude. I informed him that my card has been charged multiple times and I will continue to call until this is handled. Let me make it clear that the $39.96 was charged TODAY. As I was talking my mask started to slide down. I continued to pull the mask up but was yelled at by the bartender" can you pull your mask up". I informed him that the mask was sliding and I understand the importance of having a mask on. 

I still haven't heard from the manager and my card is still charged $81.00. I must say there was a server that came by to listen to my story. I didn't catch her name but she was sweet and very helpful. She listened and agreed to follow up with the manager. There was a black gentleman that came over to simple listen to the conversation or play pretend security. Not sure why he was even called over to the door. Maybe the bartender didn't like my tone and felt as if he needed the black server to assist him? Anyway, I am planning to contact my bank to dispute this matter further. I will NO longer spend a dime at this restaurant. Anyone who decides to come here, make sure to have cash!!!  FYI: Still no call back from the manager!!


Update: manager called me back!  Working on the money being refunded. He was very nice!!

Visited Steve's Hot Dogs yesterday. Had the Chicago dog and Jamaican Fries. Fast service, delicious food, very clean, friendly staff and good value. Enjoyed looking at Wayne St. Wayne's artwork and The Urge memorabilia.

Last evening was our first night in the area and we decided to stay close for dinner since we'd traveled all day. Keegan's is amazing! Their staff makes you feel like your dining at a friends house and the food was absolutely amazing! Everything we ordered was delicious, even to our pickiest of eaters. I wish I'd have remembered the waiters name for this review because he was seriously the best! Our drinks never went dry, he checked in often and stayed for a moment to chat, and he kept us up to date on our food status. Very friendly service, delicious food, and a nice atmosphere- it's a 10 in my book!
We had two combination plates. The sushi and tempura were good. The yakatori and teriyaki were horrible.

BED BUGS I fought credit card company to get money back to no avail for months. I told em. Simply give me money back after I killed a bed bug going into the hair of my gf's baby's scalp!? In exchange I wouldn't leave a bad review.  So here we are. They did nothing to remedy the situation. I guess bed bugs are an issue they simply don't want to deal with? There was also loud noises all through the night and people smoking weed in the hallways as well. Called security a bunch of time. What a nightmare. Stay here at your peril. Stayed late April but finally getting around to review after not getting my money back

There are a few flapjacks franchises around the Indianapolis area that I'm pretty sure are locally owned. I've been to the Lebanon, Indiana and The Brownsburg, Indiana locations for breakfast many times and the food has always been good. 
I went to the Plainfield, Indiana location this past Saturday and I have to tell you it was a great experience. We pull in the parking lot and I kind of cringe because it was packed and we didn't have a lot of extra time. 
This place runs like a fine-tuned watch. The server came to the table as soon as we sat down. She brought us our drinks? The server then came back pretty quickly and took our breakfast order, and then, I'm not kidding when I say this, in less than 10 minutes the breakfast order was at the table and it was cooked to perfection. The eggs were cooked perfectly I asked for crispy hashbrowns because I don't like them mushy, and they came out exactly as I asked. Everything about the experience was perfect. If you're looking for a good, locally owned, hidden gem of a restaurant in Plainfield, this is it.

After my last experience with customer service I will never go back. I had 3 items in my cart and after waiting in line with only 2 checkouts open the cashier ushered in some elderly people with a full cart to go in front of me. Bc they were elderly I was ok with it but then he ushered in multiple people with carts in front of me told them he already helped me and I could use the self checkout if I needed too. They were all older than me so I didn't say anything even though I'm noticeably pregnant and only had 3 items. I don't use self checkout bc I believe it takes jobs away from people. I stood there stunned for a second before leaving my basket and walking out. My whole family has stopped shopping there. I think the cashier was a manager. I've since been told they are all rude and why others won't shop there either. I'll wait in line with more people at Trader Joe's any day then deal with this place
Andy did an absolutely amazing job! They are beyond friendly and accommodating! I would highly recommend them!

Great experience and lovely service. 
I came in for a walk in and they made room for me immediately. A little bit pricey than typical places but the service you get is worth it. 
I got a gel manicure and it came with a massage and hand scrub.
Best hole-in-the-wall seafood joint in New Orleans. 100% recommended. The seafood pasta with fried shrimp and stuffed lobster tail was to die for

Stopped by for a happy hour drink with my cousin.  She lives downtown and frequently goes to Malios.  She recommended the burgers on the happy hour menu.  I had the French onion burger medium rare and it was out of this world. Maybe the best burger I have had.  I called my husband on the way home and said we are coming back for burgers!  And the dirty martini was Ice cold perfectly dirty!

I was lucky enough to stay at the Dwight D hotel thanks to an auction win back in the Spring.  My interactions with Vittoria, one of the owners, and Sarah, their director of food and beverage, were nothing but kind and welcoming.  From the moment you arrive, the team looks out for you and ensures a pleasant stay.  This was my first time staying in a boutique hotel, and it was enjoyable! The location is convenient to the many things offered in Philadelphia, and the effort they put in to preserving the 1800's townhouse feel of the hotel totally pays off.  It was very much appreciated that they added a modern bathroom to the guest rooms!  If you're looking for a nice getaway with a historic feel in a historic city, check out the Dwight D hotel!

Friendly service, welcoming atmosphere, and, most importantly, a GREAT haircut! Only $35 for a cut and style by a student, (only $10 more for a pro) and they throw in a complimentary hot towel treatment. The stylist was happy and approachable, and really listened to what I wanted. She also gave great suggestions, and had a pro look it all over before I left. I'm totally, 100% happy and looking smokin'!

You must make an appointment, and leave a credit card number to hold it. They charge you for your appointment if you cancel with less than 24-hours notice (but they call you the day before to confirm.)

They offer free fringe (bang) trims - no appointment required.

If I could give this place 0 stars, I absolutely would. I'm not one to write reviews, but if you don't want to experience terrible service (Jay), passive aggressive workers (Jay again), and constant miscommunication, AVOID this dealership at all costs. Jay DeBow should absolutely be fired and never work in car sales or service again. He had 5 days between the time my car was towed to the dealership and the time I was supposedly picking up my car for a flat tire after hitting a curb. As I arrived to the dealership ON TIME, he was not there to greet me, and the receptionist workers were extremely condescending. Jay kept pushing back the time my car would be "ready," and then came back over an hour later to tell me that my car had suspension issues. It baffles me how he and the service team had 5 days to assess my car, yet I was given wrong information and was forced to come into the dealership for no reason (which is a trip from where I am located). While on the phone with the service workers, if another issue somehow came up with my car, Jay would go "Fuck, another thing I have to deal with/add" while me and my friend were standing right there. He was and still is so unhelpful and rude. This happened on October 26, (my car was towed in Oct 21) and yet he is still telling me that it will take minimum 20 days to get my car back, which is absurd. It also took me three texts for him to reply with more information about my car. No accountability whatsoever. Do not come here. They are only looking to take your money.
Mediocre food, slow service at a beautiful location with no competition, I guess that's why it is not improving.

I went in for a pedicure and am very disappointed. First, the equipment and place did not feel sanitary at all. The technician kept cleaning the razor and nail filer in the water my feet were in, then he would place them right back in the basket. My pedicure was less than 15 minutes and you can tell it was rushed by the look of my nails. Eventually after he left home sitting there for 10 minutes to take another client, I asked another for a pair of flip-flops. My technician came back and took a pair out of the dirty hamper! I asked him if they were clean, because I could obviously see the dirty bottoms, and he replied "yeah" as he was pulling hair off them! The other technician was handing him a clean pair as this was happening, because obviously he was lying to me. I would not recommend, and I will never go back.

I just called this company after reading Yelp reviews to get a leak fixed regarding my shower/bathtub. I told Lindy or Mindy, the dispatcher (her name was said in haste) the leak is coming from the shower maybe behind the wall but i can't tell nor could i reach it. She stated "well if you can't get to it how are they supposed to" I said well i don't know, that's why i'm calling a plumber. I don't know what the problem is with it. I simply know there's a leak and i can explain how i know. I was shocked by her response as if though i was the one who didn't know what i was doing. Why do plumbing services exist? They don't even want to diagnose the problem? Like is there workload the great? I told the woman who answered the phone I guess I will try and call someone else to figure out why and how to fix the leak. . .The phone call was ended. I was shocked enough to write a yelp review which i never do. NEVER, but what's the point of their business? To only do the easy work a person could otherwise do on their own? I'm not even that sure WHERE it's coming from or if its an easy or tough fix or what i should do to not make it leak. . .and i won't know until someone, a pro comes and tells me! like REALLY?

Update: 5:12pm SAME DAY: So after i hung up with Rotor-Rooter I called another local company called Jet Plumbing Heating & Drain Services. The dispatcher (who i later found out to be in training from the gentleman who fixed my leaky shower) (it was actually the bath tub)) asked me the issues and I basically said the same thing and she stated she would have someone out there the next day from 2-4pm. I agreed. The dispatcher called me back and said they have a guy who can go today if i would like? I said for sure, when i got home from work at about 4pm my leaky bath tub spicket was fixed and the tech was explaining everything throughly. I am so glad Rotor Rooters customers service was so bad, because had it not been i would definetly have paid more and waited longer. For less than $200.00 and 2 hours my whole issue was fixed and house is ready for appraisal tomorrow!
