I lived in CT for 10 years and CT style pizza IS a thing and frankly, it's the best style pizza there is. With that said, Colony has knocked it put of the park at their new location. Absolutely unreal. I'm looking forward to the Tampa location opening since it will be closer to me! My favorite is salad pizza and bacon and onion pizza! Mmmm mm! Thank goodness they opened in Tampa Bay! Woo!

We were so tired of our builder grade carpets in three of our bedrooms and our master closet we could not stand it any longer. We contacted Master Floors and Santos and his colleague came and did a miracle install.
They moved all the furniture, stripped the carpets and discarded them. Then they installed the laminate we had selected and put all the furniture back. Truly a wonderful install job. Definitely would recommend these two to anyone who is looking to install new laminate flooring.

Worst movers ever.  Given a price on the phone and when moving day arrived there were added charges which I was not told about.  Must pay before the furniture is unloaded.  I was told by Richard who said he was a manager that the movers would be willing to put a few pieces of furniture at the dumpster near my door.   When I asked the movers to do so i was told they werent my trashmen.  After calling the office to complain, the one guy told me they would do it but needed to be tipped. When at my new place, I was asked again about tipping and wanted to know how much.  They left a TV behind that i had to go back and get myself and had requested 2 wardrobe boxes which didn't show up and we had to wait for them to be brought separately while the movers sat around doing nothing.  The movers charged hourly.  It cost me over $1000 to move to a 640 sq ft apt with an elevator which was 10 minutes away from original address.  TRUST ME AND DONT USE THIS MOVER

I go to Dr. Davis and have for around the last 2 years.  Have always had a great experience here.  They are always able to schedule an appointment right away, and are very kind while they do it!  Never have had a long wait time when I do go to the office.  Dr. Davis is very professional, he listens to everything I have to say, which I find to be rare in this field anymore.  He is very helpful.  I had a couple of hospital incidents, he was quick on getting me everything I needed to get further help.  I think that it is a plus that you can do your blood/urine right there in the office, as opposed to having to make a trip to a Labcorp/quest.  The whole staff is very friendly and helpful.  Office is very clean.  Would highly  recommend this group.   Anytime he makes a diagnosis, he give me the medicine I need, and everytime he has been spot on, which is rare in this field as well.

Wonderful food and ambience!! The chocolate covered cannoli ice cream had such a unique lemony creamy favor, a must try. Everything was shared among 5 people and we all left feeling full but not overwhelmingly full. Small portions aren't as small as they seem if everything is shared. The Dan Dan noodles were slightly too spicy for a couple people but was otherwise delicious and had wonderful flavor. Love this place!!

Winner-Winner Ramen dinner!  Thoroughly enjoyed this experience form making the reservations to exiting to the convenient parking lot. Kyuramen does it right. Great service, great appetizers, great soups and great desserts (free dessert with Yelp check-in). Loved the private cozy rooms to dine in no matter if your party consist of 2 or 12. They also offer combo selections to help make trying different dishes easy and cost effective.  I was pleasantly surprised and can't wait to go back again.

I thought I lost my lip gloss, so I needed to stop in here to pick some up. I stopped in within an hour of them opening on Monday morning. I knew exactly what I wanted so I headed to the Lancome counter. Apparently, they scheduled one sales person to run five or so cosmetic counters. She was helping one couple when I got there at one of the other counters. She let me know that she'd be with me in just a moment, but people kept stopping her at the counters she was standing near before she could get to me. Finally, after 10 minutes (yes, really), I asked one of the jewelry counter associates if there was anyone else who would help me because the other woman had too many customers to get to me. A minute or two later someone from one of the other jewelry counters came by, asked if I knew what it was I wanted (not at all rudely, she just was't familiar with cosmetics and therefore couldn't offer much help). I did know which gloss I wanted, but I wanted to see a few other colors because all they had displayed were a variation on a brown theme. She called someone to find out where the lip glosses I wanted even were, and also asked if there were other colors besides what was displayed. Apparently there weren't. So there goes 15-20 minutes wasted. I was pretty disappointed with the fact that they were so poorly staffed and I had to spend so much time there for nothing.

I have used Awash several times for my windows.  I first discovered them through a groupon, so I was slightly skeptical.  Happily, they did a wonderful job for a very fair price.  I even had them shampoo an area rug this last time when they came to clean my windows, and they did a good job on that, too.

They get back to you when you call, they show up when they promise, they do a great job, they don't ruin your screens or trample your plants.  You get sparkling windows, without all that streaking I get when I do it myself. 

I highly recommend Awash!

NOLA Girl Catering is the best!! I highly recommend their services for your next event.

I visited town with a group of 16 friends and contacted NOLA Girl for assistance with a group dinner at home. They were super responsive and very helpful at helping me create a menu. I ended up ordering platters of shrimp po-boys, cajun salmon, jambalaya, mac and cheese and salad. 

She delivered the food to my Air BnB exactly on time and helped me get it all set up in our kitchen. The food was DELICIOUS and plentiful. 

Also, the prices were super reasonable (~$30 per person all in). 

I would definitely order again!
Best subs in Tucson! The bread is always so fresh. Meatball grinder is so good!! Such friendly staff as well(:

Upscale Southern Dining at its best! Walking into the restaurant's modern farmhouse aesthetic is open and welcoming.  Their farm-fresh ingredients are used to make creative and flavorful dishes! Our food was amazing & I can't wait to visit again!

I've been here one time and I won't go back.  I brought in 5 dress shirts for cleaning and pressing and they broke buttons on two of them.  I haven't had that happen before when getting dry cleaning done and they managed to break buttons at a 40% rate.  I don't really want to have to get my shirts repaired after taking them in for dry cleaning

We went there after a play and just wanted a bite or two.  The charcuterie board was interesting for three of us until we hit the havarti cheese.  Totally moldy!  And when shared with the server, he asked the kitchen staff and came back to report that that is how it was supposed to taste.  We had him taste it too and from his face, he agreed with us.  Regardless of whether we were right or wrong I feel like they should have done SOMETHING to acknowledge our complaint.  There was no replacement offered, no adjustment on the bill and no apology.  Not a very gracious handling.  I wouldn't say I would never go back because the atmosphere is pleasant and though many of the places on the street were packed, we were seated quickly and had pretty good service.  But inedible cheese!

Cask used to be great and unfortunately it's now one of the worst restaurants in Tampa. Their margaritas look like lemonade, no salt, no sugar, no lime. If you order a medium burger, it comes out extra rare. When you ask to order the grouper since you can't fathom eating the rare burger, they bring out a fish so salty you have to take a sip of water with each bite. After all of this, all the manager has to say is I'm sorry here's $8 off. If you'd like to keep your customers around I suggest improving your customer service.

I had a very good experience at Keegan's, my wife, children and grandkids enjoyed our time there, food was good hot and fresh, service was excellent. I was concerned after reading some bad reviews, but our time there was great. Good food, good service, I recommend it, and I be back.Thanks, Art T

This place is a complete joke. Two girl's were fighting outside on the stage so I jumped up on stage to break up the fight and I got thrown out... I asked why and they said "no guys on stage." The girls didn't even get thrown out, this one girl threw a chick down by her hair. I was just drunk trying to help out but nope I got thrown out by two guys holding my hands behind my back, like I just killed someone, shoving me through a crowd. Screw this place.

Nice people but they need to inform customers that Fed ex does not guarantee over night shipping and does not reimburse if your package is many days late. So where is the incentive to get our packages delivered on time if there is no real deadline and no refund for my package not arriving anywhere near on time. When we are paying a lot of money for a large package to be delivered you should inform us of that then and not when our package still has not arrived 5 days later. Also telling us every day it is arriving that day and it never does. This is unacceptable !!! I wont use your service again.

VERY DISAPPOINTED!! UNPROFESSIONAL!!! 
Designer Kim Rios came out to measure and told us she would send the estimate and design within a week, A week and a half went by and I reached out to her she advised it would  take another week said  she was very busy. No response no follow up nothing so by the fourth week we decided to contact a manager and person that answered said manager was not available but we could speak to the owner (mike) ,which we did. We told Mike  about how unprofessional his employee Kim Rios was ,he assured he was going to take care of it. A week went by and nothing no message no follow-up from Mike the owner. Second week and my husband decides to leave a message this has been two weeks ago and we still have not received call or message from Mike ,Of course I gave up by now but very upset because had worked with Davis Kitchens 3 years ago and had great service and wanted to match my cabinets. A simple reply or follow up to tell me they were not interested in my business would of been ok .

Terrible customer service. Cashier texting on his phone and not friendly. Employees walking right in front 
 of me without asking how I was doing or even taking the time to say excuse me. Just all around rude. I will not be returning

Sadly, GrisGris was underwhelming with food and service. Would not recommend based on incredibly disheartening experience. Management and servers are not aligned in communication to customers when confrontation arises amongst food being served cold and the server indicating they would take care of it and be reflected in the bill but then not reflected in the bill.  Unfortunately, the condensing approach by management towards the consumer/and server ruined the evening in addition to the meal. Needless to say I would not recommend.

We are so pleased with our new water softener and reverse osmosis drinking water system Cooper's Water Conditioning installed! They came out quickly, tested our water, and gave us a quote which was less expensive than other companies for the same or similar equipment. They scheduled the install to fit our schedule. Paul the installer called to let us know he was coming exactly when he said he would be at our house. Paul was fast, efficient, and installed both the water softener and reverse osmosis water system perfectly. When he was done he cleaned everything very nicely. He walked us through everything we needed to know before he left. The price was exactly as they quoted. We could not be more pleased with the entire system which was installed! Thank you.
The interior is very dated and unwelcoming interior but friendly service and easy parking. For a to go coffee shop zero complaints but interior could use some love

The POPE is my favorite spot--hands down.
The servers and bartenders are friendly and helpful, the beer list is tremendous, the food is pretty darn good and the jukebox has some fun stuff.

I'm a regular there, and if you go enough, you can really cultivate nice relationships with the people who work there and hang out there.

They also have a good take-out beer selection.

The food menu is limited, but the expansion of brunch and the specials menu means that you can find something you like all the time. 

My recent favorites:
Grilled cheese and tomato sandwich
Portabella mushroom sandwich
Fries
Omelets (brunch)
Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie
Veggie Cheesesteak

As for beer recommendations and samples!

I've lived nearby the Dew Inn and have for almost a year, and one day randomly in early June I walked by it and finally realized I had no clue what it was exactly in terms of a restaurant, bar etc. I jumped on Yelp when I got home to find out, and the reviews had me floor. I HAD to go being a diner addict and having just started grieving my favorite Philly diner that had just closed (Little Pete's, which also had my favorite fries in the city). THE NEXT DAY I took my partner there, it was so cute and semi kitchy inside, the staff kept greeting and talking to people BY NAME, we both got omelettes and when I was told at like 8am I could get french fries instead of hash browns AND THEY WERE EPIC, I was beyond sold. Also the veggie omelette was possibly the best one ive ever had AND HUGE. Fast forward almost 2 months later and i've lost track of how many times i've been there,have told friends about it and brought a few there. 

it's become my escape when my brain wakes me up too early, or I need to go somewhere out of my apt but dont wanna travel far, or just when I need to see friendly cheerful faces who now know my name and my partners and ask about him when he's not with me. I've not ever felt more welcomed by an establishment that I havent worked in before. It makes me so calm and happy going there that I even left Bonnie a thank you note a couple weeks ago when I went in after a really rough time. Bonnie, June, Cindy and the rest of the staff...thank you so much for bringing such good smiles and food to the masses

Nothing can beat three dog bakery! If you have never been and have a furry friend, drop everything you are doing and go right now! 
My dog has severe food allergies, she is allergic to both chicken and beef. This makes things extremely tricky because we are always having to read treat labels to make sure they won't make her sick. Then my dog and I stepped into three dog bakery and everything changed! She can eat almost every type of packaged cookie/treat/snack they make along with all the fresh baked goodies in the cases. Her all time favorite items are the pup cakes and seasonal cookies! We always always have a cookie jar full of the assort-mutt cookies (the only thing that keeps her focused away from squirrels on walks). 
I love how three dog has more than just baked goods though. We have found our favorite leash and collar company through this store as well as our favorite dog toy brands. They have the cutest seasonal items from toys to bandanas to fun home wear items for your pup. There's really no bad things I can say about this store. 
If you're a frequent buyer, you should also sign up for their rewards program. When you spend a certain amount of money, you get a $5 voucher. Everyone that works here is so so friendly and also offers up great suggestions! Our dog had been going through toys like crazy and one of the gals told me she was having the same issue with her dog. She then pulled some toys that her dog has not shredded in hopes that it would work for my dog too. And it did! Just beware, once you start going here, your dog will try to "guide" you on walks to the store in hopes they'll get more treats, toys, and pets!

Had an awful experience yesterday I mean awful. Starting from the wheelchair service to the gate at love field for #229 as she called herself she was rude and even uglier to my 21 month old. I just had a nervous breakdown was traveling to my parents with my son. We had 1 hour delay when when got to the gate then a 2 hour in flight on Tarmac delay. It was the worst flight ever I suffer from anxiety and it was awful hot I miserable. The only good thing was Kim the lead flight attendant she was nice. I feel I should either receive a refund or a voucher as that that horrible we finally arrived 7:40 - 8 o'clock

Pickering Valley Feed and Farm.  I ordered two cases of dog food and went out to pick it up.  They were three cans short and when I asked about it they refunded my money for three cans.  I don't know where they got the prices to refund however since I looked on the site and saw the food for 3.36 per can.  The guy refunded the wrong amount as far as I could tell but when I went in to ask they kept me waiting and then called the guy to the front desk and that's when I said forget it.  I'm not hanging around while they figure this out.  They need to get the act together.  What if there was no canned food for me?  I paid online and they sold some of my order.  Not going back.  Would give a minus 1 if I could.  No I'm sorry or anything.  Just made me wait.

Beautiful restaurant to sit outside at Ceviche in St. Petersburg. The food and service was great. My reason for a 4-star review was we got carried away and ordered several dishes, including the Vieiras (Scallops, corn and chorizo relish) and the price was $32.00, which only contained two scallops. Really... Is that market price, $32.00 for two scallops?

Love this place.  Such a variety of food and all is delicious.  I've had breakfast and lunch and they couldn't be better.  Staff is friendly and interested in pleasing you.  The prices are as reasonable as I've seen anywhere.  I wish I didn't have to drive 25 minutes to get here but once I discovered the place, I make a point of doing it.

The staff didn't greet me when I walked which is fine. But I noticed they greated and even checked up on other customers while I shopped. While I looked around I had a few questions and I tried to approach the worked but they seemed to avoid me? I didn't think too much into it but I noticed they only greated and talked to WHITE customers I am a person of color and I get extreme discriminated against. This has happened before at this specific location and it's just something I'm going to avoid but please beware the staff seems to ignore poc and even eye you as if your going to steal super disappointing!
It's 230 pm they have 5$ special  I ask for the special  was told no  more pizza, not even a hold on we can make one....its very good pizza but customer service sucks

Since I moved to Las Vegas 10 years ago, the one thing missing from their vast culinary offerings is Basque Food. It was with great anticipation that we booked Louis's on the Labor Day weekend. I have eaten at many of the excellent Basque restaurants in the Kern County area in California.
The Pyrenees Cafe, the Noriega Hotel, Woolgrowers, Benji's and the Chateau Basque. I am familiar with world class Basque food.
That being said, I'm not sure if it was a post-covid staffing issue or the kitchen. The meal started with a warm clam chowder that was closer to a potato soup. The next course was a salad that was wilted and rusty. It was un-eaten by the other  guest as well. They then served a warm Basque chicken dish, very good but again only warm temp. The next course was the beans, and they were hot and excellent. Then there was a long wait until my New York steak came out, and the beans were cold by then.  
The family Basque style is about the pace of the serving of the multiple entrees. They need some help. I want them to thrive, they are a Reno institution.

First and last time dining at this restaurant.  On February 10th I treated my mother,  my sister, my aunt, my 2 year old niece and my daughter to celebrate my mother's  43rd birthday. We had two servers one had to leave due it being the end of his shift. I believe his name was Tommy or Tim. He gave a wonderful recommendation for a bourbon inspired drink, which was awesome. We ordered the calamari and the spinach and cheese dip.  The calamari was gummy the spinach dip was cold.  After that was fixed we all ordered. My niece and daughter shared a children's pizza. My mother, sister  and aunt ordered steaks. I ordered a pasta and shrimp dish.  So,  two of of three steaks were cold.  The sauce for my dish was bland and mainly butter. My niece vomitted twice, we ended up cleaning it up no one from the waitstaff helped out.  Or replacement server was in a few words lacked quality as well as did not do the proper steps of service.  Table never got prebussed in between the appetizers and entrée portion. There wasn't a two minute bite check, no water refills,  and whenever she was needed we had to flag her down. I only tipped due to me being in the restaurant business. Our server name was Sherri R.

So this is a mixed review. I was there with a buddy during a work trip - we were staying across the street at the Westin. The negative is that when you walk in, you're greeted with the stench of what I would describe as a "wet dirty rag" smell, kinda musty. That made it a bit difficult to hang out for the evening. The saving grace is that the donut dessert was incredible. Chocolate sauce was spot on (not overly sweet) and the donuts were warm and crispy on the outside. If I were ever back in town I might stop in just for those donuts!

When we arrived the lobby areas and pools appeared clean on first glance, as did the room. HOWEVER, what an awful experience we had. The room was never cleaned during our stay, not even brought new towels. The tub was nasty and chipped. The pool looked and felt slimy and there was hair floating all over the place!
We were told the bar closes at 10pm. We went in at 8 and Paul the bartender said he had "other things to do" and we had 6 minutes to purchase and finish a drink. We're on vacation! Meanwhile the night prior the bar was open late into the night packed with over 20 men. 
Secondly, there are literally people living in the hotel-many people!!! Some were fighting outside and felt very unsafe. 
We do smoke & wouldn't even use the disgusting smoking area. Bottles, broken chairs and an ashtray that looked like it was never emptied ever was gross! We walked off grounds to smoke & put them out and then into the trash because we weren't going to throw them all over the floor like it seems many others have and staff doesn't even clean them up! 
People smoke-make a clean, safe area to do so. There was what a young woman who appeared to be a drug addict/hooker sitting outside for hours smoking right out front with a garbage bag of clothes and a jug of ice tea. It was disturbing. She could barely keep her eyes open and was cursing on the phone and dropping cigarettes right where she sat at the lobby entrance 
Lastly, we went home with BED BUG BITES! It was the WORST hotel experience we have ever had. Never again.

I've taken my son here twice for a haircut. The first haircut was okay, but I wasn't impressed. The second time I went back Deria cut his hair and COMPLETELY BUTCHERED it. Not to mention right before the holidays. I will not be taking him back.

The food at this wendys is ok but the service is awful. I ordered a baconator and i said i want it plain and this moron guy behind the counter ask if i want bacon on a baconator.  They also make half of your order give it to you and by the time your order is completed your food is cold.  I could go on and on about wendy's terrible service but rather just say that i would recommend going to a different wendys.

We had a reservation for a group of 17 people for a Saturday night.  They handled our group perfectly, no issues with anyone's food or check and the food was amazing.  Everyone enjoyed their meal and were served with a smile by Guillermo during a very busy night.

Solid wings and great sauce choices, the location has personality, but parking can be a bit of a chore if there's not anything off the street available. Prices aren't great, and your choices in basket sizes are a bit limited, but imagine that's due to the location. All in all they know what they do well and the make happen.

Second visit -- they were out of pizzas (about 6pm on a Friday), so we got a bunch of sandwiches instead. The cheesesteak was amazing once again, and the chicken parm was excellent. I think our favorite, though, was the Boom, which is a non-daily menu item, and had chicken cutlets, fresh mozz, long hots stuffed with prosciutto, and shaved parmesan. This one really blew us away.

We'll be back to try more -- I really wanted to try the upside down especially, so hopefully next time.

My husband and I enjoyed OP during restaurant week. Food was great. My meal consisted of Lobster Bisque (it was OK, it could've had more lobster meat in it, I only had 1 piece -small may I add);  Colossal shrimp sauté (Excellent, the cheesy bread added a great delicious touch and the shrimp was absolutely the best); crab cakes (Best crab cakes I ever had & I had a many of crab cakes, my plus's include not 1 single shell in these crab cakes nor filler and a generous portion) ; 1st desert option was sorbet which did nothing for me and not to mention They ran out of the almond cookie that was supposed to come with and may I add the waiter should've notified me that they were out of almond cookies when taking my desert order, so anyway I ended up sending the sorbet back and ended up with the carrot cake which was just okay. I think I must have had a stale piece or something as my hubs piece of carrot cake was really tasty. My hubs loved every piece of his meal. Our meals pretty much included the same items except he had the teriyaki salmon ( really good, I had a small piece and I'm not even a salmon person but that teriyaki on that Salmon made it taste really delicious) 

As for service here, nothing to write home about. Our waiter just did his job but he didn't go above & beyond with doing anything extra as I'd expect at such a restaurant. Oh my drink Berries & Bubbly was a winner!

Update-the rating just dropped to one star because we just checked our credit report and after telling the dealership they were not allowed to run our credit, they did it without permission.  So in addition to doing paperwork on the wrong vehicle, having us come back and redo paperwork AND then not submitting the correct paperwork to Toyota Financial, they now put another dent in our credit.  Beware, don't go here.

I love doughnuts. All doughnuts. And I love doughnut shops close to my house and I love when they're fresh.  this place checks alllllll the boxes. And they're so nice. They have doughnuts, breakfast sandwiches, and sausage kolaches. it's so nice to have a variety. Please,  please support this small business. their cream cheese burger doughnut and their cronut are to die for. I got a breakfast sandwich once and it was humongous. Anything you get,  I promise you will have a smile on your face!

Doesn't look like much when you pass by but this is a place you need to stop. My friends and I have  tried multiple items from the menu without disappointment! Nothing frozen or pre made is coming from here! This is all fresh delicious food made from the hands of Latin culture. The fresh juices are just an added bonus! Delicious I wish I could eat here more often!

0 stars. The most terrifying part about this "attraction" is the line (over 2 hour wait outside and then of course more lines inside). Save yourselves the frustration and money and either just watch a movie at home or go to literally anything else...unless you like walking through a dark mostly undecorated factory with nothing happening. Wish I could dispute the charge on credit card...it's that bad.

The manager Mr.Michael wolf at store #117 was very helpful. Amazing customer service. Thank you. 
Can't wait to shop again at the store when we are back in treasure island.

Okay this is the perfect place to wind down after a long week. Great ambience and decor. They have variety of food places to choose from with good price points. I would definitely return here. The alcohol selection is really good and it's line was always busy. This is great to come and meet people as well. The price pints are between 6-10 for food and the alcohol is about $5-9. A lot of interesting niches like a balcony table, etc. Can't wait to find more seating. The only thing I would recommend is in the summer to bring a fan.

Why would I think there would be the possibility of a strip center Italian restaurant in Harleysville to be more than "basic"?  Because I had hope, I guess, wishful thinking.

Don't get me wrong, the food was fresh and there was nothing bad, but it certainly wasn't anything more than what I could have whipped up in 30 minutes or less at home.  It's the type of place that you would rely on to cook for you when you just don't feel like cooking yourself.  But then again I'm a snob, ask any of my ex's.

And, it's the type of place when you ask for salad dressing on the side, it comes in a plastic take-out container.  The roll served with the salad was a small hoagie roll cut in half.  The seasoned olive oil was semi-flavorful, thanks to the seasoning, not the quality of the oil.

We split mussels to start.  The broth was thin and weak, the mussels tiny, but they were fresh and edible.  The chicken and broccoli and the chicken piccata were basically good, nothing bad in there. 

Again, it's OK, but don't expect excellent city Italian across the street from a Walmart.

Why 4 stars? Because this is a great addition to Harbour Island.

   ---   ---   ---

My experience is limited here, as I have only tried the Noah Bagel - lox, capers, onions, etc.

I find that these don't range very much from place to place, so I don't judge Cry Baby solely on my one meal... what I dig is the vibe. The decor is hip and trendy. The bay doors are up, which leads to the an open air venue. They have a cooler with fancy sodas.

I'll be back for lunch, and look forward to it!

I was calling a bunch of Shop Rites trying to find My Grandma's coffee cake (try it - amazing stuff) and finally found it here! Mike in the wine department was super friendly and grabbed a bunch for me. 10/10 customer service! Now I have multiple boxes to gift to family and friends. Thanks, Mike!

Great place the owner are so polite and humble,waiter she is multitasking same the owner .... My wife love this place you sit in the bar and watch outside when is raining or snowing food is incredible good , very clean , let keep helping our locals restaurants

I come in every Sunday after church with my four boys and can't think of one complaint. Not only is the food superb but the service is unlike any service you have ever had before. We are always welcomed and treated like family. They definitely are very busy on weekends but I will never complain if I have to wait a few extra minutes because the quality they put in to the food is worth it. I am originally from New York and this bagel cafe tops any around this area. I am so glad I found them. They are awesome!!!!!!!!!!! thanks for the good food and always making my sons feel welcomed.
The Restaurant at the Cheshire is average at best. I would say a majority of their 5 star reviews are from LHM employees getting free meals in exchange for positive reviews.

Great place, food is great but what impressed me today (12/31/2021) was how nice the staff was today. Placed was packed but all the staff kept their cool. Tall red head guy was talking to people, calling out names, possibly singing!!! There's always an older lady at the counter & she's great as well!! It's hard to find good help these days so please keep the staff you have. Thanks for being part of the Indy community!!!

I feel bad completely trashing a small business, and I see other people's experience here was positive. So my story may not be the case for everyone, but buying a car here was truly one of the worst mistakes I have made in my life thus far. I bought a car here in April 2015. I had recently totalled my car, and I was a poor college student who needed a car fast to commute to work and school. My dad had recently passed away and my mom was living half way across the country, so I was basically on my own buying a car. The guy that sold me my car here seemed nice enough and I thought I was getting a decent deal. I bought a 2003 Subaru Forester and paid close to $4,000 after tax and tags. So, not a ton of money but enough that I thought it would be able to last me at least a year. The car I bought here was the definition of a lemon.  I should've known as soon as I got the inspection done with their place, that it was no good. They agreed to pay for whatever it needed to pass inspection, which surprisingly was nothing. It passed inspection with a windshield chip right in front of the drivers view, so of course I was left to deal with that. 

I'm not car-savy at all, but within the first month I was able to figure out the head gasket was leaking. It probably was doing this when I bought it. Pro sport motors did honor their "warranty" that if anything happened within the first month they would pay for 50% of the work if done through their mechanic. So, that would've earned them a higher yelp rating if not for the events that followed. (See my review of the Getty in Conshohocken). But, long story short my car was at their mechanic for three weeks. When I finally picked it up, it had a loud sound that wasn't there before. The next day, when I was driving my car to work it broke down which was very scary. Pro Sport Motors sent a tow out and brought it back to their shop. Somehow, due to whatever was done at the Getty, the exhaust pipe became detached from the car and the car was leaking antifreeze due to one of the hoses being tied too tightly. They fixed it and gave it back to me. But, what they failed to tell me which I would later find out months down the line is the headgasket was either not repaired or repaired incorrectly. 

Basically, in my time of having this car up until April 2016, there was always problems. From the time of buying this car until April. I put at least $2,000 dollars into it (stupid, I know). Thankfully, I have since found a reliable mechanic and when I brought my car in for inspection this year( I already knew it had a ton of problems) he told me the headgasket was never fixed, some other expensive things it needed, and that it was absolutely not worth putting anymore money into it. By the time I sold this car in May, the best price I could get for it was $400!! As much as I think leasing a car is a waste of money, I could've leased a brand new car and spent less money than I did in my year with this car($6000+). I can't even tell you how much buying this car has negatively affected my life. It sounds dramatic, but I have had to delay important events in my life due to the amount of money spent on this car and still not having a reliable car. This car was the giant albatross around my neck, and I am so happy to just be done dealing with it. I'm kind of embarrassed telling this story, but I have definitely learned my lesson. I personally will never buy a used car after this unless it is certified from the dealer, or from someone in my family. Never again!!!

Seriously was surprised it was as good as it was. Had the Reuben, fries, and the green beans. Had the 4500 drink and it was great drink, but tiny.  Service could have been friendlier but it was ok. The Reuben was great the fries was great and the green beans were awesome! Would it all again

Their menu is deceivingly delicious, but don't get your hopes up! The food doesn't live up to it. I had the sliders, of which I only liked one. I did appreciate the different sauces though. I remember my friend got the broccoli rabe because she's vegetarian... It was literally a small tree of barely-steamed broccoli with absolutely nothing on it for FOUR DOLLARS! We probably could've made that at home for $0.40.

The inside is pretty loud and dark for some reason... was not expecting that from a BBQ place. At least the server was extremely nice for coming outside and taking pictures of us for my friend (Betty)'s birthday! All of us really liked the font for the "smokin' betty's" sign outside, haha!

The salesmen we spoke with were all nice and responsive. We were drawn in by the internet price and the add that pops up saying "no hidden fees" but don't be fooled. They tack on a dealer fee of $999 which they disclose but they don't disclose the fee of $999 for a certified pre-own (any of their cars under 60,000 miles). If the car is not certified they will throw in something they called a "reconditioning fee" and it is not a set fee. They say they base it on whatever service and parts it requires to allow for a sale, for our particular choice, a 2018 Tucson it was $1200. It doesn't end there. They quote us over $600 for a new tag fee that is only $200 or so through the DMV. They have a nice selection but the price point is a bait and switch. Once all the fees and tax were added it was over $5000 in addition to the listed price.

This location is awful, and that's putting it nicely. I ordered a pizza; they told me it would take around 2 hours, but I didn't mind waiting. Over THREE HOURS later, my pizza still didn't arrive. I tried calling them, and I was on hold for 40 mins. I never got to spoke to anyone, and my pizza never came. This is the worst Papa Johns I have ever had to deal with.

First time going there as I was getting my sons haircut next-door. Very refreshing. I absolutely recommend the Floridian French toast and the morning meditation drink. Also hands-down the best biscuits and gravy that I've had in a while. Outside seating is very desirable they have a super nice area that can accommodate the whole family with umbrellas.. Service is excellent ! The staff is very polite and attentive Can't wait to go again

beautiful county restaurant with a great atmosphere, we have dined here many times before and it's always fantastic.a varied house menu with nightly specials that never disappoint. the food is prepared, plated,and served beautifully. we highly recommend Arielle's for any occasion or just a night out.

Go to this place. Don't question me just go. The people are gracious. The food is great. The coffee's good. And, the ambiance is as good as it gets.

So, do like I say (& as I do). Go to the Grind. You'll thank me

Same great OTF workout in a great location and space!

The Avon location is super convenient with a lot of parking, just off Highway 36/Rockville Road. I walked in and was blown away by the size of this location (twice the size of the other lol location I have been too). Clean and bright with an open reception area, lockers, three showers, and a blow-dry station - it is setup for you to easily head to work after your workout.

Orange theory is a zone based workout and good for all fitness levels. When you arrive, you will borrow or buy their heart rate monitor. The monitor connects with the OTF system and displays your heart rate, zone, calories burned and the "splat points" - which are basically the top two heart rate zones.

Worried people are looking at your numbers? They are not. If they are, they got ripped off because you are working hard enough in these classes that you won't have time to look over the other numbers on that screen!

I have knee issues and use alternatives for many parts of class, coaches are great about that. Rowers, treadmills, free weights, bosu, TRX, etc.

I burn 400-600 calories in every class I have attended. Coach Erin was great. I have also taken class from Coach Lauren, as she teaches in Bloomington too - she is the best!

Give it a try! First workout is free.

Pretty crappy pizza. The workers were nice and the service was prompt. The seating area was clean. But again, the pizza was not good. Slice of plain and slice of pepperoni were my test subjects. Meh, can get better elsewhere.

Won't be back.

Convenient location, free parking, delicious TJ foods. Gets quite busy during the early evening with lines entering the store and wrapped through the produce section, but the staff is super efficient, and you'll be in and out before you know it.  My favorite item is the frozen mangoes, but too bad this location doesn't have the supersweet version.  Go early to avoid the lines!

I am probably going to echo most prior reviews. This place is phenomenal! Even as crowded as the hotel was with visiting Shriner's (the Shriner's convention was in town), the hotel staff took care of everything you could need or want. The location is perfect for strolling the streets of Ybor City and the free shuttle can't be beat for getting around the local area. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable.

This is without a doubt the best bar in town. I wish the hours were extended. They make the absolute best drinks and dessert drinks that taste amazing. I was surprised when I started feeling them because they make some of their drinks taste like they don't have alcohol in them. The almond joy boozy ice cream is absolutely amazing, also the lavender frozen lemonade. If you're not in the mood for drinks they have a pretty unique coffee menu. Parking isn't too hard to find most nights. The staff is quick and attentive and I really enjoyed the outside seating.

I received a quote over the phone from Jodi just before closing time. Afterwards, I checked an online quote from Safelite, which was about $10 less, however there were additional "hidden costs" i.e..disposal and so on which they do not disclose up front. You can not speak to a rep at Satellite, only online etc. Jodi put me in their shop the following morning and my new windshield was already there. Beto, the installer, removed all of the rust around the windshield gasket with a small grinder, primed the area with a special sealant and saved me big $$$ from an auto body shop. This was a labor intensive job and they did not charge me extra, which I was more than willing to pay. Awesome service, honest, no nonsense local business.
Thank you so much!

Food is still good, but service has tanked . . . severely. They are afraid to approach the tables, and the listening skills are very bad. They seem to be in a hurry to get stuff to you and get away. I know we're still in somewhat of a covid atmosphere, but either provide decent service or go back to take out only. I think next Indian craving will be Saffrons. They're good too and not afraid to provide service.

One of my favorite places in the city to get a good and cheap breakfast. The staff is always nice! Very local feel to it. As if you're at your family members house. Lol. Get the Fried Chicken with Eggs and homestyle hash browns! You won't regret it!!

We tried this place for the first time last week before the Phillies game. It was great! We showed up about 1.5 hours before game time, and there was already a wait. We easily found a seat at the bar and ordered food from there. We had the nachos and they were good!  Our bartender was very friendly and quick. 

It did take some extra searching on yelp because it's spelled Pass & Stow...no E at the end :)

I'll go 3 stars but the other reviews are somewhat correct. Everything I looked at was marked and great selection of goods with great boots and hats, but the help leaves a little bit to b desired. Not friendly  or outgoing which is a must for retail,not rude just really not friendly. Great store nice set up but need better help.

The service here is horrible. Our waiter had an attitude when I told him the Mexican street corn didn't taste authentic. It tasted like corn out the can, not roasted as the menu stated. He didn't say sorry or anything. He just snatched it out my hand and kept walking. He barely checked on us. Therefore, he received a very basic tip!!!! Las Palmas work on your service. I will not be returning to this location. This place is a joke. The owner asked me to contact him as you see from his reply below regarding my visit. I haven't heard anything back yet. Don't act like you're concerned on Yelp and don't respond back!
Don't be afraid of the line, it moves quickly and the food is worth the wait!  This place lives up to the hype.  Charming and delicious.  Nice espresso drinks to go along with your breakfast too.

This place has a policy of collar shirts cause they want to represent a sense of class. Had no idea there was a dress code but be sure not to wear just a T-shirt and jeans when you come to this place. This place has a nice classical ambiance with dim lighting and a comfortable dining experience. They have a wide selection of seafood here and they constantly serve you biscuits, CONSTANTLY. Like literally when your'e done eating them, a server will come to yoru table and refill your biscuit place. I recommend eating it with butter right when he/she serves it to you. 

Friend and I ordered the pork belly, John Dory, and the sheepshead. The pork belly came with compressed watermelon and to be honest it didn't really go well together. I understand its suppose to be refreshing your palate but it just didn't work together. The pork belly was infused with asian influence but it had a nice crunch with the fat already rendered completely. Dish looked pretty, but the watermelon just really doesn't work. 

John Dory fish was pretty good, the fish was just cooked nicely enough to maintain its integrity and the flavor of the fish. The sheepshead was actually my favorite dish out of the two. It was kind of like eating a cheeze it coated fish, in a good sense. You have the crusted cheese covering and protecting the fish and its structure while providing the nice saltiness and cheese flavor on the skin. The sheepshead came with fried capers along with asparagus and some sauce. Pretty damn good quality fish. One of the top seafood places I've had over the country actually. Service here is on point and very helpful with information on menu and drinks. 

Make sure you make a reservation here on time otherwise you'll have to wait a while before you get a table.

Probably my favorite burger place in Tucson. Everything on the menu is sourced locally. They do recommend getting your burger cooked medium rare because use very lean premium beef. Every burger is service with rosemary fries and on an English muffin which adds a nice texture compared to a traditional burger. Service is usually pretty good seating is not the best. 4 stars is because the price is a little high for burger and fries but very good food

Very attentive and checked in via text whenever an item was substituted. They selected high quality produce and were very friendly. I have ordered grocery pickup at several other stores and food lion was the best experience.

I waited since 1992 to visit this wonderful wonderland of Germany; and, had it not been for some fellow Yelpers that I follow, I may never have experienced this hiding-in-plain-sight gem.  It's a store, a cafe and restaurant, and a little German grocery.  I could spend hours and still not see everything Heidelburg has to offer.  If feels like you've gone somewhere else when you walk inside, and the food??? Well, I've only tasted the Cherry Streusel and I cannot wait to try everything in the pasty, bakery, and restaurant.  It was delicious.  
And, I love the vibe of the bar.  Just cool as a cucumber and relaxed.  After looking over the gnomes (I never knew they could be so cool, makes me want to start a collection), the beer steins, and just endless German Imports like chocolates, candies, shirts, and odds and ends...I was disappointed only that I had to leave.
I will be back.  I loved it and mad at myself for never stopping when I knew from the outside murals on the building and decorations that I would love it.  If you don't go with your gut, go with mine.  It's worth the visit!

Wow what is this place lol I really wanted to like this place because of the reviews, but unfortunately we could not try the famous cheesesteak. Since we went there at around 6PM on a saturday, they were all out of the steak meat. So we got another thing on the menu, the paesano sandwich. First of all, those flavors really don't match i think. The sharp, extremely strong cheese and the sour pepperoncini did not mesh well together AT ALL. And i LOVE pepperoncinis. the meat tasted really off- 4 of us who got the same thing felt like maybe the meat went bad? we couldn't finish this weird sandwich. We also got the tuscan fries which we were excited for but it had this thick black sauce on it which made it taste exactly like mall chinese food. i do not recommend this place :/

This week we bought our second Jetta from this dealership. Both experiences were by far the best car buying experiences we've had. I was shocked how fast the process was once we decided on a vehicle. The service department is also top notch. On my first Jetta I had a lot of issues with vibration at certain speeds. After not being able to correct it with an alignment and balance they actually sent an engineer from VW to Boise just to look at my car. Turned out to be faulty tires in the end but I was overly impressed with the lengths they went to make sure I was satisfied with my purchase and the VW brand.

I love this cozy breakfast/brunch place in Point Breeze! I only wish it were closer to my apartment but it's still well worth the bike ride over. They have  a cute assortment of succulents that enhance the warm, welcoming atmosphere. 

I've been here a couple times now, and everything I've gotten has been on point. This time, I ordered the Walnut Street pancakes and a breakfast sandwich with scrambled eggs, cheese, beef hot sausage, on an everything bagel. The pancakes were delicious, with cookie butter layered between each pancake, and the walnuts adding that extra crunch. The sandwich provided a perfect savory counterpart, I only wished the beef hot sausage extended into every mouthful. I've ordered the French toast and omelettes before and recommend them too. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. 

The staff is also super friendly, on our first trip we got complimentary iced tea that was so yummy (they have a wide selection of drinks that are popular). The prices can't be beat. Between the two of us, our total came up to just under $20 including tax and tip. This place is a real hidden gem!

Such a cute spot! I love unique places like this and would definitely stop by when in St. Pete again. The food was delicious, every taste well balanced and assembled. I had the best grilled cheese of my life here. Please make sure to order if you love cheese! Servers were also friendly and efficient. I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

The store didn't seem to have things in stock, it could be that I just went on a day that they hadn't received new shipment in. The things I needed weren't things I was out of, I just like to have extra stock for when I do run out so it wasn't a big deal for me. 

I love that they have the new self check lines, where its a "U" shape so its one line that feeds to all the registers, rather than one line per register. it makes your shopping experience a lot better when you can be in and out. (It's always that one person who has a cart FULL of items in the self check out, which I'm aware that its not called Quick check out, but in my mind its for those who want to be in and out) That is nothing against Walmart since there isn't any signage stating how many items you can have to go through these lines. 

I love the low prices that Walmart offers, as compared to similar stores that sell the same products. My pocketbook thanks you!

I will always choose a Walmart over other stores due to their pricing, no matter the cleanliness or customer service. 

I haven't personally had any issues with this store.

I had a fantastic experience at Gretchen's Bridal Gallery! Long story short, I needed to get a wedding dress for my wedding in 3 weeks. I called the day before, and they assured me that they had off the rack dresses and could make this happen. I walked in and I was astonished by all of the off the rack options. The dresses were gorgeous and I got exactly what I wanted and feel so excited for the wedding. My stylist was super sweet and did a great job of helping me narrow down which dress to pick. They have an alterations team next door who took me the same day and made sure I would get my dress altered in time. Can't get better than that! 

Once you pick a dress, you have options to take cute photos with the sign and white flower wall; and then you also sign your new married name on a white dress in the lobby. Super cute idea. I'd recommend them to anyone!

Awesome Awesome Awesome....

My wife and I decided to give this place a try after reading the reviews.  I am glad that we did.  We were seated promptly and our waitress was very helpful.

We started with the fried crab fingers which was very tasty.  The sauce on top was some type of sweet and sour sauce (I think) which made this dish even better.

We ordered "The Hamper" and glad we did.  It had boiled shrimp, blue crabs, king crab and stone crabs.  Also there was corn, potatoes and garlic.  The food was perfectly season and abundant.  We ate until we were full and brought plenty home.  All that food for $45.

At the end, our waitress brought us a bread pudding to try, because it was our first time there.  It was okay, but was very appreciative of her generosity.

We would definitely be back and hopefully soon.... lol

My experience wasn't great but I would be willing to give them another chance. Ample parking in the back of the building (website gives a great idea of where you can and cannot park). We had reservations and were seated at the bar top. We ordered drinks and a charcuterie board. The drinks were good. The charcuterie board took over 30 minutes when there were very few people in the place. Felt a little ignored, but maybe service would be better next time.

It's a little cramped, but the overall experience was very good. The place has a nice, local vibe to it. I am not a fan of breakfast food, but that is where the group wanted to go. Everyone that had breakfast was very happy with what they had. Since I don't care much for breakfast, I ordered the Reuben and a cup of bean soup.  The soup was excellent, but I didn't really think the Reuben was noteworthy.  It was just okay.  My wife had the number one and enjoyed it.  The vegetarian hash was a big hit with my sister.  It was the special of the day, so I'm not sure how often it's available. My brother in law had the avocado toast with bacon instead of chorizo. He was happy with his meal, too. My wife made a point of saying that they have great decaf coffee, which is apparently not commonly a thing.
My husband is here for the first time ... He loved it ..AZ is really really good . Friendly people and nice service ..... He loved it and while I waited I looved it more

Not the best option when searching for Mexican food in Smyrna but not an awful choice. Food is average and the service is subpar. 

Not one server or worker was wearing a mask and upon observation- they did not sanitize between seatings.

First timer! 
When first walking in this location I noticed the cute coffee bags that are used for decor on the ceilings. It was very quiet when I arrived and they a few tables outside for when the weather is nice. A great place to come back to either read or get some work done! 

They have great menu that include crepes and sandwiches and more. They have both sweet and savory crepes; I ordered a chicken and spinach which was amazing. 

They have great coffee, if you like cinnamon, order the campfire! You won't regret it.

Came here with a friend late one Saturday night and was excited to try something new in Haddonfield. I love that this is French and something different we don't have around here. We started off with the chilled crab soup, which was excellent. For my entree, I had the skate wing and the haricots verts. This was absolutely phenomenal!!!!! So, so delicious. I can't wait to come back. Everything I saw others getting also looked good. I am giving this five stars based on how amazing the food is. However, as other posters stated, there are some kinks to work out with the actual restaurant itself. It is hot. I live nearby and chose to walk here on a warm night so I was already warm when I got here which was a mistake. There is really not much relief inside. They give you water without ice, which is common, but for how hot it is in here they should give ice. I asked for some and they gave me it. I also agree the ventilation needs work, though it didn't bother me terribly. I really hope these issues are resolved, because otherwise this is a great addition to Haddonfield!

Amazing dinner at Santa Barbara! This restaurant is so popular, we didn't have a reservation and the waiting time at a Wednesday night is 1.5 hours. But if you choose to sit at the bar, you can wait until there's empty seats. The bar is first come first serve. The foods here are really delicious. I highly recommend the arugula salad with Serrano ham, it's very very yummy. I also love the basque cheesecake, it's the best basque cheesecake I've ever had. I recommend here if you like Spanish food.

I live in Indiana and have used Soles Exterminating for about a year now.  In all my dealings with Soles they have been prompt, efficient, and affordable.  Dan always gets back with my concens in a timely fashion and addresses the situation.  We had a mix up on a billing cycle and Dan patiently worked through the situation WITH me. I contacted him while I was there for vacation.  My family and I went to Orlando for a few days.  Dan went to the house to address my concerns.  He saw the problem and fixed it.  He then contacted me to inform me of what the problem was and the steps he took to solve it.  
Soles is really a top notch company who give personal attention to their clients.  You will not be disappointed.

Be prepared for long wait times! I came on a Wednesday evening at 6 and was quoted 45 min - 1 hr. Accurate - we were seated a little less than an hour later. 

They let you buy drinks to take on the beach or just sit in your car while you wait. I ordered the blood orange margarita (very strong) and my friend ordered the step in the right direction. His drink was much lighter and more flavorful. Very herby

Once we got seated, I ordered some oysters for the table. I love oysters and am absolutely obsessed with them. Market price when I went was $20 for half a dozen. The oysters were so fresh and it comes with a sherry vinegar and cocktail sauce I believe. I generally prefer my oysters with just a touch of lemon but I also enjoyed the vinegar - not so much a fan of the cocktail sauce

For my main, I ordered seared ahi tuna which is one of my favorite dishes. Hendrys does it right! The sear is perfect as you can see the beautiful tuna in the middle. It comes with tempura vegetables which had a nice crunch but a little lackluster when it comes to flavor. Perhaps a sauce would benefit it. You also get a bed of rice which was not too dry or wet and infused with great flavor and spices but not to the point where it overwhelmed the dish. 

I also ordered the feel good hit of the summer which was a seasonal drink. Honestly did not really enjoy it - it almost tasted like pickle juice... 

I think I would come back here during happy hour when the drinks are a better price but the food was really amazing - just a bit on the pricier side for some items. Disappointingly it was so gloomy when I came but I would love to come back on a sunny morning for some breakfast or lunch

I used to be a regular at this wing stop and had some great wings  but my experience has gone downhill due to watching kitchen staff gross me out with how they prepared food  I had a head manager reach out to me and gave me a free meal for my next time and I came back to give them another try and ended up having a worse experience on the trip back 
I've decided to get my wings elsewhere

Grabbing a beer and enjoying the Parklife (https://youtu.be/YSuHrTfcikU) are two of my favorite things. So when I first found out that Philly Parks & Rec was combining the two into a traveling summer beer garden I was sold and checking that calendar twice. And after attending it during the Columbus Park layover, I'm happy to report that its a solid occasion!

The food and drink menu is a bit lacking compared to the majority of regular beer gardens open throughout the city. But for beers it provides a selection of well rounded local drafts from the likes of St. Benjamin's, Evil Genius, and Dock Street. It also provide some BBQ goodness from an impressive on-site customer smoker truck, and has good veggie options like a smoked eggplant sandwich and panzanella to ensure that you're vegetarian friends aren't left out while you indulge on brisket and smoked turkey sausage.

Currently Parks on Tap just finished up at the Shofuso Japanese House & Garden in Fairmount, and is getting ready to set up in Schuylkill Banks next week. But with stops in South Philly's Jefferson Square, Fishtown's Penn Treaty Park, West Philly's Clark Park, Manayunk's Pretzel Park, and more; you definitely want to keep track of their website to find out what this traveling beer garden has lined up!

Stopped by Oneal's after the Happy Hour at Tattooed Mom's and it was definitely a good scene. It had the classic neighborhood bar feel, 2 floors of hugeness, late night gastropub food, and plenty of daily drink specials to merit a visit.

We rolled up to the second floor and got drinks promptly. Wednesday was ladies night (1/2 drinks for the ladies) and $2.50 domestic drafts, so the tab was next to nothing. We also got to watch the worst game of darts EVER. these players were seriously ricocheting darts off the only metal part of the board. it kind of bought back memories of when I took a dart to the leg, but it was amusing to watch nonetheless.

Overall O'Neals is a great neighborhood dive that has plenty to do and see. Cheers.

I fell in love with this adorable store on Passyunk when I first stopped in around the holidays. At that point, my shopping was complete but there were so many cute gift ideas that I knew it was only a matter of time before I would return. 

In need of a baby gift and recalling the locally-made and locally-inspired onesies, I returned to find something cute for my best guy friend's adorable baby girl. This time, most of the onesie designs were super hipster. This would be great for some of my friends but totally lost on this particular couple. Fortunately, I spotted some handmade baby blankets. So soft and with gently colored patterns, it was immediately evident that this was the perfect gift. And the price was more than fair. The woman working wrapped the blanket in pink tissue paper and placed it into a simple brown shopper with the store's name. Easy peasy! Next time I need a gift that doesn't break the bank, I'm checking out Nice Things first.

After walking by Youcol many times, I decided to give it a try for a pedicure. I recommend it and plan to return. The salon is clean and tidy with more pandemic safety precautions than most. The staff is professional and considerate. I especially appreciated the time and care taken with my feet, which exceeded my expectations as well as my experiences at other salons that charge more. I also loved that it was quiet and peaceful without the loud cable TV  that blasts elsewhere.

Incredible CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE - and I'm a connoisseur, so trust me.

The curried chicken salad sandwich was really tasty toasted!

I found the vegetarian chili to be good but on the bland side.

The FOCACCIA bread was soft, garlicy, herby, and fantastically delicious. Wish I could have bought two loaves but at 11am the bakery was already down to their last one. So arrive early if you want a good selection!

Villari's Lake Side Is a bar restaurant, that is adjacent to what appears to be a man made lake. My dining partner and I went for lunch on a weekend, and sat by the window near the lake. Well we didn't have the opportunity to sit outside, due to the weather, if you have the opportunity it would be worthwhile as it looks like a very nice outdoor seating area. They convert the outside into a tiki bar type area, and also do weddings and banquets at this location.

The menu is fairly extensive and has a lot of fairly traditional American and Italian fair including pasta, sandwiches, and other hot platters.

The service was very good, and we had no complaints. Overall this is a fairly sizable location, and it appears to be very popular with the locals, especially for the outdoor ambiance. I would highly recommend a visit on an evening where you can sit outside!

Let's start with the reason you're there. The pizza is delicious. Dough tastes fresh. Sauce tastes fresh and homemade. Perfectly seasoned. Pies are cooked right - not undercooked, not burnt.

Regular pies are cooked throughout the day (so slices are always fresh) or cooked to order (if you order a whole pie).

Slices are $1 each. Ridiculous. On Long Island we are paying $2 - $2.50 per slice. Whole pie is $8. Toppings are 50¢ extra. (The red onions were delicious!)

The restaurant is very simple, casual, and relatively quiet. It's clean. It's brightly lit. It's covered with Post It notes.

Wait. What?

OK. So what makes Rosa's so unique???

The "Pay It Forward" concept conceived by the owner, Mason Wartman - Buy a slice for yourself, buy a slice for someone less fortunate.

How does it work?

This comes straight from Philly.com (published January 13, 2015) - 

"Wartman owns Rosa's Fresh Pizza at 25 S. 11th Street in Philadelphia, where pizza is $1 a slice and $8 for a whole pie.

But that's not all Rosa's is known for. Customers have the chance to pay it forward when they purchase their dollar slices; they can also donate an additional dollar to help feed the homeless and those in need. Post-it notes cover the walls inside the shop from patrons wishing those in need some words of encouragement"

This was my first ever visit to Philadelphia and I'm really glad we stopped in and had an opportunity to meet and chat with Mason.

The world could really use more people like him!!

Stop in, grab a slice, and help support the cause!

Thank you. :-)

Great spot for a drink. I ordered a cocktail off their menu and didn't love it so got something else. Without asking or complaining they took the first drink off the bill. The environment is intimate and high end. The waiter was very attentive. I'm sad it's taken me this long to go as I live close by. I will definitely be back. Great chill atmosphere. Speakeasy vibe.

We were STARVING when we arrived to New Orleans after a late flight and after some quick surveying of the late night food delivery landscape, this place seemed to be our best bet. 

I'm vegetarian and unfortunately the vegetarian options at this place are scarce. They have breakfast, sandwiches with every single kind of ingredient you could imagine, specialty sandwiches, and sides. 

Both GF and I elected to order the fries po'boy bc why the fuck would you not? I meant to order both with all the fix ins (tomato, lettuce, and a condiment) but the "fix ins" appeared in our cart as a separate order which I stupidly deleted. 

We also ordered regular fries, and cheese fries (as if we briefly forgot we ordered a po'boy with fries) and mac and cheese. 

The food arrived within expected time but unfortunately did not contain the mac and cheese. After running through the suspects that could have been responsible for this blasphemy, I noticed an email with the refund for the missing item. It turns out they were out of mac and cheese at 1am. 

So, in case you were wondering, the fries po'boy without the fix ins is literally bread and fries. It paired nicely with the rest of our order (cheese fries and regular fries). Fortunately, the fries here are pretty good. They're thicker than I usually prefer but very crispy. The thickness provides for a nice, meaty, fry. This meal was as enjoyable as bread and fries could be. 

I'd be curious to try the sandwich again with the fix ins.

Came during dinner for restaurant week and they sure did give me the impression that I have to come back when restaurant week is over. Service was excellent, food (although on the smaller portion side) was filling & packed a punch in flavor. The ambiance is so chic & intimate, I'm already planning a date night for next month.

I would give no stars if I could.  When you call their number, you get bounced to a call center (which I did not know).  The call center told me they would arrive at a concrete time.  They said "no problem"!!  That's why I hired them.   I also told them that the street we were moving from was a small street so they would send the right size truck.  This was for a one bedroom move.    When the rep called to go over details of the move I reiterated about the time and the size of the street.  After he googled the street, I was told they could not do the move, their truck would not be able to get down the street.  He also said there was no way they could commit to a certain time.  I was left without a mover 4 days before the move.  Left us high and dry!!!!  No help, no alternatives, just said they couldn't do it.

I have tried his place several
Times over the years in hopes that they learned something about both Vietnamese food and quality preparation.  Been disappointed every time (from the Pho to the slimy papaya salad).  

Unfortunately, there are zero Vietnamese places worth eating at in the vicinity.  How much more expensive is it to do it right and create good dishes?  In our region (not immediate area though) we have so many locations such as Adams Ave, Washington Ave, etc with good examples of Vietnamese food. 

Owners/chef, please  take a couple weeks traveling around and sampling their food. You too will understand how you are missing the mark and just how much potential you have. Imagine being the Vietnamese food destination for those of us living within a 15 mile radius. You can truly do something real here and folks will come and you will make money. Just take the time to reevaluate and recreate authentic, fresh and real market driven dishes. 

Let me know when you do and I promise you I will come back give you a glorious review. I am
Sure other will come too in droves if you successfully start caring about the food. 

Best of luck.

Not sure why this place got 4 stars. 

Slowest service ever and there weren't even many of us dining here. 

Be cautious of spice level. A few of my Spice tolerant friends preferred a 4 on a 5 point scale and they were dying after a few bites. 

It took about 30 minutes to get our food. That's crazy long. 

One of my friends sent the Tom Yum back because it was intolerably hot and the chef sent it back but it wasn't any better. 

The beef noodle soup wasn't really satisfying. 

The dynamite and spicy tuna rolls weren't all that great. Quite an underwhelming experience. 

We ordered a side of rice to neutralize the spice. It never made it to the table but was on the check. 

Overall, quite a disappointment. 

Wouldn't recommend this place even though others ratings are quite the contrary. Perhaps it was an "off" night for them.
Fights inside that spill into the streets...  not ideal.  They don't seem to be organized enough to safely host parties.

I have had the opportunity now to have Barbacoa's food both as a dine-in and take-out.  This restaurant has recently re-located from Upper Darby to a cozy spot on Rittenhouse Place in Ardmore. Parking is plentiful.  Meters before 6 PM.  There are some tables, however they clearly expect more takeout than dine-in business.

Our first occasion was as a dine-in, two kids, Faithful Dining Companion, the Reverend Dr. Steak and Honorable Pastor Ribs and Oldest, Dearest Friend all headed there on a Friday night.  We were happy to find they could accommodate our size.  

We ordered a variety of items - filet mignon sandwich, ribs, brisket, pulled pork.  Also got greens and mac & cheese.  All were 'very good'.  Brisket was not *quite* Percy Street nor was the pork.  Ribs were OK, a bit chewy, not nearly up to what Luther con cots at Ribs R Us.  The mac & cheese was good but a bit clumpy.  Filet Mignon was  probably the best of the offerings.  

Service was OK, the server appeared inexperienced and somewhat lost at times.  

While we were there, we observed a steady parade of people coming in, picking up giant bags of food, and leaving. 

So, on another day we decided to order the takeout, got the chicken, brisket and ribs.  The chicken ROCKS the house. Very succulent, nice flavor, tender and moist.  Yum.  I have no idea if it's Peruvian, whatever it is, it was highly enjoyable.  Brisket and ribs, again good.

We would get the chicken again, take out.  Not sure if I would bother sitting down again as the parade of take-outs was distracting.  

It's BYOB, if you forgot yours and you want to dine in, the Rittenhouse deli exactly 2 doors away sells beer.  For wine the Ardmore State Store is about 1/2 mile away.

Let me just start off by saying there is so much freaking talent in this shop! I found Blake while looking for an artist to finish my husband's tattoo sleeve that was started by a previous artist. Blake was so quick to respond, so easy going, and met with my husband to plan out the rest of his sleeve. Fast forward about a week and Blake had posted some awesome drawings saying he had some immediate openings to fill so I jumped on quick! He was so flexible, so easy going, and honestly just a genuine cool dude to spend a couple hours with. He charges a super fair hourly rate and his tattoos are flawless. He offered touch-ups for up to 6 months after my tattoo for free. I will definitely be coming back for more work in the near future!

Ijji noodles were a little bland tonight, but still pretty tasty. Ijji fried rice hit the spot and was delicious. Tried the Kobe beef bulgogi tonight and we were all fighting over it - so full of flavor and delicious! It's not really a meal to share - it's definitely more of an individual entree served in a bowl with white rice and spinach, but we made it work. We also tried the Imperial rolls and they were quite delicious with a tangy little dipping sauce. Everything was presented very well in take out boxes and not only was I greeted right away when I arrived, but my take out server was very friendly.

Some four and five star dishes but a poorly cooked entré and lackluster service are what prevent me from giving a higher rating.  In full disclosure, we were the last table seated on a Sunday evening and it was the day after Christmas so maybe they had the "B" team on the floor and/or in the kitchen. But when your menu is $30+ for a main, then you have to deliver every night. 

First, the best parts. Our party of four started with the deviled eggs, wedge salad and the winter squash soup. Of the three dishes, the deviled eggs were by far the standout with perfectly balanced flavors of dill, sweet and spice. The wedge salad was fine and only memorable because of the bacon. The soup was a little disappointing. The texture was a bit grainy which may have been a deliberate chef's choice. If so, we prefer our squash soups a little smoother. But the server was served slightly warm but not nearly as hot as one would expect. That said, the fritters served on the side were outstanding and deserve their own spot on the appetizer menu. 

Our main courses were the filet mignon, the spare ribs, the chicken and biscuits (from the appetizers) and the pork chops. The filet mignon and spare ribs were the stars of the show. The filet was perfectly cooked, melt in your mouth tender with a demi glace that was wonderfully rich and flavorful. That filet is as good as (better than!) anything you'll find at a high-end steak house. 

The spare ribs were right up there with the filet. So perfectly tender that the meat fell cleanly off each bone. The sauce was the right blend of sweet and savory and in just the right proportion. Like the soup, the ribs were served luke warm which perhaps was chef's choice but we would preferred they arrived at the table a little hotter. 

We also liked the chicken and biscuits. The biscuits were light and flaky which could also describe the breading on the chicken.  Not sure we'd go back just for the chicken and biscuits but we would order them again. 

This brings us to the Ill fated pork chop. On the plus side, the sauce and plantains served on the side were delicious. But the pork chop was simply over cooked (or it sat in the pass for too long).  We found it difficult to cut even with the serrated steak knife provided and the pork itself dry, tough and chewy which deprived it of any pork flavor.  We can see the potential in this dish had it been cooked properly so that the pork was moist and tender.

Finally, we felt let down by the service. It started by us waiting at the host's station for several minutes before anyone acknowledging us. Once we were seated our water glasses were promptly filled by a server who said nothing even when we spoke to him. Once the waters were filled, we waited just over ten minutes before the server returned to our table to take the drink orders. At that point he was cordial but terse in his delivery. We also couldn't help but notice things like the server reaching across the table (and our dining companions) to hand off a dish rather than walking around the table and setting it down in front of the diner who ordered the dish. This might sound nit-picky but not the kind of service you expect from a restaurant of this caliber.

From beginning to end our experience with McCabe and Son Roofing was very positive.

First, Scott showed-up and gave us an estimate while others blew us off.

It became clear almost immediately that Scott is a seasoned expert when it comes to roofing. He quickly determined that our insulation contractor made a critical installation error and he identified other issues that we were completely unaware of.

He made his recommendations and promised a quote.

A few days later we had a very detailed written assessment of what needed to be done and how much it was going to cost. We were impressed with how well-written Scott's contract is. It gave a very good impression.

The most impressive part was the first day of work. I mean--wow! This was a well-coordinated operation!

Before 7:30 am there were 8 to 10 workers on site. 

Rapidly the roofing supplies came.
The dumpster came. 
The port-o-pottie came.

Boom! It all came at nearly the same time.

Everything went from quiet tranquility to beehive of activity within minutes after their arrival.  

I was shocked to see they had all the shingles off the main roof, plus all the plywood, and they were already nailing down new plywood... less than 2 hours into the job.

These guys don't mess around! 

His workers were polite, considerate and respectful of our property. Scott has an excellent crew.

In 2 days the job was done, (and it was a big job). I was very impressed with how hard these men worked.
