They left zero mess behind. 

They took pains to clean-up, and they were especially concerned about leaving nails behind.

Scott personally inspected the work at the end, ensuring that things were done to his standards.

And a few days later, after the dumpster was removed, Scott returned again to make certain no nails were left in our driveway. That was a nice touch.

We think Scott McCabe is a top service provider. I have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending him to others.

In addition to being a top service provider, Scott is also genuinely nice. 

If he costs a little more than others, he's worth it.

I love the feel of this place. I just wish it was not dominated by so many televisions. I like a true pub feel, and the TV's are a distraction. The service here is outstanding and the food is wonderful. Amazing beer selection as well. It is fun to go here for more than just Saint Patrick's day. They also have a really nice collection of whiskeys and bourbons. Get the scotch eggs or the Monte Cristo.

Great spot to get a burger. We've eaten at the one in South Bend and this decor was much more pub like. We were seated right away and the hostess was really friendly. We sat in the bar area but its really no different that the other areas except we had a raised table. Loads of tvs to watch a game (which we did). Excellent choice for food and drink. I selected the double bacon burger. One note I thought it was extra bacon but it was actually two patties. No biggie as it was excellent. Also had the onion rings. They are really large and tasty. There are  two really nice outdoor fire-pit areas but it was too cold during our visit. Will definitely come back to enjoy those spots. Overall great service and solid food. Excellent value. Make sure you give this place a try.

Came here for the last meal of our long weekend and honestly I was personally a little disappointed.  I had read SO many good reviews about the pork, the bbq, everything!  First off, the line was crazy long which usually is a good indicator that the food is good especially in smaller cities (in NYC, long lines are not an indicator for anything).  So our expectations were getting higher.  We were also looking around and the food we saw looked and smelled great.

I ended up ordering the pulled pork sandwich with a side of cornbread and grit casserole.  The grits were AMAZING.  They were probably the only best part of the meal.  The cornbread was just okay - it was definitely on the harder side and didn't really have too much flavor to it.  The pulled pork sandwich was also a disappointment.  It was dry and not at all flavorful.  The only good part of it was the BBQ sauce but that was also minuscule and was only located at a small part of the sandwich.  The rest didn't even have BBQ sauce on it.  I finished it cause I was starving but honestly it wasn't that great.

My friend ordered the half rack of ribs.  She thought it was okay but I tried a bit of her ribs and they were SO DRY.  (She also tried my pulled pork and said it was dry as well...so that goes to show that the two meats we tried was just too dry).  It also lacked flavor and overall wasn't that great. 

Very disappointed overall but definitely loved those grits!

I've been to Metro several time and love it.  I don't know why I've never thought to review it.  Staff has always been friendly and last night I saw them really take care of a customer who was not doing well.  There's an upstairs where the dj is when there is one, a smaller bar and a pool table.  Out back is a nice patio with seating that is great when it's warm.  Downstairs the big bar and seating.  Sometimes Karaoke or live music or other fun things.  I've never had a meal there but I know the appetizers late at night are good (of course sometimes at that point anything would be).  With a lot of gay bars going by the wayside I'm glad we still have this one in a main location like this.

I have been a regular here for a while. It is really the only place for Ethiopian in Edmonton, in my humble opinion. I have tried the others but there is really no comparison. Not only is this small family run place charming, but it is extremely consistent. They haven't really changed their menu since 13 years ago when they opened. I love that I can go there and get my berbere fix. I love the injera and find it one of the most interesting foods of Africa. I would love to learn how to make it.

If you love your tastebuds, save room for dessert. The cheesecake is more than to die for. It's heaven and I have often dreamt of it. One of the best that has crossed my lips.

I really appreciate the service and the attention to detail. I think that if you want to be treated well, you can go here and have that guaranteed. Well done Langano Skies!

There are a lot of great Vietnamese options in the St.Pete area and La V is arguably the best among all. The ambience has a nice modern feel about it and the friendly staff add to the overall experience. The food itself is great. I ordered the Tofu pho and it was perfectly spiced and made for a nice healthy dinner. They have a lot of great vegetarian options and always willing to customize your order if you ask.

Has a classic, old pub feel and the menu is more eclectic than a traditional pub in St Louis, which is refreshing. I really liked the Porchetta Louie sandwich - bread was soft, oozing cheese, thinly cut pork, hint of pepperoncinis. Wife got the burger and liked it. Potato salad was a little too sweet for our taste, but the homemade chips are delicious. We will definitely go back.

A friend's father recently passed rather suddenly. In searching for a florist, In Full Bloom was my go-to once again -- partially due to the good experience I had with them before, and also since their wide selection and reasonable rates seem to be one of the better options for the eastside.
I ordered a heartleaf philodendron to be delivered to my friends' house the next day. 

The morning of the delivery, an employee from In Full Bloom called me to advise they did not have heartleaf philodendrons in stock. However, she offered to send a peace lily (which is more expensive) for no additional charge. She went on to explain the peace lilies they did have are larger than usual and absolutely gorgeous. So I opted for one of those in lieu of.

I mentioned to her I had just spoken with my friend before speaking with her, and he had to make an unexpected, quick trip out of town for work. Fortunately, he had volunteered to me information about his wife's whereabouts, which I was able to relay to the florist. She was very willing to ensure the plant wasn't delivered until they confirmed the Mrs. was home so that this beautiful plant didn't freeze to death on their doorstep!

I later heard from my friends that the peace lily is, in fact, very large and really beautiful.

We came in as those asshole 20 minutes before close. Which was kind of a shock to me being most resturants in this area stay open later in the Summer because of how much business they get being close by the River. Anyways that was not the case, so we asked if it would be okay because honestly I was ready to head fast to Bardenay! But they said yes and my husband was persistent. 

We did not get horrible service for the circumstance. Some white lady was singing Proud Mary which was weird being it is Asian Cuisine but I ignored the weirdness. Our server... Tim? He was good. I was a little annoyed he said we had to "order" by nine. Most places sit up until their closing time. To each their own but what annoyed me the most was this heavy set white lady (possible  busser) storming around with a pissed off look on her face and slamming things around while yelling at other people. That ruined the vibe for me.

We managed to squeeze in an appetizer and meals before nine. The flavor of the lettuce wraps is good but the portion size was way too small. I am dieting and ordered a mojito chicken dish. The chicken was crying for salt. I ate it all but it was so bland. I thought maybe because it was a healthy dish but I trief my son's chow mein with chicken and it tasted bland as well. The vegetables tasted frozen and equally flavorless. However the chow mein noodles were so flavorful I think it pushed my review rating to a three.  My husband's ribeye tasted really good and he said the food was great. But I'm sure everything tastes great compared to my cookinh so I take his opinion with a grain of salt lol

How can anyone give this place 5 stars......maybe youre currently writing this drunk at the winery itself? 

I came here for bloody marys. I swear there was no alcohol in them....

I had 3. There was allegedly 2 shots in each. I felt nothing though!

I gotta say the worst part was the structure and overall look of this place. It looked like it was gonna fall apart. The barn/deck was like termites holding hands....


Also there were a TON of extremely sick cats roaming around!!! SO SAD

2nd dining experience at Mesh unfortunately did not live up to the expectations from our 1st visit.  

Visited on last day of their Devour Indy menu.  I opted for the Devour menu and my husband went with the Duck entree.  The food was good but service wasn't the best.  Disappointed to learn they've done away with the herb bread and olive oil that they had the last time we visited about 8 months ago.  Orange brown sugar cheesecake was okay.  Didn't taste any orange zest.  Tasted like regular plain cheesecake.

Upon entering we noticed Sunday bottles of wine under $100 are half-priced, which our server didn't mention.  After ordering a bottle we went to front entrance to verify the sign they had advertised.  We ordered a bottle of chilled rose and had to ask midway through our meal for the wine to be chilled.  The server was a younger girl, don't think she gave her name, and never asked how the meal was.  When desert was delivered as part of the devour menu we were without silverware for about 10 minutes before getting the attention of wait staff.  It wasn't packed, so really no excuse for poor experience.  Then to top it off with a visit to the restroom I couldn't help but notice a broken light switch with exposed wires.  I would like to think nicer dining establishments would take care to fix these safety hazards and for visual appeal.  If a work order has been placed, maybe it would be wise to put a sign apologizing for the broken switch & noting it's scheduled for repair.

Not sure will recommend or put on my list to return.

There aren't many places that serve beer cheaper than fountain drinks in the area, but Ghengis Grill certainly does that. I didn't really know what to expect during my first visit here and I was very surprised about how the whole process worked.

The girls working here explained everything as best as they could. I wasn't sure how much to fill up my bowl with meats and vegetables, but apparently whatever you fit in the bowl they will cook for you. 

Our food came out a short time later and the portions are obviously large assuming that you fill up your bowl with your desired toppings. 

The service was good and our server kept our drinks full. I'm excited to go back here because I really like the selection of food, the taste and the overall process of how you pick out your meal.

This is arguably the nicest gas station I have been to in quite some time. This location is a few years old and very well designed. The fuel area is far enough way from the convenient area to where there is not a lot of traffic causing congestion all over. 

Inside of Thornton's is clean, organized, well laid out and very spacious. The drink selection is large and the fountain area is as good as it gets. They have about 20 fountain options to choose from and the lid/straw area is clean and easy to navigate through. I do like how they have adapted to Circle K's .69 cent polar pop and offering their very own .69 cent version. 

If only Thornton's was on the other side of the street I would be there more often.

Terrible experience. Probably the reason that I'd never heard of this place when I went with a friend for lunch the other day. 

I ordered a salad, the Asian chicken to be exact, and was terribly disappointed. The salad was actually just a little iceberg lettuce chopped up. Nothing very appetizing about iceberg, but it was around $10 so I wasn't going to be too hard on it. But then there was barely any chicken. A lot of the chicken was chewy in a strange way. Most of the salad itself was actually a butt-ton of tortilla strips. It was mostly tortilla. 

Friend ordered a vegetable burger with mushrooms. They forgot mushrooms and instead gave her a butt-ton of pickles she'd asked them not to include. It was taken back but they didn't replace the bun that had pickle juice on it. Just removed the pickles and slapped some grilled mushrooms on top. I'm not a big complainer, but that seems lazy to me. 

I ordered two slices of pie to take home. Despite the waitress saying they had the salted caramel creme that I wanted, she came back a good 8 minutes later to tell me they were out. I changed to one chocolate silk and one pumpkin harvest slice. Both were pretty good. I was not a huge fan of the crust on the pumpkin harvest, but it was tasty overall. 

Mostly, the service was bad, which added to lack-luster foods. The waitress took forever to get us drinks. Even longer to notice we needed refills. There seemed to be one waitress for about five tables, but I expected a bit more attention to detail. When we asked for the check, we waited (yes, literally) for 22 minutes before getting the check. The waitress disappeared and when she came back to wipe down a table across from us she looked over and said, "Oh, are you still here?" Yes because we still needed the check. This was probably my only chance to dine-and-dash and I missed it. Darn. 

She gives us the check. Takes her several minutes to come back to take our cards to pay. I feel bad if they're working her that hard that she can't get back and forth to guests in a timely manner. 

The pie was ok. Maybe if I ever feel the need to get a slice... well no, I'd just to get cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory.

I love this place for their curry fish balls, but after ordering from Ubereats, I will never eat there again. I order a steamed pork bun and it came in as hard as a rock. Obviously stored incorrectly and spoiled. Unless you want to lose a tooth, i suggest not ordering from there.

Good God man, what did I just eat?!

I have had Porco's on my list for a while. I'm not sure how I first heard about it. Then we recently moved to Graduate Hospital and discovered it's right next to a beer distributor we go to (!!that has a friendly warehouse cat!!) and decided to try it when restocking our booze post-holidays.

We ordered the Philly and the Cubano for pickup via the website before we left our apartment, picked up some beers and said hi to the cat next door, and by the time we were done our sandwiches were ready! It was freezing out so we took them home to eat.

They were unlike anything I've ever had. I have never had a roast pork sandwich from the other places, so I have no comparison. It definitely isn't a ham sandwich, which is my only pork sandwich comparison. It was so JUICY. We had gotten the sandwiches cut in half so we could each have half of each sandwich to try. I tried the half Philly first and the pesto gave it a little lightness that all the pork definitely needed. It was a really nice balance (but still a big bite and a heavy meal!) We hadn't expected pickled cauliflower on the Cubano but those pickled veggies (the gardenia) were so necessary. The cracklin on both provided a nice crunchy texture. Unfortunately the gruyere on our Cubano was melted almost to smithereens and was practically non-existent, but there was already so much flavor that it was almost okay? I do love me some gruyere though... Named my Animal Crossing island after it.

ANYWAY. The sandwiches are delicious. I would love to give the meatballs a try some day.

Drip is one of those cool places that most locals will scoff at for being the clear brainchild of a hipster transplant and not being intrinsically New Orleans, however I am very thankful that it exists! While I feel like ice cream and coffee is more the stuff of drunken nights than destination dessert, this place does not disappoint! There is no shortage of delicious flavor here and essentially you can't go wrong! I had the bananas foster which contains creme brûlée bananas and a shot of espresso! Dripping the espresso slowly over the ice cream and bananas as you eat gives a real depth of flavor to this sundae! The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because, as with all downtown haunts, parking can be a nightmare, and make no mistakes, this place is pricey. Sure, your $10 could go a lot farther than two rather smallish ice cream scoops and a shot of espresso at many other places, but then you wouldn't be one of the cool kids, now would you?!

It's one of the best places for parathas in this area. It's a must try and all the parathas here are amazing.

The owner here has a bit of a attitude but the taste is well worth it. There is a chance your order might get messed up and even then the owner would still be mad at you but trust me once you get the food you won't care about the attitude at all.

Don't get the mango lassi though - tastes like preservatives.

I've been to several World of Beer establishments and this location holds true to the brand.  We came in for brunch.  I was unaware that brunch was available until I saw a sign advertising bottomless mimosas.  We stopped in and the food was great.  I ordered the huevos rancheros.  I was expecting a more traditional version but this version was pretty good.  I was hoping for a tomato based sauce. Now the potatoes!!! They were AMAZING!!! I legit couldn't stop eating them.

Will I go back absolutely for the potatoes alone not to mention the cocktails are delicious and there's a great beer selection.  For brunch probably, since it's the only time they serve the potatoes.
Loved my chicken francaise. It melted in your mouth and somehow was light even with the butter/pasta. Highly recommend. The live music was a nice touch as well

I had an excellent experience at drybar. I made an appointment online and utilized the code Friyay for $10 off on Fridays during the summer. The salon itself is bright, clean and cheery. When I arrived, the stylist immediately brought me back to have my hair washed. She was very thorough and chatted with me about what I was looking for as she washed my hair. I had already looked at the various styles online, but if you don't do that, there is a "menu" with pictures of all of the different options. I went with the straight up, which is straight with a little body. It ended up being the perfect look for me. The entire process, from start to finish took 45 minutes which was probably my favorite part. I loved that I was able to be in and out. My blowout lasted all day and I got tons of compliments-- I definitely recommend drybar!
Open a year already I found out today but read about this place online. Bought an array of chocolates to bring to Sunday dinner tonight and everyone loved them. They were truly delicious

I really like this Aldi. It's really spacious and has a good amount of offerings (it seems a little bigger than others but it could be the spaciousness). I always mention that credit cards are now accepted! The lines always move pretty quickly as well, even during "rush after work" hours

Interesting feel to the restaurant. It's located next to Southern Yacht Club and we came here after a day of sailing. There were people in very casual attire, but also people who were very dressed up by the bar but it seemed to work overall. The waitress was attentive and we were seated quickly upon arrival. The menu looked great and there were a lot of options it was hard to choose! Eventually decided on the following:

-Oyster Trash Bar: Some of the best shrimp I have ever had. Perfectly blackened and seasoned and tasted really fresh. Lump crab was also really delicious. The lemon sauce was good on the shrimp but not really on it's own and the rice was a little weird tasting but the shrimp made up for the rest of it.
-Seafood Gumbo: Very mild gumbo. Really large and good pieces of seafood inside, which I appreciated and it had a nice flavor as well. In combination with the oyster trash bar, this was a lot of food overall and I definitely ate a little bit to the point of pain (oops).

Food: 9/10
Service: 9/10
Atmosphere: 8/10

Really nice place to go to after spending time by Lake Ponchartrain and would recommend if in that area, but I don't think it's anywhere I would venture far to intentionally get to.

You want excellent Cuban food? Come here!!! You won't be disappointed! Came here on a Thursday night and it was packed. Make sure you get a reservation ahead of time, I didn't but was lucky enough to get a seat at the bar without a reservation. The bar tender was excellent and super helpful. Get a mojito but prepared to want more than 1 because it's heavenly! Got the tostones and ropa vieja and it was a perfect meal for two, who aren't starving. I Shared some plates, as this place was pricier than I was expecting. That's my only complaint is it's probably $10 overpriced but it's really good!!! This place would be great date night spot. I just happened to come across it walking down the street. They have indoor and outdoor seating.

horrible. 

I came here for lunch with my coworker and will never return again. When we walked in, it seemed like they were little busy but the restaurant wasn't packed. we got sat after 5 minutes and our server came to greet us right away. After we ordered our food, our server was nowhere to be found.On top of that, my water glass had food on it.....even before I started eating anything. I was totally grossed out. After seeing the cup, I no longer had the appetite. 

I love their lunch combo menu but I do not think I will ever come back

This is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The customer service is incredible. Every staff member is so nice and helpful, and very quick to respond. The room was very clean and beautiful. The toiletries they provide are great and they smell amazing. They have a pillow menu so if you don't like your pillow, you can order a new one. The minibar is stocked with everything you could need for snacks and drinks. There was even a tv in the bathroom! They have comfortable robes and slippers. There is a very nice pool and hot tub, next to luxe locker rooms with saunas and steam rooms. Now every other hotel seems drab in comparison to the Conrad.

The products seem a deal but they are not well made. The king beds in particular are not sold with enough center support and the slats will break sonnet or later ! I suppose they want it to happen after the warranty expires but the product is defective do not buy a bed from them that does not have adequate center support !

We came here for lunch Saturday and the ambience was great! Lots of outdoor seating and the weather was amazing. 

That being said, the bbq was just so-so. We got the 3 meat platter (brisket, pulled pork, ribs) and Mac and cheese and Brussels sprout side, and also the cracklin too. 

The meat was okay. It taste at a bit cold though and no real flavor or char. The sides were okay too but nothing spectacular. And the cracklin wasn't crispy enough. Good place to chill with friends but not really worth it for the bbq.

Huge! Went on a Friday evening and they had a band start around 8pm. There's a brick oven pizza tent outside that you can order & bring inside. I am definitely returning in the warmer months because the outside is so inviting. There is ample seating, fun lights and even fire pits. They have plenty of beers to choose from, but they are also combined with a distillery so if beer isn't your thing there are mixed drinks and wine!

My partner has never been to NOLA before, or tried any of the city's amazing staple food items. This place was right down the street from our room, so we decided to try it out. We ordered a bunch of small bites so that we could taste a little bit of everything. We got the alligator bites, the hush puppies, the red beans and rice, and the jambalaya. Everything was delicious! Our server was attentive and very nice.

I was searching for a foodie restaurant with approachable dishes for a less adventurous eater, also within walking distance of the St. Pete Pier. Ceviche is that perfect spot. 

To start, we got the bread and I ordered the Siete cocktail. The bread was great and it was served with a chimichuri which was so herby and fresh. My mom said we need more bread when she had her first bite. The cocktail of gin, lavender and crème de violet was incredible. It was so balanced. I could have drank 20 and crawled home (with an empty wallet). 

We then got a couple cold plates including the deviled eggs and the octopus ceviche. The deviled eggs were good, but just deviled eggs really, nothing special, you could skip them. The ceviche was great. My mom even gave it a try and she really enjoyed it. The red onion and cilantro gave it a great punch of flavor and the octopus was very mild and tender. 

We then moved on to our hot dishes. First was the Potatoes with spicy aioli. They are a popular item for a reason, just simply good and great flavors. Next we received the scallops, lamb and Picanha. These were the stars of the show. The scallops were perfect in every sense, hard sear and perfectly cooked, melt in your mouth. They were served over an amazing fire roasted corn with chorizo. It really doesn't get better than this. Well until maybe the lamb chops over eggplant capanada with dill and feta. Those flavors together were borderline orgasmic. Close your eyes and savor every bite. Lastly, we received the Picanha with mushrooms and chimichurri. Yet again, phenomenal. Every bite was so good, savor worthy, rave worthy. 

Service was fantastic, great views and vibes, the prices were great. I would never hesitate to recommend this to anyone. It was probably the best meal I've had in my 10 years of visiting the area. Please go try it!

In my top two favorite brunch places in Philly. I've been to both locations. I've been lucky and never had a wait but if you go on a weekend you might get stuck for about an hour and a half before a table opens. Also it's cash only! But there is an ATM in the back. 
I've been here on dates and took my mom when visiting. My go to is eggs Benedict. But the seasonal menu is spectacular and the red velvet pancakes are a literal dessert. The coffee is incredible- comes from LaColombe. 
When coming here I recommend coming with a friend so one of you gets something sweet and one of you gets something savory so you can split it because the portions are so big.

This Place seriously has the Best wings. All of the food is Fantastic. The Chef has skills here and it shows. The atmosphere is relaxing and the staff is very Friendly. I will not hesitate to come back for a return visit.

I'm a self-proclaimed ramen fiend! Coming from Seattle, have had more than a dozen trips to NYC and and after living in DC for 3 years and trying a LOT of ramen joints, I just couldn't imagine that I would find something equally delicious as I did at OBON in Tucson Arizona. 

My husband and I wandered into this restaurant as we were discovering downtown Tucson and I felt the nostalgic urge for Asian food and decided on OBON. The host noted us from about 10 yards away from the restaurant and stood waiting to open the door for us even though the restaurant was decently busy.

I was impressed with their cocktail menu which brings you a variety of Asian country inspired drinks that are super creative and tasty and beautiful. 

I always opt for a tonkatsu based broth for my ramen bc I adore the silky rich smoothness that the tonkatsu broth should bring. And with my first bite, I just thanked God that I had found great ramen in Tucson, AZ and my cravings would be satisfied!! This ramen was spectacular. I couldn't even believe it. It was rich. It was smooth. AND it was the perfect amount of flavor and not drowned in salt like many other ramen I've had at pretty reputable places!! I hope it wasn't some crazy fluke that it was one of the top 10 ramen bowls I've ever had, so I can't with to eat there again!!

This is one of my top 5 favorite restaurants in town.  The pub atmosphere when you first walk in is awesome, and the bar manager was even featured in Sauce magazine's The People, Places We Love Right Now issue.  I never know what I want at the bar, and all I have to do is tell him my mood, and he always delivers the best drink!

I have been here several times now and HAVE NEVER been disappointed in the food.  The Welsh chips with rarebit is a great starter, and while the regular menu is good, I would highly recommend any of the 3 large plate specials they usually have that change each week.  Oh, so very good!

I would recommend this place for groups and special occassions in a heartbeat as well.

If you enjoy Grand Central Market in Manhattan, and you want to visit Philadelphia, 9th Street Italian Market will test your knowledge of variety of foods. You can shop for bakery, coffee, cheese, fish, and seafood, meat, pasta, produce, and spices. 9th Street is an outdoor market, not in a building. Bring a big bag and prepare to look for street parking. It gets crowded. Most stores are only open until early afternoon like 1 PM. You have better store selection and haggling success if you come in in the morning. Early riser catches the worms.

I'm a little puzzled by the menu at Oggi Italian Street Food. The restaurant is called Oggi Italian Street Food, but I would not consider any of the items on the menu as "Italian street food" except for the mozzarella and the cannoli. 

When I think of Italian street food I think of Panzerotti (think Italian hot pocket), Pesce Fritto al Cono (fried fish served in a cone wrapper), Stigghiola (grilled shish kabob), Arancini (fried rice balls), and Pizza al taglio (pizza by the cut), and gelato. "Oggi Italian Roasted Chicken" would have been a better name for the restaurant since the menu mostly consists of roasted chicken and pasta dishes.

My husband and I had a late lunch at Oggi this past Saturday. We ordered two glasses of chianti, the homemade mozzarella with Italian olives, arugula, Italian bread and cherry tomatoes, small Caesar salad, a bowl of the chicken soup with pastini, and a sausage panini. Everything was good; the highlight of the meal was my sausage panini and the espresso that we ordered at the end of our meal.

Ignore the hours outside the restaurant's entrance. The hours state: Monday thru Saturday 11 am-2:30 pm and 5 pm-10 pm. We thought the restaurant was closed at 3:30 pm when we saw the sign, but one of the employees came out to greet us and informed us that they were open, but did not have a chance to update the sign.

It was empty and we still had slow service.
Food was good but we left hungry so I don't think it's worth the price.

Considering that I was in a king executive room, I was a bit disappointed.  This was the only room available, so I was anticipating not only a larger room, but one that was a bit more well appointed.  Instead, the room was a very standard Courtyard room, just bigger.  It had an entry way and a couch area, but other than that, the bed (while a king size), was the same as any other room's.  The desk was also the same.  

So, I basically just had a big, basic room.  I did have a corner room, so I had a view (sort of).  

The staff was nice, though I barely interacted with them.  Check out is done by voicemail on the way out.  I didn't love the need to use my room key to get up in the elevators, but I can understand why they are using this extra safety precaution.

I was happy to have free internet (as my colleagues were at the Marriott Downtown, which required $12/day).  

Breakfast was either at the Starbucks downstairs or the full service restaurant.  I am one to eat quickly and something light, so I chose Starbucks.  It was fine, but nothing special.

 The rooms were clean, so nothing amis there, but decor is a somewhat outdated and the rooms could use a refresh.

Do NOT go here if you are African American or have BROWN SKIN!!! It's VERY RACIST, they are not willing to listen to African Americans/Blacks or BROWN ppl because my daughter is mixed & we got cursed out because we laid a blanket on the car to watch the movie. I was willing to get in the car but the owner threw $20 at me & told me to LEAVE because he didn't need " OUR BUSINESS" my 13year old daughter cried sooooo hard because this was her 1st time at a Drive-In. We don't have Drive-In's where we live! Very MESSED UP & I will NEVER recommend this place to ANYONE not even my WORST ENEMY...

As always the food is fabulous at this restaurant! If you like fish and shell fish Bone Fish is the place to come for appropriate portioned well prepared food! The corn lump crab soup and swordfish was my dish of choice this time.

A friend and her fiancé went there last night to celebrate St. Patrick's Day. He is a Tucson firefighter and she works for the University of Arizona. Oh, by the way, they are Mexican-American. They were verbally told they did not belong there. And were escorted out by four bouncers and the bartender, even though they did not resist. Tucsonans: don't support this business, please don't support this kind of hate. We don't need these kind of people in downtown Tucson. Vote with your wallet and deny them your business.

I went shopping there tiday  and check out at 945 am on January 24, 2021 and i went to check out the cashier who is African American  did not speak to me at all she was very rude and racist.  Im white she didnt say hello or nothing to me. We got finish didn't say  bye or thank you but the African American  who was by her she can talk to.

I personally don't like hot dogs (never really have tbh) but the ones at Steve's Hot Dogs are probably some of the best hot dogs that I have ever tasted. Everyone kept telling me to give this place a try and I can totally see why. 

I ordered the Bacon Bacon Jamaican which is topped with sliced crisp bacon, pepper jack cheese, jerk seasoning, bell peppers and sweet chipotle sauce. Ya'll... it was so good! My friend ordered their Macho Nacho hot dog which is topped with chili cheese sauce, tomato, sour cream, jalapeños, and crushed Doritos. He also really enjoyed his choice as well. 

Steve's Hot Dogs is so good that I went two days in a row. lol If you haven't been there yet, definitely stop by whenever you get the chance.

Sports themed casual restaurant, lots of TV's playing football.

Ordered the All-pro Platter for 2 ($20) to split w/BF. Included ribs, pulled pork, grilled chicken breast, Mama's Meatloaf, baked beans, and corn casserole. All meat was slathered in bbq sauce - more the sugary variety than smokey. Really like the meatloaf - it was grilled meatloaf, brilliant! Pulled pork was very good also. Did not like the ribs - tasted like they were food service pre-cooked variety not made on site? Baked beans were good - various beans in a spicy sauce. Platter was a nice way to sample - not huge portions, the 2 of us had no problem polishing it off.

Server was not very attentive and seemed in a very crabby unfriendly mood. 

Not a restaurant I would chose but won't throw a hissy if friends suggest.

I really enjoy this venue for drinks and music. On the bottom level there is a band and on the top outdoor patio level there is usually a couple of people playing and the atmosphere is more chilled. There are heaters on the top level as well. 

Honoring our troops is displayed everywhere which I love and the people who work there are very friendly!

My wife and her best friend both really like the restaurant.  Often they come here for lunch or make plans for all of us to go for dinner.  My wife's favorite dish is the seafood pasta and that's about all she orders.  She discovered they will replace the pasta with shredded mirliton and that makes it even better as there is essentially no carbs in the meal now.  The Coconut Shrimp is what we usually order as appetizers.  The last meal I had was the red curry shrimp pasta, sautéed shrimp in a red curry sauce over pasta.  I keep the pasta for my dishes.  It was pretty tasty, not real spicy, just enough to let you know it was there.  

The restaurant also has a great wine selection.  If you go early in the week, they offer half price wine bottles (entire wine selection).  This has allowed us to try a couple of different French wines I doubt we would have bought for a weekend dinner, but we are willing to buy them now.

Only real complaint is the parking.  There is no lot, so you have to find street parking in a residential neighborhood behind the restaurant.

Just got in from a quick lunch at Caplinger's as always the seafood was perfectly prepared (oyster po'boy), Service was great ... you just cannot beat this place!  And if you are interested,their selection of fresh seafood is just outstanding.  What a treasure this family owned and operated restaurant and market presents to its customers!

This place is delicious, fresh, and legit Mexican food.  I will recommend someone in your group speak Spanish, the experience is better, but the menus are fully translated and have pictures.

The steak burrito was amazing! It had tender meat seasoned and well flavored, avocados, tomatoes, sour cream, and lettuce bundled with the heavy portion of meat.  The chicken salad is loaded with freshly sautéed meat, avocados, oranges, tomatoes, lettuce, cheese, and cucumbers.

The drinks are sweet and fresh, the service is friendly, and the price is affordable.

Strong espresso, lovely latte art, perfect, airy space for studying! Highly recommend their ham and cheese croissant, as well as their bagels. Everything I've had here was well made and the baristas are always welcoming.

I wanted to love it - I did. But I have to be honest. The food was bland and did not taste fresh. Service was super friendly. The décor was over the top, straight out of the party supply store, not impressive. But was hoping the food would let me look past that. No. It was too expensive for what you did get, which was small and bland and nothing special.

Food: 2/5
Service: 4/5
Venue: 2/5

GET IN MY BELLY.

But seriously, Camellia Grill has the best breakfast food/burgers/late night/drunk food ever. Needless to say if you see me there in the wee hours of the morning, I might be working off a drink or two from across the street. 

The food is fast, cheap, delicious, and comforting without being a junky fast-food place like McDonald's. The waiters are great, really add to the experience/ambiance, and they even learn their regulars orders! (I kinda suck though because I never order the same thing, although the Doc Brinkers special is TO DIE FOR). It's one of my hubby's favorite spots. Doc Brinkers is a double cheeseburger on rye with melted cheese, and chili and Cole slaw on the side for you to top it with!!!!!

The worst thing about it is the line, but it's WORTH the wait. I wish they added more seats, but I know it would ruin the experience of eating at the counter like the 50s diner it resembles.

The day we came in, they were out of wings. Weird. So we were forced to try the quarter chickens. I went with the bbq seasoning. Very good, very juicy.

I also ordered a strawberry lavender donut, not knowing a donut already comes with my order. Nice! Sure glad I did, though. That donut was AMAZING. If I were in town again, I probably wouldn't come back especially for the chicken, but definitely for the donut.

Hear that the bar specials are great (Thurs half $ martini & $2 bar menu daily 3-6pm) but went just for dinner and wasn't disappointed! Each of our meals (which we DID pass around) were ranging from good to outstanding! Chicken was good but not great... though the scallops were excellent!

This is the real deal chocolate aficionado spot.  Belgian chocolate, high grade, everything baked on site.  If you're the type of person into premium coffee, cigars, or wines give this chocolatier a try too.

I found the Bobcat while attempting to order a drink at the Wildcat.   The bartender suggested I check out the drink next door.  

Those who read my reviews know I do not easily give out 4 stars and hardly ever give 5.
This place is heavenly.  The atmosphere is straight up Less Than Zero vibe.  This lounge is a compliment to its sister bar The Wildcat next door.  I had the best mai-tai outside of Oahu.

I can't wait to come back and taste what else they have waiting on those shelves.  The Wildcat and Bobcat are sisters.  One is a party heaven the other is an 80s retro.

I'm coming back... and with friends.

Whoa, chicken... Spit roasted... Potatoes ... Oven roasted. What a winning combination.  Not cheap but worth every penny.  My wife and I got carry out with a neighbor, flavor profile totally rocked my world! Smoky, savory, moist... Wow.  I can't wait to dine in because this place has a cool atmosphere. Happy to live within walking distance!  We ordered a nice size meal for 3 people and the 3 or us ended up stuffing our faces to the max then we had left overs for another 2 big meals.  Can't go wrong with Barbacoa!

Why 3 stars? Because it looked better than it tasted.

   ---   ---   ---

Those pastries literally look like winning Powerball numbers. They are completely unbelievable from a visual standpoint. 

When you actually eat them? Meh.

I guess that's unfair, I only tried a couple different ones...but I was definitely let down on both accounts. I did enjoy my Cuban sandwich, as it was quite hearty.

I'll definitely try them out again, they seem like a really great local business. I'm determined to find the delicious treat that matches up visually:tasty.

Been going back to this buffet after my initial review post remodel. I've found that the BBQ station is really good, primarily the brisket. That alone is worth the admission price. At least for me. The small selection of Indian cuisine is also pretty good. With the locals discount, this buffet is a good value.

First I will say the bahn mi here is pretty good. The other food is just ok. Service is slow to none like others have said. I was there today and not once did I get a water refill. Dont think I'll be going back.

so. i was at kfc and the drive thru was RIDICULOUSLY long. They were only taking one order at a time so i went in. so like if you wanted to get more than one meal you'd have to get back in line. not much of a surprise the inside line was long. the guy looked like he had no clue what he was doing and looked drunk. he kept asking what we wanted over and over again.  and so i was there for about a half an hour just waiting. then, we gout our food, checked the bag and all 12 of our cookies were missing, mashed potatoes were gone, and they didn't give me any ketchup! i got my food but they still forgot the ketchup so i said whatever and left. they only had 4 people and nobody not even a soul at the drive thru and the place looked dirty. please shut this place down and use a wrecking ball to demolish it.

This is one of my favorite WOB locations because of the patio area and the food options. We always have a good time here. Of course always have to get a giant pretzel  but the hummus is really good too. They always have beer specials too.

Possibly the worst food ever. I ordered biryani and some other food, with already low expectations but this place beats every other place which can have zero stars. Let me give some context, a biryani is something which is cooked well with spices and rice, all they gave was chicken cooked in some paste which have absolutely zero spices taste or even salt or chili spice and its wet and smelly. I usually don't write reviews but for this one i decided i need to let everyone know how unauthentic food this is. I had my share of bad biryanis everywhere across the globe but not as bad as this. Avoid and save your money

Horrible place, was supposed to be open at 10 walked in(unlocked door) at 11:05 and rude woman said "we ain't open yet!" She was rude and kinda bitchy , who ever owns this place should be ashamed of them selfs and the waste of people they employ
Fantastic service and super fresh steak burgers. The restaurant is super clean and the service staff very friendly and helpful regarding a special order we had. Milkshakes are always the best.

We just had a fantastic rehearsal dinner at the Boundary, the food and service were excellent. My only complaint was with the management. We had booked a large number of rooms at the associated Cheshire hotel and were hosting a large rehearsal dinner, When my mother asked if there was any room to negotiate a packaged discount the person at the restaurant in charge of booking large groups was very unhelpful and board-line snobby that we had even dared asked. Mind you this was not when the check came, but months in advance. Nevertheless, beside the attitude from management everything else was fantastic. Service staff and food were wonderful.

There's probably nothing I can add to the unanimous 5-star reviews about this company, but I feel compelled to try anyway. Our experience with Burgundy Blue was simply fantastic.

We needed a photographer for a very small (20-person) wedding and right from the start, Ryan proved to be remarkably accommodating even in a busy, post-Covid year. From answering all our (likely dumb) first-timer questions to his willingness to tailor a schedule to suit our needs/budget, it was immediately clear we'd chosen the right vendor.

Our experience with Trevor, the photographer, was equally positive. On the day of the wedding, he seemed to be everywhere with the camera and his demeanor and personality made it seem like he was one of the guests. (More fun than some, in fact--Uncle Jake, if you're reading this, I mean you.)

When the pics arrived, they were as beautiful as we could have hoped for.  Ryan was even kind enough to find alternates for a handful of shots that didn't come out quite right. Which is a polite way of saying, my face ruined them.

So let me save you a trip down the research rabbit hole, if you need a photographer for ANY occasion, go with Burgundy Blue.

Hey hey hey! Decided to grab some Sunday dinner while also trying out Sweetie Pies.

Order: chicken wings w/ dressing, greens, mac n chz, & cornbread. Peach Cobbler & Lb Cake

Pros: The food was great! The greens were not meaty but them jokers were bussin! The dressing was good and the mac n chz was ok but not bad. It was to creamy. The lb cake was slappin too lawddd. The peach cobbler was ok needed some vanilla ice-cream. Something felt off about the flavors. I think it jus had came out the oven so not enough time to meld together flavor wise. Actually, I let that joker (ie., peach cobbler) sit in the fridge and the next day it was wayyyyyyy better! 

Cons: security guard asking folk if they have mask on meanwhile is mask way below his nose. Also, corn bread was burnt and dry.

This gem was highly recommended by a gf friend in the area. There was a long wait but Autumn was so nice and connected to all the waiting customers; she can give a course on how to treat people that wait.
Our helpers were Kyle and Macy, best people ever!
They helped us navigate the menu, always attentive even in a room of patrons.
Lots of gf options...the bread is incredible, the food local and fresh.
We recommend this place to single people or families alike....
I would put 6 stars...
Absolute best entree I have had in years.  The blackened cod special was superb.  The sauce was flavorful without overwhelming the fish.  The butter cake was a ending to an incredible meal

Excellent service from the crew at this location. Fast, fresh and friendly.

Dining room is spotless as well.

We had a great experience at the Peloton store. I had scheduled appointments for both my boyfriend and myself back in August as I wasn't sure if we could use the same time slot. When we walked in the store was pretty empty, most likely because it was a weekday and because they were taking appointments. We tried out the Bike+ and it was awesome. The woman we worked with showed us as many features as possible, let us know about some upcoming features, let us see how loud the sound gets - which is crazy loud- helped us figure out if we qualify for discounts, etc. We were not quite sure if we were ready to buy at that moment and we did not feel any pressure to do so. We left for a little while and then decided to come back and she had everything all written out for us regarding our bike settings and ensured we got our teacher discount. Plus, because we ordered in store, delivery dates were a lot faster - seriously ours was delivered within about 3 days! We've now had the bike a few months and we LOVE it! So much better than that brand we had previously.
This place is a hidden gem! They came from New York and opened up a couple of months ago. By far the best pedicures and manicures that we have received in the area since we moved to Florida!

Don't waste your time with this business, horrible customer service!
I purchased a buffet out of their Etsy store, and regardless of how many times I messaged them about a delivery, I received no response. When the item arrived by UPS, I was not home, and it was left with a paralyzed and (obvious) cognitive brain-injured person. I had no idea when it was shipped or coming since the shop does not respond. He Signed for it, and the driver left the box Crate in my garage.
When I arrived home and had someone help me unpack it, there was a hole in the buffet's back, and one leg was broken. I immediately contacted the seller, who, of course, did not respond. I opened an Etsy case that allowed me to be refunded for buffet and shipping. Finally, the seller responded and said he would contact me with details on when the item would be picked up. I waited and when I heard nothing I contacted the store again. At that time, the store said to discard the buffet.
I paid to have the item shipped to my home because  I didn't have the means to transport it; therefore, discarding this item is impossible. I called the shop and was told I should have opened the package while the UPS driver was there so if there was damage, he could take it back. It took nearly 20 minutes to unpack this freight delivery. NO UPS driver will wait for you to unpack an item that long. Now I have to hire someone to come to my home and pay disposal fees to the dump since it's not useable and couldn't even donate.
Save yourself the heartache and purchase elsewhere as the customer service is horrible! Just look at their reviews.

Viet hoagies aren't the best, non Vietnamese ingredient,  the Vietnamese pate wasn't very good. Also got the chicken one that tasted like it was bottle sauced poured over it. Viet coffee was ok, I got slow drip better viet coffee at home. The Tea they had was pretty solid. I really hoped that this would be good and it disappointed. I would give it another try, atmosphere was pretty nice.

Great unique foods you can't find anywhere else. It's the perfect place to bring people who are visiting the area and want to go somewhere fun. Devin was a great server, very friendly and efficient! He even brought my mom a cupcake for her birthday. The only downside is the drinks are extremely over priced for the small amount you receive so I wouldn't come here for drinks. Other than that I wouldn't highly recommend!

Fantastic experience with Indy's Finest Fence. The crew, Jordan, Chad, Trey and Jared were great. 

Bought the fence through Lowe's and they were hired to do the install. On the day of install we got a courtesy call about 45-60 mins prior to arrival. When they got to our home, Jordan walked the property and made sure they had all the details right. They installed the fence quickly and didn't leave a mess. After the job was done, Jordan walked the whole fence line with us showing us the fence and the latches, and answered any questions we had. Lowe's had forgotten to deliver a gate and a post stopper, which is not in Indy's Fence Control. They did call to make sure Lowe's sent out a new fence and will be back to finish the install. 

The crew was polite, respectful, and professional. Would highly recommend their services to anyone who needs a fence installed!

I can't explain how disappointed I am in this florist. I found them online to send a bouquet to the wife of my board President. I am humiliated and have included pictures of what I paid for vs what was sent. Also, it should be noted I paid extra for an "upgraded" arrangement so I can't imagine what the standard version would have looked like. I think the photos speak for themselves but the cherry on the cake was that she received them a day late with no card saying who they were from. Don't waste your money.
I just had exchanged emails with Chad, the owner.  Not only this seller dishonest but a cheat.  Avoid them at all cost.

I've ate here a few times now and several other bbq restaurants in town and Vernon's is by far my favorite. The side dishes here are amazing and they always have at least two special side dishes that rotate on a daily basis. The bbq mashed potatoes are awesome and the red beans and rice for the special sides. The tequila lime green beans are great and the corn bread is very traditional and moist.

The meats; the ribs here are to die for. They use a dry rub and also brush the ribs mid way with a brush of their secret liquid sauce. The ribs are meaty smoky and don't require bbq sauce. The beef brisket is chopped and very moist. They offer about four different types of sauce from a tangy peach, kc sweet, stl, and hot. Everything is very well price and the lighting is great being an old repair garage converted to a restaurant with the large bay doors still in place. The blues playing over the speakers creates a relaxing dining experience you will savor.

I'm looking forward to my next visit.

This post is in response to "Mike L. review - dated 10/31/18"

Hello Mike! 

Thank you so much for the review of Elvis Movers.
My experience with them was very much like yours, one of total dissatisfaction. However, in reading your comment that "they are bad people - who hire the worst of the worst as movers" I respectfully disagree. And here's why I disagree. The company as with any company is in business to make money. When they hire people to perform manual labor, they hire the people they can get at the lowest possible wage. It is apparent that the people hired are not professional movers. Professional movers come at a much higher cost that include - union wages.   Elvis Movers would not pay union wages so, what do they get. They hire people who they believe can lift and carry furniture. So, at the end of the day what you have as workers are a group of men, wanting a day's pay for a day of labor. Grossly untrained and inexperienced yes, but still willing to do an honest day of work, for an honest day of pay.  The "worst of the worst - as movers", perhaps. Did they make a bad impression as a mover, or failed to meet an acceptable work standard, in their overall performance as a mover perhaps, but a "bad people" ... I don't think so. Webster defines a bad person as atrocious; corrupt, cruel, debauched, degraded, demoralized deplorable, injurious, loathsome, obnoxious, sinful, etc. Did your movers in fact fit this description?

I'm sorry that you too, had a nightmarish experience with this company. But I salute you for taking the time to tell others of the grief and damage that Elvis Movers can cause a family to have. I think one of the major problems that Elvis Movers have, is the type of furniture that they agree to move. For example: If you are moving well-made heavy furniture - that has some real weight to it, Elvis inexperienced movers - would not be the best people to handle thistype of move. However, if you have light weight furniture - like a lot of college students have, or IKEA type furniture, then I believe, that this is what Elvis Movers are used to handling, and can perform well in doing that. 

Elvis Movers banged up my heavy furniture badly. After a day or two checking the damage they had caused I was devastated. So much so that I was unable to hold a civil conversation with anyone at Elvis Movers. A couple of days later I concluded that it was I who sought Elvis movers out for a contract, because they were inexpensive.  I made a bad decision, trying to save money. I choose them, it was not the other way around. There's an old saying that goes ... you get what you pay for. Elvis Movers company prices are considerably less than other companies. Which may explain why their performance is also less than other companies. 

But to say...they are bad people who employ the worst of the worst as workers again, I say respectfully, I disagree. From where I sit, they appear to be a group of people while unskilled, and untrained with not much business savvy, at a minimum they are a group of human beings  trying to find a place and earn an honest living in this cold cruel, society. It could be that some are disadvantaged, lacking the required skills to be proficient as a mover, but still moving forward to earn an honest dollar to meet their needs. Even if it is only for one day at a time. An honest dollar earned is good for the soul; the spirit, for society, and of equal importance it instills hope, for a better tomorrow. Hopfully, Elvis Movers will take heed to all of this negative press and invest in a business consultant to make their business grow and become better. 

Bad people,...no I disagree. Unskilled people absolutely,...Yes!  Lesson learned. It's unfortunate, but I wouldnt use Elvis Movers again, even if they came to me Free of Charge!

I would recommend this place to a friend! I am under 25 years old with not so good credit but  the salesman "Sean" was really helpful and I was able to drive off the lot for just a dollar down and a one year warranty. He was really patient and friendly with me. He even helped me get auto insurance which is mandatory to drive off the lot. The one critique I would add is that it was a all day process mainly because they don't tell you the prices of the car upfront because they have to go by your income so every time you pick a car your interested in they have to submit the information to the financial counselor who is off site and that's takes up to 30 mins each time. I only took me two days to find something that was in my price range and that was reliable and convenient.

Hey friends! This spot lives up to the hype! As I was driving here for the first time, I saw the long line of people through the parking lot before I even saw the sign. Word on the street is that there's always a line, which is a great indicator that there's good food inside. 

This spot is a seafood hut within a liquor store off of Keystone. There is no interior to it, rather you line up outside, order, and take your food to-go. Luckily, the line goes pretty quickly and my food was ready in only a few minutes. It's the time of COVID, and it was cool to see all of the people in line waiting six feet apart, even without being told to. Everyone really respected that and was also in their masks. 

Now let's talk food. There's a menu posted up outside, and you order from that. Essentially, you choose your seafood, trap buttah sauce, and whether you want it either loaded (with all the veggies - corn, broccoli, cauliflower, potatoes, boiled egg) or non and whether you want it spicy or not. For seafood, you can choose salmon, shrimp, crab legs, crab tails, or a combo of those. For buttahs, you can choose garlic herb, yaad jerk, sweet Thai chili, island curry, or vegan citrus chive. You can even buy a bottle of trap buttah or FoodLoveTog seasoning (mild, medium, or spicy) to take home with you. And you'll want to. 

I got the loaded shrimp platter with OG garlic herb buttah and mild seasoning. Every bite was delicious, and for $16, I got two completely full to-go boxes of food. It'll last you for two meals, and let me tell you, I'm excited for those leftovers later tonight. Run here!

So many reasons why this first experience at a drybar was horrible. I booked appointments for me and 2 friends as a treat. Overall the way this Philly location was run seems low class and unprofessional. I love drybar products and have been looking forward to trying the service for a long time so this was seriously awful.

- The front desk receptionist asked for our drinks but never brought them 
The receptionist called me back to the hair wash area - all she said was my name (yelling from across the room). So I followed her back and sat down, took out my earrings. She still said NOTHING (as in, not a SINGLE WORD) to me but hollered out at her work friends. Eventually I turned around and said "I've actually never been here before so if you could communicate with me what to do that would be great" and her response was "I'm waiting for you to lean back" with a nasty attitude. She started to wet my hair, then turned to the person next to her and said "I don't want to wash HER hair, you do it." Humiliating, unkind, and uncalled for. If a request for communication sends her over the edge, she shouldn't be working in a salon. I heard other hair washers asking if the person was comfortable, etc like the normal things that happen when you get your hair washed...
- She didn't tell the person who took over washing my hair that I had signed up for a floater, so when the new person acted like I was done, I told her I was supposed to get a scalp massage. She took care of it and was nicer.
- The stylist was just OK. He didn't ask if I wanted a drink and wasn't overly friendly but whatever. I told my stylist I wanted the mai tai with slightly more curl - still never got a drink - he ended up giving me LESS curl than in the pictures, it looked nice but was not what I asked for. At this point I was just done. 
- During my hair styling appointment the receptionist who was nasty to me earlier came back to talk to my stylist about HER haircut he was doing on Monday, they looked at pics together and chit chatted. I honestly felt harrassed by her at this point, and I had told my stylist about the incident, so he should have sent her away instead of engaging. It just made things even more uncomfortable.
- I had to check out with this god awful receptionist and I didn't have cash to tip so unfortunately had to tell her what to add on (mostly tipping for my friend's service that I was paying for at this point). She double charged my tip - seems highly suspicious since she had asked if it was per stylist or total and I clearly said total - and did not offer a receipt. Luckily I asked so I could get it corrected despite her heinous attitude throughout.
- I had severe neck pain from either the hair washing sink or my stylist pulling my hair extremely hard during the blow dry after a few hours. It still hurts today. I have NEVER had that happen at any other salon.
- In terms of cleanliness, there were hair balls on the floor and I got to watch the receptionist pull a giant hair ball out of the sink right before she touched my hair - ew.

This hotel was good for a stay in Tampa.  They were friendly and courteous.  The room were ok, but the bathrooms were small. The staff are the real gems of the hotel . . From the Valet attendant to the front desk to the cleaning crew, they all shined.

There were only 2 people working the front desk and one was training the other, so just getting checked in was slow, then paying was equally slow. I spent over an hour total waiting between getting checked in, waiting for the provider, and then waiting to pay. 

When I finally saw the provider, she spent less than 2 minutes with me and was rude and irritated. She literally rolled her eyes at me and made it clear she felt I was wasting her time and that there was nothing wrong with me and I shouldn't have come in.

She seemed like she didn't want to be there. 

And for this nonsense I paid $150. 

Don't worry, I won't waste either of our time (or my money) ever again.

I underestimated Torch-wood. I saw a steady flow of customers w henever I walked past, but I put off trying them despite living so close. 

I got a breakfast panino that said it came with fruit. The fruit salad was HUGE and made up of a wide variety of fresh, quality fruit. 

The salads easily feed two people. They are fresh and use great ingredients. 

Order online and it's ready quickly. It's a reliable place for healthy, quality food.

I was shopping in this store this morning with my daughter and needed help with customer service. The cashier that came over was very helpful but couldn't answer a question my daughter had so she went and got help from the customer service manager who's name is Dawn Elliot. This woman treated us with absolutely no respect , she was very rude and very condesending. We were not asking for a freebie of any sort just help with the question. Because of her my daughter and I will be shopping elsewhere. She should not be in customer service of any sort!

There is a reason this particular store has 2 stars. It's because of the WOMAN MANAGER. If I could leave a negative review, I would.

I stopped going to this store for two reasons (even though it's literally 2 minutes from my house).
1) Very limited selection
2) The woman manager is a disgustingly unprofessional human being

Almost every single time I went in there, this manager was rude to customers. You know, they people who pay her salary. She was never rude to me because luckily I never had to interact with her - minus the time I told her a bird was dying in an enclosure and she did absolutely nothing about it...and when I check the bird a few minutes later, it was dead. The only reason this store has any business is because the closest chain pet store is 15 miles away.

I went to PetSmart in Brandon today (the chain 15 miles away) to get items I needed, and I gladly spent $150. Unfortunately they did not have the kitten food I needed, so dreadfully I had to stop into Pet Supermarket on my way home.

I walk up to the store and there was a young employee bringing in carts. As I passed him, I said hello. He didn't respond (which is fine because he's was a kid). I proceed into the store and go left towards the cat aisles. I hear someone saying "ma'am" a few times. No "excuse me ma'am" or anything polite in the slightest. I turn around and the kid was speaking to me. He literally said "go get hand sanitizer". No please, no thank you. I get the sanitizer. He goes off towards the registers and I continue onward down an aisle by myself - no customers or employees in sight and mumble something under my breath as I'm turning the corner. I almost bumped into an employee, named Cayanne (another young kid) who was sitting on the ground stocking shelves.

I pass her and go to the cat food. I'm looking on the shelves and she said to me "is there something you wanted to say to me?" I said "oh no, I was just mumbling under my breath, talking to myself." Meanwhile I'm thinking if this was my employee, she would have a nice talking to about not being confrontational to the people who give her a paycheck. She leaves the aisle. 

I'm looking around, reading ingredients and hear someone literally right in my ear say "is there something you wanted  to say to me?" I turn around and it's the most unprofessional human on the planet - the woman Manager. I said "if I had a question, I would've asked you." She said "well you said something about my employee, so why don't you say it to me." I proceed with "first of all, how do you know what I was mumbling to myself had anything to do with your employee, and you are very unprofessional for coming up behind me to get in my face." She tried to continue to argue with me so I turned around and grabbed the food I needed. She decides to walk along side me and I say "I will be contacting corporate for your disgusting behavior". She said "make sure to tell them what you said about my employee." I said "why don't you do that since you seem to know more than I do."

We live in a world where I can talk to myself whenever I want, can mumble to myself whenever I want, and don't have to have some angry ass woman try to start a fight with me over something I MUMBLED TO MYSELF. She is lucky this didn't occur outside of the store. Very lucky.

I wasn't shocked by this disgusting woman doing this, as I heard her tell an older couple who was adopting a cat (they didn't have a carrier) that it was "common sense to bring your own carrier". I almost chewed her ass out that day for that disgusting remark to those customers, but decided that was the day I would never return unless absolutely necessary. 

This is a serious lack of professionalism and it is disgusting Pet Supermarket would even hire such a scumbag - especially put her in a management position. And now she's training her little kid employees to be disgusting too. 

She needs to get fired and get a reality check. Pet Supermarket should know better than to have such a bitch managing employees and dealing with customers.

Overall, this was a nice hotel to stay in.  The lady who checked us in and was running the front desk most of the time (including during the parade) was very welcoming and helpful.  The rooms were nice and we had a room that overlooked the fire station and the Irish bar.  As well as an apartment with funny Halloween decorations.  Our friend had a room with a balcony over the pool and some friendly guests across the way that used theirs a lot and we enjoyed chatting with them.  We could have seen the parade from her balcony but chose to go down to the street.  The pool was nice and chill and the very friendly restocking the towels let us know that we could use the pool also at their sister hotel but we never made it over there.  But it was a chill place for midday but don't expect any food or drinks because their restaurant is non-existant.

The Cons -

- There is no continental breakfast (they say because of Covid)
- There is no room service because of Covid but they said to just call if we needed it and/or needed anything
- The one morning we did need our coffee and tea pods replenished and we called them to ask for more, the lady was not helpful at all and told us to come down to the lobby to get it.  Sorry, but I'm in my pajamas which is why I was asking for someone to bring us some.  Not going down to the lobby in my pj shorts and tank!!
- Beware - there really was no restaurant.  Sure, they have a sign at all the elevators that make the food look delicious but is never open (4 pm - 10 pm) and even then they wouldn't seat us and they weren't doing room service.  This is no fault of the hotel because it's obviously run separately but should not appear to be the hotel restaurant because it's not and does nothing for the hotel guests (separate review coming for them)

Also the hotel is walking distance to the french quarter and the hotel.  Overall, I would stay here again but maybe once they have room service and continental breakfast back
Stella was amazing. Loved her spunk and depth and breadth of knowledge! I would love to spend even more time with her because she has so much information!
Best pizza around. This is our local pick for takeout. Can't go wrong w Bronx Bomber or Godfather pizzas.  Proper caprese & Italian antipasti salads.

Expect quite the line when you go, but the process moves at a decent pace. We were told the wait was an hour, but we were sat in about 40ish minutes, so that was nice. We ate and drank at the bar, and the bar tender was amazing. He was funny, and totally on top of the service. My husband and I split the Winter Flight of mimosas, which definitely packed a punch. We also shared the holiday seasonal beignets which had chocolate marscarpone, Brandied cherries, whipped cream, and of course powered sugar. They were heavenly! I had the eggs Cochon, and they were perfectly poached over the braised pork. The hollandaise was rich and creamy. My husband had the Migas and loved it too. He especially enjoyed the chipotle sour cream. The bar tender also gave us the scoop on a few other less touristy places to eat, which was awesome. Definitely make the stop, the Ruby Slipped is worth the wait.

Tell me who waits 30 minutes for some damn fries?!!! 1 item in my order and they never ended up giving it to me. They have like 5 employees. They were calling number 15 and my order was number 42 likeNot even in New York City are people this slow at their jobs. Imagine you're about to pass out and they take 40 mins to hand you medium fries. Unbelievable.

I called mr. Appliance and they said it was $99 to diagnose it but if they fix it. they would take the $99 off. They charged me $225 for five minutes of work and the fuse was $5 so they charged me $220 for 5 minutes work and when I called to ask the owner about it, he gave me a crazy spiel about they are professionals and they have Parts in the truck Etc. So that's like kind of saying look at the birdie. Absolutely ridiculous and bad customer service. I definitely feel taken advantage of .  I am a small business owner and was closed down for three months.  A shame that people just try to gouge people first-time head of caring about return business or word of mouth. I never really use Yelp as I feel that a lot of times it's unfair but this is definitely warranted. Darcy D
Had an appointment this week. Office will not confirm that the hygienist is vaccinated. Will find another dentist.

Sometimes you feel like a butt (pork of course). Sometimes ya don't! And when ya don't, brisket is the almighty alternative! 

Brother's BBQ is the best around! Barky, smoky, tender, juicy and delicious! These are the kinda flavors and textures you can only coax out of a piece of meat after making long, low and slow love to it and then slicing it to order. And let's just say Joe O has the magic touch!

For $12 with two sides, this deal is a no brainer. 

Normally they give you some thick slices of brisket, but today, they were on the thinner side, leading to my Brother's BBQ Pro-Tip:
1) The habanero Bbq sauce is amazing on anything. 
2) Always apply Bbq sauce conservatively here. The rub, smoke, and meat are delicious on their own, so just use the sauce to accentuate it.
3) Big fan of habanero Bbq sauce ON the traditional slaw and potato salad! 
4) Alway get honey AND butter for your cornbread
5) Check In in Yelp for a free beverage.
6) Brisket and Ribs combo FTW
Excellent service and food and of course your Cheese Cake and will continue to come back.

For a spot that looks like it specializes in cheap beer and loud nights, this restaurant packs a serious culinary punch! The ambiance is great... old rustic seafood restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating. But the food is spectacular! 
The menu is very diverse with many different cuisines offered. Lots of flavor going into these dishes as well and the portions were impressive. Both the blackened chicken sandwich and grilled Mahi were solid choices. The mashed potatoes were also quite good as well. 
Staff was accommodative to requests to make dishes lighter/ healthier as well.

The staff at the walk-in clinic in Franklin were great. This review is about Vanderbilt administration and policy. My husband tested positive for Covid on Monday. He was told due to his age and a heart condition that he'd hear shortly from someone in administration about a referral for treatment/therapies to help him with recovery. Three days later, someone from Vanderbilt calls to tell him they ARE TOO BUSY TO WRITE A REFERRAL! Shortly thereafter, he received a call from health department regarding contact tracing. Seems Vanderbilt  wasn't too busy to work with the health department, but too busy to work with a patient for needed therapies! They also refused to tell him which variant of Covid he has- said they would tell his PCP but refused their request as well. Although we like their walk-in clinic, we will avoid Vanderbilt in the future.

I have had occasion to install PGT windows and hurricane doors in two condos with three different companies. Weather Tite is by far the best in terms of initial presentation, office support and installation. The other companies failed in quality of installation and warranty followup. Highly recommend Weather Tite and Ross Mallin.

I have had several tattoos done with Pat Fish over the years. She is extremely knowledgeable of her craft as well as proper protocols and guidelines. She is a one person shop and there are no distractions during the tattoo session.

There were two lady's inside of this tag place one was nice sitting behind a desk another was helping people she was an ignorant hypocrite.  I had shirt covering my mouth and nose as I forgot a mask.  The hypocrite lady was straight up a rude ignorant person she screamed at me to get out no mask out.   She could have stated this in a nicer way and I would have left without yelling and being rude to me in front of other patrons in the place. Best part is this hypocrite lady had no mask on suggest taking your business elsewhere if u want to be treated like a human being and not some piece of trash like this woman was.

Food is amazing 
10 out of 10 
Would recommend 
Traditional Mexican food 
Great services

This Burger   Restaurant has been around for 40 years or more. The only thing I didn't appreciate was I felt they put too much cheese  on the Burgers ,and the Burger would slide out from the bun if you didn't hold on to it better.Other than that they are good.

DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION!!! I WAS ASSAULTED HERE.

This all took place on September 13, with Drew, at 6:30 p.m. 

I have been a member for YEARS. I always get different people to massage me, and I have never had a problem anywhere - ever. A few months ago I was massaged by a new man I hadn't worked with before (he happened to be free at the last minute). I had a bad feeling as soon as I met him, but I ignored it. This man smelled unclean, and made me feel filthy. 

He touched my breasts on multiple occasions while "reaching for my arms", he held the sheet VERY high when he was draping me, he had me roll over and he didn't hold the blanket at all (I literally had to reach over and grab it before it hit the floor and pull it back over me), and it was all adding up to be more than just ignorance or being oblivious. 

THEN- at the end- he said he was done (I thanked God silently) and then he said HOLD ON AND STARTED DIGGING AROUND UNDER MY SHEETS. He said he lost his watch (what watch...) and thought it was somewhere under my sheets?! He was between my feet- lifting the blanket and "searching for his watch". 

I took a few days to process the situation, then called the location to report this situation. I have had hundreds on massages and never had an experience like this.

Management was all over it right away- called me- and sent a "third party investigator" to call and take my statement as well. I was impressed that they were on top of it. That was months ago. I have requested an update, still nothing. Not another word. I hate leaving bad reviews. HATE IT. Which is why I tried to solve this issue directly.
