DO NOT GO TO MASSAGE ENVY ON ORACLE UNLESS YOU WANT TO HAVE SOME STINKY MAN DIGGING AROUND BETWEEN YOUR LEGS "LOOKING FOR HIS WATCH", HAVE YOUR BREASTS TOUCHED MULTIPLE TIMES, OR LAY THERE BASICALLY EXPOSED AND NAKED SINCE THAT IS APPARENTLY HOW MASSAGES ARE DONE NOW.

MANAGEMENT SHOULD BE ASHAMED THEY HAVEN'T GIVEN ME ANYMORE INFO OR RETURNED MY CALLS. 

I'm considering contacting an attorney at this point, since they haven't handled it as they promised. I feel uncomfortable at massages now, and refuse to be seen by a male. 100% violation of trust.

If I could give negative stars I would.  I called to see if I could get my dog in because he has a bad ear infection that I have been trying to take care of myself and have failed.  His ear is stinky and hurts.  The person I talked to suggested I come to their urgent care.  I told her he had an appointment with his groomer and we couldn't get there until the afternoon.  I picked him up at the groomer and headed to the clinic.  I walked in and was ignored by the person behind the desk.  After standing around for a few minutes she finally asked me if I had been helped.  I told her I was there for urgent care.  It was about 1:30.  She told me their urgent care ends at 1:00.  I told her that I was not told that even though the person I talked to knew I couldn't get there until the afternoon.  They did nothing to try to help me out.  I left, put my dog in my car and went back in to see what time I had to be there the next day for urgent care.  I was told that I would have to wait for 2 days because they don't have urgent care daily.  Again no offer to help me out, just excuses about being short staffed, and suggesting I go the emergency hospital.  With what they told me they would be charging me I think they would try to be a little more helpful.  I would never go there again, in fact I would drive to another town for care if I had to.  And I would never advise anyone to use them.

The new owner has been there about 3 months. Renovations are slowly being done. Entrance is around the side. That being said, the food is great! So many tasty vegan and/ or gluten free options. Yes, there are some great desserts.  The menu is extensive. Hope you come and support this new team!!!

Don't go here you will hate it  at least don't everyone go on Friday night, that's my night lol. Seriously, this place is such a gem. Exactly what you want. I love the yellow curry and the spring rolls. Can't go wrong. I don't add any spice and it's still plenty spicy.

If I was to die right now I would want my last meal to be their macaroni and cheese. Their platters are super generous. The owners are amazingly friendly.  You can call ahead to pick it up and not have to wait.
Was told no rush on the check but hadn't even got my food yet. Still waiting over an hour to get a two top their food while multiple tables have sat, ordered, ate, peed, and left.
This place is almost a tradition for holidays, be sure to arrive early as there can sometimes be a wait. Love the pepper shrimp app, Barbque fried rice and dimsums!
They have the best and friendly staff! The drive through girl is super quick, and so kind. She always knows my orders by heart and that's what is keeping that store running. Good coffee too
They have great beer, great food, at all a reasonable price. The staff is chill and they have a big screen tv. They're also dog friendly too. I'd come here again when I'm back in town.

I really like Dr. Harris, I even got my Laski with him.  Great experience they do it once a month on a Saturday, he give you his cell phone to call if there any emergencies.  Opens the office on Sunday to check on all the Laski patients, the whole process was very pleasant.  However, I do have to agree with most of the other review the wait time for a normal appointment is observed at times.  Morning appointments seem to be slightly better than afternoon appointment but I don't think there been a single appointment I've been seen on time for.  And due to dry eye a popular side effect of Laski I go about twice a year minimum more if the symptoms are really bad.  As a doctor he is great I highly recommend him but his office need to schedule a lot less appointment to cut down on the ridiculous wait times, it is a big issue here.

Today was my first time at Salon Charisse and I was very happy with the experience. Carly was friendly and was able to give me exactly the cut I wanted. We had a really nice chat as she cut my hair. Another thing I really appreciated was that there was no hard sell. Lately whenever I go get my hair cut the stylist is trying to push some product or more services (like highlights). That didn't happen at Salon Charisse. I will definitely go back!

Omg, I LOVE THIS PLACE!  I don't know why I haven't been here sooner.  Ok, I do know why ~ it's quite a drive from our home, but heck, I wouldn't have minded the drive had I known it was gonna be this good.
We came here for breakfast.  We decided, instead of eating somewhere after a hike, we would eat first and then go hike.  I checked the trusted Yelp, and Creme popped up.  They open early, so we decided to go there.  I'm so happy we did. 
It's a small, yet cozy little place.  There was a fair amount of people there, but we got seated right away.  We were greeted warmly by someone from the bar and by our server.   
To start, I was torn between the french press coffee (from Blind Dog, for those who want to know) and the Mexican Mocha.  I don't think I've had Mexican Mocha before, but when the server said it's essentially mocha with a dash of cumin, I had to try it.  I liked it a lot.  It may be a tad sweet, but the heat from the cumin kinda offset it a little bit.  I had to slurp it to the very last drop because that's where all the cumin ended up.  
Then, there's the crepe.  I love crepes.  And Creme has them, and theirs is so good!  I ordered the seasonal special savory crepe (breakfast sausage, sauteed mushroom, kale, fennel, and topped with a fried egg).  I mean...so delicious!  It had everything I wanted and needed to get me fueled up for our hike.  Hubby had the breakfast sandwich (two scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese, leeks, mushroom and your choice of meat).  It looked good, but he wasn't sharing, not even when I pulled the 'I had to taste it so I can review it on Yelp.'  Oh well, I will just have to order it when we go back.
Finally, the service.  I liked that I could see the chefs busy themselves in the kitchen.  The place was starting to fill up, but the servers remained friendly and warm, and didn't rush us out of there, even when we offered to get up before the check came, so that they can seat the people waiting.  It just gave off this super relaxed, neighborly atmosphere.  We got the feeling that we were regulars, despite the fact that it was our first time there.  I liked that.  I liked that a lot.  I can't wait to go back!  Go give them a try!

While the location and ambience hit the mark, unfortunately mostly everything else was underwhelming (at least for brunch). The brunch food options were great, I enjoyed the margherita flatbread and crab and artichoke omelette (although the presentation wasn't as creative as I would have hoped). They also offer cocktail options (include froses), but no brunch specials (bottomless mimosas or bloody marys) like most brunches around the area. However, what left a not so positive impression was the service. We had a brunch reservation for a party of 9 in the early afternoon of a Sunday (which was purposeful to avoid the brunch "rush") yet our food took ages to come out. While our server was attentive and regularly came around to refill drinks there was no mention as to why it took about 40-45 mins for all of us to receive our food when the restaurant was nearly empty. Not sure if this was a front of the house, or back of the house issue but the wait time felt excessive. Overall, I'm not sure if I'll be back, especially for brunch.

Y'all. This place sells eggs. For real.  Farm fresh Which are Amish if I'm not mistaken. 

I'm not a big liquor person but we have used this place for all our margarita needs as well as wine. We love wine and I love their selection but honestly what keeps me coming back weekly is their eggs.  

Friendly service. Always. And I love when they have their little dog near the entrance greeting everyone. Just my kinda place.

I came to CODAC for what I thought was depression and anxiety and was diagnosed bipolar. They assured me that my insurance was in network with them and promised I'd pay only a $30 copay. I did my intake and was diagnosed and put on medication. It worked like a charm. I thought I had finally gotten the help I needed and was excited to move forward with my new psychiatrist. Then my insurance let me know that we were in fact NOT in network. I'm now stuck with a bill of $297 and don't have a psychiatrist to keep my medications refilled, which is incredibly dangerous and concerning as someone on mood stabilizers and antipsychotics. They gave me no options other than to pay that balance even though they made the mistake and screwed me over. I'm so disappointed. If you're going to come to this clinic for help, DOUBLE CHECK with your insurance first, because they don't know what they're doing and won't take responsibility for their expensive mistake.

Tucson, Az: pretty water lakes and trails

As already shared in Erna M's great review of this park, a gem! I won't rehash all the good things she has already mentioned. I would like to add  that I felt very comfortable walking all around this clean, mid-sized park on a Monday morning. Assorted water fowl were in both lakes. Pay attention to the many information signs. The water in the motorboat lake, Archer Lake,  is not potable and fishing is allowed only in the larger Silverbell Lake. There are groomed dirt walking trails around the lakes and around the park. Access to the asphalt paved Santa Cruz River Bikeway is located on the far side of the park, away from Silverbell Rd.  I was amazed at reading the historical facts (signage near boat ramp) about how Juan Bautista de Anza established a route, from 1774-1777, from Sonora, Mexico to found the Port of San Francisco,  in order to maintain Spain's control of these territories. The trail, the Juan Bautista de Anza National Historic Trail, passes near the sign location. I didn't see playground equipment but families were arriving to join the many already walking, fishing, and the many dogs inside the dog park.  There appears to be a fenced section for possibly small dogs, but all the poochies I saw were getting along well, all inside the larger off-leash area. Plenty of free parking.
It was nice. Didn't love customer service but I'm willing to give it second try. The place is really pretty especially indoors.

Incredibly impressed with the food.  Ordered pickup takeout and surprised how much they pack into the to-go trays.  Tikka masala was on point and flavor was authentic.  High quality ingredients and professional.  This will be my go to spot in Goleta for Indian cuisine.

Meh - not worth it. They still require masks, which is fine, but the staff is very impatient about the usual issues when communicating through layers of masks, protective plastic shields, etc. It's been a long pandemic and I get that they're over it, but nothing about that experience compels me to go back. 

Also, people love the scones but every single flavor tastes like nutmeg??? 

The staff here are cliche blasé, rude coffee shop people and it's really played out. There are other coffee shops on Campbell that have much nicer service. Prioritize visiting those instead of Raging Sage.

I'm really upset I haven't came here for lunch sooner. I love this place it had great choices from wood fire pizza sandwich salad burgers you name it they got it. I plan to return to try the coconut cake I saw a picture of on yelp it looked delicious at the restaurant it was sitting out for view. Service was great our waiter was fantastic. Looking forward to try more choices

Headed back to OC from a trip to the Central Coast and decided to pop in here for lunch. Cute outdoor patio with plenty of seating (we are sticking solely to outdoor dining during pandemic so this was important to us!) Hazy IPA was refreshing, California burrito with tri tip was AMAZING, and the chicken pesto sandwich was delicious! This place did not disappoint! Will definitely be back.

There were four of us (two couples) going to Sam's. My date wanted to go as she had never been and I was neutral. The other couple tried to dissuade us as they thought it too noisy. We all went anyway and after a short wait for a Friday night, we were seated in a booth. Oh, there was some noise, but after all, this is a sports bar. We could easily converse so it's not really noisy.

Of course, there was no Manhattan for me as it's a wine and beer place only. I had a beer which was cold and large so no complaints.  Two of us ordered the oven roasted chicken and soon our waiter returned to tell us that they were out. He also said that this was often the case, so don't get your heart set on what appears to be the tastiest option on the menu.

We chose the Santa Fe chicken with black beans and rice and it was excellent. The service was fast and two servers brought it out so we were all served at the same time. I didn't test the restroom so can't comment on that, but everything else looked nice. I have never seen so many TVs all set to different channels.

Sam's Place seems like a popular neighborhood place with good food and service. Order more makin's for oven roasted chicken and all will be well.

Well I was looking for a go to restaurant and the food had always been good here.  But tonight my food was not good.  The fries had a shake or seasoning on them that was way to salty for my palate.   I had "The Don", which is basically a roast beef on French type bread, served with a dipping au jus.  The sandwich by itself was okay but needed a lot of stuff on it to successful as a sandwich alone, it needed that au jus.  But together they were overwhelmingly salty.  I need savory, not salty.

I had to take off a star and move them around food just failed and was barley average .  Service was not superior either.

I will try them again, maybe they can make a comeback. 

The Reuben sandwich was very delicious,  nice and sweet.  The sauerkraut was nice, it did not overpower the meat.   The onion rings are very sweet and delicious, not to overcooked, tender. I love the steak fries, not to firm and they are not overcooked. The chef here enjoys making the food dishes. On top of the good eats' the service was excellent.

You'll definitely work up an appetite waiting in line to order, but it is well worth it.  A friend and I split a two meat plate  it was just enough food for us to leave comfortably full.  The sliced brisket was smokey and yummy. Our favorite bbq sauce was the house special good consistency.  Grab a table outside to dine in the sun or shade
Delicious and clean! Try it out and you won't be disappointed. Only thing is they are short staffed but so is almost every restaurant now a days.

Incredibly rude bartenders, eye rolling and all.  They often don't make eye contact.  This place should look for people who are passionate about working downtown Nashville.  Karaoke is fun, but service leaves nothing to be desired.

oh HELL ya. 

I've been wanting to try this spot bc it's near our house. We had company in town and they wanted to give it a shot. While our waiter was a little pretentious, he made excellent and thorough recommendations. Between the four of us dining, we had the fried chicken, the gumbo, the mussels, the cornbread, and the beignets, and a (reasonably priced!) bottle of wine! It was all really reasonable, and the place was SO cute. I felt extremely cool being there. The music you can hear from the dining room slightly, but not in an intrusive way. 

We will be back!

Hands down, easily the best barber shop in all of Tampa. They truly deserve more than these 5 stars! My husband has been coming here for a little over a year now and I couldn't be more thrilled with the cut he comes home with and the professionalism we always receive when he goes there. 

I have accompanied my husband in here many times, even with our small daughter and we always feel welcomed. Every single time. If there's one thing I always felt when I walked into other barber shops, because of the feel and the conversations being held in there, was that women just didn't belong in this sort of establishment. 

But this shop is totally different. The music and television show choice is always appropriate, never anything provocative playing. As a woman, it's a very comforting feeling to feel so welcomed into such a manly environment. I strongly recommend this shop. To everyone! I recommend asking for Rob or Nat. Both gentlemen are very knowledgeable in their craft and by far the most professional barbers I've met in my time. 

So if you're a single mother, looking for a good shop to get your little man into or you're new to the neighborhood and looking to become established with a reputable shop, look no further than WestSide Barbershop.

One of the best wine bars in Tucson. We especially enjoyed the selection of reds and that they also have beer on draft if you feel like drinking that too. The interior design is beautiful and helps create a cool ambiance.

We were in the mood for burgers and seeing that Retreat had good veggie/vegan options we went here. The ambience is hip and trendy and makes for a great place to have drinks and dinner on the weekend. For appetizers we got the poutine and Mac and cheese. I liked both the appetizers a lot! The poutine gravy was thick and peppery and the cheese curds added a nice flavor! I could have done with a little less salt in it though. The Mac and cheese with cavatappi was great albeit a little less cheesy than we were expecting it to be. For main course,my sister and brother in law took the portobello sandwich and burger and I took the classic burger replaced with the garden veggie patty. The entrees all tasted really good. I loved the flavor of the burger with the sweetness of the onions and the creaminess of smoky cheddar. The fries were a little too brown for my taste, they could've been a little less fried. The service was very good and they were quite accommodating and got my niece toasted baguette as well! Very good food and experience.

This is now my favorite hot chicken joint after finally venturing out of South Nashville to Madison to try. They have tons of options, lots of delicious sides, and the employees are so friendly and welcoming. 

I tried the wings and hot chicken apple fritter (perfect balance of salt, sweet, and heat) both on heat level Singe, which was a perfect medium heat. They certainly live up to the name because I didn't notice the spice until about ten minutes in, then it went from 0 to 60.

They have numerous side options to choose from, which goes against the norm of most hot chicken joints, and they're delicious. The waffle fries were the perfect seasoned complement to the hot chicken. 

I'm super excited to come back and try their breakfast because the menu looked delicious. Well done, Slow Burn! I'll definitely be back.

A fun day for a ball game! The stadium had a lot of helpful, friendly staff. We started the day with mixed drinks towards the entrance. I would recommend getting them before finding your seats, otherwise you'll have a long walk back to the stand.  We also ate nachos (ground beef and pork) which were good...nothing outstanding though. They put the meat and cheese over the chips, and there was a self-service area for the rest of the ingredients.  Since lots of people were using the same servicing spoon, it had salsa and sour cream all over the handle. Again, understandable, but pretty gross. 

Overall, the stadium was clean as well. The bathrooms were a little dirty, but that's expected with a large amount of people.

All of can say is that the food is decent, but not authentic. It is Americanized Italian food. We ordered the fettuccini carbonara which was more like an Alfredo sauce. It shouldn't have cream in it if it's made the way you would find in a nice restaurant in Italy. The wait staff and owner were very nice. This is a nice place for those who aren't expecting true Italian cuisine.

We stopped here for Cuban sandwiches on the way to the airport. The sandwiches were soooo good. We also got a palomollo steak sandwich and it was really tasty. The second generation owner took the time to explain each sandwich as well as the long history of this restaurant in Tampa. One of the other customers also raved about the place. Highly recommend for those looking for a real Cuban American eating experience. Nice that it's only a few minutes from Tampa airport.
I've been coming to joe and his crew ever since his first shop. Absolutely love this place and will continue to travel far, as I do now, to get my hair cut. HIGHLY recommend this place.

Sorry for not being punk enough guys, but the attitude here is pretty d&@$#y.

I sit at the bar, looking at the beer selection--and they have a pretty huge selection--and decide I'd rather just choose a cocktail rather than paying for overpriced shitty beer. So I ask the bartender, do you guys have a cocktail menu or something? He shakes his head. I shake my head back to confirm, waiting for him to say something else, like what cocktails he can make or ask me what kind of cocktail I want. He says nothing. 
Now, put on the spot, the bartender staring at me, not saying anything, I say I'll have the tonight's special beer, pointing at the sign. $4 so I assume it should be decent. Maybe my mistake-- I didn't have my glasses on-- but the 'tonight's special' was a seasonal beer for winter 2015. Wtf?? Why are they still even selling this??

I deliberately ordered from the other bartender for my next drink, and he was a reasonably affable human being at least. Too bad they pool the tips. 

Overall, there's some kind of pretentious punk rock bs attitude that makes the vibe here pretty uncomfortable. You probably won't see me back here again.

After a 12 hour drive from South NJ to Nashville we decided to try this place out. I'll make this a quick one. 

1.Parking in the alley lot is tight. Maybe 8 cars can fit. They do offer street parking but we didn't see how good or bad it was. 

2.They have a beer garden out back or you can sit inside. We chose outside. 

3.The backyard Beer Garden is really nice. It is 92°F currently in Nashville but the shade is abundant with tons of trees for cover. The music was pretty chill too.Picnic style tables that they will sit other people next to you at the same table if they can. The tables are small but are doable if you don't have a huge group. 

4.They provide a glass bottle of water that they fill paper cups with. When you want a refill you do it yourself. Water wasn't cold but it was understandable do to the weather. 

5.The menu has tons of beers,burger,bratwurst,and fries options. I chose the Pharmacy Burger and Regular Fries. The burger was good but they don't ask how you want it so it comes out well done. I'd say it's like a "Wayback Burger" or "Smash Burger." The fries were good too. They reminded me of Boardwalk fries or Salt and Vinegar style fries. 

6.The beer. I had the 20oz Helles Lager. My gf had the Pilsner. Best Helles style I've ever had. Low ABV but definitely a summer sipper. I wish it wasn't so hot we would've tried more beers. 

And last and final...The service. I'm going to be honest. I fully understand people are human and shit happens but it's a review based on my experience. We waited a while for everything. The beers took 10mins,the food took 15 mins. To get the check took 20 mins. And we received the wrong check and had to wait even longer. On a positive note,The waitress was very sweet.That being said I'd go back to give it another shot based on the food and beer alone. Definitely check it out. It would of been 5  if the service was better.

Alright folks. I have tried many-a-taco in Indy and La Margarita's Pescado tacos are incredible. The fish is seasoned to perfection and not overly so.   Definitely my favorite fish tacos in Indy. And you can't go wrong when you pair it with one of their amazing margarita. (I mean the place is called La Margarita :)

The new Poke Guru location in the Garage is tucked away in the back so make sure you don't miss it if you're looking for a tasty but healthy bite to eat in this new food hall.

Just like the original location, the consistency in the quality and freshness of these bowls is just unmatched and it's great that you can really customize your bowl to fit your needs. While they have a traditional sushi rice option, they also have options with greens or brown rice or you can also mix and match. 

I decided to get a bowl with tuna and it did not disappoint. It is filled with tasty goodness like avocado, seaweed salad, sesame seeds and a tangy ginger marinade too. 

My favorite part outside of the freshness and the endless combination options? The incredibly friendly service. That staff here is both kind and super helpful when it comes to making recommendations. I look forward to coming back to this location in the garage!

The lunch buffet was really good. Excellent value for money. There was sufficient choices on display for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. The fish pakoda was outstanding, the butter chicken didn't let down and the beef in the vindaloo was in beautiful perfect cubes. The naan was soft and delicious. The decor was nice, it didn't start getting filled up and it seems to be a favorite lunch place in the neighborhood.
The only let down was the dessert. They had cut fruits as well as some Indian fare. The Rasmalai and Kheer were good, not amazing. However I would stay away from the gulab jamun which was too dense and the jalebi which was too hard and crispy throughout.
Anyway I'll go back for the food for sure and hope to try some more dishes on their menu on a different day.

Stopped in to have my dip nails removed. They got me right, did an awesome job, and the price was incredibly fair! I would definitely recommend this place to others and come back for services in the future.

I love Black Crow! I've been going here (in Old NE) since they opened, and have tried literally every other coffee place in town, but always come back here. Bandit on Central is a very good alternative, and I go there when in on Central. Black Crow has another location off Central, but I  have never tried it; perhaps I have some ancient homing pigeon gene in me, because for coffee just I keep going to Black Crow in Old NE unless I am around Central, in which case I always go to Bandit.

I love the Goleta and Downtown Santa Barbara locations, but my experience at the Kyle's Kitchen in IV was disappointing. I ordered a side of fries, and it took a while to come out (not a problem because it was late at night) but they were cold when I got them. 

Not sure if they were sitting out for a while, but the fries definitely weren't fresh, so I probably wouldn't come again or would try to come during peak hours when the food has higher turnover. 

Go to the Goleta or DTSB location instead!

Verdict: a great Thai place to try

Atmosphere / decor - 4
Service - 4
Food - 4
Value - 4

Overall 4

I got the red curry (less spicy). I thought I ordered hot but my bf got Thai hot and mine was spicier. The food was really tasty and flavorful. They offer great deals on house wine. My boyfriend got Thai basil fried rice which was also very tasty. I loved the basil in it! We both got two meals out of our dishes so also a great value.
I brought my car there several times to get serviced, Dan in service is awesome! Extremely conscientious and helpful!  He really went the extra mile every time.

This place is awesome! We have found our new sushi place.  Ambiance was great, just a bit noisy but I guess it's a busy Friday night.  All is good, all sushi serve were superb and price is very affordable. Definitely my weekend go-to sushi  place. Great service as well.

Would NOT recommend. I used All My Sons for a one bedroom apartment move from South Jersey to Philadelphia. First, I was told I would get a call when the movers were on their way, because they couldn't give me a time, just said I was first. Never got a call, movers just showed up. Three guys, all pleasant. Took them 8:30 to 11:15 to load items from my first apartment. I was okay with this, even though it was a little longer then estimated. Next, I drive to Philly and tell them I will meet them at the apartment. I get to the apartment at 11:45. The movers don't show up until 12:45, mind you I AM PAYING BUY THE HOUR. I was unaware that I would be paying for their lunch break! I asked what took so long, driver claimed only certain routes for trucks. It was basically going up 76, don't think that's an issue for trucks.  Unfortunately, the process to get the furniture into the new place was a mess. Took the guys 1:00 to 4:00 to unload. My entertainment center, a piece was broken off and my large mirror legs are all scratched and scuffed up from the truck. No discounts were offered. My bill was OVER $1400! I was in shock when I saw it! I wanted to cry, but just handed over my credit card. Please look elsewhere, unless you want a hefty bill and broken furniture. Honestly, I feel like I was taken advantage of, because I was a female and obviously could not complete this move by myself. Take warning, these reviews are honest. Management never called to follow up after the move to see how things went or even send a follow up email. Very disappointed and I do not want anyone else taken advantage of.

I was visiting Nashville and wanted to try some chicken that wasn't from the famous Hattie B's. McDougal's was one of the top rated restaurants on Yelp for "hot chicken" so I decided to give it a try. The cashier was very kind to my boyfriend and I and asked us about how we were enjoying Nashville. At the end, she gave us a soda on the house. So sweet!

I shared the Large Basket with my boyfriend and we got our chicken fingers tossed in the honeybee and gold sauces. Plus we got to choose 3 dipping sauces as well! The food didn't take long to come out and the 1 dish was big enough to feed us both. If you like sauces, then this is THE place for you. The chicken fingers were drenched in the sauces we ordered and were SO good. The gold sauce was my personal favorite. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a delicious, quick bite.

Tasty little stop for dinner in South Philly!  Easy going and casual - you order at the counter, sit down, and they'll bring out your food.  The wall mural has some cute Spanish phrases and their English translations to keep you entertained while you wait.  

I had the pabellon arepa and yucca fries.  My other half had the shredded chicken with avocado.  Between the two, I definitely preferred my hot arepa and the flavors of the beef.  Savory, a little sweet, tender beef with plantains.  The cilantro mayo went well with everything (though I prefer a cilantro sauce to a mayo).  If you are new to arepas, they're not the easiest "sandwiches" to eat by hand so don't be surprised if you try to pick it up.  Given the presentation in a more open type of wrapper, I chose to use a fork and knife.  Also, arepas are hefty!  You wouldn't expect it to be so filling by the size of it, but it really was.  I was stuffed!  The yucca fries were tasty as well - nicely salted and the salsa it came with was pretty good.  We also had the cilantro lemonade but while it was refreshing initially, it was too sweet for us overall.  

I would definitely go back to try some of the other options, especially the empanadas!  They weren't on the menu, but the table next to us ordered a bunch and I had recalled seeing them in previous reviews.

I came here to buy my first ever plant! I left with a pathos, two succulents, potting mix and a beautiful bag plant holder! The staff was friendly but I wish they would have been a little more thorough when explaining the watering process of the plant since I have never owned one before. Other than that, it's a beautiful little shop and it was the perfect way to end our trip to Philly!

The sushi was great but on a Saturday night, it took one hour for us to finally get the sushi. It was beautiful and tasted great but you must have a lot of patience to eat here. I visited again with my brother and we had the same slow service.

Grooming staff at the Eagle Petco should not be allowed to interact with customers.  Hopefully, they are better with the dogs they work with than with the dog's owners.  I was treated VERY rudely by both women at the grooming station.  I forgot my dog's vaccination records, so had to drive home and back with the records.  (I had no problem with that, as it was  my error).   They looked at it and said it wasn't enough.  A valid up to date vaccination record AND a current rabies tag - but wouldn't accept it. They didn't offer to confirm with my vet - nothing.   I will never frequent a Petco store again.  As an FYI, I have never written a poor Yelp review before - just lots of positive ones, as I don't like to be negative, but this was beyond "having a bad day".

We stopped in for a quick bite. We ordered Smoked Wings, and the Cauliflower Apps, absolutely delicious. Our drinks were good, we tried the Cranberry Mojito, Texas Mule and the Peach Cooler, they were very refreshing. The atmosphere is especially nice if you enjoy sports. The only thing we didn't like is the bartender using his bare hands to put the fruit and mint in the drinks (everyone's). We haven't seen him wash his hands since we've been here, and it's been over an hour.

I absolutely love this tire shop. They are totally good priced and they get you in and out so quick. I went there on my lunch hour and they were so hopeful with getting me tires and back to work in 1 hour. The guys are so nice and friendly. Not in the best part of town but I wasn't even worried standing there waiting. Love this place!!!
I have been there twice since I moved to FL and the service by all staff has been excellent and was given treatment by my doctor that I am very satisfied with. I'm glad I found this office. :)

The first thing I need to say is that if you are a pretentious person who judges restaurants by their surroundings or need a fancy ambiance to enjoy good food, this is not the place for you...& you're going to miss out on a lot of GREAT food in life. I wont lie, the bathroom situation might be off-putting for some people, but again...get over yourself.

Once you start chatting with the team & hear more of their story, you love that you are eating there, supporting their culinary dream. 

We ordered the Crawdat Fries for the appetizer & devoured them FAST. The sauce was incredible & we wished there had been more, even though the portion was huge. 

My Dad ordered the red beans & rice with fried fish for his entree & we all  tasted it. It was amazing. Perhaps the best traditional red beans & rice I've ever had. I ordered the Superdome & it was OUTSTANDING. The fish was perfectly cooked & seasoned. The potatoes were just right. The lobster & cream sauce that surrounded it all was decadent. I tried to get everything in every bite because those layers were the perfect combo. 

Everything was plated beautifully, too. Chef Jeff is truly talented & could be cooking in any top tier restaurant in the Quarter or Garden District. The fact that he chooses to build his business in his neighborhood so that anyone who wants it can experience TOP SHELF food at affordable prices is AMAZING. I applaud him & his family for the love they are pouring into their business. The passion shows & I will definitely be returning the next time I'm in NOLA.

Found this gem through reviews on Yelp! Took my family for a night out to try something not very common - schnitzel! Easy to find with Google Maps. Good parking right infront but lots of signs to beware of where you park or risk towing. Friendly waitress seated us right away. For a Thursday night there was only 1 other couple there. We went at 6pm. Cool decor with a relaxed feel. Not exactly romantic but very relaxed and family friendly. The menu is extensive -  It took quite a while to make a decision with All the choices! 
One of us got the pepper, one of us got the one recommend on the menu - Jagerschitzel, and I really wanted to try the garlic butter so I went for the Prairie. 
Free salad was given quickly after ordering which was a great snack but quite tart for my taste. 
Our meal came in what I thought was a reasonable amount of time. 
The pepper one was exactly as described very pepper like. Not hot spicy but like you dumped the whole pepper shaker in. My friend loved it. 
My other friend liked their Jagerschitzel but I actually found the sauce too BBQ like instead of creamy. 
My Prairie was ...interesting with the Kraft processed cheese. Real peices of bacon! The garlic butter was frozen like a rock so difficult to spread and didn't add a lot to the dish in flavor.
Portions looked great but actually we didn't end up with any leftovers at all considering we all got full orders. 
The potato salad was loved by everyone. The potato croquettes were very good but soooo pricey. Paid an additional $5 to an already $25 dish for 5 deep fried mashed potato balls. Worth trying once but I don't think I'll get them again. Didn't seem to have a lot of other seasoning inside but very nice crispy and fluffy inside. 
I was out of water for quite a while before waitress came to refill but otherwise great service.
If you want something different or love schitzel this is the place!

The freshest thing there was the salad bar ironically. Everything else looked like it had been sitting there since they opened.. All of the cooked veggies looked gross. The pizza looked like it had been sitting there for probably 2 hours. My boyfriend said he could smell the bacteria when he walked by certain places.. I thought it smelled a little like cat pee.. The order your steak section looked to scary to even approach.. The chocolate wonder fall didn't even seem like real chocolate.. It was very Thin.. We won't be going back.. Dirty dinning may want to check it out.. The only thing that was tasty was the orange chicken and the bourbon chicken.. They were loaded with Sodium but not terrible.

SB IT/Orlando- came out and configured a new modem, moved sons game system and re-hooked it up and pulled out  a BUNCH of old electronic equipment we didn't need anymore-  He was great, efficient and reasonable.

The owners of this place, Pete and Jeanne are so nice. They're pretty knowledgeable about the shoes, fitting, insoles, etc. 

 They have a nice limited selection of running clothes. Pretty posh though. No good sturdy running bras nor underwear but they have a good set of base layering clothes. 

They have information up everywhere regarding races, runs, and stuff.
The store managers also host runs for beginners and marathon training weekly. I've joined them before- really enjoyed the runs with them. Good support system!  

Very cool-- they even have a website that promotes community running. 

The store is pretty cool about letting runners go and try out the shoes and can return the shoes if not satisfied.

I was looking for help with my taxes and after meeting with Michael and Dawn, they seemed like good people. After our meeting I sent over previous years taxes but never heard back from them. About a week later I emailed Dawn and she said they were ready to start working on my taxes. Unfortunately, this was a few weeks prior to the shutdown. I emailed them mid-July to see if they were still open. Ten days later Michael replied they were indeed open and Dawn was there most mornings. I explained to Michael I was a new client but hadn't heard from them after the shutdown. He hasn't replied. I'm very disappointed with their lack of communication. I understand things got wonky after the shutdown but they could've communicated much, much better than they did. 

I would not recommend this business as tax preparers. I am now left to find another business to help with my 2019 business and personal taxes as now I am late and face penalties and fines. I did all the correspondences with them as their response was pretty much nonexistent.

I've had two appointments with Kaylin now and I've walked out of both loving my hair! She manages to understand exactly what I want and then exceed it. She also recommends the products that she uses on my hair and never pressures me to purchase any. I have bought some because I've loved them so much and because she provided me a small sample to test them out at home first. The staff is always so nice at the salon as well. I highly recommend Kaylin and Element!

Worth the trip, but needless to say, I'm glad *I* wasn't the one picking up the tab. 

I wanted ice cream after a trip to the northern part of the city, but nothing was too close by; the beau found this place and surprised me. After waiting in a 45 minute line...no, really...we got inside and placed our orders. This place is a strict throwback to the early 1900s. The inside was gorgeously decorated with old cabinents with glass cases showcasing old-fashioned candies and sodas. The staff, made of ice cream scoopers, sundae makers, and soda jerks, was dressed for the era. Once we ordered, we got our food quick and made our way to a small table outside. 

The ice cream choice selection is vast, and I was thrilled to see banana ice cream, one of my favorite kinds! It's so hard to find. It was good...but, admittedly, a little bland and I've had better. (Riper bananas make for a more banana-y ice cream.) Regardless, I was excited to eat it. I topped it with house-made whipped cream and house-made caramel sauce. This sauce was definitely no butterscotch, definitely no imitation. This was 100% caramel sauce, thick and sticky and full of flavor and texture. It coated the bottom of my to-go container and I joyously scooped up globs of it with my spoon once I started to finish my ice cream and whipped cream.

The prices though? *phew* It cost just shy of $22 for one small and one medium to-go ice cream each with two toppings! Toppings are a la carte, and a small to-go container cost a little shy of $5. Like I said, I'm glad the beau was treating. 

This is a popular spot, and I'm glad I was able to get a scoop! It's charming and delicious.

This restaurant is a very nice and relaxed place that you can come to chill in. you can get a range of Mexican American meals for a nice price . the drinks range from margaritas to coca cola's so it is okay for youth to come here. Though I would not suggest you bring your family here it is a good one on one restaurant to catch up with someone.
    At this local Bar and Grill on South Street, customers get what they paid for. This Mexican American eatery is ready to fill all of your Mexican cravings. From Tacos to Margaritas this place has it all. The menu usually stays the same but every week they have a weekly special. It is not very Family friendly restaurant since the base of the menu is alcohol and fancy dishes. But even without a kids menu they can still seem to keep their customers satisfied. One of there most known for sections on their menu is their Mexican take on American burgers. Some examples are Acapulco, the Benedict Burger, and The Toluca Burger. My personal favorite entree is the Acapulco burger witch consist of Guacamole and salsa with an all beef patty. Everything in the restaurant has a very "chill" vibe with no stress.
    The General feel of the restaurant is very nice there is no stress. People come to this place to relax and have a drinks there are very litle families and this place is a place you would go to see your friends of catch up with a relative. There prices are relatively cheap. Ranging from $8.00 to $18.00 meals. It is also highly decorated and very nice looking.

This place was amazing! We sat on the upstairs patio and with a heater was very pleasant. Had the Caesar salad witch was very fresh along with Gumbo. For the main course, Swordfish and shrimp, cooked to perfection! Limited menu but what they do, they do well.

My first time here was perfect. Started with latkes which were perfectly fried and came with both sweet and savory sauces. Hubby ordered the rainbow bowl, a cold bowl of farro, chilled pickled vegetables, pico, mushrooms. Flavor packed. It was pretty spectacular for a vegan bowl. I ordered the egg breakfast: my eggs were cooked to perfection, the "little salad" was dressed perfectly, the grits had peppers and cheese and were OUT OF THIS WORLD, the bacon was obviously made in house and the toasted brioche was definitely made from scratch. Cant wait to come again!

My experience here was just ok, both the food and service were not on par with the more upscale vibe and price point Mei Mei is targeting. Ambience is awesome though and food comes out lightening fast if you're into that 

1. Food - Some dishes were good, others were bad, but a common issue was the flavors were mostly one-dimensional 

Drinks - Inconsistent, the same drink tastes different each time 

Appetizers - Korean chicken bites were extremely dry, Shrimp Bao Bun was delicious, Egg rolls had good filling, but were overcooked, Pan-seared Chicken dumplings were only cooked on one side so were partially gummy but had good flavor 

Entrees - Skip the Crab and Mango, the presentation reminded me of cat food. Shrimp Lo Mein was good, Sesame Chicken thankfully was not dry this time and tasty

Dessert - Mocha cake was just ok

2. Service - I tend to peg my expectations to the type of establishment (e.g., diner vs Michelin star fine dining). When I'm paying $20+ for Lo Mein, I start to notice the little things. My primary waitress was very pleasant, others not so much. 

If we order 4+ appetizers and the plates are oddly shaped, please time the food so that you are not forcibly squeezing them on a small table without even attempting to clear plates or help us shift stuff around

Provide serving utensils for dishes and choose appropriately (A spoon to serve noodles?)

A soy sauce based dish cannot go into a paper to go container

If you're looking for something similar I would stick to Buddakan, DoubleKnot or Morimoto

l A very nice driver. When I was on vacation and my package was about to be delivered, the driver called me and I left him a message. The day after I returned home from vacation, he delivered my package again. Thank you very much. It was a surprise for my vacation. Nice!
This restaurant was recommended during our visit to New Orleans we truly enjoyed it. We highly recommend it, the service was great and the food was amazing!

DO NOT USE!
This company will exploit your desperation, jeopardize your health, and break & steal your belongings.  What follows is an account of my TERRIBLE experience with All My Sons Moving & Storage Company:

When the movers arrived, I received a call from an administrator stating that I would have to pay an additional 60 an hour.  This occured because they had inadvertently sent four men rather than three.  And when I mentioned not feeling right about being penalized for their error, I was told that they could just leave & move on to another job.  I, however, just bit the bullet and paid the extra 60.00 an hour.  Really, I was stuck!  It was literally the last day I had to relocate!  Also, the movers broke my bedframe & fireplace, stole my drill, and showed up without masks.  I provided them masks and a drill; they were unprepared.  Oh & get this, after they disassembled my bedframe (which I subsequently discovered they broke), they were unable to reassemble it.  If I had the time & energy, I would sue All My Sons Moving & Storage Company!  STAY CLEAR OF THIS COMPANY!

I usually love Happy Dragon! I have been ordering for years. The soup is delicious, and the delivery is usually there within a half hour. However, I ordered last week and it was not a good experience. The woman who took my order rushed me off the phone. After waiting an hour, I called to see the status of the order. A man very rudely said they were busy and it should be there any minute. Another half hour went by, so I called again. I was told that my food hadn't left yet and that they were waiting for their driver to come back. They said it should be another 15-20 minutes, they couldn't get in touch with the driver, and they didn't know what I wanted them to do. They were basically unapologetic and didn't care that we had waited close to two hours. The food eventually came, and was missing the spring roll I ordered. Not to mention, everything tasted kind of bland. Not sure if new people are working there? Very disappointing, and not sure I will ever order again.

After a bit of a rocky start our experience did get better.  Probably closer to a 3.5 experience. 
We had reservations for 4 and 2 of us were there and they wouldn't seat us so even though several tables were open we forced to make our way to the bar and awkwardly stand around while we waited for a drink - it would have been much better customer service just to seat us and let us start ordering drinks and apps. 
Once we were seated everything was much better. Our server was great - she was super friendly and just the right amount of attentive.  All of the food was really good. We started with the fried green tomatoes, biscuits, and tartare. You can't go wrong with any of these.  My friend and I shared the short rib meat loaf and under the brick chicken. The root mash with the chicken was not my favorite - it didn't have much flavor and surprising I felt the same way about mashed potatoes with the meatloaf. However the meatloaf and the chicken were very good.  If I had to pick one next time, I'd go with the meatloaf. 
The coconut key lime pie was the perfect dessert. It was light and full of flavor.  
I'll definitely come back - I still need to try the fried chicken!

This is a must if you visit Nawlins! The guide was charismatic, funny, and knowledgeable.  The tour took us through the French Quarter and described the history of New Orleans. Then we went to St. Louis Cemetery No. 1 and learned all about how New Orleans takes care of their dead.  Was a major highlight of my trip!

I do appreciate them having vegan pho options! However, it's not worth it to me to go back.

The space is also tiny, so you always feel like you're in someone's way, but they do have counter seating, which may be more pleasant because your back is to the people bumping into you rather than having to awkwardly look at them.

The pho wasn't that great, and we got golden papaya for dessert, and that was fairly disappointing as well (overly simple, not very good flavor). I probably wouldn't hit it up again, but I do give them credit for having veg options.

As soon as you walk in the door you are surrounded by collectables in all sizes, shapes etc.  As you meander the isles it takes you back to another time in history. It can take hours to really get a good look at all that Tom's has to offer.  Retro furnishings from the 50's, dishes, glasses, jewelry, lamps, paintings.  You name it and you can find something special to add a special touch to your home. Some of the prices are a bit high but if you love it then it is worth the price.  This time around I put the reins on though.  My house is small and not much room for more.   If you want to lose yourself in the wonders of the store then just spend some time enjoying the nostalgia of an other time and place.  No charge for having a delightful bit of eye candy and who knows you might find that one piece you can put in that empty corner.

If you're in the area that is clearly a fabulous food place to go!! The food is so tasty, so authentic,  well balanced!! I only regreted having discovered it at only 800pm  as i would have returned later on for a secound round of food, if it did not close at 9pm...

The staff is super nice and friendly, attentive and respectful. The place is super clean and nice and relatively comfy (though still more of a food court ambiance than a restaurant)

Went here for my lil brother's bday! His favorite spot. I wasn't all that convinced from the outside that this place would be good BUT come to find out, it's a lot larger than you'd notice on first glance and the food is amazing!

I'd recommend sitting in the "secret" patio section. It has an open roof which makes for a beautiful dining experience. The host actually walked us out of the main seating area to this spacious unique other section of the restaurant that reminded me of being in New Orleans AND they played songs from the Youngblood Brass Band album! That was an added plus for me since I saw them perform live and it brought back so many fun memories.

On to the food, damn good stuff and great service! I had the lobster & wild mushroom pasta, my dad got the oysters Rockefeller & alligator nuggets, mom & sister got shrimp & grits. Lil brother got a shrimp po'boy & his gf got the crawfish po'boy with the crab cake appetizer and my cousin got the calamari.

Everybody absolutely loved their meals, every single plate was clean! The food was fresh and well seasoned and had just the right amount of spice.

No pics of the delicious food this time because it was all about enjoying this special occasion. This place is definitely a must visit if you're in the STL area!!

Greg and all the staff are the most professional and efficient people around. I got my wiper fluid hose and exhaust gasket/manifold fixed. Both were done in one business day. They even applied an employee discount. I will definitely come back if I have any further car problems!

Been here four times.  First time was the first week they opened and working out  kinks. Waitstaff very attentive however the food was mediocre.  Fried fish was over cooked but onion soup was very good. Would have preferred the French onion soup to be served in a ceramic crock instead of an aluminum crock. Second and third time the food was good and waitstaff still attentive. The fourth time I was very dissatisfied. The table was dirty when we were seated and I noticed other unoccupied tables ready for seating were also dirty with dried spills and drink rings. Watched the bus staff clean a table and they only wiped it with the towel kept on their waist. Never sprayed a cleaning agent on the table. Second bus person came to the table and did the same thing. More training and management attention needed here. Ordered the onion soup and found that a sweet cheese roll was used as a crouton. Gross!!  Hamburger was over cooked and did not get my onion rings that I had ordered until I asked. Waitstaff still attentive and friendly. They continue to show wines and beer on their menu but still not available. I desperately want this diner to succeed as Ponzio's is further and much more expensive. They need to pay more attention to cleanliness of the tables and the consistency in their food. Will go back once more to see if there is any improvement, if not, I will not go back again.

I have never had such a pleasant move in my life. In the last 8 years, I've moved 7 times (and hopefully not again for a while) and I always dread moving day. I ran out of boxes and had some of my stuff in Trader Joe's esque bags, but the 2 Haul Zingers didn't mind at all. They were extremely professional and friendly. The move took 30 minutes more than anticipated because my couch couldn't fit around a corner, but the movers found a way to maneuver it through the kitchen. I am so thankful yelp exists and people have reviewed this company because without them, I would never have had such an easy move!

Open disclaimer, I've been to TWO yelp events at North. However, I was SO IMPRESSED with those events, that I selected North for my own holiday party. I booked the front patio and the special event coordinator, Mariah, was so professional, helpful and made lots of special accommodations for me. 

The night of the event, the staff were great and even helped us setup our own decorations. They were all about smiling and happy-to-help attitudes. The fire pits and heaters made it such a great location.

The appetizers were all accented with truffle oil, which I love. The bruschetta had great prosciutto and a little crunch of asparagus to go with the drizzle of truffle oil. The zucca chips were addictively simple and delicious. They also had spicy/sweet nuts and some castelvetrano olives (which are my favorite type!)

The soup was a good tomato bisque, but by far my favorite thing was the braised beef short ribs with gnocchi, horseradish, arugula and bread crumbs. The beef was exceptionally tender and fall-apart moist. The peppery arugula went well with the creamy sauce. The breadcrumbs provided a bit of a crunch and the gnocchi was tender and fluffy. It provided a great range of textures and all the flavors worked well together. I would certainly order it again. I had a few bites of chicken parm which was impressively moist and better than I expected. I also has a few bites of salmon with butternut squash risotto which was tasty.

They graciously added the French toast (from the brunch menu) to the desert list at no extra cost and everyone who ordered it was blown away. (P.s. It's actually bread pudding sliced and sautéed and served like French toast). I got the Nutella desert which was perfectly creamy and the right amount of sweet. 

The cocktails were all delicious and strong. The Julietta with vanilla and ginger was a great combo. They also made a special drink for the event with gin, limoncello and thyme which was amazing. Overall, it made for a perfect event!

My husband bought me a massage for my anniversary. I went in and the massage was adequate. When I was leaving the girl at the counter asked me if I wanted a membership for 58$ per month plus a free massage. She said I could cancel at anytime after the first billing cycle. I read the contract and the contract stated this also. It turns out that with economy as it is I became to busy and broke for this luxury. When I went to cancel, they told me I had to wait until the day after the billing cycle. I came in two weeks after the billing cycle thinking that enough time had passed. In the meantime, they had billed me again. When I tried to cancel they told me that if I did I would lose my money AND the massage that I paid for. I asked if they thought that was fair and they said it was company policy. Beware of the memberships. They are a scam.
Update: The next time I went there, they were out of fajita veggies AGAIN and also out of brown rice...what is happening at this location??

I'm not a big fan of cupcakes or chocolate cake, BUT their midnight chocolate is scrumptious! It's an easy indulgence that is both rich and creamy in all the right ways. 

I prefer the mini versions and the pre-packed 4-pack for $5.99 (if you purchase something else, you get it for $4.99) is a great way to try a variety.

The only reason I came back here was because my mother loves their mediocre donuts. The few times I've been here are an absolute nightmare. I feel like it's a requirement to have terrible customer service skills to work here. The old lady with the short hair behind the counter is the absolute WORST. I went two days ago and was completely ignored. I waited 15 minutes while the old lady behind the counter just stood there and never offered her help. When someone finally decided to help the only non white person in their bakery, the woman behind the counter asked the ignorant question if I was sure I could afford two donuts and a cookie because the $9 order would be "expensive" as she said. A statement that none of the other white patrons received in the whole time I was waiting. I don't care if my mother enjoys their bland food, I'm never coming back here. I'd recommend the Krispy Kreme across the street the service is much nicer and the pastries are a hundred times better.

Adorable little studio with a great location in S Philly. I love that there are no mirrors - I tend to get distracted from my practice by criticizing  myself, so I had a much more centered class here. The instructor was great and prices are pretty standard for yoga. We used all the props, so I read felt like I got my money's worth.

Terrible restaurant.  Closed on a Saturday night at 8:30pm.    Not only are they closed but the waitress hurried over and locked the door as she saw us walking up.  Very bad impression of this franchise.  Saw another vehicle pull in, walk up, and were disappointed as well.

Let me start by saying that I was a huge fan of Pacifico.  My flight got in at 1:00am.  Which Pacifico knew.  I did not check baggage cause I wanted to be able to get home asap.  When I landed and called Pacifico they said that no drivers were available and they would call me when one was available.  I had a reservation, they had my car!  I called back when everyone had claimed their luggage. Was basically told that I had to wait my turn!  Really?  I had an appointment! I was the only person left alone in the baggage claim area.  I finally got my car around 2:00am.  I am a woman and was literally alone in the Philadelphia airport.  Ridiculous.  I will never use or recommend Pacifico again.

I'm going to start this review with a disclaimer: I'm a vegetarian. Therefore, it might seem unfair that I'm reviewing BDubs (as it's fondly called). But hey, they have potatoes on the menu, which I figure means fair game. 

For a picnic earlier today, my cousin picked up to-go potato wedges with LOADS of their signature ranch. I'm relatively forgiving with potatoes, mostly because it's kind of hard to ruin them beyond retribution. BDubs, on its first try, has proved my theory wrong: I have no problem being critical here.

Not only were the wedges hard, dry, and relatively difficult to make our way through, but the 'sour cream and chive seasoning' (according to the menu description) was less-than-favorable. After about 3 wedges, I abandoned my attempts: I had found a potato that couldn't win my heart. 

The ranch, however, I would recommend: we used it as a dip for some other fries that had relatively gross dips come with them for a beautiful marriage made out of unpleasant circumstances.

One of the most creatively curated artisan showcases I've seen in a long time. It's hard not to spend allllll my money at Zele (only $75 or so, phew). It's a large space brimming with unique decor, jewelry, art, apparel and everything in between. We left with a print of a cat eating sushi, a Jareth the goblin king keychain (labrynth), and other ridiculous items that I love so much. Still, looking around is 75% of the fun even if you don't buy a thing. You won't find the cheapo NOLA tchotchke souvenirs here, it's all quirky handmade gems that I just can't get enough of!

The French Onion soup was some of the  best ever at this diner style restaurant.  I also had a very tasty salmon with spinach in filo with red pepper sauce that was very tasty.  The vegetable sides though, were less than fresh and the thousand island dressing on my fresh salad was seemingly watered down.  The butter pecan ice cream I finished with was a generous helping but still lacked taste.  My server was attentive.  Good service but the food was hit or miss.

Well I would love to review them... needed to get a manicure.  However when I took them up on "walk-in's welcome", the one manicurist said she was booked all day.  How can you say walk-in's welcome with there is only one person working?  How is that ever going to work?  Super sad.

Came here on a recent visit to St. Petersburg.  We knew that visiting Major League Baseball teams stay here when they are playing the Tampa Bay Rays.  My family and I had a lovely visit here.  We wandered the hallways of the hotel.  We enjoyed the gardens  the exterior the building.  Very intrigued by a hallway that tells the entire history of The Vinoy.  It also goes into some of their association with the Tampa Bay Rays and Major League Baseball.  

Truly a luxurious the destination spot on St. Petersburg Tampa Bay Coast.

Looking for some of Indy's hidden gems? Commissary is one of them! Located under New York St., Commissary is slinging lattes like nobody's business!

Vibes: Exposed brick, chill atmosphere, great natural light, and a perfect spot to crank out some work.
Coffee: I love their capp, but if you're more a latte pal they have some funky and different flavors worth the try! And let's talk about the coffee art. B-E-A-UTIFUL! I also love that they serve their drip coffee in a carafe when enjoyed in house. Makes me feel fancy.
Baristas: Lovely humans and passionate about their craft.

10/10 would recommend.

I've been looking forward to going to this place all week and I was SO disappointed. I don't know if I came on a bad night or what but the meat was super dry and bland. I love the idea but the end result wasn't great. I lived in LA for 6 years, the mecca for KBBQ and maybe my expectations were just a little too high.

Out of all the boba places I've tried in Philly since I came two months ago, A Cup Of Tea is definitely one of my favorites. 

If you decide to get milk tea, try the roast oolong! I tried it for the first time and it's an interesting take on regular oolong milk tea that brings out more complexity in the flavors in your mouth. I would definitely recommend!

Another tip is to get normal or little less sugar level! I've been traumatized with life threatening high levels of sugar at other boba places but A Cup Of Tea is the only place that stays true to their sugar levels.

Overall, I would definitely recommend coming to try this boba place. Although it's a bit far off from the main part of Chinatown, the amazing boba here makes it all worth the trek!

This is a really cute spot in Ardmore! It seems to be a family business, and I love supporting family businesses. We ordered rice bowls, bbq, a beer and a drink called ade. I'm always slightly hesitant to order things that I never tried before, but this drink was perfect! 

The staff is really nice and it definitely has a korean ambiance. I will definitely be back!

Great cozy little dockside restaurant. We had a burger and oyster sandwich. Server was friendly, and great service. 
Food was delicious, although only 4 oysters on sandwich, could have used 2 more. Burger was good too. 

You can sit outside and watch the boats come and go. Very quaint place to grab a casual bite to eat. 

My reason for not giving 5 stars was the bathroom situation. Their bathrooms were out of order, and you have to use an outhouse in a trailer outside the restaurant in the parking lot. Not very cool. Stinky and just gross. 

I am not sure if I would make the drive there again, just because of the rest room situation. It grossed me out.

Funky place. The staff could not care less about patron satisfaction or happiness- that is except for the rather tall man serving the coffee and taking orders. He was nice. The décor is shabby without the chic. The staff was too worried about appearing hip and aloof to care about service and forget about a welcoming smile or genuine , connective human feeling. I was served a typical American egg breakfast and my relatives both ate breakfast burritos. All very uninspired and absolutely no better than I prepare at home; although I put some effort into making my plated product pretty. Coffee was good and plentiful on the positive side. The interior itself was drab and frankly dingy and dirty appearing. I felt like tipping them with a can of paint and brush. Anyway with so many fantastic places to eat in NOLa I can't imagine us returning here.

This location has nostalgia for me as it used to be Winchel Donuts. I stopped in to get my husband and son a donut.

The building is a bit run down and could use paint. However, the employees are kind. They make donuts here.  You might be lucky enough to be there when fresh donuts come out. 

My husband and son said they donuts were good.

It's your basic rental car company except, the exceptional service of Alison.  I use this location periodically and Alison always remembers me and greets me with warm enthusiasm.  

There are generally many cars too choose from and what I appreciate about this location, is the large lot I can leave my car in while I'm using the rental.

I've been here once before and I don't remember the ice cream being as good as it was last week! I think I just ordered well! I got the honey comb and hyrox cookie covered in hot fudge. It was fricking amazing!

I didn't even get to see the doctor and my experience was bad. I called them and gave my insurance info. No issues, no questions, no concerns. I showed up for my appointment and my insurance IS accepted but only a certain, exclusive type. I've never met nor called an office before that didn't know what insurance is accepted and what plans within that insurance is accepted. I wasted my time coming here. I needed a primary care doctor for an urgent medical need and now I have to start over. Dissatisfaction is the mildest feeling I have. AVOID.

I haven't been to the gas station in over two years! In addition to filling up my car each week the driver texts me when my tags are approaching their expiration date and even checks my tire pressure once a month. Love this service!
Tried for first time, if had little more meat they'd be the best, but overall good bagels I'd come back

My first 1 star review!!! After over 90 reviews I have had the worst dining experience I can ever remember. 

First impression walked in the door myself and my date were handed menus at the hostess table then the hostess instead of walking us to our table pointed to where our table was in the back of the restaurant. We were shocked literally laughing to our table. Once seated we were given complimentary champagne which was nice except my glass had lipstick on it. I felt like we were being pranked. As we were waiting for our server the table next to us sent back both of their plates. At this moment we were going to walk out but we stuck it out. Bright spot our server was very friendly and attentive and helped best she could.

Food- I want to keep this short my entree was a $35 dollar lobster ravioli. I received cheese raviolis with 2 little chunks of lobster in the sauce. 1 bright spot the complimentary bread was the best thing we had. I don't know how this place can get it together but I hope they do because if not they will be out of business soon and I never want to see that happen to anyone

The worst dunkin' i've ever been to.  Puts the ones in new england in a different league.  Everytime i've come here some part of my order has been wrong.  The first time they didn't know how to make an iced chai do I had to literally explain to them that they make chai tea and then ice it... to make matters worse, this was at the start if covid lockdowns and they didn't wear masks.

The most recent time, I asked for iced chai with a shot of caramel and a bfast sammy.  The chai tasted like licorice- they put WAY too much mix in.  The guy who took my order didn't give a single damn and didn't put any caramel in.  Straight didn't even drink it, disgusting.

How is this place still open?  Its management is atrocious.

Love it! We travelled 17527kms from Perth, Australia to NOLA and Bayou hot wings was up the top of our to Eat List. (Create one of u don't already have one, much more fun than a boring 'to do' list... In fact how do you not have one of you are on Yelp?!) 

We caught a taxi there for about US$20, wings cost us $US17 & taxi back was US$13. It was totally worth it :) The owner even helped us call a taxi to pick us up because they are a bit out of the way and we didn't have a cell.

We ordered the plain hot (off the menu) it was awesome 4/5 stars and we also had the pepper jelly 4/5 stars. The pepper jelly was super interesting to try, it was good and like nothing we'd tried before, a great recommendation by the owner. 

A Beast Challenge was being done while we were there. There were 4 who were going to try it, 2 ppl who did it but no one achieved vixtory. Watching them cry and guzzle milk after their attempts made me super sure I was not 'man enough!!!' 

It was a show and dinner and was absolutely worth it, love it!!! You should try it if you are looking for a great place, cheap eat or fantastic service :)

As soon as you walk in, you can feel the New Orleans vibe. This restaurant is very lovely and perfect for a date night. I made reservations for the sole purpose of getting a balcony table, but that didn't happened due to the rain. Nonetheless, it was still a perfect dinner. 
The waiter made some recommendations and we went for the Trout Eugene and the bf had the Duck D'orange. The dishes were perfect and nice in size at a very reasonable price. 
The service was professional and elegant. I will definitely be coming back here.

I was told I was driving to Spring Mountain.  I had no idea what that was, but figured it was a long drive.  Then I found out it was in Schwenksville.  Where is the mountain?  A nuclear reactor?  

We arrive to a haunted house ski area with every single middle school student in there area.  You wait in a single line to ride up a ski lift.  This was really fun to ride up at night.  Then you wait in a line at the top of the hill, to go through a trail.  It was an interesting journey.  At the end of the village is a line for a hayride to complete your journey. 

This was much better than I thought it would be.  I guess the bar was set low, but it was top two 2021 Halloween adventures for me.  We found a parking spot, but I could see how bad it can get.  Also, every single parent then has to pick up their middle schooler at the same time.

I wasn't expecting a place like this to be located in Downtown Dunedin. They have been here for years and apparently business is good for them. 

To me, Casa Tina has that odd New Orleans voodoo vibe to it. New Orleans is known for Cajun food and Casa Tina is obviously Mexican, but that is the most accurate way to explain it in my opinion. It's colorful, yet the lighting is dark and the walls are filled with crosses, pictures and odd knick-knacks. The walls were cluttered with items and the surrounding areas of the tables were neat and clean. 

Our service was average at best and their "lunch menu" was nothing special. The prices were very high and although the portions were good, I'd rather have a smaller portion and pay a smaller price especially at lunchtime. That's the point of a lunch menu. 

My girlfriend got two meals out of her lunch size burrito and my half plate of quesadillas (two) and rice and beans were not worth nearly ten dollars. 

Our food was good, tasted fresh and came out shortly after it was ordered. One odd thing that I liked was how big the plates were. It gave everything on the plate enough room without everything overlapping. 

The complimentary chips and salsa that were given to us when we were seated were good. The salsa had large chunks of tomato in it and tasted fresh. 

Two lunch special meals and a soft drink were $30 w/gratuity. There are tons of other places I can enjoy for lunch and not spend $30 to do so.

The newest Dunkin in the area has a very nice modern feel to it. 

Inside is neat, spacious and clean. The employees are friendly, knowledgeable and the donuts were completely stocked. In fact, my bagel was so charred I should of gotten a donut instead. At first I thought it was a whole wheat bagel by mistake. Nope, it was just borderline burnt. That lead me to eat half of it and chuck the rest away. Someone will figure out how to use a toaster soon...

I get that it's a new location, but my meal was significantly more than the waters location and that is only two miles down the road. A large iced tea at that location is .99 cents all of the time. It's $1.99 at this location.

I'm not sure who is in charge of training in this area, but every location I go to never puts napkins in the bag. That's kind of a must at any place that serves food. 

Getting in and out of here is going to be a mess when they get busy considering there is only one way in and one way out of this parking lot that is shared with a bank. 

Friendly people and a clean restaurant will keep me coming back to this location compared to the waters location, which is an absolute mess every time I go there. Hopefully next time my bagel is edible.

It's probably silly to have a favorite location of a chain grocery store, but I've been so pleased with the curbside pickup at this location that I've got to give it a special shoutout. I would give it five stars except they're sometimes out of stock of common items I would expect them to have bursting from their seams (like regular mayonnaise). Going to this location means going out of my way since the Kroger on Blair is much closer, but the layout, selection, and service at the Green Hills Kroger can't be beat.

This is seriously one of my favorite spots, whether for date night or meeting up with friends. In the summer, they open up the front window which looks right out on to the cultural trail, making you feel as if you could be outside drinking wine on your porch with friends. 

The staff here is incredibly knowledgable and great at suggesting wines based on your preferences. They also have options where you can split a bottle with your table or even carry out a bottle you tasted to go. 

One of my favorite events I attended at the Wine Market was last fall, where they had a yoga instructor come in and hosted a yoga and wine tasting night. It was not only relaxing, but a great way to meet others in Indy! 

My favorite item off of the menu is the charcuterie, which is great for snacking on and has lots of different items to appeal to anyone you might be sharing it with. While I have never gotten any of the other food, they seem to have a great selection to choose from.

This used to be one of my favorite restaurants! Everything is always served fresh and usually in a timely fashion. Consistency hasn't been excellent. I used to love the consistency with Anthony's and I find that things aren't always the same on different occasions. Sometimes the items are cooked differently than the last time and it's not the way it should be. The food is still good regardless and so is the service.

What a gem! Definitely check out this place. They have awesome specials: $1 macaroons on Wednesday, bottomless mimosas on Saturday, half off wine on Sunday's...come on. It doesn't get any better! Their atmosphere is so beautiful and welcoming. The owner and staff are so fun and kind. We make a point to bring all friends here when they visit from out of town. They've also recently added impossible meat to their options, so as a vegetarian, I definitely love that! They opened a location downtown that I'm looking forward to visiting as well!

We got on the waitlist before leaving our hotel. The seating is very structured and effective. Our wait was between 20-40 mins and I believe we waited 30 mins tops. They are very organized. There is a large bar in the center with seating around the bar. I ordered the Chicken St. Charles. It was mouthwatering delicious. The chicken was cooked perfectly, juicy and crispy! The biscuit was moist and the sauce on top was the perfect touch. I rarely ever finish my food but this meal was not going to go to waste! I'm stuffed!
