My friend ordered the skinny miss, which was flavorful and if your trying to eat On the healthier side this is a meal For you. The portions are great and filling. Loved this place!

I'm in my hometown visiting this week for Thanksgiving and finally made a trip to Breaking Grounds coffee for my morning caffeine fix after hearing my mother rave about it for months and never getting a chance to go. Had to also go support them for Small Business Saturday! I'm a lover of coffee in all forms, iced, hot, drip, latte, etc. and will drink it all but especially love the ambiance of a coffee shop and the energy and personality of the employees. 

The employees in the shop, including the owner, were so happy and upbeat when we entered and were sure to mention the coffee specials of the day. I got the drip Bali blend and it's perfectly brewed. They were featured on a few news segments and in the NJ newspaper which is well deserved because they are helping an amazing cause. I love to see people do good things out of the kindness of their heart and help to better the world around them - makes you really feel that there is kindness left in this world! A must visit coffee shop tucked away in Mount Holly.

A friend and I chose to go here to celebrate our birthdays. I got a chicken sandwich with a small side salad and my friend got a chopped chicken salad. The portions were generous and we both agreed they tasted great. My sandwich had so many layers, it was hard to take bites out of it! We chose the apple strudel to share for dessert. Delicious pastry with sweet apples, vanilla ice cream, and caramel topping drizzled over. Since we were celebrating our birthdays, they gave us the dessert for free! Our service was great and we had an enjoyable meal.

Last Saturday on 12/26/20 I visited this Starbucks through the drive thru. My sister got her beverage and I got my standard hot chocolate. There was a bit of a wait but that is standard for any Starbucks drive thru these days. The beverages were decent and the location on Easton Road (Route 611) is very convenient if not very crowded. Overall, it was a decent experience.

I came here with a group of friends for brunch on a Sunday. Service was really great, they were very attentive. Brunch menu was very brunch-y but it has a good amount of options. Food was bland not much seasoning, but the fries were really good! Bottomless mimosas are $25 a person & the drinks were flowing! It's definitely more of a hookah lounge then a brunch spot but overall the ambience is nice, they have a good drink selection & a lot of hookah options.

I just have to start off by saying I love the Home Depot app. It allows you to lookup items and locate them within the store. This is a great resource during these crazy times.

I came to Home Depot today to buy a new water heater. The app allowed me to shop prior to entering the store. Once, I arrived I knew where to find my deserved item. Well while walking to it, I happen to come across a nice tool chest with built in power plugs and work benches area on top. It was a wonderful score for $248. 

Okay, now back to the water heater. I was able to get a nice customer service rep to help me get it through checkout along with my extra find. Then, we loaded it up into the back of the truck. The dangers of having a truck is having the possibility for more room which leads to more unplanned purchases of awesomeness.

I enjoyed eating here while it is still new. Like every other Asian buffet, lots of options for a low/medium price. 

What I really enjoyed here were all the seafood options, but I would have liked it if they did fill the snow crabs up at least once while I was here. I was excited to see they had them and it was the end of the bucket which leaves them soggy and watered down; I took them in hopes for a refill on it, but they quickly swapped it out for a different dish.... Bummer. 

Other than this I thought it was fairly clean for a buffet and the food looked fresh. The service was on point, our server always made sure our drinks were refilled. The bathroom was a little bit sketchy, it was not well lit and the doors did not close properly. 

Don't forget to check out the cold bar while you're here. They have the deserts and salads on the other side, they even have kimchi and pickled radish which I think is awesome.

This is such a great breakfast place. I came here excited to try, and couldn't believe how many choices there were. I got the tri-athlete, and absolutely fell in love with it. It was clean, delicious, and didn't leave me with a heavy feeling after eating it. I'd be more than willing to return to this little place, and excited to try new dishes!

This location is in a really good spot! Right off the freeway and close to the shopping mall. Our server was so kind and recommended a few things for me. This was my first time trying their breakfast. It's actually really good! I definitely enjoyed my sandwich. I ordered the egg white with biscuit and chicken on it. Very juicy and flavorful. My husband ordered the bagel with eggs and chicken. It was really good! I love how cute their hash browns are.

I don't need to explain more than what the stars say.

Arrive at least 15 minutes early to order drinks or food. Slightly pricey but exactly what I'd expect at nice events like this. Performance by the artists and MC were seamless. 

Must to do while in Nashville.

This review reflects one item, as there is no reason to eat anything else when going to Rubio's!!!!

The Shrimp and Bacon Burrito will kick your tastebuds into overdrive. 

Prepare thyself for the perfectly pan seared shrimp to the wave after wave of citrus rice, to the billows of toasted cheese! Lest ye not forget of the mounds of crispy bacon pieces or the waves of handmade guacamole and out of nowhere BAM BAM BAM Come the war drums of the Blackened Jalapeños for the Heat you desire pair that with the roasted chipotle salsa and the creamy chipotle sauce and get ready to rock!

Don't waste your time going here, very disappointed. I ordered an iced tea, tasted like mold, I asked for a Pepsi instead. I ordered a short-stack with 2 eggs & bacon, but before that my wife received her soup and they brought out warm rolls as most diners do. While the waitress was taking another patrons order, she walked over to our table and said, you won't care if I give 2 of these butters to the other table will you. She put her hands into the bread basket to grab butter packets, um gross. Why couldn't she go grab butters from salad bar that just 2ft away.. My wife ordered scallops with mashed potatoes and Brussel sprouts. The order came out and it was the saddest plate of scallops I've ever seen and gave her broccoli, not she ordered. The waitress said, oh sorry and didn't get the Brussels. I'm usually not the kind of person to make a seem if not happy with my food, unless undercooked. Needless to say, this is a waste of a local restaurant. I give a 2 star, only cause the short stack was pretty decent.

This space is awesome! It is entirely outdoors (to my knowledge) and has awesome outdoor games on tables and on pavement/grass. The beers were a good selection and offered some Philly natives. I am giving it 3 stars because at $7/cup i thought it was a little steep. even $6 i think is more reasonable. Our service wasn't the best. there the food comes out when it's ready, typical for a biergarten. Two of my friends' food came out first, no problem, me and my other friend ordered the same thing, the tacos, and were told they'd be out shortly. only mine came out and it took another 15 minutes for my friend to get hers because eventually we asked about it. overall a great time but i wouldn't eat here again.

My group had a meeting here this morning and I was excited to finally stop in. The space was cool and there's a great variety of vendors in the space. 

This was a great place for an informal meeting and we saw a few other groups meeting as well. 

There was free parking out front along Gent street and paid parking in the lot across the street.

Only a few places were open on a Thursday morning so I'd love to stop in again when everything is open.

Oh man where to start? Pretty much treie everything here and it's all trash!! Worst thing they could have done was take away the steak taco and change it with Philly style shaved "beef" if that's what that is lol the most nastiest steak taco ever..taste like DOG food!! The ground beef..nope don't do it that nastiest blandest taco meet you will ever taste. Then to top it off you have the absolute worst and laziest staff ever as well. Old lady Susan just sits there doing nothing, manager Casey could care less about your experience and the dog food they serve!! Just avoid this place Tijuana flats is much better!! Plus Tijuana doesn't smell like poop inside nor is hit inside as of the AC doesn't work!! Hot mess!!

When it comes to meat, Martin's in Reading Terminal Market does NOT mess around. Fresh and reasonably priced, Martin's really does have quality meats. I was impressed with the multitude of cuts available at this well-known butcher from beautiful roasts, classic cuts of steak, to chops and osso bucco galore. Even more impressive were their selections of freshly made sausages. If only I was able to take some home with me on the plane!

Absolutely amazing !! Clean professional and very welcoming ! I made an appointment and was seen right away . I brought in pictures of the shape and design and received exactly what I wanted !! If your thinking about it just give them a try . Make an appointment they will text you a confirmation and weekday mornings are probably best for walk ins. (If that's something they offer)

I was skeptical as I turned onto 9th Street and saw a mile-long line of people waiting to get into the Starlight Ballroom for the Ting Tings show. To my surprise, once the line started moving, we were at the doors in no time. 

Once inside, I was immediately a fan of the venue, which reminded me of the roller rinks from my childhood. Circular half-booths lined the sides of the darkened room, neon light fixtures dangled from the ceiling and hot dogs spun on wire grates at the snack bar. The bar area was relatively large and the lines moved quickly.  Although I didn't see one, and I can't imagine that there was a need for it on such a mild night, the smell of a lit fireplace filled the air.   

Expecting the worst, we inquired about beer costs. That was when I heard the magical words, "two dollar PBRs." Oh hellllllllls yeah! I got that party started. 

The show itself far exceeded my expectations. The sound quality was great and there was plenty room to dance. The crowd was friendly and it seemed like everyone was just out to have a good time. The only issue was that the room temperature skyrocketed once everyone got moving. I felt like I was dancing in hell and at any point I might look over and see John Candy in a devil costume, laughing maniacally, from that scene in Planes, Trains & Automobiles. On the upside, I didn't pass out and I'm pretty sure I worked off the fried green beans from earlier that evening. Win-win!

We had breakfast at Olga's and it was just okay. The hash browns were weird, there were no onions and they were like mashed potatoes with some crispy outside pieces. Not worth eating. I got 2 eggs with ham and the ham was so small. Won't go back.
If you looked at me after eating this croissant, you'd think I just tore up the entire thing into little pieces and scattered pieces of flake on my shirt. This shit is that flaky.

Unfortunately for everyone else, sorry folks, but I feel a little better knowing that I am not the only one having a nightmare relationship with these goons.  I too have had many orders cancelled for no reason.  I received an email notification for each of them stating that the meds were being shipped.  After waiting a week or so I would check my account only to find out that it had been cancelled and no follow-up email sent to let me know.  And they were meds that I was already about to run out of.  My doctor would then have to resend the script and then provide me with an "emergency" script to hold me over until the full amount arrived.

I work overseas so trying to time out receiving the prescriptions while at home is important.  On one occasion I was overseas and updated my account with a temporary address weeks in advance.  But ES sent them to my home address instead.  It took over a month for them to finally ship the meds to my overseas address.

The iPhone app they have worked for a bit and was handy.  Now I can no longer view the prescription information.  When I select the link it tells me I have no payment information.  Funny thing is I pay nothing for the prescriptions anyways.

My newest issue with them now is that when I log onto the website nothing but general information appears.  Under the Mange Your Prescriptions tab I am allowed to do a general search for medications.  A good feature if I wanted to look up a random med but nothing that shows my prescriptions or order history.  The only information that pertains to me is My Account information.  This is simply my contact email address, phone number, home address and that general type of information.

As I mentioned I pay nothing for the prescriptions I have with Express Scripts.  They were great in the beginning but are worthless now.  I am done with them and will just pay out of pocket from here on out.  Sorry this was so long but I wanted the years worth of bad business out there.

I am all about gourmet pizza!  

My husband and I ordered two medium pies and ate them both, ouch!  They were great, but I would not drive out of my way to eat here in the future.  I can understand why someone in the neighborhood would think it was great.  We had the Pizza Sophia, which was just ok.  But, the Pistachio Pie was amazing.  The pairing of the rosemary with the pistachio was excellent.  This is the pie that I would recommend to anyone trying this place for the first time.

I am not going to delve further into why I was not amazed by the pizza, because the people here take themselves waaaaay to seriously and I would hate to be the one responsible for a suicide attempt.

5 stars for ambiance+location
4 stars for service (although perhaps it was because they were super busy)
4 stars for food. 

Tonkatsu ramen, a little too spicy and it overshadows the flavour of the broth, noodles seemed a little on the small side. I prefer Ikkuyu's ramen up north, or even Yamato's on grant and 1st, but again because of the stellar location and the ramen being pretty good I would definitely reorder if I got ever got the craving for it downtown. If they fixed the spiciness or gave an option to have it spicy or not that would be perfect!

Rolls: were good here, i notice they dont jam pack a lot of rice in the rolls which is why some people may think the portion sizes here are smaller than usual. 

Nigiri: expensive for what you get. I believe we paid 5.5 for each order of nigiri. 

Chirashi Bowl: best thing ever. I am coming back just for that. 

Overall I like this place, and I am definitely coming back

I have to agree with one of the other reviewers that this place is over-hyped, when it comes to the food. The staff is very friendly and they were very prompt but the portion size of my meal just didn't seem to be a good value for the price (Jerk Shrimp, roughly $17 with tax for 6 shrimp). The taste of the food was average, in my opinion.

I was beyond excited to try Banh Mi Boys for this Yelp Elite event. I have been hearing incredible things about them for years now, so I figured it was about time I went! 

When I arrived at 11:45am, they were already out of a lot of things, which was a bummer (and surprising because it was still pre-lunch rush!). 

From the Elite menu, I ordered the Tofu Spring Rolls and Grilled Shrimp Banh Mi. Both were pretty good! My complaint is that the "grilled" shrimp was definitely not grilled and there wasn't much flavor in the spring rolls. But, once I added the peanut dipping sauce and sriracha, that changed! I hope to go back and try some different things next time so I can get more of a sense of what they have to offer!

Literally like 20 minutes after i wrote a bunch of mean things about this business they called me and said they were in ny building. I have since received my package, and none of it is missing, it was obviously handled with care, and I am glad that even after a month long delay, they still managed to keep it in the system and not just have it destroyed. I spoke too soon, and that was an honest error on my behalf. My deepest apologies goes out to Uni Express, and thank you for making sure my parcel made it to me safely :)

Not one to complain, but this one is not good. I recently visited this office with my wife. After the visit we were told our insurance did no cover services rendered. We then paid the full amount that we were told and said to be given a discount.

We walked out and a few weeks later got an invoice for 8 dollars, after 3 calls and being on hold forever they told me to forget the 8 dollars. A week later we got an invoice for $80.00 and after being transferred around, being told they call back and never did I continue to call and 6 days later I found someone to tell me that it was a lab fee and it was out of their hands. All I wanted was for an explanation the day of service that this was possibly going to be separate to the office visit. Sorry to say I don't like being mislead.  Never calling me back hurts. Never again will I step foot in a Women's Care? They don't CARE!!!

The restaurant is beautiful, and a great date spot, ambience wise. But overall it can't compete with others in the area. We ordered three small plates. One that amazed us, one that was ok and one that was awful. The fish crudo was just incredible. A beautiful dish, very well balanced with fresh ingredients. The burata was ok, not incredibly flavorful but we ate it all. The chicken liver was just awful. The moment we bit into the toast, we knew something was wrong with it. 

Overall we found it to be pretty expensive for the meal. Two glasses of wine and two apps (we sent the chicken liver back) came out to over $50.

Whaaaaa? Can you say amazing? 
We ordered the shrimp and grits, which was incredibly good. And the burger and fries which were delicious. We got the moisture and bacon appetizer which was spectacular. It was all very very good and the service was fantastic and quick. It's in a great location, we get to sit outside because the weather was a little cool. Loved it!

The bracket that's to hold the ironing board....oh, look, when I hung the board it came out of the wall and the board hit me....and water stain...cause the damn iron leaked and really didn't work.....THEN....the ankle deep water in  tub cause drain didn't work....#isitmonday. I forgot to mention there was hair on the sink and trash in trash can too...... Oh IHG look out.......

Came here with a friend to try the renowned pearl shots but was ultimately disappointed. The shots were overpowering and difficult to swallow for us and the table next to us. Nevertheless, the service was so friendly and the atmosphere made the night memorable. The P Diddy Magic was a very good drink - I would come back for it.

I popped by on my way home to pick up some empanadas because I wanted to try the new vegan one. 

The Vegana, which I've had before, is very good with quinoa, peppers, onions, cheese, and spinach. The Hakuna Batata is also yummy, with sweet potatoes, spinach, and shallots. Of course I ordered extra sauce and had lots left over to use on other things. It's really delicious.

One day, I'll make the time to dine on their cute outdoor patio.

Again, damn you Yelp and your non-half stars. A 3.5 for me. High for the beer, 3 for the food and service.

We arrived around 5:50 on a Saturday night and were told 40 minutes for a table for 2. Okay. We snagged a corner at the bar and crammed in. It was hard to get the bartender's attention considering we were not 5 people back. I had a beer in the time the fiance had two, and forty minutes had gone by. K - the place was packed. Good soundtrack going, sort-of friendly crowd. He checked in with the hostess. I could see her make a motion of flipping her pages and saying "we will find you!" ...

He finishes beer #2 and we are really hungry. Finally get the bartender to bring us food menus because other people at the bar are also tired of waiting for a table. Then the gal comes to us and asks if we still want a table (at about the one hour mark). She ushered me off because boy had to close the tab. I had to text Pat where I was so he could find me. Pretty cluster f. 

We were seated by the front window which was nice, also chilly. We were so hungry so ordered ASAP. Got the Monk's Mussels which were VERY plentiful and good. Very comforting, especially on a cold night. I wish it came with more bread to sop up the broth at the bottom. The frites that came with were a nice touch and that mayo was divine. Boy ordered a fish dish that should have been less expensive considering that was by no means a fresh catch but he was satisfied.

The waitress forgot a beer I ordered so I had to ask three times, and one of our water glasses was cracked and never replaced. The place was kind of too busy to relax... or maybe I just hadn't had enough beer. I had two, my first delish but my second was the Flemish Sour and that just wasn't for me... tasted like cherry Nyquil through and through. 

So - I'd be back earlier in the day for a late lunch and beers for sure. But not prime time.

A hidden restaurant in Harahan in a small strip mall.  Plus it doubles as a small grocery with a deli counter...  Quite a few 4 seat tables with black and whited checkered table clothes.  Fairly full at lunch time.  Place your order at the counter and it is brought to your table.  Just tell if it is for here or to go.

In addition to the regular menu, there are also daily lunch specials M-F.  All specials are served with bread and (salad, veggie, or dessert).  My favorites are their Meatloaf w/ Baked Macaroni and the roast beef plate.  You also order the roast beef as a sloppy poorboy.  

They don't take credit cards, but do take checks.

Second time I ate here but its been a while because I felt the place was grossly overrated due to Guy F.  coming here for Triple D.  I hate to say it but it was the same.  The place was packed and the food was just OK.  No need to come back since there are too many other places to go that are so much better especially since there was an hour wait!!

Wow, I was impressed with Vernick Coffee Bar, and I only had their coffee and a baked good (so far at least)!  A major positive for me is that it is located extremely close to my office, which also makes it very dangerous.  I came here and to the Comcast Technology Center for the first time and overall, loved the look and ambiance of the space.  It was fairly large and they had tables to sit/stay and drink/eat your coffee and baked goods, as well as actual tables to order food. 

I ordered the "lighter" drip coffee and the lemongrass ginger scone and my friend who went with me ordered the same coffee and the gluten-free peanut butter cookies (he's gluten-free).  I really liked their coffee and I think they brew it there themselves.  The scone was absolutely delicious, especially if you like both ginger and lemon.  The combination was even better, and the scone actually had small pieces of crystallized, candied ginger inside, which I really enjoyed.  My friend also said the gluten-free peanut butter cookies were really good! 

I will definitely be back for lunch and several more coffee stops!

My like-affair with Dutch Bros started on a re-route trip to Sacramento.  I was excited that the chain would be coming to Reno. 

The service is always over the top.  It's kinda weird to have them run to your car to take your order. 

My 3 shoots of espresso were good and at $2 its budget friendly.   

Food options are slim muffin tops and granola bars.   They offer Dutch Mafia cards - frequent coffee buyers... fill up the card and get one free.  

If I'm in the area, I'd pop in again.   Not sure if I'd make a special trip.

Wow, fast food is supposed to be a little faster than sitting in a restaurant and ordering right?  I've been in the drive thru for 10 minutes so far and I an still in front of the ordering box.  I just left the drive-through Lane, Burger King lost my business.

We were looking for a vegetarian Po-boy sandwich, but no dice, so we found this place along the way.

Thank goodness they cater to vegetarians, as we were scouring the city for a place to eat. 

We found it very homey, but it felt a tad dirty. I felt at home if that makes any sense.

The service was good and the vibe of the place was laid back and communal. 

The (soul) food was good but nothing to write home about. 
It worked in a pinch! 

This was part of our world-wind tour (we had less then 24 hours) of New Orleans.

I'd love to visit again, when we had more time to discover the city in it's entirety.

OHHHH SoBou... this was truly the perfect first meal in New Orleans. 

The menu is tremendous. Creative small plates, succulent big bites, and one hell of a cocktail list (oh, also, the wine dispensers are genius). I enjoyed the Georgia O'Keefe which combines many of my favorite ingredients - Cathead honeysuckle vodka, elderflower, hibiscus, citrus, and of course, some nice bubbly cava. Still, it was REALLY hard to choose a libation - I was so intrigued by so many of them (lookin' at you Karmic Alarm Clock: cajun spiced rum, Cynar,
curry-caramel syrup, cold brew coffee).

On the food end, kicking off the meal with sweet potato beignets was nothing short of blissful... especially when said beignets are accompanied by foie gras fondue and chicory coffee ganache. My yellowfin tuna was cooked perfectly and extremely well complemented by sticky sesame farro.

Really no complaints - amazing food, company and service - the recipe for a fine dining experience, indeed.

I was surprised to find this place so empty of an evening, but it made for GREAT service and attention and quiet atmosphere!
Speaking of atmosphere, I LOVE the lighting and ambiance of the interior. We were promptly taken to our seat, and attended to with wonderful attention!
Large and extent wine list and plenty of mouth watering menu options, except when it comes to options for children. Though I did appreciate the server being quick to suggest their mac and cheese offered with only butter as an option, though not as balanced/healthy of an option I would have chosen for my child. So I was sure to chose my meal based on things I could share with her.

What we had:
House salads - $7.75 pretty good, but over priced for my liking

Duck-Duck-Hash-$27.50 = Duck Confit-Sweet Potato Hash, Roasted Brussels Sprout, Blackberry-Jalapeno Jelly - WOW, flavors were AMAZING!!! (Price wasn't too bad for duck)

Shrimp Risotto -$28.75 = Shrimp, Black-Eyed Peas, Green Tomato Relish, Chipotle Cream - Tasty and good! good size shrimp (maybe a little overpriced)

The Meridian Burger-$22.50 = Gruyere Cheese, Dewig Bacon, Onion Ring, Tomato Marmalade, Garlic Mayo, Fries - Delicious and very juicy burger for sure... but $23 for ANY burger seems too high!

Dessert of Mini Cinnamon Sugar Donuts-$7.75 = Malted Coffee Cream - suggested to us from the server, and through we considered passing on dessert, glad we went with this option, freshly made and hot donuts with this coffee cream were fantastic!

Over all, all food items were DELICIOUS with fantastic mixes of flavors that complemented the others wonderfully!! Service was very attentive and good.
BUT our cons were 1. not child friendly and 2. price seems a bit high... yes the food was amazing but I would have to say I have had comparable meals at lower prices around Indy! If prices were a little more comparable, I may be back more often!!

Omg this place totally gave me the lavish feeling I wanted. Staff is more than awesome and the owner is really friendly. Definitely coming back to this new place. So glad I came across it and gave it a try.

First time here. When I arrived with no appointment, I was able get seen right away. I asked for a pedicure. So I was shown the nail polish on the wall and told to grab any pedicure chair and they would be right with me. There was 2 nail techs and what appeared to be a owner/manager. So the young lady (Yalena) was very attentive in doing my pedicure. I asked if they offered different services and she said oh yes and gave me the brochure. I told her that this was my first time. She then asked if I wanted something different, I said no basic pedi is good. We talked and she did a great job with my dry skin on my pinkie toe. Not a really good massage but I guess you pay for that. Overall the salon is clean, nice atmosphere and the ppl seemed nice. So why not 5 stars, well when I cashed out the cashier (a different lady) I forgot to mention my 10% off check-in thru Yelp, and when I did, she didn't offer anything. I will return for Yalena's services keeping in mind to mention my coupons or discounts upfront.

Great burger place! The meat is FRESH! And trust me you will know this with the first bite! We later commented how fresh their burgers tasted and were told they get their meat local within 72 hours of processing. Now that's farm to table. They have many burger creations to choose from but honestly I think just a standard American style would stand in its own. The fried pickles...best evahhhh!!! Fresh cut fries were good too. Spicy margarita hit the spot.

VERY disappointed. Made a prenatal appointment one day in advance and the business called less than 6 hours before the appointment (two hours after they opened for the day) and cancelled my session. I've been extremely stressed and was very much looking forward to this massage in advance of the holidays. I'm willing to bet if I had cancelled with 6 hours notice, I would have had to pay a cancellation fee. You should always have staff on call for situations like this. And I was set to become a member and everything! No thank you.

***UPDATE: Since posting this review, they have reached out several times, including TEXTING ME. I did not give anyone from this business permission to text me. Since when is this OK?

This is the opposite kind of service I would expect from a business that promotes relaxation and wellness. I told them over the phone when they initially cancelled that I would go elsewhere for my massage, and they continue to call/text me and invade my privacy. This is very poor behavior from a business.

Another update: 

This business continues to text (again, without my permission), and at this point made it clear that they are only doing so because I've left a Yelp review. 

A couple hours after they cancelled my appointment, I received an appointment reminder. Yes! They had the audacity to remind me of the appointment that they cancelled. I called after receiving the reminder to confirm that they did, indeed, cancel my appointment. Yet, the appointment is still reflected in their scheduling software. 

I'm really appreciative of the emotional distress they're causing me (a stressed pregnant lady), when the whole reason I made appointment there in the first place is to try to relieve stress. It's really getting me in the holiday spirit.

I finally became a card-carrying NPL member...took me long enough.

Only having visited the Green Hills Branch for a meeting, I found this branch to be quite lovely.

The location is great and easy to access, with a good amount of parking avail. An area behind the building hosts a gated playground, which I believe is only open during this branch's operating hours.

Inside, there are several kiosks for checking materials in, alongside two desks that allow for human interaction too. The building is spacious, with an airy feel to the architecture (which feels like a mini version of the downtown Seattle Public Library).

Plenty of seating lines the perimeter of the library, including meeting space and private study rooms. WiFi is readily available (full bars!), in addition to many computers available for public internet use. 

A fan of NPR's "Putumayo's World Music Hour", I was pleased to find a fairly large collection of the "Putumayo Presents" CD's, which I promptly checked out for my listening enjoyment.

Be sure to take advantage of the online services, which includes a catalog of all items available at each branch. If you find an item you'd like to check out in another branch, just submit a request. NPL will coordinate bringing that item to your branch for you, so you don't have to drive across town to check it out. Now that's service!

The manager Leeann at this location has no customer service skills. And no knowledge of obviously business customers she threaten to close my account because In their system they could not verify me and I'm still trying to understand how you cannot verify the president of the company... I've provided that my ID as well as my credit card that showed my name in my company but yet they could not verify me it took them over an hour to figure out how to service me and then she threaten to close my account becauseShe didn't know how to do her job and she was creating chaos instead of creating solutions and she was providing miss in formed information to the customer like I don't understand how she is a manager when she treats customers like they are beneath her and her staff like are you kidding me.She continues to talk over customers not allowing them to say anything without correcting her and letting her know like let them finish so she could literally help them but yet she don't want to help them she just want to create chaos and tell them oh well they'll probably cancel your account or they'll do this oh no it does it makes it oh wait come on lady help the customer understand what's going on stop being such an ass.

Two years ago our pug needed emergency surgery for bladder stones. Dr. Kinsey performed the surgery and I have to say she was absolutely amazing. She was very informative and definitely took her time to explain everything in detail. She kept us in the loop through our dogs entire stay and even answered questions for us after our dogs discharge. Fast forward to this past week. Our dog has needed yet another surgery for intervertebral disc disease. The first vet that saw us suggested we go to university of penn or another facility for our dog to be evaluated. Thankfully she reached out to Dr. Kinsey because once again, Dr. Kinsey comes to the rescue and walks me through the benefits/risks of the procedure. Due to the amount of information she provided, I was able to make an educated decision. My disappointment has not been with the medical care my fur baby has received, but with support staff. I never received a call from anyone telling me my dog was out of recovery. Now mind you, I don't need a call from Dr. Kinsey every time. Just some update would've been nice. I have a daughter in college and a husband who was away waiting for updates. I had nothing to give them. I ended up on hold for over an hour before I got in the car and had to actually drive to the facility and request and update. The woman who I spoke to was very apologetic and requested the doctor come speak to me. While I waited I heard one of receptionists tell another client that they could not accommodate a quality of life visit for an apparent very sick cat. The receptionist was not private about the conversation and she was matter of fact. It absolutely broke my heart to watch this woman walk out the door with a cat that she didn't know what to do with. Heart wrenching. As a business owner, I'm careful to write negative reviews. What really upset me was my last interaction with the support staff. One the third night of my pets stay, I called for an update. Once again, I was on hold for over an hour. Had to drive up again. This time I had to interact with the same receptionist that sent the woman with the sick cat out the door. I will be honest, I wasn't as thrilled having to drive up there a second time for an update so I was not in a great mood, but she acted as though she couldn't be bothered and that I was an inconvenience for being concerned for my dog. She told me to have a seat then yelled across the waiting room that the doctor would call me. The doctor did call and I did receive an update. My frustration really boils down to how much this facility has taken on. They're not handling the volume well. Dr. Kinsey obviously works very hard and has very long days. I don't fault her. I fault the owners for not seeing this and making necessary changes. The owners in my opinion are making themselves look greedy and continue to grow a business that is obviously very short handed. I wish I could believe this was COVID related but two years ago it was the same. You cannot be an animal hospital, pharmacy, mobile practice and a regular veterinarians office and properly triage all patients and give them the care they need. I wouldn't go to the ER for sore throat or for a vaccine but yet this is what they are doing for our pets. The entire operation has to be revamped. How about live wait times on the website? Separating the hospital from regular well visits. Specific medication pick up times. Staff training for how to properly interact with clients. When you spend $9800 you don't want to pushed away as an inconvenience and that's just what happened. As for the girl at the front desk with the tattoos and red hair, she doesn't belong at the front desk as the face of your company. She obviously doesn't respect your clients. I have a hard time believing it was just me or the woman with the cat that she treated the way she did. I've now spent approximately 17k at this establishment and it is extremely disheartening to be treated like crap by support staff especially considering the amount of money I've spent. Dr. Kinsey is and has been amazing! Owners, you need to figure out what direction you want to go and give it 100%. This Jack of all trades operation isn't working. Feel free to call me. No need to ask me to email you. I've given you enough information in this review that I know you can figure out just who I am, so you can contact me to resolve the issue!
Very friendly service :) I always have fun going to the car wash and this one was extra fun like a roller coaster

The kiosks weren't working and they were severely understaffed. The girl behind the counter was very busy and seem to put out that she had to actually take an order from a human being. We waited probably 20 to 30 minutes for food it was delicious because Shake shack is the bomb, however they gave us paper straws with our incredibly thick shakes and basically the straw just became part of a shake so that was kind of a drag. If you don't mind putting up with a bunch of BS to get food then go for it.

Do NOT become one of Dr Sheif El-Asyouty's patients. From the very first time I contacted him, the only relationship we had was about money. Before I even saw him once, he asked me to complete and send back many forms. It's only after he checked my insurance benefits that he gave me a call to schedule an appointment. I have seen many mental health professional before and after him and never felt so intensely that he only saw my as a dollar bill rather than a patient. For very unfortunate reason, I wasn't able to make it to my first appointment and Dr El-Asyouty charged me $100 and sent the bill to a collection agency! If you need to see a Dr, choose anyone but Dr El-Asyouty.

I have read a lot of recent reviews and I have to agree with the negative statements. From taking forever and also how confusing their process is.  They keep passing the paperwork on to other people.  Too many people involved!  I wouldn't use them!

Would have had a great night with my girlfriend if not for the obnoxious, rude, and disrespectful bouncers. There was ZERO need to make comments about her body. Thanks for ruining a both of our moods. Drinks were also very overpriced. Shame.

I recommend Mt. Zion Moving to all my friends and family. Norman and Prince were incredible to work with. These guys worked through every obstacle and made sure I was 100% satisfied. For my next move, I will call them again. 

*fast 
*careful
*timely 
*fair price

All downtown coffeeshops were closed, so went here. Got the nitro cold brew. No ice, slightly below room temperature, and zero "nitro". Tasted like very average coffee forgotten on the counter. Wife got an iced peppermint mocha that was 90% ice and tasted terrible.
Both were smalls, and bill was over $10. What a joke.

My 2 kids go to the school and this is truly amazing school and Christian school I love it , kids love ! If you have kids this is the Scougle send them to all staff all teachers and the whole environment it's friendly 
AAA+

I want to thank the team at Rhythm Dodge Jeep for helping me pick out my 2020 Dodge Challenger Scat Pack Widebody. I absolutely love the car and the team took great care of me. I took the car in on trade and there were a couple issues from the previous owner and these guys went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure everything was perfect. I'm grateful for their help and I look forward to being a customer for many years to come.

Normally, they do a decent job but recently it seems like they just gong don't care as much any more. Hopefully it changes before my wife and I decide to take our dog elsewhere. Waited outside as they ignored my car my for over 10 minutes and they took 13 other cars let them skip right past. Maybe they just have a personal issue with me. The shift working closing on 4/8/20 Needs to be trained better. I expected more from this company.

Omg this place is a gem!  Fresh breakfast made to order with a great menu!  Want a little adult beverage start to the day...they have you covered with mimosas etc!  Want fancy...try the crab cake Benedict!  Specials like Pumpkin Spice hotcakes should not be overlooked!  Excellent coffee and smiling faces on the staff...a great start to your day!

This was the WORST experience I have ever had with a business. I purchased a groupon and ended up not being covered in their area -- the deal was 30 miles from her PART of Nashville (Madison) not metro area (which should have been within range). When I tried to contact the owner to either pay more or get a refund, she simply would not return my calls and would only email sporadically. She was so delayed that I didn't even have the option to get a refund thru groupon because she wasn't timely in letting me know she wouldn't work wth me. I was more than willing to pay extra but she wouldn't even return my emails or calls even though I had paid her. She would tell me to call at a certain time of day and then wouldn't answer or return my voicemails. What a roller coaster and a BAD businesswoman. Not impressed. I am an owner of a small business myself and this is the worst communication and customer service experience I have ever had. DO NOT do business with her.

I was super appreciative of the customer service o received when getting a watch battery and ring appraisal from Ben.  I've been going to Harland Watch repair for 5 years and have always left feeling the customer service was above and beyond!!

Appointment for car maintenance made, garage work done, customer service professional, and great place to have any Honda, Toyota or Subaru repair, oil changes, etc work done. Never disappointed with their service.... But do make an appointment as this is a busy place!

I recently organized a party at Skyzone.  The entire experience was AMAZING!!!!  The staff was attentive and made sure that everything was taken care of.  The family was able to enjoy the party and the logistics were spot on all day.  I would strongly recommend this facility for any event!!  Even the adults had a great time!!  The best part was that the party was right on schedule!!!  I cannot thank the staff enough.....really top notch!

Had a terrible experience here a few weeks ago. Yes I waited to post a review as I contacted Fellini's first and wanted to give the owner or manager a chance to rectify the issue but no one made any attempt to contact me OR make the situation right.
It was Veteran's day when we went to Fellini's with my brother who is a vet and he specifically chose this establishment. We went with his wife, myself, him, and my three nephews.
When we arrived we saw that there was a large party of about 30 people that were on one half of the restaurant. I didn't think this would be an issue with our service or food quality but it was.
First the server took our bottles of wine from the table for around 20 minutes until we flagged down another server to retrieve our bottles. I don't know why they were taken off the table in the first place and not opened in front of us right away but we let that go.
We ordered the calamari appetizer, 2 seafood medley's, a penne dish, and for the kids grilled chicken with a side of pasta and a chicken cutlet for my nephew.
The calamari took over 45 minutes to arrive and was poorly plated, no side salad was on the dish (which the dish always comes with), and tasted greasy and was all tentacles and no rings. Very disappointing.
The kids food arrived with the appetizer. My nephew loved his grilled chicken but let me emphasize that it was two very thin pieces of chicken and a small side of pasta. We were charged a whopping $19 which would have been fine if this dish was adult portions but it was not. My other nephew had a few pieces of chicken cutlet on a plate and the cost was also $19 and it wasn't an adult portion. If you don't offer kid meals then the least you could do is give the kids adult portion to justify the cost.
Our 3 meals for the adults didn't arrive for an hour after the appetizer. It was ridiculous. We received no apology for the wait in food. If you can not be properly staffed when you have a large party in the restaurant then you should close the restaurant for the party.
My sister and I were served the seafood medley which we normally love despite the $35 cost because it's delicious and loaded with seafood. It wasn't this time. The dish had cold crab meat on top, no shrimp or calamari as mentioned in the description and just a few clams and mussels. 
When the bill arrived, my sister tried to nicely speak with the manager who couldn't care less about our concerns, horrible service, and being overcharged. After being in the restaurant for close to 3 hours, the kids were miserable and we were all ready to leave. I will never return to this restaurant. Had the manager or owner contacted me a few weeks ago, I could have overlooked this experience and been back.
I've worked in the restaurant industry for over ten years so I am sympathetic to the struggles of the wait staff, chef, and pleasing customers but anytime I've had a bad experience at a restaurant the owner has always made it right. The manager/owner here didn't even care to respond to my email or give me a call.
Do better. I will not be returning, nor will my family and friends who often frequent this restaurant.

We've been here twice now, once before covid and once after. Both times the food has been very good. The menu can be a little overwhelming at first, but once you figure it out, the tacos are delicious. We also like the elote queso and chips. 

Our contactless pick up experience during covid was safe and efficient. The order was correct and on time.

I stopped by during a recent day trip to SB to bring some home with me as I was curious about their vegan empanada. Service is friendly and the order was made fresh so it took about 10 minutes to make four for me. 

They have a nice outdoor seating area and a couple of bar stools inside. Once I got back to my car, I did sneak a bite of one without any sauce (because I was quite sure I'd end up with oil and herbs all over my car) and it was piping hot and had a nice flavor. I really liked the vegan cheese they used. I ate them the next day with the sauce and that took it to a whole other level. Delicious!

Had a burger and wings and the food was good.  The staff was friendly, but the service was hap-hazard.  We were originally seated by the bar, but the volume of the country music made it so we could not talk to each other...we then moved to another room, where there was a really loud group, but it was better than the country music.  I would not go back, as I do not drink and there are places with comparable food, and better ambiance, closer to home.

I drove 30 mins to get pizza here since I'm from Illinois and have not found decent pizza here in tampa since I've arrived. I have to say, the flavors were spot on and oh so good. I took off a star because both my breaded mushrooms and the pizza crust were soggy. I even opened them both to try a bite right when I got the pizza and they were like that out of the shop, so the sogginess was not from sitting in the car. I'd still go back though, the sausage was legit Italian sausage and the cheese, sauce, and seasonings were all spectacular.

We were a large party celebrating a wedding in New Orleans and decided to book a balcony table here for brunch. The weather was perfect for sitting outdoors and we had a lovely time. The Bloody Mary's were excellent and we all enjoyed our food, especially the oyster dishes. The staff was friendly and accommodating with our food allergies and we had a great meal.
So...the people here are very nice but they have no idea how to do black hair. The woman who did my hair said they didn't have the right tools for our hair...I'm just going to stick to black salons

I was looking for a new Chiro in my area and Batson came highly recommended.  The entire staff is friendly, welcoming, knowledgeable and really care about their patients.  

My initial evaluation was thorough and the treatment plan suggested was correct for my hip injury.  Ad the end of the 8 visits recommended I was pain free and back at 100% participation at the gym and in all my outdoor activities.

At my request I started a monthly maintenance plan and that is working well.  Today was my first maintenance visit and I enjoyed the therapy, massage chair and my adjustment.  I felt like a new person when I left the clinic.  

They worked with me to design my personalized treatment plan and offered a choice of payments and discounts.  They also let me customize my plan to add some visits for the massage chairs - which I absolutely love!

I would gladly give them 6 stars if it was an option.
Good portions and your standard Chinese food fare. Easy access and quick and in a great location at Lenox village.

This was our first time here and we will come back as often as possible! We ordered way too much food and beer (nachos, tuna tostados, primo fish and square grouper tacos, and hazy IPA) and ate every single morsel! Our waitress Bobbi was amazing and super knowledgeable of the menu. She also was so sweet to us and our kids! They have live music and it's right across the street form the beach. We can't recommend this place enough. You won't be disappointed with anything on their menu!

This place has it all atmosphere, service, music, and the best Creole food in St. Louis. Their Bread Pudding is phenomenal! We had at least two employees come to are table and ask how our food and service was.

This place is sooo good that I brought 2 people with me.  Happy Hour chargrilled oysters for $18.00 a dozen will keep me coming back. I am convinced they stole Dragos Chef

But wait..  don't stop there.....the Brussels sprouts and. wings are awesome happy hour items.  I love the watermelon swirl martini

Yvonne was our waitress. As nice as my last servor.  She was very attentive and professional. Customer service all over the place. 

I ordered a Hamburger and was a little disappointed about how greasy it was. Nicholas ordered redfish and was mote than satisfied. The newbie to the place ordered the sirloin with a Caesar salad, she truly enjoyed it.   Still deserve a five star rating.

My servor from my first bisit actually remembered me and came over to say hello

And everyone I tell about Legacy who lives on the Westbank tells me " I love that place".

Do not deal with this company!!! 

While working on my my neighbors property, they did several hundred dollars worth of damage to mine and refuse to even call me back, let alone pay reparations for their damage. More specifically, while digging up my neighbors lawn, they dumped what they were digging up on my front walkway and lawn and then caused several hundred dollars worth of damage to my property finishing the job.

In other words, they used my property without my permission and damaged it while doing so. 
I have tried a number of times over thh past month and half to get someone at the company to fix my property and I have gotten nothing but silence; no one will call me back. I am extremely disappointed that they couldn't even have someone call back to apologize, let alone pay for the damages. 

I am strongly considering suing this company in small claims court for the above described actions. 

In the end, these people are awful. Do not give them your business. There are far better plumbers in the Philly region. If you value your property and your relationship with your neighbors take your business elsewhere.

I ordered the Basil Noodles with brown rice and a side of naan for pickup from Rice from their lunch special menu. The price was reasonable but not really a great deal considering the food and service.
I ordered the Basil Noodles with level 2 spiciness ("zesty") but the seasoning was very uneven. One bite was bland and the next bite brought tears to my eyes. Mixing and stirring the dish helped even out the taste somewhat. The rice was exceptionally bland (cooked without even a pinch of salt?). The naan, although small, was surprisingly the best part of the meal.
Because establishments are having difficulties hiring staff, I try to be more tolerant of slow service and staffing shortages. However, when I walked into Rice, there was one inside diner, an outside table with customers, and one patron in the bar. The only visible staff was the bartender. In the apx. 15 min. it took for the hostess to come out of the kitchen with another to-go order, three more people came in behind me and the bartender, with his one customer, never acknowledged or even looked at us. He could have at least greeted us. The staff was, like the rice, bland. It seemed they really did not want to be there and the customers were pretty much an inconvenience (except for the one guy drinking in the bar).
I will not be back any time soon.

This place is really three different places in the same space with Melrose Billiard Parlor, The Sutler Saloon and Rambler Cocktail Bar. My experience here was mainly all down in the basement bar which is Melrose Billiard Parlor and it was packed during my visit while The Sutler Saloon and Rambler Cocktail Bar didn't seem to have much going on at the time I visited.  I found it interesting they had "No Smoking" signs in here while lots of people were smoking and the smoke was hanging very thick in the basement so I couldn't stay very long as the smoke was really getting to me as a non-smoker.  This looks like it could be a cool and fun spot but if they are going to allow smoking they really have to get better ventilation in here as it was far too smoky for me in the Melrose Billiard Parlor while upstairs there didn't seem to be any smoking.  The Melrose Billiard Parlor definitely seemed to draw a much better crowd later at night and seemed to stay open later than the spaces upstairs which would have been great if it wasn't so smoky in the basement. Overall it seems like a cool spot but with so much smoke hanging around I just can't handle that.

I do quite a bit online ordering and each time I have noticed that Panda food quality is not what it used to be. Another thing is their portioning is smaller and smaller each time I get it. I used to love Panda but in all honesty I it's getting to a point where Panda Express is not one of my top choices.

this place is the absolute WORSTE! i made an appointment at 4:30 and I sat there for an hour an a half and ended up leaving. they seated other people before me AND were SO RUDE!!!! i got no apology for the inconvenience also. i did not give this place my money. dont waste your time going here. why overbook yourself if u dont have enough staff?? dumb ass hoe fuck all yall hoes smd fr.
Ordered chicken fried rice and egg roll and I have to say I'm impressed. The beautiful young lady that took my order gave great customer service definitely recommend this location.

If you're not culturally Southern, then you need to know this place is all about "Southern food." There are places that do Southern cooking far better than Vittles but at least the meat and dessert portions are large. The sides are unimpressive. Service was slow; I joked to the server that I thought they were on Central Southern Time. Then you have to wait even longer to pay at the front. Don't eat here if you are in a hurry or have anything to do within an hour.

Fire every employee in this dump. Waiting for 30 minutes at the drive through, asked 3 times "are you still there? Can you help us please?" only to have some trashy lady yell "you want to come in and make your own damn food!?!?" Get your act together, hire some decent people who won't treat people like garbage.

Came in on Friday 4/23 for dinner. At first I was happy to see that the parking lot wasn't that full because everywhere else had a pretty long wait, but I soon understood why. My server was nice enough and food was okay once I finally got it. What I noticed most though was the manager. Where we were sitting it was hard not to overhear him yelling at his staff in a very demeaning manner. I can't imagine wanting to put up with that while working, but I certainly didn't want to be privy to that while I was just trying to enjoy a mediocre meal. Before long this location is going to have a "closed due to lack of staff" sign. I felt bad for multiple employees having a front row seat for that. I can't support a restaurant that openly treats their employees like that in full view of the guests. It's unprofessional and because of this I'll be taking my money elsewhere from now on. ,

We went for the weekend lunch buffet ($17 per person) and were disappointed before we even ate. It opens at 11:30am which is a damn sham because they didn't even have the buffet set up fully until nearly 12:30pm (seriously change your hours you bums).  They had a decent amount of options, but alas, our excitement was fleeting. EVERY single curry dish was 99% watered down gravy and 1% substance. I get saving money, but this shit was nearly inedible. I could go on and on about the garbage gulab jamun, but instead I'll tell you that I spit it out. Twice. Don't waste your time or money, nothing here can be considered decent, let alone good, "kwality". 

I honest to god have no idea how this place has 4 stars, because I'd give it a zero if I could. Changing your name after a scandal doesn't improve food quality, silly me for expecting more. 


PS - as a Gujarati, your watery, dense, bland dholka was personally insulting. Don't serve shit you have no idea how to make.
They have a state of the art body shop and do excellent work on modern and classic vehicles.

tldr: do not recommend and will not have them back if I can help it.

Our house has mice and our landlord has used Dynamite in the past. They stopped by the first time, patched up a few holes and put down some poison - $300. 

A week later, we realized that there was a massive hole on the second floor they had completely missed the first time around. We called them back out to fix the issue as there were literally 20 mice in the room at one time, running around. Rich, the technician and owner, was incredibly unhappy to be there, citing a two-week policy. While that might typically work, we were literally unable to sleep from all of the mice running around!

During the appointment, Rich verbally harassed me and accused me of being a "bad customer," threatening to "never come back" and "ending the warranty." He shouted at me for 15 minutes!! Absolutely unbelievable - incredibly disrespectful and I cannot comprehend how this type of behavior is at all acceptable.

One month later, after the warranty expired, we still have mice. Not going to call them back and going to dissuade all of my friends and college students I know to avoid Rich and Dynamite, lest they also experience the verbal abuse I did.

Two stars for being timely and doing their job, sort of.

Stopped by for a burger around 2:30pm on a Tuesday. Place was empty as could be. It was my first time ordering here and I got the regular cheeseburger with a small fry. Total was $8.61 - burger was good but undercooked for my liking. Some folks like an undercooked burger but I'm not man enough for that apparently. So pro-tip - order well done if you're like me and you will have a solid burger.

Nice atmosphere too - old pictures of Reno on the walls. Very nice touch! I love Reno and photos! Staff was friendly, place was super clean.
Called around about having My tires mounted on new rims these guys wanted $100 more than Discount Tire for 4 Wheels. Rip off masters
Wonderful local coffee shop with self serve coffee, delicious homemade breakfast items, and kind service. The bedrock French toast was fantastic.

Horrible....Poor customer service! Ignorant employees! Claims that they are "so busy" when multiple employees are standing around talking to each other and not helping any customers. Need to buy an iPad. I was told that they are out of appointments to sell me anything today. They only have Genius Bar appointments. Why have a store with products to sell if you can't actually buy anything! I have tried to shop here multiple times and it's always the same foolishness. Seriously a waste of space. Don't waste your time....you stand around in here and can never get anything accomplished.

I went to look at an apartment here and Lori was so rude! I was told that by two people who previously lived at these apartments. Wow, were they right! Not only are they small, noisy, insect infested, but when the staff is rude.. You have no help to ever get anything done. Read the reviews and know you will be sorry once you move in and stuck in hell for a year! 
I'm so lucky to live in the Vintage where the staff is beyond awesome. Says a lot when my neighbors have been living at the Vintage for 5+ years and even some over 10+ years. Bet you can't find many people living there that long. It's all about the staff. So Lori, I'll stay where the staff has class and pay the extra to live in a nice place! $200 a month savings isn't worth dealing with you. Thanks anyways :)

Where to start...

Ordered a milkshake along with nuggets & fries tonight, pulled up to the drive thru to pick up my order and I saw them hand my milkshake and bag to the car in front of me. The man in there must've had it for 30 seconds or so while he looked through the contents confused until he then handed it back to the kid working the window.

I thought since there's a HIGHLY CONTAGIOUS GLOBAL PANDEMIC going on right now the least they could do is make a fresh milkshake since it's in an open air container, but when I got to the window the kid just handed it to me without even second guessing it. 

I refused to drink it because who knows if that man coughed, spit, sneezed, or fingered around in my shake or food... 

This isn't the first time this location's had less than favorable service as seen in some of the pics from previous screw-ups, but what can you expect when the place is ran by high school students...
I LOVED my nails! They did such a great job, I recommend. The laddie that did my nails were so nice and did an amazing job!

We came here today....very strange visit. Everything was rotten and disgusting. All the apples were infested with bees. They charged  10 dollars for dogs. This place has a very strange way of handling dogs on the property for -0 dollars they put a sign up with your dogs name, a sign that says "autographs with (dogs name) and give you a reserved parking space which you don't need?? Very disappointed trip. I understand they weather can effect the crops however atleast tell us there are no applies before you charge us... 1/5. Will not return.

All I can say is the airfare is cheap and the flight attendants are usually fantastic. If you want to save money and don't mind riding the Greyhound Bus of the sky, Spirit Airline is the way to go. 

Is it a horrible experience to fly Spirit, of course not, you just get no bells and whistles. This is straight up cheap transportation. They get us to our destination safely every time which is most important and we save a buck or two (yeah!). 

Don't overlook it when cheap travel is what you need.
This is best Italian I've had in Tucson. It's nothing fancy but the food is incredible. Super fresh food and hot! The bread was warm and buttery. Also had the cannoli for dessert.
Mitchel answered all my questions re my new Nest thermostat over the phone and even advised our handyman on how to install it.  I offered to pay him but he said it wasn't necessary.  Standup guy.
Nice clean mall with all the classic mall stores. Large regal theater being built. Nice food court. Large name brand anchor stores, Macy's etc

If you're looking for some good Chinese food, this is a pretty good choice. They have all the typical Chinese food options. We ordered the string beans, beef chow fun, moo shu pork, and 1/2 roast duck.

String beans were fried well and crispy on the outside - probably the best thing we ordered. The beef chow fun was just alright - didn't have as much flavor as what I'm used to but still cooked pretty well. Moo shu pork tasted just like every other moo shu pork I've had (which I guess is a good thing). The duck was also pretty good. Skin was a little fatty but so much flavor in it.

Yum!
Came here with my girlfriends twice in one day and again the next day. Amazing service every single time. Highly recommend the pineapple drink, super delicious!!!!

Sultan is true to its 5 star rating!  I enjoyed every item I got here and cannot wait to return for more.

Saksuka $8 - Grilled eggplant, tomato, onion, pepper and garlic served with fresh na'an.  Mild flavor, goes well with the na'an.

Falafel Plate $ 10 - 5 amazingly crispy falafel served on top a layer of hummus, served with na'an.  Pairs well with the Saksuka.

Lentil Soup $3 - Good flavor and texture.

Saffron Curry Vegetable $12 - Delicious curry, not spicy hot kind, loaded with green beans and other vegetables, served with basmati rice and a side of fresh tomato and onion salsa thing.

Pistachio custard - Their most popular dessert and it was yummy!  It was more of a pudding consistency, but lighter.

.|\---/|
| o_o |
.\_^_/..2021

I was in the Mall and decided to try the place. The waitress was very friendly and accommodating, no masks were worn by anyone in there including myself for those wondering if they wear masks.  We ordered two smoked Philly cheesesteaks. The meat,  was little bits and pieces like they scraped up the bottom of the tray they keep it in, and it was bland.. The cheese was skinned over on top and the sandwich, was not hot at all. I told the waitress and she said she'll mention it to the cook. That was it, no mention of remaking the sandwiches. The beer was good. I wouldn't go back, wasn't worth 36.00 for those sandw iches. Could have gotten a better sandwich at a deli for a lot less.

I am writing to express my disapproval with the Cooper facility at 2001 E Route 70.  I arrived at the facility at 7:40 PM on Monday November 1.  I was suffering from a broken finger and bleeding..  When I approached the desk the receptionist indicated no patients were being accepted. At first I was told I could not be helped because of a glitch with the computer system.    When I complained I was informed that Cooper is a business and closes at 8 pm.  I arrived within 15 minutes of closing.  Well as a customer I will never be doing business with anything connected with Cooper in the future,  I  then drove to Lourdes Urgent care on Brace road and arrived at 7:55.  They accepted and treated me.

First time getting my car tinted and the staff was super helpful and showed me all my different options. Lifetime warranty and speed were amazing. The whole tinting took about 40-50 minutes. I was in and out during my lunch break.

Fantastic place for lunch. This place is a little hidden but glad I found it. This place specializes in spanish style tapas and have a large variety of menu items to try. I tried the cod rellenos, mushroom estafado, and the shrimp pil pil. The shrimp pil pil is more like an appetizer but an amazing one. you get shrimp soaked in wine, butter, and herbs with a baguette to eat with. The flavor is amazing! The mushroom dish surprised me. I was expecting little mushrooms or just the cheap kind but they had large chunks of good mushroom. The sauce had a little heat and it was fantastic. The cod rellenos was good however I wish it had more cod. I felt it was more filling than anything. Still tasty and very well put together. Overall I was very impressed and the server is great and very friendly.

Fabrika is a new restaurant and during covid they basically built an inside, outside. As if that isn't area is dope enough, the actual inside is even more popping. Just check out the bathroom you won't regret it! I think we tried every cocktail there, fabrika spritz being my favorite but they were all decent. For apps we had the octopus, the pork belly, the burrata and the bolognese. I wasn't crazy about the burrata, but the rest were outstanding. The pork belly melted in my mouth, you could taste the freshness of the homemade pasta. Although the bolognese is not a standard appetizer it is a must try!  I may have enjoyed the potatoes more than the octopus. For entrees we "family styled" it as usual. Lamb chops, shrimp risotto and flank steak. The lamb had great flavor, the mashed potatoes had flawless consistency and the risotto with the shrimp was just wow! The risotto with the shrimp was much better than the risotto that was served with the lamb chops.The steak itself was pretty good but not as good as the lamb chops. The menu has already changed since my visit a month ago and I believe they're open inside so I cannot wait to try again. The server even let us try some homemade peanut butter ice cream the pastry chef was experimenting with !!! I'm excited to go back, eat inside and see what lm sure will be fabulous show. This place will be a total vibe in the summer especially if they participate in sips! This was a closer to a 4.25 out of 5

Heard about a great seafood restaurant in Harahan so went to check it out on a Friday night. This place is not a secret to the locals. It was packed! We were able to get a bucket of beer while we waited for a table to open up. It was probably an hour or so wait. Luckily, they had a band so the time passed quickly.

The food here is good. It seems like there are 100 items on the menu so do some research before you go. There are some interesting creations like The Volcano which is what I ordered. An upside down fried taco shell with boiled shrimp inside, crab salad on top, drizzled with at least two Asian style sauces, and throw in some seared tuna for good measure. This thing is a beast. The best part about it was actually the seared tuna. This as actually something they are famous for having won awards at the Oak Street Po-Boy festival for a seared tuna po-boy as well as a couple other exotic creations. Even after polishing off this giant plate and tasting off other plates at the table, I still had to order the dessert. The fried bread pudding was fantastic. Glad I ordered it even if I did have to be rolled out at the end.

All the staff there were very friendly and wore masks. Customers wearing masks were hit or miss both inside and out.

What a cool place!! I have a whole new respect for improv. I was laughing throughout the entire show! The comedians are hilarious and you can tell they love what they do. The concessions offered food items from popcorn to hot pockets, and they had beer, wine, and liquor. Definitely will be returning regularly and recommending to people! Go check it out and support local!
Love meat? Try the surprise plate for two. It's a wonderful combination of Lamb, Beef, and Chicken.

My first foray in Philadelphia was almost 10 years ago... Many a date were had at quaint little byos that the city was known for... 10 years later, it seems that the phl byo scene isn't quite as flourishing and I'm puzzled by how I can eat great food and drink too much wine at a decent price again.

Enter helm. It reminds of the days of yore. The food is written on chalkboards. Tables are close together. The staff reads your tweets about your #oldladydinner and ask you about your life. The food is amazing to the point where I asked for more bread to dunk into my sauce. Each course was better than the last and the dessert was big enough to share for 2 (although the weakest part of the meal I think).

Happily I'll be back with my bottle of wine to enjoy a lovely dinner.

I had a negative interaction here last week.  I was so upset that I completed my Yelp review from the car before leaving.  I have now changed my previous review from 2 stars to 5, based on 2 things.

First, without reading the review, the owner found my number and called me then messaged me to apologize and he refunded an item on my order.  Then today (5 days later) the lady I was speaking of sent me a message and expressed such genuine regret and says she apologized to her staff and values them so much. She has been bothered by the interaction all week.  

We all have bad days and this is such a small interaction in the big world.  I am relieved to forgive her.  She is obviously a wonderful person who had some stress at the time.

I still don't agree with charging a convenience fee for take out, but the service recovery was 1000 percent above anything I expected and I have respect and gratitude for them.

Please try eating here.  It is BY FAR the best quality food around.  It is fresh, not frozen.  And the young ladies who greet you will win your heart with their super sweet attitudes.
Highly recommend very professional, very knowledgeable. Thank you so much so all your help through the years!
Closest thing to Brooklyn pizza in the area. Great service! Get a red top!

You have to love frozen custard for being the creamiest form of ice cream around, and Whit's does it very well.  Last night we tried their seasonal Carmel Pecan Pie version, and it was delicious.  Mine was in the form of a sundae with hot fudge, caramel, and pecans.  Atop the seasonal custard was just perfect.  My husband had the Old Henry or something like that and also loved his.  If you haven't tried frozen custard before, Whit's is the place to do so.  It's monumentally better than Culver's or most of the large chains.  It's like thicker, creamer soft serve but it's scooped, at least most of the good ones we have had seem to be.

Whit's generally has chocolate, vanilla, and one seasonal flavor. Those appear to change weekly and are posted on a calendar for you to see easily. 

Oh, and the young people who tend to work the counter at Whit's always are friendly & seem well trained.  We will be back next time we are in the Franklin area.

This place is definitely not A-OK.  The beef bulgogi was horrible - it was dry and pretty much nothing like a bulgogi.  The spider roll was terrible and by far the worst spider roll I have ever had.  I didn't even know it was possible for a spider roll to taste this bad.  It left a very fishy aftertaste.  The sashimi is the only thing that saves this place from a one star - At least that was fresh and the slices are generous.   So if you are in University City and are just craving sushi, I guess you can go here for sashimi.  Otherwise, I don't think I really want to go back.

Anthony is the best dog trainer, owner trainer, and pet caretaker!  He is not cheap, but you get what you pay for and he is well worth the investment.  I have been lucky enough to work with Anthony for the past two years. I got a boxer puppy as a first dog for myself and my 10 year old. Anthony not only has trained my boxer to be an obedient, well socialized dog; he has also trained both me and my son how to have control, and get what we want from our pet while maintaining a playful and affectionate relationship. 

Anthony worked with my son so that my son could really act as the controller/ master of our dog. It was a great experience for my son!  I would highly recommend any parent to set up a few lessons with their children, the dog(s)  and Anthony. 

He is the best!

I cannot believe it has taken me living in Philadelphia for 2 years to finally make my first trip out to Frankford Hall!! What a great place!

We came on a beautiful Saturday afternoon. It was very crowded but if you kind of mull around people are constantly getting up so we were able to secure a table for our party. We played games. Drank large beers. A great friendly environment. 

The food is amazing also! Which i guess is to be expected for Stephen Starr. Order the cheese dip with the pretzel. You will not be disappointed!! The menu is limited mostly bratwurst and pretzel type options. However they were really good!

Looking forward to my next time here. I only wish it was not such a trek from Center City. 

Oh and they have ping pong!

This has been a great find for a quick bite to eat. This is a family run business that has very good food, and very quick service when needed. 

I enjoy the family dynamic of this place as it seems to be the kids and parents all involved. 
The daughters are so wonderful and could run that place on their own. 

Outside of the way it's run, the food is good. The lemon chicken is amazing. All in al, it's really just a normal Chinese take out that is similar to all the others,
But this one struck a cord with me in its feel. 

But seriously the food is pretty good so go check them out!!
Amazing place to have a date in the Gayborhood. Their food was really tasty and my waiter had to layers of protection a mask and face shield

If we could give Gabrielle 10 stars we would! We were buying property in the Tucson area and living in another state. There were so many moving parts! Gabrielle took it all in stride. She was Super easy to work with,  she was knowledgeable, punctual, and honest! Even when I was all over the place in what I was looking for in a property, she kept me focused and even talked me off the proverbial ledge a couple of times.  She was always available for questions even when I knew she was extremely busy, she found the time to make us feel like we were her only clients. Her personalized service was second to none. We have purchased several homes all over the United States over the years and this buying experience rates one of the top. We ended up purchasing a beautiful home, and exactly what we were looking for. If you are in the market for a home, no matter how big, no matter your budget.. do yourself a favor and contact Gabrielle Feinholtz from Coldwell Banker... you will NOT be disappointed! Thank you Gabrielle!
