My husband and I went for dinner on a Saturday night with a reservation. We order miso soup and 3 rolls, the omg, Tale of two fish, and kraken. Everything was amazing. Service was great. Nice atmosphere. One of the best sushi restaurants in St. Louis. Will definitely return!

I feel no other feelings but pure love towards Pure Love Juice!

I need to preface this review by saying I do not eat vegan or have dietary restrictions, but I choose to eat here to not only feel good but also because it is crazy delish! Tucson is extremely limited for tasty healthy restaurant options, and Pure Love Juice truly stands a cut above the rest.

The prices are reasonable, ingredients always fresh, recipes consistent, and the service is quick! I am a huge fan of the avocado toast paired with any fresh squeeze juice (depending on what boost I feel I need that day). I also recommend the cure-all shot for when your immune system needs a perk me up!

As a flexitarian, I flexed on these h$*! today and got me some catfish and when I say Sea Kings is the best in Indy, hands down, the best in Indy!

They are not where I want them at for their sides game. Okra, fries, onion rings and baked beans with my catfish is just not giving me life like I want them to. I want some mac n cheese , sweet tatters , cabbage, greens, green beans or something savory now. All that fried needs to be tapered off with something I can shake my head, roll my eyes to the back of my head and moan while eating it. Can you do that for me SK?

I got their catfish sandwich which as they call it, was the old school way. Old school way is just fish and white bread. New school is which a brioche bun, lettuce, pickle, tomato and mayo. I went with old school way because I like to take my fish home and make tacos out of them :) 

The seasoning on this fish was amazing! it was perfectly on point. Cornmeal batter, maybe even a little flour too, fried with with love, 2 fillets for $8.99. 

They have every other kind of fish and specials as well as tacos but the sauce is not my favorite. I definitely recommend SK to everyone who hasn't tried it yet. I go once a week, I may bump into you there.

P.s. Oh and I wanted to add, after just seeing another Yelper's review, that their customer service is on point! I am always late picking up and when I am, they call me to remind me. Then when I get there, there is a nice gentlemen that is sure to give you some kind of salutation, making it personal by adding your name. It's a nice moral when you come to SK. 

There parking lot is not the biggest so it's best to enter and leave off of Layman instead of 38th. 38th is known for places to grab something to eat from the commercial to the family owned, this is just new dope joint to add to the ages.

I live around the corner, when I moved here I thought oh cool a corner bar,  but I have come to learn that they are a hidden gem. The staff here is super awesome, always friendly and the food is delicious! They are pet friendly for their out door seating, the waitress today even brought me a dog bowl of water for my dog. Love this place!

I received my first Covid vaccine from this location. I called the next day to schedule my second dose on a specific date because I was headed out of town for two weeks and needed it done by then. They told me no need to make the appointment, I can just walk in. Walked in on the day I needed my second dose and was turned away stating they are no longer taking walk ins. Now I cannot get my second dose. Maybe let people make an appointment instead of turning them away for that too!!!!!!!!!

Would have given 5 stars, but I have never had a chile relleno that wasn't fried, and prices are higher than normal for Mexican food. Hubby had enchiladas rojas, He said that they were very good. Very slow day, and service was just ok. Had to search for server for to go box and check. He was on his phone at the front entry. 
Would I return? Probably not for a 45 minute drive.

This particular Target is a smaller two story facility.  This is not a Super Target! Groceries and clothing are located on the 1st floor.  Housewares and all other items are located on the 2nd floor. The store overall is clean and staff is friendly.  The parking lot is not too large so parking maybe a little challenging on the weekends.

I did not get my hair done there but I did go with a friend. The establishment does not practice safe covid guidelines. The personal were not wearing mask. Caitlyn was the hairdresser that my friend booked with, she asked for a balayage in her virgin hair. She came out of the salon with a mess. The color was not blended well. She had damaged from the bleached she used. When asked if she could get someone else to fix it they turned her away claiming it was not the salon's fault. She paid over $300. They have poor customer service, poor products and incompetent hairdressers. Please find another replace where they will take care of you from start to finish.  

Update to your response: 
No she did not go by herself I was outside in the car because she had texted me that you guys were not practicing safe covid guidelines. That's the reason I stayed behind in the car. Secondly, she is not a confrontational person as soon as she sat in the car she expressed her disappointment. I was the one that encouraged her to call back. That's when your business instead of providing good customer service decided to not help her. You know what I'm glad it hurts because now my friend has to walk around with damaged hair. And don't forget to mention that you guys have been calling her saying you guys will sue for the review! Shame on you!

We went to the regular Sunday brunch buffet today. Those shrimp are still amazing, and the food choices were even better than the last two times we visited. Today, we also sampled pasta al forno, hand-carved roast beef, caprese chicken (with a great pesto sauce), crab-stuffed flounder, roasted vegetables and a few breakfast items. We didn't like climbing the long staircase to get to the restrooms, but the downstairs restrooms were closed. The service put The Stone Barn over the top for us today. Our servers were pleasant, efficient and delightful! The price for the regular brunch is $25/person, which we felt was reasonable for what we got.

Tribeca Color Salon in Tampa is great. I have gotten several haircuts here and also have came with my nephew's and they have gotten kids cuts here as well. Every time the staff is super professional, nice, and ready to offer advice and do a wonderful job with our hair. 

Tribeca has a parking lot in the back to park your cars. When you enter you are greeted by the person at the front desk who will sign you in and let the stylist know you are here. They will also offer you a drink. They have lots to drink like white wine, red wine, PBR, teas both hot and cold, and fresh fruit juices. 

Once you go back to the stylist they will ask you what you want to do with your hair. You can get it colored or cut or even both. They will do pretty much any color you would like and you can get it cut anyway you would like it!  

This place does a great job! The stylists are nice and offer lots of suggestions! They will take really good care of you and your hair!

I highly recommend this place!

This is the 3rd time within the last 6 months that I have experienced rude staff at this cafe.  I had met the store owner, Robert Szasz back when it first opened and was just Tropical Smoothie, not Nathan's, not the sandwich place, not the salad place, just Tropical Smoothie.  He is a very nice man.  However, I apparently am not the only one who is complaining about the rude staff.  When I got back to the office and mentioned to co-worker how rude the staff was, she reminded me that she too has had that same experience.  There are too many other choices of healthy restaurants in downtown Tampa to put up with this rudeness.  Therefore, that was my last trip to Tropical Smoothie.  I will get my salad and healthy food options from Nature's Table and The Secret Garden.

Love the staff, and the shrimp po boy was very good!
This place should stay open later. Maybe even 24 hours.  There's no other food around. 
The chicken was pretty good. 
Rice and beans were fine,  too.

This place is great and I eat here often. They offer quick service and great healthy options. I only wish they had something besides an à la cart menu option for those of us who try to stay away from the carbs. When I try to order a bowl without including a base, as there are not many low-carb options for a base aside from lettuce, it is always a little difficult as there is no option to forgo a base in exchange for a veggie. You have to order the items a la carte instead, which can get expensive.

I wanted to update my review to give Aspen Leaf the proper credit it deserves. Of course on the day I decide to do this we get the rudest employee ever. Other than staring blanklessly into my soul the only interaction I recieved fron her was "11.99". No greeting, no smile, nothing. Literally she looked at me and said "11.99" (the price lol)

Anyways, I almost never recieve this kind of service here. It was a dead thursday evening and I just imagined this crap service to be a great metaphor of how the light of summer is fading into the darkness. Well played Aspen Leaf. 

We love this place though. The froyo is the best in the valley, actually scratch that... in the world. I spent 3 summers working for my aunt at TCBY in Wyoming so basically I'm an expert. 

Some froyo I've tried is really watery or has this weird lumpy texture but Aspen Leaf's froyo taste way better than any yogurt or ice cream I've ever tried. They've turned Baskin Robins into the illegitimate love child of frozen desserts. We only visit them twice a year. Meanwhile we spend most our summer nights at Aspen Leaf. 

One year in the fall they had this salted caramel corn flavored froyo. I was like a crack addict with that stuff. I think i would go weekly for pints. It was amazing. They always have good flavors and mix it up. 

Pro-tip: Tuesdays you get double punches.

Visited Shogun yesterday for lunch. We ordered the sushi pizza as an appetizer. Yes, they have sushi pizza! It is fabulous! For lunch, I had the sushi special which includes two rolls and soup or salad for $8.95. The food at shogun is second to none.  This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants. Yesterday, I visited with someone who has seafood allergies. There was confusion regarding his salmon allergy and other fish allergies. They could not tell him the type of fish that they were using in their sushi. The issue also involved a language barrier. They continued to explain that they used to whitefish and when he explained that he had an allergy to certain types of whitefish they were not able to tell him what type of whitefish they were using. He ended up only being able to eat half of his meal and they did not offer any substitutions.  The food, fish especially is incredibly fresh unfortunately the service was not so great this time.

I went for the first time recently. Parking is limited. The facility had no heat in th dining room. It's very loud. The prices are very high for tucson. The portions are small. The woman who assigned our table was tall and very pretty but wow what an attitude. I did not feel relaxed in the small chairs and out food order took a bit too long for a professional meeting. I won't be back. However I think if you are 20 something you might vibe with this place since it has endless bar games and a 20 foot projection tv. Just not my idea is a good meal with adequate attention to our table.

This was my first time here, and I was really impressed. I used to come years ago (when it was the old Kenny's) and am really impressed with that they've done with the place. Decor is really cool and i love the vibe. The food is also really good - and affordable. I really appreciate the "cheap bites" menu - its like an all day, every day happy hour! If it were closer I'd be here all the time!

We have been coming to Sea Critters for 20 years and have continuously enjoyed their platinum margaritas and their excellent food. It was a wonderful little piece of old Florida. We despaired when they were recently bought by a chain. When we visited a couple of months ago, the recipe for the platinum margaritas changed ( and not for the better) as had some things on the menu. We were disappointed with that visit.  However, when we returned today, we were so pleased to see the longtime staff and to know the "old" margarita recipe was back. The fish spread was delicious and cold peel and eat shrimp was cooked to perfection! It was nice to know that the new owners are willing to retain the good parts of what makes Sea Critters special and has regulars coming back, i.e., the staff, the food and  drink, and the atmosphere.

My wife and I stopped by this place for date night. We have positive feedback. 

The bruschetta was dynamite. The flame burger was rather spicy but tasted delicious. Spinach ravioli was creamy and yummy. 

Will come back for more bruschetta!!!

Brian the GM of sales and Mike the GM of the dealership gave me the worst experience of my life. Full review will be posted soon but I felt compelled to give some comment now due to how my fiancé and I were treated. I would give zero or negative stars if yelp allowed. Do not waste your time with this dealership.

I came here a week ago on a day trip up from LA. I had never been to a full-fledged vegan restaurant before Mesa Verde, but let me just say...it left me speechless. My boyfriend and I shared the polenta fries to start, and it was one of the most immaculate dishes I've ever tasted. Sometimes you try a dish and you immediately know that the chef has a sixth sense about how flavors and textures mesh and mingle. This was one of those dishes. Do NOT miss the polenta fries. 

For our mains, I had the empanadas and Derek had the impossible burrito. Both dishes were just...wow. The flavor profiles of MV's dishes are simply on a higher plane than I'm used to consuming. I don't know what I was expecting, but this is cuisine-as-art. It was also very obvious that they used very fresh ingredients as all of the dishes tasted wonderfully bright and herbaceous. 

We shared a chocolate cake for dessert, and it was just as stellar as the first three dishes. I just wish I could remember more specifically what was in it, but it made me incredibly happy.

There is a common misconception among meat-eaters (my past self included) that a vegetarian/vegan dish could never provide the same level of savory satisfaction that a meat dish does. This notion is simply false. I encourage any self-proclaimed carnivore to come here with an open mind and see if you don't agree. 

Bonus points: this place is way more affordable than it could be, and I'm so grateful for that. I think the good people of MV want their food to be somewhat accessible to the masses, and I felt little-to-no attitude of elitism here. I LOVE that! The staff was also extremely helpful and friendly. Thank you so much, Mesa Verde. I will be back someday.

If you are looking for authentic, delicious Italian food, just stop reading and go to ristorante Pesto. I'm an Italian girl with a soft spot for homemade noodles and this place did not disappoint. I had the puffed shrimp appetizer, Cavatelli for my meal, and gelato for dessert. I would order any one of those dishes again - so so good! The service was friendly and authentic Philly - we're talking "yous guys" and "wooder" to drink  parking isn't terrible either for being in Philly. We parked less than a block away. 

This is a place you don't want to miss!

Being truthfully honest I've had better barbecue but I'm not saying this place is bad. I had got the combo plate that eats 2-3 people with some cousins and it was enough food for 3 girls but probably wouldn't feed 3 guys. Wished there was more meat on the combo. The hush puppies, max and cheese and ribs were definitely my favorite.

Came here for happy hour last week and loved it. Such a cute place and the happy hour specials are great. The food and drinks are really good. The cosmonaut drink is GREAT! I had 3 lol. The tacos, fries, and cheese board where all good too. Happy hour = a decent menu of $5 drinks and small plates. Added to my rotation of happy hour spots!

I've been here quite a few times now and each time the staff is super awesome. They are quick and efficient. I truly appreciate their kindness while stopping in for a quick cup of joe. They also sell some pretty tasty raw bars amongst others grab n go foods. Highly recommend their Pumpkin Pie Latte with Oat milk. It phenomenal!!

This is one of those times that I really, really wish Yelp allowed .5 star ratings because three stars seems stingy but 4 stars seems too generous, but I'm going to err on the side of generosity and give this place a 4 for a number of reasons.  Here's a list of the things I tried:

-Raw Oysters.  These were some of the best raw oysters I've had since living in Louisiana.  Perfect taste and texture, and they serve them the right way, on ice.  It drives me crazy when places just serve oysters on a plate with a paper towel on it (looking at you, ACME).  Yes, these were awesome.  

-Chargrilled Oysters.  These were good, but not as good as Drago's.  Either they were too oily, too buttery, or something.  They were covered in cheese, but didn't have that great smokey flavor I've come to expect from Drago's.  They were good, however, and I would definitely eat them again.  

-Seafood Gumbo: This was disappointing. Even with the addition of lots of Tobasco, still kind of blah.  

-Pomegranite Mojito: The Superior group gets one thing right everytime: the drinks.  With this place, I can start happy hour with pomegranite mojitos, then go for a drunk walk/street car ride down St. Charles to get one of their top shelf margaritas at the flagship that Yelpers love so much (kidding).  This drink was sweet but not too sweet, and was very strong.  It paired perfectly with the oysters.  

The atmosphere this place is going for is Parisian Cafe, which is kind of confusing since TVs are everywhere, instead of just limited to the bar area.  The service was efficient and friendly enough.   SO SO happy to have a place to get oysters all different ways uptown.
Worth every penny. To summarize my partner and I had their grandma style pizza with pepperoni. It was BADANGIN'! And large enough to feed us for few days. Can't wait to try their Detroit style next.

Atmosphere is really cute, which it needs to be while you wait twenty minutes for your hot drink.  Despite having 5 staff, only one person actually seemed to be doing anything? My hot chai latte was lukewarm at best, and the scone was so gross - like mealy and tasted like baking soda. Also, they don't have a mask requirement so nobody but staff was wearing masks.

I have a monthly subscription, so I receive a bouquet every Monday. The flowers are always gorgeous and they, along with the herbs that are interspersed into the bouquets, smell amazing. It makes my Monday morning at work so much happier! Last week, there was even a flowering kale in the bouquet! It was beautiful and very unique. I definitely recommend Floradelphia.

When I'm in need of a last minute mani/pedi Excursion is always the spot or me.I don't get them very often, but the staff is always courteous and gets the job done in a decent amount of time. I've had a mixed bag of results when it comes to the Shellac manicures lasting, but that all comes down to whoever the nail tech is.


Overall A-OK. They are affordable,quick and make my nails look pretty. That's all I can really ask for.

Super friendly staff, efficient during busy hours and coffee is always YUM!  If you need a hit of caffeine and love DDs?  If you're in the area definitely stop in here.  Breakfast sandwiches are also good but be warned...if you get a bagel with cream cheese? they lay it on THICK!  I usually scrape a lot off so i don't get sick but it's nice knowing they're generous...

I would have given them 4 stars for service but they only get 3 since parking is terrible here.  People try to come in and leave from all directions so it's chaos when it's busy.  You're either fighting for a spot, waiting for a spot or making your own spot...parking nightmare...
Very interesting place. Yummy food and cool atmosphere. I will definitely be coming back to Sid's.

Stopped in on a Wednesday, we were a party of three. The space is five booths, maybe a dozen tables and a large central bar. The place is new and buzzed about, and was limited to bar seating--if you have a larger party, make a reservation! 

We ordered from each section of the menu to get a good sampling of the offerings. We started with the fried cauliflower (manchurian bezule) and Bombay sliders. Go with the cauliflower! We also had the "Golgappa" --Big, bite sized wheat shells stuffed with a chickpea and potato mash, garnished with pomegranate seeds and cilantro. Paired with a tangy tamarind and mint dressing to pour in and enjoy. One of the three of us didn't love these, but I thought they were pretty great! This is the innovation I was expecting from a place that bills itself as "a new kind of Indian." 

We then shared three entrees, which were all served hot and were very tasty. The three of us shared the dishes--butter chicken was my personal favorite! All served with a side of white rice with peas, the plates were pretty familiar Indian fare to me. 

We had more than enough food, with very few complaints. The wait staff was stretched a bit thin and sitting in a booth vs the bar would have been more comfortable. The space is a bit bright and lacks some of the personal design touches it will likely get over time as they mature. 

All in all we ate like kings and queens for $80 and enjoyed checking out the newest addition to the Loop! 

(Oh, right...the lychee martini was strong and made perfectly!)

This is my 4th historical pharmacy and I was pleased by the variety of items on display and the amount of information available for a self-guided tour. The cost to get in at just $5 was extremely affordable. Unfortunately, the tour is only given once per day, 4 days a week. The tour time is 1 p.m. which was not helpful for my itinerary. 
Visit for an hour at your leisure throughout the day.

I give Imos in Granite City three stars because normally my experience there is great, but tonight on the other hand wasn't I ordered the "great taste of st.Louis" box and the pizza was great but it also comes with ravioli cinimos and provel bite.. well the provel bites were under cooked they said because it sat in the box with the pizza it just seemed like that but the cheese wasn't even melted and the cinimos had no icing on them. Well I work in the restaurant industry I know how it is when people complain but I just spent $30 with them I would expect a nice meal for my family I simply called and they said they would replace my cinimos which they did and that was great but they lady that came back to deliver them was extremely disrespectful I was about to apologize for complaining but you would think she would apologize but no she flew my screen door open and threw the box at me and said there you go and walked off didn't close the screen door didn't apologize really wanted to call again but didn't see the point they obviously don't care about their costumers and I know it was a mistake but she should have been nicer about it as well as the manager my experience was not good kinda disappointed in them I've always loved choosing them.. sadly no more
Good food. Good service. Pasta con broccoli is the best! Never had one similar. Wish they had a location on the hill tho besides the catering location.

One of the great aspects of being a part of the Yelp Elite community is the opportunity to meet some really cool people who love to get out and do things.  Among the people I am fortunate enough to call friends is Sari A, who introduced me to one of the most fun experiences I've had doing something pretty ordinary:  Combining brunch with  a Drag Queen show.  That is the joy that is L'Etage's Drag Queen Brunch.  

First,understand, I love drag queens.  Drag is a celebration of women, of art, of creativity, and of being not only who you are but who you wish you could be.  Look at my profile pics and you'll see one of me with Hedda Lettuce, one of the great queens I've had the privilege of seeing perform.

So when Sari asked about a Drag Queen Brunch, I was definitely in.  

L'Etage is just off South Street,  a little off the beaten path but not much.  The show happens on the second floor.  I arrived and was ushered to Sari's table - a long half-oval shape with banquette against the window and tall chairs facing.  We had a great view of the stage floor.  

We were offered drinks and happily chatted as some of the Queens came out pre-show to mingle and chat.  They were great, happily being both sassy and friendly, I even got a couple of makeup tips that have turned out quite well. Want to know how to accentuate your best features?  Talk to a good Queen.

Then, the show - OMG was it fun. Singing, dancing, even splits were to be had and for the first time ever I saw a Drag Queen Puppet/Ventriloquist act.  It was wonderful

Food was...fine.  I had the strawberry compote stuffed french toast with vanilla cream.  It was...fine. A little chewy, and not as much interesting flavors as I had hoped.  Then again, I didn't come there because of the cuisine.  It's all about the show.

The Queens love tips, so I brought plenty of $1 bills which they happily come to collect as they perform.  I was even able to get change for a $20 from a Queen from all her $1 bills later.   She was happy to reduce her stash, and of course some of it was coming right back to her and her fellow performers. It's what you call a win-win.  

That brings me to my sole gripe of the show: The staff.  Invisible, irregular, and kind of bitchy. During intermission I saw I was low on tips and so I did my best to find a server or bartender who could help me get change.  No takers, and the bartender was kind of nasty about it too.  I was surprised and disappointed as I would have thought the restaurant was well aware of all the tipping and would be prepared to help people spend their money.   After all, the Queens are going to perform when they are tipped, and the Queens are bringing folks to the restaurant, and the folks are buying drinks and food.  Duh.  That's the 1-star off. Service, people, and even if you can't help someone, don't be an ass.  

Overall it was a blast, afterwards I got to chat with some of the Queens some more as we exited, and it was wonderful.  They loved that I am quite comfortable with others' preferences even if they aren't my own. In the end, love is love.  I got hugs and a few more tips on makeup and dress too. :) 

If you like drag, go.  It's not the naughtiest show you'll see - it is after all a Sunday morning - but it's tons of fun.  Thanks, Sari.  You're the best.

If I were to commit a capital crime tomorrow in the city of Philadelphia and were asked what I wanted for my last meal, I would without hesitation answer "The Duck Salad Sandwich, Ghent Mussels, and draft Pliny the Elder from Monk's Café."

It's kind of hard to describe experiences like these, but every time I walk into Monk's Café and sit at their rustic bar waiting for my food and beer, it's as if I'm sitting on some sort of invisible, yet mobile spa; all my stress and worries just melt away from my shoulders and leave me in a state of complete relaxation and bliss... which soon shifts to ecstasy as soon as my food and beer arrive.

Fluffy and flowery images aside, if you don't know already, Monks Café probably has the most extensive Belgian beer offering in Philadelphia and maybe in the entire USA. If you didn't know already, Monks Café probably offers the most authentic Belgian fare in all of Philadelphia and maybe in the entire USA. And if it hasn't hit you already, you should most definitely make this a to-go destination if you enjoy good food and beer, which probably means YOU, since you wouldn't be on yelp.com if you didn't enjoy good food and beer.

I would also recommend stopping by here during the afternoon if you like a more serene, home-y atmosphere; make this place your destination in the evening if you like a more ambient, dive-ish under the candlelight atmosphere (to whomever called this a dive/hole in the wall: how dare you.)

I love you Monk's Café. Never leave me.

It breaks my heart that I have only been here once.  The Affogato was amazing.  I shared a flight with my fiance and we thoroughly enjoyed every flavor in front of us.  Matcha was my favorite.  The flavor is incredibly rich.  I can't rave about this place enough.

Update - 5/6/2013

I spoke with Stacy the owner of April Fresh Cleaning and she explained a number of technical issues that prevented her from calling me back.  As someone who works with technology every day, I realize that these things can happen.

Based on the circumstances, my initial review of 1 star was perhaps a bit harsh.

We finally touched base today and April Fresh Cleaning is scheduled to come and organize my downstairs kitchen storeroom this Saturday at 9:00 AM.

I'll update this review again Saturday afternoon and let you know how it goes!



Original Review:

I called April Fresh Cleaning today and was greeted by a friendly voice who asked me she could give me "a call right back" as she was on the other line with a customer.  I said absolutely and based on your yelp review, I'd like to talk to you about organizing a room in my basement and for regular cleaning of my home.  She informed me that she would call me right back and when asked if she had my phone number, she told me that she did.  That was at 11:51 AM EST today.

It is now 6:50 PM EST almost 7 hours later and no call.

This initial impression has left me quite convinced that this is not the company I want to do any business with and I feel it's noteworthy to review my experience.

Went six months ago. Let me tell you something! The owner is helping to spread covid-19. Rather than responsibly acting like the majority of restaurants in the county are by doing curbside carry out. I would rather go to a vending machine as far as flavor goes. Give you money to ANY other restaurant that is not involved in non sense litigation against the county

The line was a bit ridiculous but it was "the shortest it's been all day," which I suspect is maybe a ploy to get people to stand in the line. Regardless, we stood there! If it wasn't so blazing hot, it would have been fine. They line manager person did a great job of handing out umbrellas, water, and menus. He was on top of his game. Prices were decent. Food was a letdown. The East Nasty was not the "best sandwich in America" in my opinion, contrary to what we were told in line. They ran out of bonuts and The Hummingbird before we could order, so maybe it'd be a 5-star if we could have tried to popular bonuts!

I had heard another brewery had opened so when I had a lazy Friday afternoon I thought I would visit.  It's street parking but that wasn't a big deal for that afternoon.  It's probably the most polished of the breweries as you walk up.  A nice porch (with a ramp) where you can sit and watch the traffic on Tchoupitoulas.  Inside, there was plenty of comfortable seating.  Lots of TVs scattered around; I counted 6 of them.  I started with the Slack Water brown ale which was a good beer, if you are into brown ales.  Continuing to explore their beers, I followed that with the Storyville IPA.  It wasn't quite to my taste, but then that's why they have a half dozen or so beers on tap, something for everyone.  I fibnished the afternoon with the Tea Pale Ale.  Nice, light beer, goes great on the patio.  And it is a dog friendly place as there were 2 there that day.

I had the Tuscon Chicken Sandwich. For me, it was just so-so. I'll try something else next time. But I also tried out the Margarita pizza, and that was good.

We sat by the river. Nice ambiance. This place has multiple different environments to sit in.

We did experience a degree of service resistance as we began our experience here. This was actually a 3 1/2 star visit. (It wasn't a 4 experience. But it also wasn't a 3 experience.)

Wow. Authentic and delicious!!! Definitely reminds me of old school Little Italy NYC  back in the day. First, the atmosphere was just wonderful. The old school music of Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Jimmy Durante was touching. Brought back memories. Being from NY, we were thinking, "would we find real Italian food like in NY now that we're in Florida ??" Well we did!!! I had the Butternut Squash Ravioli and added chicken to it and my husband had the veal. Him being Italian, he's a veal parmigiana man. Both the veal and chicken were so tender you didn't even need a knife!! The scallops as appetizers were REAL scallops!! BIG AND JUICY. Everything was awesome. This will be our place. The manager came by twice to check on us and Joanne our waiter was great. We don't have the good 'ol days anymore but we have Esposito's.

We got the small family meal deal which was amazing for $25. It feed my husband, two small kids and myself. We even had a ton of leftovers. We decided to get the beef bulgogi, fried rice, glass noodles, fried dumplings and had miso soup. 

The food was delicious. Their fried rice and their dumplings are especially great. 

We drove all the way across town to try this place out because I love Korean food and the place we normally go to is closed. When we arrived we were the only car in the parking lot and a gentleman came out to let us know our order wasn't quiet ready. We waited maybe 5 more minutes to get our huge order of food.

We will definitely be back and love supporting local businesses. Cannot wait to try this place out when it opens for time in.

I wanted to say that Garrett and all of the other DeVons Rolex representatives have treated me with a level of professionalism and respect that I haven't seen from any other Rolex dealer in my search for a GMT Master II.   Moreover, the representatives at DeVons are always happy to help and show any watches that are on display. I also genuinely appreciate the small things like handling out Rolex catalogs while I wait for the call. If you are looking for a Rolex dealer I would highly recommend DeVons.
Very clean and friendly staff. Great salad bar lots of options and the meat is great! They made me cocktail sauce from scratch that was amazing!

Hands down, the best Thai restaurant this side of town. You can tell that they only use the freshest ingredients because it just tastes so so good. We have never been disappointed ordering delivery here- and that is an art to get it delivered and it still be hot and delicious. 

Our favorite is the yellow curry and the basil fried rice!

My favorite iced coffee in town. 

I live in Santa Barbara proper and have been bummed to see that the two CBTL locations had closed down over the past year (dang Covid). Luckily, the Goleta location isn't too far and is still very accessible by car. 

There's something about this particular location that just makes you feel cozy. Maybe it's the oak-accented bar and walls. Maybe it's the bulletin board teeming with local happenings. Maybe it's the friendly staff. Whatever it is, I enjoy it. 

When I worked in Goleta, I'd make a point to stop by once a week at least. There's going to be a long line on a weekday morning, but the staff always seems to cycle the customers through in an efficient manner. I'm always greeted with a smile, and it's really no time before my order is cranked out. I'm big on their iced coffee (black!), love the crunch ice. I also love their everything bagel. It's the perfect pairing when toasted. 

All this coffee talk is making me want to drive out there again. I think I will do so tomorrow!

Superb indian fare, in a clean, modern, relaxed setting! I recently had their Sunday brunch buffet. Their selection is varied and tasty - with a great deal of vegetarian dishes. The naan is excellent, and made fresh to order. The value is superb - at less than $13 - this place is a winner hands down. Give them a try the next time you are in Town N Country!

Came here on a Tuesday for dinner and the place was nice and clean. First thing we noticed after being seated is the vents from the air condition are blowing down directly in the row against the wall. It was very drafty, cold and uncomfortable even though the places décor seemed nice. We had to button up our tops and jackets.

We ordered: Shared the appetizers and one burger with fries.
Crispy Calamari-  they where good and light.

Honey Bay Wing Bites-  the chicken was good but there was something off on the sauce on top of them besides being to sweet, it had a bad side taste to it. Blue cheese dressing was ok.
.
Pub Burger- had a good flavor and was cooked right like we ordered medium the bun was also very soft. 
It came with French fries which arrived cold and soggy I guess it comes from the vessel that they put them in a little bucket, looks nice but makes them soggy since they are piled into them. They should consider removing this from their presentation. We let the waitress know that they where soggy and cold, received a new batch with the same issue they just get soggy period. We like our fries warm and crispy. We never received our ketchup that we asked for had to get it from another table ourselves.

This is the biggest issue I have with" Roots" they have a good beer menu and offer cocktails and wine and they are all listed on the menu in the restaurant and online.

Where is the menu for NON-ALCOHOLIC DRINKS????? 

They do not let their patrons know about what they have to offer is it Coke is it Pepsi? Do they have lemonade or Ice tea??? I checked online as well they do not even list any non-alcoholic drinks. WTH seriously you should consider adding these onto your menu as I can tell you this is not very customer service friendly. I don't favor having to ask for what you have on non-alcoholic drinks I get you sell beer I can see that by your long nice bar etc.

They do have a nice side outside seating area with plenty of seating that we will try out.

Overall the atmosphere is nice the service needs to be a little more attentive and follow up on your patrons especially bring the ketchup if someone asks for it please. Food is good with little  tweaks it will be better.

On a side note ROOTS should consider updating their computers to reflect the actual name of the restaurant!!! 
After receiving the check we noticed that it says " Guppy's 2" as the name, seems that its a quick fix but you are called ROOTS last time I checked right.

Tacos Los Campesinos is a great place for authentic Mexican cuisine. Once inside the restaurant, it's absolutely adorable complete with colorful murals and a friendly staff. My husband and I started with the Quesabirria, a fun twist on a traditional quesadilla that is packed with a delicious slow cook beef birria and melted cheese. We also had a variety of traditional foods including the chorizo pambazo, asada tacos, and barbacoa gorditas. I would recommend all three! The tacos and gorditas were especially good because the tortillas and masa pockets are  handmade daily. The barbacoa slow cooking process makes it extra tender and absolutely delicious. Everything was packed with a combination of flavorful spices!

I dont get to go to Starbucks often, largely because it's not within my route to work. 

I had a mocha latte and it was delicious. I wanted something warm and soothing. 

The barista was pleasant and made my drink carefully. The atmosphere of this Starbucks was quiet. There were a few groups of people and they were not too loud.

I will return to this location.
Very friendly helpful staff, despite not having what I was searching for they gave it a good effort.  Look forward to my next visit.

I have mixed feelings about G&S. If I could give 3.5 stars, I would. The food (although good) didn't quite match the price point, the service was sub-par until the GM stopped by, and there was a terrible draft throughout one third of the restaurant. 

The Shrimp Scampi appetizer was probably my favorite dish- that chili infused oil sauce was awesome- I was dipping my bread in it. Just the right amount of tangy-spicy kick.  The pasta dishes were alright, and the Branzino was tiny.

Service-wise, we waited 40 minutes before our waitress to bring us bread. She was also a little weird about putting in an appetizer order until our 4th party member joined us (he was struggling to find parking)- so we had to wait for him on that.  We were seated right next the waiter station, yet the staff often forgot to bring us things we asked for (water, tea, and another helping of bread).  The GM asked how things were and quickly took care of the 3 things mentioned above ... but before he arrived we were waiting for at least 20 minutes on each item. He was very helpful, but we wish things were more consistent from the start.

Great spot for sharing New Orleans style tapas small plates and handcrafted cocktails!!  The cuisine is a creative twist on some of my New Orleans favorites. Hubby and I shared the Crispy Oyster Tacos, Shrimp & Tasso Corndogs, Natchitoches Meat Pies, crispy Brussel sprouts and savory beignets. I enjoyed my own personal small bottle of sparkling rosé. Hubby enjoyed a craft cocktail but I can't remember which one. Wish I'd saved room for the tuna cones! Just means we have to go back. :) Hubby and I had a bit of bubbly in our room at the W before coming down to dinner so we forgot to take pictures. 

Love the lighted bottles that decorate the walls. Creates a very unique ambiance. There's plenty of room for a group gathering either at a table or at the bar. Just FYI, my first dining experience at SoBou was several years ago with for a friend's Bachelorette party dinner before a girls' night in the Quarter and it was such a great experience!

Would definitley love to come back for the Legs & Eggs Burlesque brunch on Sundays, although I hear it fills up quickly so need to grab a reservation.

Oh and if you're still reading, this restaurant is part of the Commander's Palace family of restaurants. Great choice if you want yummy food and cocktails in the French Quarter from a family that's been doing great NOLA food for a long time!
A great place for sporting outdoor gear, snow ski, outdoor sports equipment, shooting range, large selection of guns and knowledgable staff. This is a great store in beautiful location.

All I can say is WOW! Faubourg Brewery has done an amazing job re-branding, and their beers taste delicious as ever! I tried the Dat'Suma IPA and loved it--it has sweet undertones. The food was also delicious; I tried the burger with a beyond beef patty to make it vegetarian. I loved how they had a vegetarian/vegan option.

The Trash Grits and The Crawfish Poutine are also pictured below! The poutine came with a decent amount of crawfish. I would highly recommend coming here and enjoying their gorgeous out-door seating!

Instant Smog makes it so easy to renew your car's registration! The service is super speedy and I have never had an unpleasant experience. Even if there's cars in line, I never have to wait long. Today, my car had a smog test and was registered in less than 10 minutes.  I paid the small and very reasonable fee for them to submit my renewal info to the DMV and was on my way. Thank you, Instant Smog!

My husband and I  went to Big shakes to try it out and I ordered the chicken sandwich with no spice at all and my hisband got the same thing in mild with the ghost pepper mayo. In addition, we order the catfish platter. First off be prepared to wait a while when you order chicken sandwiches, not sure but it took lthe chicken sandwich is made with chicken tenders, not sure but it took 30 min while other things that people order came out  a bit faster. Any way I do NOT recommend you get the chicken  sandwich none spicy, you MUST get it with the ghost pepper sPice cause thats wHat gives the flavor to the dish! Without the sauce the chicken tenders it self has no flavor at all! Chicken tenders in the sandwich had no flavor at all so I had to add ketchup to make it taste like something. My husband on the other  haNd enjoyed bis chicken sandwich, he said it had a good flavor. The catfish platteR was good and mac and cheese was good. Nothing super sPecial. 

Prices are ok, similar to hattie b's. Waiting time on the other hand was quiet long but they did  tell us when we ordered. If I do return I will have to try  the chicken sandwich with the ghost pepper mayo and fried chicken to see if its flavorful..

Really, I think Trader Joe's reputation speaks for itself but it can't hurt to put a little Yelp on it. 

This store is amazing! If you've yet to visit it you're missing out. Think Whole Foods without breaking your whole budget. 

One note of caution get there early in the day if you're looking to stock up on fresh produce or some frozen items. They seem to stock towards the end of the night around 8pm -9pm and the pickings can be slim by that hour. I keep running into the lot when the big semi is bringing in fresh goods but they're not quite loaded yet. 

Some of my fav Trader Joe selections:

- Baked Potato Chips
- Channa Masala 
- Brown Rice Sushi Assortment
- Garlic Naan
- Napa Valley Merlot
- Alexandra Fitch Merlot
- Organic Dark Chocolate Bar with Raisins & Pecans
- Chocolate Lava Cake
- Reduced Guilt Sole w/ Spinach & Butter Beans
- Reduced Guilt Pasta
- Chicken Mango Salad

Been there several times because it's the closest. Never had a good experience there.  Forexample, 3 customers in the place.  Manager seated me. 2 servers talking about their hair and never served me. I left after an hour.
Another instance I ordered my food and never saw my server again. She waited on tables the other side of the place. Waited 30min. Finally a different server brought my food and it was cold.from sitting.
The last time the server was nice but again it took forever to get my food. When it arrived cold. So I have to guess it sat for awhile.
We stopped here for dinner and we really enjoyed our food. I loved the grilled shrimp tacos and the churros were amazing! The seating is outdoors in a cute shared courtyard. Would come here again!

If you love sandwiches, this is definitely your destination spot in Philadelphia.  Paesano's is really as good as it gets.  Not just in Philly, but anywhere!  

Be you one of those crazy vegetable preferring folk or just a plain old omnivore, they have options for every diet. Try the "Paesano" - it's well worth the...uh... really inexpensive cost and fast prep. time. 

Another thing to love is the service.  I've always found everyone working to be pleasant and funny.  Did I mention that this location is also conveniently located just 1/2 a block from a State Store...?

Yes, it's a great place to find yourself when you need a sandwich fix. Cash Only.

After hearing about this nice little place from a friend I decided to pop over and give it a try. Greeted with a smile and a hearty hello welcome. The staff was friendly enough that it made eating alone not so bad. After looking over the menu and deciding what to have it all sounded so good. I went with the Ortega Burger. When it came out it looked as good as it sounded on the menu. Lots of nicely melted cheese with a great bun and the bacon,well there was plenty of that. I ordered it medium rare and it was just that. After taking my first bite I knew this was gonna be a very pleasing lunch. Taking another bite it only got better. I then thought to myself what a great choice for lunch, thanks Dave Mencarelli. I would have been more than happy to give this GREAT "Little House on Center" all 5 stars but no one is perfect and thats what makes it nice is to come back over and over and watch them grow and get even better. Great Job Little House.
Foam and fabric place has had my awning for 7 months and counting... now they're not answering their phone... I guess I'm screwed what a way to run a business

I was here last night, absolutely enjoyed it and almost forgot to do a review. So here it is: two thumbs way up! And another two  thumbs for Bartender Courtney, who kept me steeped in  Lagunitas IPA and treated me like a king from the minute I walked in. Kudos to the kitchen, too, for the tasty Black and Blue burger! Oh, they allow smoking, be which really sealed the deal for this man of many vices!

Hmmm - This place is actually in Westmont, not collingswood, but close enough. A great family owned hardware store, this is one of the few places left where you can get beef jerky, a bar of lava soap, custom colored paint, an awl, rat poison (the good stuff), tubular light bulbs, a lawnmower blade, and pretty much anything else you can imagine. 

Home depot you say? Home depot doesn't carry the sheer variety they manage to squeeze into place. Heck, you can find stuff here that will have men in black suits showing up at your house. Don't screw with those men, as this place also sells everything you need for waterboarding too.

Let's sasche away from such terrible talk and say that this is truly you're one stop spot. Usually not too crowded. As I've mentioned previously my house is 80+ years old, so I spend a lot of time in here picking up various items I need to keep the place in shape. 

The staff is friendly and helpful, (It's family owned), and there's always a strapping young lad to assist you loading your 300lbs of birdseed or whatever.

Watch their hours, as they tend to close early on Sunday, but otherwise enjoy patronizing this old school hardware store!
Best little secret right in the center of it all. The ladies are fantastic and all know your name! Yummy food. Homemade desserts and a down home nice time.

I'm pretty sad to write this down, but I felt like I had to throw it out there and see if I was alone in this thinking, or if I just went on an off week.I feel like I just went to see my favorite band in concert, and waited all night for them to play my favorite song.. and then hear them lip-sync it or something terrible like that. I've actually been to this restaurant twice this week (okay fine, three times! don't judge.) and each time was kind of disappointing. 

Not sure if Plaza has gotten a new chef, or some new line cooks? But someone in there must have a salt shaker taped to his or her hand; and that is the only excuse for how salty everything was this week. Literally the first and sometimes only flavor I could get from several items! The ranchero sauce on the chiles, the refried beans, the guacamole.. everything was too salty for me. To be fair, I am very sensitive to salty foods. But to be more fair, I don't think many people would have disagreed with my assessment. Also our table chips weren't particularly fresh, but far from being not tasty.

I still give you four stars, Plaza Azteca. Because I am still a huge fan of everything you do, and if someone were to ask me to dinner there tomorrow, and the next day and the next day I would probably never be able to say no!

Reading Terminal Market (or 'RTM' for short) is famous among tourists. A potentially better spot is the newly renovated Bourse, but RTM has some things going for it. On my recent visit, I grabbed a buttery Miller's Twist warm pretzel, Hope's cookies from the Pennsylvania General Store and a cookie from 4th Street cookie company, and a tiramisu cake and biscotti from Termini Brother's bakery. All of these were good. My taste test (albeit of different types of cookies) leads me to give a slight nod to 4th Street's macadamia chocolate chip cookie (the healthier looking Harvest cookie - cranberries, oats, cinnamon - at Hope's was actually kind of greasy). That said I like the selection at Hope's as well as their signature peanut butter chocolate dipped cookies. 
My one disappointing experience with RTM was the Dutch Eating Place's open face turkey sandwich. Not sure how this got positive reviews - the plain white bread was drowned in gravy that coated excessive turkey - so much unappetizing food! I've had their delicious apple dumplings in the past (so I know they offer some good items); Stick with their breakfast/desserts. Another limitation with RTM is the lack of healthier options (try Tootsie's market for a fresh salad bar).

Buying a phone is a whole test.  I went to the store and placed an order there.  I was told to wait and the order would be ready in two hours.  it's horrible!  as a result, some kind of error occurred, the support service said to wait for an e-mail notification.  How long to wait????  Wasted two hours of my time and left with nothing.

It's my second time here and I came back because of the great flavors and affordable prices. Given some of our allergies they were able to accommodate and replace eggs with veggies for us. The salad that we had was a great start and the pad Thai was really tasty. We appreciated the service which was friendly and quick. The restaurant is kept exceptionally clean, and we saw their dedication to service after someone left they were very careful to clean the entire space. I would highly recommend trying this place out.

Nope. Don't bring your dog here for a groom. Maybe a short hair dog requiring no cut is safe. No one from Pet Suites has gotten back with me about my disappointment. I've been waiting since 4/2/2021. It's 4/25/2021 so I'm writing my review with no resolution. If I would have known my dog would look this bad, I would used the kitchen scissors myself. Not worth the money. She was shedding LIKE CRAZY after this. Don't go.

Customer Service- I've called, no one answered and I left a message but I haven't heard back from anyone.

Good pizza (house-made sausage), ordered crispy with garlic confit (an add-on).  Although without the garlic confit which I asked to be added, I think it would have been a little bland.  Crispy crust; outstanding sausage, roasted red peppers ... could have done without smoked mozzarella (but I don't like smoked cheese or meats).  Haven't been to Sauce, so can't comment on how their pizza stacks up comparatively, price-wise or qualitatively.

My husband's "grinder" was actually panini-style (rather than sub-style) -- the server let him know before she placed the order.  He liked it -- although there was more bread than meat  (sopressata, salami and mortadella), peppers and provolone.  

Grilled artichoke with lemon aioli to go was okay (although, they could turn the artichokes upside down after par-boiling them for a bit longer to get more of the moisture out ... toward the middle of the artichoke, the upper portion of the leaves had water dripping from them) ... lemon aioli was more like a lemon crema ... I asked them to hold the truffle oil and it would have been nice had they substituted olive oil ... came out dry.  I've had much better (including my own, at home).

My "ducati" cocktail was cloying (and strong (the latter, not necessarily a bad thing when you're not driving)).  My husband enjoyed his Sauvignon Blanc by the glass.

Good service.  Loved sitting outside in the shade.  

Quite a bit more down-scale than the last time we ate here (when we had a home in Tucson more than 5 years ago) ...

Upscale and priced to match. Probably the best glass of wine in Terminal C, with their wine bar. 

Stopped for breakfast and a had a small appetite. Hence the fruit platter at a steak house. But I had a clear view of my gate. 

The Bloody Mary was good ish, not mind blowing. Little disappoint in the old lime wedge and mushy tomato. Service was on point. 

Overall, very nice if you are ready to spend $$$.

I will try to explain my unnatural love for this place without blathering on and on like someone who's been subjected to prolonged sun exposure and too many margaritas.

1.  The Scene: Two miles of smooth and easy walking paths suitable for the young 'uns and the geriatric in all of us, not counting the side treks, like the aviary, the hummingbird aviary and the cave.  Around two acres of natural - or man-made-to-look-very-natural scenery carved out of the Arizonan desert.  The rocks in all large animal enclosures are made from concrete but shaped to resemble the animal's natural habitat.  You won't see no wolf sharing a pen with a stuffed toy version of himself here.

An awesome exhibit of the Arizonan flora.  You'll be amazed at the variety of cacti and how some of them are comparable to the most exquisite orchids.

2.  The Facilities: Keeping in mind that the clientele may be of the urinally-challenged and easily-tired set, restrooms, drinking fountains, and benches can be found throughout the park.  Benches are thoughtfully located underneath large mesquite trees.  Some of the restrooms even have sunscreen in a pump.  That's right...SUNSCREEN IN A BIG PUMP, in case you thought you were in Seattle and have no need for the stuff in Tucson.  Water fountains are also equipped with a "water bottle" refilling station.  

Side note -- the blueberry muffins at the cafe were not petrified, like the fossilized remains of animals found in the Arizonan desert centuries ago, but some of the largest and moistest I've ever tasted.  At premium prices, of course.

3.  The Learning: If you're like me - whose memories of school year field trips involve falling asleep at the planetarium and drooling all over yourself, trying to sneak a bag of potato chips into a Japanese tea ceremony, putting a bra over the head of the animals on display at the natural history museum - then one trip to the Sonora Desert Museum will absolve you of all those past transgressions.  

The museum never passes up an opportunity to educate visitors young and old.  The entrance of the aviary has a stack of colored, laminated cards explaining each of the bird species inhabiting the enclosure.  Another outdoor exhibit details the flora found at different elevations of the Arizona desert.  Well-informed docents set up tables full of fossils and tools throughout the day, in front of key animal exhibits.  Each animal enclosure even has a little table with a stamp of the paw print of the animal on display for kiddies.  There's also a GPS app through your phone, which will explain each area you visit.

4.  The Animals - ...were all well-taken care of.  None of the animals were clanging their metal cups against the bars of their cage (there are no bars on any cages, except for the fowl), no looks of desperation in their eyes, or pacing back and forth chewing on an old cigarette butt.  The animals all looked healthy, looked alert and well-fed.

Don't miss the Raptor flight, held twice a day, during which 4 or 5 Harris Hawks are released among gawking visitors, then prey upon small children and the elderly...actually, no.  There's no preying but watching the huge hawks in flight is a pretty amazing experience.

We spent 6 blistering-feet, sun drenched happy hours here and will be back later in the season to see the cacti bloom.  Highly HIGHLY recommended stop for anyone who truly appreciates the beauty of the Arizonan desert.

We live in this neighborhood so Ichiban is just convenient. But it's also GOOD. The sushi is always fresh and the service is decent. Nothing to complain about with this restaurant but also nothing super-sparkling if you're looking for the wow-factor. Just a good little neighborhood dive (but clean!).

Why paddle when you can pedal? Get a whole new feel for downtown Tampa's waterfront by climbing aboard one of the Tampa Bay Water Bike Company's cool cruisers. They also have kayaks that are propelled by peddling.

The sensation of coasting along water is nothing but smooth sailing. Even when the water got churned a bit by passing boats I stayed high and dry. 

The seats are comfortable, the peddles turn smoothly, there are places for water bottles/beverages and no gears, brakes or possibility of flat tires. So it really is as simple as riding a bike.

I most enjoyed the peace and quiet that surrounded me throughout most of the ride. This is definitely a fair weather activity but I think it would be really spectacular just before sunset or while some fireworks were filling the sky overhead.

I found this much more fun than passively riding along in a boat. And I was surprised how much attention it attracted from people strolling along the Riverwalk. These bikes are moving billboard for the business and they seemed to equally delight people of all ages - youngsters to seniors.

You can stay as close to shore as you like and there are various routes to explore that extend to the Straz Center, Gasparilla Pirate Ship, Harbour Island and the Garrison Channel and Davis Island.

All I can say is "ride on!"

I pretend like I'm not a crier, but let's face it - I very much am. I cried when I found sashimi grade salmon in a Cincinnati seafood market. I cried when my boss told me that about how her dog trots and meets new dogs. Hell, I cried when Jordan Staal was traded from the Pittsburgh Penguins in 2012. I have never met Jordan Staal. I have absolutely no ties to his life.

Why am I telling you this? If I tell you this, you will know exactly what my reaction was when I walked into Reading Terminal Market.

I cried. I bawled like a baby right next to Bassett's Ice Cream.

They were joyous tears, of course, but that doesn't take away from the fact that my over emotional self doused the baked goods at Beiler's with my waterworks. I may have been so overwhelmed that Valley Shepard may now be selling a variety of pickles featuring my tears. The waterfall of emotion perfectly showcased reason #3162 why I can't have children - I certainly wouldn't make it through nine months of this kind of overreaction.

But, guys. Everything was just so damn beautiful.

By the end of my time in Philadelphia, I had eaten at 3/4 of the entire market. The stalls are plentiful but the aisles are cramped because I am clearly not the only person that appreciates the perfection that is Reading Terminal. I ate my weight in ice cream, I stood in line waiting for a subpar Philly cheesesteak whilst complaining in a faux New Jersey accent, I ... I may have even scarfed down a 4th street cookie while hiding in Jonathan Best's grocery so that when I emerged from the abyss I could pretend to be famished and hit up another stall. (If you ever ask me again whether or not this is true I will look you in the eye and swear on my grave it is not. I'd rather go die harboring a secret large enough to make me a Hogwarts ghost than shamefully admit on multiple occasions that I am enough of a fatass to eat two meals in the same hour in the same place.)

This is, by far, the best indoor food market I've ever visited. I still dream about Carmen's Franklin cheesesteak (they add cream cheese to it! Smart people) and I've recklessly attempted to recreate DiNic's iconic roast pork sandwiches at home. (Broccoli rabe is difficult to cook y'all.) I am currently attempting every which way into visiting Philadelphia again so I can skip and dance my way through this amazing food mecca. In the meantime, I will cry - because apparently I do that for everything.

I friggin' LOVE this place. The mac and cheese is exquisite! The fried chicken is perfectly delicious and crunchy, the cocktails are nicely executed and the service is great. The creamed collards are an interesting twist on the typical preparation and I enjoyed them. The cornbread, although raved about quite frequently, was just okay to me. I would order it again, but it isn't a must like the mac is. This is one of my fave newer spots in the city. The parking sucks, given its location, but the valet is just fine and not too expensive. They have live jazz each night with an additional cost to sit in the jazz parlor, but honestly, you can hear the music in the regular dining room also, so it may not be worth the extra cost to you. Either way, the Bynum Brothers have done it again w/this great addition to the Philly restaurant scene!

This was my first time having empanadas, let alone having food from Buena Onda. My friend actually picked up the empanadas and brought them to the beach, but I have heard that the customer service is wonderful. The empanadas were so yummy and you can tell they are made with love. In the photo you can see the inside of the Hongos (mushroom), which was very good. The other was the Carne, which was also delicious.

What a FUN and DELICIOUS birthday lunch I treated my high school friend to. It's our tradition to take each other to a special lunch for our birthdays. At our age we don't need more "things!"

Our go-to spot was ALWAYS Cafe Ponte BUT we all know what happened there so we have been trying new places together. Today we enjoyed fabulous service from Rajib who truly made a special occasion even more so with his personality and fantastic recommendations. 

They were out of my favorite salad but Raj's suggestion to go with the Barbecued Shrimp Salad did not disappoint. It was spectacular as we shared that and the Asian Tuna Salad. The dressings for both salads we had requested on the side and it really allowed us to identify the unique flavors of each one. 

To top off the already spectacular dining experience my friend was treated to one of the most light yet decadent peanut butter chocolate desserts. So happy we shared that because it rates in my top 3 desserts on this planet.

Slice's pizza was pretty good! I just got a margherita pizza with arugula on it. I wanted to like this place but I thought the service was terrible. I initially came in and just ordered to take out, nooooo one seemed to want to help me. I waited and waited and asked for help and waited some more. When I paid, I ended up leaving a whopping tip but changed the amount right before I left because it dawned on me that I didn't need to leave so much money for take out and bad service.

I'm at this place a lot, since my office is nearby.  Sure, it's fast-food Mexican, but you get a lot of good stuff for the price.  The carne asada burrito is very good (if just a bit too salty), and you can't beat the $.99 tacos.  Today I tried the shrimp burrito, which was amazing - stuffed full of big, fat shrimp, lettuce, sour cream and pico de gallo for only $5.50.  The breakfast burritos are also huge and delicious.  I don't understand the complaints about service on here - the staff is always friendly and courteous to me.  Try speaking un poco de Español, and you'll make them laugh.  I love this place.
So I know everyone loves this nail shop. But look at my nails after leaving the shop today there were done. I am upset because they look old.

So I was very disappointed to learn that server KATIE misgendered a friend 3 times during HIS visit when HE took HIS beautiful girlfriend out for lunch. When it happened the first time my friends just told Katie " that's my BOYFRIEND that's a guy" the server apologized but during Katie's second round to the table Katie AGAIN decided to misgender him that's when my friend "A" got irritated and told server Katie AGAIN that her boyfriend was a guy/male. Then when Katie hands my friends their bill KATIE AGAIN decided to misgender my friend for the 3rd time making sure that my friend was not comfortable anymore  please educate your servers on pronouns because that was unacceptable

Does this place really need another amazing review? I just came here to say, this isn't your standard eggs and bacon brunch place. This is an amazing lebanese fusion flavor explosion on a plate brunch place. Maybe a little pricier than other spots, but so worth it. 

I got the N-liberties and smoked salmon benedict at two different times, both were great. Each dish comes with a small side of greens and a small side of fruits which really balances out the meal. Coffee served is la colombe.

Atmosphere is very cute, but also a bit cramped if you come during a busy time. Come before 10am if you don't want to wait too long.

We saw some great reviews and went there to try it. It was really far from us, but everyone said its a must try. We took a really long Uber ride just for a disappointment. 

Very limited seating, we had to wait a while before we got service. The food was mehh and not very hot. Service was really bad, they took a while to take our order, and we had to ask twice to get the coffee's we ordered. 

The coffee was not hot, we had to ask for cream and sugar, then they brought only sugar and forgot the cream. we got fed up and just drank the warm coffee and left.

I would strongly recommend to stay AWAY from this company.  They also did not show up to my original free estimate appointment.  Once they finally came again they want both spouses present; they come in all friendly asking you questions about your kids, food, just to get you in a happy mood.  That's fine but then they are in a very subtle way extremely pushy and want you to sign in right away.  They don't leave until you say yes; they keep coming back with stories or reasons to sign up.

Then we decided to cancelled our commitment to the project.  We have three business days to cancel.  I called their office and the lady name Teresa told me nothing else was needed but our phone served as notice of cancellation.  Then she said someone would come over to sign cancellation papers.  NOT TRUE.  All they sent was two guys (sales) trying to get you back in.  Honest true these guys would not leave.  They kept going and going with stories or reasons to re consider.  I had to threaten them to call police as they would not leave.  They said no papers needed to be sign.  We had to just tell them to leave the house.  I was ready to call the police or a neighbor who is a state trooper.

I was actually considering just delaying the project for a year but after my experience with their sales tactics, I WILL NEVER EVER use them or recommend them.  Stay away from Power Home Remodeling Group.

I've never had such a terrible experience with a company and the worst manager I've ever talked to.
My family member booked this moving company. They gave very little information during the booking process but she asked how much. They said $125/hour. She also asked if clothing items in bags were okay, the manager said it was. There was no emails sent with any information at all, no call to confirm. In fact, she had to call the day before just so we had peace of mind that movers were actually coming. So with the information we had, we prepared for a few hours at $125/hour.
The movers arrived, with the worst attitudes, I need to add. The most unhelpful, awfully rude, extremely unprofessional people. I just can't believe they actually have jobs in the service industry and not alone in a basement somewhere.
They come in and suddenly all the details have changed! As well as, new information that we were completely blind sided by!Right off, they want $1300 to start and then they would 'refund' what they didn't use. What? Does this company think people just have $1300 without any notice to prepare? The average person usually doesn't, especially since this was a small, one bedroom apartment job, by the way. Then they say the bags aren't okay and they want $90/box things that aren't packed. And, the hourly rate changed to $175/hour to add a 3rd mover, which I can get that, but again, this should have been all laid out in preparation.
My family member called the manager to figure out why everything is different and why nothing was told in advance. He was absolutely horrid, would not let her get one word in. Seriously, managers are supposed to listen, then respond, and not just managers, this is how actual capable and respectful adults communicate. She became so frustrated that he would not even listen for one second, she just had to cancel everything. Who could blame her? Why would we give our business to a company that literally can't be professional in the least and are so miserable rude and awful? The fact we could just cancel without a deposit lost or anything shows how unprofessional this company is.
I take time to call him back. Again, would not even let me get a full question out. I had to spend time getting him to just stop talking for one second in the most frustrating conversation ever. I said, like adults I need you to listen and take turn speaking so we may communicate. He says he doesn't have to let us know about being charged $1300, we all know that's ridiculous. He also said things change on site based on apartment level and distance, etc etc. I said, A competent company would have asked all these questions when they were making the booking and that changes on site are unacceptable unless notified in advance by circumstance. He didn't actually listen to anything, just continued to be defensive and argue. The worst, most infuriating manager, and adult man, I've ever tried to talk to and am so grateful we didn't actually work with this company.
I told him it was a blessing in the end because we were able to find a different company on short notice that ended up being more affordable, profession, and kind. And wouldn't you know, they called and asked all the proper questions and gave all the information necessary to be fully prepared. No 4 figure amount necessary to be charged in advance, either.
Highly do not recommend ever.

Here on Presidents Day a Holiday which is of course notorious for people going to the movies and they have one concession line open which is for snacks as well as buying movie tickets. It's disappointing that they bothered to renovate the movie theater yet the service is still dated. Although I live in Manayunk it makes more sense to drive to Plymouth Meeting rather than deal with this.
Found some really nice and affordable gifts here at Christmas. It is a cute place and I will be back!!

I've been wanting to try this restaurant for many a year. It was featured on Diners, Drive-inns, and Dives several years ago.

The restaurant itself is rather on the smallerside, they also seat a few tables outside. Everything seems very "tight" and crowded inside. 

We came on a Friday evening about 5:45 pm, we had a 35 min wait to be seated. Our server was Kathryn, who was very efficient and answered all our questions.

We started with an appetizer of calamari with a very mild marinara sauce. The calamari cooked fine but was rather blah. Next came the she crab soup, got to say this was not good. it tasted sour to us. We told our server Kathryn and she graciously took it off our bill.

I ordered a blackened grouper sandwich, it came with lettuce, tomato, and tartar sauce. I chose fries to accompany my sandwich. The fries were awful, barely warm, tasted old. The grouper was heavily blacked which was fine with me, it was a decent size fish. Tasted good. 
My Bride had seafood linguine, which she found enjoyable. Not great, just OK.

I think we're one and done for this Dive restaurant.
No good. Service including waitress and manager was unacceptable at the Plymouth Meeting location.   Will not go back to this location again.   Very disappointed .

I've worked here for 3 months, before I had my fill. The family that owns the store comes off as very sweet and kind, but so do wolves in sheep clothing. Not only will you have to deal with privileged snarky customers, but they will also throw their money at you and talk to you any kind of way and management is very okay with this. The bottom line of every business is to make a dollar, but when you own a business, can hide in an office and delegate and not really be in the thick of it---how do you know what your employees are dealing with. I went into this job happy and optimistic. Now: I'm in therapy.
-job has high turnover rate
-for $9 IT IS SERIOUSLY not worth the bullshit
-if you decide to work there be on guard: from all of them. A smile means NOTHING in that store

Before I write this review on the waxing service I received, I feel I need to admit some things upfront. First, I did read the reviews before I decided to go back and I chose to take the reviews under advisement to manage my expectations, because I wanted to us my last Groupon (I purchased a 3-pack) and I had positive past experiences. Lastly, Ms. Ruby is a very sweet girl who revealed she had only been doing this for a few months, and I just didn't have the heart to raise a stink about the end results in front of  her co-worker. I also don't want her to be discouraged from learning and perfecting her craft, but I  won't be back. It's just too painful a process to pay to be someone test dummy. 
I feel I have a responsibility to other consumers to give fair warning of what you should expect if you choose to patronize this business for waxing services (that's the only perspective I can speak from). So here it goes:

Most painful experience EVER, not because it was the first time in a long time but because of the methods used. She used the same type of wax for the entire process which required going over the same area more than once or twice. She wore rubber gloves that may have been too big for her hands because they also stuck to the wax in my very sensitive areas and needed to be pulled from unwaxed areas (twice the pain).  The process was slow and painful. To Ruby's credit, she is very engaging and kept me talking but, I was definitely praying for it to end soon. 
When it was all done and I was cleaning up the wax, there were spots that I still had to cut strands of hair from and there was no smooth feel. Some areas felt shaved instead of waxed, so I know the hair was not fully removed, and I will have to worry about ingrown hairs and bumps. 

Ruby, if you're reading this, you need more practice, honey. You're a sweet girl who would have no problem retaining customers if you were also excellent at this, and I believe you have great potential. 

To potential clients, proceed with caution... If you do decide to utilize Ruby's services, at the very least you'll be greeted with a smile and a very pleasant and engaging young lady.

This place was really cool! There is street parking available around the area, and the restaurant wasn't too crowded when we went. We ordered a few different dishes to split, and almost everything we ordered was great. This was only my second time having Tibetan food, and it did not disappoint. The Momos were my favorite. I would definitely come back here again if I am in the area.
I felt very uneasy about a food,smoothie establishment not requiring masks. Smoothie tasted good but was unsure of it nutritional value.
Late hours and those pepperoni rolls are excellent! Nice friendly staff was cool too. Tx see ya next time

The atmosphere and wine selection make Vina Divino a fantastic destination. It's a family owned wine shop that has such a fun and welcoming vibe. A great spot for celebrations of any kind. We went here for a graduation party and it was such an awesome experience in Santa Barbara. Enjoy a glass of wine with friends and family while making special memories you won't get anywhere else. Perfect place to celebrate something special or life in general!

Adorable market where you can pick up a delicious cheese, sandwiches, salads, or to-go prepared foods!

This shop is a great place.   I love to come for a sandwich at lunchtime, and I always end up leaving with some baked goods, cheeses, and tuna or chicken salad. 

The food is super fresh and full of flavor.  They have great sandwich options, and there is something for pretty much anyone.  

Some of my favorite items are:
