- Turkey with apple butter and brie (sandwich)
- Roast Beef, cheddar, and horseradish sauce (sandwich)
- Chicken Salad (I usually grab a container of this to take home)
- Tuna Salad (I usually grab a container of this to take home)
- Greek Orzo Salad (I usually grab a container of this to take home)
- Chicken Pot Pie
- Panko Walnut Tilapia

However, I do like to pick up something new or change up my usuals every so often. You really can't go wrong here. Plus, there is often something new, as the menu changes pending on the season. 

Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I highly recommend!

Lots of firsts.  First time at Datz, first time having chicken and waffles, first time having a poached egg (somehow).  The chicken and waffles benedict was good, though I don't have anything to compare it to in my mind.

I'd love to go back, a bit pricey but there were a ton of things on the menu that looked awesome.

One of the best wine tasting experiences in my life. Sally was an amazing host, we tried several types of wine and she was the best wine guide. Every single wine we tried was fantastic. We had a living social package and ended up buying 6 bottles of wine. 

I recommend this place to everyone. The facility is so nice, it's old school, quiet and so clean. I cannot wait to go back!!!

This place is so cool! There are so few of these around now and felt like an authentic experience from when I was a kid! They have the speaker that attaches to the side of the car for volume but you can also tune in on a radio station. They have bathrooms and some basic food items like popcorns, soda, water, hot dogs, Chips, etc. you could probably being your dog since it's outside and great for adults or kids. Looking forward to seeing our next movie here!

Michele did a fantastic job on our refinance loan.  She is very knowledgeable about the loan process and all of the options that are available.  This helped us find the right loan with the best terms. I highly recommend Michele to anyone interested in a new loan.

I had a problem with the couch purchased last June. Expected it to be a big ordeal and they were VERY kind and professional, setting up a tech appointment for next week and telling me it was all covered under warranty. No hassle, just support! Yay Macy's! I will definitely return and pass the word!!

I've been coming here a lot recently but things have been going down hill. Very disappointed. Just waited in line for over 20 mins to find out that they're out of romaine for the salads. So I barely had any time left to go get food on my lunch break. The line moves very slowly and they are very inefficient. Not a good lunch spot. The price point is great but issues with the place. I will only be going here from now on. 


Previous post:
What a great addition and value to the block! So reasonable at 7.99 a pizza. If you want it as a bowl or salad is 8.99. You get unlimited topping!! I repeat unlimited toppings! This includes meats, cheeses and veggies. I've only ever had the pizza. But it's a thing pizza. They also have a gluten free option. Personal size. But for the quality ingredients it's a steal! I can't wait to come back and try the many variations. There's one long table in the middle with seats for 12. And a bar area with seats for about 6. So if it's crowded it is definitely more of a take out place. Staff was friendly and helpful especially on my first time when I was confused what to order. Highly recommend it! Can't wait to try a salad! The person in front of me ordered it and it looked tasty.

First off, the setting is casual and clever with rustic and fun accents like the saying painted on the wall by the bathrooms: "Men to the Left because Women are always Right!" Haha! 

We happened to make it right before Happy Hour ended so we got in on some appetizers priced at $6, along with specific drinks off the specialty menu. The drinks were fantastic and unusual mixtures, but the apps were lacking freshness. I got the feeling they were the ones that could be pre-prepped and it was obvious that they were. On the other hand, the fried pickles were wonderful and not over battered, as is the case with most restaurants. Cask chefs kept the tartness of the pickle evident in each bite! 

As for entrees, all 6 of us ordered a different selection and were highly appreciative of the care put into each one. The NOLA shrimp & grits, duck, short ribs, chicken & waffles, and seafood pasta were equally excellent. Truly excellent! The chopped salad was exactly as expected-not bad or great, just a chopped salad with no frills-a but boring when the rest of us had our incredible dishes, but that's a dieter...sad for them! ;-)

We were exploding but still shared 2 desserts, the red velvet bread pudding and the southern sundae with sweet corn ice cream, bacon and maple syrup. Interesting, but I may have just been TOO FULL! Next time I'm starting with dessert! 

I would highly recommend trying Cask out-it was a bit warm inside but the windows over the bar were open to have a two-way bar and it was 90 out. I'd ask for a
Seat further into the restaurant next time if it's a scorcher! Live & learn in Florida!

Some of the best pizza I've had in the Philly area, and for those of you that have been around, that's saying something. Their ingredients make the proper pie - it makes a huge difference. Good thing I don't like close to here, or I'd be having more than the usual diet concerns with overconsumption. Steaks are good, but come for the pie.

Typically I balance ambiance, service, and food when writing reviews. I have noticed that most four and five star resturants are very good in all 3 categories. Not this restaurant, the food is exceptional but the service was poor, and the musty smell of mold does not help the dated ambiance. 

I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and was expecting a conventional possibly boring entrée. However, the chicken surpassed my expectations and was perfectly grilled and juicy. In addition to the flavorful chicken the bread was baked perfectly, fries were served extra crispy, and the homemade hot sauce was addicting.

I've only been to Ruby Tuesdays a few times, this was my first time at this location. It was close to where my friend and I were, so we stopped in. It was empty with the exception of one other table and a group at the bar, but it was a Monday. We waited a little bit to be seated, it seemed all the employees were in the back or something.  The hostess apologized and seated us, we received out menus and ordered drinks. As I'm looking through the menu a random guy walls in and asks the other table to use their phone... Huh... So as he is standing there obviously not with the party, the Waiter comes over to take our order, looks over at the table and noticed something off but says and does nothing. I was ready to leave, my friend wanted to stay, so I obliged. I ordered the ribeye and a Ruby relaxer, he came back shortly saying they were no longer making drinks for the night... Huh? But I could order a wine or something I declined, but he kept asking me apologizing and kind of forcefully asking me to order something else, I assumed he would make it complimentary or something, I was wrong. Anyways my meal came, I was pleasantly surprised, they steak was really good, seasoned well and cooked to the perfect temperature I indicated. My friend's ribs looked good as well.  I would visit Ruby Tuesday again, just not this location.

Enough is enough with the attitude you'll receive at this place. I am a regular customer and have been for around 10 years or so. It's just sad that in our current climate, the staff goes out of their way to be rude to you. 
I'm nice, I'm courteous, I wear a mask when I come in because they ask even though I'm vaxed. 
Is it really that hard to just be nice? You're in the service industry.....just BE NICE! 
I always support local Tucson places over the chains especially with restaurants, especially NOW!
But no more for me. I'm tapped out. I can't support this place and I recommend you don't either

Very cool place! Mostly all outdoors so plan according. Beautiful views! Lots of restrooms and water fountains around. There are coyotes, a walking path, wolves, beavers, otters, mountain lions, big horned sheep, etc. They also bring some animals out for interaction/Q&A. We were there when they brought out an owl. Very cool. Everything is reasonable priced; ice cream, souvenirs, and snacks. There is a touch pool for sting rays but you have to pay to get in to this specific exhibit and then pay extra to feed them. I would say this is the only downfall to this place. Otherwise a great experience and must see.
I was here a summer or so ago and thought it was a great place to a ballgame. Was never at the old Busch Stadium, so I have nothing to compare it to but this was a great ballpark to see a game at.

Bad service and mediocre food.  

Will try something else if I'm at this airport again. Caesar  salad was not that great.

I stopped here to get a brake tag one morning. There was only one car ahead of me and everything was quick and efficient! You can get either a 1 year tag ($10) or 2 year tag ($20). The guy that works here was very nice and professional, so I will definitely return when it's time for another. There's also a hand car wash located here, which may be convenient if you're rushed for time.

Located right across from the Galleria in a dark and unassuming building connected to a hotel is a gem of a coffee house. Parking is free  outside in the lot in front (right) of the hotel entrance. When you get inside, seating is a little confusing. You can seat yourself at the bar or wait for someone to notice you and seat you at a table in the main coffee bar, or upstairs in a dining room if you want more privacy. It just wasnt clear either time we visited what to do.
      Delicious delicious!! That is my review. Sumptuous rich coffee and really good quality food here. I have had the incredible avocado toast on crusty baguette and a chai latte on my first visit, then cocktails and sandwiches on my second. Every single bite I had to eat here was delicious. Like high end without a huge pricetag. My favorite thing was the goat cheese burger which was gooey and savory, the bun chewy and dense, the patty seared to a juicy perfection and seasoned well. I could eat that every day! The "buffalo" chicken sandwich was a really tasty crunchy big chicken breast on same fab bun, but spice was pretty mild. The sauce was a thin aioli with red cabbage that turned it pink! It was good, but not unusual.
The burger came with fries, but I upgraded to truffle fries. Do this! Everytime. Thin crispy perfect fries with a savory oil drizzle and plenty of parm cheese, they were a knockout (And I am not a big fry person). We also had an order of fried pickles which had a very thin and crispy batter and nice ranch dipping sauce. Not too salty or greasy like some fried pickles. Very good. Everything here including sauces tastes housemade. 
The only thing I didnt care for was a wine spritzer I got which was sour and bland for a juice drink. The cider we had was amazing though.
Next time I want to buy some of their house roasted coffee and have a Chai latte and dessert or breakfast food. Cant wait for  girls night out so we can return!

This is the most amazing idea they have ever had to stick a salad and wrap stand/place in the big cheezy. So now when my husband wants big cheezy I can still be healthy and good on my diet and get a wrap or salad !!!! The salads are huge too and the ingredient are fresh, this is something that was defiantly needed in town bc it's hard to find a good to go salad . I would def give them a try if your are looking for a good salad and good prices too

I had to move last minute and needed movers right away. I called Best Price Movers and they were able to fit me in their schedule the next day. The movers were professional, personable and quick! I move a lot and they were some of the best movers I've worked with. Oh! And their prices are great too. Beating out most of their competitors.

Stopped in on a Tuesday with my 92 year old Mom.  She had just received her second Covid vaccination at St Thomas.   
There was no line when we arrived.  Mom got meatloaf, yams, and green beans along with a roll, chow chow, and water.  I got meatloaf, mashed potatoes, squash, a roll, and lemonade.
The place was clean and bright.  The cashier carried mom's tray for her
It was all delicious and we had no room for dessert.  Another great dining experience for Mom.   The $30 was fair as the food was homemade, fresh, and authentic.

I visited here last night for an early dinner. I've been wanting to come so I was really excited to finally have a chance to get here. The fall menu for me was kind of eh.    I started with the pumpkin seed dip (it was okay, not the most appetizing looking thing). I got the scallops for dinner - so good! The featured drink was great, but didn't look as advertised on their social media. The inside of the restaurant is super cozy and I really enjoyed the ambiance. Our server was great and everything came out at a good pace. They are doing 5% off for cash, which I think is great. 90 minute time limit so if you're looking to hang out with a large group, this might not be the best time to dine here. Overall, not thrilled with the new menu but the experience was good.

This place has THE BEST pancakes in the Philly area! I was very pleased to learn the restaurant is still operating (at limited capacity) however, when we arrived, my hubby and I were seated right away. Service was quick and accurate and the prices are good.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory for a work dinner as it is usually good for large parties. The service was great but the food was very meh. My friends ordered the Jamaican chicken and shrimp that was served to them cold and I had the bistro shrimp pasta. The pasta and sauce was delicious but the shrimp itself was very bland and honestly made me push them aside. I don't know if it was just a coincidence that all the shrimp dishes turned out mediocre. I may come back but not on my own accord
Awesome service. Great staff. Good prices. Caitlin is a rockstar. Easy online booking. Highly recommend.

Called in an order for pickup. Got a couple of cheesesteaks and an upside down pie. I went with the cheesesteak with cooper sharp cheese, it sounded like the thing to do. It's not my favorite cheesesteak in philly, but it was pretty good. I tried my friend's buffalo chicken cheesesteak and I liked that a lot and wished I'd gotten that one instead. The pizza was great though, I'm salivating thinking about it. It was also really heavy, it felt like a workout carrying it while walking. I do wish they accepted card, I think this spot is too pricey to be cash only.

The ultimate sports bar. A perfect spot to watch the game. Every seat is a great seat to see the game. The food is better than your typical bar and pub food. Our food was surprisingly delicious and we left interested in coming back to try other menu items.

I first had the pleasure of dining on their delectable ramen when I participated in a Yelp Elite event at home during the pandemic. My tonkatsu ramen was out of this world and I was having a serious craving one day and decided to take my daughter for dinner. After we arrived she decided that she wanted a poke bowl instead of ramen. After reading the menu I decided to do the same lol

We decided to get a couple of appetizers and chose the chicken karage (Japanese fried chicken) and Ijji chicken wings. The karage was okay, not a lot of flavor really but the wings, oh my oh my the wings were delightful! Fried to crispy perfection and covered in a tasty sweet and spicy sauce. I could've eaten them for days! 
 
Now for the poke. The list of items for the poke bowls is quite extensive and, if you've never ordered a bowl before, can be a bit intimidating. Lucky for us, we had an amazing waiter who patiently assisted us with some of our selections. I ordered my fish and veggies over a bed of warm rice but you can also have it served or greens if you prefer to. On top of the multitude of various fresh veggies and accoutrements (wonton chips, fried garlic, lemon slices, fried onions, sesame seeds, etc) you get to choose from a variety of several sauces. Choose one or choose them all. I picked a spicy mayo and a citrus ponzu type of sauce. The fish was so fresh, the veggies cold and crisp, the sauces were the bomb, bowl was epic! The large bowl was enough for my dinner and leftover lunch the next day. My only dilema now is which amazing entree to get next time: the amazing ramen or the unbelievable poke!

I'm a Titanium Bonvoy member with lifetime Platinum status so I'm very familiar with all Marriott brands and this property is very tired and in desperate need of an update. I stayed at this property Dec 29-30 2021 and did not have a good experience. I booked a 2 room suite with a bay view and paid full price for the room.  So I could have a touchless experience at the hotel I did a mobile check in on my Marriott Bonvoy app and awaited my mobile key so when I arrived at the hotel I could proceed directly up to my room without having to stop at the front desk.  I arrived at the hotel and the mobile check-in process failed so I had to stop at the front desk which was annoying. The front desk agent told me that I was booked in a "presidential suite" so I was excited to get up to my room.  When I did get up to my room it was not a presidential suite but was a standard two room suite that had very old and worn furniture, worn carpet and generally needed updating. The televisions were very small and old. When I went to open the curtains of the room the view that I had was of the roof of the hotel and the windows were absolutely filthy!  It was difficult to even clearly see out of them. As a frequent customer of Marriott I am finding I am continually more and more disappointed in their customer service and quality of product and services.  There are other more favorable hotel choices in the area and I would urge anyone considering this property to look around and do your diligence.

Adam, Patrick, and Robert offer impeccable service and advice at Copper Still. I've enjoyed their Friday night tastings for nearly a year now and almost always bring a bottle home from the tasting bar. Adam does a great job of expanding his clients' palates, whether it is for wine, spirits, or beer. They also have been very accommodating with special orders as well. 

A small store with big time service, selection, and personality.

Thank you, Quinn!!!! I went in to see if there was anything they could do to help me with a pretty bad scratch on my car. I have a 2012 Jetta SE and I'm gifting it to my brother so I wanted to get rid of this unsightly scratch on my bumper without paying a crazy amount of money. I read other raving reviews for this business and I'm so happy I decided to come here. Quinn greeted me immediately, walked outside to look at my car, and handled the entire job within ten minutes. He was extremely friendly and thorough. He did an AMAZING job! He completely removed all of the paint transfer from the pole I hit and filled in the spots where the paint was chipped. I'm so impressed with this business and I would recommend to anyone looking for quality repairs!

I love Poco's. Maybe it's not authentic Mexican food but Tex-Mex can be equally as good. Plus they have some American additions (Burgers, Wings, Cheesesteak Eggrolls, and FRIED PICKLES) on the menu.

I highly recommend the Pickle Pickle. It's my favorite fried pickle appetizer in the area. I find myself comparing other pickles to this. It's only 4 spears so you can definitely eat an order yourself. It comes with a yogurt dill sauce that is drinkable.

It's a very fun and friendly atmosphere. The service is fast!

FYI - Half Priced Margaritas on Thursdays!

Food: Good overall. The quality and quantity are good and the taste of the food is good. The tofu was warm, I thought it would be hot -- steaming hot since we waited for a while but it was not. 

Service: Not the best. We waited over an hour for two noodle plates. The place was not busy... bunch of empty tables and seats. I was about ready to leave when the food finally arrived. 

Recommendation: Order to pick up. It's not worth it to wait over an hour to get food and the service being 'meh'.

We came here because on their website it  said "kids eat free" on Thursdays....warning this is only if you buy an entree which are only 6 menu choices.  Also this was not posted on the website, told to us by our waiter or posted anywhere we could see it in the restaurant.  When we spoke with the manager he was not apologetic and very defensive.  He even snickered at our complaint.  We purchased two adult meals and 2 kids meals and were there for lunch.  The cost difference between the adult meal  we purchased and an entree meal was $1.  We left feeling frustrated and disappointed in their service.

I really enjoyed the gluten-free waffles when I visited Waffles on Maple last year. I wasn't impressed by their failure to provide coffee cream and was pleasantly surprised to find they now have real cream instead of only the powdered ick when I was there before. The ladies working on the day I visited were so friendly and helpful. When I had visited before, there was a girl cooking who ignored you when you said hello. There was none of that rudeness this time.
The restaurant is small, but it is seriously cute. I do like sitting at the bar which looks out on the bright red property next door. I had the Walking in New Orleans waffle which was my favorite from last time. The pralines on it are wonderful, and I can't get a waffle like that in Ontario that's gluten-free. I also got their hashbrowns again, which are delicious! 
When my server found out I was gluten-free, she pointed out they had GF king cakes. I'd already bought one at The King Cake Hub, but WOM had a Bavarian cream flavoured one. I had to get it. The first piece was delicious and really had that Bavarian cream flavour, but I believe it had all travelled to the front of the cake. The rest was very good, but I wanted more BC.
The coffee was great, as usual, even better with the real dairy. I really appreciated the delicious food and very friendly service. I will definitely be back when I visit next February!
This is my second time at this location. The staff was nice this time as well as my first time going. I was very happy and pleased with the service I recieved.

I'm always up for Subway so I typically know what to expect food-wise and this location did not disappoint. 

There was only one woman working and she said it was her first time opening and working alone and apologized for it but she was doing a great job! Nothing to apologize for and she got our sandwiches perfect. 

There is only so much to say after a certain amount of Subway reviews I've left but this location was clean, service was nice, veggies were as fresh as they come for a chain, and I'd come here again.

With Ardiente I don't even know where to begin! How about the front door? The place is stunning. Draped head to toe in sexy sensual decor. From top to bottom the location glistens despite its dark atmosphere. The bar is sleek and inviting with a warm sophistication that is matched only by the competency of its bar staff. 

I came here with five of my others friends for my birthday on a spur of the moment decision and I am so glad we did. We weren't sure if we were going to eat or not but after tasting a number of their incredible craft cocktails we figured this place likely had even more to offer other than looks and fancy cocktails. Boy were we right!

Our bartender Jolene made some great suggestions and because we couldn't decide we were offered a chefs tasting menu. For a super reasonable price my guests and I were treated to plate after plate of mouth watering meals. I'd like to name everything we ate but there was so much happening that I couldn't possibly fit it all here. The tune collar fried rice, the volcano chicken, the INCREDIBLE ceviche, an amazing cauliflower side dish that blew my mind with it's creative and unique flavor profiles... the tiradito was shocking but my absolute favorite thing was the bbq spare ribs, which our bar tender informed us was made with amazing citrus glaze that ran a gamut of flavors and ending up being a wildly complex fall off the bone rack of ribs. 

The variety of food was wild, yet held together beautifully through unique flavors and considered pairings. I wouldn't be able to go back without getting the chef's tasting again because anything less would leave you wishing you tried every item on the menu (next time we likely will!)

The hostess was warm and welcoming from the start and several staff members, including an incredibly charming manager named Ron and even the Chef himself came to talk about the food and drinks we were so thoroughly enjoying. 

The tasting ended with five of the most amazing desserts I have ever tasted, including a sugar free treat you have to taste to believe. 

This place is dripping with finesse and skill and you can see and taste it at every step. Ask for a tour because the location is magnificent! If I had enough friends I'd book their private lounge (complete with statues of Shiva and amazing other decor elements). 

Thanks again Ardiente! My birthday was a true treat at your establishment!
Great Happy Hour! A great atmosphere to spend time with friends ! The chips with the spinach artichoke dip was suspect ! But would highly recommend their loaded tater tots and chicken quesadillas !

A must-place-to-eat-that-isnt-near-Burbon! Highly recommend the broiled oysters. They're super cheesy and seasoned well. Get the garlic bread as an appetizers because well... who doesn't like and or need to carb up whole in New Orleans? 

Found out about this place from a local who said it's their favorite spot in the city. 

Expect a less than perfect experience when it comes to service.  All of the food - appetizers and entrées- came out at the same time which is frustrating since everything would sit instead of coming out fresh.

I have mixed feelings about Boardwalk. I love the vibe and the fact that Maplewood finally has an ice cream shop! However, for someone who advertises vegan options, per their website, they only have two vegan/dairy-free options on their menu, and often (possibly always), only one of those flavors is offered on any given day. As someone with a severe dairy allergy, those two options are the only ones I can consume; making trips to Boardwalk with my husband or friends a hit-or-miss experience. If the available flavor is one I'm not a fan of, or if it is out for the day, I find myself forced to choose between missing out on time with friends, or going with them, only to sit and watch them eat ice cream (which I LOVE) with nothing in front of me-- which is sadly reminiscent of my past, decades-long struggle with anorexia. I would LOVE for them to have more vegan/dairy-free options, or at least to have both available daily. 

Personal Opinion on Vegan/Dairy-Free Options:

Mocha Cookie Crumble: 
I LOVE THIS FLAVOR! Seriously, probably the best dairy-free ice cream I've ever had! I am a sucker for coffee-flavored ice cream, and the mocha ice cream pairs incredibly well with the chocolate ribbons and cookie crumbles. 
Keep in mind, this ice cream has a STRONG mocha/coffee flavor, so if you're not a fan of coffee or coffee-flavored desserts, this one is not for you. 

Lemon Poppyseed:
I am not a fan. Typically I love lemon desserts, but this one just didn't do it for me. In my opinion, it was more creamy than tart, and the coconut milk just didn't pair well with the light lemon flavor. 

Again, both of these are my personal opinions. Feel free to try them out and make your own!

Stopped by this spot for a light meal. I honestly wasn't very impressed. The sandwich was lacking in flavor and the bread had an odd texture and taste. Maybe I just hit them in an off day, but I wouldn't recommend it.

The cutest brunch place in Franklin. We went on a Sunday around 9 and only had to wait 5 minutes for a table. You order at the kiosk station and they have cute merch too! 

The Brown Sugar Lemonade taste like homemade goodness. It's the perfect sweet to sour ratio and full of flavor. Free refills as well!! 

For the main entrees, we ordered the East Nasty and the Princess. Overall taste and portion size were amazing! You will leave feeling full and satisfied. The East Nasty is a classic twist on biscuits and sausage gravy. The egg ($2 extra) was a good addition on this entree though it seemed a little pricey for an egg; You can choose how you would like the egg served. The Princess is a hot chicken biscuit sandwich and delicious with every bite. There is a slight spiciness to it and ends with a sweet flavor. The pickle are a great addition to the dish. 

Last but not least were the bonuts!!! Not expensive and they are to die for. The donut portion is a typical southern fried donut rolled in sugar. They sit on a blueberry jam and are topped with a cream that has a slight hint of lemon! Worth it. You must order these. 

The staff was friendly and came frequently asking if everything was going well.

Absolutely love Frankford Hall! I always come here when friends are in town or when the weather's nice. Tons of indoor and outdoor seating so you can always find a place to relax with your friends. The beer selection is pretty robust and the bartenders have always been willing to let me try something before I order. Beyond that, when I'm indecisive about what I'm in the mood for, they work with me and help me find what I'm looking for.

You get a fairly interesting crowd (i.e. a nice mix of young professionals, parents, locals, tourists, etc.) which gives Frankford such an interesting vibe. It really comes across as a nice, drama free place to hang out with your friends and maybe make some new ones along the way. Since the outdoor seating is picnic table style, you might very well end up drinking next to a stranger. 

The food at Frankford can be a bit pricey, but it's tasty and the portions are huge, so I'd say it's generally worth it. The pretzels are top notch. Overall, this is one of my favorite Philly places and I highly recommend it.

Cute coffee joint with lots of indoor and outdoor seating (even in the covid era). Music is pretty good for studying and conversations are kept low most of the time. 

Ordered an iced latte and felt like the coffee was fairly weak compared to other places I've been in the past month. Will definitely be back for the environment, but feel like you can find a better beverage elsewhere!

I had my entire home, which was wood, re-surfaced with stucco three years ago.  I wrote a review then complimenting Nevada Drywall and Stucco for their outstanding work.  This year I had a new window installed which was bigger than the original and the stucco box around the window had to removed.  I called the company and set up a time for them to redo the window framing.  Although they are very busy, they found the time to come to my place and get the work done.  It looks as though it was the original! If you are considering having stucco work done - give them a call.  You won't be disappointed.

This is between a 3 and a 4. So. I was so excited for this place. Lobster rolls, ice cream... all my faves.
Since this is one of my first covid dining out experiences, I will say that the tables were nicely spread apart. I was also pleasantly surprised by the fact that there were less people walking by this busy corridor of 13th st so I didn't feel claustrophobic.
The good: the margarita slush pops were fun and tasty. They're like boozy ice-pops. It was fantastic (if a bit pricey). My friends also enjoyed their drinks.
The also good: the soft shell crab platter. The crab was nicely fried, not overly battered. And OMG were the potatoes good. Perfectly crispy on the outside. The corn salad could have used a bit more dressing, but overall this plate was a success.
The pimento cheese was also a winner.

Now... the less-than-good. I'm not a send-back food kind of person. But we had the hush puppies--which I love--and I had to send them back. TWICE. And perhaps it's just an unfortunate and just bad luck. The first time, they were clearly not cooked through with runny batter still in the middle. The second time... well... they were cooked through, but...
At least it was batter and not raw meat, right?

In any case. They server and manager did try to rectify the situation, and I give them major major props for their prompt attention. 
 
I will return for drinks, but just not sure if I'm ready for another food performance.

Looking to take a break inside from the cold?! Smiley Indy is an indoor play land + arcade. Picture a giant ball pit with more square footage than the average family home and in that ball pit there are slides, teeter totters, and spinny-go-round things. It looks like somewhere Blippi would hang out!

There is also an area for younger kids, an arcade, VR pods, a lego room, and a snack stand. The amount of fun is endless and it's a great spot to wear your kids out in the Castleton area.

Would highly recommend for a spot to hang out with kids when they can't be outside. The kids loved it and it wore them out!

While Whole Foods has the overall customer service and variety, Trader Joes has the better lunch selection, frozen foods department, and all around better buys. Trader Joe's is also better for the quick get what you need and go shopping, because your usually compelled to hang around Whole Foods a little while longer then you intended. and while Whole Foods has the better Whole Body section by far, your generally going to find a better deal on vitamins here. 
My only flaw with with Trader Joe's is how desolate its aisles can be on most weekdays. when it gets hit by a big sale aftermath, it really gets hit! I have seen row after row of empty shelves on a number of occasions as a result. but they make up for it with the customer service and help they give when this happens.

Bar Ferdinand had long been on my "to try" list. Our party of four plus a dog arrived on a Sunday evening and we were fortunate enough to get a table outside right away. We took some time discussing the menu and came up with a pretty extensive list. 

Highlights for me were the surtido de carnes (charcuterie board consisting of four delicious cured meats), patatas bravas (fried potatoes in a tasty aioli), datiles rellenos (stuffed dates), queso de cabra cocinado (baked goat cheese with pine nuts) and the almejas (steamed clams). These items would all make my list on a return visit. 

Items that left me less impressed were the empanadas, which had so much potential but ended up tasting kind of bland. Same with the stuffed peppers, which had little flavor other than the peppers themselves. The hits were far greater than the misses, and I'm looking forward to seeing how the menu changes with Ansill's reign.

This is the sleaziest club/bar I have ever been to. I have been here 3 different times & the experience is the same. They pretty much let people do what they want. People that are already having a seat at the bar are rude & its hard to get the bartenders attention. They let girls dance on the bar like in Wild cats/Coyote Ugly They also let people dance on the restaurant tables which is dangerous & not to mention nasty cause most girls we saw we wearing heels & drunk. The last thing that made me say never going there again!  are the people there that are obviously drunk start pushing people & all the security does is just say stop or break it up. Well because security did not break up this one fight a young guy there got knocked out as soon as he stepped out of the bar. His his teeth got knocked out & when he hit the concrete head was busted. The paramedics were still trying  to revive him as we were leaving. The security is not good at all for  such a rowdy place.

Eew.  The produce is terrible!  I don't normally shop here but needed some veggies and a few other things - and I've found other Acme's to be decent.  Not this one!  Half of the (overpriced) produce I bought is disgusting.  One of the garlic cloves I opened up was half rotten.  The bag of mini sweet peppers I opened the next day had 2 peppers in it starting to rot.  I was going to buy parsnips, but all the bags in the store looked like were starting to rot.  The organic section is about 2 feet wide, and if you want something organic besides carrots, celery, lemons or limes you're out of luck.  The rest of the veggies I got (broccoli, tomatoes, onion, carrots) are ok - not rotten but pretty bland and tasteless.  Some of the in-season fruit is ok.  The grapes, blueberries and cherries aren't spectacular, but are pretty fresh and tasty.  But beyond that, ick.

The rest of the store is small with limited selection.  I can be a somewhat picky shopper (spoiled by Trader Joes, Wegmans, etc.) but this is pretty bad.  No organic or nitrate-free packaged deli meat.  No raw nuts.  Part of this is just that it's a small store so there's limited shelf space.  But I left without several items I came for just b/c they didn't carry them or anything similar.

If I was going for dry goods, or other non-produce items, this store might get 2-2.5 stars.  It's not filthy and the staff seemed friendly enough.  But for produce, my main aim, it is HORRIBLE.  I spent just as much on my veggies here as I do at TJ's or Wegman's, and was either grossed out or underwhelmed by half of it.  Rotten food - Yuck.

We went here for my wife's birthday. I had a rack of pork ribs. They were excellent. My wife had the burnt ends. She found them to be a bit spicy with more sauce than she felt they should. She comes from Kansas City, where the flavour of the burnt ends are in the meat, not the sauce. We also had the garlic fries. They were very good. We also had the oven baked beans. Not our favourites - in fact ate few of them. They appeared not to have been baked long enough. Our server was friendly, efficient and couldn't have been better. She didn't charge us for the beans - it was her initiative. The grapefruit radlar I had was great. Overall a very good experience. We will be back.

This is the creepiest hotel ever. The concept of rehabbing an old train station into a hotel sounded cool but staying here was a whole other trip. The statues are creepy as they placed right in front of your room. The first two nights, I had a pair of nuns and the front desk just around the corner from my room. After a leak in the HVAC, I was moved to a room near the pool, near other statues including a little girl standing on a beam above my head. 

Customer service here is mediocre. The front desk staff are constantly clueless and rude. The housekeeping staff only clean parts of your room while throwing away items that aren't trash (like my commuter mug!). The only bright side is the maintenance crew-- Richard, who came to assess the leak, gave me a dinner comp ($75 for two at the Pullman lounge) for the hassle. 

Lastly, I found myself feeling super hot every night due to the bedding. Other colleagues staying at the hotel felt the same way. Really odd.

The service was good, the live music was AWESOME, but the food was only okay.  Extremely overpriced for what we got.  The gumbo was almost $7 for a small cup.  But in their defense, it was full of seafood so I suppose the cost was justified.  Too bad it wasn't for our taste.  It tasted bitter to us and not what we were used to. Definitely not the gumbo like the one I've had at Heaven on Seven in Chicago.  Maybe I'm not Southern enough to appreciate it?  We also shared the sampler plate which came with fried alligator, frogs legs, calamari, fried stuffed mushrooms, and fried meat balls.  Maybe I had too much fried food during the trip and was tired of it?  It was good the first few bites but I got tired of it and full really quickly.  A great place for music and dancing though!

The Saloon is a Bella Vista fixture, and is quite an interesting place.  It's definitely got that "Italian" feel, which is a big part of its charm.  They have a nice menu with seafood, veal, steaks, and chicken along with drinks and appetizers.  The food was very good, the portions were large, and the service was a-ok.  It's not an especially formal place, but rather a place you can go casual or dressed up and fit in either way.  They have given up their "Amex Only" policy, and now take a full range of cards.  Cash flipped out of a roll of $100's is perfectly fine, as well.

Run... 35% is what they charge.  Like others I wished I had did my homework before moving forward.  This is my first time using a public adjuster. It's horrible because now I don't have enough money to get the work done on my home.  After speaking with other insurance adjusters and agencies the 35% actually equals up to 10% of profit fee 10% contractor's fee and then 10% of adjuster fee.  So they collect all this money and offer no assistance with the contractors and from the way they operate right now I would not want to use their contractors if they had any.  Run... Do not use these guys.  They will not give me a breakdown of their fees and what the insurance company expects from me.

Best bird store ever ! They've got it all.. amazing hand painted locally made feeders.. as well as standard feeders, bird houses, and etc for all types of birds.  Everyone is very knowledgable and extremely helpful, everything from helping me pick out products to loading my car up.. I've never been disappointed with their excellent customer service. All their bird feed is made in house.. if you are ever in the area come in and check it out.. you might just end up walking out with something special

Burgers are great on a rainy Friday evening and this place was close by. 
This place is a lot bigger than it looks from outside and I love the decor. The bathrooms are small but have art by Amberella, which I love so much! 

Highly recommend the mac & cheese, I wish they sold it by the pint. It's the perfect comfort food. I had the veggie burger, the patty was mostly black beans, and it was good! I just wish they had more options for those that don't want meat. I will definitely​ return ​to try the tater-tots.

This Starbucks is very often super busy. I have rarely come when the line is not a mile long. So I am so glad Starbucks came out with an order ahead option on their app. The seating can get a little tight, but usually you can get a seat. On the weekends, all manner of Newtownian folk come out, and it is hilarious to eavesdrop on their conversations. The nice thing is there is a large parking lot in the back, so access is easy.

I got another top notch A+ cut from Will the other day.  I got several compliments.
I called made a same-day appointment and took the bus over, he was very flexible with the timing.
The price was also very fair for a men's haircut in the city.

Holy balls. This was not expected! I was like "I'm hungry now and here is food" well needless to say I downloaded yelp just to leave this review. 


THIS FOOD IS SO GOOD IT GAVE ME A MASSIVE FOOD BONER

Every time I order from here I'm missing something in my order. It's covid you put stickers on the bag so the dashers can't even check the order to make sure everything's in there. At least have the common courtesy to do your job and check yourself. I missing some nuggets. 1 time I got 2 slushees that I didn't even order and no meal. This is stupid get it together.

Loving hut was a LOVELY experience.  The Loving Hut was delicious from start to finish. I walked in and ordered a mango bubble tea - it was delicious! The tea tasted great, the bubbles were yummy and tapicoa-ey. The food we followed up with was great too - I ordered a noodle dish (Chow Mein) that was delightful - and  my friends soups, cheesey bread, and curry were all equally wonderful. I recommend the bubble tea highly, as well as all the food that we tried.  All of it was great - I look forward to trying it all in the future. The restaurant itself is not very sit down formal-ish. More of a cafe. Well lite, interesting asian channels playing on large tv's. The service was pretty awesome. And there are some funny signs all around.  All in all a great experience.

Do not go to this wash & fold place on 2820 Roberts ave. they are located in the Fox Shopping Center across from ShopRite.. I took all my clothes there and had them washed in folded. When I want to pick them up all of my clothes were stolen. My children's clothes were the but all of my clothes except for bras were gone. I was told by the attendant that I would be refunded my money and then the mangers Gale & Larry which they refused to give a last name called me from a blocked number and told me they were not refunding my money. And they believed their attendants. I took the same  police back up there they then changed the story and said that they were not coming in. They were the managers and they were not refunding my money.... All of my belonging jeans, shirts, dresses, shirts were all stolen:.. I now have NO clothes... Place do Not patronize this place.. They are these and the owners do not stand behind what they say... #frauds #foxnews #boycott #foxstreet #bakerslaundry #philadelphia #philly  this is not the first time this has happened this just happened to a girl last week and the owner told her he would not be refunding her anything and that she could take him to small claims court! They are running new commercials saying they can pick you clothes up from your home and bring them back to you... Please DO NOT Go here! Ever!

I'm a huge fan of dive bars, and this one would probably be super close to my heart as it is walking distance from my house. 

Dim lighting? Check.
Your friendly neighborhood bartender? Check. 
Good prices? Check check. 
Rockin' beer selection? Yes, sir.

But, it also has two things that make me unlikely to come back. Smoking, and only beer in bottles. 

So, while I love me a divey bar, this one just isn't going to cut my mustard.

You start with the most amazing biscuits on earth...then on to Lobster Dumplings which are the best you ever had in your life....
This time we shared  the blacken red fish and the chicken cracklin skin drum...over the TOP.....THEN THE SALTED CARMEL .. .Seriously 10+

This place was so awesome! Who doesn't love hip hop music and pizza? The vibe is great and staff is friendly! If you see Ms. Willeta at the front door tell her I sent you! She was the best representation from the door! She was very friendly and kept that line moving! It is a smaller place so if you don't like to sit with people you don't know....get over it! The pizza is so fresh with fresh ingredients and you can add any topping you like! I will definitely be back! Did I mention they have a great variety of local brew on tap as well? 

For dessert you better unbutton those pants and get ready for a cinnamon roll! They are so good they are opening a store across the street with cinnamon rolls! We will be back!

'Closer to/nearly 4 Stars' -but needs some work 

Thai food is my favorite food genre, every three times I go out to eat it is for Thai Food; as a result, I'm extremely picky about my "Thai Food Frequents. While Moo Dang doesn't live up to some of my other favorite Thai Places, it is still very good.


Food:

Both times I have had their food it has been very tasty.

Fresh summer rolls with tofu - I loved the fact that they used healthier types of lettuce and the cilantro sauce it came with was different, un-expectant but very tasty. My only complain was that the Spring roll were very loosely packed and I wasn't crazy about the minced tofu in it. I much prefer the tradition tofu strips. 

Green Curry with Tofu - OK this dish has no faults, it is truly delicious! Rich creamy coconut base with delectable curry seasoning and fresh vegetables that have been cooked perfectly! NOM! NOM! This is a just a great dish!

5 Star Level Spicy Kra-Pow! Spicy Basil with Tofu - I love the nontraditional tofu they used in this stir fry, typically Thai restaurants use extra firm tofu, but this was a medium firm to firm tofu -the result was a creamer texture that was a heavenly contrast to the 5 Star Spicy level I ordered. The herbs and vegetables are super fresh and were cooked perfectly, only wish they used more! The dish was onion heavy, I love onions but I always feel restaurants use onions as filler to make the dish look larger -less onion more green beans please :)  Also, while the 5 Star spicy level was spicy, if 5 is suppose to be their hottest, I would say the 5 Star Spicy Level was really about a 3.5 spicy level. 

Brown Rice - They use a super good quality rice and it was cooked perfectly: fluffy, firm but not crunchy, and not at all soggy or sticky!

 Sticky Rice with Mango - Rice was sweet and cooked perfectly, mango was fresh. HOWEVER, they didn't serve it with the traditional creamy coconut milk sauce that I am accustomed to and that I love :( rather it came with a citrus flavored sauce it wasn't bad but I didn't really love it. Keep everything else but replace that sauce with the traditional  creamy coconut milk sauce and you'd have a great dish!

***That said*** I would also like to state that I wish they had more vegetarian and vegan dishes.... they are noticeably short in comparison to other Thai restaurants in the area. I know they said they would modify dishes for vegan and vegetarians, but some dishes just can't be modified e.g. meat skewers. 

Also their portion sizes both times I have been there, are noticeably smaller than other local Thai restaurants. We went there for a dinner and I have had larger portions served to me during lunch specials at other Thai restaurants. 



Service:

Service was friendly, prompt, and professional. No complaints. 



Pricing: 

I already mentioned the noticeably smaller portion sizes in the Food section, so I won't repeat it here.
 
Also, while I realize some people may like Moo Dang's pricing plan, I personally loathe when restaurants charge extra for sides that 95% of people are going to order. People eat rice and noodles with asian entrees, RICE IS A STAPLE! When I see a staple item with an extra charge, I automatically start sing Les Miserable's song, Master of the House ..."Charge 'em for the lice! Extra for the mice! Two percent for looking in the mirror twice!" and it makes me cranky. I feel staples should be included with the meal and charge a little more so the total price covers the cost of the rice and it's preparation! Soooooo therefore (in my opinion) any non-noodle dish should automatically include the rice. Brown rice can be extra and if someone doesn't want the rice, maybe offer a discount. 

Also charging the same amount for tofu as you do for beef is ridiculous! I can go to Costco and purchase a month's supply of tofu for me for under $6.00! Moreover the time cooking tofu is far less than cooking meat! NUTSHELL: Tofu is NOT anywhere as expensive as beef! 



Cleanliness and Decor:

While I prefer nicer decor environments, I can get over the simple, 'cheaper', and non matching color scheme of the decor of Moo Dang. However, there is no excuse in my book for a lack of cleanliness. Please wipe down the vinyl booth seats! Every booth in my eye site had seats with food spots. An 5 extra minutes max a night in cleaning would remove this problem. Also, your bathroom needed a scrub down and remove some of the clutter. 



Yelp Check In Offer:

Fried Fish Balls -thanks but NO THANKS! said the vegetarian Yelper, please offer something for non meat eaters!

Great big ole burgers, crispy tater tots, unique libations and sodas, and a good selection of beer. On a sunny day, the Biergarten is where it's at!! I can see this sorta place fitting right in the Portland, Oregon food scene. And it's an easy place to go with a group of people or your family. 

Everyone thoroughly enjoyed the food. The standouts: the Farm Burger, the dry hard Apple cider with Pinot Grigio in a can, and the Strawberry basil soda. The kids loved the creamsicle drinks, sweet tea, chicken tenders, cheeseburger, and grilled cheese.

This place is amazeballs!

Got seated after a 45 min wait on a weekend on the patio, which was beautiful. Had a wonderful waitress who recommended the ABSOLUTE BEST items on the menu. We ordered exactly what she recommended and my bf and I loved every single dish.

My favorite dish was the cauliflower dish.. There was nothing I have tried that was anything like it. Super creamy and delicious. 

I honestly think you cannot go wrong with any dish at this place.. Service was amazing and food was amazing as well. I now recommend this place to anyone who visits SB. And I will definitely be back for more!

Make a reservation because it gets crowded! Bar is open seating but it gets crazy!

The Sun Link is a great idea in theory. It needs improvement. So far, all my experiences have been good with it. It's not near my house, but as a segway between my home and working downtown, it helped a lot when I would bike to it near UMC and catch it (bikes allowed on-board) and ride it downtown. It's fast, and pretty efficient, and runs every 10 minutes or so depending on the scheduled time of day. It is never crowded, which worries me. Sun Tran is often crowded and standing room only. But then, Sun Tran covers all of Tucson, and Sun Link only has a certain radius. They need to offer more options for riders other than day passes. It's nice if you have a Sun Tran pass like I do, so I use that. But it seems mostly useful to UA students and some downtown folk. I can see great uses if I lived near the area. I just can't find a lot of advantage to the link myself. It's clean, comfy, safe. I enjoy it. I'll use it when I can. Just, not that often. I hope more people are using it, however. I would love to see this cover more areas of town and I'd be on board.

Lauren was such an amazing life saver! The move in process was so easy and she is so knowledgeable. Lauren has made everything easy to understand as she was thorough and patient! The Gossett is beautiful and my dream home! Ask for Lauren If you are looking .. she's simply the best!

I went on a trip to visit my family over in the Tucson area and found Lloyd's. I'm really happy I did!!

Darrell and his father Lloyd took the time and helped me with some minor problems I was having with my Toyota and saved me tons of money and were upfront and honest(which rarely happens these days)! 

I liked them so much they even helped me find a new lift kit for my 4 runner since I had been wanting to go bigger and the one I had was causing me some issues. Lisa(his wife) was on top of everything too and made my life easier and went above and beyond and shop I have ever been too has done for me! 

If you want a honest shop that do not have crooks working there then I suggest you contact Lloyd's. They will not disappoint!

Decided to go on a donut run on a Monday morning, since I was visiting a friend who moved to Philly and her apartment in Rittenhouse was only a six minute walk from here!

I had heard much about Federal Donut's, and was excited to try it out. We ordered a box of 6 and I was a little disappointed that the specialty flavors were pricey (I think around $2-2.50). The flavors we tried were cinnamon, vanilla, strawberry, lavender, milk chocolate, and pumpkin spice latte.

The donuts were all made of the same type of batter, so when I sampled a bit of each, they all started to taste indistinguishable. The only notable flavor I tried was the milk chocolate. It had a bit of chocolate crumble on top. 

The real star of the show at Federal Donuts, in my opinion, is the fried chicken sandwich. This was delicious!!! The patty was juicy, and the bread complimented it well. I also tried their  1/2 order of fried chicken with the Za'atar flavoring. Spices were great, but flavor was overly salty. Size of chicken was very small, and expensive for the $9 we paid. However, the chicken order came with a plain donut, which was nice. It tasted great later warmed up.

Overall, glad I got to try Federal Donuts, but it didn't blow me away. If I went again, I'd just get one donut, not a whole box. +Get the fried chicken if you have extra $$.

So all of the burgers are good. No complaints. 

But order the pork nachos. Trust me. They may be the best thing on the menu. 

If you order the nachos to-go (they come deconstructed, no biggie), you may want to ask for some extra chips because they loaded us up with the queso (it was glorious).

I first visited DeVons with a friend who wanted to get his Rolex watch serviced and the crystal polished.  My friend received his watch back several weeks later looking brand new and the salesperson, Darrin Cody (also the assistant manager) could not have been more helpful and kind.  On that trip I noticed a pair of opal earrings set in gold with small diamonds.  I have been looking for gold earrings for awhile and I had never purchased expensive jewelry before.  I thought about the earrings all summer and when I returned to DeVons in September, I decided to buy the earrings and the pendant that matched.  Darrin again was our salesperson and he discounted the earrings and pendant, gave us jewelry cleaner, boxes and cases.  I loved the earrings and pendant and Darrin told me to wear them and enjoy them, which I did.  A short time later, the chain for the pendant broke and I thought I lost the pendant, however, my friend found the pendant, but the chain was lost.  I called Darrin and he said to come to the store and although he would be on vacation, he would leave a chain for me.  He left two so I could choose which one I preferred.  The next week, the clasp on the earrings broke, and when I called again, I was told to bring them in.  The jeweler was there and he fixed the earrings.  I was thrilled because I live in South Lake Tahoe and it would have been a week or two if they sent the earrings in for repair and it's not the shortest trip to Reno.  Then last week I noticed one of the opals in in the earrings had a crack.  I called Darrin today and he said just to come in and he would take care of me.  I went to DeVons and he told me he already ordered a new pendant that was on it's way.  When I explained it was the earrings, he said they had another pair of earrings and I could exchange the ones I had for those. He told the woman helping me to just write that the earrings were defective.  I cannot be more satisfied with this store, which is employee owned and definitely goes above and beyond to guarantee customer satisfaction.  Prices are reasonable for a high end jewelry store, the employees are very helpful, and the service is extraordinary.  I cannot praise DeVons Jewelers in Summit Sierra more highly.

Our go to place for pizza and wings in Cold Springs.

Take out is go for eating in the park or at home.

Broad selection on the full menu.

This is our first trip to Santa Barbara and since we wanted to have some good Italian food, we chose Olio. However, it was a BIG MISTAKE as little did we know that the staff would be so rude and unprofessional. I don't have any review to add regarding their food as we left the restaurant right away since we were treated rudely. We came in when they were 75% empty and Open Table was showing plenty of availability to make a reservation (it was a Tue evening). Their staff member asked us 'what do you want', really?? Especially when you're traveling with a baby, you really would like the staff to be more cordial respectful. We wanted to be seated outside to which they said 'no' and when we told them online it's showing that they have plenty of tables available outside suddenly table(s) opened up. Their staff member then barely walked us to our table, told us to leave our stroller 6-7 tables away  and then dumped the high chair for our child next to the table for us to move around. It almost felt they didn't want us there. We got up and left. 

My $.02 to the management of this restaurant - get your staff trained ASAP (and have some racial diversity) to be cordial and respectful before you go out of business!!! 

Wish I could give them NEGATIVE STARS!!!!
Went for the muffins and was satisfied: one chocolate chip and one delicious zucchini walnut. Nice neighborhood.

Love upland for their fantastic brews and delicious food. We tried their turkey and guacamole sandwich as well as the Bad Elmer's Fav burger. The turkey sando was delicious and fresh and the burger was fantastic paired with a Dragonfly IPA. We had the fried cheese curds as an app and they slapped as well. Awesome spot to chill and drink some brewskis with friends.

It's not even been 24 hrs and my French manicure is already chipping off. The lady who did my pedicure did an excellent job, but the one who did my manicure did a half ass job. She was very harsh with my nails, I flinched a few times while she was working on my them, felt like she wanted to rush through the whole thing and didn't really care about doing a good job. Even her nail polish application wasn't great. I paid an extra $5 for French manicure but it's not worth it. Skip it for a regular manicure and save your money. Not going back again.

The three stars is all for the pedicure.

We read all the reviews and still decided to give this place a chance. Well let's just say...trust the reviews. Food was super greasy and not much flavor and the place really is just kinda weird. From the decor to how eerily quiet the place is. Just not the greatest experience.

My wife and I and our neighbor and his wife went to Ricks Reef tonight for dinner and drinks.  I had one of the more expensive item on the menu as I recall (grouper) and the wives had medium priced items.  My neighbor had the evening's special described by the waiter as a half pound of catfish and fries plus a beer.  We had three wines and a beer plus another wine refill.  The food was good, but my neighbor's special did not arrive with the other food.  We waited quite a while, and then started to eat our orders.  The waiter came by and said that my neighbor's fish did not look good, so they were redoing the order.  Finally it came and it consisted of a big basket of fries and two little strips of fish.  I guess it was the wine, but I complained (politely) to the waiter about the size of the fish order.  He left and another man came out and said he was the "owner" and  asked what was the problem.  I explained, and he said "what did you expect for $8.00"?  I told him that the waiter had said a half pound of catfish (possibly we all misunderstood as we are senior citizens and local residents).  At that point he became unglued.  He rudely cursed us out (I never curse) and ordered us out of his restaurant immediately.  He grabbed a garbage can and raked everything off the table including the unfinished meals, the wine and wine glasses, my iced tea, water, utensils, etc.  I'm glad he did not have a gun!  It is the first time in my 73 years that I have ever been "kicked out" of a restaurant or any other establishment.

This has been my favorite little market for almost 10 years. They have a killer selection of craft beers, ciders, kombucha beer, wines and Mexican candies. Their prices are comparable to other stores in the area and selection sometimes even better. They have a private parking lot and are located just a few minutes away from Santa Claus Beach. 

Besides being my candy and alcohol shop, many come to Kims for their carnitas and burritos. They have a kitchen in the back where you can order food freshly made to-go. They also have meats to cook at home and all general food, beverage and emergency items. Great one stop shop for RV vacationers and campers. I definitely recommend!
The hot and sour is the best ever (pick any variety).   Pod Thai is second to none.  We like the regular or veggies.  All the apptizers ate excellent.  We've only done take out since Covid.

Definitely a must try if you love BBQ! The staff were all working hard and at the same time all friendly and made sure to welcome me as soon as I walked in. I ordered the wings and also bought two sides. If you know me you already know what sides I picked lol. Collard greens and Mac! Both of which were very very good. My wife got the ribs which came with two sides. She chose greens and potato salad. She loveddddd it! We will definitely be back for more! I'll leave pics below :)
Very bad customer service ...  it's been 4 times I've had to sped off because of all the rude employees. Thanks for nothing McDonald's I got Chick-fil-A breakfast instead.

Wings etc are great wings, with a sports bar vibe - the best in the Indy region. Wingstop? The best "quick dining" wing place. By far. And, I'd say (along with my family) that these are the best wings I've ever had. I love these wings, and have had them many times. Also, their combo deals with wings/fries/rolls/etc, are awesome. Love this place.

******Edit. Tampa may not be included in participating districts. But if that's the case I don't know why that reply was given when asked if they had it. 





Krispy Kreme has been advertising the birthday donut filled with cake batter (for their anniversary), available one week only (started Monday, today is Saturday). Saw the social media post last night, had to go try one after work! Went to this location and the worker said, "I think they were too lazy to make them today."

 It's lack of work ethic and loss of spirit from locations like this that really take away the magical feeling of what Krispy Kreme use to be about. A huge disappointment.

The street tacos are so good, I had them for lunch 3 days in a row. Melt in your mouth. Side of beans and rice are authentic and so flavorful. Can't wait to try more of their food. It is a limited menu, but that only means specialized excellent food. You won't get the heavy carb plain Americanized food here. Store items are great as well!

Let me start by saying, your experience at a restaurant makes a world of a difference depending on the server. With that in mind, I brought my family here for my brothers 18th birthday and to say the least, Lauren (our waitress) made our experience regret me taking my family there. Our food orders were not correct, snag the food, never brought items  as we request so we had to get up multiple times, came no more than twice to check on us, it practically felt like we were bothering her the moment we arrived. To top it off, she somehow believed she can add her tip to the bill ‍. We are generous with our tips, but I guess she thought she should add it knowing her service was crap! 

Service is very important to me and with this experience, that is the last time I will be supporting this business. At least for a while. 

Thanks Lauren, for the negative vibes we felt .

Please read reviews prior to offering this salon your business.  I paid a large sum for a full set. The tech clearly needed more experience, even for as little as adding foil. She did not take the time to trim cuticles and filed my nails down without inquiring. I. Order to shape, she cut into the side of the nails. I made repeated calls regarding my concern to I avail as the owner was never in the shop. Two days later I went out of town. Less than a weeks time of the manicure, nails were lifting and one actually popped off. When returning to town, spoke with the owner Er who claimed to be there on the days I phoned and "trusted her manicurists". After much to-do she agreed to repair and fill my nails her self however, at discounted cost. She refused to refund. Quality of work is  extremely poor as is customer service. Please consider this review.

If I could give this store no stars I would. When the food came out; over half of it was forgotten about and never given to the table. The waiter walked away too fast after it was set down that none of us could say anything. We had to get other servers to grab our server (Jorge) multiple times and it took him over 10 minutes to come take care of us. We were never checked on, the chips were empty twice, our water was never refilled, and overall it was just a horrible experience. I asked to talk to the manager and the host got the server; not the manager. He was rude and dismissed everything I had to say. I will not return and will tell others how horrible this place is.

I cannot recommend Burgundy Blue highly enough. We spent a long time trying to find the perfect photographer for our wedding, and decided to go with Burgundy Blue last minute. Despite the time crunch, Ryan was incredibly flexible and considerate while working with us, and the photographer assigned to us, Lena, was absolutely incredible. She has such a creative and artistic eye for photography that we had so many unique yet non-cringy shots. She was great at suggesting poses and set ups, and was amazing at scouting out multiple photo shoot locations including checking what the light would be like at certain times of the day, what flowers would be in bloom and how crowded places would most likely be on the day of our photoshoot. We live out of state and couldn't do much of this ourselves so her input and organisation was invaluable. Not only is she skilled but she makes you feel so incredibly comfortable and relaxed. She makes you feel like a good friend from the start. We loved everything about our experience that we returned and had our pregnancy photoshoot done with Lena at Burgundy Blue too. They have definitely earned long term clients with us! They were also very flexible with how the photos were edited. We liked a particular style of editing which was a little different to what they typically did, but it wasn't a problem at all. I would confidently recommend Burgundy Blue to anyone. you definitely won't be disappointed!

I brought my truck here and instantly knew this place is only place I would bring my truck to if I didn't have time to change my oil. They are super friendly and provide an honest service. Delfín was the employee that helped me both times and he is great. No line, little wait time, and good service. All you could ask for.

I love this salon!  Co-vid safety conscious! I have gone to this salon for the past 2 years. I love the girls here and feel so at home each time I walk through the door ! They do an amazing job on nails and toes (I get dip on nails/gel on toes). They are not just nail technicians, they are now friends. I look forward to each and every visit! So many selections too for any type of mani or pedi! Can't recommend them enough!!!!
Soooo good! And great customer service. Will definitely return during our next trip to Indy!

Slow & Expensive....
Service is slow at best.  $12 for a short pour of house wine??   $5 for Bud Light??   I don't  think so.  Most of the time I as there....about 3/4 of the entertainment was 'roped off' for private parties.   Plenty of bowling lanes open even on a Saturday night...that tells you something.

Will not be going back.  Can't see this place making it.....
Delicious food at amazing prices. I love their sandwiches and breakfast items. Their fries are so good. Would not recommend any of the gyro dishes or plates though.

First visit was fine - excellent pizza, draught beer and good server. The second visit was not good. Server asked me if I wanted her to put on her mask. That was not for me to decide. By law, she MUST wear a mask. Then before I sat down she kept asking what I wanted to order. I told her that I had to look at the menu. She kept asking. I told her to go away and leave me alone. There was only 1 other customer there. When she came back I ordered a good beer to drink there and a pizza to go. Both were fine. She was the problem. When she brought the check (1) there was no place to enter a tip (2) there was no place to sign (3) she gave did not give me a copy.
So, with no place to enter a tip, she got none. With no place to sign, I signed at the bottom of the bill.

We love this place for beautiful food, amazing lattes, and people watching. It has the prettiest and most delicious avocado toasts - especially the version with buratta on top! My daughter loves the lemon ricotta pancakes. Service is always slow (though friendly) so this isn't the place to go if you're in a rush. Just good, pretty food and great people watching from a shady table.

I've been to the Cheesecake Factory many times, but this was my first time at this location. I'm not sure what was going on but we were seated for 45 minutes before we received our appetizers. We then sat for almost another 30 minutes waiting for our drinks that the waiter forget they even wrote down. By the time we finally got our entree we had already been at the table for almost an hour and a half, so we asked for take out containers so we could take our meals to go. I ended up sending back my order of the Jamaican black pepper shrimp. I wanted so badly for it to taste as good as it looked, but the shrimp were tough, and the sauce was bland with no spiciness to it. The best part of the meal was the lemoncello cream torte (not to mention that our desserts came out before the entree's). We also had to ask about bread for the table to then be told that they were out of bread. Hopefully I'll have a better experience at a different location.

The drinks were okay, but the bartenders were not very helpful and the music was just too much. There was a DJ and we had to move just to hear each other. Also, there was also something strange happening with the elevators. We took the stairs after getting frustrated with it. 

Ultimately we went to a different floor, and enjoyed some food, which was not bad. Our server there was attentive enough to keep this review from being worse. This place had all the markings of being good, it just wasn't that great though.

I have been living in Tucson for about 6 years now and had visits to many  clinics and hospitals during that period. Not always but fairly often, things seemed to be hurried and disorganized. In many cases the employees, and healthcare workers appear to be discontented. I don't like for anyone to be unhappy and I definitely want the people who are caring for me to enjoy their work. A year ago, I suffered a severe injury and have spent a lot of time searching for good care in Tucson and in other cities. I had never heard of Iora Primary Care before but after a quick phone call I thought I would go and visit them. They have a very unique and effective approach to care that is head and shoulders above the rest. I cannot say enough good things about the clinic and the people at IORA.

Yay! Love this place. Right next to all the hustle and bustle and next to the highway. Great place! I would highly encourage anyone to go here to eat some good chicken. Staff are very kind and quick when it comes to orders and accuracy. Make sure you ask for honey if you get to go!

Just as good as some of the best of New Orleans. Was on a road trip and stopped by here before Nola... and might have been a little bit better than Oceana grille on Bourbon St.  So Broadways gumbo on the trio sampler shows how good flavor is. Jambalaya is spicy good. Etoufee ( which I didn't like but it might be cuz I don't like okra too much). The crab cake appetizer is the most unique takes ... and of course the alligator cheesecake is not to miss.

It's very hard to miss, and it's not exactly worth the drive I took to get there. Granted the food is pretty good, but not worth driving 30min to get to the place. Flies constantly landing on me really made me want to leave after a short amount of time. Service was good. Jarritos were kind of flat. All in all, if I lived locally I would go back. Since I'm not I most likely won't come back.

Be prepared to wait!!! We came in on a Tuesday morning and we waited probably 45 minutes to an hour before being seated, BUT it is SO worth the wait!!! We ordered the Southern Benny and the Bonuts (a must) and both were delicious!!! We were also pleasantly surprised about the prices!! A place this busy with food this good, I would imagine would have outrageous prices, but it's quite the opposite!! Cannot wait to return!!

Air conditioning unit installed and serviced well for many years. Then was late on a payment in fall of 2014, due to taking care of a newly disabled relative. When I made the late payment, I was not notified of being put on a 'do not service' list. In March of 2015 they sent out a maintenance   advertisement to my house despite me being on this list, and only when I responded to the ad did I find out I needed to find a new HVAC maintenance provider. So, good service but unpleasant customer service in regards to payment.

Maranee McDonald is a superstar stylist-- superb with color!! Salon U has a rocking contemporary artistic vibe commonly attempted, but not achieved, elsewhere. Truly class meets industry-- a brilliant marriage. Design, local art and competent, friendly, edgy staff complete the picture of sexy allure that emanates. 

I was immersed in frustration at the inability of a few different local stylists to achieve my desired color at the time I found Maranee and Salon U. Maranee understood exactly what I wanted. She was responsive, efficient, incredibly empathetic with respect to my prior stylist woes. She was friendly. Maranee gives the best scalp massages I have EVER experienced. (EVER.) I've never been happier with a stylist or salon, holistically, and cannot imagine life without either of them! Many thanks to Maranee McDonald and Salon U for being A+ in the biz.

What is it about this place that it's where suburbanite parents visiting town always wanna eat here?

It probably has everything to do about the generic, inoffensive food and the great location. 

It was I think my 5th time dining here, again with elderly family that picked it out of a lineup. Service was great, as it usually is, and the environment is of course stellar. Being able to sit on the patio while being serenaded by an acoustic guitar right next to the river is a great way to spend any evening. 

I had their well Moscow Mule which was just fine. No need to spring for high shelf when ginger beer quenches the taste of cheep vodka.

My plate was the short rib and I regret it. It really just tastes like a pot-roast, and was entirely forgettable. My wife had the salmon special which would have been a much more desirable plate. As it was, the evening was all about the company and location, and so much less about the food, which is normally 80% of my focus for a venue.

I'll probably inevitably be here again when the geezers come to visit, but unlikely to drop in of my own accord.

Dan is the Carpet Doctor knows his profession well. He is just an absolutely amazing person also. I had a few repairs he knocked them out at a fair price I highly recommend him. You can not even tell the carpet was repaired. Great job Dan  give him a call

We absolutely LOVE this place and have since they opened their doors years ago. If you want fresh, yummy, homemade food, then you MUST visit Bishop's. The staff will make you feel at home and you WILL enjoy your food. I mean, the rolls , the mac n cheese , and all of the rest of the deliciousness will make your day.  Bishop's does not disappoint.

This is you basic Cafe. Food and service was good. Starting with the coffee, better than average.  I had the eggs Benedict. Everything just right, with a 1/4" ham. My wife had scrambled eggs and crispy bacon.  All good. We will be back.
