I want to start off by saying I've been in 
Hospitality for over 15 years, very big on service.. the bartender Garett is a whole vibe !! So efficient & knowledgeable..:he made our dinner so amazing at the bar!

This restaurant terrible i like Italian food but I don't recommend because this restaurant messed up with menu it only as pasta and they seem to not offer pizza in their fine dining they should because they keep saying they consideration but they never listens to guest inquires and they aren't listening to guest and they won't offer pizza because even know they have a wood fried oven and they won't offer it in fine dining only other joint the reason I give this a one star Italian restaurant is that they ruined this restaurant and they ruined Italian food and the manger is very ruined and said they won't offer pizza and they should offer pizza because a lot of people would like pizza on the menu because people get tried of eating pasta  all the time and i love Italian restaurant but not this one because they don't serve pizza  and they should Understand that fish is not a Italian cuisine. It's clear to me that they don't pay the employees very well and the chef so they decided to save money and the only way they had to do this is to not offer pizza in the menu because it would make the pizza expensive on the menu and it would give Much money to the employees and not to the restaurant what heard when you sign  the check it doesn't go to the employees it goes to the restaurant and that is  ridiculous behavior that this hotel have someone needs to have a serious talk with owners and fix this hotel entirely. So who's with me on this?.

I hired Jorge and his crew to uproot and remove a tree and landscape my entire property. They did a fantastic job. All trimmings and such were cleaned up. I went with this company because of the good reviews. All of the men are hard workers. Excellent job fellas. Gracia.
Frank L.
The company and it's employees are extremely helpful and friendly.  The project was completed on time and the cleanup afterwards was great.  I highly recommend this company.
The person who made my bagel obviously didn't like me. They put so little cream cheese on it they had a lot of nerve charging me for it. A huge waste of my time and money.

Terrible place.  Run. They wanted to remove my uterus for a molar pregnancy. I told them to do a second d/c but they refused. I went to https://delvalobgyn.com/ and they did the second d/c with success. https://delvalobgyn.com/ such a better operation.

Not happy with whoever took my order this afternoon over the phone. Rudest attitude. Put me on hold for 5 minutes. Please I'd advise whoever is managing the chipotle store on n sale mabry carrolwood to take care of this issue

My husband and 2 kids stayed there over the weekend to attend a competition. The stay was average, however we experienced a big problem after we left. On the day we checked out, it was very early and we were rushing to get to the competition so we packed the room quickly and left. Once we got home that evening, we discovered that we had left our gun in the room. We immediately called and the front desk girl said she just checked someone into that room but she would check to see if it was in there. She came back and said it wasn't there and if the house keeper had found it that it would be locked in her manager's office. She said to call back the next morning when the manager was in. The next morning the manager, the house keeper that originally cleaned the room and the maintenance man searched the room and said they didn't find anything. I filed a police report and the officer went and checked the room and didn't find anything. So, my thought is that a gun just doesn't disappear! I asked the manager to review the security tapes from when we left to when the officer checked the room. She said that there is no way that any of her employees would have stolen the gun. I told her its better to trust but verify the actions your employees are taking. She got very upset that I was asking her to review the videos and then told me that she reviewed the security footage and she didn't find anything. She also mentioned that she wouldn't be able to see the gun from the footage because the housekeeper could have hidden it from the camera. Seems fishy right? I called corporate and they unfortunately don't have the footage in their systems. BEWARE this is very shady business!

Was a loyal customer of at least five years. Mostly out of convenience but I also feel they have reasonable pricing and I'd rather support local small businesses. 

Then this year's smog & registration cycle. 

I had some work done and should have driven around more before bringing it in the first time. That's totally on me. But I followed his advice of putting 70-100 miles on it (he wasn't giving me a consistent number). 

Went back, different guy working, more than 70 and less than 100. Same issue in that it won't get to the point it will even start the tests. Still needed some more driving but gave me pointers on the specific sensor in question.

So I followed that. Didn't put a whole lot of miles on it but didn't need to from what the guy on the second visit told me. 

So today I swing by to have it checked before wasting any more gas driving needlessly. (This is all in the span of like a week, I don't drive much these days.)

First guy again. Looks at the papework and wouldn't even give it a try. Kept talking over me. Didn't want to listen to what I was telling him and tried to get me to waste the gas driving around another 50 miles. 

I was pretty sure I had driven it around adequately since if left the shop by this, the third visit, and dude should have just humored me. Lost whatever they make off smog & registration combos. I drove to another place. It passed. 

Went back to show him and he tried to pass it off as me just being lucky. 

That's not how this works, guy.
Love the Chinese food here. My treat to myself. The food is fresh, and flavor is excellent.  The service is fast and place is always clean.
Another gem in downtown Tampa! Had the bun bowel with grilled chicken..so delicious and fresh. Love this place

This has been an all around great experience! The front desk was friendly and accommodating when scheduling my appointments. The staff was super sweet and did an excellent job explaining things and interacting with my young girls. The doctor was timely and efficient. Definitely recommend this place!
This yoga center is closed

This is second time during Covid that I've gone here. Last time was very slow and could only eat outside but I understand it's hard to get help. This time my friend and I ordered food and waited inside. The person who ordered food before us received her food and the guy that took the order yelled out for pickup! I assumed same would be done for us. She and kids are their food and left and we were still waiting. Finally my friend walked to drink counter to get water and guy was taking order from someone so she didn't ask; I got up and asked, " Is our food ready? We've been waiting a long time! And told him what it was. He turned around and checked bag on counter; handed it to me. Sandwiches were cold, no notice food was ready, no apology, etc. I won't be back!

Does Not Disappoint. How have Cactus Club got it so right?
They have introduced a new Happy Hour menu, all your favourites for a little cheaper. I'm into it.
I went with some friends recently to the West End location which was a first for me. It's handily located by WEM with ample parking!
I ordered the truffle fries - oh man, these are so morish. Delicious and great sharing dish and there are lots of fries. I also got the spicy chicken which is a menu fave of mine. If you tell your server you are sharing they always split it into two plates for you. I like that, then you still get a nicely presented plate and don't need to worry about being the greedy one.
The service was fantastic. Cactus Club always impress me with knowledgable and very attentive staff
Best Quiche in Burlington county! Love everything about this place!  I want to try other stuff but the quiche is so good I can't bring myself to order anything else!

Donatello's is a neighborhood white tablecloth Italian restaurant on Main street Carmel that has been our go-to place for celebrations for several years now. It was originally a tiny space with 4-5 tables that expanded into a much larger space after the French restaurant next door closed down. 
It has gone through some changes throughout the years - what has not changed is the good food, the family that runs it being present every night, and the welcoming atmosphere. Adam still greets and waits on tables, and Beth shows up to ask if the food was good, and if you need more parmesan or fresh ground pepper on your meal. 
We hope to be regulars at this great little Carmel staple restaurant for many more years to come.
Awesome food, nice patio seating with a view of the river when the weather is nice.

The general ordering process was smooth, but any kind of customer service after that is virtually non-existent. No help loading or with questions. After we completed our project, I called the store to confirm I could return our unused boxes. After loading them back up and driving all the way to the store, the manager told me I couldn't return any of them because of the order type. I told him I spoke with an employee a few days prior, gave my order number, and confirmed that I could. He just said sorry and that was it. Very frustrating that the customer can double check before taking the time and effort to make a return, and all the MANAGER of the store does is say sorry.

Nice and clean in a good location, but somewhat difficult to find inside of Westport. The sushi is always good and fresh at Drunken Fish, but a bit overpriced compared to other nearby sushi restaurants. The ordering system is nice. You order from your phone and it goes directly to the kitchen. This makes the food come out quickly, but it is difficult to find a waiter to ask questions or for refills as they never have to come around to take your order. Overall, Drunken Fish is really good, but they need to be cautious of price and service.

Best pizza I have ever had at this place. Their pizzas are all so, so delicious. My favorite is the Dante's Inferno, which they make with sriracha sauce, so if you like spicy, this is the pizza for you. Their pistachio pie and biaca pie are also both out of this world. You can pretty much add on anything you want to your pizza as well! 

As far as their appetizers, the hummus is good and while they give you plenty of bread (which I would get on their own for an app- they are tipped with garlic slivers! yum), the portion of actual hummus is small. If you like pesto, you will not be disappointed by the Pesto Tomato appetizer... It's basically tons and tons of pesto stuffed into a giant tomato. It's scrumptious and beautiful.

The reason I didn't give this place five stars is because of the service. It can be pretty slow and I know a lot of it has to do with the fact that they have limited space for making the pizzas so they only make very few at a time, but independent of that fact, I've had some bad servers here in the past who just weren't very attentive and were slow. Also, there have been times when I've called to place an order and even after dialing several times, no one would pick up. But if you're not in a hurry and want to enjoy some darn good pizza, this is definitely the place for you.

The chai that my sister got was gross. 
I got an Italian strawberry soda with cream, and it was...tasteless.  It just wasn't good. 
We both got a croissant and they were extremely dry...they had to at least be 2-3 days old. 
We were both very disappointed, and we won't be back.

Second time here both times the cupcakes were excellent. I would recommend letting them sit out for about a half hour before you eat them, I know they tell you 15 to 20 minutes, but I like mine a little more room temperature. I feel like people are hating on the cupcakes for being cold, just let them sit longer and you want have an issue.

I really like the adult style cupcakes that they had this time: margarita and pina colada, nice change of pace. 

Last time I was here they had a banana peanut butter pudding cup which was awesome. I like that there are tons of different options and that they are always mixing things up. 

The music, the staff, the atmosphere, the cozy little spot on main street in Moorestown.. It's great. Check them out. They did an excellent job with our call ahead larger order. Everything was great!

Excellent spot on Jefferson campus for a quick breakfast. I get the egg/cheese or bacon/egg/cheese on a Kaiser roll. Eggs are freshly prepared.

Their turkey sandwich on multigrain bread is good, too. Large assortment of chips, drinks, and snacks for on the go. 

Pricing is fair.

Used to be my favorite Chinese food in Kenner but since the new ownership it went down the drain. The egg rolls taste like generic egg rolls from the "fast food" Chinese restaurants and so does the crab rangoons. Portion sizes have gone down while prices still remain high. Will not be returning.

We came on a Friday night and it did not disappoint. It was after 1am and the food was hot. It was flavorful and worth the walk.  The Staffel was busy but friendly. 

The Wings were over cooked , the fries were yummy and the Fried pickles were amazing .

I would definitely come back for fried pickles

I only selected 1 star because it's required, otherwise they would not have received a star. The Boathouse was a bad experience in every respect. 
First, expect an hour plus wait to be seated, and expect that no one at reception really cares. 
Second, the food is extremely high priced, which is okay if it's fantastic, which it is not. IHOP food is comparable, and way cheaper. 
Third, we waited 1 hour to get in, then waited ONE HOUR for the entree. By the time it arrived my wife and I were done. I asked the waiter what took so long (it was 9:30 pm and a half empty house). He said "what do you mean, it always take this long here." It was perfectly natural for him to have us wait ONE HOUR for our food after waiting ONE HOUR to get in. 
The attitude of a place and it's staff is important, a desire to serve, and understanding that people don't have to go to your restaurant and they should be treated well OR an arrogance that the customer will take what they get and like it. The Boathouse is the latter. 
The only redeeming thing is it's located on the beach. 
I'm not sure how this place got such high rankings but they could have only come from the owner and his/her extended family and friends. My wife and I would never eat here again. 

Postscript: we sent the entrees back and left. The salads and lobster Mac & cheese were very bad.

The absolute worst customer experience ever. I thought I was being punked! About 20 employees and 3 customers yet you can't go in without an online reservation. Which I had. I was there to just pick up a device and had to wait 45 minutes in the hot sun even after having a reservation. When I complained to the "genius" guy at the door he snapped at me and said it's better than last week when they were completely closed. Ahh no it's not. At least if they were closed I would not have wasted all in, 3 hours start to finish and would have gone to Beat Buy. Apple stores and products have totally taken a downwards turn. When sales are down 40% and people are coming out to buy your stuff and this is how they are treated believe me, even Apple can fall.

I just experienced the worst service experience at Whole Foods! I normally go to the Whole Foods on River/Craycroft and I get exceptional service so of course I expected the same thing at this store. I WAS WRONG! I stopped to but a few items after a great workout so was feeling amazing. I arrived shortly after 7, picked up my items and then went to the cashier line. It was very long and so I asked the cashier (name begins with a S) if she could call another person. She abruptly said there are no others and said I could go to the coffee shop which wasn't a good solution since I had a cart full of groceries! So I waited and waited and waited. When I got to the check out I told her I'm used to better service at Whole Foods. She just said the next cashier comes at 8. No apology, no empathy, nothing. She rang up my merchandise and handed me my receipt without a thank you. Nothing! 

It is apparent to me that all Whole Foods are not committed to exceptional service. I love the way I'm treated at the River/Craycroft location and so will go there and will not return to this location. 

I love the Whole Foods on River and Craycroft so much that I decided to give the Oracle store another try. I'm happy to update my review as the service was much better. I'm hoping they continue to bring the service levels up to the River/Craycroft standards and then I will frequent this store more.!

I have been a fan of the haircuts I received at Billy's original location off of 4th street, but it is a long commute from my home near campus in Gulfport to there.  I was excited to learn that he has opened up this second shop in Downtown St. Pete, headed by Omar.  Omar is an excellent barber and has given me some awesome haircuts.  I can't recommend this spot enough.   

It is a classic barbershop, great barbers, location, and style.  

The haircuts, shaves, and beard trims are all fairly priced- but be warned it is a cash only shop.  

Like most barbershops- there aren't appointments, but this location has developed a system that I found really convenient.  You walk in, and if there is a wait, they will put you on on the list - and text you as the chair opens up.  This way you can grab a coffee or sandwich next door at Bodega, check out a book store, maybe walk over to Greenbench and grab a pint- or whatever other errand you may need to run in DTSP.   

This shop is the model of professionalism. Check them out- you won't regret it.

I needed the Junkluggers to clear out a one bedroom apartment, a job that ended up being much bigger than expected and more expensive than quoted. It involved multiple trucks and people. Junkluggers went above and beyond, even helping to arrange a cleaning of the apartment, after I had left the area. They really made a difficult situation seamless for me.

As a brand new patient, I was incorrectly assessed a $25 Late Fee.

Seeing that we had a difference of opinion over a very small amount, I wrote a letter to the doctor suggesting a gentlemanly compromise and offered to meet in the middle where I'd immediately pay $12.50.

Their office totally ignored my letter and when I called a short time later, was told they were not interested in any kind of compromise and that I was responsible for the full amount.

Seems to me this doctor is more interested in money than he is in helping people. Glad I'm no longer a patient.

I would NOT recommend this shop to anyone. I was NOT happy with my service. I picked up my car today. I paid to have the dent and scratches repaired and the bumper painted. They decided to paint just the spots and blend. NO blending was mentioned, I was told the bumper would be painted. So there are 3 chips in the bumper that should have been painted over... NOT what I was expecting
The food was outstanding! Best fried chicken I've eaten in a very long time! Service was also on point, keep up the great job!

I would never trust anyone but Jenergy Air Services for my A/C or heating needs. This only problem is that they're far too fair. They never charge anywhere close to what any of the theiving other people in their industry charge. Honesty is a virtue that is nearly impossible to find today but they do so every minute of the day. I would never even look for a bid from anyone else. They will win Everytime, and do the most magical/artistry that their profession could possibly. Look no farther!!!!!

The woman at the front desk is super nice and friendly. That is about the only reason this business is getting a star. The missing four stars are due to the scratches my car received after getting an oil change. 

I live 2 blocks away from the mechanic, and went there for the first time because it was too cold to walk back home from my normal mechanic( A&W mechanic - awesome btw!).

Anyway, I brought my car in and picked it up a few hours later. I never check my car mainly because this has never happened to me before. But as soon as I got home, I parked and immediately saw scratches all over the front right fender and hood of my car. Not only were there scratches, but there was physical grease residue on the bumper. Not soil, wood, bits of curb/cement, but actual grease that you basically only find in a mechanic shop or when you work on cars. 

Although the mechanics were amicable, they tried saying it was there and without proof on my end, it was a stale mate. I called the police to file a report, but nothing came of that. The scratches are noticeable but not major. Not enough for me to pay out of pocket to fix, but that's because it's an older car I had planned on running until it died anyway. 

At the end of the day, it was more of a 'principle' sort of situation where I felt shafted that I brought my car in for an oil change, and walked away with damage as well. 

They could have at least offered to cover the cost of my oil change. I waited in their parking lot for 2 hours for the police to arrive. People just trying to scam companies don't do that sort of thing. 

P.S. I took the car to an actual auto-body specialist the next day, and he said it was clearly a fresh accident. I just wish I had the professional with me when the mechanic tried saying the scratches were rusted and "couldn't have been from us".

They were here when they said they'd be, and the job was done as we requested, and the installer was friendly enough, but (again) we found out that the customer should ask "why?" a lot, and insist on a real answer.

When the first tech was here to check things out pre-installation, he was adamant that we should get a small tank (at the time, all we were running on gas was a dryer, though we had plans to install a gas stove and possibly one or two wall heaters.)  Hubby was equally insistent that he wanted a 100 gallon tank.  Why not?  It's not as if propane goes bad if it sits around, and it's no more dangerous to have a 100 gal. tank than a 40 gal. tank.  When the tech couldn't come up with a convincing argument for a smaller tank, he backed off and we got our larger tank.  It took us a while, but we eventually figured out that with a smaller tank, they'd have to be out here, refilling more frequently...for an additional charge.

On installation day, we made sure that there was plenty of space between the road and the tank so their truck could pull right in and be about 5' from the work area.  The installer parked his truck in front of the *neighbor's* house, (embarrassing!) not even in front of our house, where there was also plenty of space, so every time he had to go retrieve a part or a tool, it took him 3-5 minutes instead of just seconds.  It took us a while to figure this one out, but all we could come up with was that he was being paid for his time, not by the job, and however he could make it take longer was more money in his pocket.
  
We started out our contract with "auto fill" (or whatever it's called) meaning that they could come out at will to check the tank and fill, as needed.  Apparently, we needed(?) our first fill-up just after they'd implemented the higher winter rates.  How convenient.  We immediately changed to "will call".

Hubby requested that a couple of extra shut-off valves be installed in the main line in the basement, for future growth (such as the aforementioned gas stove).  The installer added them, all right, cranking them so unnecessarily tightly that it's going to be a royal pain to loosen them.  Of course, we're supposed to wring our hands and call the company to come out and loosen them for us...for an additional charge.  We may not be as young or strong as we were, but we can be pretty darned stubborn, especially if we feel that there's been an attempt (or several) to take advantage of us, and whatever solution we come up with, it will most certainly NOT include calling them for help...for an additional charge.  

We are SO not used to professional outfits (not just this one) scheming to squeeze as much money out of a customer as they do here.  Where we're from, where there's actual competition, that company wouldn't last very long, but when there's one company providing a service to an area, customers are stuck without choices.  This outfit has done nothing to cause us to be loyal customers, probably because they don't have to, but if a competitor opens shop in the area, we'll be among the first to switch.

I'm so very tired of the "only game in town" mentality that pervades south Jersey.
This restaurant is my new favorite. Five stars for everything that matters for an eatery: great food, fast service, wonderful setting, friendly atmosphere, and easy to find locat

once again. ordered because of extreme convenenice. close this horrible chain. no sauce. kids laughing in there. had no change for me. every single one of these people that work there need to be fired. close thing chain rude employees horrible service no food got wings with no sauce on them who wants plain wings f this dumb chain remove this immediately please.

I went to this car wash today and although the exterior looks good, the interior not so much.  I purposely asked if they wipe down the seats and told yes.  When I got in my car, they only rinsed off the front winter mats, nothing on back mats,  the rugs were not vacuumed and they never wiped anything down inside.  What a waste of $21.00.

ACE Cleaners is trying to accommodate the "times" we're in with this whole Covid situation and they're doing a fabulous job. I've taken my husband's shirts here for quite a while, turn around is usually pretty quick. Lately, understandably, it's been a bit longer. Recently though, when I waited WAY to long to bring the shirts in they were more than accommodating. Instead of the longer waiting period as of late, they said they'd get back at least a portion of them in a couple days. (there were 17 shirts!!) Anyway, I went to pick them up and to my surprise they were ALL ready. Like I said, I've been using them for quite a while. They're always friendly and the shirts come back nicely. Thanks!!

We loved our wedding flowers from Zionsville Flower Company!  We were looking for a bohemian style and Joellen has a true artist's vision.  She was the only florist that we met with who was able to get us the exact type of flowers that we were requesting.  Wedding planning was not easy during covid and Joellen made the flower piece very simple.  The flowers delivered on our wedding day were even more beautiful than envisioned!

I love the boat club. Super convenient and affordable. I keep the boat overnight often on my boat lift, which is great. The staff are very helpful. Would be five stars if the members took better care of the boats and didn't ding them up as much. I'm not sure if it's more inexperience or carelessness, but it's amazing how quickly a new boat can get a bit banged up.

Every time I've stopped in here, it smells like there is some kind of sewage backup going on. And even though it's been cleaned up a bit from its early days, it's still pretty dirty everywhere you look.
As for the food, I find the portions really skimp on the protein. Even the refried beans come in a miniscule portion. Granted, they use ingredients such as cilantro. But that is no longer the novelty it once seemed around here 10 years ago when I thought the Taco Bus offered better deals at better prices.
I think success has gone to their heads and they've gotten greedy.

This is one of my favorite breakfast joints. We sat outside on the sidewalk and luckily today was gorge. Their menu is small but purposeful. We started with mimosas and iced mochas, they were both amazing! It was busy but their staff managed well. These are things that I pay attention to. Our waitress (and sadly I don't remember her name) was an absolute doll. She knows her menu offerings and she consistently checked on our table. We dined on scrambled eggs, applewood bacon, hash browns, pancakes and biscuits. Seriously, their breakfast is delicious. Seasoned well and not too much. Cafe Navarre is a local, Lakeview haunt. If you're a tourist, get an Uber and check it out. The neighborhood is clean and pleasant and it's just a good vibe throughout. Check out the shirt of a Lakeview matron sitting next to us and you'll understand!

You are not important to this company unless you have already signed a contract with them. Was basically told my inquiry to get a quote didnt matter since I was not under contract with them and they only focus on customers who are ready to start their project now. 

Communication is terrible and they are rude when you call them on it. If that is any indication, the pool building experience or if there was ever a problem would not be good.

The logistics service with the shuttle and cars was very efficient. However, the customer service at the desk was the worst I had experienced with any car rental company. The lady failed to explain the charges I would receive, and also did not explain properly about the toll pass device. I have been getting additional charges several weeks AFTER renting a car from Alamo. They have withheld information and unless I had checked my account I would not have known about all of the charges. The front desk attendant also had a smirk on his face when we tried to ask what exactly we were being charged for and why we were not told when we picked up the car.

I will never rent from Alamo again. The quality of their customer service was the worst I had experienced.

This place never disappoints.  We have had great experiences with take out and in the restaurant.  We have had just about everything on the menu.  The poke bowls are my kids favorite.  The ramen, BBQ dishes and Vietnamese dishes are delicious every time.  The staff is very friendly and attentive and always above par.  Always are go to spot for the family.  They have something for everyone.

My husband and I were flying to Kansas and had a bit of a layover so we both went and got pedis here. He of course got the basic male pedi and I got french shellac on my toes. IT LASTED WELL OVER A MONTH, with no peeling etc. Longest I have ever had any shellac last and I loved it. The staff was very professional, extremely friendly, just a smooth working business. It was a little pricey, but in my opinion their personalities and professionalism was worth it. Great experience!

WORST SERVICE EVER! this place is unreal, I waited 1 month for an appointment to sit in the office for over an hour! than when I walked to ask how much longer they said at least another 1-1.5 hours!! are you serious???? this is completely unacceptable  and rude, I was in shock. Will never go back.

9/24/16 was my first time at this restaurant. I used to go to the one in Lumberton. I still go to that one every once in a while. The service on that day was good and pretty quick. They were accurate in getting my order right.

Since the demise of the Asian Market on route 70, we've all been waiting for a replacement because the HMart down the road just doesn't cut it as far as a replacement and the market in Pennsauken, well, you know. This place is a mega Asian market for this area and is quite an upgrade from its counterpart on Washington Ave in Philly. Anything Asian related you can probably find here. The only knock I would have would be that they don't have the quick and hot food which I loved at the old Asian Market, other than that you should find everything you need here.

Poor selection - Should be called Smash & Collision not scratch & dent. Was looking for a refrigerator they were all smashed, horrible customer service (all too busy chatting with each other) when we were approached it was all about the selling the leasing plan. After several times stating I'm not interested in leasing to his displeasure the associate was trying to walk away. As I kept asking what they could do on the pricing (mind you that question being ignored several times) until asking for manager. "Items are already marked down, that is it all we will do, but the leasing plan will save you money out of pocket" UGG! "I do not want to lease. Mark downs were a joke especially after googling some model numbers only to see the list prices jacked up with min discount along with $300 3 year extended warranty pricing. Better off buying a brand new one. Save your time and don't go here for Refrigerators period. No wonder why Sears is going out of business.

BIG RIP OFF!!!!  I paid to use the touch-free car wash. I pulled in, it put soap on the car and then it stopped. I had to then pay AGAIN to wash the soap off myself while wearing heels!! I called the number that is given but it took twice before someone called me back. The guy, Scott I think was his name told me her would send me coupons to get a free car wash. I NEVER RECEIVED THEM!! No surprise! He told me that  it had happen before so I am not the only one that got ripped off at this car wash. It's bad enough they are too lazy to fix it but they also don't care about ripping people off! I will never go back and have told everyone I know in the area not to ever go there.

I already reviewed them on Google, I felt like I needed to review them here too, in case people don't use Google reviews. I can't say enough good things about them. I really enjoyed being a patient this past year at Society Hill Dental and I'm sad I'll be leaving them behind since I'm moving. Everyone is friendly, accommodating, and explains things well. This past year, I also had to fix my long-time bonded chipped tooth into a veneer, and it really turned out well thanks to them, especially who they ask you to see to color match your teeth. Dr. Dee is the best, as are all the techs like Corina. Would highly recommend.

I rarely leave a review for any company but I hope the owners will read this and make some changes. We live very close to Old English and quite often order food for delivery. Ever since the virus changed the world we have ordered even more because we want to keep the local businesses open and keep employees with jobs. When we do order it is always for me, my husband, our two children and my in-laws. (So, a lot of people) The food is always good for your typical pizzerias. The orders are always correct and delivery is fast. The delivery drivers are kind and courteous. The reason I gave 3 stars is because there is ONE girl that answers the phones there and is beyond rude! It ruins the experience of a friendly, local restaurant and lately has made us think we should just stop eating here altogether. My husband ordered last night and he said three chicken platters, egg Parmesan and baked ziti...he was stopped and told they didn't have the EL or BZ so my husband turned and asked what they wanted and he told her okay, add another chicken finger platter. She said (very rude) "So NOW you need four platters?! (And signed really loud) This isn't the first time this girl has acted like this. It's every.....single...time we get her on the phone. We don't know her name. We only know it's NOT Jenny. Jenny is always kind and professional. I just think it's sad that one sour person could potentially make it so people stop going to a restaurant. She shouldn't be in customer service with the attitude she has.

This is always very nice place to have brunch. It is centrally located, relatively easy parking on the street. It has a nice ambiance and fun place. They have music for Sunday brunch, which lasts till 3 pm. So, don't forget to ask for the brunch menu. The food is good, but service is very good. Our server Payton was very attentive and fast. She available and did not miss a beat, we felt special.

I am so impressed not only with the food but the staff.  Since the soft opening I have enjoyed most of the Irish fair and specials along with sandwiches.  I have not had one meal that was just alright.  The only downside I can think of is the plates are too small for the servings!  If you want good food, great atmosphere and a variety of beverages this is the place.  They are also starting live music.  I have to check that out!

First wanna say Keira was and excellent server. Highly attentive and about her business. 

Tired a few menu items that are my usual. Not may faves but happy I tried them. 

Mac and cheese ball app as well as the potstickers were fabulous. 

Willow Grow you did a great job. 

Keira thank you for great service
Had a really good meal here tonight. Good service, clean restaurant. Plenty of room to eat inside restaurant.

Growing up in Georgia, I know some good southern cooking when I see it. I stepped into this place and KNEW it was going to be amazing. Everyone was so welcoming and made it feel like home. The food was amazing. The cornbread cake was to die for. If you're in the mood for some home-cooking, make this your first stop!

One thing for sure, Oyster Bar lives up to its name. It has some of the best oysters in St. Pete. Unlike those shoreline tourist trap restaurants, the Oyster Bar is located right downtown in the heart of St. Pete and relies up repeat, mostly resident, not one time hit tourist customers for its survival. Hence, it has to be good.

The oysters I had were delicious, fat, plump, juicy, devoid of grit or grime, and totally fresh. I couldn't have been more pleased, but the best was yet to come as I had also ordered their lunch special lobster roll and cucumber salad.

To my shock, when my lobster roll plate arrived it didn't just have one lobster roll but two, both loaded with fine fresh lobster, delicious in flavor,  and in what were actually slightly toasted real New England lobster rolls; no trying to fake it by using hot dog buns as so many other restaurants attempt to do. And as for the cucumber side salad, stunningly delicious. In fact so much so that my dining partner asked and for and was graciously given the ingredients.

The décor of the Oyster Bar is rustic, but in a way that gives it a splendid ambiance and causal warm feeling. Though nothing fancy, for what it is and what it is supposed to be, I'm going Five Stars.

went to ceviche for brunch with the family. had the breakfast pastries to start with some morning cocktails. Jessica was our bartender and she showed us a great time with a mind reading trick and great suggestions for brunch. I suggest this restaurant for a great brunch and an awesome time.

The only disappointment was the outside patio was not open.  Other than that it was great.  Food, service, and the views. 

I love stopping here on my way up the coast.  The Santa Barbara Omelet was the perfect breakfast to keep me going all day long.

Found a lump on my dogs breast and was told today it was most likely cancerous.  So was hoping to get a second opinion from Dr Spector. I called the office to make an appointment and spoke with a sorry excuse for a human being. Joanne.  Who informed me that we had a balance on the account. So I explained I didn't realize and stated we would be happy to pay the outstanding balance today. But she said "no it went to collections and you never paid it...so we don't want you're business".  So again offered to pay the bill to which she replied " no you're not welcome here".  Completely uncaring. It's a shame a veterinary doctor would allow his office to be run by an office manager who acts like this.
The family loves this spot! A little bit of everything and a lot of Philly flavor! Something for everyone!

It was ok.  It wasn't bad, it wasn't the best thing I ever had.  If I were 30 years younger, I might enjoy the place a lot more.  It is just not somewhere I would go for gourmet pizza.  It is 'fast food' trying to not be fast food.  Were they polite?  Yeah they were ok.  Was the pizza good?  Yeah it was ok.  My friend and I were looking for a place to have some food and cocktails on a Saturday night.  Everything was packed and most places stopped seating.  Covid and all that.  We ended up going to the store and buying a bottle of wine and coming here.  I have never been to a MOD before and didn't know what to expect.  If I had to guess I would say their target customer is in their teens or early twenties (that's who was here that night).  It's a little loud, it's a little bright.  The people that work here are pleasant but as someone else said the ordering system is confusing and I think the young lady working behind the pizza bar just expected us to know what was going on.  The others were gracious, they allowed us to pop open our bottle of Orin Swift and drink while we ate.   Covid restrictions are not their fault, however, the tables were tiny and for the two pies, the bottle of wine and the plates... we just didn't have enough room and I felt cramped.  Again, this is fast food.  Grab your pie and go home.  If you are going to eat in, be prepared it's loud on a Saturday and it's bright so forget about the ambiance.  Other than that, I don't have complaints.  It is what it is and I give it three stars.

Ok. So you already know going in the place is expensive. But the quality of the produce (over Trader Joe's... cringe I know!!) is what keeps me back. You will always see workers putting out fresh product throughout your visit. It's hard not to keep picking up stuff when you're there. From flowers, to a slice of pizza, to a bakery cupcake. I even love that this location sells alcohol (something a Delaware native like me is not used to in our grocery stores). The only drawback is you'll see tons of Amazon workers in the way due to the prime delivery options. Still doesn't take away from the experience.

Sad and pathetic these people has to lock their bathrooms and it takes forever for them to unlock it for customers because they are "busy" or "short staffed."

Ordering kiosks inside are once again operational but they made changes where I can NOT get assistance because they are "busy" or short staffed. 

Seriously folks, go elsewhere as these people here are useless.

It's an understatement to say that my dog is fat! But I don't ever get charged extra here! I find that he's always happy when he comes out! He always looks awesome, I never have any complaints. I have been to high end dog grooming places and they don't compare. It's clear they don't hire just anyone. Whenever I explain what I'd like. It gets done on point! 
Whenever I have any question regarding food etc, they are always there to help, with answers! 


Love this place 
Just wish some animal items were priced a bit lower as I've found things significantly cheaper near by.

I scheduled a contact and glasses eye exam and showed up 20 minutes early. I was finally called 50 minutes later to the pre-exam then sat back down waiting for the doctor to call me
in. The doctor called me in 5 minutes later and said take a seat then looked at my exam chart
and informed me she couldn't do the exam today because she was scheduled to leave shortly.
The office manager was no help at all and actually less sympathetic then a cat eating a bird.
I called customer care to complain and along with their hollow apology I was offered next to
nothing for my inconvenience and wasting my time. This business is a cattle car cash cow situation and in no way a professional caring, to any degree, doctors office. Your eyes and
your wallet are important... Both belong ELSEWHERE!!!

My favorite spot in Broad Ripple by far. They have delicious food, especially the pizza. They also have a diverse tap menu and plenty of drink specials. Also, if you're a big soccer fan, this is your bar. Soccer is always on the TV and they even hold watch parties for Indy Eleven matches! Free parking in the back which is a huge plus.
What a strange concept, and it works! No toppings, just soft serve and ices, and yummy combos. Surprisingly good!
Great food and wait service. The arugula salad was good. Steaks were cooked to temp and the desserts were amazing. Jerks for a manager.Will not come here again.

Mama Angelina's is one of the best bad places in Philadelphia. They are so good at being nasty that it's worth the visit! The pizza is never consistent, the staff is often rude, and the prices always change. It's like Vegas!

The flip side is that there open 'till 2am, next to UArts, and rude! So if your craving something unknown between classes, check out Mama A's!

A wonderful greeting when we arrived at the restaurant after a short walk from our room. You walk along the garden to get to this restaurant.  The entrance is right near one of the many smaller waterfalls.  It was nice, no need to take your car here and it was only a five minute walk from our room.

Ravello, like the other restaurants was a delight to come to.  We were greeted by three lovely hostesses and one brought us to our table.  We were outside in a garden atmosphere.  Outside of seeing the rooms above you it's hard to believe that you in the complex.  We were served water and given menus seconds after we sat down.  

Our fabulous server Kelly, was just that... Fabulous. After seconds of speaking to us you would think that she has taken care of us for years.   So much personality.  We passed up appetizers and drinks and went right to dinner.  This is another place that wants to make sure that you don't walk away hungry..   

Food was terrific. for our dinner we had:
Sausage Tagliatelle: Large pieces of sausage with broad noodles in a delicious red sauce. This was perfect as the sauce was rich and flavorful and the broad noodles were a perfect al dente.  
Chicken Scallopini:  Beautiful pieces of tender chicken with plenty of vegetables in a wonderful light sauce.

We walked away very pleased with our excellent dining experience.  I asked for the manager and let him know too.   

Defiantly a fan and will return when we come back to Nashville!

I took my two friends to lunch at this new location last week and it was such a great disappointment. The Paella was too salty you could not taste anything else. The mussels (Mejillones) were so anemic they look like little raisins. The ox tail was good. Unlike the older location, the portions are much smaller and fewer dishes are available on the menu. We definitely are not coming back.
This place is my go to because it is consistently good. I love the falafel and the green sauce they put on it is so good. Nicely decorated inside but can get pretty busy!
Delicious. Super cute outdoors space. Wonderful food & service. Parking is hard so carpool or plan your time carefully. Will be back again. Especially loved the tots!

We stopped by the dealership on our way thru town & found the staff very helpful & knowledgeable about the vehicles.  There were about 4-5 other ppl that had stopped in while we were there also, picking up the vehicles they had already purchased. Everyone was smiling & happy and was very business professional in their conduct.  If I were in the market to purchase another used vehicle, I would definitely purchase one from this dealership.  Had my eye on the 99 Lexus & if I had an extra driver to bring it back home, it woulda been mine!  :-)   Thank you gentlemen for your kindness & professionalism we need more used car salesmen like you in our world.  God Bless you & your business.

We ate there last night for Mother's Day. I have never been so violently sick in my life. Food poisoning is no joke, and I definitely had it after eating there. I barely made it home. My other two kids had it to... I love seafood, I will probably never eat it again. That was the absolute most horrific night. the service was great our waiter was awesome, but wow that food poisoning hit like hard!

The food here is very good but the wait is absolutely horrible. Over 30 minutes for three frickin tacos. I would love to come here often but if you have a time restriction, I wouldn't rely on them to deliver your food in a timely manner.

My wife and I decided to have breakfast here. We both ordered the crab omelette with O'Brian potatoes and muffin. At $18, I expected a treat. Instead, the omelette was folded over several times with traces of crab. The O'Brian potatoes were chunks of roasted tasteless potatoes. Even a large dollop of ketsup and salsa weren't much help. Luckily, my wife took only one bite of her omelette and brought the rest home. After a couple of hours, I was feeling dizzy and sick at my stomach.  Bottom line: food poisoning and a day spent in the bathroom. The ONLY thing this place has going is the view on the wharf. We have lived in Santa Barbara for 40 yrs and fondly remember the old establishment. This place is only for naieve tourists. Management knows it's sitting on a golden egg with its location. We'd been here about 5 yrs previous and didn't think highly of this place, but our breakfast was a 2 for 1 offer and we didn't think anyone could mess with breakfast but we were wrong. Avoid this establishment by all means.
Food is fantastic and the atmosphere is chill. Perfect for a date.  Definitely recommend!!

Food was ok....the owner....that's a completely different story. Rude doesn't even describe her. Will never support this business again. For this asking....this was not from yesterday. I just finally got around to posting my review. Honestly had no idea anything was going on there. And, when I went it definitely wasn't free.

Called for a quote.  Admin set up a visit for last Friday morning to scope out the job.  Owner (?), Eric, called to say he wasn't coming, but he could give a verbal of $2,200 quote because job was standard.  Said he would send quote.  Called the next day and said he needed an "installation kit" and quote would have to go up.  No quote.  Called.  No call back.  Emailed.  No email back.  No quote in 3 days.  I got this guys name from Home Advisor.  His star rating on Google is really skewed high (4.9+).  He is not that good.

Don't go here for fast food. Lots of Mexican restaurants have batches that they throw in the microwave oven, and you get it in 10 or less minutes. 

Not here. 

Our order for five people took a while. And it was great! You can get standards here, but the "La Escollera" name means "The Breakwater", and that means mariscos, which means SEAFOOD. That's their specialty. Some of us tried the standards, and they were delicious. The seafood, however, is the specialty. 

It helps if you speak a little Spanish. Don't be in a hurry. The wait is worth it, however, and there will be a wait because it's made fresh, old school-style. Prices are decent but not cheap. Go hungry.

As others state, looks sketchy outside but is fine inside. This was a Chinese restaurant long ago in Irvington's history, and this one's a great replacement. We'll be back. Nice place. Tasty food, well-prepared.

been here a couple of times, the theme is great, everything is clean and fun. they've got many things to choose from, even my picky brother was able to find something he enjoyed. the food was great, but the service was a little spotty. i understand things get busy and stressful but i was interrupted when i spoke, and i got a snarky remark when i tried to pay half in cash half with card. other than that i will be back!

Small family farm that's been in business for 104 years that now grows organic fruits and vegetables. Starting this summer 2017 they are selling farm shares and will Cap the number available to  a small enough number to keep it manageable and know their customers well. 
Gail the wife of the son of the previous owners is passionate about their mission to provide organic, sustainable items to the local community. And although I have not met her husband I know he shares the same passion from conversations with her. My interactions at the farmstand with Jackson have been incredibly pleasant. All this makes me happy to support a local farmer. 
.I have purchased one such fruit share and have been extremely pleased with the quality of the fruits I received thus far. When you raise them organically and with love they just taste better.
I hope they stay in business another hundred for years!

PHOENIXVILLE, PA: as were were walking around the town, we were ready for lunch and spotted Great American Pub Phoenixville! What caught our eye was the very fun look to their outdoor patio. The first thing we thought of was a restaurant like at Great Adventure with themed decor. We sat at a table on a raised platform in its own little gazebo-like structure that has an awning, which was fun!

Leashed dogs are allowed anywhere in the outdoor area and your server can provide a water bowl.

The menu is American with also very nice vegan options. There are drink specials and entertainment throughout the week too. We really enjoyed the food and vibrant atmosphere.

Creole Cookery was my favorite restaurant out of the seven I went to during my weekend in New Orleans. First, the food. Portions were large and the food arrived very quickly. It was hot, very flavorful, and cooked well. My favorites were the voodoo shrimp and bread pudding. Great value for both as well. 
 
Our server was Ricardo and he was wonderful. Very knowledgeable about the menu, but most importantly - fun! He had a great attitude and made recommendations for other restaurants and activities. Very attentive as well. Also, the host was pleasant on the phone when I called to make a reservation and we were seated upon arrival (no wait).

The atmosphere is phenomenal. An open courtyard, with good music and lighting.

Honestly 10/10 experience and cannot wait to return! :)

My transmission has started slipping badly and frequently, shifting roughly and at times is unresponsive.  Because it's the cvt transmission, other places say they can't get parts for it, so I reluctantly took it to a dealer.  The second I walked in the door there was a salesman in my face trying to get me to trade in my car.  The people at the service desk were nice but ultimately the car wasn't serviced at all.  They say the mechanic drove it for 3 miles and didn't notice any problems and it wasn't showing any codes.  So they decided it had no problems and had me pick the car up and now the transmission is slipping worse than ever.  I guess I'll have to try luck with a different dealership.

I chose this place because of difficulty getting appointments elsewhere.  Appointments are easy to get.  However, staff does keep you waiting for an extraordinary amount of time.  Care is good, but staff also attempts to push medications and bloodwork on you.  I suppose they are instructed to "upsell".  I don't like that approach at all.  The cost to get a female cat spayed is 600+, which is frankly highway robbery.  My last female cat was spayed at PAWS in Philadelphia for $75, with no upselling...!!!

Great food & great service every time we go! Sometimes the seafood fettuccine has broken chunks of shell from the shellfish they cook in it, but still my favorite dish though. The bread and oil vinegar is delicious. Unfortunately they do not allow reservations at such a small yet busy restaurant. Also tried to go there a little while back and they were closed due to staffing shortage. I understand that but their hours on Google did not reflect that and stated that they were open. Driving there only to get let down by a paper sign taped to the door. That's why the four stars

Well, I had three friends with me, first, my friend didn't get her 70 cents in change. After that my friend got a disgusting and old hash brown (which another lady had gotten and was absolutely disgusted that she reported this so called establishment to corprid) and didn't get cheese on her sandwich. After such I noticed I ordered half an hour ago, so I go up and ask for my food with my receipt ( took them 20 minutes Of ignoring me ) and gave me a bag. I went back to my seat and started to eat when I realized they didn't give me my fries, so I went up and they told me to sit down, so I did assuming they were on it. I went back up about 15 minutes later asking someone else because it became obvious even the magager had an attention span of a blind rat. She went and mentioned it to the manager as she got me my fries and I heard the manager say "tell her to wait and sit down" as if I hadn't done enough of that this visit already. I then finally got my fries. We got there at about 3:50, it is now 5:05, so I basically waited an hour and twenty minutes for a 10 piece chicken nugget meal at the McDonald's, which didn't even have 10 nuggets. And my friend decided to use the restroom and noticed plastic wrap on one of the toilets, the other one not having toilet paper, and the last being absolutely absurd and disgusting, Moral of the story, this McDonald's is an absolute disgrace.

I've been coming to Brinton Lake Nails for a few months now and am very pleased for the most part. I initially started going because they offer SNS/powder dip but I transitioned to gel since their selection is so vast! My only complaint is the pedicure -- not enough massage for the amount you pay...

Frank. If we didn't love the restaurant so much we would come just for him. He truly makes this more than just a restaurant, it is a complete experience. The food is always great, the hospitality is one of a kind and we bring every visitor who comes into town to "our spot." My only apprehension in leaving five stars is that now everyone will come. We want Frank all to ourselves.

Simply amazing is Lexus of Chester Springs! After having a major disappointment of bait and switch at Koons Lexus in DE, I decided to contact Al Lichenstein at Lexus of Chester Springs.  Al was extremely saddened by my experience at Koons so he went over and above to find the car I was looking for. I just picked up on my car on 11/17 and I could not be happier.  Thanks to Al and Alison (Finance manager) for turning a horrible experience at Koons to an amazing car experience.

I drove down from Phoenix, and went way out of my way to track down this food truck, boy was I glad I did! I love Banh Mi, and this was some of the best I've had yet. Easily as good or better than the big chain restaurant Lee's Sandwiches here in phoenix. Great flavor, the bread is way better than I expected, and the thai tea was exceptional as well. If I am in Tucson, you can bet I will be stopping by here for a sandwich.

The prices are reasonable, the office staff is generally helpful, but the property definitely could use some better maintenance.  
Pros:  Quick maintenance response to indoor issues.  Our AC went out and it was up and running again within 2 hours.  The accept large dogs, and the office staff is always friendly.  Large grass areas for kids and pets to play, but would be nice if they fenced an area in for a off-leash dog park.
Cons:  Eaves are exposed from chipped paint, rain gutters and drainage is ineffective and lands on the patio, trees have large portions of dead branches that have not been cleaned out, the clubhouse is only open by reservation (what is the point of having a clubhouse then?), and there are next to no trashcans on the property except the dumpsters.

The food was ok and I think it would have been better with better service. It started when we first walked in and the host was very depressing and not happy we were there, I think we were bothering him. Our waiter was ok but he was no disengaged it was rude. I felt they were trying to get us out of the restaurant even after spending 400 with them. They took my cup twice.... Ugggg.. I'm surprised they gave 4.5 stars. The manager was so rude. He was smoking his pipe outside and you can tell he hated the place! I don't think anyone enjoyed their job there. Try other places!
Absolutely amazing, the vibes are so nice, not to mention the personal serving experience and the very inclusive shows! Me and my girlfriend had an amazing time and food!  will definitely be back!

The USPS website clearly states that walk-in passport services are offered at this Bala Cynwyd location on weekdays 10am-3pm. Several people were standing in line for passport service on Wed 08May2019 at about 1pm...only for the staff handling this task to announce she was only taking folks with appointments only and no walk -ins. Imagine the frustration of everyone who were walk-in and had been waiting patiently for at least thirty minutes. They left to go look for an alternative location and then there was no one left waiting for this service. 

Mission accomplished by the lazy USPS lady staff who clearly didn't want to do her job. Mind you there was only one person who had an appointment and she could have taken others afterwards because it stated clearly on the doors of this post office/USPS website that passport walk-in are welcome. Avoid this place if you can, they make their rules and don't follow store policy

Penzeys is open on 233 Market St! I am not sure if this listing is at an old address but I definitely shopped at a location in Old City today. What a delightful experience it was too. I love exploring new flavors and left with a seasoned salt and a dry mix for a vinaigrette style dressing. There is a specials rack by the check out counter (e.g. 1/4 cup of seasoned salt I picked up was only a dollar). I'm super excited to return to Flavor Town!

Sooo good! We got 2 meat dishes and 4 veggie sides for a group of 4. The brussel sprouts were so good we had to get a second order! Knowledgeable staff and very cozy atmosphere. Exceeded expectations!
Best sushi we've had in Reno. We got takeout and we were so impressed. Fresh and delicious
This place is great, they have so many options and it's affordable. Definitely recommend the cookies at the cash register to save for later!

The best blowout salon in all of STL!! When you go to Drybar, whether for an occasion or just for fun, it is always a personal, relaxing experience that will make you want to come back!!! The stylists are all so friendly and dedicated to making sure you walk out the door with fabulous hair. I have gotten blowouts/dry styles here numerous times and never once have I been disappointed. Like I said-best blowout in all of St. Louis! Even with Covid, I feel extra safe at Drybar because of their sanitation and distancing measures. 5 stars!!!!!

This is the fourth project that we have trusted PHRG with and so far we are pleased with the installation of our new siding. The install team was even willing to work with me as the project was being completed to install the new light fixtures and outlets that I wanted to replace my old outdated ones.

The people that work at this location are great this is directed at the corporate AHole douche bags that come up with their  "policies".
Charged me for a whole months rent even after I moved out! Beware they have a very stupid company wide policy, not just in Philadelphia. I moved out on 12/2 and they charged me for the whole month! All they say is "That's our policy". Yeah but that doesn't make it right!  Your charging people for what they haven't used. If they were a decent company then their policies would reflect the ethical treatment of their customers. Treating people like crap and squeezing as much money out of them with zero regard for fairness or customer satisfaction is not a viable long term strategy. I will NEVER use this company in the future and will go out of my way to influence everyone else not to. Now was that worth an extra months rent? Being greedy and unethical and creating an army of unhappy customers is a sure way to lose in the long term.

This is a bad company.  They don't honor their pricing plans, always moving you to a higher priced plan, regardless of your contract.  Internet service is very slow, usually less than a quarter the speed they promise, and my phone goes out-of-service several times a year, sometimes for days, sometimes for more than a week, and they just don't care.

I have been coming here since they opened.  They went from our favorite 5 star date spot to now it's just mediocre at best.  The quality and portions have gone way down.  The happy hour is fun but when you go in there for it the servers are super slow and act like they don't want you there (and to be honest the quality is even lower during happy hour).  On that point, when we were seated we got traded between three different servers which was really weird.  They kept on forgetting us and spending more time with other patrons.  It made me feel like they didn't want us there with our children.

The Mac and cheese has like no flavor (seriously chik fil a has way better mac, just go across the street and save your money) and the they forgot salt in the crab cakes.   The wedge has WAY too much dressing and the burger came out still raw.  I used to think so highly of this place and I'm sad that it's now just over priced bar food. I really hope they turn it around. I really don't like writing reviews like this but I hope the feedback helps them improve because we would love to see them succeed.

Visiting from NJ and wanted some wings and pasta, found this place with a good rating on Google maps. They provided awesome service, portions, and price! Nice interior and food was worth the wait. Instantly earned 3 stars from polite gentleman taking our order, 4th star from sizzling fresh food, and 5th star from the fact that they didn't get mad when I asked for sauce to go for my wings. Will definitely be my go to spot when returning to the area!

Absolutely awful experience. My son ordered a wrist corsage weeks in advance for his homecoming and when we arrived to pick it up, the corsage wasn't ready... turns out the lady who took his order put wrong  date into system. Thankfully he had some extra time before event and.... mistakes happen.  We returned second time and were given a much smaller corsage arrangement than shown and promised. My son was quite upset and embarrassed about how small and cheap it looked for how much he paid. To add to this unpleasant experience, the corsage had wrong ribbon color on it and was missing decorative components that were supposed to be included.  Clearly a rush job... awful every step of the way. Would not return.

Disappointed. The Santa was good. The other staff not so much. They were in a rush hearing them saying they wanted a break. They just handed us some prints and told us the others would be online. After completing the purchase they told us that we could have picked the print we wanted by looking through the computer but they didn't even give u that option. They followed it by saying but don't worry bc you'll get access to them all online ...... only to find out that we "have access" in other words you have to pay $10 per picture and you can't even see the picture bc they make it blurry until you purchase it. I feel like I wasted $50. We were looking forward to that classic baby with Santa picture and we weren't even given the opportunity to pick that picture out because your staff was in a rush and just printed one for us and sent us on our way. Not ok. I won't be returning next year. Very disappointed.

I love Lowe's in general but about my experience during the Coronavirus situation... I ordered an item for pick-up thinking I'd do the responsible thing and maintain social distance. What a mistake, the store pick-up line was the same as the returns line. The line was out the door but everyone tried to stay 6 feet apart until one man decided he wasn't going to wait outside with the rest of us to return his plastic tubing and stood right next to another man returning some PVC pipe. PVC guy then threatened to call the police, there was some cursing and F- bombs and general consternation. Once inside I stood right next to several customers also making returns. PLEASE, some common sense here Clearwater Lowe's and put the pick up area away from the returns or maybe even stop returns while the Covid-19 pandemic continues.

The staff was friendly and I enjoyed the atmosphere of the place, but I was hoping for a little more... the food seemed bland and subpar to me. I was disappointed that the Pad Thai couldn't be made gluten free, but oh well. Instead I had a poke bowl that was bland and very little substance. It also used dyed ginger which I hate. The fried tofu appetizer was also bland and small portion size. My husband did enjoy the beef pho, so maybe some dishes are better than others.

Terrible! 
Our HVAC burned out, it took 6 months 4 visits from non pros before it got fixed by a pro!!!! Our electric bill went from $150 - over $500. The wiring to the unit was jimmied or patched blowing hot air constantly daily, and the breaker box is double tapped! They don't care about the tenants! Rick never answers his phone!

The work in the units is shoddy and cheap materials are used. It took them 3 months to change an air vent! 

I would not recommend anyone consider renting with them! The most unprofessional residential management company ever! I wonder if the owners know of their terrible reputation and if they care!

We have lived here for over a year and are currently on a month to month as our home is being built!
Amazing job on my phone. Did it on the fly, just with a walk in. Luis stayed late after work to help fix my phone. Only $60. I'm thrilled with their work

I live very close to this new location and had heard a lot about the original location so i was very excited to try Nortons east side. It is a very nice, new and clean sports bar with lots of flat screen TVs for sports watching! Got all the newest games...I.E- golden tee, silver strike etc... So far so good... The drink prices are standard and the pours are fair to light. We ordered the chicken wings ($15 for 20) which are a bit pricey. We got the med buffalo and the garlic parm. The wings are horrible. It is really hard to mess up chicken wings but this place did just that. Not only were the wings the tiny little no meat size wings they were so over cooked that what little bit of meat on the bones was like jerky! The med buff sauce was fair... The garlic parm sauce was awful! It was basically butter with no seasonings. So very disappointed to say the least! I usually try to give a rest a second chance but based on the fact that they are using the tiny wings it just tells me that they are budget minded and not concerned with quality food. Sorry but with its location and this quality food this Nortons location will not survive long. They have to be losing money already! Good TV's for a sports bar but that is it! Def not enough to get my business again!

Virgin Hotels are simply the best! Better than all the rest. The decor is modern and chic.  The staff is too notch.  The food and beverage offerings always excellent.  We loved our time here in Nashville.  The Lodge Rooftop bar was super fun on a Saturday night.  Drinks in the Common Club before dinner time is always a good time.  Really enjoy the perks of being 'In the Know' during Spirit Hour!!  This is an excellent location.  Can't wait to visit again.

I m a prior customer. My safe battery died and I needed the safe opened  It took Larry 5 minutes to open. He needed 2 batteries that he said he d get from his truck. He charged $150 for batteries that cost $5 at cvs. He charged$600!!!  Stay away from Houdini ! There are many locksmiths with consistently good reviews!! Ie Glenloch and Patriot !! Both companies are professional and fair priced  and a pleasure to deal with!

this place is disgusting there very  racist t they put people  in rooms that have rats, cockroaches, bedbugs. There really  rude to kids and every races of people the but there races there's is a lots of drug dealer, prostitution, and they and loots kids are trying to play and they be seeing people doing drug 3 people where here with COVID-19 because the housekeeping didn't want to were there mask but two. And they don't care if there ur room has bedbugs, cockroaches, rats they keep there. there this lady at the front desk who very nice to everyone but the manger and his partner are really rude. there alway people looking at you and they somehow get the master key  to seal stuff and they blame it on the works there they where forcing a lady to live in a room that had rats, cockroaches, and mold so my review is a 0 stars

First time in the area and I really wanted some quesadillas. This is an authentic Guatemalan restaurant with excellent customer service and the food is also really great. It's a little wait for your food but it's definitely worth it

Pharmacy and minute clinic staff gave me incorrect information in regards to COVID19 testing over the phone. After scheduling online and driving almost an hour for rapid test results they treated me like a child and robotically kept repeating themself instead of actively trying to help me solve the problem (which stemmed from the bad info). I felt terrible and drove far for testing , obviously I was desperate. I expected better trained, more compassionate people. It was disappointing and frustrating.

My girlfriend and I came in for cocktails and apps, and were WOWED with our experience. I had been in with my husband before, and we were not impressed, but this visit was different from start to finish. The manager that helped us answered all of our questions about cocktails and wine, and even went a step beyond that and gave us a few tastes. I believe he said he was visiting from another store, it's too bad he doesn't work here, he was great. Go eat at North, it's the best restaurant in the area.

These guys did a fantastic job on my Cummins. I needed a muffler swap, hangers and some extra 4" pipe. I was in and out within an hour. My truck sounds great. I inspected the work done and was impressed. I couldn't be happier with the customer service and the job done. Great job, Thank you.

I won't lie....I heard the name of this place and was like, WHAAAT? We were in town visiting cousins and they said we had to go here for a drink and to hang out. We had many drinks, as the service was hands down the best service we had ever had. Rocky is on it! This place is clean, they follow the Covid rules, and people are treated like family here. I could not get over how massive this place was, and let alone how clean and in order it was. I pictured the bathrooms being gross and just insane, and they were far from that. We stayed for hours hanging out and watching all the shananigans happening. But let me tell you......Rocky does not put up with any bull. You act a fool and out of line, you are out of there! Such a fun place to visit!
Come for the reheated frozen ravioli. Stay for the terrible service.

I put in notice June 5 to end my lease and was told that I had 60 days from notice to move out giving me until August 5th. I was sent an email stating if I had moved out any sooner I would be charged a full months rent and not be prorated (shown in the email sent July 31st). The morning of August 5 I left my apartment at 7:48am to drop my children off to school so I could return home to finish gathering our valuables as I returned at 10:30am the maintenance workers were inside my apartment and had all my belongings cleared out and thrown in the dumpster (please keep in mind it was trash day and my things were scattered between trash containers around the apartment complex). As I began to make everyone aware of the situation absolutely no one made an attempt to retrieve any of my belongings and continue to proceed as if I had been evicted. My most important memorabilia, family Heirlooms ,children's birth keep sakes, SS Cards, Birth certificates etc.. were all thrown out with no questions asked. I have not been reimbursed and was told to contact my renters insurance for compensation. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT MOVE IN THESE APARTMENTS AS THEY ARE UNSYMPATHETIC TO THE MISTAKES AND LOSSES THEY ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR.

Excellent experience the two brothers who are running this fabulous restaurant are extremely cordial and friendly and they go out of their way to make the customer satisfied I had lunch and they treated me to baklava and vegan ice cream the baklava was the best I've ever had! I asked about it and they mentioned that they have a chef who comes every morning and make the baklava from scratch
I will definitely go back and they recommend for you to try this wonderful restaurant

I regret not looking at the rating before going in. 

Ever tried eating a shrimp po boy with no sauce and dry ass bread? Me either after one bite. Super long wait time to get a to go order and there wasn't really a line. 

Since I had driven back to the hotel, I called and was told I had to 'request to have the sandwich dressed.' 

What a crock of bull. I am awaiting a call back from the manager. I'll update this either way. If it's after five, wait until the next day and just go to Central Grocery or another place.

Update: no call back, then they acted like I never called when I tried again in person. 

Very disappointing.

Very poorly staffed. About 20 people in line today and many fresh items completely out of stock. I am a regular Aldi shopper, and this store is poorly  run. Of the two employees working one was shopping for someone's curbside order and she was blocking aisles while having a personal phone conversation on speaker phone. The line for the single register stretched to the middle of the store. 
Aldi is normally a model of efficiency, but today it was a disaster. The normally kind and friendly employees were stressed, distracted, and one in particular was taking personal phone calls at work.
The chicken we ordered was cold wasn't even a full chicken on a 10 piece meal the chicken was so dry and the service was terrible avoid this place at all costs KFC has really lost it

To be fair, I tried them in their first week. So take that for what you will. 

And I liked everything I ate. 

Between the Dan Dan noodles, the soup dumplings, and the Sichuan dumplings, it's a case of everything tasting pretty good. 

But in each case I can tell you that I've had better elsewhere.

These guys always do a great job following up and making sure you are coming or giving you updates about what will be on the lot.

I have even got an upgrade, which we really enjoyed for a work trip!
Easy to locate and great easy drop off area for after hour drop offs.

LOVE THIS PLACE!
So happy to have a great Italian BYOB so close to home.  Our table of four ordered a bit of everything - steak sandwich - salad - pizza - entree...everything was made to order, fresh and delicious.  Our waitress, TRISH, was the best!  She was very personable and gave great recommendations. Our only suggestion would be to dim the lights a little later in the evening!  We'll definitely be back.

The wait time for take out is excessively long and the staff are not attentive and not present at the register or front station. They offer no apology for a 45 minute longer wait - just that we are every busy. 

Phoning in the order is near impossible - phones are not always answered and go right to voicemail

Not sure the food is worth the excessive wait - with family and guests at home

First off, this is the first bad review I have EVER given, but I also have had a terrible experience with Bob's Discount furniture.  Here is a summary of what has happened in the last three weeks:
