1.  Ordered a new sectional from Bob's Discount Furniture in Indianapolis, IN.  The experience was good and handled well.  The sectional was $3,000.00; so we didn't get the cheapest thing in the store!
2. Delivery of new sectional was also great.
3. Sectional was only two weeks old and the recliner came up and wouldn't go back down. 
4. Called to get that piece of the sectional replaced (stayed on hold 20 minutes) and they refused to replace the broken piece but sent out a technician to "fix" it.
5. Technician came out and couldn't fix the broken piece but would get parts to come back and fix it.
6. We called again two days later and the technician never ordered the parts, so after waiting on hold for 30 more minutes the man who answered the phone said he would order the parts and ship them to my house.  He then told me to call back when the parts come in so they can order another technician to come fix it.  I asked if they could just replace that section of the sectional and he was extremely rude.  He said no and hung up on me.
So, now I'm stuck for at least two more weeks with a section of my sectional stuck in the reclined position for at least a month.  The customer service is the WORST I have ever experienced and I'm kicking myself in the butt for thinking it was a good idea to buy a nice piece of furniture from Bob's.  Learned my lesson and hopefully you won't buy your next piece of furniture from them either.

Needed "White Elephant " gift for a last minute Christmas Party invite, was driving on Moana Lane and noticed Bouchée Confections and decided to stop.  A very neat candy shop with an excellent selection.   Also serve coffee and pastries.  If you want some super handmade candies you should check this local business out.

First, let me say YUM! I was in the area getting my haircut and I found Pho Street, a day prior on yelp. Parking in this area can be a little tough, but circle around and you will find something. Also, Pho Street has a little parking lot, less than 20 spots, across the street that gives 10 free minutes of parking! That was smart and fair because people are going to be picking up food and really shouldn't have to pay for parking. 

Their front door seems to be having some issues, there was a piece of paper on the entrance door that read "PULL" or maybe people couldn't figure it out because it's glass. The waiting area is smaller, their dinning area is much larger on the inside, than you think it would looking from the outside. I had their pork Banh Mi and I can't remember what vermicelli but it had pork and shrimp with a little fried roll. 

The Banh Mi was pretty good, I didn't put any sauce on it since I was eating it in my car before I drove more than an hour to get home, in rush hour on the Blue Route. I didn't actually eat the vermicelli until the next day but it was good and I know would have been great fresh. Their portion was large as well.

If I am ever in this area again, I would defiantly stop by for the same items or maybe try other things. Yum!

This is an easy 5-star for me.

These are not cronuts, but they are croissant adjacent. Flaky on the outside and super fluffy and soft on the inside. These doughnuts are huge and the and the flavors are just as big! First time here? Get an order of four and these flavors; french toast, pistachio, coconut cream and the maple pecan. The S'more doughnut is an easy sub if you're not feeling any of the aforementioned treats. They also have keto and vegan doughnut options available. 

They do have delicious coffee here as well. Their plain iced coffee is the perfect pairing with any of these sugar bombs. They also offer lattes, americanos, cappuccinos, double espresso shots and a honey cinnamon cold brew. 

Heads up, parking here is tough. There is just a small side lot and some parking in the back. 

Happy snacking!
Haley did a great job with my fine hair. She was very nice and professional throughout. I especially enjoyed the wash which wasn't rushed at all.
Delicious, great variety & super friendly and welcoming. This little gem of an Italian restaurant is incredible! It make me feel like I'm in Italy. A must try if you're visiting.
I love the boba drinks here, they are perfect! I don't go to any other place because moonlight is just that good. It is my go-to boba place, I would definitely recommend it!

I've been enjoying the Reading Terminal since I was 17.  So I've been going there for great food for 31 years.  

Stopped in this past Saturday afternoon to get some lunch.  My boyfriend mentioned a Thai restaurant that he used to go to when he worked in the city.  He recommended the salmon dish which was soooo good!  

I stopped in a Moroccan shop and everything was so beautiful and made in Morocco.  Took me right back to being there when I was 19 and in the outdoor markets!

I grabbed some cookies too....and they were only $1 each because it was National Cookie Day!

The terminal has everything you want and some things you didn't even know you needed!

I have been getting my lashes done by SADI for about 6 months now. I usually get them on the longer side and 2D or 3D with a C curl I think. I just tell her what look I like and she does her thing. I have always left extremely satisfied with the quality of her work. I usually fall asleep and she let's me lol. I work very long hours so this is a welcomed nap. Other times we chat and laugh the whole time. She is definitely a master of her craft! I refuse to have anyone else do my lashes. She is generally on time for her appointment and I have never had to wait more than 5 minutes after my apt time for her to be ready for me. She sanitizes the station between each client and follows the mask rules the whole time. I just can't rave about her enough! If you wanna try getting your lashes done please go see her, you won't regret it!

Not only have they diagnosed and saved my life, when they completed that part they made me feel pretty and look younger and check me every 6 months to keep me that way!!! I love all the people there and I love the care and kindness they show me.

Twice in the span of two months they screwed up my take out order.  Rather,  they took my order on the phone but never put it into the system.  Upon arriving, usually half an hour after placing my order,  my food was never prepared.   

So, poor service. And since changing ownership,  the sushi just isn't the same quality as before.

What initially brought us to this restaurant was the incredible photos of the venue. We were able to sit upstairs. Our server, Destiney, was amazing! She was very friendly, offered recommendations, and was attentive to our table. The Kentucky Colonel Bowl was probably the best of the three meals we tried that morning but the Crème Brûlée French Toast and the Short Rib Biscuit Benedict was delicious as well. I will definitely be returning  when I'm in Tampa again!

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. 

I got here at 8:10 on a September 24th Saturday night while coming in another customer just happened to be leaving. There was one lady here she asks what would I need and I tell her just a regular full set and a pedicure and said okay. 

So she tells me to pick a color and while I'm picking a color I walk towards her and she tells me the people that do nails left to pick one or the other.. that she cant. And I know it's BS. Mind you they close at 9:30

Why tell me okay then tell me you can't? 

So then I tell her fine I'll take a pedicure. 
I then ask her if she knew how to do a regular manicure instead of acrylic and she says yes but she can't.. like why? You close at 9:30 nobody else is here. 
She tells me oh sorry. baby. I don't understand. 

WHY DO YOU THINK IM HERE THIS LATE? OH, maybe because I too have a baby and can't bring a a few month old baby to the nail salon so the only time I can get is at night. If you needed to be home then maybe you should've worked a different shift.

So then my nails are done I go to dry them.. I give her my card to pay and and not even a few seconds pass and she's asking me to leave. Excuse me? I just paid for your service and you're asking me to leave? no. My toenails need to dry. I paid for your service and will use the drier until I am finished. She has the nerve to ask me twice. And asking nicely wasn't gonna make me leave any quicker. I already wasted my time coming here to pay for your services and got half assed! 

I obviously came because some people find places convenient for them.. but I guess you can't go somewhere just because it's convenient for you.  Poor service becomes an inconvenience for people that wanna put money in your pockets! 

and your hours of operation say you close at 9:30!  I was home before 9. 

I wouldn't give any star reviews! But to continue I had to give one. LOL
Pizza was delicious! Had a large pizza for lunch thin crispy crust and really good sauce that they use. Can't wait to try some is the pasta dishes. Will definitely go again!

It is with a very heavy heart that I have to leave a very negative review of Day and Evening. I have used them for over 10 years and within a few months  this animal hospital has completely gone downhill. They don't answer their phone, they tell you they can't see you for a week, and they overbook so bad that when you're there you wait hours to have your dog seen. Due to this overbooking greed they do not have the staff to actually take care of your baby. My dog died ALONE in a CAGE last Saturday because they didn't even have the decency to call me and tell me he was going down. The night before, the doctor's exact words were "he's out of the woods". I had him on  24 hour care for several days and I was there the day before hand feeding him. The Dr. called me and actually said  "Maxi's not doing so well" I immediately said I'll be right there and then the doctor says he died two minutes ago. How can you "not be doing well" if you are already dead? I am besides myself!!! She told me they tried to feed him 15 minutes before they called me but that he didn't seem right. I can walk to the clinic. I live minutes away. They should've called me and not let my dog die alone in a cage!!!!!!!!!!!! I can no longer recommend this place and will never bring a pet there EVER again! Dr. Camp came to my house a few years ago to  help my 15 year old Labradoodle go over the bridge. Every time I try to book an appointment with him they tell me he is only there on Thursdays to do surgery. They lied to me the day before my last appointment and said he would not be there but I saw him when I was in the back trying to hand feed my little Maxie. Just thought I would mention that. Completely besides myself!!!

I recently moved to the Philly area and immediately started looking for a good barber shop since I get my cut weekly. I checked out this place and was not disappointed! The owner, Will, is welcoming when you walk in the door. When I showed up for a recent appointment, only to find out my barber called out, Will was able to get me squeezed in with another barber. I also like the diverse clientele that comes through. I'll definitely continue to get my weekly cut here!

$40 missing from my handbag after getting nails done here. Go to another salon. There are a lot of good ones around. I had two twenties in my handbag and a few singles AFTER I paid. It was a small bag so there was no wallet. She said go back to the nail dryer and a moment later she came up with my bag. They usually grab your possessions for you just after the polish goes on - that was fine...except later that night (I went straight home) when I looked in my bag - there were only the 3 singles in there. I went straight home. I had already paid and I had two twenties left. I left them a message as it was after hours, asking them if my money "fell" out of the bag. The next day, no call. I called again and she says she left me three messages. Umm....no. Not even one. Why would she leave 3 messages anyway? So that was the first lie. The second one was, no, we never saw any money.

I had read the great reviews on Caffé Buondí, so wanted to try it. I was going to lunch with a friend and asked her if she wanted to try this place too. She exclaimed that it was one of her favorite restaurants! And I see why. 
It is a cute chic little place. And the food is fantastic. I started with a Chocolate banana smoothie which came with a chocolate chip cookie on top. 
For my meal I had the Sophia frittata which had sausage, goat cheese and red peppers. It was so good! It came with a side and bread. I got fresh fruit and a croissant. All really, really good, and fresh. 
The service was great too. 
Definitely plan to go back many times!

Santa Barbara is a quintessential beach town.  The proximity to tons of beaches, fun downtown and super cool trails/hikes up the San Ynez mountains makes it ideal for a travelers getaway. Every time we goto SB, always make it point to stop by Hendry's as it encapsulates a lot of what makes this city so charming. Hendry's is located literally on the (Arroyo Burro) beach, as in if you sit at certain spots outside, it looks like the tide is approaching your feet which I love. Food here is excellent and fresh. Last visit we tried their happy hour, got the ceviche tostadas which were huge and of different variety (rockfish, shrimp and crab), but what really stood out was the chowder fries, hot nice chunks of fry, covered in delicious chowder, topped with chunks of bacon, enough for 3-4 imo really hit the spot. Hendry's is a place you'll be going too forever.

Not a big fan of pie, usually. Some people really dig it, but I find that it's often dry and the crust and filling are not proportional... This is absolutely not the case of the pies at Grand Traverse Pie Company. They are delicious and moist and perfect. I especially love their apple crumb pie... which is weird because of all the pies I don't like, apple is usually the pie I don't like the most. (Does that make sense? lol.)

Anyway. I would also like to respectfully disagree with my fellow reviewer... I've had the opportunity to enjoy a few of their food offerings. Their loaded potatoes are amazing (and HUGE), but my favorite thing there (in terms of non-dessert) is definitely their chicken pot pie! The crust and filling are both superior to many pot pies I've enjoyed in the past. The crust is flaky and light, and the filling has a good chicken to vegetable ratio. They also make a pretty decent chicken salad sandwich!

The place has a cozy, contemporary feel. It would be a great place to study with friends while enjoying pie... (if only they stayed open a little later.) It's always been pretty quiet when we've been there, but, again we don't always eat at conventional times.

The other thing that has struck me every time we've been there is how GENUINELY nice the staff is. They are always pleasant and helpful. It has a bit of a family owned feel, in that sense... And even though I know it's a chain, it feels like everyone there has a vested interest in making your experience great.

Grand Traverse Pie Company is definitely comfort food at its best. Great for these chilly Fall evenings!

We are staying across the street at Moxy, so this place is very convenient. I was hesitant to try this place with so many bad reviews, but I like to give the benefit of the doubt. Everything was really good. We had chicken parm, the baked raviolis, and a pepperoni pizza. We were NOT disappointed. The staff was nice and helpful, and the wait was not long. My only complaint is how full I am, cuz I couldn't stop eating. LOL. I definitely recommend!!!!

I am shocked by how we were treated tonight. Not only do we live an hour away, but it was to celebrate my daughters 14th birthday. 

I had high hopes as the restaurant even called me this morning to confirm my reservation. 

We arrived on time and were seated. We sat in an area with several tables. My family and I sat there for 20 minutes, as servers and waiters passed us. I cannot believe we were not spoken to or even gotten our drink order. Insane! We decided to leave as I don't feel comfortable spending towards $200 for dinner and not to be valued. 

If you don't want to be valued as a customer, come here!

It was our third vacation day in NOLA and we wanted to eat somewhere where the food was healthy, still flavorful, and reasonably priced. I was browsing through Yelp and came across Cafe Rose Nicaud. What a find!

We were warmly greeted by the gal behind the counter. She was helping a customer when she greeted us, so we had some time to look at their menu.

You have to order at the counter and they bring your food out to you. A very cute cafe in Marigny (Frenchman St area) with lots of personality! My husband, son, and I each ordered the Southern Breakfast: Scrambled eggs, rosemary grits, and bacon, and biscuit. This was my second time eating grits. I'm so glad this second time was pleasant! The grits were flavorful. Our meal was yummy! The coffee was by far the best we tasted in NOLA. It was hot and smooth, no bitterness.  Service was fantastic. The staff was kind, personable, and efficient. The prices was  reasonble, too. Overall a very pleasant experience!

This review is about the hospital facility. It is not about the doctors and nurses who work in the hospital. Those people are amazing. The nurses especially are saintly people with immeasurable patience and I'm sure deserve much more compensation.

And I appreciate running a hospital is really challenging and complex. But how they run the cafeteria here boggles my mind. It is stuffed full of sugary and salty processed foods. It is very reasonably priced which is nice, but it's unbelievable how unhealthy the vast majority of the food is. They have slivers of attempts at healthy food, but it's side show compared to the sea of junk food. 

It would be unreasonable (to me) to think diet can fix any health problem. But it would also unreasonable to me to think that food has no impact on health - yet that is the impression I received visiting their cafeteria. If a hospital cannot make it easy to be healthy and make the default food option be nutritious, what hope do non-health institutions have? I feel especially bad for the people who work at the hospital, as there seem to be few other food choices within walking distance.

I saw a deal on Gate 1's weekly newsletter for the 8 Day Classic Dubai trip in March 2015. I sent an email blast to my group of travel buddies and we booked two days later. This is our second trip with Gate 1 and we will definitely be using them again in the near future for our travel desires! 

Dawn Stott in the sales office is a fantastic resource of information and her patience is incredible. Our group of 4 did a conference call to her to book the trip and between getting disconnected and having one person's credit card declined, she spent a solid 45 minutes with us to ensure that everything was correct. 
We booked our optionals soon after and sent in our check payments to get the reduced price. The paperwork with all the logistics arrived when promised and we were able to make arrangements with our work/vacation schedules. All the logistics for the trip were flawless between the flights to/from the US, the transportation between airport and hotel, transportation during our time in Dubai and the schedule ran smoothly. Our tour manager was Hench and while he was rather new to being a tour guide, he did well with accommodating to our group of 36. 

The hotel in Dubai was the Hyatt Place and it was perfect. It was a good location for us because during our free time we went to shop and check out some local restaurants. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Jane at the front desk was great at answering our questions and always had a smile on her face when we walked through the front door. The breakfast had slight variations every morning but included fresh fruit, cereals and yogurts, hot items such as eggs and chicken sausage, toast and pastries, fruit juices, and lunchmeats and cheeses. We had the dinner buffet one evening and it was fantastic.

The itinerary for Dubai and Abu Dhabi was full of activities yet we had a decent amount of free time to explore on our own, I felt it was a good combination. We only took a little bit of spending money and brought home a bunch of dirham because the prices were cheap for everything. Lunch on your own runs about $3 and dinner around $8-10. Shopping in the souks allows you to barter for lower prices so we did well on our spices.

Many of my friends and family members couldn't believe that we were going to Dubai because they believed it to be unsafe, but honestly I felt more safe there than at home in the US! There is little to no crime since 90% of the people are ex-pats working in the UAE on a visa. Any violations or crime record would have them deported back to their home country immediately. We walked around in the evenings and explored as much of the city as we could but never felt unsafe.
Gate 1 is a fantastic travel company who offer good deals so you can see the world on any budget. I highly recommend them because their logistics are flawless and their staff is fantastic to work with during your planning process. Thank you!

The pinnacle of used book stores.  This place is huge, more books then a Borders or B&N, and the place is an actual old barn.  There are little staircases leading all over, and they provide a map, in case you're not sure if you seen the whole place.  Hard and softbacks throughout the store, which is well organized by subject.

Overpriced... when called out on it said they price match, but then refused to let me look at the style number or RN# so that I could make sure I looked up the exact same shoe online. 

Customer #1 *tries on New Balance shoes*
Customer #2 *I think these are cheaper online"
Sales Lady "Those are a different style, the shoes on your phone are this other pair on our wall."
Customer # 2: "would you price match those ones for the exact same shoe?"
Sales Lady "yes"
Customer #1 "Oh okay well if we can find this other style on the new balance or other website will you price match it?"
Sales Lady "Yes I'll price match if it's the same show"
Customer #1 *takes off shoe and starts looking inside the tongue of the shoe for the SKU or RN # , looks up and asks sales lady for help/to check the shoe box for the style number instead..."

Sales Lady: "what are you doing?!"
Customer 1: "I'm trying to check for the style number to look it up online and make sure I'm showing you the exact same shoe so that you'll match the price!"
Sales Lady *LITERALLY rips shoe out of my hand* saying sternly "you can't have that!"
Sales Man comes over: "That's COMPLETELY inappropriate here!"  

Customer #1's brother: "it's completely inappropriate to look up the shoes online?"
Sales man: "Yes I'm sorry!"
Customer #1 "why?!"
Sales: "like I said it's completely inappropriate"
Customer #1 "but why is it inappropriate?!"
*Sales lady starts walking towards the back furiously*
Salesmen: "because we're the ones that fit you and you wanna do business with someone else!"
Customer #2 "but we're trying to buy them from you and have you price match them!"

Salesman "we don't do that!"
Customers brother "you don't price match?"
Customer #1 "that lady said you'd price match the same shoes!"

Salesman "absolutely not thanks for asking though!"

Actually flabbergasted, this is not a word I ever use but it's THAT ludacris. 

You don't think people are going to look these up online? If you don't want to price match that's fine I totally get it! You're a small business and may need extra margin to get by!

But if you explained that to me I would be totally fine with it, I would respectfully say "oh that's fine I get it! I'm just not willing to pay that amount."

Instead they assumed I was somehow undermining their business and being extremely rude!

It's 2021... your customer service matters!

This practice is really great! I moved to Nashville and was dreading having to find a new doctor. However, everybody here is so nice and the office is immaculate. The waiting room is very nice, and you can tell that they all care about having a nice place where women feel like they're going to get the best of care. After years of talking myself out of it, I finally decided to get the IUD in. The procedure was very painful- as expected- but I couldn't have asked for two better women to help me through the whole thing. Jennie was one of the nurse practitioners. The second nurse was telling me each and every step along the way, while Jennie was fanning me. I know that sounds weird- but it helped sooooo much! The pain is overwhelming at times and you heat up so fast. Her doing that helped me from being nauseous. Even afterwards they were very encouraging and warm. The front desk woman is friendly also. Overall, I'm very happy that I found my new OBGYN, and I'd highly recommend them to anybody.

I liked the place, but had to knock off a star because of flies coming in from the open air bar close to the dining room.  It's a great concept, but real bad idea and was wondering how many of the flies might have ended up in the kitchen and in the food.

I had the ribs and the were very good, but a bit too fatty and really greasy.  The veggies and potatoes were both real good.  They also gave six complementary muffins that were very yummy, but you have to pay another $1 for an additional six of them...real bummer!!!

My grandson got a bacon cheeseburger that had some real bad tasting bacon on it and was mostly fat and the burger wasn't cooked to medium, it was more like med rare or almost rare and he chose not to finish it.

My wife really liked her salmon, veggies and sweet potatoes and had nothing bad to say about the food.

Out server was pretty good and attentive, but not sure if I'd go back, unless the bar and fly area were taken care of.

Fantastic tacos al pastor with a hint of sweetness from the grilled pineapple. Nice sides with cactus and onions and overall a filling meal for 10 bucks. Don't be fooled by the aesthetics, this place is a gem!

We were very excited when we saw this place open in the new Town Center but we haven't tried it until now. I scoured the other reviews prior to going which is why we were in no rush to go. We finally did. Here are the results:

Group of 6 dining at 7:00 on a Wednesday night. 

Atmosphere: this place is much larger inside than I realized! Lots of tvs above the bar...some playing sports and some playing (current and oldies but goodies) music videos. It is pretty loud inside. We had a hard time hearing each other at times but we didn't have to yell. We were sitting nowhere near the bar. There is a good mix of tables; high tops, booths, round tables, etc. The bar was packed. It is very long and there is only one side for patrons to sit. There is a really awesome outdoor area perfect for relaxing with friends or a date. 

Service: we had a reservation but had to wait a little bit past our time. Nothing major. The hostess had a bit of an attitude. Our server was a bit awkward. He was not very attentive. We asked for water but didn't receive any. I had to ask again. He was a bit awkward with small talk when we tried. He didn't come to ask how our food was until some people were already finished so if there was a problem it would have been too late. It wasn't terrible service but it wasn't great, either. 

The bathrooms were ATROCIOUS! This is always concerning to me because I feel like if the bathrooms are that nasty, how clean is your kitchen? It smelled like a subway station upon entering. The scent of urine hit me like a train. There was trash literally thrown in the sink. Gum wrappers, a napkin, paper. Really? 

Food: Pretty good! 
Crab dip- mostly cream and cheese, not much crab
Buffalo shrimp- a bit over cooked but the taste was good. Nowhere near as delicious as Redstone's buffalo shrimp. The blue cheese was good 
House salad - large, good
Fish tacos- a little dry, the bottoms broke open from being soggy. I think they were sitting for a bit while waiting for everyone else's food to be ready. The flavor was good. Fried mahi, not grilled. There was an extremely flavorful corn and bean salsa of sorts served on the side which I wasn't expecting. This was excellent!
Sriracha and City Works burgers - good, not great 
Fries- hot and tasty, respectable portion. Not the 3 or 4 fries other people are talking about. 
Filet Sliders - only 2, gentlemen would prefer 3, as it was a small portion for them

Drinks- worst Riesling I've ever had in my life. Gave me a headache and I haven't had a wine headache in a very long time. It was very dry. It almost tasted like beer. Never again!
Beer - just ok. Different sizes available. Chalkboard with beers listed on wall
Strawberry mixed drink - delicious
Dessert - only two options which is kind of weak. We did not try either

Overall, it was a good experience. We will return and would recommend it to other people. Definitely make a reservation! If it looked like this on a Wednesday, I can't imagine what it looks like on a weekend!

Once again I'm impressed with Drybar. I came to town for a wedding and needed my hair styled. I made a last minute appointment and came in Saturday morning. My stylist was professional and quick! My hair came out lovely. 

Having thick, curly hair can be intimidating to some, but not this drybar. I was welcomed with open arms and received great care! Highly recommend!
I normally love this place especially the scones but I'm not going back until all of the staff wear masks. I don't appreciate them talking over my food and drinks every time I've been in there.

I have been going to the Dali museum since early 2000's and till this day I do not get bored of it.  It's seriously such an amazing place to go relax and check out their rotating exhibits as well.  Of course I do get asked if it doesn't get old going to the museum like 2-4 times a year, but my answer it's always "nope". Specially when you have visitors from other states it's definitely worth it to have them visit the museum and afterwards enjoy the garden and what the city of St. Pete has to offer. 
The staff members are always so happy and eager to help you with any questions.  You can also download their app, stand in front of some of their larger paintings, point your phone at the painting and follow the instructions. I don't want to spoil it so I won't say much more  :) 
They have a small cafe on the first floor which serves some refreshments and food, and a shop for souvenirs.  The small garden in the back it's also a nice spot to have some drinks and enjoy the views.

Pretty dang good pizza! My husband is obsessed with their mushroom truffle sauce! Dave Portnoy from Barstool has made me obsessed with New York style pizza and I have zero regrets. Perfect amount of cheese, flavor and that crunch! Yum! So delicious!

Totally worth the stop when on the westside! THE BEST RIBS EVER! Yes I need to yell, they are that good. They are so big that we split a full rack and still have some left. We got the mild and the sauce was the perfect flavor. 
We got our order to go and they wrapped up the box which was awesome or it would have been all over our car I am sure. We also got 4 slices of bread each individually wrapped, which I thought was cool. It was busy, but not too busy. I was worried about it with the race stuff going on down the street. I was happy to be able to introduce my husband into some finger licking good ribs!

This is the best Chickie's & Pete's around and it is the original. I've been to the one near the stadium but I like this one far better. The staff here makes you feel at home, where at the others I just feel like another number. They stick to the original menu here so it is smaller than the rest but it is still very good. I recommend the cheesesteak and crab fries. They have the best fries around. Even PJs famous fries don't compare to these. They have a full bar as well. If you're going into the city stop here for food first and you won't regret it!

Maybe it's me, but this was not good.  I ordered the Szechuan Shrimp, it was red.  I mean literally red.  Aside from that, there was loads of sauce with shredded carrots, I think and three shrimp.  The shrimp were mushy, yuck.  The ribs were fine, but stick to the appetizers if you're starved, otherwise, go elsewhere.

Made two stops here during my recent visit to Nashville. The staff was very friendly and did a great job picking the perfect dozens. Had a little sample for my self and lucky there isn't a location near me. The donut was light and fluffy with the right amount of sweetness.  The combination of croissant and donut is a match made in heaven. Looking forward to my next visit.

This place is amazing ! Small but cozy, the atmosphere is fun and the staff is very friendly !! The suggestion of the food was spot on , also there's a check in for a free koozie on here but they were out so they offered me a bar glass with their logo on it ! I love it ! I'm going to add it to my at home bar collection ! The only thing is I wish the spicy chicken sandwich was everyday ! It's hard to get to Nola on Tuesday , deff come again! Nachos were my fav I love a good bbq pulled pork nacho

We love this place also have great service and a wide selection of cigars. We really like the customers as well they are always very nice. The bathroom should definitely be deep cleaned though it's definitely a mans bathroom . Good selection of whiskey and bourbon.

What a great hike. The beginning of King trail is a little rocky, but worth it. The trail gets better once you reach sweetwater trail to head up to Wasson Peak. It's amazingly short with only 4 miles to the top. Great views of the Catalina and Rincon mountains. The only bummer is no dogs allowed. We also took the option to make it a loop. I would highly recommend seeing a different view back down. Plus slightly less steep and easier on the knees. Hope to take friends who visit soon on this hike.

We enjoyed this tour very much. We got every bit of the 3 hour tour we reserved. 

First off, the service was excellent. Our guide was very friendly, and helpful. He made sure we all had water, properly fitted helmets, and we were all happy with our bikes before we took off. 

During the tour, our guide was incredibly knowledgeable. He made sure he shared with us as much education as he could, and he gave us plenty of time to take pictures and quickly explore areas we stopped at. He was very kind. 

Also, during the rides, while in the City, he was extremely cautious with traffic, made sure no one was left behind, and we were always safe on the road. 

Even after the tour, he offered recommendations on where to get lunch, and gave us a free water bottle. 

Not much else you could want on a tour. The tour was affordable, the service was kind, the trip as saw and packed with plenty of stops and education on the beautiful city of Philadelphia.

Great place! I bought my family a gift basket and they loved it. They already opened the gift and were chomping away when they called me....they couldn't resist I guess. Will return again in the future to purchase for myself or for a special gift.

Leaving this feedback after a personal attack from the front desk which I previously wrote about saying I was racist against Asian people! That is a sad and disgusting situation and all that know me know not only do I have friends of every ethnicity but I have also dated al ethnicities bc people are people, they are not their gender or RACE. 
Please EVERYONE stay away from this place! 
They take your money give shit attitudes and then attack your character DO NOT SUPPORT THIS LOCAL BUSINESS

Went here for my birthday brunch and they had all of my favorite things: coastal views, bourbon flights, lobster rolls, and raw oysters! 

Had an amazing time with my family and wish I lived closer to Santa Barbara to enjoy a boozy brunch from time to time! Although the parking situation was hectic, as it was Labor Day weekend, we found the literal last parking spot in the overflow lot and missed brunch service. No shade to benedicts but uh, lunch was nothing to turn your nose at!

Quite simply.. there is something for everyone to enjoy and you can even make a beach day out of it!

I feel weird giving this semi-casual, surprising little place in the heart of Whitestown five stars. A good friend of mine lives in Lafayette, so this is the perfect place for us to meet that's not too far for either of us. That's the end. No expectations except to maybe get a burger that wasn't awful and split a dessert that had been taken out of a box in the kitchen. 

But hold on. Could it be that this place is... FANTASTIC? Noooooo... but YES. 

The staff is friendly and accommodating. They go out of their way to make sure you have a good experience. And the food. THE FOOD. For real, it's perfectly prepared. The fish is wonderful, the steak is exactly as ordere, the vegetables were yummy. Their pasta game is on point. The side salad was fresh and crunchy and they didn't skimp on the non-lettuce items. We had a bread pudding dessert that was to die for. 

We've met here twice and both times, for real, we had an outstanding experience. At lunch it's more casual--grab a sandwich and you're on your way. At dinner they fancy the place up with candles and white tablecloths. It's so nice. 

So, yeah. I can't believe it either. But the five stars are well deserved.

This hotel is great. We arrived super early and they gave us a room. We originally booked a king room city view and was offered an upgrade. We took the upgrade and had an nice room with an amazing view. 

The hotel was super busy but never seemed over crowded. The service provided was great and the staff we encountered were eager to help or answer questions. We ordered room service for breakfast one morning and the food came in quick and tasted great. FYI they add gratuity to room service orders. 

With all these great things there was one problem. There was no extra blanket nor one that was very thick. So we spent a bit of time chasing temps on the thermostat.

I enjoyed little Leon! 
Food: build your own bowl or select from a few of their recommendations. All ingredients look fresh and are tasty. They have clear delineations on the menu for those with dietary restrictions. I liked their hummus bowl, their Thai bowl and I also tried a build your own bowl several times which were all excellent. They have "vegan meatballs" which are actually really good. I am glad they didn't go with some bland unseasoned vegetarian option. When they opened they had covers for their take out bowls that didn't fit but they have since resolved this issue. My one point for improvement is that their portion sizes seem inconsistent each visit. 
 
Atmosphere: really bright and clean. They have indoor seating and an outdoor area. They have a window for pickup orders too. You go up to the front and pick out what you want in your bowl. 

Service: staff is very friendly, and provide good service. 

Overall: really great menu and options, it's really nice to have a healthy food place with quality food. I plan on returning frequently!

Solid spot for an airport meal.

Pros:
- Food was pretty good - got a grilled chicken sandwich with fries. There are lots of options (sandwiches, wings, salads, burgers). Also lots of drink options!
- Food came quickly, which is obviously important at an airport restaurant. 
- Plenty of outlets at the long tables in the airport concourse to the left of the restaurant.

Cons:
- When I first sat down, table hadn't been cleaned, and it took ~10 minutes for the waitress to come over. Once she did, she was super friendly, but def took some time to get going.

I love this store! Just moved to Reno and I needed just about everything! I found great warm boots (almost brand new $8, and another pair for $20), slippers, household and kitchen items. I went out with a cartload full of things I needed for under $100. The staff was friendly too. I'll definitely go back soon!

Tonight was my first time going here because I bought a Groupon and it was expiring. What a GREAT time. I didn't expect it to be as great as it was. 

The food was AMAZING, especially their mussels in delicious sauce, and the sushi was def a 5 star rating and very very good. They have a great menu selection along with great drinks and specials. The prices are very reasonable and the quality of the food is excellent. The service was outstanding and I will be back for more laughter.

I just moved into a home in a subdivision from an apartment, so it has been difficult for me to stay on top of yard maintenance. HOAs are no joke! One little weed touches the sidewalk and you get a notice. Lance with Prodigy came out to clean up my lawn and even went in an trimmed my bushes in front of my window. He was quick and thorough and I will definitely keep him on regularly because he's very knowledgeable about how the HOA wants the yards to be kept. Also, he has been helping get the grass green again since the weather started getting hotter and the lawn started loosing oxygen.

The humanity from all the staff at this specific location will stand out for me for years to come! The lead in this team is a young beautiful and very kind woman and her name is Shaylee, I believe! If I'm off a little bit, you guys know who I am talking about!
The location I am speaking of is Albany Market Square in the very cold and unkind city of Edmonton. I can say this because I was born and raised in this city 50 years ago and I am not proud of this fact.
On January 4th I had the pleasure of being stranded in this very busy shopping area. It was only a little bit after 5pm, colder than ever, I had a little money, but no phone of my own, I was very emotional and hopeless to say the least... I went through 5 businesses offering to pay 10 -20 dollars for a quick phone call to my husband, no way lady! I had called 5 different cabs to try and get home to Alberta Beach, 70 kms away....
When I flew into this restaurant frantic, in tears, frozen, I was met with the kindest, most sincere spirit of this young lady I will always 
hold up in prayer for her to just be allowed to be herself, for all of her days to come! How she handled my entrance and hopelessness, you cannot learn... it either comes naturally or through personal experience, directly or indirectly! Because it is so real, this lady's beautiful character, the staff working alongside her are very human too!
Shaylee if you read this one day, I need you to know that your response to my desperation and brokennness was so felt for days after our meeting by me personally, the ripple effect of that as well has left me in awe of hope, humanity and the hearts of our  young people today.... I will never forget you,   I pray that you are blessed beyond anything that you could ever dream for yourself, your loved ones and your response to people who are clearly not worth the effort to 75% of the rest of the world is never extiguished! 
You follow your heart girl, cause it truly knows the way!
Give this young lady a raise! A spa day! Anything she needs! Be blessed Panda Express, you deserve it

sincerely, Angela Harter

Everything about my experience at this salon made me feel relaxed and pampered.  From the moment I left my car with the valet, (comes with the salon service) I knew I was in for a treat.  Walking in to the hotel is like walking into luxury and that only continues in the spa. 
I followed my favorite stylist to Evan Todd (I'd follow her anywhere).  The cut and color came with a foot bath and pressure point massage, my arms and hands were massaged as well, and the mini-facial cleanse is part of the deal too! 
The whole team works to make sure you are comfortable and get the exactly right look you came in wishing for.  I was so happy with my hair and left feeling beautiful from head to toe. Worth every penny for the whole experience and the look I left with...great color and perfect cut Claudia! Thank you to the entire staff.

This place is a Tucson staple! The food is authentic and diverse. The menu has practically anything you could ever want Santa Fe style! The chicken tortilla soup is spicy and delicious. The staff was all so friendly and accommodating, truly making the experience outstanding. Bring some friends from out of town here, give them a local experience. Amazing spot.

Anyone old enough to remember the TV show Voltron?
Savor knows how to pull it all together and deliver an epic experience!  
Form feet and legs!  
The atmosphere is sensational.  The staff was friendly and engaging.  The smell radiates and abounds around you making "Savor" such an appropriate name.  
Form arms and torso!  
The menu is diverse, dynamic and delicious!  One of your most difficult tasks will be deciding WHAT to chose.  So prepare yourself to make numerous visits.  Hint:  the appetizers are superb.  Feel free to spread your WINGS!  Hint, hint!   
And I will form the head!  
Personality, decor, exceptional food. 
And then the drinks!  Wonderful wine selection but I highly recommend the cocktails the Lemon cocktail is seductive and surprisingly refreshing.   

Go Voltron!  Er, um... SAVOR!

I've been putting this off for a while because I absolutely hate to have to write this.  I also had some physical trouble recalling the entire event. 

I had been looking forward to trying this place for quite a while as I live close by and just happen to notice it one day.  Then I came across a social medial post raving about their tacos and I had to try them.  I placed an order for the Compadre Quesadillas with Birria, it sounded amazing.  My wife, at the last minute decided not to order anything.  The food arrived via delivery service not too long after the order, I opened it up, snapped a photo and started eating.  It was pretty tasty, the reason for 2 stars instead of 1.  This was my first time having Birria and I enjoyed it.  The cheese in-between the tacos was also pretty delish.  If only my review could have ended there.

This was all I ate that day, I may have had a granola bar in the morning or something but it was a busy day at work and I just didn't have the time.  Around 5/6pm I opened a beer and sat down with my kids to talk about their day.  Sadly the beer was never touched.  I spent the next 8 hours revisiting the Compadre Quesadillas and whatnot.  I'm not sure what exactly did it and I didn't even know you could get sick from tacos, being one of my staple foods I thought they were the perfect food to live off of.  This happened a couple weeks ago and I still haven't been able to eat another taco, just writing this has got me feeling a bit off.  I'm sorry Cielito Lindo, but you may want to revisit some of your sanitation practices, that night was rough.

A must-see if you're in Philly. You could find anything you want here! A little bit of everything. I'm gluten free and dairy free and we ate at a shop called Molly Malloy's with lots of options. Remember this place is veryyy busy and it can get a little overwhelming. Parking on the same block.

Kinda overpriced, for no reason. Fridge magnets $9 ?! C'mon!
Sponges vary from like 5 to about 25 for really big ones.
Other than that, they sell a lot of stuff. You can find here a ton of sea treasures, whatever got into the net along with sponges lol

My fiancé and I stayed at the Howard Johnson in St Pete and we decided to check out Jimmy B's for lunch out last day.  It's been voted the best beach bar several times in recent years so we figured it would be a good spot.  Our bartender, Mike, was great!  He talked us through some of his favorite menu items and even gave us a few suggestions on other places to check out while we're here.  

We started off with some drinks.  Beer for my babe and a mudslide for me.  I also had a mimosa, which was made with the perfect champagne to oj ratio.  I ordered the fish and chips (SO GOOD!) and my fiancé got the shrimp tacos.  The bar is super relaxed with a fantastic view of the ocean.  Shaded areas made it really enjoyable to sit and relax while we ate.  The live music was a nice touch as well.

Overall, we were really impressed with the entire experience and will definitely be back on our next visit.

Good sushi and great service! The food comes out  in a timely manner, and it's not expensive. I would usually leave sushi places a little hungry, but I was in a food coma after eating so much good sushi. Their bobas are pretty good as well. I would definitely come again.

Today was my first visit after hearing about Frutta Bowls for a while, and man, was it one of the best decisions I made today (the other was getting my lazy butt to kickboxing class)! Located on Centennial Blvd, near White Bison. 51st Deli, Frothy Monkey, and several other notable establishments, Frutta Bowls has a homey vibe to it. There are couches and tables if you choose to eat in - unfortunately I was unable to stay this morning, but I definitely will be back. They have menus up on the wall, as well as smaller hand-held options. I always like to ask the owners/folks who work in the establishment what their favorite is vs what is popular. The gentleman who took my order said that hands down, the Frutella bowl, followed by the Fiji bowl, were amongst the most popular sellers. I had been eyeing a bowl called the Coco Puff, but his avid endorsement of the Frutella bowl really got me, so I went with it. Best decision! 

So. Let me break down the bowls. They have 3 different bases you can use, from what I saw. I had acai (such a fun word). There is also pitaya, and you could have done oatmeal as well, for a more a breakfast-y feel. I had the acai base, topped with granola, topped with swirls of peanut butter AND Nutella, topped with fresh banana and strawberry slices, topped with coconut flakes. I meant to take a picture,  but I'm gonna be honest folks, I took one bite, and a few minutes later, was looking down at an empty bowl. Lol! The bowls are a decent size - you will be full after eating one. Compare the bowl sizes to those Publix fruit bowls, and you know what you're working with.

I plan on going back... maybe as soon as this evening. The bowls range in price from about $7-$10. They also have smoothies and toast. Check this place out - I am looking forward to seeing them around for a long time!

Building and pool area decor/atmosphere: 10/10

The common areas in the house and yard were decorated in a way that felt cozy and inviting, but without the tackiness of home-and-garden kitsch that sometimes passes for "homey-ness." The decor was both classy and warm, and I doubt it would be possible to find better in this price range.


Room interior: 8/10:

The room that we had was very cozy and romantic, and the furniture and other items were in good condition. I found the bed to be quite comfortable as well. The one exception to all the positives was that we had an A/C unit in the room instead of central cooling in the house, which is fine if different guests want different temperatures in their rooms, but the A/C unit was very old and loud. It cooled perfectly well, but was better left on while we were gone during the day so that the room would be cool when we got back, so that we could keep it turned off while we were there. Otherwise, having the A/C on in the room made watching TV or relaxing there just a bit less pleasant due to the loudness of the A/C unit. If the room had a quiet A/C unit then the interior would get 10/10.


Extended continental breakfast: 8/10:

The hours for this were reasonable, making it easy to grab food even if you slept in kind of late. The selection of items was generous, and when we were there, they had hard-boiled eggs available in addition to the juice, fruit and grains that you expect. The cereals and bagels were mediocre quality but I felt like overall I was getting a good deal to get all of the breakfast food included with the room price.


Service: 9/10:

Ed was very accommodating and pleasant. We received everything that we needed. I did request a toilet plunger be brought to the bathroom before leaving for the morning, but by the time that I returned after a couple of hours the plunger was not there, because I think it wasn't brought until the afternoon when the maid service went there. Otherwise I can't think of anything that wasn't perfect about the service.


Location: 10/10:

Being able to walk to everything in the French Quarter made our trip much more enjoyable, and we were still secluded from the noise by being tucked away on Chartres St. I wouldn't have changed anything about where we stayed in the city. Parking the car on the street was also no problem.


Value: 10/10:

I am convinced that by staying here I probably got the best deal in New Orleans to be had within this price range. 


OVERALL: 9/10

My girlfriend liked the place as much as I did. I researched as thoroughly as I could to plan this trip and was concerned by some of the negative reviews but felt more at ease after seeing that they were several years old and mostly upset with the service back when somebody other than Ed was running the place. I also saw a review which complained that the room was in bad condition, but our room was in very good condition and everything was kept very clean, so the few negative reviews I've seen did not at all match our experience as of June 2013. I enjoyed Lions Inn as a place to come home to at the end of the day, not just as a place to sleep and wake up. We also were glad to have the pool and the generous breakfast options, which were more than adequate. Based on our experience I would return here if I vacationed in New Orleans again.

A buddy of mine took me to Tokyo Sushi for my 40th birthday and it did not disappoint.  Their monthly special was All you can drink sake with the purchase of all you can eat sushi.... I don't know how that could go wrong.  The quality of the sushi was amazing. The service was prompt.  Absolutely delicious.  It's crazy that my new favorite sushi joint is in landlocked Reno.  Can't wait to go back

Went here for dinner with my sis. The restaurant looks organized and clean which is nice. When you walk in you have to go straight up to the cashier to order food then they'll give you the number and pick any table you like and they'll bring out your food which is similar to Sauce restaurant.

We both order Pho which is beef noodle soup. Pho is popular for vietnamese food but the Pho here is not authentic. It doesn't have much stuff in it besides a few slices of beef and beef balls. I wish they cut the beef more thin, but the pho here pretty decent for a quick grub.

Overall it's a good place for hang out and get a quick lunch/dinner.

I've eaten here a number of times over the years hope they're successful at their new location on Broadway. They are what they say they are much cleaner less fatty and fresher Chinese food. Also I find that quite reasonably priced. If you like lots of crispy vegetables and even vegetarian Style, I think you'll be quite satisfied.

This is always one of the first places I bring friends and family who visit my boyfriend and me in Philly.  Whether you want to go for ice cream, cookies, Chinese Food, Italian, whatever your craving is, Reading Terminal Market has it.  You won't be disappointed.  It's usually pretty crowded, so expect not a lot of room around you when exploring the market.  

In terms of food, I've tried peking duck rolls from one of the Chinese stands, they're fantastic & affordable.  The ice cream parlor is great too.  I enjoy going to the stores in the back corner where there are a bunch of kitchen gadgets.  I have yet to try the famous donuts that there's always a line for, but I will one of these days!  I highly recommend.  Tons of food options, perfect place to buy a gift for the holidays.

Bisbee Breakfast Club is a favorite for my family and Joe stay, the food is good and there is always something for everyone in my family to eat. Honestly, Bisbee is one of the places that we can go and my youngest (who is an extremely picky eater) will finish her meal. 

One of the things that we live the most (aside from the friendly, knowledgeable staff and the great food) is that there is many choice. If we want breakfast or lunch, there are plenty of options, and we have never been disappointed by our choices. 

Bisbee Breakfast Club has also done a wonderful job adhering to new guidelines set forth during COVID-19 and they have done a great job with to go ordering. The quality of the food had not decreased and the staff remains friendly and up to date with policies and procedures.

Great food and very friendly service. There as something for everyone in our family- the kids enjoyed the carne asado tacos and my husband enjoyed the Sonoran style hotdogs. The condiment was great too. A neat place to eat with a great atmosphere. The only downside is that there aren't any prices on the menu or hours of operation. I would love to know what days and times they are open. We would definitely return.

I love La Colombe! I avoid Blahbux at all costs to support local coffee shops, and La Colombe has great coffee, tea, pastries, and sandwiches. The owner is also a stellar person and philanthropist in the Philadelphia region, so this is a business I can 100% support.

So why a 2-star review? Although I'm thrilled there is a La Colombe at the airport, they need to improve customer service. I'm not sure if the staff here are poorly compensated, overworked, or otherwise badly treated, but they seem anything but thrilled to be working here. They get orders right, so they are trained properly. I think this is a morale thing. I've tried being friendly to brighten their day, but it's little use. I get it, working food service in an airport must not be fun. I hope whatever irks them about working here can be improved.

Ok y'all.... I know I've reviewed quite a few pizza places buuuut I love a good pie!

Blaze has it figured out. As you walk in you'll see what I'm talking about. A build-your-own pizza station!!! They have quite a few options but my go to is the Red Vine. It is topped with ovalini mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, parmesan, basil, red sauce, and olive oil drizzle. I always add an embarrassing amount of whole roasted garlic cloves, might throw on some pepperoni, and then a healthy topping of balsamic drizzle to finish it off. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. 

I never forget an order of the dough knots. They are pretty tasty as well which is why I always go for the 4. They have mozzarella and garlic pesto wrapped in their classic dough! Both my kiddo and I love this place!

Really fun affordable history excursion in Franklin. The tour guide, Seth, did a great job explaining the history of the Lotz family and how he was impacted by the war and trying to protect his family during a crazy time. (This family was only involved in the war because of the location of their home.)  Honestly, the main takeaway for me was that he raised 3 successful kids despite being a first generation immigrant and moving many times trying to make a living for them. I wouldn't recommend bringing young kids, but older children may enjoy it.

I avoided reviewing this Pizza Hut location for a long time now. The experience has always been mediocre but it is our go to for some greasy grub to nurse a hangover and so we get delivery from time to time. It didn't seem fair to write a bad review knowing what I'm going to get each time anyway. With that being said, there are tons and tons of terrible reviews for this location. Most of which I tend to agree with. However, after a fun night out at the GSR, the husband and I were in need of hangover grub and got delivery from this Pizza Hut. I was shocked at how hot and fresh and IMPROVED the quality of the food was. Perhaps they finally decided to do something about the poor reputation or maybe they are under new management but everything we got was actually very good. Usually the stuffed crust pizza thin and dry, toppings shriveled up and burnt, wings are soggy, etc. Not this time. The pizza was fluffy and thick and cheesy and the honey bbq wings were even actually crispy and yummy. It really hit the spot for us and I was inspired to finally leave a review... to encourage the team to keep it up and that people are definitely going to take notice if they stay on this track.

This is one of my favorite places to get great Mexican food! From the tacos to the salads, everything is excellent! I've been a return customer for 10 plus years and I keep going back. Definitely ones of New Orleans hidden treasures.

Very nice atmosphere. I went on a Saturday night around 10PM and it was a small crowd. There wasn't any specific event going on (I don't believe). There was live music which was great! They had the fight playing and the drinks were on point! I was able to find a seat at the bar comfortably. It wasn't overcrowded at all. It's not a large space, but there are plenty VIP styles seating if you ever go that route. 

The was definitely a grown and sexy crowd. I had a great time. R&B vibes!

After getting a $19.99 coupon  in the mail, I opted to try Einstein's over the usually Jiffy Lube trip. We've been a little irked at Jiffy Lube, so we were ready for a change. 

It was a very positive experience. I told them right off that I wanted just the basics, because I was not the car person int he household. I was simply  getting the oil changed for my husband, because I happened to have the time and he didn't. 

I stayed in my car, and was offered a free paper and a drink, cocoa, cofee, tea, soda, or a water bottle- I opted for hot cocoa. I had a leisurely 15-20 minutes, while they worked on the car, and paid my money and left. 

Unlike the others, I was not up-sold to a crazy degree. They offered me a few things, which I politely declined. They were not nearly as pushy as Jiffy Lube typically is. 

I thoroughly enjoyed the experience, and plan to go back. They were polite, not pushy, and cocoa is a nice touch.

None of our food lasted very long, but I managed to snag one photo of my entree, which was incredible. I was here with a large group for a business dinner, so we were seated in a private dining area, but the entire restaurant has an amazing ambiance and could make for a very intimate dining experience.  

My red-wine braised short ribs were to die for. Perfectly cooked and sauced. Coworkers ordered snapping turtle soup, death by gumbo (which had quail, not seafood), scallops, and oysters for starters -- some of the best we had while in New Orleans -- and filets with mushrooms and shrimp, swordfish, and lamb for the main course. Everyone was very happy with their orders, and continued talking about that dinner throughout the week, even after we'd visited some of the classic NOLA restaurants, like Brennan's.

For my drink and dessert, I went with a bit of a theme -- tried the charred citrus old fashioned and roasted lemon sorbet, which were equally delicious. 

Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner out, or are planning a large business event, I highly recommend R'evolution. The menu is very refined and excellently executed. The staff were all pleasant and helpful and were very patient and accommodating, even with the few picky eaters we had with us.

It was a blazing hot day when my wife and I scurried into Le Skewer for lunch. We placed our orders at the counter and found our way to our table-fast casual dining. I'm more of a slow, relaxed diner

We both ordered the Arabic Lamb Burger. Plus, I ordered a bowl of lentil soup. Delivered first, it was a green lentil soup. Tasted OK, but was a recipe that I wasn't used to at all. Oh well. On the other hand, my burger was a thick patty of ground lamb meat with a spicy taste, topped with a dollop of feta cheese. Winner! My side was a generous portion of light, fluffy basmati rice. Our desserts were  Greek baklavas. Every bite...the luxurious taste of honey, the crunchy layers of phyllo dough...were reasons to return.

Now to rate Le Skewer.My meal was almost perfect. But for one item, the soup, I'd award five stars. As it is, four stars for Le Skewer.

We got the fried shrimp po boy which was quite a large portion! It was clearly larger than a Subway foot long for reference. The shrimp was well fried and overall quite an enjoyable experience. I would suggest getting it to split, as it seems like the right amount of food for 2 people (and maybe order something small to split on the side if you have a larger appetite). I was expecting to get blown away but honestly it was good, but not mind-blowing.

We frequent Tokyo Noodle Shop because we dine very late (usually after 9pm) and their hours work for us. This isn't however the best place in the city to get sushi and I feel like the quality over the years is slowly going down.

We ordered a few veggie rolls which were mediocre and consisted mainly of rice. We also got two bowls of the vegetable and tofu ramen with house made noodles. The photo on the menu looked beautiful with a bounty of fresh vegetables. I was pretty disappointed when our soup arrived with a few curls of green onions. Where were my broccoli, carrots, bok choy, peppers and sprouts? The noodles were nice but this dish was sorely disappointing. 

The restaurant is really cold and the chairs are ridiculously heavy. I know that seems like an odd thing to write, but you can actually hardly move them in and out of the table. 

The company I was dining with was pleasant so I wrote off the underwhelming menu but when I got home reflected that this was actually quite a poor experience.

Since nothing is made like it used to be I frequent here to have things fixed or altered. The ladies are so nice and are able to have the items done in a reasonable amount of time. I have also had a few things cleaned and they do a great job. I've never had any issues except trying to find parking.

My first visit to the Golden Arches in yeeeeeears and I really regret giving it another go. I made the mistake of thinking this would be a quick trip through the drive through to grab some chicken McNuggets for my grandson. 30 minutes later, yes THIRTY minutes in the drive-through, we finally got to the front of the line.  
The man in front of us had just thrown his drink at window, which the young woman behind the window was trying to mop up when we pulled up.  I was pretty frustrated and my grandson was very unhappy and hungry as well, I am not one to throw a drink like the jerk in front of us, but a 30 minute wait for food in a drive through is unacceptable. 
The girl in the window apologized and said it was because of the kitchen staff, they are apparently all new and slow (her words).  I started to tell her I understood the frustration of the man in the car in front of me when she said "I'm not in the mood to be yelled at again" and walked off.  I had no intention of yelling, and was surprised that she walked away...but I'll give her a pass since she had just had a beverage thrown at her. 
Here's the thing...the food was cold by the time I got it.  If the food is cold...how is the slow delivery the fault of the kitchen staff? Hmm. 
This started out as a one star review, but the kid who took her place at the window turned it around.  He smiled at me.  He was apologetic and didn't throw the blame on anyone else.  He quickly grabbed my food, threw in a few extra sauces (at my request) and sent me on my way.  I wish I'd gotten his name, because he was cool and collected under fire and that's the kind of guy you want running your window.

Everytime I stop by here, it's a great experience. I've been to PL about 4 times now and wish I started going sooner. The restaurant is tucked behind Greenwood mall and is honestly one of the highlights of the area. I typically order a combination of Japanese and Vietnamese dishes when I go. Rolls are very inexpensive, so I never feel bad adding an extra one to my pho orders. You get about 6-7 pieces, which is pretty big, size wise. They also do not skimp on the pho. Decent meat, lots of fresh herbs and flavorful broth is what keeps me coming back.

This is an awesome place that we visited while we were in the st Pete area of Florida.  I got the black and blue burger with fries and we got the amazing bread sticks. I have two Ford vehicles and this was a lot of fun to visit and eat. Great place

This is one of my favorite coffee shops in Tucson; I really love their frappes and baked goods. I didn't even mind waiting in line for quite some time sometimes. However...seating has perpetually been an issue here, with very little room in the structure as it is.

Frankford Hall is a fun place to hang out with a few friends or even a larger crowd. I went as part of a rather large party one Saturday night and even though it was busy we still managed to find some tables to chill around. They've got a great beer selection, and while I didn't get to really try their food, I did share a soft pretzel which was good! A little salty, but you could rub off the excess. They have fun games to play and just an overall lively vibe going on.  Parking can be tricky around there, so just keep it in mind if you're driving.

I was invited to Coma for an Elite Yelp event. They are in the old Blue Sky space, across from the Galleria Mall. The interior has changed. Much more industrial feeling. We arrived at 5:45 and there were a few people enjoying coffee and food. You order at the counter and then your items are brought to your table.  We were comped for one drink of our choosing(French 75) and an order of fried pickles. We ordered an additional drink(Sangria) and an order of pretzel bites and beer cheese dip. Our drinks were tasty and strong. The two appetizers arrived hot and were good. If I am honest, paying just under $70 with tip for two glasses of wine $8 each, two entrees $12 each and two coffees $3.75 each,  I wouldn't want to order at the counter. It could be a great place for happy hour and/or  a drink and appetizer.
The food was amazing & the drinks!!! Our service Catey was amazing & the sweetest gal! We truly loved our experience and will be back!

So during this coronavirus pandemic, you can't get the full experience of Sno La as you can only do mobile ordering on a limited menu. But they still had the popular flavors available and I applaud their efforts to flatten the curve by implementing effective social distancing during these uncharted times. As for the food...the Chantilly Cake Sno Ball gets a 3/5 from me. The Banana Foster Sno Ball gets a 5/5...it was amazing! The nachos...eh. $4.25 for nachos they had in a bag and cheese in a container is a bit much (they provided a plastic tray to pour your bagged nachos in). This is New Orleans. We like our nachos in a paper bowl and drenched in cheese. I assume though this is because of their new, temporary social distancing regulations. Either way, you can get better, cheaper nachos from the sno ball stand round the block. But their premium Sno balls are definitely worth a try. Again, the banana foster one was a personal favorite of mine. Amazing blend of banana flavor, cheesecake stuffing, and caramel drizzle. I'm sure it's even better when they will be allowed again to serve it in a plastic cup and uncovered whereas right now they have to serve it in a paper cup and lid on top due to their social distancing regulations.

Nice store out in Eagle! Happy that they have healthier options for this side of town. The check out lady I had was not very friendly though! Man I was ready to get to my car....my advice as a person who has worked in customer service is just to be kind! Even if you are having a crap day. You can really effect others whether you know it or not...

I stop here when in town for a quick drink & apps- the bar is a hole in the wall spot in a strip mall and pretty much what you expect from the outside. A full bar area has TVs, a wide variety of beers on tap and pretty good bar-food apps. The bar is pretty small but they do have a few tables available to sit in if you're not interested in the bar area. The Manny's Nachos were pretty good but not sure I would explore/spend more for the entrees. More often than not we utilize Manny Brown's take-out beer option where you can buy a variety of six packs to go.

I have to give this place 5 stars...the food was super good.  I had the psycho cheesesteak with avacado & mayo.  They chop up the beef really fine which is awesome, because some places serve up the nasty chewy gristle that ruins the sandwich but not this place. Pizza was thin crust type but was very tasty and sweet tomato sauce made it nice.  The toppings were decent, and had the right amount of cheese (not piled on).  The habanero wings had really good flavor but were a bit too smokey for my taste.  This location was decent and spacious, the seats were metal chairs (cringy) but the food made up for it.  Only downside is that they have pepsi products to drink if you're a coke person. Will be back for sure.

Visiting from out of town! I had the Randy which is a tuna sandwich with celery, banana peppers and carrots on sour dough bread. It also comes with a side of chips and salsa. It was very delicious and refreshing. I enjoyed eating it outside on the patio.

I LOVED this museum. It's only $5, and contains a wealth of information. I learned so much about how doctors derived many cures and procedures after first testing them on slaves without using anesthesia. My mind was blown. There's an upstairs and downstairs, as well as a courtyard. I definitely want to return to take advantage of the tour.

Was looking for a place to eat with friends that was indoors so we could beat the NOLA heat. Don't let the outer appearance of the restaurant deter you away. Nice neighborhood bar feel inside. Limited seating inside but they do a good job accommodating everyone while following COVID regulations. Our sever was super nice and gave good and honest  recommendations which is always a plus when trying a new restaurant. I called twice prior to making my way over to the  restaurant and they were very prompt when answering the phone. If you are meat lover than this place is perfect. If you are vegan or vegetarian the menu is limiting. Everything was good. The fries were a bit salty so my recommendation would be to order unsalted fries and add your own seasoning.

Pros: Portions were great, prices were extremely reasonable, staff was attentive. The food was cooked to order, came out quickly, and tasted delicious. All in all, very good breakfast for the price. Also the home fries were so crispy on the outside, my favorite!

Cons: No fountain drinks available, only cans.

What we ordered: Two eggs any style w/ croissant and tomato slices, and Taylor special (huge portion).

I LOVE Remi's. Not only is it in this cute little 1960s airstream, it's in the cutest little shopping plaza! The owners are amazing and go above and beyond for their customers and I love the interaction with them! And they are pet friendly, with permission from the pet owner, of course, they'll sneak your dog a plain donut! Not only that the story behind the name Remi's is so precious and instead of excepting tips they donate money to the humane society. I have to admit I can be a pain sometimes especially because I'm mostly plastic free so I bring my reusable mug every where and they will gladly put my coffee in my mug instead of in a plastic cup! And their mini donuts are the perfect bite size snack that aren't too sweet but sweet enough to hit the spot. They also work around peanut allergies and can customise donuts for you. I will be coming back for sure and bringing all the family and friends!
Great atmosphere, DJ was fantastic. Had the lobster Mac and cheese and it was delicious!

Gyoza are pork filled little dumplings of happiness! Nice char on the bottom just the way I like them. Oyakodon was lunch in a bowl; egg and chicken served in a slightly sweet sauce over rice. It was very filling. Happy to have Mikado downtown. It really is a step above other Japanese places in ambiance, service and the cuisine.

Freddy's is extremely close to Steak N' Shake, with some important differences. First off, yes, their burgers are very similar in terms of thinness and style. Same with their fries. 

However, Steak N Shake has more choices, like salads and burger concepts (like the Frisco melt, Freddy's doesn't have that). That said, Freddy's has some amazing seasoning salt and special sauce for their fries. It kicks them up a notch. Plus, I like Freddy's custard better than Steak N Shake's ice cream. 

I believe Freddy's menu is better than Steak N Shake's core menu. Now, if you go to Steak N Shake for chili and salads, well, Freddy's doesn't have that. 

My vote goes to Freddy's in this comparison.

Came here around 2pm on a Sunday. Yes, the line was out the door, but that's to be expected because you order at the front and are then seated (so it gets backed up really easily). There were about 8 or so groups ahead of us and my boyfriend and I were able to order in 15 mins. They're fast! 

The place is really nice with some cute decor. They have light up letters that spell "Nashville" hanging on their main wall. Very cute for pictures. As for the food, I ordered the "Princess" while my boyfriend got the "East Nasty" with tomato gravy. We also got a side of potato casserole. The food didn't take long to come out and looked very appetizing. The piece of chicken on the "Princess" is HUGE so I was very excited at first, but was then disappointed when the supposedly "hot chicken" wasn't hot at all. It had a slight spicy taste which was then overwhelmed by sweetness (too much honey or brown sugar in their seasoning?). Unfortunately, the restaurant doesn't carry ranch either. The biscuit didn't live up to my expectations as it was rather dry. The "East Nasty" came with a smaller piece of chicken and tasted alright. The potato casserole was cheesy, but other than that it had no flavor. 

Overall, the food here was okay, but I wouldn't be back again.
This is the most authentic Mexican food in Hamilton County! Absolutely delicious, clean restaurant with great customer service.

Make a reservation. Sit by the bar so you can listen to the awesome pianist! The food was amazing the waitress was sweet. Valet was as fast as possible. ( all the celebs on the wall and not one african American was listed) all of our food was fresh

3 Stars, mostly for convenience. This is my last-resort-Schnucks. If I don't want to spend a bunch of money at Fields Foods, but don't have time to go to Trader Joe's, I come here. I mostly hit up when I need Shandy materials: Simply Strawberry Lemonade and a 30 pack of Miller Lite. 

Despite trying to be in and out, you cant avoid parking. The parking lot has to be the worst part. Getting cat-called doesn't typically happen to my queer self, but when I bring my wife here, (which I try not to) the patrons go wild. People's inability to keep their lewd comments to themselves is probably my least favorite part about coming here. This is ultimately not Schnuck's fault, and I am happy to have one so close, so beggars can't be choosers, I guess. 

Ultimately, love-hate this place. Love that I don't live in a food desert, but wish this establishment was a little more dignified.

Beautiful, peaceful and relaxing atmosphere. Great place to picnic  or bring the kids to go fishing . There are paddle boats ‍ to rent and a small swim area on the one side. Also, there is an excellent track that extends all the way around the park.
