Across the street, on New Gallena Road, near the parking lot is the Peace Valley Lavender Farm which, on a warm, breezy day, you just might smell lavender in the air! 

Don't know any other place where you can find such beauty.

This was my first time eating Carrabba's. I did curbside pickup so I didn't really get the full experience. I ordered the lasagna family meal that comes with a side salad and bread along with the trio of bread dips.

All the food was good and packaged well. The only thing that was a little off was the actual portion sizes of everything. The menu says that a family meal feeds 4-5 but everything was portioned in 3's. 3 slices of lasagna, 3 packets of olive oil and herbs, 3 cups of Parmesan cheese... It was truly enough food for 4-5 people but just not what I was expecting.

The online ordering process was simple and the curbside pickup process was simple. The staff person that brought my order out was friendly too.

My sister and I stopped here on our way out of Nashville headed back to Indianapolis. My sister had the biscuits and gravy with egg and I had the hot chicken and biscuit. Both were great as was the brown sugar lemonade. We were seated near the restroom and when we asked to move, they were very accommodating. The service was friendly overall and the food was great.

I've tried both Pat's and Geno's in philly, and Chick's easily beats both of them. I really didn't expect this small shop to make such a great cheesesteak, but its popularity is clear when you see the number of people waiting and picking up sandwiches. I recommend the cheesesteak with mushrooms. 

I went during lunchtime and would recommend ordering ahead, because I ordered 2 sandwiches in store and waited nearly 30 minutes.

11/30/21

Quality/Quantity -
#34 Flame Broil Pork with rice noodle - generous quantity and very good flavor from the pork to the pickled vegetables to the spicy fish sauce.
#37 Kobe Beef Bulgogi Don - okay, would have preferred sliced beef vs. almost ground beef. Flavor was also okay. Generous amount of rice
Like the cool steel cups for ice water, it keeps the water colder.

Atmosphere - Busy, got here just in time, people behind me had to wait.
Good space.
I believe they also own "1 2 Tea" next door.

Service - Casey was GREAT.
Took care of us, gave us the time we needed to decide to order. She came back often, took initiative to give us additional plates as we were doing family style. She also gave me extra sauce when asked.

Price - $36 with Tip

Owner Suggestion - Congrats on all your successes and your 4+ locations. I also like the fact that all your locations are a little different with the type of restaurant style.

This place is apparently closing on June 23 so they're doing BOGO of their small acai bowls (so $11 for 2 bowls). 

I'm kind of sad this place is closing as I'm not sure where else around here I could get a smoothie/acai fix. The service was super nice and the bowls were great, especially at BOGO. 

We ordered inside at the window and sat outside. Perfect lunch on a hot day.

I love Loquita! It is one of my favorite restaurants in Santa Barbara. I actually prefer Loquita to it's sister restaurant, The Lark. Delicious Spanish fare in a vibrant, cleanly designed restaurant. I prefer sitting at the bar as table service can be a hit or miss depending upon the server. 

These are a few of my favorite dishes: 
Pulpo (Octopus) - tender, grilled, flavorful, yum!
Fermin Bellota - thinly sliced cured ham served with crusty bread slathered with fresh tomato 
Flat Iron Steak - always amazing!
Jamon Iberica 
Pintxos - get the anchovy, bacon wrapped date and quince 
There is also a lovely vegetarian dish that involves pea tendrils and it is fabulous. I can't remember the name!

The cocktails are also great. Shout out to Chris for always providing great service and drinks, remembering regulars and making guests feel truly welcome even on busy nights.

The food here is fresh, authentic Mexican and it's awesome.  I order the chicken burrito enchilada-style 90 percent of the time, and the green salad that comes with most of the dinners is the best pre-meal salad I can think of anywhere.  It is huge and comes topped with shredded zucchini, carrots, Mexican cheese (I think cotija) and some tortilla strips.  Always order the homemade cilantro vinaigrette.  Also, they ask if you want chips before they put them on your table~ I think they might charge like .50 cents for them or something... but they come with 3 different types of homemade salsas which are fantastic.

The reasons I don't give the last star: 
1. Mexican chain restaurants have better margaritas.

2. The interior needs a major spring cleaning or perhaps even a little refurbishing (keep the Frida art though).

3. My girlfriends and I once sat on the attached patio, which backs up to the woods.  We were on the side closest to the woods, when we heard rustling in the nearby foliage... a skunk and some cats!  Nice.  We spent the entire meal with one eye on the skunk and the other on the cats, hoping they wouldn't scare Pepe into spraying us all.

This was my first visit last night. I took my boyfriend out for his bithday and we loved it. Our waitress Ashley was thoroughly attentive, friendly, sweet, and very knowledgeable! We loved her almost as much as the food! She even surprised us with a Strawberry desert roll. We absolutely smashed it. This place is 100% bussing! We'll see you guys real soon. 

A note to Ashley- Thank you for making our night really special. You're really special and you're the reason kindness exists in the world. Thank you!!

I've been here for happy hour a few times and I am never let down.  The BBQ sliders are the best bang and variety for your buck - 8 dollars will get you three sliders with pulled pork, brisket, and chicken with different sauces.  I've never found the service slow or curt and the drinks are satisfactory.

I'm really, really, really trying hard to come up with something I don't like about Smokin' Betty's so that this review seems a little more fair and balanced.  Oh yeah, I got the fish tacos once just to be the one jerk at the table getting something different.  My expectations were modest and they were met.  The fish tacos are OK but if you are smart then you should stick with the BBQ options.  The chicken wings are a little fatty.  Take that, Smokin' Betty's.

On the action-movie-parallel-satisfaction-scale, this establishment is Doomsday.

Overall, after everything we had heard about Alpen Rose, we were disappointed. 

The good:

-Our waiter was friendly and genuine
-The creamed spinach was well prepared with whole spinach leaves and not too heavy
- The excellent response of the manager when she heard we were disappointed by the experience. Apologized, wanted to get our feedback and was very gracious with us. 

The not so good:

-The silly procedure to get in where the hostess greets you through an opening in the door 
-Rushed dinner - cocktails to dessert in a little over 1 hour
-The decor inside which is a Disney-fied version of a steakhouse. Feels inauthentic. 
- Caesar salad with barely any dressing
- Bone marrow on beef cheek toast that was oddly sweet and one-dimensional
- Beef Wellington with soggy crust that fell apart with meat inside that, for some reason, tasted like pork loin and not beefy at all ($92 for two, order in advance)
-No whiskey menu so can't tell if you're getting charged $15 or $50 for that MacCallan. Had to go up to bar to ask.

Dudes...dudettes...this place is amazing. I thought I loved Tha Joint...but after coming here, Hiroba's is definitely the one sushi place in Reno I will only go to now. 

Hiroba's is what started Tha Joint. Don't get me wrong, Tha Joint is good. But I truly think HIROBA's is REALLY GOOD. Not only is the nigiri AWESOME, their Salmon Nigiri is so delicious. My mouth is watering as I write this. I swear they must put drugs in their sushi because 3 hours after stuffing my face with sushi from here I wanted more. Haha.

Anyway. It's not too far from the freeway, I mean it really is tucked away quietly in a nicer neighborhood of Reno. Small parking lot, small restaurant, but totally worth a long wait. DO NOT HESITATE if the wait is long. Your time, money, taste buds is worth it all. 

We have gone twice in the last 3 weeks already. We really enjoy having Beto do our sushi, hes very sociable and we got to know him well in the two visits. And he remembered us the second time we came. It might be because I'm Asian and my husbands Mexican, so we are a odd couple with our little 10 month old. ANYWAY.

Very personable sushi staff, particularly Beto.

Dining area seating is fast service, the waitresses are really on top of drinks, clearing plates and asking if the table is doing good.

Sushi rice and fish Ratio is perfect, not too much and just enough to balance out the fish. 

Snow Mountain - YUMMERS! my husband is a huge fan of this!
Spicy Tuna - GREAT!!!!
Spicy Habanero Tuna - EVEN BETTER, I love this one, so good!
Black Sunshine - AWESOME!
Hiroba - Okay
Godzilla - Great!
Rainbow - Really good.
Unagi - Good-okay, just a reg unagi
Lulu - This was okay, it was a little too much, for me
Seared Maguro - DELICIOUS!
Salmon Nigiri - MOUTH WATERING, MELT IN YOUR MOUTH GREATNESS
Mickey Mouse - SO GOOOOOOD!
Upside Down Shrimp - REally TASTY and yummy
Mussels - Really tasty, not the best I have had but really good.
Edamame - Really good, steamed hot and sprinkled with salt
Golden Gate - Really yummy and tastes refreshing
Kwon-a good roll, its simple, lightly spicy, my sister in law and husband like it a lot
Special godzilla - better than the regular godzilla
fried jalapeno with crab salad on top - pretty good, I dont like fried much but its good


I will add more once I remember what I tried, we have tried so much and they are sooo good.


Anyways I don't even know how to explain it. Just try it if you haven't you will miss this place especially if you are just visiting town! I think the quality of fish here tastes better. I think I really base it off of my salmon nigiris, the raw salmon really tells me a lot about the quality of fish sushi places buy and Hiroba's says all the Great stuff.

GREAT SUSHI, FRIENDLY STAFF, FAST SERVICE, WORTH IT! GO. GO. GO!

I heard both ends of the spectrum about this place.  Some of my friends thought they were excellent, others bemoaned the long wait and service.  

Pros:
-very good rice.  Superior in fact to any other sushi I've had in reno.  It's all about the texture here.  no smushed up rice, nice individual grains that hold together well and are seasoned lightly with slightly sweet vinegar.  
-best tobiko I've had in Reno.  I generally ask for tobiko to be omitted from all my sushi orders in Reno because of one too many experiences with old mushy fishy tobiko.  Theirs is visibly different.  bright almost sparkling (no cloudy tobiko here) eggs that have that proper tight burst of slightly smoky sweet brine.  absolutely delicious.  
-a few unique rolls and ingredients that aren't available anywhere else (yet). Crispy Shallots? yummmm. Monkfish liver? not my thing, but appreciated by others I'm sure.
-chef was fast and friendly.  willing to modify rolls without hesitation (a lot of their rolls aren't available as handrolls according to the menu, our chef gladly made perfect handrolls for us).  Al answered all my questions (I had a lot!) with a smile and gave honest recommendations.
-good variety of appetizers included in the AYCE price.  the appetizers we had were small portions, which is perfect to get a taste but not get full on them.
-hot sake included in Dinner.  The sake they serve is very rich and sweet, paired deliciously with the sushi.


Cons:
-limited menu for AYCE.  We actually did not run out of selections to try, but we aren't super heavy eaters either.  Between 2 of us we shared 5 rolls.  I have friends who can eat 7-10 rolls alone, and I can see them being bored by the choices.  
-location of the restaurant.  It's basically a fake patio/al fresco area outside of Roxy.  It's a walkway between Eldorado and Silver Legacy by the fountain.  Between the fountain, occasional live music from Roxy, and the constant pedestrian traffic, it's very loud and you get gawked at.  
-$1 extra to have rolls topped with mixed crab.  It's just the fake crab surimi stuff so I don't get why the extra charge. 

Overall right now it stands as my favorite sushi joint in Reno despite it's limitations.  I don't mind the short menu for AYCE (I will most likely just go a la carte in the future anyway) and the chefs seem more than willing to concoct an off menu item based on your preferences.

one warning.  listen to the chef when he advises your lower your spice rating on any roll that includes habanero.  yeeeeaaoooouch.  Those are the hottest peppers I've had in so long.  They use orange habaneros, and even a spice rating of 3 (out of 10) had us panting and sweating.  This is for a girl that usually insists on extra extra hot.
Brought my watch in for service (a very basic metal band repair). They estimated $10 and gave it back to me, missing a link, for $40.  Never again.

After reading the reviews of Yangming, I was expecting to be super-impressed...something akin to a more casual version of Susanna Foo.  Overall, the experience was just...meh.  The restaurant is large, with a full bar, and circular booths, regular booths, and tables.  Overall, it's a very nice atmosphere...upscale, but not pretentious.  They have a full wine and drink list, as well as a regular menu and some specials.  

We ordered the lamb skewer, spicy pad thai, seafood combination in flower basket, crispy shrimp rolls, and a wonton soup.  Overall, everything was just OK.  Not bad, by any means, but not great, and certainly not up to the hype.

Most of my reviews are from a neutral point of view... This is however recockulous. I have a recall on my magnum. It takes Reno dodge almost 5 months to get the part because about a month into the wait, they had me bring my car in for a wrong part ordered. Waste of my time and fuel, getting a babysitter for my three kids all to get to Reno dodge and be sent home cause they ordered the wrong part. Now here we are a few months later. I took my car in Thursday morning at 9am. Got a call later in the day it's e done Friday morning. Friday morning comes, I'm getting the kids all squared away so I can head down to dodge, when I get a phone call from them. My car now will not be ready saturday. I've got kids who have activities to get to, and I have zero transportation. Kids are 6,4, and 19 months old. This dealership boasts it's 5star service and product but they don't offer a loaner service when they mess up? Nope they send you off to enterprise so YOU can pay $35 a day, that they(dodge) says is a preffered rate. No, that's a normal rate. I called. So now here I sit calling coaches to let them know I have no way of getting my kids to the functions. I had thought about just cabbing it everywhere....

Mmmmmmmmmmmm...

... mmmmmmmmmm...

... mmmmmmmmmm...

Yeah. That about sums it up. Dol sot jeeyok pork in a portion the size of your head, with soup and kim chi as sides. Tasty, tasty dumplings. End it all with a prostitute, and congratulations, you've just destroyed any possibility of getting anything done post Koreana food-binge.

I'm always a sucker for Korean for the same reasons I love Vietnamese: fresh, diverse flavors all mashed up into a single dish. I have no idea how authentic it is, but Koreana pulls this off with flying colors, and they do it so fast that you barely have time to wonder why this place is hidden behind Abner's.

This place is one of my favorite lunch spots, so if you hang out in UCity, and hate my guts, beware. Cause I'm not stoppin' for nothin'!

Pro-tip:
The lunch and dinner rushes here can be brutal. Prepare to wait a bit for a seat during these hours.

I live close by, and have been here several times in the last few months and have always left happily sated. Service isn't usually super personable but has been friendly, somewhat helpful and attentive. Food has always been great and plentiful. 

Last visit I had the shrimp and potato enchiladas which were delicious! Lots of sauteed veggies and large shrimp, with a mashed potato filling. My friend and I split the queso fundido con chorizo as an appetizer, which was the weirdest plate ever. A sizzling plate of chorizo that was almost crunchy in several places, with just a few crumbles of cheese on top. It was kind of tasty, but not what we were expecting as an appetizer. Another friend got one of their combo platters which looked fairly standard, but large and delicious. Another got lobster enchiladas. For under ten bucks, we all expected fake lobster maybe, or maybe just a little bit of meat. Nope, all three enchiladas were stuffed to the brim with real lobster! Based on our three meals, I would suggest branching out more to their house specialties since they are all super cheap and really delicious! I also love their always-fluffy rice that is tasty but a good side to not overpower the rest of your plate. Last but not least, we all ordered grande margaritas with our meals.. Seriously bigger than my head, and super smooth going down! I would go every week if I could.

The restaurant is also pretty good for ambiance. the place is huge and I can't imagine there ever being a wait for a table. The bar area is nice as well, and has sweet karaoke on Thursday nights. 

**Edited! Just wanted to mention that my last couple visits were highlighted with excellent service by all front of house staff. Waiters were super friendly, patient, and even a little entertaining, but especially the guacamole dude mixing at my table. Thanks for the extra serranos, ouch!

I don't know how Servus is still in business. Hands down the worst financial institution ever created. They hold cash deposits!!! For 24hrs!! Its cash!!!! Wtf! And their customer service line is only open during banking hours, so if you have an issue Friday after hours, you can't get ahold of anyone until Monday! They treat you like garbage and deny every application. I wouldn't stop at a Servus credit union to take a sh*t.

My grandmother just passed and we were looking for a place to take her things. There was one older woman here that was helping with donations who was awful to talk to. She was very rude and unhelpful. It was about 3:15 in the afternoon and I guess they were trying to close early even though they say open until 4. She made this experience a lot harder than it needed to be. Maybe the staff inside the store are a lot nicer than the ones helping with donations but I would not recommend this place.

I have been going here for many many years, it has gone way way down hill and so has the staff. Any problem I have had has always resulted in me being told I'm in the wrong, as a Paying customer I expect to get some sort of quality, now I'm not dumb I do see where I am ordering food from and how not healthy it is. But to be yelled at, talked down to and belittled over the phone by the so called night manager is just plain wrong & when asked who his boss is so i can talk to someone else i get told there is no one else, He is it.!!!!  And to find hairs yes multiple fried into the chicken wings is even more disgusting. One maybe but more that one made my stomach turn. And all of that for $40 plus every order. This place was AWESOME when Brad ran it.. And ever since he left its not even worth the 1 star....

Generally, I love this place. Last night sucked though....bought a large pizza, receipt even showed that, yet I was given a medium that had been cut as a large...4-5 pieces were just slivers and not actual slices. That's some ridiculousness

First the restaurant was beautiful and the food was delicious.  The restaurant week menu was one of the better deals during restaurant week.  The salmon was cooked to perfect medium rare and I loved it.  The half chicken was a little on the salty side, but the meat was flavorful and juicy and piled on top of delicious red lentils.   Dessert was beautifully presented and featured unusual ingredients that you don't see in many restaurants in Santa Barbara.  I had the cherimoya semifreddo and my partner had the cassava creme brulee with purple potato ice cream.  

The glaring problem was the disorganization in the restaurant.  We were seated for 15 min without anyone coming to take our orders.  We sat right across from the hostess, but she was busy looking at her phone.  The water boy came twice to refill our water glasses and we finally asked him on the whereabouts of our server.  When he finally came around, he was apologetic, and gave us 2 complementary drink.  The dinner proceeded smoothly from that point until dessert, which again took a long wait.  Finally, there was a mix up with the credit card.  Our bill was charged to another table's card and I assume another tables bill was charged to our card.  That took sometime to sort out.  I expect an expensive, not super busy restaurant to run more smoothly.

Some coffee places are victims of their own success - crowded, noisy and not at all personable. Others can be too laid back and just not service savvy. Jet City Espresso is a rare find that not only celebrates the cult of caffeine but also has a warmth, humor and low key likeability that is rare. Jessica Glover is the artist, musician and mastermind behind the grind that makes the coffees, teas, smoothies and fresh, organic scones sold here. The fact that the shop occupies a small corner of her own home tells you that she personally stands behind what she makes, bakes and serves, all with an infectious smile.

*NEW YEARS EVE REVIEW*

This was my 4th or 5th time dining at The Washington House, but my first time as a yelper.  So I kind of knew what I was going to be getting. A great meal but I was never totally blown away here.  After last night, it would be impossible for me to rate this any lower than 10 stars.  But since yelp will only let me do five, that will have to suffice.

Since we went here for New Years, they had only a five course dinner available for $63 a person.  At first glance $63 does sound like a lot of money but a) for New Years, not really and b) the amount of food you get for $63 turned out to be a steal.  My table had five people (including another yelper) and I thought about critiquing each dish, but that would get too lengthy.  However, I cannot do this review without mentioning a few things:

The waitress, Jen, greeted us with a complementary glass of champagne.  Each person at the table got their own chef created amuse-bouche.  The fried feta dumpling with tomato sauce was particularly delicious.  It was like a traditional "mozzarella stick" you often find, however feta of course, and very creamy.  The fresh tomatoes were great compared to a sauce.

Next came the appetizers.  Now, this ranks up with *one of* the best things I ever ate.  Which is saying a lot.  For my appetizer I got the Thai Curry Steak Eggrolls filled with shitake mushrooms, peppers and cream cheese, with hot mustard sauce.  Think *fried Philly cheese steak*.  The mustard was amazing, and what I would imagine the high a cocaine addict must feel considering the spicy mustard seemed to zing from my mouth to my nose to my brain rendering me completely addicted.

I was very impressed with my experience here, more so than any other time I had been here.  Maybe it was because it was New Years and the chef's were on top of their game... maybe it was because I was able to sample so many things.  I would not be surprised to see the young executive chef Andrew Loeffler going on and doing even greater things in the future.

I'd give just about anything for more of those Thai Curry Steak Eggrolls.

Once again, my fellow Yelpers we're on point with this restaurant. This place is a haven for foodies or those who just want something super yummy to eat. Had the roasted beet salad and Zookers Chicken Sandwich. Both were seriously to die for. 
I'll be baaaack!!!!

Had a wonderful experience dining at Auberge for Valentine's Day. They offered a good-looking prix fixe menu, but my boyfriend and I stuck to their a la carte. 

Escargot and French onion soup were excellent to start off with in addition to the fresh piping hot rolls. The FOS was noteworthy as it was not overwhelmingly salty (as tends to happen with FOS). The escargot, however, could've used an extra sprinkle of salt and a crusty slice of baguette to sop up the herby butter. 

My boyfriend got the steak frites with mushroom sauce, which was absolutely delicious and so simple but, again, a little under salted. I chose the duck, which was also tasty but definitely needed some salt as well and 2 minutes less on the pan as I prefer mine pretty rare-medium rare. 

We finished the meal off with the pavlova and it was a dream - you can never go wrong with fresh meringue! Extra noteworthy were the drinks. Espresso martinis to-die-for and a phenomenal old fashioned. 

Super friendly bartender and waitstaff, and a lovely homey atmosphere! Can't wait to return.
Great service, great beer and some of the best Belgian fries I've ever had! Bartender was great and very resourceful. He had a hot sauce bottle always available!  Thank you!

I would give negative stars if possible. My iPad, laptop, and pet medicine were taken by someone who works at the hotel, and the hotel staff were not responsive to the problem. I filed a police report and also reported the issue to the BBB. 
I booked the hotel because I was traveling with pets, and I wanted to stay at a national hotel.  After this incident, Choice hotels informed me that the hotels are independently owned and operated, and therefore they could not do anything to remedy my losses and inconvenience. 
I booked a 2-night stay Nov. 14. -16 directly with Choice hotels. The reception desk is not staffed at night, so when I arrived before midnight Nov. 14, nobody was at the desk. I had to wait 20 minutes for someone to arrive, and then the "system was down" and they couldn't complete the check-in, but they had a print out of my reservation. 
Nov. 15 after 9 am but before 1 p.m., while I was away with my pets, someone who worked for the hotel "threw away" my belongings. Everything I had left in the hotel room was in the dumpster--except of course my laptop, iPad, and pet medicine. 
Whoever went into the room would have seen wet towels, fresh dog food, and other evidence that the room was occupied, in addition to my luggage and laptop bag. There is no closet, and the hotel does not have "Do not disturb" signs for the door. When I arrived at night I removed anything visible from my car because I thought the hotel would be safer. 
When I told the front desk person that my things were missing, she told me they threw everything away because they thought my reservation was a "no show." They had my information, and they knew that they don't staff the reception desk at night. They should have investigated rather than throw everything away. They could have called my number on the pet medicine. 
When I complained, I was told the manager was not available until Monday. She later called me, after I called Choice hotels and also filed a police report. I asked her to review the hotel security videos. She took the hotel room charge off my credit card and has not responded to any other communications.  Something is wrong at that hotel, and if they had looked at the hotel video they could have determined what happened and how to prevent it from happening again.

Phenomenal service, elegant accommodations, and absolutely superb food. The spa treatments exceeded my expectations, and they were reasonably priced, too. I highly recommend the Four Seasons to anyone who is looking for the ultimate getaway. And for horticulture fans, the gardens are amazing. If you do nothing else, you must have a walk through the lush, manicured gardens. Simply spectacular.

I've been to this place a few times and it never disappoints.  Usually you have a bit of a line but it does move quickly.  I like to start with a mimosa or bellini...both are nice.  Do yourself a favor and have either the banana fosters french toast, the migas, or the costa rican breakfast.  Each is well worth the line.

Food = Great 
Service = still needs some help!!

Food:
We all shared the mild Dukboki (Korean dumpling dish) which was fantastic! It was a little hot/spicy with a little sweet!
Had the Blew Damon stuffed burger which was worth the 30min wait - BE CAREFUL the blu cheese is VERY hot!!! But the taste is GREAT! Burger with blu cheese oozing out and bacon and oh sooo goood! Fries are also very good, nice and crispy! Husband had the Chuck Norris with jalapenos, wasabi mayo and pepper jack cheese and whoa it was spicy, but you just can't stop eating it!! Very good!! He also had the potato salad which was also very creamy and tasty!

Service:
It was quite lacking! We were approached by a server who told us it was 'bar service only due to he was the only server and admitted that he wouldn't be able to handle all tables, thus bar service only" after asking him what he meant and if they were still serving food, we assumed that he meant that he was only serving food and we had to order drinks at the bar... oops, wrong... flip that... once we decided on our meals and waited a little while to see if he was coming back we noticed that he was taking drinks out... soooo we figured out that we had to go to the crowded bar, wait on a bartender to become available and then loudly read off to him, so he could hear over the noise at the bar, what we would like for dinner!!!! Very, VERY inconvenient! And if you ask me, as few of table that are in this place and where only 2 or 3 of them were eating anything, I would think it wouldn't be a big deal to take one's orders!! ESPECIALLY when you have one or two guys always standing near/at the front door... get to work so we can place meal orders!! I mean, if you don't want to be inconveniences with meal orders, DON'T SERVE FOOD!
Then to pay: The server didn't not approach us at any time, didn't check on us (you know, 'bar service only' (even though we DID have drinks)) and when we were finished we had to go BACK up to the bar, find the bartender who then had to look up our tab and check us out. Though the bar tender (co-owner)  was VERY personable/kind/nice and he did ask at this point (after we were finished eating) if everything tasted good and if we liked the Dukboki to which he told us the story of having it while in the service in Korea and how they had to find the mild version because most people who try the hot have sweat pouring down their faces, etc, etc... it was STILL very inappropriate and inconvenienced to have to go to the bar to order and pay!!!! If you ask me, a former server myself, the bar (counting all tables and those small tables around the bar) was full but a server who was on top of it could manage all these tables with food AND drink... he/she would be VERY busy, but it was do-able!
Will we go back, YES, food was great and atmosphere is very laid back and fun... but will we every expect good service... well, I am not holding my breath... or shall I say, holding out that I won't become parched or starved!
Lovely and very clean new nail salon. Jon is great! Everyone friendly and professional.

Ummmm liquor snow balls?! Sign me up!! This place was PACKED on a Sunday night even and we barely waited! The girls were helpful and friendly... I ordered some skittles number with two shots of tequila and my husband ordered sloppy sunsets or something which had two shots of rum! It was a little pricey ($17) but sooo good and worth it! How fun! Will def go back if we ever return!

Not much Ramen variety. The broth was a little salty. Compared to other ramen places, OBON's ramen is very mediocre. They have a cool contemporary atmosphere, but the food is not authentic. It is also over priced. It's about 11$ for an average sized bowl.

So while in town for work I had a few friends recommend that we visit for dinner.  Now let me start this with I am not a huge Beer fan and maybe only drink 3 to 4 a year so I went with the plan to have a good meal and maybe a beer.  So it was a rainy night and we get there about 730.  We ask to be seated upstairs this was just 2 days after Halloween so they still had decorations up and it was really kind of cool made me think it would have been fun to be there.

This is not at all what I expected when my friends said we were going to a brewery for dinner.  We had 3 different Bread and Butter dishes with a few different types of pickles.  I had one spicy pickle that caught me off guard I like hot foods so I had not been warned just to get a reaction.  After the initial shock at how hot it was wore off it was good just not what I was expecting from a pickle.  We also had a carrot / radish raw dish I ordered a steak and cheese sandwich and my friend had a mushroom sandwich.  Overall it was just not what I expected, but really enjoyed everything.  Now for the beer again I usually have 3 or 4 a year and try to be home and in bed around 10 to 1030.  Well I had not seen my friends in about 8 or 9 years so time got away from us all.
After eating talking and drinking I had had 5 beers while chatting and when I checked my watch thinking it was about 11 I found out it was now 1AM.  I almost never let time get that away from me, but all of the beers were really good, (I should have had more) food outstanding, atmosphere cozy and conversation stimulating so it was a perfect combination to enjoy the night.  I had nothing regret the next morning and only wish I had time to return one more time before I had to leave.  I am looking forward to my return just to come here one more time!

Truffle fries were crispy and golden salted perfection, we finished our first order and quickly put in for a second.  My avocado turkey burger was a stand out, very moist with out tasting greasy.  I loved the seasonal menu, I felt like I would have been pleased with a number for items on the menu.  I sat on the patio in the breezy summer air, great atmosphere, plenty of glass and interesting dog related items.  Staff was very friendly and quick with the jokes.  The bread was really good but the butter was the star of the show.  Overall a really good meal but I am going to hold that last star until I get a chance to visit a few more times.

My new favorite Sky Zone! They have it ALL! Jumping, Hoops, Climbing Wall, Jousting, Foam and Air Pits, Dodgeball, Warrior Courses, Warp a Wall, Laser Tag, and Arcade!!!! The owners are awesome and the staff is friendly! They have lockers and massage chairs. A nice selection of food at the snack stand. It was SO much fun for our whole family! They offer tons of specials and fun classes. Don't forget the party rooms for birthdays. Look forward to returning!

Here's one that I especially needed to update! I have since found out that the "Not exactly a friend of Bill's" reference had nothing to do with me (guess paranoia came to get me yet again.). It's actually the bar's pretty hilarious reference to Bill Wilson who created the Twelve Steps program for AA. I learned that months ago but sometimes McThrill is a total slackathon -bangs head on desk- !

love it or loathe it 12 Steps is still the same bar that it's always been. And as long as it's around I doubt that it's ever going to change. But if you look past it's clear and present quirks and kinks then you can find a good time. especially when it hooks up the inexpensive Bloody Marys and mimosas Sunday mornings.

My Favorite Muffin & Bagel Café is actually not my favorite muffin & bagel café.

First of all, I don't really care for the flavor of the coffee. I can't really describe exactly what it is, just something that tastes funny. Their cappuccinos are pretty good, but I wish they served 'for here' orders in a real mug. It's so cozy to sit at a coffee shop with a warm mug in your hands on a cold winter's day. Not so much with a hot paper cup.

They do have one of my favorite teas, Numi's Berry Black is quite hard to find usually. It is the main reason I keep going back there.

Their muffins are really good, but I have to refer to my husband's opinion on their bagels.

His words: "Why would you serve a sliced bagel open sides up in two halves? A bagel has its toppings only on the top. You're essentially getting half the bagel that you ordered, and half of a plain one. It should be served closed, then sliced in half vertically."

Bottom line: We'll continue to go there from time to time, but it's not getting 5 stars.
Been craving a gyro for a long time, did not disappoint! More than enough for a very hungry girl. I will return to try some of your other menu options! No picture because cause I tore it up!
Without a doubt, the best Resort on Clearwater Beach. They have it all. A first-class operation, I love staying here.

Loved the service and how fast the food came to the table. Have been there often. Last time I went, I booked a reservation for my family and I. I have to say that I'm glad I did because it gets crowded after 5pm. Definitely recommend the chocolate martini and the intoxi-cake martini. Only downsides to this place is that it's a very popular place for "tweenagers" and teenagers. And, for some reason, the menus now doesn't have chocolate in every food you get. I remember that somehow they spinned and created meals where chocolate was amazingly put into burgers and steak, etc. Kind of sad about that, but overall very happy!

Eh... for some reason I was not impressed with my shrimp mojo de ajo tacos. $11 for 3 tacos seemed a little steep for what I got. The shrimp was nice and tender.. but for some reason this dish didn't pack any punch for me. I actually ended up dousing my tacos in sriracha sauce at the office to give it more flavor. There was really no wow factor.. I think I am going to have to come back and maybe try something else like their breakfast burritos or their tortas, and perhaps that might change my mind about this place. I also was still left feeling hungry after my 3 "Grande" tacos.. I could have easily finished another 3 no problem.

I'm not the biggest fan of hot dogs, but I am a huge fan of anyone who treats my dog like the princess she is! (I know I'm a little crazy, but anyone who is a dog mama will understand) My puppy loves it when we eat here because it means she gets 4 pieces of hotdog chopped up for her served in a little ketchup bowl. Hotdogs here are OK and will definitely do in a pinch. My greatest annoyance with this place is their mediocre or almost terrible hot dog buns. Last time I ate here my hot dog bun was so smushed that it barely contained my hot dog. They should definitely reconsider their hot dog buns because the buns are more important than the hot dog itself. It's the first texture that hits my mouth and should be warm and soft, not stale and mushy.

One of my favourite places in St. Louis to get sushi!

Its a small little place and by looking at it, you wouldnt assume that the place was worth even a second glance.  Once inside the decor is a bit 'silly' but it adds to the charm.  They have delicious sushi though, creative one of a kind rolls and lots of favourites made extremely well.  The staff is inviting, they waitress's are always on point with service and the sushi makers really give you your money's worth in size, quantity and of course quality.

I love Mr. Sushi!

When you want Mexican food in the Market East area this is the place. Huge portions, decent mexican (what is the delicious white cheese on the burritos) and extremely reasonable prices. I challenge you to find a place in Center City that gives you that amount of food for that price! Good lunch spot -- they get you seated and served in enough time for you to enjoy your meal and roll yourself back to your office in under an hour.

If I could give 0 starts I would. 2 months in advanced I scheduled a move from my apartment in Philadelphia to Boston with Rick from All my sons. They seemed to be very nice and reasonably priced. Just to be noticed 3 days before my visit that they were unable to carry out my move because "one of their trucks got into an accident, leaving several employees in the hospital." I was sent a pre written email with "alternative" companies to reach out to that they trust in the event of an "emergency" like this. This was also the last weekend of June in which everyone around the county was moving, so I obviously was not able to find an open date with one of their "alternatives" so last minute. I called everyone on that list, and was most surprised when of them was extremely candid with me. She told me "They do this several times a year, make up some lie probably because they over booked moves. I was just on the phone with someone else who was also cancelled for a different reason who also was given our contact information from that pre-made email." Unbelievable. She even suggested more people should report this fraud so that people stop using their company. While they did give me a complete refund, I was left stranded and forced to rent a large 16 ft truck and move everything on my own with the last minute help of family, given no moving companies within a 400 mile radius were available to make that move

DO NOT USE! TERRIBLE SERVICE!!We had a move with AMS Moving on 9/7. The guys who showed up were good. No issues there. My belongings were supposed to be held for 24 hours and delivered the next day. The appointment time came and went. After 2 hours of waiting we were told that the mover had had a "hard move" earlier in the day and wanted to go home. They would come tomorrow. They had my stuff. I said okay because I didn't want movers who were pissed about being made to work. I had to get a hotel room for my wife, myself, our four year old and our dog. Not an easy task last minute. They showed up the next day. Told my wife they could finish the job faster if they were paid more. I contacted AMS about getting reimbursed for the hotel room. Chris said that he would get back to me. I just called and the told me he no longer works there. BE SMART! DON'T USE THIS COMPANY.

I know, it's fast food... seriously it's so good!! Even better, best customer service!! Every single time. You know you are going to speak to friendly and helpful employees!! This location is super clean, has a small playground for the littles. It's always busy. Lunch time and weekends are super busy.

Absolutely the worst place I have EVER been for $112 breakfast with 2 mimosas.  It took over 20 minutes to get water.  I had my dogs with me and they stayed they were "dog friendly". My boyfriend and I were the last ones to be served and we were starving.  After all that money, I got a $10 from $26 parking ticket.  This was breakfast and I would never recommend this this resort to anyone.

Stopped in here after a soccer game. I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and I'm really glad I did.  I wanted something different, hot and fast that I could carry out.  The Venezuela Bowl was an obvious choice for me - with black beans, cheese, white rice, shredded chicken and fried plantains, what's not to love?! 
That would have plenty of food for me but I also had a craving for grilled shrimp and that side of shrimp did not disappoint! 
I highly recommend and I will be back soon!

First time to a Fresh Market and utterly disappointed. Was expecting it be like a Whole Foods or Trader Joe's or a hybrid but it was not. The produce was fresh looking but very overpriced, and the packaged goods were way overpriced and the selection very limited. The store was dark, small, and the aisles cluttered and difficult to navigate. Seemed like there were as many employees mulling around as there were customers making it feel even more cramped. The sushi, deli counters, and bakery looked decent but very pricy. 

Might try visiting another location in the future if it's convenient but will never waste my time at this location again even though it's very close to my house and there is a serious need for a grocery like this in my area. Whole Foods - please open a store near my house :)

Terrible service. I came to this restaurant a couple of years ago and things were much nicer. They now charge a cover at the door (even when there is no party going on) AND they add an automatic 18% gratuity to your bill. This, of course, leaves no incentive to provide you with good treatment and friendly service. Our food was not warm, and was pretty average as far as taste. I believe the quality of service changed once they saw the demographic of their clientele change. As other places have done in Broad Ripple, the more Black people start to patronize an establishment, the worse the treatment becomes and the more rules appear. We would have tipped over 18% for an inviting atmosphere and welcoming staff. Steer clear.

I came in by myself for some falafel and ended up getting fatoush and the whole pot of coffee. Everything was really great tasting, I had every last drip of coffee and every last bite of food. The server was super nice and extremely helpful. This place has a very at home, cozy charm with also a somewhat deli/diner/hole in the wall feel at the same time.

We came in and had lunch after riding around in the canoe. The hostess was very friendly. Our server was very nice and attentive. The food also was really good. I like the atmosphere. I'm sure we will visit again.

Having gone back again, I find I need to upgrade them to a 4 Star. They have come a long way from my initial low rating.

The new management is much more personal and the new menu (to me, at least) has some good things on it, like a lamb burger. Still have really fresh squeezed OJ. You can watch it being squeezed.

Coffee is still good, roomy dining area and clean. The Eagle  restaurant is our choice for breakfast when in Eagle.

Cute little hipster coffee shop in Nashville. Actually it's not all that little, size is akin to a dreaded SBux plus there are a bunch of outdoor seats for nice chill mornings drinking caffeine alfresco. They have all your regular brews plus a bunch of fun specialty drinks.

I went on a Sunday morning and the line was to the door. My friend and I both decided on special drinks from their chalkboard and he went to grab a seat outside. After 15 minutes in line, I got up to the front and and placed my order (no greeting, just a stare to let me know my ordering time was come). They then unfortunately told me my friend's drink was out because they didn't have cider. No alternatives given, no apologies, and why in the world did they not erase or cross it out from the chalkboard when there is an insanely long line of people, I don't know. Since my friend was outside, he then got no drink because we didn't prepare or think we needed a backup order.

That aside, I ordered the Black Bear Latte for a reasonable price of $4. I had it with skim milk then it came with blackberries and honey. It had a really great first taste but drinking a whole cup of it was a bit too much sweetness. That's on me for not realizing how sweet it would be.

Overall I liked this shop and thought they had some cool concoctions & it's a really nice space with tons of people chilling out getting work done. They just need to keep their specials chalkboard updated.

I am always so pleased with my visits at Glenmoore Veterinary Hospital.  A few years ago, I was going to another local vet and they were charging astronomical rates and the staff was rude.  At Glenmoore Vet, it's the complete opposite experience.  The last time I scheduled an appointment, I believe I spoke with Tiffany.  She was very understanding of my concern for my dog and was extremely personable and professional on the phone.  When I went for my appointment, the staff at the front desk were very welcoming, and greeted me as soon as I walked in and checked me in right away.  This transcended into the vet techs and the vet as well.  Everyone is so friendly and willing to take the time to address any questions/concerns that I had for my dog, Gracie.  I know she is in the best care at Glenmoore Vet and I always go here to them to tend to my dog's needs.

I think they took the house made chips off and fries or salad are now included. Our second visit today was just as good as our first. I'm so glad they survived the Covid shut downs, it's one of my favorite places in midtown. 


Finally got downtown to try this out. SO glad we did. First thing we noticed is tons of parking. Parking is hard in midtown but they've got 2 lots. It's shared with 2 other businesses so maybe it does get crowded.
There are tables and great patio outside but of course we'll wait for warmer weather.
Inside is idk modern farmhouse? It's really cool. Husband had a cowboy burger and I had the crispy chicken sand. Oh em gee!! We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals. I think it was the owner that stopped by and chatted awhile. Great guy and if he's the owner, it's great to support such a long time local.
The food is all ethically sourced, grass fed beef and so good!! Their house made chips are to die for!!
It's on the speedy side. Burgs and sandos don't come with sides so it's almost $20 to get both. We spent over $60 on lunch which included a couple beers. It's worth

We have been going every year for the past 4-5 years. We look forward to the musical dinner show and front of the line access (to the Haunted Houses). Unfortunately, they changed everything for Fright Feast this year, none for the better. Even the Food lines were dumb and increased the time to get your meal. The food was way too salty (I had BBQ, wife had chicken, daughter had shrimp). And worst of all, they took the Musical (Doc and his Nurses) away, replacing them with... wait for it, a 1 man 'magic' show. VERY LAME. 
Well, I figured at least we have Front of the Line, that's still great, NOT. It's only as good as the Attendants, and wow, they didn't know what they were doing. At the Zombie House, they were letting people without the Front of the Line access in that line. When I pointed this out, the attendant at the House, moved people aside to let us in. But wow, it was like a bunch of attendants didn't know or care.
The Fright Zones were good but it's getting really stale. If it's your first time, you'll enjoy that part though.
The Houses themselves, well, again stale. Nothing's really changed. If you think about the prices they charge and what they have, it's way overpriced. So we are moving on. I'll push for our company to find a different venue.
And one last comment, $20 for parking, since it's Halloween season let me say: Busch Gardens, you're a blood suckers to charge that much. Shame on you!!!

I went and paid $34 dollars plus a $10 tip for my car to look like someone ran a water hose over my car. They cleaned the inside in 2 minutes which didn't make much sense to me... until I looked inside. It didn't look like they cared much at all. I wouldn't recommend spending money at this location.

This place is a gem! Tucked in Windsor Park, the menus are exquisite. From drinks to food and of course the bonus of fresh movie popcorn for the ride home, you'll leave happy. The bar staff is super friendly and helpful with selections. I started with the roasted vegetable salad. Really fresh and great flavors. I finished with the mushroom plate. That dish is a 10/10. Rich and savory. A must have. You can also check out a movie in one of three theatres. I will be a regular.

I have been going there on and off for a few years now. I didn't have a lot of interest in coffee houses. Then i moved to Colorado for a couple of years and it was hard to find good coffee houses, you know, the one that really takes care of it's costumers... long story.

Came back to Santa Barbara and realized how good it is to get to know the people that work there. I go there 'bout for times a week for about an hour or so before going to work.
My favorite drinks are dirty chai, carmel latte, mexican chocolate and chai latte. I always get a jalapeno-cream cheese bagel too.
They should definitely bring back local musicians to play there.
When you come in, try to get to know the person serving you for a bit, won't hurt i promise.

My mom and I always stay at this Home2 when visiting my sister in Greenwood. It's right off the highway and overall very clean and friendly service. 

My only issue is that the water is really hard. I usually bring a humidifier for the room to help combat the dryness and hard water. For a good place to rest our heads at night, this does the trick. Sheets are soft and beds are comfy. We will continue booking here when needed!

Extremely slow service. The most overpriced steak I've had in recent memory, mostly because the cut was subpar and the seasoning was mediocre. The restaurant supposedly has a dress code, but it's not enforced and the customers have no respect for it. Several people were in gym attire, others in baseball hats and T-shirts, and this was at a dinner hour. Not exactly the environment you expect at a nice steakhouse. The decor is best described as gaudy eclectic.  The sides were good, but it's kind of difficult to screw up macaroni and cheese. We won't be back. If w

Went to celebrate my birthday. Loved that it was a 2 minute walk from my hotel. I was seated immediately due to making reservations and instantly received great service. I did my research so I knew exactly what I wanted to order. I had the wedge salad which was delicious, the Sheepshead fish was great too but I did salt and pepper it some more for extra seasoning, and the bread pudding. I don't typically like white chocolate but i took a leap and ordered it and it was absolutely delicious. I loved the serenade too. My server was great.

There's smoking indoors - BLECH!  Came home smelling like cigarettes. The private rooms are nice and they are decorated well. I've gone to this club periodically since 2012 and they recently remodeled and took the outdated tropical theme away, which was nice. It's got a better look to it now, even though you can still tell it's a converted warehouse. The people are still on the older side and tend to assume you want to do sexual stuff with them. I went here with a friend of mine recently and the music was just soooo classic rock and pop. I mean "Brown Eyed Girl" isn't even a good song. I guess the older stuff works for the older guests. The bartenders were really nice though. Some of their furniture is fake fur covered; you can't clean that stuff. Ewww. Overall, I only go when my friends push me to go. It's always an ok time. I can usually find something to make the night worthwhile.
Cute little spot. The food was ok. The services was great. It's a great Reataurant to stop by if you have been at the beach all day.

Absolutely love their pastries! I'm half Swiss and going to Janjou always feels like a little bit of home. Everything is delicious but especially their croissants! Can't beat a well made fresh croissant. Wish they were open more but I know that's no fault of their own (hiring shortages!).

Upon entering Gus's you are greeted with hellos and warm smiles and can pick a table where one is open. Today was such a beautiful day that I decided to sit outside and soak up the sun and enjoy my late lunch.  Service was great as always with the food coming out in a decent amount of time. I don't mind the wait because your food will come out so piping hot that you can't eat it right away. I had the 2 piece dark chicken only. Well it came with bread also and I ordered a side of okra. The food is good here but a bit pricy in my opinion w basic slaw and beans on the platter. I prefer to just order my chicken and add a side. Next time around I will try a dessert.

Ate here after a show at the HiFi Annex.  The place down the street had a problem seating all 8 of us, but this place could seat our group, so an extra star for that. 
I was pretty wasted, so I don't remember what burger I got but it was damn fine.  I am leaning towards the Kuma original burger (or whatever it's called), because I probably asked our waiter for a recommendation, as I normally do, and that one seems pretty popular.
I remember the waiter recommending the Mac and cheese, so I got a giant tub of that, and it was fuckin' good.  Even finished it off when we got home on Sunday.  Delicious.
Now to the Metal.  Metal and I have had a very tumultuous relationship down through the years.  In my younger days it was Maiden and Judas Priest, but new metal is lost on me, and don't even get me started on Death or Black Metal.  I have seen High on Fire, Mastodon, GoatWhore, among others, and just not a fan.  20 minutes after we showed up, it went to all ZZ Top, so more stars and a big tip for the wait staff for facilitating the crunchy, drunk Fuckers from out of town.  
Highly recommend.

I have been annoyed once or twice but overall the service is super friendly and the food is incredible! The favor is so bright and deep that you'll want to try everything while simultaneously wanting to get the same thing every time.

I normally order from here early morning around 9-10 paying with my card I placed an order at 9:30 at 10:50 I called to cancel my order because it still had not arrived. Thinking I would be refunded with no problem I was told that I had to wait for the delivery guy I told them I didn't want the food because I did not trust that it would be hot. The delivery guy came 3 minutes later and surprise my food was not hot. I opened the box to hover my hand over the food had no type of warmth or steam. My refund was still refused because to Pete's I touched the food. All they had to do was refund me my money. Worst customer service ever I very displeased because I order from them every week they have lost a loyal customer.

We moved in March of  2020 and we had a list of things that needed to be fixed and done from the first day we moved in and nothing has been done maintenance never responds. They painted the buildings redid the roofs added a dog park and playground ... to attract new residents but don't fall for it this place is disgusting!!! but yet still they're not helping any of the residents. there are roaches.. there are cobwebs all over Especially in the back buildings You think you're walking in a haunted house just walking to your apartment is disgusting they refused to power wash the floors. We've put in numerous request they constantly just close them out as done even tho they didn't do anything!! We've even gone to the leasing office to speak to them directly they just  say that they're going to send someone over no one ever comes all they do is lie to your Face!! I hate it here. And won't be renewing my lease.

- Food: my dish was really good. I got the Kuma burger, with grilled chicken & without a bun. The chicken was freshly grilled, and the marinade was really nice. It wasn't dry, and they provided a thick slice of tomato, onion & a wedge of fresh lettuce. Loved the fried egg (I added some salt & pepper to the yolk and used it as a dip for my fires). The crispy bacon & cheddar cheese brought it all together: Overall the food exceeded my expectations!

- Atmosphere: loved the music as I grew up listening to metal, and had a warm nostalgic feeling upon hearing the tunes that were playing . If you you dig metal (thrash, death, doom, popular and even other less popular European metal bands) -the music alone would make it worth the trip.
The decor was perfectly in tune with the metal theme, and the burgers all have names of epic metal bands which was clever and a lot of fun. Our server was friendly and service was on point. 

This is a unique joint with great food and an atmosphere to match. I high;y recommend it!
Love love love this place so much. Their grilled fish is good in many flavors and other authentic Chinese dishes are way better even than Chinese restaurants back home.

Very rude staff..   take your
Business elsewhere .  No one ever calls you back. Made 3 attempts

On January 22 2018, Wife and I spoke Lindsey J Marcus a representative of POWER HOME REMODELING GROUP. We had a pleasant conversation between 2 vets then on to business of windows. He went in to details about the windows and all the functions, counted windows in house to do and gave a price about 1200 per window installed. Of coarse we are getting our 5% SAM discount.He ask what our credit score were for which i knew. hes said that he needed to run a soft credit check to see if we qualify to do business for which I repeated that we don't want to run a credit check because how it affects scores and i'm waiting on 2 inquires to expire. He assured me that we were not applying for a loan and I told him I deal with cash, no credit. ok. We negotiated for 8 window to be done and set the appointment for final measurement for Feb 6 2018.

Today I get home, have dinner, go to office in home to see e-mails and mails. Opening one of the mail from a loan company saying that I have been approved for a home repair loan and I went ballistic. Finding the number to the loan company I called them to find out how this was possible. I nor wife applied for a home improvement loan especially from Atlanta GA. See we live in TX. So I inquired and my wife and found out that POWER submitted the application from signatures written on electronic tablet. Don't sign anything on those electronic tablets. I really was looking forward to having those windows but after going through the packet and reading everything Marcus printed and seeing for first time what I he didn't show me when I was signing.

The verbal agreement between Marcus and the wife & I was,
1. I didn't have to pay until I was satisfied with the windows and  
    installation up until 30 days after.
2. The windows installation would not be until end of June.
3. There would not be any financing involved.
4. Get approval from HOA before commencing project. Strict HOA.
5. No more than 2 day removal and install.
6. Satisfactory sweep and clean up after install.

Marcus And I spoke many times over about credit, cost , payment and he assured us that there wasn't going to be financing, just soft credit to see if we were over 650 because that's the company's approval requirement. Yes they would take care of HOA and that it takes 6-8 week to build and ship by end of June once your order gets in line, and Who is at HOA to contact for approval. See living in Houston there's a problem of contractor's asking fro half the money up front then never showing up to complete. That's why the assured that no money exchanges unless i'm satisfied.
 Sorry to see so many unhappy customers out there.

Simply put PERFECT! The food is exceptional, as is the service and the ambiance! Johnny was that perfect balance of professional, friendly and knowledgeable! Everything the said was exactly how it was and that means a lot to me! Superior service, food, ambiance this is our spot now will definitely be frequenting at the very least once a week of not more!! Highly recommend Apps: deviled eggs and or charcuterie board, entree love, love the Babette steak entree as someone who usually makes quite a few modifications it was crazy I MADE ZERO!! Make you way to Wine Market & Table ASAP!

Ideally, my wife and I enjoy dine-in and we've been here several times to do so, pre-Covid. Our attraction here is mainly the authenticity of the menu straight from the island! There's no fake commercial imitation attempt here... This is just what you would get for dinner on the island! That's the appeal! The service is nice but the wait might be slightly longer because they cook their specialties as ordered. So the best thing to do is to call ahead for your take-out and enjoy a great meal.

Rene is a fabulous technician who is very responsive and whenever I need an additional service, he comes over within 24 hours!  He also makes sure to tell me if the service I need is not included and tells me the cost which I really appreciate.  Overall, I am very happy to have both Premier and Rene as our exterminator!
Brent was super dope! Very attentitive and friendly. Definitely made it a great experience :)

Great place to have lunch. I don't get all the people complaining about how expensive this restaurant is. Friend and I split an order of lasagna and a huge slice of pizza. The server (Jake) overheard my friend say she was treating me for my birthday and brought a pizzookiie desert on the house. I took half the pizza slice home-it's huge- and the total bill was under $20, including iced teas.

Good food and great service. Drinks were refilled and to go boxes brought without having to ask. It does get busy so I either go right when they open or after 1:30. I love the calamari and passion fruit iced tea. Biggest negative is the music which is way too loud. Other than that, I've got no complaints. Never had a bad meal here.

The tea here is so weak it needs to join a gym and start lifting some serious weights. 

If you like your tea to taste like hot water and not of the floral or herbal bouquet then this is the place for you. Their loose leaf to water ratio is way off. For a 16oz cup more than what looked like heaping teaspoon needs to be used. 

I know these are hard times and corners are being cut, but, damn, I just spent $4.50 on hot water masquerading as "tea".

Severely Disappointed!!!!
We read some good reviews about this place and went hoping it would be good. We arrived on Sunday an hour after they opened. The bar was full of food but everything we tried to eat was cold or luke warm. Crab ragoon, green beans, chicken sticks, sweet & sour chicken it was all cold, the only way that is possible is if they put out last night's left over food. Is that even sanitary???
We tried to get hibachi cook to order rice and the grill wasn't hot, so it took a long time, the chef messed up our orders and the rice was over cooked since the grill wasn't hot enough in the beginning. It was a horrible experience and we would never eat there again.

I just come here to get those rare cooking ingredients that make regular dishes feel fancy. My local supermarkets don't have stuff like medicinal herbs, so I usually check here first.
I know that the products here are supposed to be organic and extra careful about the sourcing, but for the love of everything that is holy, the prices of some regular table items are actually terrifying.
Excellent turkey dinner.  We have been going here for Thanksgiving for several years and this was the best it has been since we have been going there.

Absolutely fantastic experience at The Sazerac House - even during Covid! 

We visited in late July, before the next big wave of COVID. However mask precautions were in place and enforced. There was also plenty of signage reminding and suggesting social distancing along with hand sanitizer. 

The tour itself is quite detailed and has a great amount of self-exploration and interactive elements. The best part? The tastings! 

At first, the tastings seemed meager. But by the end of the tour, we realized they were just right! Definitely pace yourself! 

Each room had a unique experience with instructors who guided and taught us cocktail creations along with history. 

The Sazerac House was by far the best experience of our entire New Orleans trip, I HIGHLY recommend it! Don't forget to make reservations and plan ahead as they seemed to fill up quickly. 

Cheers!

Love this place, been going for years. Mainly take out, food literally only gets better each time. Falafel is amazing, gyro delicious, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality and quantity of what you get! Everyone who works there is lovely to deal with, couldn't say a single bad thing!

Small, quaint place serving some of the best Latin fare in the area.  Do not be in a rush as the dinners are made by the owner with love.  Shrimp tacos were wonderful as well as the salmon and the pork tacos.  Do not miss the guacamole.  The service is friendly and they want to please.  Lastly the bathrooms are verrrry interesting. ,.

I placed an online order, never received a confirmation and after waiting a few days for either the confirmation, shipment status, order update to no avail I called. And, called, and called, and emailed and sent messages, all to no avail. After finally getting someone on the line, they told me the warehouse could not locate my order. 
For two weeks, no one took the time to respond to my inquires or notify me. 
The story does not end here. 

After a few days, a charge appears from my credit card. 

Unbelievable. 
I have filed a dispute. 

Do you like to gamble? If so, this is the perfect place.

I came in for a haircut today and I got the best cut ever!!!! I got a haircut from a new Barber who started there and is he ever good. All the Barbers are really friendly and Tim the owner really cares about his customers. We talked, laughed and had great conversations about our sports teams. After the great cut they finish you up with a relaxing massage. I will be back Thank You for a great cut and massage.

Seedz Cafe is a pretty sweet spot for vegan food lovers. Fresh food prepared quickly and well, with lots of healthy and light options, healthy and hearty options, as well as pizza and dessert options for whatever type of meal or snack you're interested in. I've been here maybe half a dozen times. One of my favorite items is their tempeh caesar salad, and in general, their caesar dressing is my favorite 'creamy' vegan salad dressing I've encountered so far in my life, super tasty. 

The picture attached features a margarita pizza, a caesar salad, a caesar salad-wrap, and their winter 'rawvioli' salad. 

Fyi, you can order takeout through their website, but sometimes you won't be able to order their pizzas online -- I asked about it and they said they sometimes disable it because they have to manage how many pizza orders come in at peak times due to limited cooking capacity. But there's a simple work around: call and order over the phone, and you'll likely be able to order pizza and anything else you want, that way.
Showed up promptly gave price. Got permit and installed EV charger.

This was my first time eating at Honest Tom's.  I had the grilled or roasted vegetables ( not sure which).  It was delicious.  Very large portion.  So I had half for lunch and took the other half home for dinner.My niece and her husband also enjoyed their meal.  I will definitely be back again.  Since I have been on a plant based diet it has been hard to find places to eat.  So glad that I found out about Honest Tom's.

They deserve zero stars but that wasn't an option.  I bought over 2000 worth of appliances from best buy (pacific sales) and in the store the gentleman was very helpful and knowledgeable, the purchase went smoothly.  The installers came to deliver and set up my new unit and it was a train wreck.  To make a long story short once the sale is complete there is zero customer service and they don't do what is right.  They damaged my water shutoff valve and I have been without a washer for 3 weeks now, had to hire my own plummer.  Terrible terrible terrible don't be fooled!!!!!!

Years ago this was the best darn walk-thru haunted house! Things have certainly changed over the years. There were barely an actors and you really were just walking through a bunch of props. I regret visiting and wish I could get my money back.

I have wanted to stay here since I was a kid. I surpised my wife for our anniversary. It was a once in a lifetime experience! They go out of their way to make you feel welcome, and cater to your every beck and call. I was impressed that the front desk greeted my wife and I by name when we walked by. The pool area offers different types of water to swim in, and the poolside service is excellent. You get what you pay for, and this place is not cheap. But you get the best service, and the rooms were amazing! We had an ocean view room with a fireplace! I would love to stay here again someday, but this darn economy is holding me back. Unless I win the lottery, it will be a while upon my return.

This is a destination for the view, period. There is no justification for the price, given the slow service and average at best food. We had an app, entrée with no desert and were there almost 2.5 hours. 

The ring of rotating tables spins quite slow, just about three hours for one rotation. So if you're going for the sunset and are seated in the wrong spot, you won't see it. 

If you enjoy people watching, sit at the bar, which is stationary. You'll be treated to a steady stream of diners rotating thru before you, and will have a sunset view the whole time.

I am an E club member, so I order from this particular Olive Garden a lot (for both business and personal).  I placed a carside to go order on 6/11/2020, and I was truly disappointed.  It was order #112585600925.  Everyone knows that Olive Garden is known for its bread sticks, and I usually order extra.  I have never been disappointed with breadsticks before.  Not only were they stale, but they were tough.  It seems that they were day-old bread.  I was shocked. I would have returned the order, but I have a fractured foot, so it was already difficult to get there and I just did not have the strength to go back.

The employees and management have apparently forgotten we are in a pandemic. Employees busy and not taking into consideration their physical distance with customers. I walked in this store for about 5 minutes and was brushed by no less than 5 Whole Foods personnel. It's bad enough to have to worry about other customers. Please take time to revisit safety protocols during this pandemic.

The Family Time Carpet Cleaning Team was prompt, courteous, professional and in/out quickly.  I appreciate the care they took in preparing to do their work and to clean up after themselves when they were finished.

We walked over from our hotel to get in on the Happy Hour specials but ended up just ordering from the regular menu. Very busy Friday night, we started with a build your own beer flight. The server was very helpful in explaining how to choose our beers and told us about the interesting offerings based off the kinds of beers we said we liked. We ended up getting some odd choices like peanut butter, Hersheys and a smores. Interesting but no way could I have had more than what we got in this flight. Lol. We had our eye on a few mised drinks but were completely full after getting burgers. I got the Bolts burger with loaded tots. Man, I usually don't go for burgers but it seemed like this place would do them right. They absolutely had an 8nsane one with the Bolts burger named after their beloved local hockey champs. A huge burger with a "puck" of Mac and cheese and bacon. I added tomato and onion. Very filling (I had to omit most of the bun but mostly because those loaded tots were so darn good. That beer cheese was delicious. I was very happy with my choice and happy to make it back to my room and change into my jammies. Lots of servers looking happy to be at work and we even spotted a few eating themselves. Lots of customers and the place was really jamming on a Friday night. Another place I wish would plop a location in Jacksonville.

Tampa Honda is very sneaky and scummy the way they get you in the dealership. Car is listed at a price, but it's actually about 3-4 grand more then that after all their ridiculous fees and such. If you have a trade in that you owe money on, you don't get the tax incentive if you buy a new car from them, which i've never heard of before. They have a ridiculous "reconditioning" fee for like 1.5k, shouldn't that be included in the price of the car not when you sit down? Also they have a high dealer fee and a low jack fee. A bunch of fees that make a car 3-5k more then what is advertised online. Sat down to get the numbers and they were insanely high and ridiculous, plus seeing all the fees. 30k car turns into a 35k car... Not to mention the car wasn't in that good of condition, but over the phone they were talking like it was the most perfect condition car...Normal dealership tactics, very scummy dealership. Way better off getting a car somewhere else, Avoid this dealership at all costs.

Great people work here, it's not everyday you find people who are upbeat and friendly while helping you make your bbq selections. 
11/5/2021 the staff for the lunch shift deserves a shout out! The were on point with checking in on us, helping us make selections and informing us about the business. 
Everything on my plate was delicious, give this place a try and you won't regret it!
My spouse and I absolutely love this place!  It really doesn't matter which location you choose, as we have frequent Metairie location, it's always great service and great delicious food!
I'm not sure why I go back.  I like Toyota parts and trained service personnel but staff seems indifferent.  And they're very proud of their parts and service that are way over priced.

This little gem is just fantastic! Service and food is exceptional. The kind of restaurant that you love to eat at with a beautiful story! Owned by Immigrants who came to the US escaping the travesty of the Middle East. Mother is in the kitchen preparing truly authentic, delicious dishes served by her daughter who was just delightful! You can taste the love and feel the hospitality in everything about this place. It was the best food I have eaten in St Louis...period and the best Middle eastern food ever! Highly recommend!

Here at the store now. The 'lady' at the counter has a total attitude and is a condescending bitch. Mumbles passive aggressive filth under her breath. Does not communicate effectively and I about reached over the counter to slap her with the way she spoke to my girl. Don't go to this one. What a mistake.
Casey was super friendly, careful and did a great job.  I reached out and he was here the next day. Highly recommend!

I loved my time at The Station! Everything is very nice and well kept! Updated fixtures and lots of living room space! I think everyone in the leasing office is exceptionally helpful and so nice! Any issues Ive ever had they've come to fix that day! I definitely recommend! FREE parking is enough to sell ya!

Worst Pharmacy Ever. 3 days after dropping off script- it still was not ready. When I said to give it back to me - the guy comes back & says the Pharmacist is doing it now. ( insert Eye Roll)
Finally get it - the directions are completely Wrong. 
If we followed the directions my husband would have been in the ER
We called the Dr to get the Right instructions.
Run Far Far Away from them

I have been getting the beef pho from this place a lot recently because of the colder weather. It never disappoints. 

The broth is very tasty and not too salty. The portions are big and filling. They do not skim out on the meats. The price is $12.50 which is probably a couple of dollars more than what you would pay somewhere else but given that this location is in DTSP, it is understandable. 

The wait here can be long during peak hours: lunch and dinner so I usually call ahead and pick it up. The staff here are always friendly as well.
Great place only one bathroom.  Employees use the same bathroom.  I was behind multiple employees and each one of them averages 10 minutes.   There should be a separate bathroom

Made order for pick up to avoid the long drive through lines.   Not yo long it. Wait. Arrived home  to find my entire order a mess  yet it was a very simple order 
2 spicy chickens.  Large fry  Frappuccino
