The  chicken sandwiches  hand nothing on them only a chicken patty. An bun. The fry was a Small fry an was ice cold an the Frappuccino was half full 

Not sure why this place is still in business at this point. Attempted to call back the phone is busy  seems like it's off the hook so no one can call the business 
Pretty crappy night.   Can a store manger please give me a call

Is it possible to leave no stars to this company. I ordered a washer and Dryer from them. They installed the washer so that the hot water hose was hooked up to the cold water valve and the cold water hose was hooked up to the hot water. If you set the machine to wash on cold, the water came out scalding hot. 
Service was going to call me the night before they arrived and give me a window of time for arrival. That didn't happen. It was impossible to get anyone on the phone other than sales since "the new phone system" apparently didn't ring when transferred. After Service was done, I requested my installation fee returned to me since they had charged to hook it up. I was transferred no less than 6 times and it would have been 7 except the last transfer was to an line that apparently didn't work. I've been promised call backs, hasn't happened. I wanted an installation refund and maybe even an apology, but now I am taking the receipts and ruined clothing, as well as the service description to small claims court. What would have run them less than $100 is now going to be well over $500, plus their time. I was told by people not to use them, and next time I'll listen. This was the worst experience I have ever had with a company.

Am a regular downtown but had never eaten at De La VIna location. Had a big group (6 adults, 3 young kids age 7 and under) and it was packed on a Sunday morning. We ordered, waited til enough tables opened up and put them together. Wow was wait worth it. Food came out quickly, and everyone (from hardcore vegans to bacon lovers) was delighted. Coffee has always been good; I am now a devoted fan of the food!

Love love love Izu!! It was Christmas day and we were desperate for something delicious for dinner and we were so lucky the hardworking staff at Izu was in. The Party Platter with all the special rolls ($90) was delicious! It had everything we wanted except Shrimp Tempura, which we just ordered more on the side. Their Shrimp Tempura rolls are INCREDIBLE - I've been to so many sushi places but this is the only place that gives TWO tempura pieces per roll. It was amazing. 

Their seaweed salad is also great - and the quantity is twice that of any other sushi place. On top of everything, service was extremely quick and they were so friendly. I would come back here in a heartbeat for fair prices and excellent food/service. Thank you for helping make the holidays great!

Had dinner 7/4/21. Staff was very nice and accommodating, specially the hostess. 
The restaurant is nice and the patio is ideal, in all the location is nice.
Drinks, I had a Lavender G&T, it was very good. Presentation, taste and serving size was great!
My daughters ordered some type of lemonade that was flavored, it was horrible. 
Food, we ordered Guacamole, it was good but I'd hold off on the pomegranate. Chips and salsa, chips where good, salsa lacked flavor. Toritos were good, perfectly cooked bacon and the goat cheese was good too.
Loaded fries where not what I expected but they weren't horrible, I wouldn't order them again.  Now the burger was good, the Gouda cheese was the icing on the cake. Yucca fries where nothing special. 2 carne asada taco, with a 1oz side of salsa where ok. The meat had no seasoning at all and was a little over cooked. I just poured a lot of salsa, squeezed some lime and added some guacamole and they were fine. I would not order them again.  
In all it's not a great place, just average for this visit. I will try it again and order different items. 
We really enjoyed the live band on the patio and the drinks. That's the only reason I'd return. BUT I will try different items on the menu.

Just moved from out of state, and was looking for a new salon and stylist. Came across Number 9 Salon... Haley cut my hair and I LOVE the cut! Booked a follow up appointment for a few weeks time!  Will definitely be making this my new salon home!

Walked in shortly before another fella and the guy at the counter completely ignored our presence.  

He stated "what's good man" to the guy who walked in after us.  

Then he realized we arrived first and took our order.  After we payed he walked into the back and didn't start our smoothie. 

He was speaking to his coworker with very dirty words.  What if I had a kid with me? I would t want them hearing him screaming F**k you to his coworker.

I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS LOCATION 


My visit was on 12/28/21

-- high hopes especially after viewing wonderful food pics on Yelp!
-- 2 bloody marys tasted zesty 'n spicy hot --  but had ZERO alcohol 
   for $15.00 !!  sad

-- calamari was really hot & delicious but only a meager portion - just a 
   handful with 2 sauces taking up volume on the plate     $14.00 !!  --- 
   just a handful !!
-- since the owner is from Maryland,  you'd think he'd have a genuinely 
   SUPERIOR tartar sauce & cocktail sauce w/ some horseradish !!

-- spinach/arugula salad was over the top expensive!   super sweet w/NO- 
   flavor dressing -- by far the most expensive item for some greens !!

-- meatball sub was loved by the person eating it - he said it was very filling 
-- his Caesar side salad had NO-flavor dressing       $16.00 !!

-- we asked for dry-rub extra crispy wings after viewing them in a photo,  but 
   got drippy-wet buffalo sauce -- boo hoo       $15.00 for a meager portion !!

-- BEST part was the coconut porter on draft
-- waitress was cute & friendly,  but didn't bring napkins,  forks,  or extra 
   plates to share wings, etc 
   waitress also left my real expensive salad sitting up there for quite some 
   time in the warm summer air
   we gave her a HUGE tip anyway assuming she was a student
   $82.00        for lunch w/o the tip !!
-- they deleted peel 'n eat shrimp along w/multiple other items - bummer !!
 --WON'T be back

Love this restaurant, probably one of my favorites in Dunedin but they NEVER answer their phones to either make a reservation, get call ahead seating, or order takeout. I call the restaurant multiple times with no response, leave messages though. Hostess became rather hostile when I told her no one ever answered the phone or returned my message. Just wish they would provide better service or improve their ways.

The Quarter View Restaurant has great daily lunch specials and some nice drink specials.  This is a larger venue with a lot of space in their dining rooms and their bar.  The interior of the establishment is painted to resemble the French Quarter.  They have quite a wide variety of food choices here and most folks should be able to find something they like here.  Overall this is a good place to grab lunch during the week with some good specials that provide a good value.  

My video review of Quarter View Restaurant is here:
https://youtu.be/OueCfM6HcOw

Came into Renown for my 4th MRI in a year.  Not excited about the prospect, but I was told this location had special contrast we needed for my image.  Check-in was fine - friendly staff and no wait. 

Once I got checked in, the Technician called me back.  When we determined I needed a gown to change into, she ushered me into a dressing room.  There were old gowns from previous patients laying in the dressing room (eww) and it was not the cleanest room.  

This MRI machine appears to be old and is very closed in - the worst of all those I've been in previously.  I was strapped in and the technician gave good directions - everything seemed to go well.  Until we were done...

She pulled me out of the MRI and her face was shocked.  She told me not to worry and then proceeded to share that the IV with my contrast had come undone - and there was a significant amount of blood on the table, gown, etc.  She apologized and while I completely understand that sometimes things happen, I was still stunned by her response.  Here is why this is two stars: 

1.  She never actually asked if I was ok.  Not once.  Even though I'd lost a good deal of blood. 

2.  She didn't offer me anything to clean myself - which is a bio-hazard -right?

3.  No one followed up with me.  If I had a customer who had this kind of experience, I would definitely call them to see if they are ok.  

Also, the results in My Chart didn't say anything about the IV issue and showed only that the contrast results are fine.  (I hope that part is true.)

So- not a great experience.  I'm hoping future situations allow me to return to Carson Tahoe where everything was clean and well run.

You can get an authentic fix of tacos Al Pastor, Carnitas and carne asada with fresh corn tortillas, queso fresca and other toppings. Side of guacamole was a hit. All situated at a nondescript food truck on the corner of N Florida and E Violet across from industrial vibe along Florida Ave. It's catty-corner to Cappy's. Service was friendly and prompt. There was a good amount of call ahead pickups and orders while we waited. We definitely will return.
This place is by far the best BBQ in the area! I always go for the pulled pork sandwich smothered in sweet & smokey BBQ sauce with a side of baked beans.

I came for a meeting and enjoyed my time. They have a big upstairs with a lot of meeting rooms. The lobby has a coffee shop and a restaurant if you need a quick bite. I can't speak for the rooms or the stay but the staff seemed pretty nice.  I did order a salad from the restaurant and it was just ok. It had chickpeas in there but some chickpeas were rock hard. Almost broke a tooth! I also valeted my car and the process was pretty seamless. They even parked my car out front so I could pick it up when my meeting was done. Overall a solid experience!

Let's face it, the kind of work we need to do when we need a coach/therapy/help, is not the most fun part of our lives, and it's probably taken years of putting off before actually getting help which means the cuts and bruises on our soul are probably huge open wounds by this point!! But honestly, if you need just a little push in the right direction or even a swift kick in the butt, I swear by Adleta's work! I have been working with New Options for a few years, on and off. Adleta has practiced NLP with me, been my coach, and really helped guide and encourage me on my path to success. It's been a long road, and I must admit, at first I was skeptical as this felt a little new-age to me (I'm a traditional therapy kind of girl.... at least I was back then!)...but honestly, conventional therapy never helped me. It felt stuffy, impersonal, and so calculated! I resisted and had sessions on and off, trying to absorb everything, but I was just too stubborn. Recently, I worked on a few meditations with Adleta, and went over my mental notes and all our work together, and it clicked for me. AMAZING!!!  I truly believe Adleta possesses the qualities necessary to be a great coach and root for you in your corner, no matter the circumstances. She's professional, caring, curious, honest, and non-judgemental (which is super important when you're pouring your battered and bruised heart out!) 
I would recommend her to my friends and family (and already have!!) and trust her completely with my well-being and I know she is right there with me when I succeed (and won't even take any of the credit)

If you're looking for someone to help you deal with a situation, whether it is external or internal, I would start here and get ready for some hard work and seriously awesome personal rewards :)

We came here during an apparent tri-lingual service. At first, we were concerned because the service started in Spanish, but then went to English, and then to Hmong or some other Asian language. Because of the language issues, it was a bit difficult to get much out of the service. It was very traditional, however.

Always wanted to try the NY location since I close to it but never got the chance.  

Decor is very elegant.  Service was excellent.  

We (4 of us) ordered the margarita pizza and a side of meatballs for appetizers.  Pizza was delicious, nice thin crust and melted in your mouth.  
Meatballs were excellent also.  

I ordered the Linguini with clams in white sauce.  Very flavorful broth.  Nice amount of clams.  

Gnocchi pasta was good.  Very heavy though.  ( I know most are, but I prefer the ones that are lighter). 

Jumbo Shrimp franchise was phenomenal.  I think there were 6 or 7 jumbo shrimp on the platter. Excellent flavor.. they even ate all the Julianne vegetables because the sauce was sooo good!!   

Forgot my phone so didn't take pics!!

Horrible horrible horrible! Waited for over a half an hour to be seated and when I walked to the bathroom noticed there was so many tables open should have been seated way faster. The wait only continued had to wait for server and wait for food for forever then never saw waitress had to ask manager for refills. Food was delicious but because of service will never return to this location!

Booked the highest level hair stylist for my haircut thinking she would be good at cutting hair. I wanted my hair a few inches shorter to cut split ends and get layers. She completely thinned my hair, cut my hair a little bit shorter than I wanted, choppy uneven layers. I also have split ends after all the hair that was cut off, her blade might of been dull or something but my hair came out bad. Got it fixed by her thinning my hair even more. I had long straight/wavy thick hair with even layers to make sure my hair was easy to take care of. Now my hair looks so bad, I can't even straighten since you can see how botched it is.

Great Chinese food in Nashville.  This is part of the new wave of finally good, authentic Chinese restaurants in Nashville.  The noodle bowls are quite filling.  We tried three different ones, and let the server help us choose.  The basil fried chicken was great--it tastes very close to Taiwanese fried chicken.   The steamed buns were OK, not the best.  The chive and pork dumplings were great.  The shrimp dumplings were also so-so.  

Service was amazingly fast and efficient.  She told us our 7 dishes would be out in "10 minutes," and I think the first plate landed at about the 5 minute mark.  The rest all showed up within the next 5 minutes.  

She server helped us pack our leftovers, even though I insisted on doing my own.  She was determined to help!  I actually loved that!

Great pizza great owner great social mission great prices. 

I love that pizza slices are donated, it's quite inventive to have a social justice theme to a pizza place, and the story of this place is inspiring.

I stumbled upon this place because they are one of the few restaurants that is open late during the week.  Really good food.   I tried the crawfish etouffee, the chargrilled oyster, and the alligator tacos.  Everything was delicious! And they had a live band.  Just like anywhere in St. Louis, don't leave anything of value in sight in your vehicle.  There were homeless walking around checking cars.

3.75 to be exact.

Franklin Fountain is not a very large place.  During peak times this place can be very busy, with the line going outside.  There is a reason for this though, as the ice cream is very good.  I really like the old school theme Franklin Fountain portrays.  Whenever I enter I feel I went back in time.  They even have an old phone where you dial the numbers to call!  

As for the ice cream flavors, my favorites from what I have tried include Hydrox Cookie (Cookies and Cream), Franklin Mint Chip, Pistachio (no it is not green!), and Maple Walnut.  I do have to say they make their Pistachio well here, and I liked the Maple Walnut in the fact that the flavors did not overwhelm each other.  You can also get sundaes, shakes, egg cream, sodas, etc. here.  

I'll mention though that the prices here are a little higher than you would typically see at a another ice cream shop, so be mindful of that especially since this place is CASH ONLY.  However, the ice cream is good enough for me not to mind paying these prices.  A nice touch here is that their to-go containers are the same as the ones you get at Chinese restaurants... interesting!  

I always distinctly remember the staff being very friendly to me whenever I am here, even during their busiest days.

Whether you're a local, born and raised Philadelphian or someone visiting from out of town, Reading Terminal is a MUST. 

If food is your thing, there's something for you here. Indian, Greek, Cajun, you name it, it's at Reading Terminal. Get yourself a Philly Cheesesteak from the same place as Obama or have a roast pork sandwich from DiNic's. If you have more of a sweet tooth then The Flying Monkey bakery whoopie pies are hard to beat. Beiler's donuts are also tough to beat. Maple bacon is my personal fave!

Keeping with Pennsylvania tradition, there are the Amish food stalls and also PA Dutch Eating Place with their apple dumplings will have you heading home happy.

If you're not hungry, then take some time to browse the different stalls for what you can take home. Flowers, loose tea, beeswax products are just a few of my favorite places to stop. 

Either way, you can't lose coming to Reading Terminal and you definitely will be back again!

This place is amazing. I got a suite and it was great. I think It was a little too big for me but then again my circumstances during my stay were not as I planned them. The place is clean. The staff arefriendly. Continental breakfast every morning. Helpful front desk (Cynthia) with tours I wanted to do. The only downfall was that the elevator stop working on my second day here and I was on the fourth floor. I was able to use the service elevator and the stairs for the time being. They were very friendly and helpful with everything. I would definitely would like to stay here again
Excellent , consistent, valuable local icon doesn't need to change much of anything save for maybe cleaning here and there.

Amazing place to host a birthday party.

Apparently I'm just about a year and a half discovering this place after Brett N. I'm sure he told me about it and I ignored him, so here we are. We were invited to come here for a birthday party. She rented out the entire place for her son and when I learned the cost, let me just say it is super reasonable. I may host my birthday parties here from here on out.

The entire place is super clean, which is great during a pandemic. Workers were going behind kids and disinfecting things. There were tons of little rooms where kids could pretend to be all sorts of things, like hairdressers, construction workers, doctors, etc. There's a room in the back for parties. My son is three and he had the best time. There's even a little area in the front where babies can hang out and they have a nursing room. 

My son played here for hours and never got bored. It's stimulating without being overwhelming. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

Went a few months back, we stumbled upon this place drunkenly. My friend and I ordered the Shrimp Po boy, the service was kinda of slow but my friend loved the po boy, to me it was just ok. Drinks were good enough to get the job done.

Meh.

Be very sure you want to sign up for 24 months because if you try to cancel, they make sure it's not worth your while. In fact, the way they do it, it's not even worth their while. 

My story:
My husband and I signed up at $59/mo for 24 months. After 13 months of payments, I decided to seek alternate means of exercise since I was only using the treadmill there anyway. My husband wanted to continue so I asked the "manager" for our options. He said they would impose a $150 cx fee and my husbands rate would be $46/mo. I have no problem with the $46/mo but for a difference of $13/mo for 11 months I don't make up the $150 cancellation fee. In fact, it is cheaper to stay on the contract.

Now here's where they are foolish. My husband is so irritated that he is not going to renew in 11 months. So, by enforcing this cancellation fee thereby compelling me to stay on, they are not just losing my membership and goodwill but they are getting a bad review, AND losing my husband's renewal at $46/mo down the road; never mind the cost of acquiring new business which they probably don't even understand. At the very least, they obviously can't do the math.

I've never said this before in my life but the service was... Too fast? Nevertheless our waitress was really incredible and I regret that I don't recall her name.

We rebooked here last minute when Husk closed on short notice not really knowing what to expect.

I tried the goat cheese dip, a pizza, lobster Mac, lobster roll, fries, chocolate cake, and doughnuts.

I think every dish is as good as you would expect and the desserts were both delightful, hopefully you can bring friends and try both. I would not consider this to be a destination unto itself like Husk but if you're in the neighborhood it's worth checking out.

Went in with no expectations, came out incredibly satisfied! Allow me to break my experience down for ya.

Service: Our waiter was ON IT. We never had an empty chip basket. It's like he knew I wanted to eat my wait in chips and salsa. A little slow to bring us our check but we were in no rush, so it wasn't a big deal.

Interior: More upscale, almost too fancy... Very clean.

Food: Salsa-they serve you a mild and medium. HUGE fan of the mild. So fresh! Lunch fajitas-the perfect amount and so so delicious. Whatever they saute their meat and veggies in was truly a dream. (hang tight while I wipe the drool off my keyboard)

Price: The lunch menu is very reasonable but it looked like the regular menu may be a tad overpriced. I'll stick to lunch time visits.

Overall great spot in Carmel. Look forward to visiting again!

I don't let everyone do my brows, and have reluctantly floated around to different nail salons in the city trying to achieve a certain look. Unfortunately, most places are prone to over-plucking my thick brows, when most of the time I just want a subtle shaping or clean-up. 

Unfortunately, my requests most often get lost in translation. So, I was happy to see this place pop up in my Groupon search, and happier when I realized they are black-owned. 

I arrived on time, and waited in the car to be texted on when to come in. I appreciated them doing this for safety during this pandemic. Masks were worn and my temperature was also taken. I waited a bit long to be texted, but based on hearing her tell another customer they were running behind, I let that go. Everyone is adjusting to this new normal.

Cortney did my brows and I think they came out looking great. I didn't even have to tell her to just do a soft arch and not overpluck them. I think she did one of the best jobs I have seen in years on these brows. I really can't overstate enough how frustrating it is how some of these salons just immediately go to taking off too much of my brow.

Cortney was really pleasant, and I didn't have an issue getting an appt right away (no one answered the phone originally - so maybe they were overwhelmed). I think I'll return. 

Oh yeah, they also have a little parking lot.

Stopped in here real quick after eating dinner at Bone Fish Grill to get paper towels, soil, and seeds so I can start planting tomatoes and peppers for the season. I got a parking spot right up front near the door which is great also it wasn't crowded at all so I was able to get in line quickly.

I chose the self check-out line and was scanning my items 1 at a time and would u belive the cashier was watching me like a hawk thinking I'm stealing stuff . She was doing everything in her power to look around me as I scanned each item. I didn't appreciate being treated like a criminal. I never had this happen to me ever in my life.  She made me feel like a thief. I would not recommend this Home Depot ever even if ur stopping in for 2 minutes. 
I will go support another Home Depot where I'm treated with respect and not as though I am a criminal. Screw you Home Depot worker.

Excellent. My barber, "Trey," was punctual, focused and made sure to articulate his vision for my beard. (I'm going for that Rick Ross effect) - well, there's work to be done on my part: fuller growth, deep conditioning and regular maintenance. I was more than pleased with where we're starting and feel completely comfortable starting this journey in his capable hands. The shop is the shop. Black men, laughing, engaging, chatting and talkin' that talk. You know how we do.

So you might have to make a small effort to get here, as it's a little out of the way, parking is a challenge and there's construction on the street right now...but...it's SO worth it.

Charming outside and in.  Friendly staff.  And the CHICKEN.  I had a 12-piece wings with Honeybee and Golden sauce.  The wings were a good size and perfectly cooked.  A little crispy and still moist.  I didn't even bother getting fries....as my focus was on the wings.  And I'm soooo glad because I stuffed my gullet with all 12 (I never do that!).  They were just plain tasty!  My coworker equally enjoyed her chicken fingers (more like chicken breast fillets!).

Yet another repeat visit planned next time I'm in Music City.
Be prepared to wait, but donuts are worth it! Hummingbird Reserve is good too. Service is friendly and quick. Music City Bus Circuit nearby, and it's free!

Hands down one of my favorite restaurants.  I order here almost weekly.  My two favorites are the Parilla Mixta and the chapacha.  It's a fast casual restaurant with limited seating.  But their carry out is always quick and correct.

Holy moly...I found them at them at the farmers market. The basil/tomato pasta and tiramisu are ahhmazing. I'm looking forward to eating in the restaurant. 
My husband said the bolognese was great also. That's not my thing personally so I didn't have the sauce.

The real name for this place is the Universiade Pavilion - but it's, more appropriately, called the Butterdome by everyone. For obvious reasons. It's shaped as a giant block and painted a golden yellow. When I moved here, I saw it from a distance and thought it was an unfinished building with exposed inner walls. I always thought it looked like the inside of a Crunchie chocolate bar, a giant block of sponge toffee. 

Garish and giant as it is, it's a landmark, which is a good thing on a big campus, so many people have a love-hate relationship to it. It's right next to the sports hub of the university and it is used for big events, like concerts, sports meets, craft sales and also had an indoor climbing gym which is open to the public as well. 

I've been there on more than one occasion and it's a great place for a concert or just to use as a landmark when giving directions. Hard to miss a big block of butter...

It's located inside what looks like a little convenient store, so you definitely can't just sit around and hangout...regardless, the food is so good! 

I love Chicken Fried Steak but I think I found my favorite spot for it. The meat is thick, gravy full of flavor and after your first bite, you can't imagine having this anywhere else!

Muffuletta. Wow! I love the olive spread on this sandwhich!  

I don't like stuffing...but I will eat their Turkey and stuffing every week, if I lived there. They know how to do their stuffing. I can't explain it but the it's full of flavor and made perfectly with the Turkey!!

OMG I can't even rate this as much as I want to. I would give then 10 stars if I could. I booked this after seeing it on the news for my husband's 40th birthday. I booked both lanes for 2 hours and we had about 30 people go. I worked with Michelle and she was phenomenal! She helped me with everything, got me the waiver for our friends to sign early, she helped me order food in advance and had tables set up with everything. They even decorated for the birthday theme, we had our own bartender for that side of the bar and she was just the cutest and so good! Everyone ended up throwing and they kept going back (even the girls who said they wouldn't!) We just had the best time ever, I wish we had one closer to us, but we will go back for sure. This would be a great spot for team building for work or parties or just plain fun. We had a blast, and my husband was so excited! Thank you for such great memories

While in Philadelphia for a quick turn around trip, I wanted some southern comfort food. Immediately after walking in, I enjoyed the ambiance. Good lighting and faint music. I was immediately seated and greeted by a waiter and ordered the seasonal sangria and grilled chicken wings as an appetizer. Both were amazing and greatly priced. Sams famous BBQ sauce is delicious. For my main course, I ordered the ribs which I have to say were disappointing. I saw a few people who had a burger and wished that I had ordered such. I would definitely come by for their happy hour deals, but dinner, probably not.

i went on a double date and the food was delicious. our waitress Amy Lee was so sweet and helpful. the whole concept is cool, especially if you're a reader like me!

recommendations: NY strip and the spicy margarita

Really nothing special. An average cheesesteak - not too much meat, kind of industrial tasting bread. The wing zings were disappointing. Previously frozen and of course overpriced. Nobody was there when I arrived Saturday for lunch.

It has been 15 minutes NO one has came to our table. They sat us down no other contact. I will wait 5 more minutes then leave
22 min ..... yeah they do have waiters. He just took our order. 
55 min in still no food. I checked nothing else is open this later or i would have walked out. (We found a Waffle House the next day)
69 min ....... we finally got our food. Still waiting on my grandson milkshake 
75 minutes ....... milkshake finally made it to the table
On a positive note the food was good. But don't expect to be in a hurry

OMG this is now a night mare. We had to wait on the cook to check us out. 
It took us 1 hour 38 min. From the time we walked in till we walked out..

I wish I had taken pictures but I'm always too hungry by the time I order. I have ordered their pizza a few times now and aside from some Uber delivery challenges it has been incredible! Probably the best pizza I have had in Nashville. The crust seems to be brushed with garlic butter and is the perfect bake every time. The toppings are spot on and taste fresh and fantastic. The sauce is unique and seems like it could happily work with pasta or pizza, delicious all the same. Usually there is one thing that really stands out about a pizza to me, like the toppings, crust, or sauce. At the goat they have nailed all of them IMO, and if I lived in the nearby apartments I would likely gain weight from eating so much!  I have not eaten anything other than the pizza from here, and I like it so much I have been hesitant to try anything else. Give them a shot, your mileage may vary, but I am glad I found them.

I have now spoken to an additional 4 people at Metro to try and upgrade my plan. I'm now hoping after speaking to employee #4 who was Venessa, a supervisor, maybe I'll be on the correct plan.
Note that for Metro, this IS good service...
Also, I found it strange that employee #3, Mario, didn't know what a supervisor was...

I found Salon Belladonna through Groupon and met Hannah who is such a good stylist!

I visited for the 3rd time yesterday to get highlights and low lights and a cut.  Another excellent experience from Hannah!

The salon likely was a house at one point so most stylists have their own private room.  It is a bit of a maze.  I think each stylist is independent and rents a room.  

Hannah has never given someone a hair cut or style while I wait which is something I can't stand that stylists do! I want to get in and out without making a day of it.  

With Hannah, I'm in an out in about an hour and a half.  I make my appointments in advance for Saturday morning but it was not difficult to get my first appointment on a Saturday morning.  

I highly recommend Hannah at Belladonna!

I love Trader Joe's they have interesting items the prices are right and the portions are about right for a small household. Stores are quick and easy to use. I highly endorse this grocery chain.
P.S. They are the absolute Kings of inexpensive wine.

Went to Bernie's with a group. My food was pretty good. There aren't a ton of gluten free options so I got a burger with no bun. The egg on my burger was a little undercooked which made it a little slimy. The risotto was great. After we ate several of us ordered coffee. The coffee was pretty bad. It was cold and old. A nice warm cup of coffee after dinner would have been amazing. They service was great and the place is super cute. I would give it 3.5 if I could. I would definitely go back and give it another shot.

After having a bad experience at another bar near by we came to Woody's everyone was super friendly. They had live karaoke and the place was fun and entertaining. 

We grabbed drinks and just sat there listening to other people sing and we had a great time. We were only there for about an hour or so. 

The only bad thing at least for me: 
The bathroom are gender neutral and I didn't  like it because the urinals smelled bad. (But I was expecting this since this is a gay bar, so this did not affect the review)

Wonderful, friendly customer service. Their lattes and americanos are delicious! A big step up from the few other coffee shops in the area, and at a similar price.

The menu isn't overly long, which makes it easy to figure out what you want. They have an impressive list of flavored syrups to choose from, so you can always find something new to try too.

Tucked away amongst businesses this is a gem. Food was great. I had the filet. It was served on a steel plate hot as could be. Delicious and sizzling. 

The flavor was perfect 

And their corn bread was amazing. 

Really enjoyed my meal. Nice, romantic restaurant with awesome service.

Stopped by on a Thursday evening to catch the first half of the first Eagles game. They weren't too packed, and we were able to find seating right away at the bar to get a great view of the TVs. The place is pretty big with some table seating also available throughout. Bartenders were friendly and attentive.

We were brought complementary popcorn that was seasoned with crab fries seasoning, which is freshly popped on location and gives the brewery a nice scent. Then we ordered the pretzel with beer cheese. The pretzel was a little bit smaller than I'd hoped, but it may have been one of the best beer cheeses that I've ever had. We also ordered a variety of beers throughout the night, which were pretty tasty.

I want to minus a star just because I do wish they had more beers, but they did have a decent selection. However, I'd add that star back because they actually have great happy hour specials!

We came for breakfast after lots of friends raved. It was alright but nothing out of this world. The menu was limited to chillaquiles, which were ok.  Too much salsa for me, I like mine cooked down more. The restaurant was supposed to open at 8am and didn't open until 8:45. Over all it was ok.

White Yak absolutely blew my mind! I wasn't quite sure to expect with Tibetan food, but it was like a fusion of several Asian cuisines. We had the momo combo, beef curry, and thukngo. The momo were all delicious, but the beef ones were our favorite. I'm not kidding when I say that the beef curry was one of the best dishes I've eaten in a looong time! It was so savory and rich and flavorful (like the best beef stew you've ever had). My wife had the thukngo with chicken and also enjoyed that very much. It was similar to a pad thai. HIGHLY recommend trying this place and we will definitely be ordering again!

Really cool new spot in University City. I attended a pre-opening event and got to try parts of the menu buffet style. I was a huge fan of the chicken wings and the flatbread pizza.

One of the most attractive things about the space is how many hang out nooks there are. If you make your way all the way to the top of the stairs, there's even a cozy pool table lounge next to a seemingly private dining area.

I imagine the outdoor balcony will be a huge hit as temperatures begin to rise. It's located right near the bar and has two flat screen TV's, string lights and two fire pits. 

Five star space!

With all the hype about Boathouse, I was excited to come here with a friend for brunch. However, we were extremely let down by our experience here. Service was brusque at best (and pretty far from the friendly service described in other reviews). We sat at one of the high tops, but because of the sun, we didn't really get to enjoy the view from patio, as it was around noon (we turned around to face the entrance so we didn't have the sun in our face for the entire meal). 

My friend and I both got the Boathouse Signature Breakfast. I got mine with the eggs scrambled, and she got hers with poached eggs. The food wasn't bad, but I wouldn't say that it was particularly good either, and certainly not worth the price or the wait.

It's unlikely that I'd come back, especially since it's pretty far out of the way.

Been to Bulla on  numerous occasions. The 1st time was for brunch with my boyfriend a few months after opening. Bulla is a solid 4 Stars. I'll admit after my 1st experience I would have left 5 stars but  this review is an average of all my visits. Small plates/ tapas style  restaurants are my favorite because I love being able to eat multiple dishes instead of settling for one large dish. This is a great all round restaurant ideal for  all celebrations like birthdays, happy hour, anniversaries, date night, girls night brunch group dates. The decor is modern and I love the varied seating between tables and chairs, partial booths and high top booths as well as high top chairs. There is a pretty decent size bar area. Definitely always make a reservation for Friday's and Saturday's  around dinner time. 

BRUNCH: 
Why Bulla is one of my favorite brunch spot and where it takes the cake for me is it's pre-fixxe brunch menu  for 27 dollars and bottomless mimosas/ sangrias (18 dollars) . Most places offer bloodmary and mimosas and since I'm not a fan of blood Mary's, I fell in love with Bulla for bottomless sangria to change it up. What's great is that you don't have to stick to just sangria or mimosas, mix and switch as you choose. The pre-fixe menu is pretty legit because you get full sized portions and get to pick an item from 3 categories , appetizer, entree, dessert/ sweet. Both times I have done the pre-fixe menu and shared my items with another person and we were both incredible overstuffed and couldn't finish everything. So it's a lot of food for two people and definitely way too much for one person to finish, but you can always take your items boxed to go . My first visit we  ended up taking the blueberry ricotta pancakes straight to go. I'd suggest not picking something very rich each time if you plan on  finishing everything. 

For brunch I've had the had the "Coca" aka flatbread- Mahón cheese, quail eggs, bacon, caramelized onions, mushrooms. Loved it, especially when the eggs were slightly runny. Good change up for a breakfast pizza with quail eggs. The caramelized onions and mushrooms created so much flavor and I savored that flatbread each bite.  Next I had the "Huevos bulla" - eggs, homemade potato chips, Serrano, potato foam, truffle oil. Very delicious but after just eating the breakfast flatbread it was too rich for me to eat a lot.  Next I had the ricotta blueberry pancakes and they weren't the best pancakes I've had but good. My 2nd visit for brunch I got the chicken and waffles as my 2nd course. I did not like it. Would have been much much better if the whole dish  wasn't  drenched  in the  chorizo gravy. Better yet just not have it at all. I recently checked the menu and so glad they removed the chorizo gravy form this dish, because it made it toooo tooo rich to eat and made everything soggy.  So maybe worth a try now. I like my waffle crisp and not a soft baked texture. When I had this dish the waffle was a soft texture.

FOOD:
Some solid things to order are the Patatas bravos- crispy potatoe cubes with a sirachaesque aioli sauce. I enjoy these when they're extra crispy. The gambas al ajillo (10 dollars). Small but the brandy- garlic-olive oil mixture is to die for. I wish the shrimp was charred and not simmered though for more flavor but still good because of that olive oil mixture it sits in mixture. My other favorite thing to order is the  pork pinxtos (9 dollars)- Cumin marinated pork loin skewers, mojo verde, Greek yogurt. Pork is so flavorful and multiple friends have said they thought the yogurt sauce would be weird for them but loved it!  I've had the "tabla mixta"- Tetilla cheese, manchengo cheese, Serrano ham, chorizo, olives (happy hour $18). The first time I ordered the charcuterie here I didn't like  the crackers that came with it, so I was so happy when I saw this time around it came with little grilled baguette pieces instead. 

Was not a fan of the queso fundido but other friends liked it but commented it was much  more tomatoey than cheesey, and would have preferred more melted cheese. I  hated the tomatoe sauce. The chorizo pieces was not crumbled but cubed and honestly it brought me back to when I was younger and I tried a frozen pizza bagel bite.  I like my queso fundido cheesy and with crumbled chorizo. The meatballs are ok, moist but not enough season/ flavor for me.

HAPPY HOUR: 
All drinks area half  off from 4-7 Monday to Sunday.  There is a select HH food menu but only available at the bar. Usually most places  HH are weekdays but I love that Bulla also offers HH weekends too! I've come with a group to HH here a few times. Around 5 on Fridays bar is usually already filled or almost filled. Drinks are always well made. I love the Moscow  mules here. I'm not a bourbon drinker at all and I really liked the" bullfighter" because it's pretty balanced. You taste the bourbon just  enough.

I had this place when I was in high school and it was amazing at the time. I then had it again during my late college years and something happened. Either the management changed or they switched foods or something. The food was horrid when I went last.  

Would not suggest this place, better places for this type of food in Saint Louis.

Been here a couple of times late nite inside of 30th Street Station. Coffee was dangerously hot as hell but on point. Getting a donut late night is a crap shoot. This is about the 3rd time & not one donut. They were making their hot sandwiches tho. But be careful, make sure you get what you ordered before you walk away. The guy couldn't get 2 orders right tonight. That's about it.

Don't think your getting away from the horrible job you did to my vehicle and charging me over $5000.00 when u quoted an estimate between $4000 - $4500 but once you heard i was taking out a loan you went and took as much money as you can. ROBERT YOU'RE A SCAMMER. I'll be posting up picture,videos and the receipt of the amount that MF charged me. Had my vehicle for almost a month and seems like they were rushing to fix my vehicle. found many problems. Missing caps, misplaced/missing screws, car returned to me and let me drove it out of their parking lot without replacing the thermostat, and said its normal, why the fuck was my engine temp way up there. ROBERT never replaced the thermostat and almost cause a major problem on my vehicle. ROBERT IS THE BIGGEST SCAMMER THERE "WATCH OUT FOR HIM" attorney on hand collecting evidence. Don't know how this place is 5 stars overrated. 1 star from the wife, daughter and I. Its time to exposed these scammers and this horrible establishment. More picture and video coming soon, pretty sure i know where i got scam and paid over $5000

60 1 star review because its my opinion, why TF you care about my 60 1 star review?instead worry about your salesman thats scamming customer. I'm complaining and you want to sound rude, Doesn't sound like a place where I'll bring my vehicle back to fix the repair your mechanics made. I will continue to leave 1 star reviews. I'm a human being and i have every right to leave a 1 star reviews just like your buddy robert who is now a customer. Dont ask me stupid question.

Worst experience ever! Do NOT go here!! I don't even know where to begin. We came for a birthday party, which was booked weeks ago, and they gave our entire section to the wrong party! It took 30 minutes to finally find a server. The food took an hour to come out and the manager said they aren't taking orders for 30 minutes because they are backed up. There was kids all over and even by the bar! Shouldn't kids be gone by 9?? We ended up being sat by the bar area but they couldn't figure out how to turn the TVs for the game! I would never ever return here. Not even if they sent me a gift card.

This was actually my first time trying Greek food and I have to say the Greek food served here was pretty good. They first served us an appetizer, which was very filling on its own right. Afterwards, the food was served. I had the Gemista (which was vegetarian and GF according to the menu). It was a large portion and I definitely had more than enough to take home. The rice was especially the one I liked the best- the herbs and spices made the rice not bland and tasty. 

The staff were very friendly and nice. I overheard one of the waitresses talking to another customer and it seemed as though it was very recently that most of the (main) staff had come to the States. It is truly admirable to start a business in a foreign country, so I give them major props. However, that meant that certain staff members were limited when speaking English. When I flagged down a staff to ask about something, he redirected me to another staff member stating he did not speak English. After, I realized that the more fluent staff members were the ones taking the orders and overall speaking with the customers. Because of this, there wasn't much of a problem in terms of communication.

Overall, I highly recommend this place and I would love to come back again.
great covid measures! nice dividers between each groups. such a great experience especially for kids. i love the yum yum sauce with the hibachi and the best roll is the filet mignon roll!

This is a great addition to Fountain Square, and man do they know how to cook fish! I cannot emphasize enough, if you like seafood, go here for dinner. The food is delicious, the prices are rational, and the best part... on Tuesday you get 2 for 1 wine! They have a wide selection, something for absolutely every pallet. I cannot wait to go back!

Green Eggs Cafe is CASH ONLY! I don't feel this fact is well advertised. Despite this slight inconvenience, my experience at Green Eggs Cafe was wonderful. They have an extensive menu with both savory and sweet options. The portions are very large so if you are unable to decide on a single dish, I would highly recommend splitting both a savory and sweet dish with a friend. My friend and I ordered the Kitchen Sink, the Guacamole and Pepper Benedict, and the Creme Brûlée French Toast. I look forward to going back again to try their Cookie Dough Stuffed French Toast!

I love to see vegan options other than veggies at pizza places! I was excited to try their pizza with Impossible meat. Our waitress was very monotone and seemed inconvenienced to greet us/take our drink order. I asked our waitress for light cheese sprinkled on top of our pizza like I saw in a previous customers helpful photo on Yelp. I don't like a lot of Daiya cheese on my pizza. The pizza arrived with a lot of cheese and barely any sauce. (The sauce that was on there was delicious.) Next time I'd just say no cheese to play it safe, and I hope that waitress is having a better day today.

I will not be going back.  I took a bridesmaids dress with drink stains on it.  The stains were not removed after cleaning and the dress now has deep etched press marks in the delicate fabric.  If they had just returned it to me in the same condition, I'd be a little more favorable, but the dress is in worse shape than before.  I took it one block over to Sparkle cleaners and the people there were much nicer and were able to get the stains out.

This review is embarrassingly belated, as I was in NOLA at the end of April for my sister's bachelorette party and only getting to this review now :( 

I came twice in a couple of days-- once for lunch with a bigger group then again for happy hour with just one other person the next day.  (Specifically to try the crab beignets, which were not available at lunchtime the day before! :)

Food Pros (imho):
-- Sizzling Oysters R'evolution, Smoked Bienville Butter
-- Fried oysters (side)
-- My 1/2 order of pasta was AMAZE... it was seasonal and no longer on the online menu, perhaps a Fazzoletti? I'm remembering fried sage and a brown butter..?  Our party (of 5) agreed that it was the best entree of the table.  Although my friend's R'evolution Burger was pretty darn good too.
-- Crab beignets (next day @ HH)

Food Cons:
-- Creole Louisiana Snapping Turtle Soup: Deviled Quail Eggs, Madeira (my first try of turtle soup & wasn't blown away)
-- The preparation of veal on the menu at the time was not good.  That's too bad bc if a baby cow is going to be taken out for my meal, it had better be good pretty darn orgasmic.  Anything less and i may swear off veal forever!

Service was great!  It was a bit chilly for us Northerners as we had dressed for the outside un-ac'd weather.  When I asked the staff (we were the only ones seated in the dining space close to the kitchen) if they were able to stop the cold air blowing down on us, not only did they do so, but also brought over beautiful shawls for us to wear until the temp went up.  First time ever in a restaurant I have experienced this... true southern hospitality!!!

All in all, this was a great restaurant experience!  Would I say it was my best for my first visit EVER to NOLA for a short 4 days?  That distinction goes to my next review.... ;)

I have absolutely nothing to complain about the Florissant Ashley Homestore. 
     My sales associate, Jill, was professional, friendly, patient and helpful without being overbearing or pushy. She understood what I was looking for and our budget. 
     The delivery personnel were equally professional and efficient. They arrived well within the scheduled delivery window. 
     I am happy with my purchase and pleased with the whole experience.

I'm going to upgrade my review based on some truly delicious Lamb Vindaloo I recently had. The gentleman who recommended the place to me originally has stopped ordering from the buffet, claiming the menu was better. Now, don't get me wrong, Saffron was fine the first time, but it was legitimately good this time. 

Their Lamb was tangy, very spicy (and this at only 3/5 heat) and a plentiful serving - plenty of tender, medium rare lamb, good salty potatoes, and lots of gravy - I can eat about a bushel of rice with the sauce if given the chance. And their naan had improved - not as soggy as last time, with good flavor. All in all, a better experience. And prices are still quite reasonable, even on a weekend, for very large helpings. Worth checking out - but if you don't see what you want on the buffet (or, maybe, even if you do) consider choosing from the menu.

I rely on a certain level of service and cleanliness for KOA campgrounds.  This place is a real S_ _ _ hole!  I have seen cleaner gas station bathrooms.  The bathroom was nauseating and beyond filthy.  They close ALL services when the office closes at 6:30!!!  WHAT?  NO going into the POOL, no purchasing of any kind, no use of the dump station.... at 6:30 on a summer evening??  Crazy!  They don't open the office until 9:00am!!!!!  We wanted an early start but couldn't use the dump station until 9 when they open the office.  Grrr!  Few of the pads are level.  There is no night security.  Some dummy left their dog while they , presumably, went gambling.... the dog barked NON-STOP for hours on end!!  Oh and the train right next to the campground blares its whistle!  Wifi...forget about it.  It is impossible even sitting in front of the office.  HUH, not a good stop... HATED IT!!!

The Dali is one of my favorite museums.  My only gripe is that it is cheaper to go to the MET in NY.  That said there are coupons available and student/college discounts available.

The free parking is slim so go early in the day or two hours before the museum closes to snag a free spot. It costs $5 to park in the garage so bring cash.  As far as the complaints on the gift shop prices... Get over it.  All gift shops are overpriced!

The collection at the Dali is amazing and it changes out frequently. I highly recommend going on the free guided tour or picking up an audio headset.  I have learned so many cool things about Dali and his paintings through the guided tours.

If you live in the Tampa Bay area and you haven't been to the Dali: GO!!!  You have to travel all the way to Europe to see the great museums of Michelangelo and Van Gogh.  Dali is local.  Appreciate the greatness of this local museum!!!
Clean as could be awesome couldn't ask for a better place. Staff is great always in a good mood

I have been coming to this place since I was a kid. (The 80's) and still love this place so much. The decor is the same as it was back then. The Jelly Donut is a simple no frills, fast, easy donut (try the fritters. So delicious) or sandwich (one is enough to split with someone) that is priced super fair. Best midtown donut spot.
Some of the best food ever. Hands down. The farm burger is a beautiful and complex creation that never disappoints.

I really loved the tour! It was self guided and lots of reading and interesting facts! Kinda wish they had even more floors. The hosts on each floor were so kind and knowledgeable. Loved every minute of it and would recommend one of the paid tours if you'd like more facts!

MIDDEN GEM!!!!!!
This is my favorite place ever!!!! I found this place in January & went 2 days in a row back to back . The service is amazing. The restaurant is the perfect size & cute. Everyone is so nice & genuine. The food never disappoints. I go here alot & ive never been dissatisfied with any of my meals at all. Everything tastes amazing & this is coming from a Dominican! I highly recommend.
Such a cute place! Every floor was adorable. Great for drinks snd brunch. I wish they had more vegetarian options  but it was overall amazing. Great service. So  beautiful!

Usually when a place ends in "burger" I discount any appeal it might have to my vegan tastes. So when Tom M. said we'd go here for vegan milkshakes, I was quite intrigued.

They have a bunch of vegan flavors (not just one or two) which is fantastic. When I came the first time, we got a "small" fries (for research, obvs) and it was fantastic. Coming in at $2, it was massively tasty, and they have a bunch of sauces to choose from, in addition to having ketchup and malt vinegar on the table (love!). 

So I came back the next day, to try out their seitan sandwich, which apparently rotates on the chalk board. It was delicious, if extremely filling (seitan will do that), and of course we had fries. 4 stars, will eat again (and again ...).

Other deets: Cash only, art supplies at your table (to make your "sketches" of course), and you sit down at will and wait to be served, even though it kind of looks like an order at the counter place. Menus on the table by the wall.

Pretty darn good pizza. Generous toppings, which means if you order sausage and pepperoni it's going to be a little greasy. Friendly service. If you have leftovers they wrap them individually for you. Will be back
The cocktails are really awesome, not only are they strong but they are also priced right!  The food came out fast everything was tasty and the portions enough for two to share!

Talk about an outdoor experience!!!
This is it, Tucson weather with a nice cold drink, awesome view, cool people 
You gotta come and experience the sunset Mountain view.

If you want to see a wide variety of New Orleans, this is the tour to do. You literally ride all over. And I will say that even if you aren't an avid biker, it's easy to do. They're on beach cruiser type bikes, so it's an easy ride. 

We rode all around the different hoods, but it started in the Marigny. We were able to cover a lot of ground (teehee). I loved seeing the different historic spots that were pointed out and it was interesting that they took us down in the 9th Ward were Katrina hit the hardest. I found it very interesting that some houses that were marked up from search and rescue kept the markings on their doors/walls as kind of a badge of honor.

I also thought it was cute that our tour guide took us into his home. It was like no other home I'd ever seen before. Quite honestly, I loved looking at all the houses and different architecture on the tour. 

The tour guides were very friendly and welcomed any questions asked. If you're wanting to see a whole lotta the city, this is the way to go!

Oh Metro, what a long and strange relationships we've had. With no lesbian/queer lady bars left in Indy, your second floor is the last similar space remaining. There's a patio upstairs, karaoke at different times in the weeks (I think Tuesdays), TVs for odd movie/CSPAN/debate/music video watching, and three pool tables on the top floor (when they aren't moved for dancing).

The drinks are decently priced with regular specials worth considering. The bartenders/waiters have been good help in the past recommending good new things to try - be it shots bobs or full cocktails. 

The food is good and in small enough portions where you can try several things without being overwhelmed. I recommend trying a trio of sliders! 

Go have a well poured drink and a snack and enjoy!

Once again I want to emphasize this store is the best store in the state. They get tier 0 releases meaning they get shoes that other stores in the area can't/won't get. Also they carry BBC and Staple. They honestly have an interesting variety of shoes ranging from New Balance, Asics, Saucony, and Nike/Jordan.

Another great thing is that it's a local business and unlike other "chain" stores the don't have rigged raffles or confusing release procedures.

This place really blew me away. Colorful and vibrant decor and little items for display and sale... The food excellent! Delicious! But what really blew me away was how genuinely NICE the women who were running everything were. Every moment of their time was spent trying to make the space, food, and environment a good experience for their guests.  This place is a treasure!

Union Jack has always been a staple in the heart of Broad Ripple. With the new location directly across the street from the old, I was skeptical of what changed with the menu, ambiance, etc. Fortunately, nothing has changed! The food is still good and the ambiance is a cozier, brighter feel than the old location. One side is family friendly and a smaller bar set-up on the other. There are plenty of TVs for the sports lover - but not chaotic and distracting like at a regular sports bar. I'm looking forward to the summer months to enjoy the large patio. I selected the staple fish and chips. The fish filets are breaded with a tasty seasoning and still flakey in the middle. The fries have a crisp seasoning to them that make them disappear from your plate. We split the spinach and artichoke con queso as an appetizer. The dip is served with large, warm pita bread and tortilla chips. Rather than just a regular spin dip, this has a slight kick to it! Yum!

I want to start off every morning at Rise'n Roll Bakery! I got a massive cinnamon roll, an apple fritter and coffee to go. Everything was delicious! The staff was friendly and got my order pulled together very quickly. They have so many doughnut options as well as other baked goods. If you're looking for a bakery downtown check out  Rise'n Roll!

Awful place. It's dirty. Had two birthday parties there for my kids when they first opened. I'd say it was average. However I've been there for open jumps and never again. The staff does not monitor the participants at all. The parents are just as bad as the kids there.  One occasion I witnessed a boy that was being beat up by another and the parents were cheering the actor on!  The little boy did nothing wrong. I felt like I was watching dog fighting with all the cheering. And no staff was around to help!  I do have to say the little boy being beaten up was white and the actors and parents were African American. I'm sure if this were reverse you'd see it on the news. I've also had a party where a mom just dropped off her two kids at my party. We didn't even know who they were!  I let them stay to be nice but even the staff had no idea what or who these ppl were! Do not go there.

This family owned business is a easy to miss, if you aren't looking for it.  However, if you want to know where we dined last Christmas - it was HERE!!!!

We took a leisurely drive late Christmas morning, enjoying the fact that parking lots were empty, and people were taking time to be at home, with one another -- when what did we discover!?  A beacon of the neon sign, lit through the windows, inviting us to have a holiday meal and our favorite Mexican spot this side of the Rio Grande!

There aren't many places that welcome you every time you walk through the door - but El Gallo Jiro IS one of them.

You won't find better (authentic!) Mexican food at any of the chain restaurants (sorry, Qdoba and Chevy's).  Their menu items are reasonably priced with nice sized portions, and great staff (husband, wife, sister-in-law, and son).

It's a hole-in-the-wall with about 8 tables indoors.  But out back they opened a great space to relax and dine.  With coolers full of cerveza, Jarritos, and south-of-the-border Coca Cola - made with pure can sugar, you can enjoy a delicious drink with your meal.

You'll enjoy every item they serve.  I prefer their tacos (that way I can have several), with the pastor and barbacoa being my absolute favorites.  I can't help but mention they also make great horchatas!

If you're lucky, one of the locals will already have put money in the Jukebox, playing their favorite Mexican classics.  You won't be disappointed!  It's just off I-70 Eastbound, 2 blocks east of Hwy 111.

They said the soonest we could get in for the reservation was 9:30 pm. We came in and the place was empty. Are server was very rude and kept rolling her eyes. We asked why they didn't have the thanksgiving meal and they said they ran out and notified everyone. We never got a text message. They also said turkey was "way too expensive" highly do not recommend this place. Opal sands, oceans prime, etc. is way better. Save your money and time. I really liked this place but not anymore.

Lovely location in Meridian. 

I ate outside on the patio overlooking a common green grass area. Kids were playing, people were happy, no masks were needed on this outside area during Covid in June of 2021.

It was a good day.

The fish and chips were well prepared. The beer was dark and cold as I like it.

Only one thing kept me from giving them five stars. When my bill arrived the server had already included my tip putting 30% in the tip area. 

Now, I had formed a policy of tipping heavy because of the stress of Covid and how it hurt so many individuals in the restaurant business. But I like to be the one to choose what I will put as a tip and not have it placed there before me. And as it was only me, it was not a fixed gratuity.

So instead of choosing to give this person 30% which I would have probably done, I only included a 10% tip. I let it speak for itself and hopefully the server got the message. But if not, she's angry and so be it.

A tip is just that...extra money for quality of service, chosen by the patron.

I have not returned to this restaurant.

After the holidays, I was expecting the worst to be honest. Figured I'd be there for a while, as it turned out my tire was pretty quick to swap with no real wait time to buy "new." They found me a great deal and I was out in no time. Awesome customer service on the phone initially and the guy out front was super helpful too. I appreciate it greatly.

My girlfriend and I love this place. It's our two year anniversary today and we are piggin out on some sushi. 

I got the pekking duck. Ghost is pumped about it
I would go a long way to have some of their famous juices and drinks. They are beyond delectable and surpirse my tongue with an array of flavors i have never experienced every time!
Ate there yesterday definitely recommend signing up for the waitlist while you're walking over so you don't have to wait long. Hot chicken sandwich and the French Toast bites were delicious.
my friend went with me and she got an infection in her toe. The staff was not very friendly.  Not a relaxing experience at all

My husband has been working for Cheesecake Factory of and on for 10 years. I have found that Cheesecake is a place that has food which you can consistently expect to be wonderful.
I love their food and am never disappointed.
I had a 6:15 appointment.  I was still waiting at 6:45 with no apology or explanation. I left.  I won't be back.  It's a shame because I have had a good experience in the past.

I had an excruciatingly bad experience at the Party City on Veterans Blvd. I wanted some napkins, plates, & forks for an upcoming event and had spent a good bit of time at home on the internet researching options. I thought the Party City Value Packs were a great price and had exactly the colors I wanted. I stopped by the store after work, thinking it would take about 2 minutes to pick up the products and go. However, they did not have the Value Packs anywhere in the store (although the website had said nothing about them being an online-only item). I was able to order them on the store computer and get free shipping, which was awesome, but the store computer was slower than a 90s dial-up connection covered in molasses in slow motion. It took me literally 35 minutes to do my simple order. It also randomly re-added things into my "cart" that I had deleted out of there. The customer service was awful. The cashier checked out my purchases about as fast as the computer functioned, and came to a dead halt in the middle of my checkout to have a detailed conversation with a customer who had just walked in about her return. I asked 2 different workers to speak to the manager and express my concerns about the computer. The first one did nothing to put me in touch with the manager, and the 2nd one only did so after another long wait. All the manager had to say was "Yeah, it's slow." All told, I was in the store an hour and a half, after a long day at work, just to get some napkins, plates, and forks. Party City has great products but this particular location was an extremely frustrating experience. From now on I will just order what I need online. It's worth paying the shipping.

Horrible customer service. Placed an order and waited for nearly an hour to never get any food. Place wasn't too busy so I couldn't imagine what was taking so long. Finally I asked the lady as she began to mop the status of my order she simply claimed they probably lost the ticket and could only refund me my money. Knew I was going out on a limb ordering here. I will not be returning.

Efficient, quick, and half the price of dealer and Costco tire replacement! 
They recommended an alignment and had that done quickly too!
Thanks

Company did a very poor job managing our lawn/landscaping.  Our grass was brown, and our palms looked pathetic.  We have since switched companies, and the difference is remarkable.

In addition, the customer service provided by ETM is terrible.  The people working in the office are rude and completely inappropriate.

Much better options - avoid this company.

We had a mini-wedding in Nashville this weekend and had our pre-wedding, welcome to Nashville dinner for our guests at Martin's. I was initially bummed that we couldn't get into the Downtown location, but the mid-town spot was fantastic! We had one of their private dining rooms where you can choose from a pre-set menu. We got the ribs, brisket and pulled pork and wow, was it delicious! We chose the baked beans, macaroni and slaw as sides and the pecan pie (get this!) and banana pudding for dessert. The staff was friendly, efficient and accommodating. We had to take our desserts to go because they close at nine and we were too busy enjoying our main dinner to realize how late it got. They helped us package up 'to-go' boxes and everyone enjoyed a late night snack back at their hotels. Really a wonderful experience and everyone was super pleased with their dinner. Thank you, Martin's for a special wedding weekend kick-off! Highly recommend.
The pizza was thin crust and light. Great spot for a pizza and a beer. Classic New England interior. Glad they are on the 600 block. Can't wait to try all the combinations.

I was craving a cheeseburger today but did not want to pay the $12-15 that so many places are charging so I went online to find burger reviews.

Found this place and thought, why not? I am familiar with Bloomin' Brands (Outback, Bonefish, Carraba's) and they usually do a good job.

Parking was easy. The place was pretty full and LOUD. The lady at the register was obviously new and trying to figure out how to enter the order but she was friendly and trying hard so ...shrug. We were all new at something at one time. All the staff were very friendly and welcoming.

You order at the counter, take a seat and they bring it to you. I ordered a regular cheeseburger and fries. The order came out exactly right. The meat has an odd taste - like maybe hickory grill seasoning? Not unpleasant, just unexpected. There was a very small pile of fries and at first I thought "that's not enough!" but I could not eat them all. They were great.

All was good and filling - and less than 10 bucks. Better and cheaper than 5 Guys down the street!

I will be back to try other menu items.

Tried the prime rib special tonight, what a shame! They had a great cut of meat and served it luke warm. The baked potato would not even melt the cold butter. We will probably give it another try as the food was top quality, just cold.

Had a warranty for LG refrigerator VTC came out to check the issue; found what parts were needed.  Second trip came out and installed new parts, was on time and did a great job.  Then we had another warranty issue, Leo came back checked the issue and ordered another part.  Once the part was delivered Leo installed and did a great job!  The office personal at VTC was courteous and responsive.  The hardest part of all this was dealing with Home Depot's warranty department they were extremely difficult. We had no issues with VTC, only purchasing the LG refrigerator and dealing with Warranty from Home Depot! I would not hesitate to recommend Video Tech Center.

I have gone to Tribeca for about three years as it is literally across the street from my school, The University of Tampa. Today was my last day there as I am graduating. I have to say that it will be hard to find another place that offered such excellent service. Everyone there is friendly, helpful, and experienced when it came to what hair styles or products I needed. I have had quite a few stylists, as they moved on, but every one of them listened to what I wanted and followed through. Thank you to everyone at Tribeca ColorSalon for your services!

The folks in this place are so very nice! They have updated the space and made it much more comfortable. I get the lunch tuna wrap special at least once a week, and it's my favorite! Had a quesadilla last week and it was also great, and giant! Salads are very large for a small, I can get almost 2 meals out of it. I don't have dinners here, so I can't review their entrees, but from my experiences, they've been awesome.
Great job on the new radio install and the window tinting. The owners and staff are very polite and helpful.

there service person is a bully and a know it all. He could only lecture me about his experience  and would not listen to my issue. He was so rude that when I asked him to stop telling about how he would not guarantee  the work and to please just start looking at my a/c unit he got so insulted he walked off and left. I tried and tried to get him to overlook and start over, forgive any
bad feelings and let it go, to be men. But a true bully he went to the owner and I think lied.
I bought my a/c from airpro thirteen years ago, I have had them service it yearly, a good customer.  The unit has never been able to cool the home on hot days, hence the service call. I now think they are the reason it wont cool the home, either to small or leaking air? I will call
someone else to find out why it wont cool, I will never think airpro anymore. Brandon Gusman

They acted like they didn't want us there. Our rooms weren't ready when we got there after 6 plus hours on a bus. Had to wait almost 2 more hours for our rooms. The card I was given with the complimentary $5 of gambling money didn't work. Bingo games were not adequately explained to the new people who had never played there before. The people who work there are rude, the place is dirty, and my phone was stolen and security could care less. Wouldn't make a report...save your money and go elsewhere.

Staff was hustling to get tables cleaned and food served but was not quick enough with service. Kitchen was very slow and the food was not as tasty to the palate. This is more like a cafe spot that you would go to as a last resort. There are plenty of other delicious spots to try besides here. Not worth the wait!

HIDDEN GEM ALERT!

The Chef's Hut is not easy to find ... but now that we have, we'll definitely be back. The cinnamon roll "appetizer" was to die for. I chose the Chicken Fried Steak Burrito. It was HUGE! The coffee was perfect to me. All in all, such a good experience.

Heads up: it's a small cafe, and they have limited staff. Be ready to be patient: it's worth it! Yum!

Buyer be ware on this place.... many bait and switches going on. They offer a happy hour from 3:00 to 7:00 but that only applies if you're sitting at the bar. Even though it doesn't state that on the website... the dinner menu has a 20%+ uplift from what is posted on the website. The service was decent and the food prep was good but certainly not worth the significant upcharges. Waaaaay too many good steakhouses not to mention restaurants in and around downtown Tampa to waste your time here.

Very unhappy with them!  When they  gave me a hybrid, I told them I wanted to cancel the prepaid gas bc I wouldn't need it.   I was told they would remove the charge for prepaid gas when I returned, but when I did they refused.  Boils down to the first guy being too lazy to fix the charge and the second guy being unwilling to listen or try to help!

While the people at Calm Community Acupuncture were kind and probably knowledgeable, I didn't care for the atmosphere. They have a no-questions-asked sliding scale, which was appealing. However, what wasn't clear to me was that I would be on a recliner in a room with multiple clients who come and go at various times, speaking in whispers to the practitioner. I'm sure this is why they are able to charge so little; they make it up in volume. They were busy, so this arrangement obviously suits many people, but it was not good for me. I found it very distracting to hear all the movement and whispering during a treatment that was supposed to be relaxing. I will go elsewhere where I will have to pay more, but sometimes you get what you pay for. Anyway, I think it is important for folks to know this is how this particular place operates.

I discovered Revel kitchen a couple years ago while I was doing a Whole30 diet, which is quite restrictive and makes it nearly impossible to eat out. I was happy to learn that they have several whole30 compliant options. Revel Kitchen quickly became one of my go-to's, and it still is, diet or not! What I really love about them is the quality and consistency. They food is always fresh, delicious, prepared on time when I order ahead, and I know what to expect every time. I have literally never ordered something I didn't like. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly. I'd give six stars if I could!

Not your typical "chinese" menu, this is our "go to" asain (other than Thai) take out place; have not eaten at the location but the food is quite good and they get our order right. 

If you like fish, the Thai lime steamed fish is tasty and a large portion. The salt and pepper calamari, the wings, and the egg rolls are usually in our order, and their noodle dishes are always well cooked. 

We've run through a bunch of their entrees and have been happy with everything. Same with the wor won ton and hot and sour soups. 

What's worth noting is the food is consistant; a lot of asian/chinese places seem to wobble. Keep up the good work.

Biscuit Love is like Pancake Pantry. It's a restaurant that focuses on a specific menu item, but has a huge draw to locals and tourists alike. There is always a line here, at least when I've visited, so plan accordingly unless you line up at the door prior to opening. Part of the reason for the long wait is because Biscuit Love is a fast casual restaurant, but don't stress as there is no table service. You order everything prior to taking a seat. As people leave, they let more people in. With that, the line moves at a respectable pace.

As with the name, Biscuit Love's specialty are their biscuits. These are buttermilk biscuits, the layered kind, baked to perfection. I especially like these kind of biscuits (not to say rolled, drop, or other types aren't as good) because of the way I eat them/pair them. You see, layered biscuits are especially good with gravy. I peel off a layer or two, set it on my plate, and then scoop a spoonful of gravy on it. Not only do I efficiently and expertly have the perfect flaky biscuit layer to gravy ratio, it ensures nothing is left after the first bite. Of course, this method works great with jams, jellies, etc.

The menu here is simple but it is a bit pricey, even for a breakfast/brunch restaurant. I dropped $33 for my meal alone. Most of them feature their signature biscuits (including sweet appetizers) but there is a small menu for those who would rather not have a biscuit with your breakfast/brunch. Their main entrees are all big enough for one person and can satiate even people with bigger appetites. I was tempted to order 2 entrees but I settled on the "Princess" entree, a side of sausage gravy, and The Bloody (a bloody mary).

The Princess is a Nashville-style spicy boneless chicken thigh, topped with pickles, mustard, and honey on top of a buttermilk biscuit. What they don't tell you (unless you've been here before) is with the Princess, there's another biscuit on your plate separate from what the fried chicken sits on. So technically you get 2 biscuits.
