What does one do with an extra biscuit? Add sausage gravy of course. Ordering a biscuit & sausage gravy entree cost $9.50 by itself, so I saved $5.50 by doing it my way. Of course, all my money went out the window when I ordered The Bloody, which was good but not worth the $10 price tag.

So how was it? The Princess was crunchy, juicy, tender, with a nice blend of spiciness, sweet, and bitter/sour all mixed in together. The spiciness is very mild, so don't feel like you're going to need several glasses of water. I liked that the chicken thigh was deboned. It made cutting into it much easier and it guaranteed me layers of chicken + biscuit with every bite.

The sausage gravy was on point. I *LOVE* sausage gravy. In my opinion, it's the only way to have white gravy. Their sausage gravy is almost as good as mine. It's savory, salty, meaty, & rich-enough-to-clog-your-arteries good. Pair that with their flaky, buttery, biscuits, you have a Southern breakfast staple.
My favorite cocktail is the bloody mary. Honestly, it's just a plain bloody mary that didn't warrant the $10 price tag. For $10, I expect a near-kitchen sink type bloody mary. The pickled peppadew was sweet (like a red bell pepper) and pepperoncini add the tang/subtle heat profile. It was rather small too, so I feel I should have gotten a different cocktail.

If you've never been to Biscuit Love, I would definitely give it a try. The line is a bit intimidating but honestly, it's not terribly bad. The food is great despite being a bit pricey, but then again, it's in the heart of The Gulch. You're paying to be there no matter where you go.

I've been going here for years, but I have to say I won't be going back again after today's visit. The last two times I went, my massage therapist aggressively haggled with me over the tip. I usually tip $10 on a $50 massage, and the therapist gave me a hard time the last two times. 

It really ruined the relaxation I got from the massage to have to haggle over a tip. On top of that, the usual $50 massage suddenly became $60 when I wasn't tipping what she wanted. I'd rather go somewhere where I pay more and don't have to deal with that.

The food seems to generally be great, although I wish they had more options for picky people like me. Service is excellent, and the place is small (read: cozy or cramped, take your pick).

Disclaimer: I'm not a huge breakfast/brunch person, but my boyfriend is. I'm also not the biggest fan of cold food, read: sandwiches. Therefore, I had a hard time finding something I'd like off Cafe La Maude's menu, but I definitely see the potential for people who like eggs, aren't lactose intolerant, aren't allergic to fruit, etc (I know, I have a lot of problems!).

I got the steak frite sandwich, which was pretty good, but nothing to shout about. In fact, the bread was pretty hard and tired out my jaw, so I took half of it home and heated it up--it tasted infinitely better then! I especially liked the combination of steak, avocado, and mustard aioli. The fries were great and flavorful--but not in a normal, salted way! On the other hand, my boyfriend got the french toast (Berrylicious Pain Perdu), and it was so. beautiful. And he said it tasted as amazing as it looked! (Picture posted.) He definitely wants to come back for brunch again.

The service was excellent, and everyone was really friendly. They don't really assign a specific server to you, so the waitresses frequently check up on you to make sure you have everything you need--especially before you get your food. When I was there, people came out of the back and talked to customers they seemed to know.

The space is a little cramped, and the high-top tables in the front each have a tall chair and a spot on a long booth that goes against the wall. I imagine walk-ins are best for two. Oh, and you can definitely hear everyone's conversations.

I went on the cemetery tour with my friends and their kids.  My friends and I are from New Orleans and we thought we already knew a lot of information about the cemeteries.  Our tour guide was Thorn, and we learned so much from him!  He was so relaxed and easy to listen to! As locals, we had a lot of questions, and Thorn knew all the answers!  We had a great time, and the two hours flew by!  As a native New Orleanian, I enjoyed the tour and all the extra information that Thorn gave us.  Highly recommend taking this tour with Thorn!!

After waiting in line to get in for 1.5 hours (with no communication or orderly sense to the wait; some people putting their name down, some being seated immediately, and others skipping the line entirely) we were finally seated at a table that had been open for the past 30 minutes. We requested to be seated outside when a table opened and we were told we were at the top of the list. Immediately, we ordered drinks, queso/chips, and our meals. Over the next hour, our drinks were delicious but everything else was a complete disaster. We watched many tables leave from outside and new groups go outside. Despite reminding the host and waitress kindly, they avoided us and when confronted they reassured us without following through. Our queso took an hour and 10 minutes to arrive at which point the queso was oily, crispy on the side, and impenetrable to reach; our chips crumbling trying to reach what we thought would be soft queso but was thickened strips of cheese. Kindly, we asked for a new order of queso because we were unable to enjoy the one before us. At this point, we were frustrated. After waiting for so long we had no food and were not being moved outside. I talked to the host, she told me they had a clear table she was about to bring us outside. 15 minutes went by and still no new queso, no outdoor table, and our food (2 paninis and a quesadilla) was probably an hour+ from arriving. I decided to get the check, which again took 10+ minutes until I approached the host where she had charged us for 2 Quesos. After the fix, I immediately paid. We talked with the manager who was extremely unprofessional. As someone who has worked in the industry, I understand things can become busy but communication is key. Rather than explaining or giving some clarification to the chaos or even apologizing, he became defensive and blamed the rush (that was no longer there after 2+ hours). When expressing frustration with the cost and experience not aligning he was shocked yet offered no kind resolution or peace offering of any sort.  


I felt extremely bad for the staff. Clearly, there is a larger issue at hand on a business level. Others around us felt similar, many walking out and others closing their checks early and verbally expressing a lack of tip. The bartender and our waitress were kind and working hard for everyone. The host and manager were extremely unprofessional and lacked communication completely. Very disappointing as the view was gorgeous, design trendy, and menu glamorous with lots of potential.

Have never been a fan of Primos once I realized how little Philly-style hoagie building knowledge these people exhibit. But my wife was hankering to have a hoagie on New Year's Day and every other place nearby was closed. I ordered their Old World Italian, a whole sandwich which ended up being $30! It was absolutely horrible and consisted of basically prosciutto and cheese with lettuce, tomato and onions. Someone else may have liked it but I can tell you that 3 of us had some and all thought it was horrible. I honestly do not recommend Primos, and this location in particular. Sorry not sorry, do better if you want a decent review!

At the FIRST sighting at a dolphin in the river, the captain circled around for at least 15 minutes, hoping the guests would encounter a "dolphin experience"! Although it (singularly) surfaced again for a brief moment, a few more times, I personally felt as though this was a complete waste of time. I understand, this may not happen on every cruise, but I would have liked to take the chance of sighting another, whom may have stayed closer to the surface for viewing and/or photo opportunities. The beach was enjoyable. Found a few decent shells to take home. Comparing the discount given from the boarding pass to the prices charged in the gift shop or diner, we chose not to even use our coupon, nor purchase anything. The narrative from the captain reminded me of a washed-up swanky strip-joint DJ. Hard to understand at times and expecting him to announce the next performer as Diamond or Mercedes or ...? Although the price was okay per person, I expected more than we received.

Great place for dental work... Very informative and answers all questions. I like it because they won't do any unnecessary work. Everyone is very nice! If you are looking for a dentist.. this is the place to go!

I really use to love this place but a lot has changed. 1)The service is polite but tremendously slow and often ignores the customers which is very frustrating. 2)There is a 18% gratuity on all orders now. I usually tip 15% but 18% is high when service is poor and you might have just had tea. 3)The hookah shisha tobacco is often not what you ordered but even if you are aware and complain it will not be replaced without charge for their mistake. 4) The hummus is amazing.
              I really use to love this place for its atmosphere and good selection of starbuzz shisha however when i have to pay 18% more for it and not actually get what I ordered I can go elsewhere; honestly the shisha tobacco is usually $25 for 250 grams and you are paying them $16.99 plus 18% gratuity for about 2 grams if that.
              I do not think I will return.

Terrible service. I recently moved here and I was looking for a good place where to trim my hair, TRIM, just TRIM I don't know the name of the person who did my hair but she made a disaster I couldn't even wear my hair straight because of how bad It look I had to wear it in a ponytail until I went to another place and pay an extra $50 to get it fix. I won't recommend this place at all.

My dad came to visit recently and I took him here.  The waiter kept telling us that it would be just a few more minutes.  Well, almost 2 hours later we got our food, now, to go. My bacon wrapped shrimp was over cooked and dry.  My dad's meal wasn't what he ordered.  I can't positively say that I will not be back to this place. We would have gotten a better meal at Taco Bell.

Although the store I'm sure for their customers is a nice local spot they enjoy, I'm not a fan! The quaint items they sell along the treats may be good but my reason for the low score is based on service and product received using the 'Too good to go' app. This app was designed to help stores and restaurants that serve a range of items from baked goods to fast food and everything in between to possibly avoid total loss on food that wasn't sold. In placing an order you should receive leftover or unused supplies that can help create or supply a meal. On the site it's listed as surplus food. 

Now to Alif Brew. When I showed my order on the app the counter person said 'oh another one I thought we only had one'. She then went into a back room for a few. I took this time to peruse the store. They have nice novelty items and small food items from the Middle East. This was a good start and I decided to return for a $50 Turkish coffee set until.......I was called to pick up my 'surplus surprise' that cost $3.99 and 5 miles of driving. For $3.99 I received ONE DAY OLD CROISSANT! I can get a SAME DAY FRESH CROISSANT for $2.50 ANYWHERE!

Im so upset because this store look so exciting. My planned return WILL
NOT HAPPEN! If this process is designed to save and possibly create a new set of customers Alif Brew has lost me and more I'm sure!

I was so excited to eat, I almost forgot to take a picture! 

Loved my first experience this morning at Inclined Burger and brews. The addition of a small menu to breakfast items on weekends is a great idea, options for anyone. The backcountry breakfast was your standard breakfast,  but tasty. The frosted flake French toast was the star.. the perfect crunch and berry compote was outstanding. The only con was I think there could have been 1 more half and the portion would have been perfect. I also ordered a side of bacon and it was a little skimpy, but crunchy and good. My friend ordered the hot chicken sandwich special and said it was also very good with great flavor, but wished the chicken itself was a little thicker. 

The vibe of the restaurant from the minute I walked in was amazing. The customer service was top notch and friendly. We sat outside by the heaters and it was perfect for a quick meal. We were even checked on several times during our brunch. Our food also came out extremely fast, maybe 10 minutes at the very most. 

I will definitely be back soon and often! #yelpelite #yelpeliteevent

We went there today for lunch and it was the worst food we have eaten. First I have to start by saying that when I sat down the server spilled two glasses of water on me. Since I was traveling I was in wet clothes for most of the day. Then I place my order and didn't want soup (have restricted diet) I wanted two sides instead. Nope you have to pay for the extra side , but its ok you just dumped two glasses of water on me and didn't even comp my meal let alone 1side. Then food comes and we both thought it was the worst. No flavor and mushy, Meatloaf tasted like dried out sausage and veal had no flavor ,pasta was mushy. Since we were visiting family that was the only good thing about the meal.
Saturday morning brunch hit the spot. Our bartender Julie was sweet and very helpful with our gluten allergy. We ate at the bar and had brunch cocktails. The DJ was playing awesome tunes

A lot of hype after Barstool and the pizza is top notch. Crispy, chewy crust, excellent sauce, and light enough to have another slice. The service is nice even with the lines and the turn out the pizzas pretty quickly.  Enjoy.

After moving in to the area about a year ago, we searched hi and low for a nice family-styled restaurant. We found that place with Marlow's. My girlfriend can't get enough of the Prime Rib Dip. Even after multiple trips, that is all that I have ever seen her eat from the menu.

In the past, they have been cooking their burgers a little of the pink side. Tonight, it seemed as if they finally have it dialed in. The size is abundant and the taste is just right, all the way down to the last bite.

One of the treats that I really enjoy are the amazingly fresh pickles that are included on the plates as a condiment. The cucumber taste reminds me of my grandmother who used to grow her own cucumbers, then painstakingly jar her own pickles. The treats brings my senses to another place altogether.

The salads are probably my only active complaint. The lettuce is sliced so thin that it changes the texture of the leafy greens. Not necessarily bad tasting...it is just weird in your mouth.

Wednesday and Friday nights, they feature live acoustic music that sounds eerily similar to Mouse Rat (extra points if you can identify that reference). A little on the loud side for dinner music, but kudos for supporting live local music.

Make sure you check in on Yelp for$5 off of your Bill of $15 or more.

I really love this Whole Foods because it is brand new, organized, and has great items and staff. There's live music which is a great idea, but it is very loud and a cover band which makes it difficult to hear and concentrate. We came here to grab dinner tonight and it's just too loud.

Found this place on Yelp when looking for dinner. We don't live in the area and came across this place. It is TINY! But its the tiny where it makes you feel like WOW this is gonna be a good place. The bread is AMAZING 5 stars for the bread. I was interested in trying a slice of pizza but they were out (it was like 7:00 so thats ok). I tried the penne vodka which was decent. I am super picky with vodka sauce so this could be amazing to others, but to me it was just ok. Needed a little more spice. overall I did enjoy my experience and would like to come back to try a pizza.

This place has quickly become one of my favorite places to hang out. They always have some of best picks of Florida Brews on tap at all times. I love that the staff here knows about beers. The last couple of times I've been here I've had Laurel. She has a great personality, funny, and knows her stuff. If I ever have a question about a beer, it's always been answered very informatively or if they didn't have a beer I wanted, she knew exactly which beers  to have me sample, to help lead me into the right direction. That's always a Plus. Yes, that should be a given, but trust me, I've been places where the bartender serving could not give me suggestions or info. Not the case here. This place is very clean inside, plenty of seats at the bar where I love to sit, and the counter is so spacious. Pint & Brew does not offer food, but u can always order from Mystic Fish next door and they will deliver to u. The menu is on the bar if you're interested. If not, u can help yourself to complimentary popcorn from the popcorn machine located by the front door.
Beautiful atmosphere and I love the design.  I went for breakfast and the food was great.  I went with the avocado toast which was excellent.  Service could've been better otherwise I'd give it a 5*

We are out of this one, this one, all of these, and this one.

You'll probably hear this a time or two when you're visiting Insomnia Cookies in Broad Ripple. Cookie variety is rarely too..well, varied because so much of the stock is out.

And you'll be stunned that the ice cream is stunningly average and doesn't hold a candle to Tiny House Treats or BRICS.

And this place easily fills up. Lines will often be out the door.

But let's be honest: You've either enjoyed a few alcoholic beverages, or are about to enjoy some alcoholic beverages and you need to sober up or eat something before enjoying said alcoholic beverages. So service or quality of food really doesn't matter. Just get in, get your delicious cookie/ice cream combo, and get out and enjoy.

Insomnia is what it is. It is mediocre at any other time. But on those weekends when you're hungry for some ice cream or cookies, it will be there.
Great dealership to deal with!  Jason always takes time for me with my sales needs, and the "dream team" in service is always extremely thorough.  Will always bring my vehicles here.

Visited this place on a roadtrip with a friend after learning about Boise's famous Basque culture and cuisine. As others have mentioned, it's pronounced chee-kee-tay-o which according to their website is a Basque word that refers to "a pub crawl or stroll with friends to partake in coffee, tapas, and wine." This is the perfect spot to enjoy some tapas, great wine, and delicious fare with great company. 

I loved my lamb stew. I ate the whole thing by myself. Lol! It's a savory dish with chunks of tender lamb over saffron rice and topped with radish and onion. My friend had and loved the Jamón Sandwich which was filled with jamón serrano, manchego cheese, mostarda, arugula, aioli on acme ciabatta. If we lived closer, we'd eat here often. 

Unlike the fast pace of other food establishments, you'll notice the vibe here is a bit more laid back. We missed the live performance but we still enjoyed our time there and the chill vibe of the place. If you check out the Up Next calendar on their website, you'll find upcoming events that you can partake in such as cooking classes, performances, and other interactive activities for you and your family and friends. Some events do have a fee.

If you're in the area or visit often, you should take advantage of their rewards program!

If this was solely based off food and drinks then I would give five stars, unfortunately I had a terrible dinner. To start, our waitress told us a side order of a chili rellano would be $1.99-found out when I got the check that it was $3.50, now I'm not being cheap but it would've been nice to know ahead of time. Next, I was with a friend whose food, we were told, got taken to the wrong table. So I had my food, and waited ten minutes for him to get his. Our server again expressed no concern and did not adjust the bill for any inconvenience. To boot, our server didn't refill our drinks or provide us with any napkins. It would have been nice if a manager could have stopped by after the food mix up just to check on us. I've worked in the restaurant business for six years and there are some things that still just ruin the meal. 
I was really looking forward to this place, and the food did not disappoint, but I likely will not be back because of the poor service.

This adorable little coffee shop shares a space with Great Harvest Bread Company, which other reviewers pointed out (and helped me find the place!). They've made great use of the space and seem to really complement each other (and the smells that hit you walking in are amazing). 

Our barista was friendly and I really enjoyed my mocha. I love that the coffee beans are fair trade and that they roast everything themselves. That big metal machine behind the counter isn't just an awesome piece of decor, it's actually functional! 

You know, I would rather come here than Foundation Grounds (just up the road) because it's quieter here (the louder it is, the harder it is for me to think/discuss/read/write/study/etc.). If I lived in the area, this would probably be my go to spot for coffee with friends.

The bartender whom has discreetly won the 2019 Tucson Bartender  Award can make one heck of a drink! I ordered the purple haze and it was this beautiful hue of red and blue that as you drink it is a purple you can sincerely appreciate. 

They also promote safe sex with complimentary adult resources;)

I was introduced to HotBox pizza at my first Gen Con years ago. At the time I was staying outside of town town and ordered a pizza for delivery from a different location. I wasn't impressed. 
During a different Gen Con I tried it from the downtown tent. It was like cartoon blast lines appeared around me and a rock anthem played every time I took a bite. I was hooked! If I did crack I would have given it up for Hot Box. Now that I live in Indianapolis I order it once a week. It arrives fast and hot and I haven't found a special pie I haven't liked. 
Porky the pie and the cheese specialty pizza are my favorites. I'm also a fan of sticks and salad. It's fun to try the seasonal pie when a new one comes out.

Lives up to its hype. AMAZING vegan restaurant; wonderful ambiance, excellent options prepared incredibly well and lovely presentation. Wonderful cocktails. I highly recommend checking out their wine and cocktail list, all wines are organic or biodynamic I believe which was a great touch. Favorite dishes: Fancy Radishes, pretzel with rutabaga... literally everything is amazing, you can't go wrong.
Amazing. They stick with tradition. Original IBC root beer. Not frills, all taste. Enjoy!

Pro: variety of lousiana food (you WILL find something you like), fully cooked, frozen so keeps well, offers samples of daily soup, WINE!!!!!

Cons: variety of louisiana food (i want everything), was unsure and unclear if they served fully cooked lunch- did not appear to have a place to sit and lunch.

Full Disclosure: I walked in and was so excited by the variety of local specialty faire that I spent almost $70 on frozen food I wanted to try. 

The ambiance is adorable. I was drawn to the shot gun style house on magazine by the chalkboard that promise crab cakes. Nuff said. Even though it is a gourmet market- I was not prepared for the huge freezers of... well... Louisiana stuff. 

FOOD

The single item that was not worth it- The king cake. This is not the place to buy a king cake. They are huge and pretty (so pretty- my non-edible- week old king cake from chez nous is encased in my glass cake plate on the dining room table as a center piece). It is too doughy for my taste, and a little tough.

That said: there are things this place does really well- and my greedy stomach wants to try a whole bunch of stuff to find all of my favourites. I will tell you that I like more spicey, savory and complex flavours.

I loved that all entrees were fully cooked and frozen - so they kept nicely and heated well. 

Guacamole- not frozen- my hands down favourite. I ate all of it in one night. I put it out for others to share with me while watching a movie- and caught myself hoarding it. Different, fresh and well seasoned.

Deviled eggs- needed more seasoning

Salsa- loved the whole tomatoes and chopped onion and bell pepper, needed salt and lime juice

crawfish bread- no greasy- liked it a lot. went well with a decent cab

crawfish pie: GET THIS!!!!! awesome. Looks single serve but can comfortably feed 2. Huge pie, lots of crawfish- not a thin soupy sauce, thicker and beautiful pastry. So good.

Seafood Stuffed Eggplant casserole- YUM. The only way I knew there was eggplant in there was by the seeds. Not fried, slimy or greasy. 

Crab cakes with remoulade sauce- heated in the oven- came out so nicely. Did not taste fried, crispy and wonderful

Found this on a rainy day- this was truly my idea of comfort food- even though I had to share :(

Hope it helps.
Hip atmosphere, great servers and very good food.  Really enjoyed. 4 star means to me very good.

I've eaten from this place 3 times now it's my favorite place out here so far I'm from California and the sushi places aren't that good that I've experienced but this place so far has had the best sushi out here

Highly pissed and upset about this so I have to write a review. 

Long story short: we put in an online order and the food wasn't even started by the time we got there 20 minutes later so we ended up not having food. 

Detailed story: We put in a mobile app order so that we could have food ready when we got to this location. We drove 10 minutes out of the way to eat here but it's what us and the kids all agreed to eat. 20 minutes later when we get there, not only is the food not ready but they know nothing about it. Why? Because no one was paying attention to the printer that prints the online orders so the ticket was just sitting there. The bartender tried to start the order, which is what made us aware that it hadn't been started or sent to the kitchen. My sister and I went outside to ask everyone if they wanted to wait but since it had already been 20 min ago since we put the order in and we would've had to wait 15-20 minutes more to get it they didn't want to...So my sister and I went back inside to get the card refunded. The manager, Johnny, goes to the back to do the refund and comes back like 4 minutes later saying he couldn't and has to call IT. That confuses me because we didn't have to call IT to charge the card so we had to leave our information so he could try to do it later and then call/email us back.
As a manager, I would've had the kitchen drop the food while we went out the the car to see if everyone wanted to wait or not and ran a refund on the card anyway since it's the fault of the restaurant that the food isn't ready (not the customers). All we got was a lame "I'm sorry about that" and that's it. This is NOT how you run a restaurant. Because instead of him fixing our situation, we walked out with no food and no refund. Fixing the issue would've been a good thing but since it's not, this review will change the choice of future guests who may think about going here. This is a shame for Hooters; especially with all the competition. And they weren't busy! It's was about 14 ppl in there and most were sitting at the bar. DONT WASTE YOU TIME OR MONEY! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

We really like stouts for breakfast, they serve a good breakfast at a great price, and get the order right every time.  I always get over medium eggs, with home fries and rye toast, sometimes add grits, and either bacon well done or kielbasa and it is excellent every time.  Also have very good jams and jelly, I like the raspberry and the orange marmalade.  
Highly recommend this place if u are wanting a good local breakfast place.
Good restaurant but not as good as the hype. Boring menu with nothing exciting to cone back for. Staff was friendly but not very welcoming.

Nice place with a whole bunch of eateries and restaurants to choose from. It was actually my first time here and it's a bit overwhelming as I didn't know which or what to choose from but it did have a lot of options. The place is crowded as massive amount of tourists and Philadelphians combined meet in this massive market.

Only complaint I had it that it was difficult to find anything that was in the healthier side and which they were more or if any option to get either a salad or wrap at the least. I know this isn't the place to look for when wanting to eat healthy but at least give me that option. Anyway I still recommend in coming here. I had a po' boy with blackened chicken which was pretty good.

Buttery, warm, light and dense all at once biscuit. I'm in love! Definitely recommend coming if you're in Nashville. You can just have the biscuit, one of their biscuit sandwiches or custom create one. I had the basic biscuit with egg over easy + fried green tomato + fresh cut tomato + Nashville sauce on the side. It was SOOO good!! Very filling. Nashville sauce had a kick to it. Staff was all friendly, easy to order and take to go. Nothing tastes as good a fresh hot homemade biscuit and some jam (oh yea, I added some grape jelly).
I'm not a sweet eater but these cookies are soooo good!  I always get the chocolate chip cookie and they never disappoint!

So, when visiting Nashville I wanted to make sure we had a great brunch spot to hit up. Preferably with some type of drink special like bottomless mimosas or Bellinis. Well Hopsmitb had an offer we could not refuse, 2-4-1 champagne bottles for, get this, $29. 

The place is very cute and despite the cold weather we chose to sit on the closed in patio for a light breeze and a view. We ordered a few things off of the menus because we just couldn't decide and it was all very good and affordable. Our waitress was nice, friendly and fast. The foods are simple so they come out fairly quickly once you order. We ordered breakfast nachos, chicken and waffle bites, breakfast biscuits and the Chicago skillet. 

My friends were shocked by how good the nachos were. Something so simple yet so tasty. The chicken and waffles bites were chicken cubes covered in waffle batter and deep fried. Very unique and delicious. The Chicago skillet was good and spicy with fresh jalapeños on it. The biscuits were my least favorite because they were basic. The other items we ordered were packed with flavor and uniqueness that the biscuits seemed so boring. 

I see why the crowds are lining up for Hopsmith on the weekend and so glad we got a chance to check it out on our weekend trip!!!

I don't know why it has taken me this long to write a review on hands down one of my favorite restaurants in the area. I have been here more times than I can count and even didn't cancel my reservations during a big snow storm though the majority of Philadelphia was no where in sight. 

I recommend here the most for brunch with a group. You should order several plates to share so that you can maximize on how many dishes you experience. My favorites from the small plates section for dinner are: pork ribs and tuna crudo; pizza for brunch: double margarita and the mushroom truffle burrata; pasta for brunch: bucatini cacio e pepe; "eggs and whatnot" for brunch: hanger and egg.

The only thing I haven't gotten into is their dessert. I have to admit I was slightly disappointed that after such an amazing meal there wasn't that cherry on top feeling with the dessert. However I still can't not give this place a 5 - the staff is friendly, the location is beautiful, and the food is overall great.

Ambience provides a warm, tucked in feeling. Even the breakfast/brunch coffee mugs enhance this sentiment - my friend and I looked to the bottom of our cups and laughed as they were made by Wm Mulherin's. Of course they would be- everything they touch is pretty much perfection.

Tip: book in advance as it can often be difficult to obtain a dinner reservation for the window of 6:30-9pm.

Great place to stop by for coffee and food. They have fast WiFi and lots of tables so it also makes this place a great place to get some work done.

For coffee, I've tried both their drip coffee which was great and lattes. Strong and delicious flavors for both. 

For food, I've had the greens and grits which was so YUM. Delicious grits topped with cherry tomatoes, bacon, collard greens, pickled red onions and a poached egg. My only critique is the poached egg could have been a little more runny.

Another great food item is their avocado toast. It has perfectly cooked Brussel sprouts on it, a combo which I've never had but it works. The presentation for this was also really nice with fresh greens and edible florals. Overall great place!

Yelp has a check in coupon! $5 pizza! Dress appropriately...loose jeans-right on point. 

They do have a cauliflower crust as an upgrade that you can opt into. Just make sure to text your reply to " DONT STOP ".  They don't make you pay for extra topping so it's like subway line style fast food pizza shop where You just sit there adding what you want until the person behind you in line starts to give you dirty looks.  But you won't be judged by the staff. Very friendly place, indeed. 

They do have vegan cheese, and several options if you are trying to curb your appetite. But for the most part it's a mozzarella cheese festival that's ready in less than 10 min. I'd say it's better than one of those hot and ready places by far. There are fresh veggies to choose from and everything is clean and prepared in front of you. They even have deserts and well chosen side items. 

Without the coupon the pricing is decent. But I would go ahead and check in and check it out! It's a great alternative to grabbing a sandwich or some other fast lunch option, without having to go too greasy or leave you wanting more. Well...I could actually go for more...so if you'll just excuse me then...brb. Promise!

Top Two restaurant pet peeves:
#1 Open Kitchen ordering when it is not spaced out. Let me finish the hot dish before you bring out another hot dish. We had probably 5 hot entrees on the table at once, not cool (unless we are referring to the temperature of my meatballs). This basically go against all Italian dining culture- dont rush the meal!

#2 Anything negative bathroom related. The bathroom attendant directing me to open stalls was not necessary. I can determine an open stall- This was totally awkward, everyone at my table agreed! She didn't even have mints or hand out paper towels-  Just yelling at me where to go!

Overall the food was good and it was very swanky (fun for the girls) but I cant stand all my courses on the table at once! Plus all my friends where Mom's and getting out was a special occasion so to rush the meal was lame.

New spot to check out in clearwater!!  Nice establishment. The staff is quick to take your order and get the food out. There's a window in the dining area where you can watch them cook and season your wings orders. We got garlic Parmesan and mild flavor. Both were YUMMERS!!!!! I recommend you try this if you like wings. They have a variety of things in the menu. They do take out and dine it and the price.....!!  Very fairly priced. Our order needed up to be under $20 for their meal deal 15 wings, 2 twenty oz drinks, fries or veggie sticks and 2 sauces.

I don't know how else to describe this place, besides saying it's just OK. 

We pass by Smokin Bettys every night on our walk home and finally decided to give it a try for a late night dinner. The place was pretty empty, as expected around 11:30pm. Our server was very friendly and gave us some food recommendations. We decided to start with cheesesteak eggrolls. They had a strong smokey taste and were not as good as I expected them to be. We also ordered the sliders, Mac & cheese, and pulled chicken quesadillas. We were excited that the sliders gave us an opportunity to try the brisket, pulled pork, and pulled chicken. While the mac & cheese was tasty, the BBQ left a lot to be desired. The highlight of our meal was hands down the quesadilla, which was surprisingly good. I don't know if I I'll ever be back here. Just feel like there's way better restaurants in the area.

A nice spot for a well-made, upscale meal! 

Ambiance: 
Wm Mulerhin's manages to create an upscale, rustic atmosphere that makes you feel like you're dining in a wealthy relative's cabin as opposed to a restaurant. The roaring fire-place and leather couches in the dining room that are often filled with bar patrons make you forget that you're right under the El in Fishtown. The whole thing feels very upscale and cozy, albeit a bit loud with the proximity of the tables and the fact that there is not a clear distinction between the bar and dining room. 

Food: 
I'll start by saying I've never eaten anything bad here - everything they made is well executed and has come out flawless every time. Their kitchen definitely knows what they're doing and holds themselves to a high standard which shows the caliber of the restaurant and the attention to detail. The first time I came here several months ago I struggled to find something I liked on the menu - though now they've updated to feature a lot more dishes that I enjoy. My advice is to check out the menu ahead of time to make sure there are dishes that call out to you - while they do a great job of cooking not all of the dishes match my personal tastes. As this is an Italian restaurant, they offer a lot of seafood options and it seems to me there are several vegetarian and vegan options available as well. 

Stand-outs for me are the brocolli rabe appetizer and the hanger and eggs for brunch - I don't normally like over easy eggs but they do them so well here I have to order it. 

Drinks: 
Much like the kitchen - the bar here knows what they're doing and their cocktails are spot on in terms of balance and flavor. You can't go wrong here ordering a cocktail you like. The selection of beer and wine are standard Italian fare. They do not seem to have an extensive wine cellar or wine by the bottle offerings which may deter some folks, though I'm sure all of their wine by the glass can be purchased by the bottle as well even though not explicitly quoted on the menu. 

Service:
While it's clear the servers here are pulled from top notch establishments and have knowledge of the menu, the overall service lacks the refinement of a five-star establishment. My drinks tend to sit empty here for several minutes before being topped off and the little touches such as being offered spreads for my croissant or a steak knife are lacking unless I explicitly ask. For some of you this won't bother you, but I was a bit disappointed as having to go back and forth with the wait-staff can throw off the pace of a meal a good bit. That said - the service is definitely good and friendly. 

Value:
Why 4 stars? Everything is good here and well-made, however Wm Mulerhins lacks the magic to make this a 5 star experience. While I've never had a bad experience I've also never felt compelled to rave about this place to my friends either or to bring guests from out of town - it's kind of just a nice spot to eat when I don't feel like going to Center City. Some dishes are better value than others, but ultimately it's comparable if a little bit less than center city prices which is fine for what they offer and the neighborhood. I would say go value-wise, but for the reasons described not a place that I would use for a special occasion.

Let's travel all the way to the Mediterranean and have some delicious cuisine! If you can't get on a plane and go I have the next best thing. Get in your car and head to New Tampa and dine at Petra Express! I can't fully put into words the mouthwatering tastiness of all of their food. So flavorful but not overbearing. My favorite meal to get here is the Mix Grill platter. Comes with grilled lamb and chicken with your choice of two sides. I always opt for the yellow basmati rice and their salad. Then I get a side of hummus and pita bread. The hummus is homemade and taste like your grandmother made it. Everything from grandma is great right? On Monday & Wednesday they offer a weekday special. If you're not sure about what go get go on those two days to get the most bang for your bucks. Either way you won't be disappointed! Enjoy!

We had reservations here for Christmas Day Reveillon Dinner. It was supposed to be a 4 course meal but ended being only 3 for us because after 2 plus hours we requested the check.

The servers were trying their best and fielding several complaints from tables around us. It was obvious there was some back of the house issues and I felt bad for the servers that had to take the brunt of the blame. They were so overwhelmed that nobody even batted an eye at our request for a check before the end of meal or gave thought to apologies or make it rights. In my opinion, management failed the servers and left them out to dry. 

Advertised menu items were not available. We were only served one drink and never asked if we would like another. Honestly it got to the point that it was amusing instead of infuriating. 

What food we did eat was good. Understandable that it was Christmas and may have been dealing with staffing shortages. There appeared to be plenty of staff just not utilized in best way possible.

Too inconsistent, no wonder they start losing people after the third visit or so. They did well the first couple times then mistake after mistake that we happily paid for, sadly it just gets to the point where it isn't worth it anymore. Who wants to meet at the Social? Mistakes they've charged me for: 0!

After a movie at Kan-Kan, my husband and I dropped in Amelia's for a cookie. He loves chocolate chip cookies, so we grabbed one to go. The establishment is very cute, is brightly lit, and has a modern farmhouse feel. We were greeted upon entering and exiting. The cookie was great and I look forward to returning, trying more goodies, and sitting on the patio.

Between the incredible food options, and the incendiary beer list, St. Benjamin's Brewing delivers plenty of good reason to venture off to an area just outside of Temple Campus that's often less traveled. and with in being the exact space that used to house my cousin's warehouse loft during my college days, this also happens to be one of those culture shocks in an odd and impressive manner!

As someone who used to party in the 5th & Cecil B. Warehouses during the 2000's I knew they were capable of holding a lot. But still I never quite expected them to house multiple fancy loft apartments, a delicatessen, and a huge brewery space. But as soon as I walked in and previewed how they refurbished the place it was something that made a whole lot of sense. Especially when I looked at the well rounded not too heavy on IPA beer list and saw how reasonably priced their flights were.

And what a phenomenal list it was! for my first beer I was officially the 1st person to tap into their newly added sour and oh so decadently fruity Griotte, which managed to deliver a suitable taste of what I was in for. For my flight I was definitely impressed with their Crop Cover Rye IPA, the Heart in Hand Rauch Bock, and the deceptively smooth Bonne Anne 2017. But for me it was the Pat's Hat Honey Rye Porter that's aged in rye whiskey barrels that especially stole the show and earned a spot on my top 5 porters list.

For testing out new spots, my latest prerequisite food item of choice has been trying veggie wings when available. And while they were definitely sweet and delicious, I just found the ones with sweet gochujang sauce that I ordered to not hold a candle to others that I've had at other restaurants. But with amazing sounding items like pretzel crusted cheese curds, grilled flatbread pizza that you can add bacon to, and lobster poutine; I'll definitely be here and trying more food items to come!

What can I say?  I am a sucker for White Castle!  Unfortunately, well, fortunately, so is my coworker... so when we figured out that this White Castle was on the way to where we were headed... we had to stop and have a few!  We hit them at a good time and beat a rush... Also, everyone working there was in a great mood - which always scores extra brownie points.  For the first time, I had a BBQ pork slider... the sauce was too sweet for my taste, so I will stick with my regular cheeseburgers.

I have been calling all week in order to transfer my significant account to the pharmacy. For the fourth time I tried following up on the completed transfer.  The pharmacist proceeded to scold and yell at me for calling on January 1st. They were open. I was not ordering anything, I was not asking for anything.  I simply wanted to confirm that the account had transferred. If she cannot take a phone call I am fairly certain she cannot handle an ongoing customer relationship. I cancelled my whole account.. BTW this is the first yelp review I have ever submitted.

Simple tour with delicious chocolate samples at the end. We had 3-4 pieces each and did not feel the need to pay extra for the tasting room. Lovely shop also. Check the "outlet" section; it's a huge bargain!  Love the fact that they use 20% solar power and no artificial colors.

Pretty underwhelming, really. A friend and I split some hummus and shawerma, plus a falafel plate and the lamb kabob. Hummus was fine, not particularly awesome, but certainly not bad either. The beef shawerma has a nice crust on it, and was seasoned pretty well. The bread served along side was...bad. Very thin, chewy pita, with no real flavor. I hold all pita to the standard of Naf Naf, so I know no one will compare, but this was further towards the bad end of the scale than most. We got a second basket of it towards the end of the meal, and it was at least a little more leavened, but still kind of tough and flavorless.

My lamb was inconsistently done, and a little tough - OK flavor, but the cut just wasn't all that great. It was served on a large bed of rice that was well seasoned (with I think a little cardmom?) but not exceptional. The falafel plate was a large serving of about 10 falafel, but they featured very crisp outsides with kind of dry, crumbly insides. Not terribly well seasoned, not tender and moist like some I've had. Just...not great. Which really is the theme for most of this meal.

I know there are a bunch of places in Chicago that are better than this - Naf Naf, Nesh, Benjehuda, even I Dream of Falafel, all available in the Loop for my lunch enjoyment. I don't know if similar options exist in St. Louis, but I would definitely try other options before coming back here.

I don't know where to begin....met a friend for breakfast this morning.  This is my first visit to the new Olgas Diner.  I'll make this short; the music was so loud we could hardly hear each other talk.  The worst part was how they handle clearing tables.  Apparently the server does not have to remove plates when you are finished eating.  After the patrons leave a table, another a person pushes this huge rolling bin to the table.  They proceed to clear the table of all the dishes and utensils into this bin.  Unfortunately, they park this thing right next to the table so if you are sitting across from it, you watch uneaten food being scraped into a garbage bag and listen to all the plates being banged into the bin.  It's like sitting next to a garbage truck.  It was the most disgusting thing I have ever witnessed in a restaurant.  This rolling bin was so big it hardly fit between the booths.  Won't return.
Fun atmosphere with great music and dancing. Very busy, but pretty good service. A little pricey, but all the food was great: catfish, fried shrimp, oysters, calamari, and delicilious gumbo!

I know everyone loves Biscuit Love, and I hate to be that person, but it was just meh.

I was lucky enough to get there before the long line started to get in and the ordering process was easy and smooth, but the food was just not that great. Had the bonuts and the southern benny and was not impressed with the biscuits. All the food arrived cold, and trying to flag down a server while they are busy was almost impossible. I will say the chronic bacon was absolutely delicious and the best thing I had there. Their specialty however is supposed to be biscuits, not bacon.

Tourists, if you are reading this, you don't need to stand in the long line and buy into the hype. Nashville has so many options for better breakfast at a better price, so yelp on before making the decision to wait here.
We used Marc for a big event last year. He was flexible, professional and, best of all, we have great pictures. Will definitely use Marc again soon.

I was thinking of koshari today! And Egyptian friend of mine said that he only knew of one true Egyptian restaurant in the area, and it's this. So due to this Covid situation in the world you can eat inside the restaurant. I was able to order a couple of dishes over the phone and pick them up. I ordered my beloved koshari and the meat sampler dish. 
Let me say that when I went inside to pick up my order I was so giddy to see the movie posters in Arabic writing and most of all the pictures of beloved  Egyptian singer Om Kolsum. 
So my friend and I brought our food afterwards to the nearby park and dug into our dishes. Let me say that the aroma of my takeout was so delicious that my mouth was watering until I got to my location. We really loved our food and I look forward to going back and ordering many other things that are on the menu. I really enjoyed my food it was so flavorful all the amazing delicate seasonings, the color of the food looked so homestyle delicious. I'm happy with my dinner today

Not a single sales person was wearing a mask although many of the customers were. A salesman approached me and I asked him why he was not wearing a mask. He said, "Well, my boss doesn't require that we wear them so I don't bother." Absolutely disgusting. I thought,  Really? I'm wearing one to protect you, the employee, but your boss and you don't feel any obligation to protect me, the client? The place felt absolutely dirty. I walked in with $5000 in my pocket to furnish my new house and even though I skimmed through and saw some pieces I liked at decent prices I walked out with nothing. Would never give these people a dime of my money. We're in the middle of a pandemic and their boss does require them to wear masks to protect their customers? No wonder Boise has such a terrible Covid problem with management  like that.

If you're looking for a massage this is the place to go. I walk into that place barely even able to walk and they get work done and get me loose and always professional and great. My favorite spot in the city for a massage

Fran's was recommended to us and it looked great from the curb so in we went!  The menu was nice and my husband ordered a burger that he said was a 6 on the 10 scale (arbitrary) and I ordered a pizza that had hair in one piece... then I looked and it had it again in two pieces baked into the cheese.  I wouldn't have written this review if i hadn't gotten it redone and it was great and we were checked on again.  I got the 2nd pizza and was soggy with raw garlic - it was thrown together and not done well - nor did the waitress (who was a nice person and really apologized for the first one) ever check on us after that was delivered to the table.  It wasn't our fault that the first one was a head of hair but the "chef" seemed to have taken it out on us ~ I would have personally come out from behind the pizza bar area and said something but he avoided eye contact.  oh well - looks like the reviews are all over the place.  I think these are simple things to correct and Fran's would be an all around nice place.

This place is lovely and the owners are such nice, knowledgeable people. 

It is such a calm, enjoyable place. I can't recommend it enough.

This was my first visit to Rita's Italian Ice but I am definitely a fan! I was slightly bummed to learn that they were out of the traditional Florida Orange flavor to complete my creamsicle craving, but I gladly opted for the Blood Orange flavor that they offered as an alternative. 

The Blood Orange Italian Ice paired VERY well with the Vanilla custard and I only wished that there was more custard layered throughout the treat. It was SO creamy and delicious. I ordered the large size and it was only $4.70 - and very filling! I would return if I found myself near downtown Clearwater again!

BONUTS BONUTS BONUTS JUST GO HERE AND WAIT AS LONG AS YOU NEED TO TO GET YOUR HANDS ON A BONUT!

Went here on a Monday morning around 10am and there was already a line almost to the corner of the block -- the wait was around 45 mins. I couldn't believe the line was that long on a Monday so I figured it was worth the wait, and I was 100% right (as usual).

Fast casual spot: Place your order at the register, get a number and pick a seat. 

Bonuts: Must order. I repeat, must order! Why you ask? Because it's friggin' fried biscuit dough that's why! Seriously one of the best first bites I've ever had of something sweet. The lemon mascarpone and blueberry compote are quite literally perfect compliments to the delectable dough ball. 

Southern Benny: Really friggin good. It came with country ham and they pulled a pro move by shaving it so it was easy to cut through.. The biscuit itself was so perfectly light and buttery too. The SUPER STAR of the dish was the sausage gravy -- I would put that on everything if I could.

Chronic Bacon: Really friggin good. I usually douse my bacon in maple syrup at diners, so the sweet and spicy sticky bacon they served us here was right up my alley!

Bring a magazine, your kindle, headphones, whatever just get in line and wait for however long you need to to get your hands on some of those bonuts ya heard?

Any place that has 2,476 beers on tap is OK with me. OK... maybe I am over-exaggerating about the number but it seems like that to me. Also, any place that can get my wife (who hates beer) to drink beer deserves a bow-down.

Oh yeah... they got some mighty fine pizza too. Slices are bigger-than-your-head-get-a-box-now-cuz-you-are-definitely-taking-some-home kinda big. 

We had:

Me:
Beer: an IPA I have never had before (and I have had a lot) from  a brewer which I cannot recall. Shame on me... and I call myself a beer drinker.

Food: a slice of the Roman, aka Combo, Pizza. All the stuff I love on a pizza and an adorable little personal pizza cutter. 

Wife:  
Beer: She is more partial to wine and mixed drinks. She does not like beer, but that's all they have besides soft drinks here. She told the server this and the server brought her samples of some stuff she might like. She settled on a Raspberry Framboise. She drank it and said she enjoyed it... but I am not so sure. What a trooper.

Food: a slice of Ham and Pineapple.

The pizza was very good. We did wish we had asked for some sauce on the side. There is a fine line between too little and too much sauce. We like to have some in case there is too little and, in this case, there was. With slices this size, they would probably run out by noon if they used too much.

Beer and pizza is a classic combination and 1702 does it in style!

This is a cool location and that's about it. Went with some girlfriends on a Thursday night. Weather was warm, Windows open, horrible loud singer. I've heard better karaokes. Had a wide array of tapas. The best was the chicken salad roll. The black bean hummus was decent, chips sucked. Cheese dip was decent as was the mac n cheese. Did not like the hot chicken, crab cake or salad. Just average food. Waiter was flaky. My sangria was fruity and ok, but not fab. Had a horrible headache the next day. Worst part was the heavy smoke in the air coming in from outside. On their rather small patio, there is a smoking section and a non. Seriously? It's like having a peeing section in the pool. Will not be back.

Life changed and it was time to get my own bed.

Considering the time I spend in my bed and the importance of the quality of sleep for my general well being, buying a mattress is a pretty important investment! 

I totally agree with the other reviews! I'm strongly satisfied with the quality of my mattress and the price with a free delivery! Jack was super friendly and very knowledgeable! He sure helped me to choose my perfect match! He will ask you to to lie on different firmness levels and types of mattresses in the store, don't feel self-conscious. Do it! Once you find the firmness level and material you find most comfortable, he will ask you to try more mattresses of that kind. Comfort will be determined by your personal preference but I found it super interesting that I could decide on the firmness based on my preferred sleeping position! He also suggested kind of waterproof mattress protector since stains will void the warranty. 

All in all, excellent experience and customer service with on time delivery! I'm very happy with my new mattress and my decision to buy from Mattress Clearance Center of Reno! Highly recommended!

We visited Frenchmen Street when we visited New Orleans in Jan 2017.  The street is located in the heart of the French Quarter and has tons of jazz clubs and music halls.  It's a must-do if you're visiting New Orleans, especially for the first time.  It's also where the locals seem to go to have a fun time.  It's certainly classier than and away from the hustle and bustle of Bourbon Street.  Our hotel the first night we were in New Orleans wasn't too far from there, and we made sure to go back for dinner and to listen to jazz music on our last night in New Orleans.  I definitely recommend it.

Hi Hat serves comfort food, and does it well.  

On our first visit, the pork plate arrived with an enormous portion. (I do not recall whether that was the regular menu item or a special).  They offer an $8 red beans special on Mondays, with an optional side of andouille or fried chicken for an additional $4. I had the fried chicken, which is an uncoated Southern traditional preparation (i.e., without the thick Popeyes-style batter layer) that arrives fresh and hot from the fryer. It's some of the best fried chicken I've had in New Orleans.  The red beans and chicken appears to be a popular option, judging from a quick scan of the room during a Monday noontime.  

The redbeans are served with a garnish of fresh green onion. The beans tend toward the bland side, despite having a few slices of sausage in the mixture.  The beans seem lighter and less greasy than the typical local preparation, and that makes for an appropriate contrast if you choose to add  fried chicken or sausage.  

The burger is a nice sized thick patty that show no signs of having ever seen a freezer, served on a toasted bun.  The burger was good, but on this plate, the french fries were the standout: thin cut with skins in place and served just as hot and fresh as the fried chicken.  Our experience reminded us of how fried foods are best served moments after being rescued from the vat. High Hat appears to make this a priority, and does not allow fried chicken or fries to languish while  sublime hot crispiness cools down toward a mediocre warm and soggy.  

The side dishes are notable for being fresh and homemade. The cole slaw alongside the pork dish was crisp and tart and not overwhelmed by mayonnaise, providing a perfect balance against the meaty, rich pork.  Cornbread comes out in thick warm cubes perfectly browned on top and bottom.   

The desserts are homemade and interesting, often consisting of a seasonal citrus based custard pie (in our experience, orange and satsuma).  At $6, these items are expensive and not large--but since so many New Orleanian diners are just that,  it's just as well that the portion was just big enough for sharing.

The cocktail tour was amazing. Theresa did a great job very knowledgeable and the places we went were really cool and historic. Special drinks were at each spot and were delicious. Got a lot of good history of New Orleans!

I haven't written many reviews on Yelp. But, I decided to write one for this place, because I feel it warrants a review. It serves a traditional Irish breakfast as well as Mexican food in the afternoon, I'm guessing it's a merging of of two different families; however, I'm only going to review the Irish breakfast and European candy and food you'll find there. The Irish breakfast was spot on, it was a very large meal, but, it tasted just like you'd find in Ireland.  The Mexican food in the afternoon was also pretty tasty. Definitely one of my favorite breakfast places.

Stopped in for a beer here on a Wednesday night. The hostess asked if we were here for drinks or food. We said drinks and she informed Us that tables were only for dining and we could look to see if there was seating at either bars. After finding none, I left back out. Meanwhile there were a bunch of tables open, I would think that they would let people sit down who were just having drinks because it wasn't a busy night. On a weekend day or night I could understand this rule but I don't want to stand up in a not -packed bar. 

This equals bad service to me, and there are too many other places in the city to deal with this on a midweek evening.

In my week in Nashville, I've yet to stop at a place that doesn't pass the Americano test. Their shots were pulled to perfection and I could really taste the different notes in the espresso. 

It's sad to see some of the bad reviews for this joint. The place is spacious, the baristas are wonderfully pleasant, and the coffee was great. The food seemed sparse, but I didn't dig into it too deep. This seemed like a great place to work from home, study, or meet up with friends all while keeping it relatively quiet and to yourself. The space wasn't crammed, but was still cozy. 

I'll definitely keep this on my list of places to return to when I come back here.
Really cool fact knowing I was in a restaurant that was featured on Guy Fiere's Diners-Drive-ins and Dives!! Food was fantastic!! And service was top notch!!!

I've been here at least 50 times and it seems to slowly be going down hill.  I'd like to chalk the issues up to being short staffed due to COVID, but it was more than that.  The food was lukewarm and slow to come out.  If my food i slow then it should at least be hot.  Consistently, the service has been lackadaisical, but if you do get lucky enough to sit up stairs that does not seem to be the case.

First Time here

We made a reservation for Sunday at 5:15, for our family of 5 (3 kids).

It was the perfect time.  We were seated outside and although the space heaters turned on, any later, the kids would have been cold or too tired.

Upon arriving, there was a line to enter (even with reservations) and were seated quickly.

We started with both refreshing drinks: Horchata and a Costa Blanca (Gin and Tonic). 

The kids had the option of a grilled cheese on rustic bread and fries or chicken tenders with fries, the kids were happy with their comfort food but we were excited that they tried other things as well!

Ordered:
-juicy manilla buttery clams with crusty bread for sopping up the broth.
-vaca which was a delicious strip steak and buttery potatoes cooked on a cast iron.
-tortilla espanola an egg dish with chorizo.
-verduras paella was the highlight in that it was seasoned perfect, crisp perfectly cooked rice, and juicy eggplant was a great last dish to end our culinary adventure after the dishes preceding were savory, rich, or acid forward.

Of course, to reward the kids after sitting through our adult dinner, churros with three dipping options (de leche, strawberry, and Mexican chocolate).

This is the closest drugstore to me, but I'd rather walk a little further to CVS. But if you're in the Walgreens mood, TREAT YO SELF, and walk to Broad & Chestnut for a luxe drug store experience {see my review for that one lol}. 

They close at bloody 6pm on the weekends. 6PM!!!!!!!! Wtf. 

It's very mundane, nothing cool. No good makeup (no Essie, for example). Services is whatevs.

Ugh these people were so rude, customer service must be the lowest priority!! No one greets you when  you walk in. I stood waiting for someone to come see about me at the ice cream counter for at least 7 minutes. I then walked over to the donut counter and asked Rachel if someone was working at the ice cream counter. She tells me, "Just give me one sec" and then proceeds to fix a coffee drink. Um ma'am, you def seen me here for the longest. Two women at the drive thru and no one in the store aside from me. What's the slow up here? One of the drive thru women kept walking back and forth from the window looking at me, but never speaking to see if I needed help, at least twice this happened. They were so rude. Still Rachel's attitude was the worse. It costs you nothing to smile at your patrons or at least acknowledge them waiting for service. Yuck!!

They're the ones that will get me back to running without pain - which makes me so incredibly happy! There is no hesitation in giving Methodist Sports Medicine a 5 star review. I began experiencing hip pain about 6 months ago and had no idea what was the cause. I am an active individual in that I love running, cycling, going to the gym, doing interval training, being outside -- definitely an on-the-go person. So having hip pain when I was doing these activities was very upsetting. I ended up becoming good friends with a girl that had been experiencing the same symptoms and the cause of her pain was a labral tear. The other symptom I had was a "clicking" sound in my hip. She recommended I check out Methodist Sports Medicine to see if I had the same thing. Low and behold, I had a labral tear. She also highly recommended Dr. Peter Maiers. And now I'm to the point where I would highly recommend him as well.

Before my initial visit, I didn't even know that I had a labrum in my hip. (Body problems = improving my medical knowledge. haha) My doctor, Dr. G. Peter Maiers, explained to me that hip arthroscopy would be my best bet. I was experiencing femoroacetabular impingement (FAI), which is when bone spurs (bone overgrowth) around the socket or femoral head cause damage - which is what happened to me. I was told that it was definitely my choice as to whether or not I wanted to have surgery. If I was to wait, there would be a good chance that I would get arthritis in my hip sooner rather than later and that would most likely result in a hip replacement. At 26 years old, I felt that getting things fixed now would be best. Plus - I wanted to get back to my running without pain! 

Dr. Maiers has been fantastic and I would recommend him to anyone. He specializes in hips, knees and focuses on getting you back to your active lifestyle. (Which is fantastic!) He's treated Colts players and was taught under the physician that first did this specific surgery. I trusted his knowledge from the beginning and knew that this would be the best route for getting my body back to "normal." His assistant, Staci Eufemi, has been great with explaining everything thoroughly to me as well. I've had nearly a hundred questions for her (well, almost) that I've send via email and she has quickly responded to each of them. So appreciated!

The surgery itself went really well, which is obviously of high importance. All of the staff at Methodist Sports Medicine were super kind and helped me through every step. I honestly didn't realize how big of a surgery it would be -- just in terms of what recovery would be like for me. No, it's not a hip replacement, but it still involves a lot of recovery. Everything that needed fixed is now fixed (hooray!) and I'm still in the recovery period. A few weeks out and I'm definitely feeling better, but I promise you that it takes patience and so much rest. One life saver was the Recovery+ compression wrap that I rented for two weeks. I literally kept that thing on day and night. I HIGHLY encourage patients to take advantage of this ice machine (what I've called it from day 1) as it truly helps. 

As for physical therapy, I encourage you to use their staff! All appointments (check-ups, surgery, PT) are in the same building, which makes it super convenient. I've been working with a PT named Andrea Wilson and she truly has been amazing. She explains all PT workouts thoroughly and understands the surgery I had inside and out. You have no idea how comforting that is - to work with someone that truly understands what they're saying. haha 

I plan to update this review once I get back to my normal routines - running, cycling, going for long walks, hikes, etc. I'm not a very patient person, so this has definitely been challenging for me. But - I'm thankful that I found this place to get me back in action.

The service was terrific. Building was beautiful. The food was mediocre. I ordered a Smashburger and it had no taste. The french fries that came with the order were tasteless as well. My husband ordered chicken and biscuits and they was hardly any hollandaise on the dish. The potatoes "home fries "were raw. And the biscuit was dry and floury.The other couple that we were with said their home fries were raw as well. We had to ask for silverware and salt and pepper and sweetener for my iced tea. Things that should have been on the table we're not there. Thank goodness nobody wanted ketchup
I still owe them a fair amount of money, but I think it was worth every penny!

I'm a little torn writing this review because it's not as if the place sucked I was just expecting more.

If you're going to wait in a ridiculously long line for something I'd hope it was the best something you've ever had.

The ambiance of the establishment was by far its strongest attribute. The service was meh. The hostess was great but the wait staff is very very busy. The food was also just OK, Im not dreaming about those biscuits and I definitely didn't NEED it one more time before I left Nashville. 

I LOVE biscuits and I'd pass on having these again. That being said, I'm not a huge meat eater so to me, the chicken was chicken. My boyfriend thought his chicken was good but also agreed that it didn't leave us completely satisfied and fell short of our expectations.

If the selfies are worth the wait in line, sure check it out but I didn't find the food up to what I was expecting.

I've been looking for a go-to BBQ place in New Orleans since moving here, and I may have found it in Blue Oak. Getting out of the car all the way down the block you immediately smell the smokey meat and know you're in for a treat. The line moves pretty quick, and while you're waiting, you can look into the kitchen and watch meats being chopped up, sides being made and you'll be plenty hungry by the time you order. 

The service is pretty quick and they'll bring your order out to you whether you're inside or out on the porch with misters which keep it cool even in midday summer heat. They only have a few sauces, and nothing too spicy, but the house sauce is a sweet Memphis style which is so good. Would recommend the pulled pork as well as the ribs- so much flavor. All the sides were great. 

Definitely want to try the nachos next time.

Today is Father's D and the restaurant isn't packed so my friend and I entered. We were greeted and seated immediately. Within minutes our waiter appeared. We starred off with water with lemon. When he returned we were either really ready to order or starvin perhaps the latter for me. 

I ordered a wedge salad and the Shanghai power bowl. My friend ordered the Waldorf salad. We had cocktails. I went for my fav and yours too if you try it and she went for the Orchard sangria. When I tell you the food came out in a timely sequence our young and movie water brought my salad out and yeah not with my meal. Go Anthony!!!! 

The food was so fresh hot and cold for the salads. Seriously the power bowl is just the perfect balance of spice and seasoning. I could instantly taste the ginger which I though yeah it will pair excellent with my Blueberry Ginger Smash! 

Service and food were excellent!!! However the only blemish is my drink garnish. No I'm not petty but I love the fresh ginger in this drink. Thanks Kanisa (Bar-lady), Larry (HNIC) and out server Anthony. 

We're not fathers but thanks for a wonderful experience!!!

So funny, I thought I'd been here before when a friend suggested meeting here for a quick drink.  I walked in and realized I hadn't.  It's beautiful inside!  I love the dark look, the open floor, the wall of alcohol . . . .the bar tender was dressed nicely and the countertops at the bar were really nice.  
The bar tender was a bit busy with a vendor and I was in desperate need of a drink.  I think I might have seemed pushy at first, but I didn't intend to be that way.  There were only 2 other people at the bar, and one of them was my friend.  He did hand me a menu to look at the different cocktails, and I quickly picked out a healthy sounding drink.  I say healthy because it had Ashwagandha root, apple cider vinegar, lemon, mezcal, honey, and el campane herb. The drink had a KICK to it.  I enjoyed all of the flavors, but there was this one flavor that wasn't my favorite . . the bartender was super nice and offered to replace my drink several times.  I explained to him that I just couldn't put my finger on the flavor and that I guessed that it was this herb.  So, he went in the back and brought the bag for me to take a sniff of, and that's exactly what it was!  I was curious about the medicinal benefits, and although I could not find those listed, it did say that in large amounts it could cause diarrhea and vomiting.  Yay!  We all had a good laugh about that.  I finished my cocktail with very little concern of the aforementioned.  
I did try their variation of a mule, as I really needed ginger to complete my healthy drink.  That was super yummy, and probably what I'd order again.  And I will.  I can't believe this is my first time to Chapel!  I like it!  
I'm only giving 4 stars because at this point it didn't blow me away, but I will come back, spend a bit more time and try a few more drinks and update my review.

Great patio, terrible attitude at the host stand (they try to send you away to other restaurants if they don't want to deal with the volume).

Had my work training there- the management was great, they gave us a reservation. The service was terrible. We waited a half hour for our food, crammed in the worst and smallest booth with five people and the server was exceptionally rude.

If it wasn't for the ambiance and the patio, wouldn't go back
New to Philadelphia my girls are in for exams and treatment. Elija has had some hair loss and is scratching. Alexis just am wellness exam and moral support for her sister.

Where do I even begin. This place is massive and packed. Brace yourself as you walk through the doors. 

The market has a lot to offer so you can grab a map when you walk in or wander and see where the road takes you. We stopped and tried a few stands as we were visiting and wanted to try everything. There's a polish stand inside that offered amazing head cheese. It's towards the 'picnic area' seating. I ordered a pork chop from this vendor as well. Delicious!

Make sure to try all the Dutch goods available. It's out of this world, the jerky vendor has some of the best jerky I've had in a while.

All in all, I loved it. Hopefully next time I stop by I won't be packed in like a sardine.

I have never been so disappointed with a business owner/manager... 

I originally contacted the Greeks Pizzeria on Columbia Ave because it was closest to our wedding venue and we wanted to have our rehearsal dinner here (sentimental reasons since going to BSU). The owner/manager at that location went above and beyond to find solutions for us over the phone because his space wasn't big enough. Finally, he recommended I get in contact with the downtown location. The owner/manager at this location would only text despite my repeated requests for a call. We were told we would have a private space big enough for 30 people. When we arrived, the employees had no idea who we were or why we were there. Later, they must have spoken with the owner/manager because they magically figured it out. They directed us upstairs TO A BAR filled with drunken, loud people and TV's. Not only was the space not private but it clearly stated 21 and older, even though we had told the owner/manager previously we were bringing children (he was even the one that asked). With all of these people already occupying the space we only had 15 seats for 30 people. Some of our party had to go downstairs and eat separately. No one came to take a drink order - my now husband went downstairs to buy 2 liters from the cashier. We had to go down to ask for silverware, plates, etc. and fight our way through the crowd each time. I was so embarrassed to have my wedding party and parents at a bar with their children where they couldn't even sit or be served properly. We were grossly misquoted on the total of the food - $100 difference. I never got another text from the owner/manager asking us if we got in okay, or how our experience was. I don't why I had expected him to be there for such a large party, but you could say I was disappointed to say the least. Of course, the Greeks pizza was good like always...but I give no credit to the owner/manager running the establishment but only to the originators of the recipe.

We started out at a different restaurant for lunch but were disappointed by the menu so we decided to go to bittercreek instead. We are very glad we did. 

We have three kids and when we first walked in we weren't sure if it was kid friendly since it was a sit down restaurant that also has a bar. But we were soon put at ease when our helpful waiter brought over Elsa lunch boxes filled with little toys (dinosaurs, cars, etch a sketch, crayons) goldfish crackers, and a kid's menu to color on. They were sad when they learned they couldn't have the toy boxes though, so you might want to give your kids a heads up about that. 

My husband couldn't decide which beer to order as there are many choices. The waiter let him sample a few different ones in shot glasses so my husband could pick one that he really liked. I also wanted to drink something, but didn't want beer. The waiter suggested strawberry thyme kombucha from red feather next door (both restaurants owned together and connected in the middle). It was light and perfect, even the kids liked it. The glass it comes in looks kind of like a fancy wine glass. It has the bitter creek logo on it as well. They are available for 8$ if you want a souvenir. The kids got sodas in little mason glasses that come with cute little sippy lids (also cool). 

My husband got a meat dish and enjoyed his meal. For the non meat eaters there is a hummus appetizer, veggie and hummus gyro, and a black bean burger. I got the black bean burger with a side salad. My meal was delicious. The kids ordered a grilled cheese meal with fries and a Mac n cheese meal with veggies. The Mac m cheese was the winner and the kids ended up sharing that. Each kids meal comes with a side(but the drink is not included.)

Finally great service too, we will be back!
