I was a bit disappointed with how small the drunken noodles order was, for the price. $30 for two noodle dishes. 
I will say the flavor of the drunken noodles were AMAZING. I just wish there was more. 
Pad Thai was good, shrimp was cooked perfectly.

Munz Construction brought our 40+ yr old home into the future. New siding and Windows - good bye powder blue and hello dark green/brown/ grayish color. 
Hello new insulated windows!! Hello new window in the formal LR! 

Good bye outside noise! 

Goodbye no insulation, big heating bills. 


We recommended Munz to a neighbor who chose someone else for $200 less...
Pffft - they were NOT happy with their choice. 


Don't move...Improve! 

Love this company!! Nice guys and considerate!

Although I am actually slightly disappointed in this new Boba spot, I will say that I loved their Buy 1 Get 1 Free promotion the 1st week that it opened. I actually would never have found this spot, if a sponsored post didn't appear on my Instagram.

Anyways, I was hoping to find a Matcha Coconut Bubble Tea here (which is my all-time favorite) but there wasn't an option for that, and although the cup lids are cool, it's really hard to pop the straw through. Because there was no Matcha flavor, I ordered the Taro and Thai Tea flavors. Both were okay and sorta tasted the same as one another, and in my opinion, a little powdery. I will be getting my bubble tea elsewhere, but I hope to be back to try their rolled ice cream!

I've been coming here for tea and candles for years. Leo and Deb are the best; sometimes I go in and buy something just to tell them hi. The selection leans towards the eclectic, but it is a little more refined than other stores. There is a polish about the place that is very pleasant. You can get crystal balls, cauldrons, candles, teacups, little Buddhas...all manner of spiritual figurines. I highly recommend Aurora as a tarot reader.

Best bagel place in Indiana when it comes to the quality of the bagel. Most local restaurants who serve bagels on their menu get them from here. Closest thing to a NY bagel you will find in INDIANA. Family owned/operated for ever if I'm correct. Their smears are house made and amazing as well.

I'm new to the area so I'm just getting to know all the local poke places. The ingredients are good and very fresh. I was greeted as soon as I walked in and was in and out quickly. I will say they don't have as many topping options as other poke restaurants or maybe i didn't notice them all  because the toppings are not visible to customers. Other than that, I think everything was good and they even have cool special sushi donut and corn dog options.

Since microbrews have become so popular the last few years, breweries are popping up everywhere. Reno is no exception. IMBĪB is located in an inconspicuous building down the street from Jimboy's tacos (in case you need an afterparty snack) but is definitely worth the trip. They always have at least a dozen different brews on tap and the list is never too IPA heavy. In my opinion, I find that a lot of breweries can sometimes go too IPA heavy. How many IPAs do you need in one place?! Ales, porters, stouts, wheats, sours, they've got them all.  

The last time I visited IMBĪB they were featuring sours. Sours are my favorite! I was able to try 6 different ones in a flight and the raspberry was my favorite. To be honest, sour beer doesn't really have a beer-like flavor to me but it sure tastes good! The staff is very helpful if you need assistance choosing a brew and some are good as mixing flavors together. 

Wanna play some foosball and have a beer, get your growler filled, or just chill after a long day? Check em out!

4 stars because Danielle made my visit a little more personalized then the first lady I spoke with. She was very pleasant and great to work with. The first lady didn't seem to want to give me a temporary card...I almost felt as if I was bothering her and asking for too much. But I was stern with my decision that I did in fact want a temporary card instead of withdrawing money to last me until my new card came in the mail. This location is on the corner or Bearrss and 41, a few minutes away from 275. I'm not sure why this location only has 2 stars, I think from my short experience here, 3-4 stars is an appropriate rating. They just need to work on greeting costumers in a more cheerful manner :)!

This was our second time at the heavenly Diablo Burger. Once again, both the food and the service rocketed us straight into seventh heaven! The staff was attentive and efficient. My husband ordered the cheech and I had the db burger. The reason I chose the db burger was because I love egg in my burger. Wow, the db burger was heaven-sent! My husband also had nothing but praises for his burger. We shall return in the very near future!

What a pleasant surprise! This establishment is off Glendale, a little out of the way, but not so much that Would keep me from going back! Everything is freshly made with healthy ingredients. The staff is so friendly and helpful. I went there with the purpose of picking up donuts- 4 for me and 4 to #giftback. The owner(I presume) showed me their fridge with the pre-made meals and told me they also offer fresh lunches and breakfast burritos. What? Fresh, hot, healthy, breakfast burritos? I hadn't had breakfast. I'll take 2! ( Gotta feed the hubby!)  I had to wait about 5 minutes for them to be made, so we chatted. Most of their food is gluten free, and not full of stuff you can't pronounce. 
  Well, the burritos came with a drink and a cookie and were HUGE! My hubby and I shared one burrito- the other is being saved for tomorrow's breakfast! So delicious! Eggs, sausage, potatoes, onions, cheese in a spinach tortilla. 
 Oh yeah- the original reason for my visit and review- DONUTS!  First and foremost- yummy, cake donut with simple ingredients. You can definitely taste the applesauce. Not a bad thing. One of the 4 is chocolate, others are the same kinda applesauce cake flavor with different toppings. The cinnamon topping was my favorite. They are kinda heavy, but moist. If you are looking for an over-sugared, deep-fried donut, this ain't it.  If you want a tasty treat you won't feel guilty about, that won't argue with your digestive system, Mother of Macros is your place!

I debated writing this review for awhile but think it's important to share my experience. I went to this office about a year ago (10/17) and had a really negative experience. The office is really nice and had a lot of decorations but the doctor I saw was not good. I have a fear of dentists and let them know this in advance. I saw  Dr. Patel and he was really nice and comforting at first but it didn't last. After looking at my xrays and giving an exam he said he saw 4 main quadrants of concerns and that I would need to have fillings done. I asked how many cavities and he said "I don't want to freak you out so I don't want to give a specific number." I asked again and he still wouldn't give a specific number of cavities he saw but kept repeating that he saw areas of concern. I was speechless and didn't know how to respond. When I checked out they asked me to schedule my next appointment to get started on the cavities and I asked how many there were and she said 11. I was shocked. I didn't have any pain except minor pain in 1 tooth that was off and on. I was stunned and left to go back to work. I ended up calling back and talking to the receptionist (Danita) about how I thought it was unprofessional that he refused to tell me how many cavities I had. She repeatedly made excuses for him instead of hearing my concerns and talked over me. He ended up calling me back but I didn't want to talk to him because I felt the trust was already broken. I shouldn't have to get information from the receptionist because the doctor refuses to answer my questions. Also, if someone has a cavity it's billed per tooth so there should be transparency between the doctor and patient  so that the patient has an idea of how much everything is going to cost. 

I finally went to see another dentist who took new xrays and compared the xrays I had taken here. She saw no cavities only 2 teeth we need to watch and told me she was glad I didn't go back to this place.  The only thing I'm appreciative of is that they prescribed me toothpaste which I believe helped reverse some of the demineralization in my teeth. 

If you go here, please be careful or they might try to rip you off. I'm so grateful I decided to not come back here.

Ablett's Cleaners is fast, priced reasonably, and provides great customer service. If you are unsatisfied with clothes returned to you, this cleaners will clean your clothes again at no additional charge. There is no question that this facility provides a luxury service for a everyman's price. I recommend all to stop on by!

My fiancé loves her custom engagement ring! 
I didn't want to  get her something out of the case, because I couldnt risk getting her the same ring one of her freinds already has... Therefore I decided to have Kaplan's make her ring like no on else's. They helped me pick a diamond  and taught me about all the possible settings and once I made all the decisions, they provided a computer generated preview.  The ring was hit, she said yes and I still have money for wedding rings.

Was so happy I found out this place opened up after Khmer Kitchen closed down. Maybe my expectations were too high but it was a rather disappointing experience. I ordered my two favorite dishes - the grilled steak and lok lak (shaking beef stir fry) and both were over cooked and not as tender and flavorful as Khmer Kitchen. We asked for medium rare but half of the steak was well done and dry. Also, it took over 30 mins for our dishes to come out and although both dishes should've came with rice, they didn't bring it out until we asked. The rice was delicious though! Perhaps it's because it's still new, food and service were both a little disappointing. Definitely will try to come back to give it another chance!

Thanks Yelp fam for this one! It's a local hole in the wall that's serving up some delicious seafood. When we arrived at this located there were locals pouring into pick up call ahead orders, which confirmed this place is legit! 

The sauce was ginger licking good. The garlic buttery sauce is a house sauce that comes on all broiled orders. The sausage and potatoes were my favorite, but the seafood don't disappoint. Sorry i didn't snap a picture of the large pan of food first, I was soooo hungry! If you're in the area and want to have a laid back family gathering with a good movie, this is the place! Don't forget to grab plenty of napkins and wet wipes...can get a bit messy

The only reason for the 1 star is the wonderful wait staff - they were fantastic. We drove to NOLA for 8 hours and the first place we went to eat was Cafe Sbisa. We were so excited to have a wonderful experience. First off - the food was okay (a little bit bland, for what we expected) but it was not "bad". I had the gumbo of the day - it was fine. We ordered drinks as well - hurricane tasted like a juice blend for children, the champagne was warm - almost all drinks were bad, but most were drinkable. We returned two full drinks that were exceptionally terrible and instead of just taking them off the bill - the owner came to our table and was terribly aggressive and accused the table of coming in, trying drinks, and returning them for fun?? We're grown, polite, adults who spent $300+ at this place. Very strange and a terrible start to our trip.

This is the first time I let the boyfriend book everything for our trip. And with the hotel - not a bad choice. 

Check-in was quick and painless, and first impression of our room was decent - slightly dated beige decor, a small balcony, and a tiny bathroom with the sink outside by the front door (but it did its job). Our bed was super plush with smooth sheets and slightly squishy and flat pillows. Very thin walls - heard crying and screaming kids a few times a day in the hall and next door.

Pricey breakfast buffet (around $16/person), but decent choices. Eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, cold cuts, cheeses, fruit, sausage and gravy, French toast, pancakes, grits, oatmeal, and a wide selection of toasts and pastries. 

Pool is close by, and they make great daiquiris. I get that this is a family-friendly resort, but screaming kids seemed to vastly outnumber adults. Beach is a 5 minute walk away - sand is mostly shells unless the tide is low and the soft sand is exposed. Cabanas and umbrellas are available for rent at $25-ish a day. Ridiculous. Get a free towel from the kiosk at the pool.

Not a bad place to stay while in Clearwater.

I like this Mexican restaurant for what it is. Simple, quick, and quality. It's your typical no frills Mexican restaurant that is great for what it is. Food is good and service is quick and friendly. It is our new go-to Mexican restaurant after having some negative experiences at our old one. Everything I have gotten so far is great! They also have different drink and food specials each day.

Sunday brunch with endless bubbles. That's what I ordered this past weekend and got the surf and turf eggs benedict. For the bubbles you can choose blackberry sangria, Bellini or a mimosa.
 
I tried the sangria at first, but it was way too sweet, so I had my drinks switched to the mimosas. The eggs benedict and thin slices of filet and lobster along with the traditional hollandaise sauce on top of a poached egg and English muffin.

Very nice modern decor and very clean. My waiter was always there when I needed to place an order or ask for something else. The price of the food and all you can drink mimosas were reasonable at $19, which I thought was good because of the amount food and drinks given (unlimited drinks:-).

It's a good food and quick brunch for a decent price on Sundays.
Amazing tacos and anything else you order off the menu.  Seis Kitchen is the real deal. Plus it's in a killer atmosphere.  Make it a lunch or a dinner date. Seis is a Tucson gem.

Yesterday I went here for dinner with my boyfriend. The place is small, but great for couples if they want something romantic! When we got seated, the waiter served us bread, which was warm. I had the Linguine con Vongole, and it was delicious! However, it was a little bit too oily for me. And for dessert, we had the chocolate soufflé with vanilla gelato and whipped cream. It was great! We enjoyed the dessert a lot.

First, the food was very good.  One of our party was confused with the menu and ordered a philly  which came as a wrap.  The waitress offered to bring her a bun so she could fix it herself.  She declined and picked at it until an olde waitress with light colored hair came along and said "if you're done picking at that, I'll take your plate.  Surprised, she just pushed her plate away, and the waitress grabbed it and dumped the contents in the garbage.  When we finished, I went to the register to pay,  (mistake, the same waitress was there)  I asked about the philly, and she rudely showed me the menu, pointed 3 or 4 times to the word WRAPS.  I said ok and tried to pay.  She grabbed a cloth and said i'll be right back, and never returned.  I will go to my local Breakfast Station, But NEVER back to the New Port Richey location again.

Gloria
Zephyrhills, Fl

Disclaimer: If you have lived in LA or Portland or anywhere else where good gastro vegan can be found you will be slightly underwhelmed by this place, given the limited drink and food menu and frankly, this is not the place for strict vegans - if you want to get into the scrutiny of vegan vs. plant centric of honey and wine distillation methods etc...

That being said: it's pretty good.  

Service is great- friendly and quick. Only one suggestion I would offer would be for the waiters to be a bit more sensitive of the timing- our starter and mains came at the same time leaving the latter dish luke-warm upon eating. Also the water cups were a nice touch but never refilled and harder to get the waitresses attention as the restaurant filled.
 
The ambiance is sweet and casual enough to where your comfy clothes but trendy and cute enough to have a romantic date and for a nice dinner for two with a bottle of wine you are looking at about $100, not bad if you consider the other options in town.

For starters: The Cashew Nut Cheese Board, this is one of those things you order for your grandparents (or French friends) and just don't tell them it's vegan- the board is beautiful artistically composed pieces of dried fruit and nuts, fig and wine gel, a variety of tasty pickled bites and a couple varieties of sharp nut cheese sure to encourage any cheese lover to consider it worthy of a place on the coveted cheese board.

Mains: Portobello Mushroom Tacos- Good and sure this is a thing you could easily and cheaply ,make at home but what this dish lacks in uniqueness it makes up for in presentation- again beautifully plated, whole avocado, carrot shavings, onions and spices. Everything fresh that leaves you perfectly satiated and doing the happy tummy dance.
Flatbreads are all good but ehh could be missed.

All in all we left feeling happy and healthy at a price point that was reasonable ($85 for two- bottle of wine, starter, 2 Mains, no desert) . We will definitely be back to try desert and some more mains at which point will be sure update on hereJ

This place is really close to where I live and decided to go check it out. I am half Peruvian and have not been to a Peruvian restaurant since I moved here so I decided to go. The place was more on the smaller-med size on a plaza type of area. Aesthetics were more on the simple side from what I remember. I went around June when things were slightly opening up and I was having bad luck with restaurants due to all the changes with Covid. I came here because my friend wanted to try Peruvian food and I was REALLY IMPRESSED. The portion size, the quality, the ingredients were fresh, totally exceeded my expectations. The service was very attentive and friendly. I am so happy that the closest Peruvian restaurant to me is THIS TASTY.

This is the only Brazilian steakhouse I have ever been to, so how they operate was a bit of a shock. If you go here, come hungry and be prepared to feel the pain from gorging yourself on some fantastic meats. It really doesn't matter how much you eat, your plate will almost never be empty. They will keep coming around with something new every few minutes.

It is a steakhouse so they do excel at, what else, steak. With that said though, when they come around with some pineapple, give that bad boy a shot because it is worth it. The salad bar also has some good options with some excellent cheeses.

If you are coming here, do not worry about parking. Most of South Tampa has garbage parking and sometimes I find myself steering clear of this part of town just because I don't want this headache. This place has ample parking with overflow parking just a short walk away. All of the spaces are also easy to access as well.

Went to Hotbox for a quick lunch run. Had the cheese pizza + salad and I was pleasantly surprised (especially after a not-so-great pizza experience recently). There was about a 20 min wait from order until pick up, so I stood around and scrolled through IG and yelp (ha!). Upside = pizza wasn't greasy and the salad was loaded with cheese, tomatoes and the dressing was pretty great. Downside = salad had PEPPERONI ON IT. Why is that not put in writing somewhere??? As a no-porker, this was kinda gross to discover. Also, the salad blend was ice berg, so it wasn't anything to write home about. For six bucks and some change, it's a pretty good meal and I will probably branch out into the rest of their (expensive) menu when it's time to share a meal with friends.

Finally made it to Loco Ono for lunch today! We loved it!

I tried the Chicken Katsu with Curry (12.95)  - a twist on the classic island dish, panko-breaded, deep fried chicken thighs served on a bed of Japanese curry and two scoops of white rice and a side of one of the best mac salad's I've had! 
Bella had the Kids Chicken Katsu (6.95) - a smaller portion of the same chicken thighs over a white rice. My girl is super picky, but she loved this!

Next on the menu I want to try is the Hamachi Kama!! And of course the Poke too! mmmmm

Loco Ono sure isn't chintzy on their portions either! You'll definitely leave with a full belly of yumminess! If you haven't tried Loco Ono yet, you're missing out!

Great atmosphere! Greeted as we entered. If there is a wait, it is worth it! Seated in a much shorter time than told. We ordered Macncheese bites, Cali Bowl with tuna, Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, and a House salad with chicken; all delicious. Would have ordered the hanging, massive soft pretzel, but trying to watch my calorie intake. Lol! Excellent selection of beer (duh!) and drinks. Our server, Alaina, was absolutely fantastic. Alaina was very personable and efficient.  Prices are reasonable as well. If you haven't been to WOB, what are you waiting for?!?!

Reservation can be difficult to snag, but the location is great if you are downtown or have visitors. It's in the new fifth and broadway outdoor mall space. Great spot to sit and people watch as well. The food is not authentic Mexican, but it's still flavorful and delicious! The inside of the restaurant is beautiful, it doesn't feel crowded, and service has been great both times I've been.

I'm having the same experience as the other posters.  After having a great sales experience while IN the store, it's been more than 14 days work to get the delivery arranged.  I'm astonished that even after reaching the sales manager who promised a prompt resolution, it's been another four days of no follow up.  Plus, after trying to call many times, each responsible person's voice mailbox is full and I can't even leave a message.  

Unfortunately, they already charged my credit card or I'd cancel.  It's turned a great experience into an unpleasant one.  I hate having to make a dozen calls when one should have done it.  

I wouldn't shop here until I could carry the item out with me.  (Not to feasible when selling large appliances.)
Kudos to the wonderful lady who delivers my mail rain or sun. I wouldn't be able to do the job she has and i respect her for doing it every day

I am still very confused after eating here and that's not a bad thing. I'm the typical "New York and North Jersey have the best pizza no questions about it." Which I still stand by but this place was so good I'm giving it a 4star. For one the slices are HUGE literally like 2 slices put together... so I got 2 slices. One plain and one white with bruschetta which was killer. This isn't NY style pizza it is pretty thick and they LOAD the toppings on which is good for me because it's very filling. The crust it's cooked PERFECTLY not the typical south jersey raw dough slice that you eat because you feel like you have to. This was marbled with charred crust and probally wouldn't have held up like it did without it. I am very impressed and had Pats at another location before and was very disappointed. This one made up for it tenfold... the staff was really awesome too. I will be back.

My friend and I had a wonderful late night dinner at Bistro! I ordered a short stack with bacon. She ordered the apple cinnamon pancakes. Both were equally delicious! The pancakes were warm, fresh, and covered in powdered sugar. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. We will be back again to try some of the other yummy options!

Such good food! To my surprise, you can make reservations (which we didn't know at the time) so just a tip when going on the weekends because they were busy!! I felt like I was eating at a French bistro  the food is very authentic and is well made with great ingredients. One of the better brunch spots we've had!

Food was awesome! The atmosphere was awesome! It's a old farmhouse with the charm of days gone by. Not to say that the place is run down, it very well maintained. Six of us met for dinner and drinks. The bar area is small, doesn't need to be large because the place can't handle a big crowd. That's the great part, its not mobbed. It is off the beaten path so it is out in the middle of nowhere. But it worth the trip. All six meals were cooked perfectly and the service time was just right. The waitress was very friendly and had a good sense of humor. The back room had an original walk in fireplace. Great experience, great food.

The service is impeccable.  I don't think I've ever seen such good service at a restaurant this busy before.  We had a large group, and everything was executed flawlessly.  Everyone raved about their food, and I think the menu was more or less covered between everyone.  I had the tofu with spinach, mushrooms, and a mushroom tartelette thing, which was quite tasty and ample.  And it was priced reasonably.  They know their tofu.  The Mesh salad was worthy of the signature designation.  And, the cheeses on the charcuterie plate were all very tasty.  

The wine list is respectable, and the beer list features some local beers (I had a porter), and even Bells (!).

I'd definitely return.

I ended up here.  I am an idiot.  Who the hell goes to a place like this?  An idiot. (Me) that is who.  well--  shots were about 7 bucks a pop--  poorly made with little to no liquor.  The music.  bad 80's metal.  Until it was time to leave then they played Eve 6 Closing Time and that kind of crap to drive everyone away.  My friends and I got stuck sitting in a back corner underneath a speaker.  Oi.

I had already covered in my Elite Event (http://www.yelp.com/biz/yelp-elite-event-at-boot-and-saddle-philadelphia) review how my not going to see a show at Boot & Saddle yet was basically a gross asinine mistake on my part that I had to rectify ASAP. So when I saw that We Are Scientists (love them!) were playing 2 shows back to back, I decided to check at least one out, and hit up the bar for a bite to eat and couple drinks before the show. And when it comes down to it The Boot might not just be the best smaller scale music venue in Philly, its also the best venue to enjoy a meal at!

from the GIANT boot sign out front; to bull ropes, full wooden tables, and elaborate cowboy art; the decor is full on wild wild west. And whats even more amazing about it is how faithful and unchanged the R5 Productions/Four Corners Management crew kept it from the bar's old school line dancing days. Add in the spot on service and you have some flawless ambiance which carries over in the impressive food and drink menu, and you have a winning destination.

For the first bite we were completely amazed by the fried beef chips, which were essentially tiny country fried steaks among a plate slathered in green onion jam and house made ketchup. Good to the last bite and a hard one to resist licking the entire plate clean afterwards! While I was VERY tempted to revisit the octopus that I savored at the Elite Event, or join my dining partner in digging into the decadent pierogies with  cheddar, beef kielbasa, caramelized onions, and creme fraiche; I couldn't help but find myself drawn to the turkey burger. Normally I find myself disliking the dryness of turkey burgers compared to regular or veggie. But the combination of duck fat and chili relish managed to give it a bit of heat and pizzazz that was balanced out by the tang of the roasted apple mayo. Add in fries and a house pickle that could have been just a touch crisper, and I was left pleasantly fulfilled.

The beer list has plenty of favorites from the likes of Elysian and Ommegang on draft, as well as a widespread selection of cans that are perfect to take in for a show. The cocktail list manages to bring out the best in Art in the Age's standards, but the bartenders are capable of mixing on the fly as needed. The sound for the venue is absolutely flawless and among the best in the city, and the close proximity to the stage that you can maintain leads to the making of plenty of memorable concert moments in the making.

So our first night in Reno, we were pretty exhausted from snowboarding and we just wanted a nice meal to charge us back up. We walked over here from our hotel so the location was not far from Silver Legacy. The place is pretty small and not that busy when we arrived at 6pm. We ordered our drinks and got a free appetizer (thanks to foursquare), they gave us bread also which was not bad and the appetizer came out, but after that I seriously dont know what was up with our dinner!? it took almost 45 mins to an hour for our food to come back. Seriously was there only one cook in the back? 

And when the food finally came out lets just say it wasnt great, my gf's scallops in her salad were still raw and not seared correctly and the dressing was oily, lets say Chef Ramsey would of threw those scallops in the garbage!!!  We actually had to complain about it which the server was nice enough to change out the salad for a brand new one (this time the scallops were cooked alright but still not that great) the sprite she first got was flat almost like a tonic water, then the second one she got was fizzy but just tasted funny). my two friends who ordered the steak dish were totally not pleased both ordered medium rare but had two inconsistent steaks and meat that didnt come out piping hot, almost as if it was sitting under a lamp until the other dishes were ready. the meatloaf dish was okay, lobster ravioli was nothing special, and my free range chicken was probably the only decent dish there.

the service was pretty good which probably only reason why my friends didnt complain about our meal, the server even took off the gratuity for our party but we still gave him the tip he deserved but for the restaurants food itself it was LACKING big time! honestly for the prices it was definitely not worth it. We even noticed other tables who had complained about how their food was cooked, so I dont think we were the only ones not satisfied with our meal that night.
Dr. Kristen was awesome. Very informative and seemed like she cared. Nurses were very polite and offered water. Was in and out in an hour.

My fiance proposed in April with a ring from Barsky. I couldn't have done better if I had picked out the ring myself - it was exactly what I wanted! 

Fast forward several months. The ring has always been loose, but over the winter it has been looser than ever so I knew I had to get it resized, and quickly. I brought the ring to Barsky the day before Valentine's Day, because I like to torture people. Kidding, but I happened to be in the area so I made a stop, knowing I would most likely have to leave the ring for several days. I was told it would take about a week. When I mentioned that I had an event to attend on the following Wednesday, the gentleman helping me said he would get it done in time.

I called on Wednesday and sure enough, my ring was ready for pick-up. The end result was stunning. Not only does the ring fit perfectly but it looks like it is back to its original condition - all sparkly and shiny! We'll be heading back to look at wedding bands and I'm looking forward to that experience as well.

I've spent many a weekend afternoon browsing the selections at Vintage Vinyl. It's a St. Louis institution, hands down!

Have you ever been there when PBR is hosting a special event? Free tall boys and live music can't be beat! 

Usually they have the selections that I'm looking for. And then some. Which makes it difficult to go in here for just one album. I usually end up leaving with three or four, even if I went in here "just to look". Such a sucker for cheap CD's.

I agree with Richard C that in an era of digital music, stores that sell CD's and records are taking a hit. But Vintage Vinyl seems to be doing OK despite the technology shift - because at the end of the day, we all like to have a gathering place to listen to, talk about and enjoy good music!

A huge fan of this place for years! The happy hour (offered every day) is one of the best in town. Raw oysters cost a little more these days, but the frozen drinks are a great deal and are deceptively strong, which is nice because you get a lot of bang for your buck! Brunch, as other reviewers have noted, is probably the best meal here, but I went for dinner last night and it was a good experience. I've forgotten our server's name, but she was so cheerful and took great care of us. Our group shared charbroiled oysters, crawfish beignets, and stuffed mushrooms. My entree was the steak salad, which for $19 had a fair amount of steak on it. It comes with Gorgonzola dressing which was delicious- and I love Gorgonzola- but oh MY there was a LOT of dressing! It's hard to fault them for being generous with dressing, but if you prefer lighter dressing, order it on the side. Location is unbeatable, great for people watching and on the streetcar line. Nice outdoor space also. I'm a regular!
I love this place! Nice inviting and clean store! Lots of different cupcakes and pies selection.  The mini pecan pie is FANTASTIC!! the crust is so light and fluffy.   Staff is very nice.

I really don't have much to say other than does everyone in what they consider to be a hip coffee shop have to be pretentious?  You make coffee you're not a barista unless you're in Italy.  Barista's in Italy wear vests and are clean shaven not hippie-ish so if you want the title then man up to the vest.  

Coffee good and whats to be expected but not like OMG I can't live without it.  I would only stop for the convenience of it but that's about it.

*Real* frozen yogurt, fresh delicious toppings, pleasant service, and an eco-friendly Euro vibe. Yum.

A little more info by request of monica s.:

So far, they have only had one flavor of yogurt (plain). Since it is probiotic (contains active cultures) it has a tangy, even slightly bitter taste which is probably offputting to some people. But, as it turns out, this is what actual yogurt is supposed to taste like.

The toppings are what make the experience special. There are several sauces, including a really lovely pistachio sauce, but the hands-down winner is the dark chocolate sauce. Heaven.

In addition to the sauces, there is an array of toppings including fruit, nuts, granola, and shredded coconut. The fruit is all fresh, as evidenced by the sight of someone standing at the back table chopping fruit every time I have been in the place.

My personal favorite combo is the dark chocolate sauce and chopped hazelnuts...basically re-creating the flavor of Perugina Baci candy.

Thanks for making me describe this. I am now salivating and Yogorino is closed for the night.
I could drink the Cajun Ranch dressing right out of a cup.  It would be gross, but I would do it.

First time evah at Jacques in zee boques.

Super friendly counter service. Highlight for sure. My husband insisted I try his fave ultimate bacon jack. The lovely lady behind the counter got me to get the curly fries. Definitely good advice. 

The curly fries are way better than regular. The burger was an odd cross between a Wendy's baconater and a Super Sonic bacon burger. The mustard makes it in my book.

I'm sure my husband will have me stop again on the way home.

Awesome beer selection, nice inside dining, perfect back porch, flavorful food from pizzas to burgers. $2 off select beers for happy hour, meaning you could find a beer for as cheap as $4.50!
I hate to complain about this place because I love the environment. But, the one thing that bothers me is the service. They never seem to be smiling, excited or happy to be working.

This museum isn't going to be for everyone. You have to have a passion for the medical field in some capacity, and then it's a win. For $5, the entry fee ($4 for students) is a steal and well worth it. 

I was going to pay cash, but only had a $20 and they told me they couldn't break it, so I paid with a card. 

I spent over an hour here exploring and learning about the field I work in, and mainly it's history. The time I visited, on a Saturday afternoon, there was no tour guide and I walked through the museum at my own pace. 

This museum isn't interactive, but there is more than enough to see and to to keep your interest. Here, you can learn the history on Dentistry, optometry, obstetrics and more. 

In total, I spent about an hour to an 1.5 hours here and left with so much history to share with my work friends. This museum isn't large, it's the size of a house, but I read through everything they have on display. 

To the museum, I adore you, but I highly recommend a deep cleaning. There was dust everywhere and the displays needed some obvious TLC. 

I don't think this museum is handicap assessable as most exhibits were on the second floor, but I could have missed an elevator. 

I highly recommend stopping in for a visit next time you are in NOLA.

Not as enamored of this place as everyone else seems to be. It was just alright. 

We ordered a lighter dinner of dan dan noodles and wonton soup with a side of dumplings in chili oil. The best of the 3 was definitively the dumplings. The wonton broth had good flavor but the dumplings could only be described as weak. Weak on flavor with a super soft dough. The boyfriend liked the dan dan noodles but I didn't. We wish they were spicier. I didn't really care for the texture but he enjoyed it.  

Delivery was pretty quick so that's a big plus. I'd give it another shot perhaps. I need to get a better ideal of other delivery in the area before I will make a repeat stop.

Rude staff, over priced pizza. I watched them try to kick out a girl and then try and steal her credit card. She had to call the cops. They then gave her a bunch of crap about not wearing a mask when for some reason everyone In the whole store was mask less. The manager is a jerk and the rude girl behind the counter that looks like a good rat with a birthmark on her face needs to chill the duck out. She is lucky the cops never showed up for theft

The attitude of the waiter was, "who gives a care!!" 
*Table was sticky
*Food was warm to cold
*Hamburger was overcooked and tasted bad.
*The bingo caller in drag, was a, drag-hag.
*Bad jokes and insults to the 55 and over crowd by saying most lived in a mobile home which is basically a tin can held together with band aids.

I gave two stars because I like playing bingo, but the service and food was not good.  They add their own tips so I doubt this will change....

My sister is an artist so I know what it takes to create art. I write. So I know my limitations when it comes to creating visual, not verbal, "art." Painting With a Twist is an idea that intrigued me. I doubted my own abilities. I figured I would probably worry too much about following instructions. I knew I would fail on some level. I still have clay pots I made in elementary school so I know what I am capable of, or not, even with art instruction.

Instead I left with a feeling of achievement and a painting that surprised me. In a good way.

Participating in a group painting event at the newly opened Painting with a Twist in Carrollwood was definitely fun but it was also fascinating to find out firsthand how the instructor can take something that can be really daunting to people and make it so do-able.

It was a friendly, informal and really relaxing experience. Lots of humor, good music and, for some, good wine all contributed to the festive feel that went a long way towards eliminating any apprehensions.

The instruction is minimal but that is the point. The instructor, for lack of a better word, describes and demonstrates what to do but the interpretation is really up to you. Rather than trying to get people to duplicate an idea or copy a painting, the real fun is in liberating participants to fearlessly try, boldly experiment and unleash their inner, more unconventional artist.

This is a great activity for individuals, couples, groups and just anyone who likes art, admires art but has never really considered themselves capable of creating art. 

I can't wait to go back and be a little more fearless and really allow myself to think outside the box and color outside the lines.

Have had my hair dyed many times at this student staffed salon/school.  The price is good.  On my latest visit I asked to have my hair dyed.  Price was $25.00 as listed on their price display board at the front desk.  Student who did my hair did an excellent job.  When she brought out the the bowl with the hair dye it looked low to me, but I stupidly did not say anything.  My hair is cut just above my jaw line.  Well after she covered up the roots she needed more of the dye and told me it would be $10 for an extra bowl.  I said I have had my hair colored many times at this salon and never was there a need for a second bowl of color.  She said the color is mixed by the instructors.  I said I noticed the bowl was low.  She said yes, it did look low to her, but students do not mix the color, the instructor does.  Please note this person did apply the color correctly.  At the same time a women across the room who was also having her hair colored was asking the same thing why do I need and have to pay for a second bowl of color when I never have in the past.  IT IS OBIVIOUS THEY ARE PUTTING LESS COLOR IN THE BOWL.  When I left and paid my bill with a credit card including the extra $10 for the second bowl of color, I asked the cashier if they are putting less color in the bowl.  She said oh no, no.  I said yes the amount is less.  She said I needed to speak to a Manager.  There were several people waiting so I left and called Empire Beauty School and Salon the next day and spoke to the Manager.
She insisted the amount of color has not changed, and she mixed the color herself personally.  I asked why  the first bowl seem to be filled more than the first, she said it wasn't.  I told her it visibly was.  She also said maybe I need more dye if my roots had grown longer.  I told her this does not make sense since I always  have my whole head colored and my hair has acutally been longer in the past , and only one bowl was used.  I suggested perhaps she made a mistake on measuring the first bowl, but she said that she did not.  I told her I would let my credit card company pay the $25 but would be disputing the $10 for the second bowl.  She told me to do what I have to do and to have a nice day.  IF YOU HAVE EXPERIENCED THE SAME PROBLEM PAYING FOR A SECOND BOWL WHEN YOU DID NOT IN THE PAST, PLEASE POST YOUR EXPERIENCE HERE.  Also,  why is it the students do not have disinfectant to clean there combs, brushes, etc after each use???  Why do they not soak your nails during a manicure.  Are they sterilizing the tools???  I will have to research these facts with the State of Pa. Dept. of Health and or Insurance.  One last note,  the Manager said they mix 2 ounces of color and 2 ounces of the activator for a total of 4 ounces.  I will be calling other salons to see if this is the amount they use.  MY ADVICE TO YOU IS TO ASK THEM IF ONE BOWL IS ENOUGH TO DO YOUR HAIR BEFORE YOU HAVE YOUR HAIR HALF COVERED WITH COLOR.  DON'T LET THEM GIVE YOU A LINE SAYING THEY DON'T KNOW AND EVERYONE'S HAIR IS DIFFERENT. A WELL TRAINED STYLIST SHOULD KNOW.  
CC:LEGAL FILE
CC:STATE OF PA/ DEPT. OF HEALTH

Aight, you dont have a lot of options in the airport hotel district and this one isn't bad if you order what the waitress recommends.  She said to stick with the burgers or crabcake and try the asparagus appetizer. Sounds wierd but we took her advice, the asparagus was grilled and topped in parm and pine nuts, there were also in a lemon sauce that was nice. Goes to show vegetables can be fun when covered in other things.  Grant got the crabcake which he had trouble fitting into his mouth but he enjoyed it when he did. I got the burger because I wasnt feel like risky. Burger was decent, (4 stars if you want to run to vegas and marry fried onion straws). I wouldnt go out of my way to find this place but the food isnt bad.
Like this place for breakfast.  Haven't been for anything else.  Breakfast was pretty creative.  We ate outside which was nice because it was a beautiful NOLA day

*******4.5*******
I found this restaurant thanks to the N.O. yelp elite page...I made 7pm reservations for a Saturday, we got there at 6 and were seated immediately without prob. One of the hostesses complimented how pretty we all looked, so that's why I'm giving them 5 stars...J/p...or maybe not. Our waitress was friendly and helpful. We ordered small plates only, to sample some of everything: fries w/ the pickled okra dipping sauce, pork belly steam buns, chicken & mushroom gumbo, squash salad, and boudin balls. My fave was the gumbo, then the boudin balls. The pork belly was a little salty and it only came w/ one. That was a turn off and should've been listed on the menu. The gumbo however was filling and flavorful, it came w/ mashed potatoes in the center. Yum yum! The squash salad was perfectly light and flavorful. What was weird however was they didn't have any to-go containers...our waitress packed our leftover gumbo in a paper coffee cup. Tacky. Another waiter gave us free mixed shots from the bar because my mom was nice and helped him locate the wine glasses next to us (he couldn't see them because they were low). They have a daily HH, then another on weekdays from like 11:30-3:30 where they serve 0.75 cent martinis w/ a 3/pp max. I wish I could've partaken in that. I wish our food would have all came out at once at the end, because it seemed like it took forever. That could def be just how I was feeling because I was super hungry, but wudeva.

I came here over the weekend right before the dinner rush at about 5pm. It was pretty empty when we arrived and plenty of parking and open tables. We were greeted once entering the restaurant and seated as well. For a Korean bbq joint this place is very clean and it doesn't have that meat lingering smell like some Korean bbq places do. Now let's get to the food...

Me and my girl both order the dinner ayce (all you can eat) which was a decent price. We started off with the spicy pork belly and the miso pork belly. Honestly the spicy pork belly was well seasoned but the miso didn't really have a taste. Next was a round of seafood which consisted of shrimp, octopus and calamari. Out of those three the calamari was our favorite. Very tender and well seasoned. I'll definitely recommend the calamari if you're into that! Last but not least was a round of beef. The highlight was the boneless beef short ribs. Soooo good! I ordered about 3 more times of that because the portions here are small which is a good thing. Helps you not waste food and also gives you the opportunity to try different things. Shout out to our waitress, she's was amazing and was A1 the whole light! This Korean bbq place had the best customer service out of any ayce Korean bbq I've been too! That says a lot! So if you're around Sparks be sure to give them a try and don't
forget to try the boneless beef short rice. You won't be disappointed!

Since this was showcased on one of the food network shows, I had to try it when I was in town. Their crepes was noted on "Best things I ever Ate". I couldn't resist but venture into this crowded, congested area and try it. 

The decor is gorgeous. Designs are very reminiscent of a typical fancy European cafe. (I'd get rid of the fans though....huge eyesore in a gorgeous restaurant). When coffee is ordered, a cute white cow comes alongside it holding milk. How adorable is that?!

Here, you can design your own crepes with a multitude of ingredients or you can order their predesigned ones. I went with the nutella, bananas, and roasted almonds. I wished they had more nutella...but it was pretty good. 

I had to try a savory one...so i went with mushrooms, cheese, and roasted almonds. This was super yummy!!! The bright flavors and cheesy gooeyness was heavenly with each bite! 

I also snagged a bite of the lemon sorbet and berries crepe. The tart sorbet meshed nicely with the sweet berry sauce! 

We also ordered the french onion soup. Wish there was a bit more cheese and maybe a hair less salt. Otherwise, great flavor! You'll need a nice tall glass of water to go with it!

I came on a Saturday noon..and there's no wait. Although, I heard it's wise to make reservations just in case. 

Service was great. Friendly, attentive waitress only added to a great experience. She knew we were splitting the crepes between the kids, so she brought them out in separate plates without me asking. 

I did have to take a star off for their high prices and parking problems. If you're lucky you'll find street parking, otherwise, you'll have to pay 10$ to park in a lot a block away. 


Still...it's worth 10$ to park in a lot and walk in the misty rain for a good crepe!

Great building with a great story to tell. I really enjoyed the museum since I have a passion for Revolutionary war history and my better half and kids are Jewish. It is definitely geared to the older teens and not very kid friendly. Prepare for some reading, if you have been to the Holocaust Museum you know what I mean.This is a one visit museum I cant see returning unless they have a special exhibit or a great speaker. Admission is $12 for adults which is a good value.Go you will like it. I would allow 2 good hours

The best thing about Landry's is the view of the lake.  We tend to go for Sunday brunch or an early afternoon dinner specifically because of the view.

This latest visit I wasn't quite that hungry, so I thought I would try their fried shrimp po-boy with fries.  I like their fried shrimp and fried catfish so I thought the sandwich would be a good bet.  Wrong.  It wasn't made with French bread.  I don't know what type of bread it was, but the sandwich fell apart before I could finish half of it.  The shrimp was good as I expected, but the experience left me a little frustrated.  My wife wanted to try something different from the avocado & crabmeat salad she often has, so she ordered the fried shrimp & fish platter with baked sweet potato, loaded.  I don't think she was expecting a large baked sweet potato treated like a giant Idaho spud, just oozing with butter, sour cream, etc.  We shared the fried green tomatoes with crawfish as the appetizer.  It was as good as always.

We've been working our way through the dessert tray (we share one rather than each get our own).  Our streak ended.  We picked one that we weren't happy with.  The key lime pie just doesn't measure up; especially compared to memories of the other desserts we have tried.  Just about any other dessert on the tray is worth the money.

This particular meal was a 3 star affair, but I would rate most meals I've eaten there as a 4 star, so I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt.

My husband and I were craving wings and decided to try this place. Even though it was 2 pm, it was fairly busy and Elyse looked a little understaffed--but, she managed to handle all service very well (and with a great attitude). 
I wish more restaurants carried trashed wings in STL. Instead, Elyse suggested we try ordering regular wings extra crispy with the sauce on the side. Great suggestion, and this will be our backup plan going forward. They were excellent and their wing sauce was perfect, and not too hot. My husband ordered the same, however I got a small Caesar and he got the small house salad beforehand. Both salads were very good and we order them again. 
Can't wait to return, thank you!

Came here for lunch after a recommendation. Variety of items for lunch but dinner is fried chicken only! I ordered the pork tenderloin sandwich with slaw or chips, I chose slaw. The sandwich is actually called Icehouse Tenderloin which I assume is beer-battered in such. Anywho, the sandwich was good, not great. The bartender offered mayo since it had no sauce, so make sure to ask. The slaw however did offer a slight surprise as I noticed a minor spice too it. Definitely hoping to comeback & try "THE WHOLE DAMN THING!"(see pics) as they are popularly known for their fried chicken, but would need a possè to conquer it! 

P.S.-Thought it was odd, they didn't have straws but that's just me.

I had to return an Amazon package this morning. I left the package and went back home to e-mail the labels that I left behind. They had no problem keeping the package at the store. He sent it once he received the labels via email. There was no charge for his great service.

I don't get art. I realize that's a pretty broad statement, and that art is a subjective medium but art galleries aren't really my thing. I look at a painting and usually the things that come to my mind are adjectives like; neat, weird and thoughts such as, "I like that colour of blue paint." I'm never able to comprehend what an artist is trying to say about himself/herself or society in general. 

Despite this I've been to the new Art Gallery of Alberta three times. Once with a friend after it first opened. Then to check out the Escher and Looney Tunes exhibit, and finally again with another friend to see the Andy Warhol exhibit. 

I love that Edmonton has such a beautiful and unique space to display art from all over the world. I think the AGA has done a great job of bringing in art exhibits that will attract a wide range of people, from art aficionados, to people like me who don't really get art. There's an art area for kids, more traditional art, and even interactive art. One of my favourite exhibits on my last visit was the interactive silver cloud exhibit. I don't know what it was supposed to mean, but it was fun.  

Adult admission is $12.50 but if you're a student or senior you'll only pay $8.50. Alternatively you can check out the AGA on the last Thursday of each month from 6pm to 8pm when admission is free. However; the free night gets busy, so if you like to take your time looking through a gallery and/or you want to avoid crowds then this won't be your best choice.  

You can drive to the AGA and park at a nearby parkade, like the one at the library. But I recommend taking the LRT because the AGA is right next to Churchill Station. Take the escalator from the platform of the lrt station and at the top you'll see the entrance that goes to the AGA. 

The AGA has a restaurant, Zinc, which I haven't been to. There's a rooftop space with different sculptures. It's not a huge, but day it give a nice view of Churchill Square and city hall. Plus the standard gift store featuring a variety of souvenirs, including postcards of the when the AGA was being built (which I thought was kinda neat). They also have souvenirs relating to the exhibits that are occurring at the time, books, and products from local artists, like Sushi Papercraft journals (disclaimer: I know the artist behind Sushi Papercraft but I still really love the journals). 

The next time I come to the AGA I'm going to book a tour to learn more about what I'm seeing. Maybe I'll finally understand art, and maybe it'll always be something I don't really get. Either way I'll come back to the AGA and have a nice time trying to figure it out.

Made the trek across the High Level Bridge to try out Noorish. We had made reservations online and so we got seated right away. After that the service took a while to get back to us to take our orders. We shared the slider appetizers and I had the pad thai, while my wife had the mac and cheese. By far the sliders were the best part of the meal so I was looking forward to my pad thai. Unfortunately I was a bit underwhelmed and a bit let down. After a great appetizer, the pad thai was more like rice noodles with vegetables and an almond sauce and not pad thai. The dish itself was all right but nothing to rave about. My wife's mac and cheese was like comfort vegan food. Overall, I'm still interested in the Bodhi Burger since the sliders were pretty good, but I won't need to get the pad thai next time. One other thing... I'm not sure if room temperature water is a vegan thing or a yoga thing but I've never been served that at a restaurant before, at least in North America. Not sure if it'll catch on.

Wow! I had the lunIch special today- Goat Soup. Normally i'm not a fan of digging bones off meat in my soup, but I'll gladly, happily and heartily order again. Delicious broth, steaming hot as he made it right there in front of me in a to-go container. i savored each spoonful and the goat meat was so delicate and good. it comes with a huge portion of rice which I also scooped some of into the soup- that worked very well for me. For $5.99, you can't beat the lunch price. It looks like it is something different everyday. I'll look forward to my next day off to come and try another dish. Pleasant, friendly environment, I'll probably dine in next time and try more dishes. Dinners are VERY reasonably priced as well.

This is truly a hidden gem just off Bourbon street down in the French Quarter! 

We came here for a late supper after a ghost tour. Our tour guide suggested we come here because he eats here often for lunch. We didn't feel like a sit down place and to be honest we were tired and wanted a sandwich to go. 

Do NOT let looks be deceiving. This doesn't look like mug from the outside. It's small and very unassuming. When you walk in it looks a convenience store, but then you go to the back and it is a deli. 

They have just about everything there. Po-boys, sandwiches, chicken, cold salads, hot salads, dinner platters and more. Everything I saw looked great and the portions are huge and price is great, especially being directly off Bourbon. 

We got a muffuletta sandwich and it was GREAT!!! The bread was fresh, the meat was great and the olive salad was some of the best I have ever had. It was big and more than enough for two people to split. We were really happy with it.

Go here, eat here, you'll be happy here. Great place.

District: No PBR Or Bud. That's okay! Ask for the "F..K You" drink ($5). Ask for James the bartender and tell him I sent you. You can get a Miller Highlife and a shot for $3 here. Nice bar. Bring your I.D. because they will check. Play some pool, smoke on the outdoor patio.

My husband and I stumbled across this place while exploring the French Quarter. It seemed only fitting that we go in since my husband works in this field.
 
Not your typical museum. Mostly because it's in the actual 1st licensed pharmacy in the US.  It even has an original soda fountain (not functional).  The cost to take a self-guided tour is $5. My only complaint would be that the guy sitting behind the counter was rude. When we walked in he didn't say hello, he just looked up from his book and said "It's $5."
 
Regardless of Mr. Curt-door-guy, we found this place very interesting. The downstairs looks like one of those old pharmacies that you'd see in a black and white movie. There are a ton of old tools (don't touch), and things like leeches and other odd items. The shelves on the wall are all labeled with medicinal herbs, some are still full.
 
If you go upstairs, they have some larger exhibits, books, and of course more ingredients.
 
If you're interested in this kind of stuff, definitely pop in.

Nice little brewery off the beaten path. 

Though the location is fairly hidden from the road, this brewery is still very popular and is full of customers each time I visit. As it does tend to get busy at times, I try to come during off hours (before 5pm during the week). 

The dining room was recently moved to a larger suite in the same business plaza and is so nice and spacious with its own bathrooms - something that the old spot didn't have. There are plenty of places to sit both inside and out. The parking situation is kind of awkward so I'd recommend parking around on the outer perimeter of the plaza. 

There are a great variety of beers on tap and I've tried a few. I'm a fan of the Vortex IPA as well as the 20,000 Leagues nitro stout. Very refreshing on a warm afternoon. 

I look forward to coming back soon.

Ordered delivery from CK hawaiian BBQ. My first impression was that the menu doesn't represent traditional hawaiian food but still had many great sounding options. Delivery time was a little long but nothing unusual. I tried 3 sides and 3 different meats. The short ribs were by favorite among the meats and the general's chicken was the least enjoyable as the sauce was very thick and generally tasted like store quality. Sweet potato fries were not crispy at all but were surprisingly not bad despite that. Fried rice was unimpressive and a bit bland. Overall it's a spot worth trying but the food alone is just okay.

Horrible service. I know it's a Saturday night night and you only have drive thru open but good customer service is still expected. They had two cars. My mom went for me. She ordered 2 piece leg with Cole slaw and drink. They didn't have two legs so she supposed to be given a leg and thigh. No problem. The other one was 4 piece strips with cole slaw and drink. Asked for bbq sauce was told only have honey mustard. She said that was fine. 

She came home with the correct chicken but no sauce and mashed potatoes. And no receipt to prove what I paid. We went back to get it fixed. I asked if she could redo it all since everything was cold. Now the strips and sides were correct but they had no dark meat. It's a Saturday night between 7:30 and 8:00 pm. She got wings. Now we got all kinds of dipping sauce (was out of them a few mins ago). When I asked him f she could redo the order so everything was hot, she got an attitude, rolled her eyes and threw the bag on the counter. You might be wearing a mask but we can still hear the grunt and see the eyes roll. I still did not get a receipt; said they were out of paper. Some people like to have proof of payment. 

Last few times we've had either bad service or/and food. But when we do get the order right, it's good.

I love Chipotle so much no matter which store I go to, so any possible glitches are minor to me, although this particular location did goof up on us once on an order and we came up one burrito short.  Still, a pleasant, receptive staff, and excellent food that is a great alternative to the other fast food and fried joints that seem to have a monopoly in this area.  Finally, healthy food!!  It may be pricier but you don't need a lot of it in order to be satisfied.  I hate soda so I love how they allow you to get cups for water. I love Chipotle!!! (Did I mention that already?!)

These happy hour devours come all the way from a rare jade stone in Chinatown. @daynnitephilly is a premier Hookah, Karaoke , and bar! This modern hip-hop/streetwear establishment brings you a dope graffiti wall thank gives off a hip hop Chinatown NYC subway vibe. Their happy hour is from 5pm-8pm  This establishment is the perfect size to hold a small yet extravagant event. They do offer both indoor and outdoor dining. They also allow bar seating and section seating. The bathrooms are really clean And they are both unisex. The drinks are very creative yet intriguing. The food menu is simply astonishing! My big bro @eldee_arr is the master chef of this establishment and he brings his own twist on urban cuisine which is absolutely delicious. While here, I ordered the henny lemonade in both passionfruit and strawberry flavors. Both were super good and you can barley taste the alcohol . For food I ordered the fried shrimp with french fries and the infamous chicken Cesar salad . The shrimp and fries were seasoned perfectly and they were huge! The salad was dumb delicious with a burst of flavor in every bite! The blueberry mint hookah was also good! Wasn't too strong at all; and easy to puff on . If you ever find yourself in Chinatown wanting to escape please check out this dope establishment @daynnitephilly and check out the big bro @eldee_arr perfected dishes! Oh and duh  tell them that shimmy sent you!  #philadelphia #philly #chinatown #drinks #hookah #hookahlounge #hennessy #strawberry #passionfruit #shrimp #fries #frenchfries #friedshrimp #salad #cesarsalad #blueberry #mint #water #foodphilly #food #foodie #foodphotography #foodstagram #foodporn #goodeats #brother #vibes  #bar

I went to City Works for my birthday on a humbug because the wait for Founding Farmers was way too long for the party of 13 I had accompanying me. We were seated within just a few minutes. I'm so glad we choose to eat there instead because in hindsight, it was more appropriate for the larger party. 

City Works accommodated us very well. Our host was attentive, gave good suggestions, and was patient. He handled us like a pro. I later told the manager of how satisfied we were with his service.

The menu had delicious offerings, all made from scratch. Each person enjoyed what they received from bacon cheeseburgers, to fish tacos, to chicken entrees. The food was so flavorful and satisfying. It was portioned well too. I ordered the fish tacos and it was tasty and filling. The fries that came with it were great. They were so kind to offer me dessert of my choice. I thought, "wow this is so nice" and made my experience much more pleasing. Given the last minute change of plans, I glad City Works saved the day and ensured a great birthday dinner! 

Can't wait to get back for the mouthwatering bacon cheeseburger burger I was eyeing there!

The service at the buck is absolutely wonderful and I love the classic Decor the seafood and steaks are always very tasty prime rib very good and have enjoyed getting takeout in these Covid times and it's always excellent.  I would've given five stars but my first seafood order was overcooked
They were the first ones to respond, and the message was fantastic, very personable, I appreciate that. I hope to connect soon as I'm able. Very professional thus far. Thank you

overpriced and lousy. $16 shrimp cocktail was rubbery. greek salad (which is pretty hard to get wrong?) was wrinkly tomatoes, no cucumbers. my "cocktail" was a pint glass of orange juice on ice. waitress took half an hour to get our cards after bringing us the check, i had to chase her down across the restaurant . it's probably fine if you want a beer and fries, but anything else, joke's on you.

Very disappointed with my visit last night. Was craving some soup from the soup bar so made the trip to Publix. I walked up at the same time a couple walked up, seemed like they were in a hurry so I let them go in front of me. While they were finishing up, an associate starts pulling the soups out of the bar and onto his cart, says "sorry boss closing up."  Never mind the condescending "boss" comment (if I was his "boss" he surely would wait till the customer in line gets his food before taking the food away), he couldn't have waited one minute until I got my soup before he pulled them? I was so confused (since Publix closes at 10:00 and it was 8:07) and angry but I kept my mouth shut, I didn't want to make a scene. I should have said something. I still can't believe this guy couldn't have waited until I got my soup. I love Publix but my last experience was the most unprofessional I've ever seen at a Publix, and you're only as good as your last encounter. I've always gotten respect from associates there, this was the worst I've ever had with them.

This place was amazing! Great food, good atmosphere, fun bar. I cannot explain how good the food was. Everything was super flavorful and they didn't shy away from the heat (good heat not like fire). The green Chile sauce on the Chile Rellenos was delicious. Had to try their cheese enchilada and green pork chili togo!

Excellent service. We accidentally came right before close (don't do this) and of course apologized and immediately went to leave. The staff insisted we stay and eat. We ordered quickly and scarfed our food down, which wasn't hard because everything is incredible. The drinks are awesome too.

LOTS of furniture to choose from. Staff was really great and easy to work with. We purchased some unique pieces that we were fortunate to find as a set. John & Dwayne were helpful with our small budget and knowledgeable of their inventory. Victor was a great delivery guy who made sure the pieces fit with no damage to the ceilings or the walls. Overall a great experience and we would definitely come back!

If you go here for a service, expect bill after bill from doctors that you've never heard of.  I received a bill from a doctor that "reviewed a report."  His local office can't find me as patient.  Billing phone number on the invoice, takes you to a billing service in India.  Memorial can't tell me the names of the doctors that should have seen me.  They tell you that "physicians bill separately" and that I agreed to that on the in patient paperwork.  Great.  Super helpful.  Farming out all of these billing services makes you look bad Memorial.  They are your representatives and they couldn't care less about finding a solution.  If I want a copy of my records, I have to fill out a request online and wait 7-10 days.  All I need is for someone at the hospital to say "yes, this bill is legitimate".  But that seems way too much to ask.  Stay healthy folks.  Dealing with hospitals, doctors, insurance and farmed out billing services really sucks.

Ordered 12 wings with two sauces on the side Korean garlic chili sauce and Buffalo sauce wing came out very hat and crispy with two other creamy whites sauces and celery.  The wings were pretty good and meaty equally mixed between legs and wings.  Also ordered the Vampire taco's three which were good and came with a side of beans and spicy rice.  Rice and beans arrived only warm to almost cold so they had to be packed into a togo box for reheating at home with the leftover wings and taco.  Place is noisy but expected that lots of TV's for sport fans.  Service was fine between friendly waitress and food server's.  Don't really get it they is always a wait for seating at this place but they told us 30 minutes and it was just about 30 minutes.  Everything was just what I thought from a change restaurant type of place, we won't right them off just yet.

Today I decided to give this tanning establishment another try, hoping it would be a better choice- Well it was today, they are under new management which greeted me Which in a way was unusual, then the prior staff that were simply rude and would talk about you from the other room- when there is open ceilings. Which made those of us who were paying customers feel uneasy. For me it was Kelsey that was extremely rude- who when I walked up say their closed and she was going to lunch/bank. I did end up using my tans only when I knew she wasn't working. You can only take someone being so rude to you-
My son i been coming here for yrs now..we feel like family every time..the food is delicious and Cindy and June are the best we love them

We are a Toyota family with 11 years of regular service from Lou Fusz.  I arranged for 15K service on my new, still-under-warranty Tundra and the service of a Tire Pressure Monitor System malfunction.  I requested both maintenance and service when calling to schedule the visit and with the service agent when dropping the vehicle off.   

When I came to get the vehicle, the very same service agent  informed me, as if I wasn't aware, that there was a "Tire Pressure Monitor System malfunction" and that I would have to bring the vehicle back for service.  I was also told a technician would have to determine if I caused the problem in order to see if it would be serviced under warranty, since such issues are "very rare".  Note that the tires and wheels of the vehicle are original, undamaged, and have only been rotated by a Toyota dealer.

I requested a call from the service manager, twice.  No luck.  

This experience is what I might expect from a used car dealer with a vehicle that is not under warranty.  Not from a Toyota dealer for my new vehicle.

Adios, Lou Fusz.

Let's start with the wonderful, Great tasting burgers and wonderful flavor packed fries. for those of you who order to go, They always pack everything needed in the takeout. Very organized and as requested. Our favorite is the hangover with the pretzel bun. Loco fries and Parmesan fries. Hubby likes the spicy Nashville chicken burger. regarding actually seating in the location... well, its not my favorite. super loud, not the best vibes, very close tables to keep safe distance and lets not get started with the wait line standing outside under the blazing sun on summer days. super tiny location. if you want better experience, order to go and enjoy all the positives they can offer
Very underwhelmed indeed. Slow and poor service, had my Range Rover for eight days to replace a vacuum hose. No apology for delay, no loaner, simply no car for 8 days.  Will not go back here!

The staff are super friendly and enthusiastic. I've been here several times with different shipping and project needs. They're efficient and make sure you're taken care of. The store is clean and I feel safe since they require masks.

Sea Critters is a fun place to come if you want to relax by the water, enjoy some live music, and have a few drinks. 
It is located in Pass a Grille. There seems to be plentiful parking in the dedicated lot every time I have been here. They also have docks for boats. 
They have an indoor restaurant as well as an outdoor bar and restaurant. I really enjoy coming here to sit outside and watch the boats and sea life. The food is okay. I have had a few good meals here and a few not so good, so there is a little inconsistency in preparation. On the last visit, I ordered the burger with sweet potato waffle fries. The burger tasted like nothing. No seasoning, no flavor. And why ruin a perfectly good potato by turning into a waffle fry? Everyone knows you don't get the same even crispness when you waffle it. Had I known these were going to be waffle fries, I would have just gone to Chic Fil A first and brought my own because they were awful. Anyway, I will come down off my soapbox. The seafood I have had here has been very good.
It seems to always be happy hour, so that is nice. The service is usually pretty good. The prices are fair for a waterfront establishment It is a really laid back atmosphere, to the likings of Margaritaville. I bring people here when we don't want to be fancy. It is definitely worth a try.
Food here is quite good and I have had food delivered a coipl times. I especially like the lunch pizza special with a lot of gooey cheese.

Great way to spend an evening!

I had no clue what to expect. It is a variety show with multiple guests. This really is a must if you enjoy country music.

I'm not sure if BetRivers Online is a part of your casino but I'm writing this review anyway. BetRivers Casino is horrible! They take almost 2 weeks to pay your your withdrawal winnings & come up with every excuse in the book to explain why there is such a delay. Even after providing them with the required documents they take forever to review than & then they request documents that you already sent to them several times. I closed out my account today. Not dealing with their inefficient casino any longer. Too much frustration & headaches. Beware!! WRITTEN ON BEHALF OF TERENCE MAYNARD/ACCOUNT HOLDER.

This is a Chinese Food take out place although you can eat in if you like.  
So if you are looking for elaborate ambience, you are in the wrong place. 
If you are looking for really good Chinese food, you are in the right place.  We come here often and have never been disappointed. The staff is friendly but if you go at prime time expect them to be busy. They have always been willing to customize my orders and are responsive to food allergies and taste preferences even when busy.  We love the food and of course have our favorites.  The place is very clean and family owned.  The owners have been here forever and many of the staff live locally.  This is not a chain. They seem to take pride in their business.  We will continue to come back again and again when we are in the mood for Chinese food which is often.
The only thing great about this place is Hibachi! The rest  should just be shut down. Everything fried is soggy  Never again

I love coming to European Wax Center! Alyssa always gives me a great wax and great conversation. Get the wax pass if you can the savings are worth it. Please please please use the serum and scrub at a minimum! It's always a fabulous day at European Wax Center

Today is my birthday and it is also my first time here. The ladies who work here made me feel at home and like I was celebrating with my friends. I sat at the bar and immediately they took our order and got us mimosas (with freshly squeezed orange juice). I called in before coming to see how much their mimosas were and told them it was my bday and the lady remembered talking to me on the phone and brought me a delicious homemade cinnamon role with a candle in it. I will definitely be retuning! Thank you griddle! The food is amazing! And Christina is the most amazing women

A perfect boutique to find something for a friend, a gift or yourself. The clothes range in price and variety of style and the jewelry and home goods are all so cute and classy! The staff were so kind and helpful, and not overly attentive. It was a great place to check out on my Nashville trip!

Sprouts denied me entrance because I couldn't wear a mask due to a medical condition. They gave me options for curbside. But it's not the same when there are things you have to look on the shelves or if you're being spontaneous like I was that morning. They broke ADA rules by doing this but I chose to take my money to another store that is not a "mask police". Safeway has better produce anyway and many more organic products. #noshopsprouts
The food is fantastic. I love the basa. All the sides are great too! We always order ahead and just pick it up and have never had an issue!

0 star for the rude service from the front desk mid-age women. 
We stopped by the place to grab some sushi for snacks after shopping in the plaza.
The mid-age Asian women had extremely rude manners towards us and POINTED FINGERED at us. Told us to get out and sit on those crappy dirty chair to order to go.
It's not really about what she said. It's about HOW she said it and her GESTURE. It's just very low class.
Not sure if she was just having a bad day or what. 
We ended up just grabbing the sushi from the Publix next door. We did not want to turn a bad experience into a worse one.
The chef was there at the Publix and able to customize our plate.
We received much much better service at the Publix.

Too bad for Jasmine-Thai. We were Asians and we would have become regulars. 

Still appalled by the horrible manner by that mid-age lady.
Walked into this gas station and walked right out as the cashiers mask was around their chin.  I will not be coming back here. 0/5 stars if I could. Get your shit together.

***So' Basic***

I really dislike giving low ratings after one visit. I also like to try out a place at least twice and a few months after opening to work out any kinks. However, I don't think the menu offered anything special to warrant a second or third visit. 

The concept is homestyle pasta/ chicken at fast food pace. The interior is small, but inviting and a lot nicer than a typical "fast food" restaurants. We ordered:

Combo! Pick 2 Fettuccine w/Garlic Olive Oil Cheese and Risotto bites (3), Combo 3 Fried chicken,  Chicken Tender Combo, Cheese Manicotti and Fettuccine Alfredo. It was "okay."
