By far the chicken and was the best. It was well seasoned, crispy and juicy, but not incredible. The pasta, well...it tasted like Fazoli's. I ordered the 3pc chicken combo to go. They forgot my second thigh. When I went back up she picked up the chicken with her hands to inspect. Ugh. Overall, it's just basic.

Can't wait to eat here!
Owner is super nice and gave my office menus. 
Will be trying them this week
I love sushi and he promises it's the best around!! 
I'm looking forward to a weekend trip to see if he's telling the truth!!

My husband and I are fairly new to the Tarpon Springs area, so have been trying out many new restaurants in the area. Currents is a little higher-priced than we're accustomed to, but we just felt like an "upgrade". We went at 2:30 in the afternoon so it was very, very quiet - which was fine with us. We sat outside, and although the tables sit on a slant because of the sidewalk, we managed just fine. My husband ordered a shrimp and scallop pasta and I ordered the Pork Bucco Russo. Oh. My. Gosh! We were both deliciously surprised! SO worth the visit. We'll definitely be returning!
Consistently good food and friendly staff. They were out of mandoo today and there was a bit of trash that missed the trash can (napkins, a fork, and cup lid). Otherwise good atmosphere.
Went in today for a quick cut, it came out way better then expected. There was good conversation and laughs. I will definitely be going back

I didn't review this because I didn't want to admit it was over.

I loved everything about my experience at The Fox Bar. Even during this pandemic. They are clearly taking safety seriously. Keeping social distancing at top of mind and doing everything to make guests feel comfortable. 

The atmosphere is enough to make you want to give them all your money. And then you watch them create a beautiful drink and you will give them even more money. And then you taste the drink! Okay. All the money. They get it. Take it. It's theirs. 

The service was also super accommodating and kind. The place could easily lean into the pretentious category but they didn't from my experience at all. In fact I got nothing but welcoming vibes. Is that southern hospitality? Maybe. 

Sometime my guy and I like to play a game where we order each other's drinks and guess what they will pick. Sometimes this can be annoying. Instead of ordering like a normal civilized human, we point to menus and make weird gestures with our eyes. They had no problem with our shenanigans. Because they are using QR codes for menus (touchless) it was pretty easy to just show them the phone. 

I loved this spot. Prepare to spend some money. But this is like Disney World for adults. You are buying an experience! WORTH IT.

I took my car for a tune-up (replace spark plugs and ignition wires)...I had to have more work at the dealership where I was notified that the wires and plugs were not the correct ones for my vehicle.  I called (the svc. personnel are very rude if you have a problem) and eventually spoke to the store mgr who had me bring my car back and replace these items.  Sooo 2 months later I take my car to my mechanic b/c my check engine light is on.  What does he say to me?  Your wires and plugs are not the right ones for your car (again!!!).  So am now waiting for a callback from customer relations as I'd like to be reimbursed for paying for this item yet again.  I will never use pep boys again for any reason...2 mechanics have been befuddled over how they could much such a stupid mistake twice.  Oh, did I mention the parts they used are for a 1999 Corvette...I drive a 2008 Aveo.

I went to this store today shopping for a new bathing suit. They are in a middle of a remodel. I went and tried on a bathing suit, and realized after I could see a security camera in the mirror. 
Please don't use or allow your family to use the temporary dressing rooms. 
The camera should of been covered. I feel so violated

Covid has changed everything. My family has stayed here many times in the past. The hotel is beautiful and everything you would expect from a Ritz Carlton.  As soon as you step outside, that's where it all changes. There is a larger than normal presence of vagrants and undesirables all along Canal Street; no police presence at all. This area is becoming a blighted part of the City that I don't wish to be in. I've cancelled our reservation for the end of the month. Will not be returning to this property until things change significantly. 

City leaders need to start to make changes.

Power Home Remodeling replaced the gutters and facia on my home.  After about 5 months or so, model began growing on two locations on my my home's stone, just where the installed gutters met the stone of the home. This never happened with my original gutters.  

I contacted Power Home and made a Warranty claims.  They sent a contractor our to remedy my complaint but according the home security camera footage, the contractor did no work and reported that the mold growth and stains are not the result of the gutter installation. 

I contacted Power Home Warranty department and shared my disagreement of this assessment, since, I lived in the home for 6 years before, and never have this problem, until I had the gutters replaced by Power Home.

Furthermore, I requested to speak with Service Manager and waited 2 weeks, without a contact from Power Home.

I spent $25K+ to have this work done, with a lifetime warranty.  However, I don't believe that I work was correctly done, specifically, where the gutters meet the stonework on my home.  I would like the situation remedied.

This place is so authentic and the service was spectacular. The servers and staff are very helpful with the menu and the food was INCREDIBLE. If I was on death row I'd choose this pasta dish as my last meal.

I got vodka sauce penne with the chicken on top.
This jiffy lube is the best in the area. They change the oil in all our cars.. The manager Greg is top notch and takes care of the customer..  thank you keep up the great work..

I've been a member of this studio for over 8 years and it is truly the best yoga studio in Santa Barbara. Recently they remodeled and transformed Sol Seek (formerly known as Divinitree) and the space is absolutely stunning. There are two studios and the design is clean, modern, and organic. They are very conscientious about ensuring folks feel safe and masks are mandatory for all indoor classes. There's excellent ventilation and everything is sanitized before and after class. They offer a variety of classes from intro basic Roots classes, incredibly relaxing Restorative Yoga to Burn yoga sculpting and level 2-3 (for advanced yogis). I've been to almost every yoga studio in town and I have to say that this is the only place where I've felt truly comfortable. Classes are diverse and you will see every type of body and skill level. The teachers are excellent, the music is upbeat and you will leave class feeling like you lost 50 pounds of mental and emotional stress.

When I first visited Castle Dental in 2018, I had a great experience. The people are very kind, and that never changed. What I ended up being unhappy with was the constant scheduling issues and actual dental work. I had three appointments for fillings rescheduled because of scheduling problems in the office. After the third time this happened, I moved to a new dentist. The new practice took NEW x-rays because Castle Dental never sent over my records, only to show me that THERE ARE CAVITIES UNDER THREE OF THE FOUR FILLINGS I HAD DONE AT CASTLE DENTAL. Two of those fillings were already re-done at the Castle Dental office because they chipped, had to be drilled out and re-filled. Funny thing, I have several fillings older than these that I've never had a problem with. And another fun fact: during my last cleaning at Castle Dental, the hygienist who cleaned my teeth told me I got a filling (from Castle Dental) THAT I DIDN'T EVEN NEED. I also never appreciated feeling like I was being sold on treatments I didn't feel I needed (I just chalked that up to it being a corporate office), the personal conversations my dentist had with her assistant while I was having dental work done, or that my dentist smelled of cigarette smoke. I'll never go back, and I do not recommend this practice to anyone.

I've visited Frothy Monkey on several occasions and have always enjoyed my experience. Their breakfast fare is traditional and well executed. I prefer lunch and dinner because my palate requires a little something extra. I always find something that fits the bill.

I come to this restaurant 3/4 times per month. Normally I am completely satisfied.  Last night however,was an exception. First, it was burger night so I thought a burger sounded good. Our meal started after our party arrived in three separate groups. I do understand that this may cause confusion but the hostess was told of the number of people in our party. So, as I was saying, once everyone arrived, we ordered appetizers. They were good and brought out quickly. This is however when things began to go south. Along with the appetizers a stack of dishes and silverware were set in the middle of the table. Problem was there were less dishes and silverware than guests at the table. No extra napkins. Then when the food came and almost everyone ordered burgers it was a struggle to get silverware for everyone. Again napkins were requested. The burger I got was so greasy I only took two bites. With no napkins my hands were covered in grease. I ended up using a napkin that was already used by my mother just to be able to clean my hands. Condiments were never brought to the table which I thought was crazy because almost everyone in our party ordered burgers! Finally, my glass was empty halfway through the meal but I was not offered a refill. In conclusion, I don't know what went wrong last night but I was left wondering if this experience was a sign of a bad night or an indication of a much deeper problem. I do know that if your restaurant is offering a featured dish - that dish should leave the kitchen as the best example of that category on your menu in hopes that it will inspire you to order from that category on future visits. The reality of my experience last night was the entire experience had no inspiration in any area of the visit. Not the food, service, or the atmosphere inspired me. In conclusion, I will return to McGlynns again in the coming weeks because after many good meals I am hoping that my experience last night was an anomaly. Even the best restaurants have an off night. I wrote this review in hopes that the staff reads this and work to eliminate the possibility that any patron will have a meal like I did last night. Also, I know that they have the ability to do so much better.

This is the best sushi I have had in a while! This establishment is very clean, the service is great, the people are nice, and most importantly the fish is fresh! 
I got the rainbow roll without the cream cheese and they were very accommodating. It tasted great! My sister had the Vegas roll and she said it was great! She also had some spicy Mayo on the side and it completed the meal. Lastly my dad got the gyoza and the tempura roll and again we're great with no complaints! 
For dessert I enjoyed the green tea ice cream and it was sooooo gooooddd. Overall, it was a great night with the family and I will definitely be coming back!

The croissant was good, but the customer service here is terrible. I hate giving bad reviews, but I'm also not going to lie for the sake of a good review. 

If I'm going to spend over $3 for one croissant (and it's cheaper and tastier in Paris), then at least provide good customer service and not be rude.

The worst Marriott that ever existed. Do not stay here. Ever.
I don't have a good thing to say about this hotel. The staff is rude and unhelpful. I tried to check in for a 5 night stay at 9:30PM and my room wasn't even ready (check in is at 3PM by the way, and I'd had the reservation for weeks). No caffeinated coffee in the room and after I asked for coffee to be brought up to the room, no coffee was ever brought. The room phone didn't even work for me to call reception. I then accidentally left 3 shirts hanging in my hotel room closet and called at 11AM, within hours of checking out, to find them and talked to the manager Savannah who promised me housekeeping would call me that day -they never called. I called back at 5PM and spoke to a gentleman who claimed to not have access to the housekeeping closet to look for the shirts and to call back the next morning at 8AM. The next day when I called, the manager Savannah stated, 'we can't find them, there were no shirts in the room.' I informed her yes they were 100% in the room, I do not have them. She was mean and rude and when I stated what the nighttime manager told me the night before, she said 'That's a lie.' So, calling me a liar. Repeatedly saying, 'Sorry YOU left YOUR shirts in the closet, they weren't there.' So, apparently housekeeping or someone threw out or accidentally took my shirts. She never once apologized until I asked for an apology. This is awful treatment someone who is supposed to be the manager, the leader of the hotel, can give to a guest. This hotel is a shame to the Marriott family. Sadly my shirts were 'never found' which Savannah claims is 'my fault for leaving them in the room because she is not responsible.' I was promised hotel points for compensation (which I haven't received yet...) after I had to beg and plead for something to be given and point out what an awful experience this is as a guest and how as a manager she has handled this situation poorly every step of the way. Do not stay here. Ever.

I love, love this place! The food is muy delicioso. Sure the place is like a hole in the wall, but the food is great. I have eaten at the location on the Loop but for some reason the food is not as good. Especially the Chilies Rellenos and the salsa. Their cheese dip is the best! A patio would be nice but I don't think there is much room, and I wouldn't want that to take away from the quality of the food.

If I could give this place a ZERO star review, I would. They don't even deserve a one star!! We made 1:15 reservations. We walked in at 1:17 and they said that we would be seated in 15 minutes. In that time they gave our table to a different group on accident. We offered to sit in another area outdoors and the waitress was so sweet and said she would serve us. But the short bald manager told us and her that they would not do this for us. We sat there for AN HOUR waiting for them to "come up with a solution." After an hour passed with NO word from the manager, we went to find him for the first time. Yea, he never even came out to speak to us or apologize in that hour we were waiting. We found him to talk to him and he simply said "there is nothing else I can do" AND THEN WALKED AWAY FROM US. Is this for real?! Please save yourselves from the world's WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE and avoid this restaurant at all costs. The unprofessionalism and way this was handled is completely unacceptable!! #RUDE

Best massage I have ever had, and I have had quite a few.  I can't wait for the next one.  Kuryn's techniques helped reduce my neck and shoulder pain immensely.  I wish I had made it for 90 minutes instead of 60.  The next one definitely will be 90 minutes.  She is phenomenal.  Thats all I can say.  Her studio is comforting, relaxing, quiet, and her demeanor is friendly, professional and respectful.

Love it here!  The most toppings and yogurt flavors but more importantly,  clean and pretty friendly service!  It's bright and cheery with plenty of seating so don't feel bad if want to sit and visit.  Love that you yourself can control exactly how much topping you want.  Even the owner is great!

As I write this, I am eating the second half of my chicken salad po-boy left over from about 2 o'clock this morning. It is one of my favorite places for chicken salad. There are huge chunks o' chicken not that ground into baby food crap that most people try to pass off, so that you won't realize they use all the nasty bits of the chicken in it. What's more amazing after a great night of drinking than being able to call a place up, order really good food along with smokes, toilet paper, a gallon of milk & whatever else you realize you need & having it delivered directly to your door in a reasonable time? Alright, maybe the hangover faerie coming to alleviate your ails, but hey we all know that's not real.

As for the roaches & rudeness, this is a very old city on a river. There are things lurking in the corners & shadows that no one wants to know about, but the reality is they are there & on occasion come out & show their faces, or antenna, or whiskers. And for the rudeness, how would you be if your main clientele were all drunk, not in the process of, but just plain old stupid drunk. I imagine it gets pretty tedious after a while. I've never experienced rude. They are sometimes, short & to the point. If you let a drunk person take over a conversation, let's face it, it could go on for hours, which they don't have. Get over it.

If I could leave this place zero stars, I would. Absolutely disgusting. I brought my fiancé with me and she hit on him and was trying to touch him the entire time. Not to mention how unsanitary the place was and how rude she was to me. She must have payed to have those 5 star reviews before.

Just saw Chase for the first time.  And, Wow!  Was I impressed by both the salon as well as Chase.  The salon has a really fun, retro/chic vibe, making it feel very warm yet high-end at the same time.  I was greeted with a smile when I arrived.  Then Chase came out to greet me with her own winning pearly whites.  Her assessment, our discussion on plan of action, and her attention to detail was spot on.  I actually felt like I was her most important client of the day!  Then, when it came time to pay, I fully expected to pay at least $50 MORE than what I was charged (No, I'm NOT complaining).  Needless to say, I think my head of hair has found a new home.

This is one of the most negligent and unempathic businesses I have been associated with. I had reserved a tuxedo months in advance for an event that wasn't until April. I even paid the deposit, and I get a call four days before my event saying my tuxedo couldn't be ready for my event. Essentially leaving me with little to no options, and they didn't care about the inconvenience I was facing. Definitely will not be back here.

I've used Metro Public Adjustment for damage on three occasions and was very happy with the outcome on all issues. 

First I had a leaky pipe in the waiting room of my Chiropractic office. I talked to Aaron Stutman, a public adjuster in my business club that worked for Metro and he said he would take a look at the problem. He studied the cause of the leak which was our central drain pipe that had sprung a leak from age and he evaluated damages it caused. He also discovered that a drain pipe from my upstairs bathroom had also caused damage and he ultimately filed both claims as one thus bypassing a second deductible. An expert auditor from the company came and added up the damages. They were professional and did all of the legwork in addition to meeting with the insurance company adjuster. I would not have been inclined to file a claim if it weren't for Aaron and Metro taking care of everything. 

A second problem I had was my air conditioner downstairs. The pan was rusted and that caused a leak that went all over my cellar. There was damage to the tiles. After the good experience I had with the first leak, I called Aaron again and he looked it over while making no promises. They negotiated again with the insurance company and we made a decent recovery. I again would not have had the time or perseverance to have made a claim on my own and followed through with the paperwork. Aaron and Metro again did all of the work and I just had to sign the check.

A third issue I had and by far the most expensive was damage to my roof from wind. I went out the door after one of our recent serious wind storms perhaps related to climate changes only to discover a handful of shingles on my front lawn. I thought I might try to have a few of the shingles replaced, but then remembered that Aaron had mentioned roof repair at one of our meetings. I asked him about it and again he said he couldn't promise anything but that he would look into it. He went up on the roof with our public adjuster after having his own people review the problem and he asked me to get an estimate on the repair. He also suggested including our 2 large sheds in the repair and I agreed that if he could that would be fantastic. One of my patients has a great reputation for quality roof repair so I got an estimate from him and Aaron took it to our insurance company. A short time later, I got a check covering 4/5 of the work. I had the job done, it looks great and Aaron got them to send me another check. At this point I just about broke even and it included both of my sheds. The building looks great and once again they did all of the work. I can't thank Aaron and Metro enough for their professional help.

Breakfast turned into upset stomach morning I ordered my breakfast then went on my phone for a business call I'm preparing my coffee took a few drinks of it started to feel stomach pains right away I looked over the table grabbed the dish opened another creamer they were rotten so I told the manager about it and she still charged me for coffee

I should've listened to the other reviews.  The shower was clogged and after two complaints and two 'engineers' unclogging it, the water still creeps up when it is running.  The sink was at least 50% clogged and when the water starts to fill up, you can see some brown puke/flem remnants clinging in the drain.  This is especially frustrating when trying to brush teeth and it splashes you.  

In addition, some of the staff at the hotel were unfriendly and less than prompt.  One positive was that they gave me a complimentary upgrade to a suite on check-in.  I would've preferred the other room however if the drains were clear there.  

I've stayed in downtown Indianapolis four other times and this was my first experience in a Sheraton.  Needless to say, it will likely be my last.

DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT!! It is a hole in the wall, disgusting! The food is gross. The prices are outrageous! I ordered a salad for $22 that had shrimp and lobster in it and you needed a magnifying glass to find the lobster which was shredded and the shrimp were tiny and tasteless. It said it was grilled but it was steamed. They had steaming hot mushrooms on it which wilted the lettuce. The chicken parm is dry. They charged us more than the prices on the menu because they said the price of seafood went up. When I got the bill it said the salad was $28. I asked the waitress and she said there is a note near the front door that says prices of seafood went up. I never saw the tiny note nor did I think a salad would ever be $28!! They couldn't mark the increase on the PAPER menu?? The owner said she didn't want to write the new amount of the salad on the menu in case the prices ever came back down. So not only is she reusing these disgusting paper menus with food all over them, but she intends to use them a thousand more times. They are rude and do not follow any type of social distancing and they are dirty. They use paper menus over and over that had every food item on them. If you need to use the bathroom you have to go outside! We HATED this place!! Its expensive and disgusting.

THE WORST PIZZA HUT EVER, SO UNPROFESSIONAL!
I ordered at 8:41 PM.. It said my order will be delivered at 9:11 pm, 9:11 past.. I never received my order! 
I called them back like 4 times because I literally was on hold for the longest. 
Only once the second time the girl picked up and said "Thanks for calling pizza hut please hold" with an attitude.. I waited and waited...then the phone hung up again and I called them back.
I said to my friend It seems like they're real slick and lazy not picking up lol and they knew they didn't have that long anyway because they were about to close. 
I was on hold for hours, I remember the phone hanging up again! exactly at 11:53 PM.
They were closing at 12:00 midnight, So basically they got away with my money because I ordered online.. but not for long! 
This store needs to be SHUT DOWN or whoever they are needs to be replaced!

Super cozy atmosphere!! I had the Delgado, my husband had the Rajun Cajun and our son had the Mac n cheese. Our food was full of flavor, and just the right amount of spices! I would definitely recommend!!

The store is well stocked, but about every other visit i have a problem with an employee. One charged me for the previous customer's stamps. While she discovered it before i left, i had to spend 30 extra minutes in line @ Customer Service because she allegedly couldn't correct the problem. My 75 year old mother has been yelled at by an employee in the garden department, and i was yelled at by a cashier today because i didn't know that one line forms for 2 "20 items or less," lanes. I was next in line, but she didn't mind when a guy walked in front of me and checked him out. For the record, i had one item. I'm new to the area, and if i had known where else to find that item, i would have dropped it on the floor and left. 
I've been shopping at assorted walmarts for many years and have never experienced rudeness at the hands of any of their employees before.
Sorry, three times and you're out.
I guess i'll look for another walmart. Or shop at target.

I'm not sure what they've done to my favorite dish...pasta carrabba which is now fettuccine carrabba...but it's awful. We ate there last night (April 20, 2018) with friends. The Alfredo sauce had almost no taste and I literally had to dig through a mountain of pasta to even find any...and there wasn't much to begin with! I had asked for extra sauce which was in a little ramekin and it was so runny that when I poured it on my pasta, it simply ran through to the plate. This used to be my favorite dish but no more. I've had it probably 3 times over the past year and it's been like this every time. On a brighter note, their Moscato was excellent!!

Great flavour to the Ramen dishes, and the service is pretty good also. The location is easy to get to and from, and they have plenty of parking. Sometimes they do sell out,  you sort of have to check in advance as possibly you could be disappointed at the door

The food was not good. I ordered the fish and it was way over cooked. It had no flavor what so ever.  My fiancé ordered the steak and it was well over cooked as well. We ordered the boudin trail as an appetizer and the cracklin was stale, the only good thing about the meal was the boudin. My fiancé also ordered a Paradise Park to drink and it was flat and disgusting.

I love this place. Great food, good atmosphere and great staff. The cost is low and supper filling. The best part is their French fries reminds me of my moms. I come here often and have never had a bad experience. Located on grand so plenty to do before or after you eat.

Thus literally is the BEST hotel!! The service is beyond what I have ever expected  - the management actually texts me asking how we are doing..we are here now and have traveled for years and this is BY FAR the nicest hotel and right on the beach! So much to do - we were disappointed with our first room and they immediately changed my room to the most spectacular room I ha e EVER SEEN!! Yes it was a bit more money bit WELL worth it - when we come back - there will be NO reason to look at any other hotels - THIS WILL BE NOT ONLY OUR FIRST CHOICE..BUT OUR ONLY CHOICE!

I love little diners. I especially love diners where the wait staff is friendly and you can tell who the regular customers are. Mom's is one of those places. 

I'm on a Greek salad kick, so I came here after learning that they have a Greek background. I had the gyro with Greek salad. The salad didn't really make me think of a traditional Greek salad. It was mostly lettuce and tomato. But it was still tasty. The gyro was full of meat. I liked that the onion wasn't overwhelming. 

I think I'll return the next time I'm craving breakfast food. 

The food wasn't extraordinary, but it was filling and reasonably priced. And the waitresses are really great.

Not a food review since we decided "against" eating there after taking a look at the place. Where is "pride of ownership" in this place? You look at Brennan's on Royal or Mr. B's across the street & they are pleasant & inviting spots to visit. You look at Dickie's Brennan's Steak House & it's a disgusting mess. 2 rats running out of the garage as we approached. Place is located on the 1st floor of a parking garage that has had absolutely Z E R O done to it to improve the exterior presentation. Entrance & bar area looked like they had not had a "deep clean" this year? Looks like owners are phoning it in on the reputation of their other highly regarded spots. Walk down the street & take a look at the Monteleone Parking Garage. See the nice flower pots & other upgrades to make it look more inviting. Get the hint? Total turn off compared to their other restaurants.

Visited for my first time this past Sunday and I have no complaints. Being the basic bitch That I am, I had to try the pumpkin muffin, which was super fluffy and rich with pumpkin flavor. Also ordered an Asiago bagel with cream cheese for my boyfriend which he enjoyed. Their menu is surprisingly large as well, was not expecting a muffin bakery to have sandwiches and a smoothie bar. Looking forward to trying their chocolate chip muffin next.

This is one of the best Whole Foods I've been to. It's clean, well stocked, friendly employees and even when it's busy it's not annoying to shop. There is always a person to help bag your groceries. One time we asked for some pretty obscure items and they were totally fine with helping us locate it. Great store and will be coming back!

Excellent Cuisines, Excellent service, Excellent atmosphere! You will not be disappointed. The staff was extremely friendly & the food/drinks were absolutely delicious. Reservations are recommended though.

This is my fourth time trying this location. We always have a horrible time. The food is good for the most part. I did receive spoiled cole slaw one time though. The service is horrible and we always wait entirely too long for drinks, food and even to be seated. The location on Cortaro is always good and we thought this one would get better with time. Unfortunately it hasn't. This will be my last time at this location.

I came in here as part of a food tour, so I didn't get the full experience, but I really enjoyed it.

It's a beautiful setting - high ceilings, clean and bright, some nice design accents. There's a little market area in the front with merchandise and some other bits and bobs like kitchenware, honey, and Christmas ornaments.

We came in close to closing time as the staff were cleaning up after a presumably busy shift. They were very welcoming and got us set up quickly with seats, waters, and then brought out our bonuts.

We were served one bonut each and I'll tell you what, I could've eaten 5. They're small round biscuit-dough cakes. Kinda like a big donut hole. They're rolled in a little sugar, warm crisp to bite into, with a little lemon mascarpone on top and a berry compote underneath. It was very subtly sweet - almost perfect IMO. I could've gone for a tiny bit more sugar on the outside, but I liked how understated it was. I'd also have liked a little more tartness to the compote but that's probably a little variable depending on the season.

Just a little taste, but boy it was a good one. I was glad to give it a try without having to wait in a long line. Thanks to Local Tastes of Nashville for getting us in at a good time.

(Update): In response to Leon, owner: I walked out because I thought you were telling me that the service was free (assuming you were comping it due to the poor service, came back inside once I realized that wasn't the case). I kindly suggest you put your customers first instead of arguing with them about their crappy experiences. People will forget about poor experiences if you treat them well. But I won't be coming back or recommending to anyone due to the way you've handled. Have a great day :) 

(1st Post:) They had me take a seat and start soaking my nails. I sat there soaking them for 45 mins and during that time heard other people complaining about how long they had been there. As well as being unsatisfied with their results. I decided to get up and leave but still had to pay $10. There were about 4-5 employees and 6-7 guests. I would've been fine if they communicated better but it didn't seem like they cared about their customers.

I'm going to give this review from a takeout perspective. I love me some spice and they deliver!! Uwu they got the fire ( haha sorry I'm immature). Besides absolutely tasty spicy Thai food, these folks are so nice!! I always tip because they seem to start some friendly small talk with you. Perhaps I'm old fashioned but I just like that at an establishment. Especially one that I really enjoy. Go ahead and dine in if you want, it's clean and cozy. In warmer weather they have a nice patio. It's really good Thai food and it will keep you warm (spicy or not).

My friend and I wanted to check out what Chef Ginny Wooters was dishing up at the recently opened space in the Doubletree Hilton adjacent to the Tucson Convention Center. Wooters exceeded our expectations, as did many other details of the eclectically decorated space. Large indoor and outdoor seating options can easily accommodate large parties, but one of the most remarkable details I noticed immediately upon being seated was the comfort of the chairs in the main dining room. As a veteran of two spine fusions, comfortable dining furniture is often overlooked in most restaurants. The four top offered rounded, fully-backed upholstered chairs with ample cushioning making our 2 1/2 hour dining experience extremely enjoyable and comfortable. Both my friend and I are small in stature, and our feet could easily reach the floor. I wish more restaurants would invest in comfortable, upholstered chairs for diners instead of hard wooden seats.

We started off with Steak Tartare and Toritos Cangrejos. The Tartare was accompanied by an array of escabeche vegetables and chimichurri, all to be devoured with fried plantain strips. Both the escabeche vegetables and chimichurri were outstanding, and we asked for more chimichurri as the portion on the plate was a little scarce. The server quickly delivered. Each element on this plate complimented the raw beef perfectly with acidity and color, and I could have easily gone for another side of the vegetables solo, but I had to pace myself. The Toritos are three bacon-wrapped fresh Caribe Chiles stuffed with herbed goat cheese over a bright yellow Cholula-lime aioli. I've never had a Caribe Chile before, and I am now a huge fan. My friend mentioned shying away from anything bacon wrapped, but this dish was sublime. The bacon was not only perfectly cooked, but it was also thinly sliced so it was crisp-tender and didn't overtake the dish. The fresh Caribe Chile and creamy goat cheese were the star, and the sauce offered a perfectly acidic, bright yellow contrast. 

The entrees: Confit Pata de Pato (Duck) and Coconut-Crusted Snapper. My duck was cooked perfectly and sat over a chipotle-agave glaze. Although the sauce was sweet, there was nice bite from the chipotle Chile at the finish. It came with thickly sliced plantains, halved baby potatoes, Torino pork (lardons) with sautéed kale. Every element was complimentary, but the plantains were a bit woody and hard, maybe a tad underripe - my only disappointment. My friend's snapper was to die for, served with cauliflower chicharrones, dates, sautéed kale, piñon nuts over a lemon-manchego cream. The snapper was crusted and cooked perfectly - flaky, tender and MOIST! Don't skip this dish. It's beautiful and elegant.

We were stuffed, but I had to order a dessert, so we tried the lemon-coconut flan. This was a flan like neither one of us had ever had. The texture was very firm unlike most flans, but the creamy texture was smooth and very refined, almost like a crème brulée, but stiffer texture. There was more of a hint of lemon than coconut, and both flavors were extremely subtle. It came with fresh berries, whipped cream, and very large gingerbread cookie in the shape of a pig. The cookie was a subtle gingerbread, but a bit thick and dry, and I could only eat half. The sauce was very good, but can't for the life of me remember what it was. A reminder to snap the menus so I have them for reference.

They have live mariachi music, but it's not your standard mariachi. They sang and played some American songs as well, and their music was extremely enjoyable. They were packing up as we were leaving, and the guitar player was strumming a Led Zeppelin tune before casing his instrument. I couldn't remember the name of the song, so after guessing its name and album it was on, he played a few riffs of different Zeppelin songs for a continued guessing game. Just a nice, unexpected end to the evening. Will definitely return to try the other outstanding items on this menu - there are many to choose from. Vegan diners are welcome here. 

Chef Wooters never disappoints since her debut at McClintock's at Saguaro Ranch many moons ago, then moving on to Jax, The Abbey, Jackson Kitchen, Commoner and Co., and Alloro AOC and the Hilton East. Her thoughtful array of ingredients, colors, sauces, and plating have only elevated over the years and I have always been a huge fan of her food. She definitely made this a meal to remember. 

This space is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Can't wait to return.

I don't often write negative posts. I live in this area and would love for this restaurant to succeed. They have a lot of work to do. Took the team for lunch and was so disappointed . Lunch menu was very small. Medium burger was raw and grilled tenderloin cooked way to long, very dry. Forgot the cheese and brought me out broken pieces of a slice that were dried out. They advertise daily specials but there are none yet. They've been reopened for 3 months.  When I paid the receipt still had the old restaurant's name on it!
The food is a bit pricey however it is definitely worth the price because your dish will come out the way you want it. I personally like mine spicy!

First off parking is next door which was the best! Do you know how hard it is to park in the French quarters. O my gosh and only $3 or $4 not sure something like that . The restaurant has great ambiance with the southern classic feel. I had the Escargot which was cooked to perfection. And the Bbq shrimps were delicious . The Braised lamb shank  was good. Overall experience was great!

I really want to love this place. It has a great location. There are always cool, interesting folks hanging out. It has funky surroundings full of groovy art, a decent selection on the menu with a little something for everyone.

But tonight we got served some super weak lattes for $4.50 each and they came in styrofoam.

"Meh. I've experienced better."
Second time having sushi this month.service is always friendly and the sushi is always amazing!

Gretna, Louisiana location. Would never recommend this company ever again. I will happily drive wherever to avoid dealing with them again. We reserved our time slot and paid $24.99 with the reservation that would be applied to the package we purchased. We took our pictures which both of our kids were asleep and we were hoping to keep it that way and do a cute picture holding our boys making a shh face easy 1 picture could've been done. Instead Santa grabbed his bell and insisted on waking my son up. After already waiting in line for 30 minutes he then suggested we get back in line to allow my son to wake up and be happier. Honestly a crying scared picture of Santa is like initiation I would've laughed bought it and still sent it on our Christmas cards. After doing a few with him fist bumping Santa and switching out our kids alone with Santa and a family one the photographer said she got some good ones. It took way too long after to get the pictures processed and there were only 2 pictures to chose from? A family one and 1 of my youngest son, what happened to the ones of my oldest fist bumping with Santa etc.??? I really just wanted the digitals because obviously that's the era we're in and so we got the best package and the lady charged my card after I reminded her we had already paid the $24.99. And after she stated yes I'll only be charging you $30 something. Okay swipe and $50 charge goes through. I ask she says the other will come off of my bank statement. We're supposed to get a Shutterfly credit, digitals and prints with this package. After 24 hours no digital pictures were available I couldn't even log on. I waited another day to give them extra time still no luck. I reach out to cust service exactly as they state to. I got an automated message saying they are reviewing my request. After a day with no response I messaged again looking for answers and after another 24 hours get a response that says I should wait 24 hours after the session to see if I get them... at this point it has been over 3/4 days. If they would've looked they could've seen the attachments to my email of the posted charges showing I did in fact get charged extra and that me date the photos were taken as well as other attachments giving them every piece of information I have. Another response from them: sorry you had problems logging into the website we've fixed it, we're closing the ticket. (No mention of being over charged even with the shown proof in attachments) Go to log in and I can finally access the website to view my digital photos and I could actually log in this time.... only to see a watermarked photo telling me to pay to download my digitals????!!! Had I not already paid for this? Still waiting on my next email response which I'm sure will continue to not meet the expectations of this purchase. Absolutely ridiculous experience. We are a young family that just wanted 1 picture with us all together and one of each of our kids with Santa and we couldn't even get that.

My husband and I have been going to Rice Contemporary Asian Cuisine for many years.  We have always had a great experience there and leave feeling happy and satisfied.  Last night, we went to Rice to celebrate both of our December birthdays.  We ordered the fried green beans and the Bangkok shrimp as appetizers and for the entrees, we ordered General Chicken and the Cashew Leek Chicken.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  The manager, Bobbi, came to our table to talk to us and found out that we were celebrating birthdays.  She immediately offered to buy our desserts.  We ordered the coconut bread pudding and we both thought it was amazing.  Not only is Bobbi a wonderful manager but she is also an extremely caring, thoughtful, friendly, happy person.  She and Toffee, the owner of Rice, have a great restaurant with fantastic food, perfect atmosphere and incredible staff.  On our evenings out, Rice will always be our first choice for a restaurant.
Awesome barber, we drive from Citrus Park just for her. I've never had anyone else be able to give consistently great haircuts. Highly recommended!

So much fun and went above and beyond our expectations!! We had a private group for a birthday celebration with about 30-35 people and everyone said the time went too fast. Beth, Nate, and Matt were a blast and made sure we got a group photo which we always forget to do!

I cannot say enough about how wonderful this clinic has been. Dr. Kuhlo is the greatest vet I have ever known--she is so caring and thorough. We have seen her for a number of years and our Ella loved her so much. Unfortunately, we had to let Ella go just before Thanksgiving this year and this Banfield clinic went beyond what I would have ever expected. They literally watched for us to come in the door (knowing we were there to let her go) and took us immediately in to a room with a blanket waiting. The entire staff was so compassionate and caring during the whole process, which is probably the hardest thing I have ever had to do. Dr. Kuhlo's compassion for Ella and for us was so apparent and meant the world to me for her to be with us because Ella really loved her. Ella knew that Dr. Kuhlo loved her too and was always happy to see her, even on this evening. I cannot thank each of you enough for your compassion and care for all 3 of us each and every time, but especially on November 13, 2019 for being with us on that heart-breaking evening. Thank you all for your excellent care, compassion, and love for Ella.

Why is this McDonald's not open 24 hours? It is on an extremely busy intersection, with about 15 wearhouses less than 2 minutes away that service probably 5000 employees in jobs. Currently only TWO restaurants open at this exit and McDonald's is not one of them. Whoever owns this franchise location is either a literal fucking moron and does not want to make money, or just does not want to put in the time or effort to hire a night shift team. And for that, you get a one star review. Management is ass on every other shift as well so I'm not surprised.

The food was phenomenal, service was great, and atmosphere was lively and welcoming! It started to rain while we were seated outside at an uncovered table and they swiftly moved us inside & accommodated us! The parmesan breakfast potatoes were to die for!! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast/brunch spot!

This is the first time I've shopped here. Are used to go to FoodMaxx over in Vallejo California. But this supermarket had the best deal on holiday turkeys that I could fine. $.29 a pound if I spend $25. And everything is so cheap, we ended up getting all of our holiday dinner needs. From cans of olives that we're only a dollar to see you need brown sugar for $1.19. Great prices.

The produce worker helped me find the 3 types of apples needed for a fresh apple pie. We needed Pink Lady, gala and golden delicious. The apples were not labeled correctly and he apologized. He then offered to help us find other stuff. This service went above what I usually see at discount grocery stores. 

In the butcher area, I needed to find a 20 lb turkey and the largest I found was 16 lbs. Again, a worker from the meat department   Offered to help and she went in the back to search for a 20lb turkey. She actually came out with 2 of them. Awesome help. 

I usually  go to a different store for my family needs but now will start coming here.

My boyfriend and I came from 2 hours out of town and this place was probably the highlight of our trip. The crab cakes are amazing, and I'm usually not a fan of crab cakes but I couldn't resist eating off of my boyfriends plate. The location is breathtaking and I was still kept warm with the heaters despite it being in winter and by the beach. I highly recommend this place, especially during sunset!! Food was amazing and for a fair price, and service was friendly. Will be coming back again!!

Are you kidding me right now???

I bought a groupon for this place. Time didn't allow us to use it ONCE and they wouldn't refund the money in services, or at all. 

What horrible customer service. If someone doesn't use your service ONE time, don't charge them for it.

Horrible policy, horrible customer service. What kind of business does that?! We are college students, we don't have $100 to pour down the drain! Sorry, that we didn't have the time to make it down to your studio with two full time jobs and school! Your hours are ridiculous with closing at 7 every night and Saturdays way early?! What normal person would even be able to make it to your studio.

I am beyond upset. I am not ever recommending this yoga studio, and I have a lot of friends that love yoga, just like me.

Wow, delicious and huge portions. We came for breakfast, "it's the best food ever, we just couldn't finish it. "!( From my 13 year old)  
Can't wait to bring my husband here! Friendly staff and best banana nut pancakes I've found. Make the trip, you will love it.

Never use them! Contractors are incompetent plus when I asked for the HVAC new unit install quite they inflated price by 2-3k then I asked itemized breakdown and no response. You will get robbed if you use them

Stopped by because the ambiance looking through the front window.  Wanted to have a glass of wine and relax after walking around the French quarter.  Not very accommodating in you just want a drink even though it said bar and restaurant.  It was $20 for 1 average pour of Cabernet - way over priced don't waste your money.

Very disappointed when I got my food delivered. I placed an order for Orange Chicken, Lo Mein (plain), and Kung Pao Chicken, definitely wasn't what I expected after reading great reviews. Kung pao was way too dry and chewy. They battered the chicken, which I've never had before for Kung Pao Chicken..normally my Kung Pao Chicken is soft and nicely glazed with black bean sauce. The lo mein was soggy, not edible..and worst of all, the Orange chicken wasn't what I expected!!! I expected chunks of battered chicken nicely tossed in orange glaze but this was some weird thinly battered chicken and the orange sauce they gave me on the side to dip in wasn't good at all. Luckily, I don't live here and have better Chinese food at home in OC :)

Went once, not awful but I expected much more. 
This is located in the beer can building in downtown Tampa. They tout in an article that they travelled all over the world to bring together a menu that was different, unique. I was thinking ooh good like how Vincent Price did when he wrote that excellent cookbook which I own and is a collectors item. I was hoping for unique wonderful full of exotic flavor foods from all over the world.
How original is a blue cheese burger? It was good but I've had better. The service staff were fine but I doubt I'd return for a second time. It's just not exceptional or maybe I was expecting much more. If you go for a burger you'll do fine, if you're expecting more you'll be disappointed like I was.

We stopped by here around 3pm on a Saturday. When we got there, there was no receptionist or security at the door so we just walked in. When we left, there was a security guy checking vax cards. What's the point in checking if you're going to let a bunch of people through without it?

It was PACKED and HOT inside and the ambience was just not it. It's a divey Christmas pop up with crazy and unorganized decorations. 

Terrible drinks that are upcharged worse than NYC prices ($20 for a hot chocolate and skrewball shot, anywhere else in philly is 10-15 at max).  The drink we did get was $15, and it was the most foul cocktail I've had - it was tiny (two gulps at best), full of ice, and ridiculously sweet. The cream base was separating from the liquid base which made it less appetizing. 

Spend your money else where.

We waited a half and hour after we were seated for our food. Everything but the pork chops and chorizo was bland, including the gumbo and sausage gravy. The service was mediocre. They must get by on their gigantic portions, which is not what we care for.

First I would say, the wording in the contract for pier installation is different than the words spoken by the actual installers. I was to have 7 piers installed, but only 6 were installed. Half way thru the installation I was told I would need to pay and additional $4161.00. The explanation given didn't make any sense. I was dismay to see what damage was done to my property. Destruction of my landscaping, stairs, yard, outside lighting and patio.The workmanship is the worst I have ever seen. When I requested an invoice and detail explanation for the extra charge, Brian in customer service sent the installers log spread sheet, which made no sense to me. I complained that I paid for 7 piers, but only 6 were installed and that the installer showed me pictures of 6 piers. Brian said he would get back with me. It has been over 30 days and not a word from anyone. I am now stuck with the added cost of repairing what they destroyed. BEWARE!!!!!

This is the perspective of a girl from California who appreciates country music but isn't steeped into its culture and just knows mainstream country music. 

It is entertaining even though I didn't know any of the singers. I did it for the experience and I'm glad I got to do it just to say I did it. Was it worth it? I'd say mildly yes. Would I do it again? That's debatable but I lean towards no. 

The best singer was actually a budding star - Brittney Spencer someone who doesn't fit the blonde cookie cutter mold but sang with authenticity and had amazing vocals. I followed her on Spotify and I hope she makes it big because she deserves it.

They had on old timers and in general the country music scene revolves around God, relationships/breakups, and drinking. It got kind of repetitive after a while. There's definitely a Nashville bubble and so, so many cowboy boots. I've ever seen so many cowboy boots in my life. It's definitely a thing.

But anyway, if you like country music go and you'll have a good time. If you're lukewarm about country music, I think you'll still have a good time and you might discover a new artist you really like. If you absolutely hate country music, maybe skip it.

Our family loves this place!  My wife's family has been going there for years.  Now, so have we.  I had a surprise birthday party that they catered for me a few years ago and the food was phenomenal.  I'm hooked on the penne alla vodka, which I challenge you to find a better one around the area.  I rarely stray from it, but my wife always strays into the domain of the specials which never disappoint.  

The owner is a great guy and Michael the head waiter adds great character to the place.  This restaurant and Fuji are our family favorites in S. Jersey.  We hadn't gone in awhile, but our one year-old is now a regular with us.

Came in an hour before close on a weekday so luckily there was a table open. It is a small space so I can see it getting really busy on the weekends. Most of the prices are around $20 but the portions are big to justify the price. The shawarma was flavorful with a strong cumin flavor but there could've been more meat for $20. It was mostly sweet potato, eggs and rice. We also got the French toast but it was average and a small portion that could get for cheaper elsewhere.

I wish I could give them a 0 star review. PLEASE READ THESE REVIEWS & Do not send these people any money. I booked my move with this company a month ago. Today is the day they were supposed to pick up my things to move them. They are not here. They have not called me like they said they would. I've been the one calling them non stop and now they are ignoring me and my husbands calls. After reading all these other reviews I have decided to call another company and hope they can move me in the time I need to be moved. This is a SCAM!! They took my $560 deposit, never contacted me after, and now are ignoring my calls on the day of the move.

One word sums up Lola's and simple enough it's Brunch!

I find Lola's as one of my go-to's whenever I'm asked where we should do brunch. Their outdoor space alongside the sidewalk is adorable. There's something really intimate about the dining setup. Whether it's sunny weather for their unlimited mimosas or slightly chill this is the place to be. Don't worry if it's cold btw as they have plenty of fire pits and heaters along the tables.

Grab their unlimited mimosas for $15 a person it's really a steal.

Some of my fave dishes are their shrimp n grits with a chorizo based sauce and flamenquin. The flamenquin is so freaking delicious with the multiple layers of prosciutto, fried pork loin, manchego, and jack cheese. 

As for the shrimp n grits, holy crap is that sauce delicious. I seriously slop it up with bread or anything I can use to clean up the plate with.

 I'll definitely be back because Lola's is one of my top fave brunch spots in the city!

Mitchel is amazing! I called C&L Heating when my mother's heating system could not be used after a fumigation job. The gas company told us it needed to have something fixed in order to be able to use again.

Mitchel was at our house within 15 minutes of calling him and he fixed our issue quickly as well as made the existing gas piping to the heating system earthquake safe. 

He is a great communicator and follows through with what he says he's going to do.

We will definitely be calling him again when needed.thank you!

The food is always really good,  but the service sucks!   The waiters are nice but they don't visit the tables often enough.  Get that together and you guys will get a better rating.  I'll give them another shot in the future to see any change just because the food is so good.
I ordered food from DoorDash. Don't do that go in and eat. The food was small portion and arrived extremely cold. Never had a problem dynamic definitely don't order from DoorDash

If someone creepy hits on you when you're in here, it's Pervy Marte.

Now we're going to let Bono introduce this one. (Vertigo by U2)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=98W9QuMq-2k

Unos, dos, tres, French Quarter

Lights go down, it's dark
New Orleans in your head, it rules your heart
A sandwich so much stronger than a thought
Your eyes are wide and though your soul, it can't be bought
And good sandwich can be

Hello, hello (hola)
I'm at a place called Verti Marte! (¿dónde está?)
It's everything I wish I ate back home
Except you give me something
I can eat.... eeeeeeeeeeeeat

If this deli were my mind, it'd be called Dirty Marte.

Unbelievably good sandwiches available 24 hours a day (although sometimes they're cleaning the grill late at night). If there's only one thing you ever eat in the French Quarter, it simply has to be this.

It's also one of those things to which I've sent at least a dozen different people over the years, and whereas most of my recommendations will get a high success rate but not perfect, this one has been 100% all the way. Every single person I sent in here has come away being amazed.

All this despite there being nowhere in here to eat and it being a dingy little Bodega grocery store basically.

If eating here improves your mood and makes you chatty, it's Perky Marte.

The grill in the back is open 24 hours a day (except for cleaning which is usually sometime between 2 a.m. and 4 a.m. or something like that).

All That Jazz is the famous sandwich which I grew up absolutely loving, and would get every time I came to New Orleans. I just tried Ernie's Power House and I have to say it's even better. Same style, same taste, but different and better ingredients than the infamous ATJ.

If you come here with glasses on and tell everyone about your fave apps, it's Nerdy Marte.

Everything they make at this Deli is incredible, and considering how big and filling these sandwiches are, it's well worth the $10 or so for each sandwich. Try this and Parkway when you come to New Orleans.

The reason why New Orleans has the best food places in the country is not the expensive crap that tourists and TV shows rave about. It's this and places like it.

The night is full of hos
'Cause bullets rip the sky with black and gold
They twinkle as the boys play rock and roll
They know that they can't dance, at least they know
I can't stand the beat, I'm asking for the check
Girl with crimson nails has beads around her neck
Swinging to the music, swinging to the music (whoa, whoa)

Hello, hello (hola)
I'm at a place called Verti Marte! (¿dónde está?)
It's everything I wish I ate back home
Except you give me something
I can eat.... eeeeeeeeeeeeat

After all this time went by I expected this place to not be as good as my memory suggested. But everyone I've sent in the ensuing years said it's one of the best sandwiches they ever had.

So I ventured here and I checked out my beloved All That Jazz sandwich, which is still the best. Ever. And then a second time, only to realize that I don't really love the stuff that's on that sandwich so I switched it up and got Ernie's, which replaces the lunch meat with pork loin and the American Swiss cheese with pepper jack.

So incredibly good that despite having bloated tummies from a day of eating, we ended up devouring in the entire thing, the perfect bread, the gooey cheese, the incredible shrimp, yummy pork loin, veggies and dripping messy juicy sauces.

And if you're Pakistani and come here, it's Urdu Marte.

Not only the best specialty Innovative sandwich in Louisiana, but also one of the top 10 sandwiches of any kind in the whole country. When in N.O., don't say NO to this, or Parkway, or Tan Dinh, or Tessie's Diner, or even Cafe Du Monde.

When you add in the fact that they are 24h, have quirky service, and fair prices, located right in the French Quarter, it goes off-charts. Even if the sandwich was only available for 1 hour day at lunch time it would still be one of the best there is.

There's nowhere to sit in here though, but make sure you eat it hot, as it's best eaten hot much like my Barbie. She's my Slurpie Marte.

And if it's dark outside, go instead to Murky Marte. And if you're a Star Trek fan, go instead to Kirky Marte. And if Barbie gives you the gift that keeps on giving, it's Herpy Marte.

All this sandwich, all of this can be yours
All this sandwich, all of this can be yours
All this sandwich, all of this can be yours
Just give me Ernie's Power House, and no one gets any

Hello, hello (hola)
I'm at a place called Verti Marte! (¿dónde está?)
It's everything I wish I ate back home
Except you give me something
I can eat.... eeeeeeeeeeeeat
This sandwich makes me so full
That I squeal
And I kneel
And I feel
Like I ate too much
(blurgh)

And if you ejaculate in your pants when you eat this sandwich, it's Spermy Marte.

Place is ridiculous. Every appointment you wait at least 20-30 mins to even be put in a room. Then another 20 mins waiting for nurse then another 20 mins for doctor. The last appointment they kept my dog and I came to pick up at 2:15p like told by doctor. Get there at 2:15p put in a room at 2:30p doctor comes in at 2:50p go back in waiting room until 3:15p when they finally bring my dog. An hour just to pick up a dog that we've been through the same process each visit for his treatment. And the whole time they never even gave him pain medication. He was crying the entire ride home in pain. Front desk girls attitude makes you even more mad that your Waiting so long. Multiple clients mad in lobby waiting or waiting in room for an hour as well. I've been and worked at vet hospitals and never have our clients experience that.
Andy in the parts department is Totally Awesome! This guy goes above and beyond! Excellent!

I've been to other professional sporting events and no other has staff that truly thanks you for coming and to enjoy your stay! I was really surprised by this but to be honest I shouldn't be, because not only do the Cards have the best fans in baseball but also the best staff!

I've sat in multiple sections and have yet to find a seat I didn't like or couldn't see the action well. Last game we sat in the nose bleed seats in section 451 and honestly they were my favorite. I had a breeze being up that high and could easily see all of the game. Also the higher seats are covered so you are shaded from the sun and rain! And we had a great skyline view and highway 44. Honestly it was perfect.  

Ride the Metro and you'll have no issues with parking too!

We withdrew our daughter from Children of America. She was very unhappy and cried every morning before the inevitable drop off. When we picked her up that afternoon, we could tell she had cried the whole day. After a few days we couldn't take it any longer. The first day we picked her up from Goddard, it was like night and day. We weren't being overbearing parents, Goddard is just that much better than the competition. Don't wait it out like we did.

Quotations seems to have a loyal following, and from what I experienced recently, the great customer service has to be a big reason.  Plus the fun & spacious bar atmosphere that makes it a good place to meet up with friends.  I think this place deserves a 3* primarily because of the service.

I ordered a sesame crusted ahi tuna sandwich with onion rings instead of the chips it said it came with.  The portion was a large 6 oz (?) tuna filet - but it was more rare than I requested, so I asked for it to be cooked slightly more.  No problem, and without my asking, the management took off 50% off the price, and did not charge me for the onion rings.  I was impressed.  

As for the food --- it's not the main attraction, unless you are a big fan of Applebee-type food.  The onion rings were hot from the fryer when my sandwich first came out... but since they went back to the kitchen with my tuna, they returned lukewarm -- wish they would have either left them with me or replaced them with hot ones!  The tuna steak was obviously some pre-frozen, pre-sesame crusted fish served on a big, fluffy institutional white bread bun on top of about 5 leaves of spring mix.  I ate the fish and skipped the bun -- it was okay, but not something I would ever seek out.  My friend ordered the steamers -- they looked okay too, though the bread also looked like some soft italian bun.  A simple crusty artisan baguette could have put it over the top.

If the food was better, this would be a great place to go instead of the ever-crowded Iron Hill across the street.  But Iron Hill's food and atmosphere is just way better. . .

I usually just use the drive through whenever I have to come to the bank.  On a couple of occasions that I actually had to sit down with someone, both experiences were pleasant and not too time consuming.  Today, on my lunch break, I had to see a 'business specialist', who was also on his lunch break.  The customer service rep said the BS guy will be back in 2 minutes.  Okay.  And he was.  He was not able to help me, though not entirely his fault,  Turns out, I had to come back with some other documents, and he went out of his way to make sure I have a list of the things needed, and where to get them, and how.  Very helpful indeed.  I appreciate that.
Just bought a 2016 Cruze from Louis Ruvo and it was by far the best car buying experience I ever had. Louis was extremely helpful and made the process quick and easy.

Great business with great products very customer friendly and willing to go the extra to insure your item is available and to get shipped on time! Also very communicative. Product arrived as promised with an actual invoice.  Wry nice, business professional

Ordered the coconut shrimp curry and saag paneer via delivery from Munsalwa. Although the flavors were good, I certainly wasn't "wowed". The shrimp were small (but plentiful). But for $13, I expected to get real shrimp, not the frozen bagged kind. Also, they gave me two small trays of rice that wasn't even enough for one of the dishes. I highly suggest you order extra rice ( or make your own).

Oh my goodness, Hippie Kitchen is DELICIOUS!!! I am so excited that I recently discovered it (thanks Yelp!) and that it's only a few minutes from work. I checked out their online menu and was pleasantly surprised by how fair the prices were, considering their food is entirely made from scratch and organic. They offer a very wide range of items from breakfast to dinner and there was a lot to choose from. I like that everything is made in house and really fresh. I mean, they grow their own fruits and veggies and brew their own kombucha! Even though it's not a vegan restaurant, there were plenty of vegan options. It's rare when I find a place in this city that offers vegan pizza or vegan desserts, so major bonus points for that.

I opted for a spicy chicken burrito bowl for my first visit, which was pulled chicken, a green spring mix, "nice rice," black beans and avocado. I also ordered the Hippie Greens juice - kale, cucumber, apple, ginger - which was made fresh in front of me when I arrived. My lunch was SO tasty and nutritious!! You can place a takeout order on their website and choose when to pick up your food for convenience purposes. The staff, like other reviewers have mentioned, are super friendly. I'm already planning my next visit!

Decided to give this place a try after hearing their fish tacos were good. We just moved into the area and have driven by many times but stopped in for dinner. Oh so glad we stopped! Fish tacos are not good their grrrrreat! Fish ceviche tostada also deserved mention but could use a little more heat. The simplest things in life such as rice and beans "muy bueno". Now for their special Frozen Mango Margaritas also very good. You may be wondering why Five Stars, well, the service, the layout and just the great way you felt in the place even the other customer's comments about their food were very positive. By the way, here's a picture to feast your eyes on....yummmm!!!!  We will be back!!!!

Horrible horrible horrible customer service. I went inside, there was one person in line ahead of me and seven employees behind the counter and it p@took over 10 minutes for them to wait on the guy in front of me and they STILL didn't even take my order. manager appears to be totally useless. 

won't be back.

HANDS DOWN, THE BEST HOLIDAY/CHRISTMAS BAR IN PHILADELPHIA. There is no competition - sleigh bells are wringing, Santa is singing, and Stevie is jingling! 

If you are looking for a Christmas bar during the winter in Philly, this is your best and top option!

I went Antojitos for lunch today. I must say I was impressed. I ate a shrimp burrito and a cheese enchilada and my boyfriend had a carnitas burrito and a goat taco (I mention this, because I tried them as well.) The food was great. My burrito was absolutely delicious (I've been on a shrimp burrito kick since July after I had the best one of my life at a place called La Playa in Mission beach and I must say this is the best one I've found in Reno.) The prices at Antojitos are extremely reasonable... our total for the 2 burritos, enchilada and taco was $13 including tax. The staff was extremely friendly as well. I would definitely recommend Antojitos if you've got an itch for some quick Mexican food!

Used to come here quite a bit when i lived nearby but first after the re-opening/remodel. The ice cream was nothing special but then again we only got mint chocolate chip and cookies and cream. The girls behind the counter were friendly, the inside got a good painting and I think new tables. The outside seating area is spacious as usual even right next to the road so not the quietest. We will most certainly come by when we are in the area again since like most roadside ice cream places in Jersey they have a pretty large food menu.

Look, I like to organize things! Is that a crime? Not here, it isn't! This place is a wonderland of organization. It's like Disney for containers. So many containers. I have found lots of cool stuff here and I always walk out with something. I also like walking around and looking at all the different things to get ideas for storing stuff.

One of my classes had an online supplement that was over 200 pages, so I decided to get it printed and bound by Staples Copy & Print. The online process was super simple, and I could see how the different options would change the pricing. Once it was submitted, staples kept me up to date that they had received it and when it would be completed. 

When I went to pick up the book, I thought the staff was nice and considerate. The guy who rang me up (you can prepay online) made sure that I had the opportunity to look at my item before paying. It was a little on the pricier side about $27 for it to be printed and bound with tabs- but overall I am happy with the product and would recommend using the copy and print center.

The atmosphere was awesome. The front of the restaurant opens up and there is a nice patio are to bring the dog.
Our service was awesome. She took pride in talking about the food and brought our dog a bowl of water.
The menu was creative and most items sounded awesome. I decided to get the slayer burger. It was mounds of fries, chili, cheese, a hamburger patty, and kielbasa. The flavors were good overall. The dish just seemed to be too meaty (never thought I would say that). Fries were good and the chili had great flavor but had a lot of liquid in the bottom of the plate. Burgers taste flame grilled on a gas grill if I had to guess.
I'm looking forward to trying mac and cheese and chicken tenders.

Oh baby baby! this salt-N-pepa music running in my head still doesn't do any justice for one of moo dang's Saturday special that elevated my quaran-time to a whole new level. Massive shout out to chefs at moo dang for making kao mun gai for local foodies and this community. This dish is fundamentally cultural chasm of East meets West. It is a popular dish all over Asia - often overlooked but it's so damn good. Moo Dang spin on this classic 'chicken oily rice' is elevated with broth on the side, and a killer generous portion of ginger, garlic, chili sauce that makes this dish so addicting! 

We appreciate them for offering something outside of their menu to their loyal fans during this oh not so normal times. So excited for their next weekend special! 

#ThankYouThursday

This bar definitely stands out from other downtown Tucson bars. I have been here on some of their busiest nights and have never wait long for a drink. While some of their popular cocktails include cotton candy & poprocks, I am a huge fan of the molecular shots. My favorite is the Mexican Candy Shot. Bartenders are awesome and the option to sit inside or outdoors is a plus. Always stop by here when I'm downtown, even if only for a quick shot, never leave disappointed.

Came here with a group of friends for dinner. They were raving about how good this place is, however, the food was mediocre at best. Rice was cold. Chili relleno was probably the best thing that we had of the enchiladas and tacos. Service was good. Drinks were great. Michelada was amazing. Free shots after a $250 tab was a nice touch too. Explosive diarrhea almost instantly after finishing our meal was not ideal. Likely won't be back.

This park is fantastic enough to make me want to move back to the Rittenhouse/ Graduate Hospital area! Whenever I have a few free hours or want to smile until my cheeks hurt, I bring my handsome mutt here for some fun. I obviously come here for the dog park. There's a big dog area and a small dog area, and I only bring my jack russell to the small dog area. This is a clean, well kept dog park with plenty of benches and even trees for ample shade. I highly recommend coming here!

Located in a strip mall in SE Boise, Off Broadway Deli is known for their deli and specialty sandwiches and soups. They also have a salads, fried chicken, chicken strips, finger steaks and deli fries. 

Show them your Boise State University or military ID for 10% off your order. The same offer applies Firefighters and Police Officers.

Years ago, this business was Hugo's Deli. At some point it became independently owned. For that reason, you will notice some similarities between the menus but Off Broadway Deli has additional specialty sandwiches, their own soup recipes, and they use different seasoning/batter for their chicken. 

One of the reasons why I most wanted to visit this deli is because they are known for their extensive list of homemade soups, which they rotate through. They usually offer two soups a day but for my first visit on 11/9/21, they had three. Homemade soup is one of my favorites and I could happily eat it every day, so I ordered a bowl of each. The soup comes in two sizes, a cup for $2.99 or a bowl for $5.09. I got Jalapeño Bacon Beer Cheese, Bacon Cheeseburger, and Loaded Baked Potato. I also ordered a drumstick and some fries. Off Broadway Deli has homemade fry sauce, as well as regular and spicy ketchup, which is like cocktail sauce. I got a little of each.

All of the soups had good flavor. My favorite was a tossup between the Loaded Potato and the  Jalapeño Bacon Beer Cheese. The drumstick and fries were excellent, as was the fry sauce. 

Off Broadway Deli usually posts their daily soups on their FB page. If not, just give them a call and they'll be happy to tell you their daily soups. Their soup repertoire includes the following:
Chicken Pot Pie
Lemon Artichoke 
Chili
BBQ Chicken 
Sausage & Cabbage 
Chicken Tortilla 
Crab Bisque 
Chicken Cordon Bleu
Cheesy Cauliflower 
Cream of Broccoli 
Potato, Ham & Corn Chowder
Cream of Asparagus 
Tomato
Buffalo Bacon Cauliflower 
Chicken Poblano 
Swedish Meatball 
Clam Chowder 
Chicken Enchilada 
Maple Ham & Bean
Chicken Verde
Split Pea w/ Ham

Address: 
3369 S. Federal Way

Hours: 
Monday to Saturday - 10 AM to 5 PM
Sunday - Closed

They have a very good menu selection.  I opted to eat outside on patio which was very nice.  I had the poboy sandwich w fried oysters, shrimp and grouper.  It was fully loaded, so was worth the $12. Price, also came w fresh cut fries that were very good too.  I had to eat some of the seafood before I could turn it into a sandwich, the chiabbatta bread was fresh and warm too.  I could only eat half w the bread, I ate rest of seafood w a fork.  Couldn't finish fries either.
Next time I think I will try the shrimp n grits.
Fast service, and friendly too.  I will be back with the wifey.

We stumbled upon Rad's randomly and it did not disappoint! At first I thought it was a coffee shop, but it's a breakfast/brunch spot. We ordered the street tacos and 2 eggs, meat, hashbrowns, & toast. Both were delicious! I was most surprised about their hashbrowns. Usually hashbrowns are a bit bland, but these had some really good flavor to it! The street tacos had goat cheese on them which made for a unique flavor. It's an acquired tasted, but I like goat cheese so it was good to me! The service was great and they had a small outdoor seating area. Can't wait to try more!

My family and I rolled up to Chuy's at 9:45p and we felt terrible because they closed at 10p, but everyone was so welcoming and entertained us like the night was still young! 

My husband ordered a steak burrito and I ordered the special nachos (see photos). They gave us more than enough food and everything tasted great! 

I'm so glad there is finally a Chuy's 5mins away from home


Update...I decided to take my daughter to Chuy's this evening since we had such a wonderful experience Sunday evening, but this time wasn't so great. There was a 40min wait (which was to be expected we came around dinner time). The food was good, but the waitress (Ana) was not so much. She didn't interact with us except to take our order, never checked on us during our visit until it was time to pay. Customer service is near and dear to my heart and since there was a lack there of I gave this experience 3 stars!

Hubby and I tried out a new place this evening. He had heard good things about this "down home" cooking restaurant in Safety Harbor. We decided to try it out.
