We missed it the first time we drove past, so watch for it.... it isn't a huge place that stands out from the crowd.  Parking was in a small lot across the street or on the street itself.

Southern Fresh had nice outdoor seating areas as well as a nice indoor dining room. We opted to sit outside.  We arrived at just the right time - shortly after our arrival, several people came to eat and had to wait - on a Tuesday evening!  Wow! I have to say that the atmosphere is true to the name of the restaurant.  Southern. Loved the Southern feel to it.

We opted for appetizers before our meal. Hubby ordered the BLT soup and I ordered the jumbo cold shrimp.  Hubby raved about the soup. I would have tried it but it was full of crunchy stuff (ie. lettuce, garlic, etc.).  He repeated how good it was, though.  My shrimp cocktail was super tasty, too.  Five large jumbo shrimp.  For our entrees, Hubby ordered the signature fried chicken, mashed potatoes and gravy and green beans. I ordered the grilled meatloaf which came with mashed potatoes and gravy and grilled asparagus.  Where do I start.  The fried chicken was okay. To me, it wasn't a WOW moment. Hubby agreed. I guess after hearing people talk about it, I expected heavenly explosion on my taste buds. I was disappointed.  The meatloaf was good. Not amazing but good. Mashed potatoes with gravy -- mashed potatoes were stiff, not creamy and they served a brown-ish gravy.  I'm a milk gravy kind of girl so I was a little disappointed that a place known for its fried chicken didn't serve milk gravy, but okay.  Hubby's green beans were a bit crunchy. Good flavor but undercooked.  My asparagus was very good, however.

Overall, the bill came to just under $50.00 for two appetizers, two entrees and two non-alcoholic drinks.  This is typically what we pay when we go out so we weren't surprised by the price.  I gave it three stars.  It was okay but we both left with the same feeling that we wouldn't want to come back, especially since we drove from Tarpon Springs to eat there.  I know this will meet with some disagreement from many folks and that's okay.  Everyone likes different things. This one just wasn't one of mine.  Enjoy!

Love this place, I think I'm here at least once a week, or twice if I get a last minute food order.  I prefer to shop here for most of my fruits and veggies, if I'm not going to make it to farmers market.  All their produce seems fresh and actually it is priced fairly, they have tons of organic items (my choice) and they don't break the bank.  And the people are always restocking making sure shelves are full and never empty.  Plus they all seem to be always super friendly and in good mood.  The bathrooms are always clean and the sample station is also always clean.  Coffee sampling place sometimes can seem a bit messy, but it just takes one person to mess that up, but did see a crew member get to it right away.  Good selection of cheeses, beer and wines.  And I do love the "what's new section" always great new finds.  So yes I will continue to shop at Trader Joe's!! Wish there was something that could be done with the parking lot, never enough parking!

We had a fun time at this establishment. It was a bit difficult to find but you literally have to go to the upstairs room to get to the bar. The bar is a tiki bar and the menu is full of all types of exotic drinks which you will have fun trying. The drinks are a bit on the expensive side but regardless it is fun. Depending on the drink you order it will be served in a very different maybe even creepy glass but you will like it. Not sure if I would go back but it was ok for at least one visit.

Multiple places were closed, so accidentally ended up at Cavern and it was a pleasant surprise. The owner was very friendly and very accommodating. We went on a Saturday when the Farmer's market was running. It was not too busy, does have outside seating and you have to walk down a flight of stairs and hope there's some seating available inside. You can sit and enjoy some java/wine or other beverages with sandwiches/charcuterie (meat and cheese boards). You can also take away which is nice. My friend and i ended up with Cappuccino and sat longer through an Americano each. No disappointment there. Our meal was a freshly baked croissant and mine happen to be a turkey sandwich. Be aware that the place has a lot of meat sausage and pork options and not a lot of alternatives and we found out quickly that you should get their early if you dont want to miss out on their fresh pastries because they run out before 11am! It is quaint and good for small groups or if you want to sit at the bar yourself. 
It is located on 104th and you can get to it by walking, taking the train and walking, taking the bus and walking, driving, parking and walking. What I am trying to say is that there is no reason to miss out on this awesome experience and friendly staff. Place is clean and aesthetically pleasing if you like cafe like feel away from busy city lights and noise.

I went here with a friend a few weeks ago and it was such a nice experience.  They have a nice selection of food, we both got the granola with fruit and it was great. I usually am let down by granola when I order it but we both thought it was spectacular. The fruit was super fresh too. 

The staff was nice and helpful as we decided our orders at the counter. 

They have nice outdoor seating options too- we snagged a small table under a tree to shade us from the Nashville heat. Great local cafe!

I seriously could not recommend Bree enough! After trying 2 other spray tan options in preparation for my wedding Bree was by FAR the best! She comes to you which is obviously so convenient but even more than that she makes you feel so comfortable and at ease. I did the gradual tan option because I wasn't looking for anything super dark. It was amazing bc I was able to shower within an hour and a half! The tan lasted longer than most and fades much more evenly. 

For my wedding tan she came to me and was extremely flexible when I added two of my friends to the list as well. She was in and out so quick and our tans all looked great! 

Take it from someone who did their homework - trying out 3 local options. Bree is by far the best out there!

I love brunch. I've gone to Cafe La Maude a couple of times with different groups of friends and haven't been disappointed. The last time I went was with my girlfriend and her first time was a good experience.

First off, the environment is very welcoming. It may get busy but all the workers are fast, friendly, and very communicative. Even in a packed restaurant our food didn't take long, and our server was on top of her game with refilling our waters. Bravo! 

My girlfriend got the simple breakfast which is basically an assortment of breakfast foods. She got very full and I had to help her finish, so this was a good choice on her part. This time I got the steak frite which sort of let me down. The portion was very small for the price, and the steak was cooked a bit too long as it wasn't tender. I've had their other sandwiches and they were all great, so maybe this was an outlier. 

When I'm thinking brunch on a nice day, this place would have to be considered as I decide on where to go.

This restuarant has the potential of being a five star establishment. The food was good and the waitress was so nice and kind. I had chicken and waffles which were delicious and my friend had beef tips which were tender and delicious. The service was mediocre. There was one waitress on duty when we got there and she had difficulty handling the small rush that developed.

O'oooooooooooo DANG, over MOO DANG!!
This place is amazing. Fast friendly service! AMAZING FOOD. I love Thai food, but don't get to eat it very often. So when I was asked to join some fellow yelpers for dinner here, I did not hesitate. 

Smart move on my part. We received Fried Fish Balls, that were amazeballs!! Just for checking in on yelp. Our table shared Drunken Noodles, Pad Thai, Garlic & Pepper Shrimp and Chicken Stir Fry, and Ginger and Mushroom Stir Fry...which had the best flavor pop my mouth has experienced in a while!!

Everything came out hot and fast, with delicious flavor!! I will be back. I really want to try the Coconut and Thai Tea Ice Cream, that is worth a stop right there!!

LOVE THIS CONCEPT. 

I'm originally from the south, and I really hope this chain moves down here!! MOD pizza is your chipotle style pizza place, except a lot better. UNLIMITED TOPPINGS (hello, double/triple meat?!),cooked in a brick stone oven for a few minutes, all for a little over 8 bucks?! Yasssssss. I love how I can customize my pizza (since most pizza places always screw up my little cheese preference), and I can get whatever I want for such a low price. I also love how all the ingredients were so fresh. Another thing to love is their pre customized pizza! I was I was around the area to try the different kinds :( The pizza was even better the next morning.

Keep in mind all you bread lovers- the crust is kinda thin. 

Papa John's, dominos, and whatever other delivery pizza- MOVE OVER. MOD pizza is going to be the next big thing.
Worst post office ever. Staff is almost always rude and unhelpful. They don't even offer tape without getting in line to the front counter...they always have a line.

This is my second time being here in the last few years. I can't stress enough how clean and efficient this place is! I literally was in and out in 40 minutes - no joke! This morning I arrived a little before 8am and there was already a short line waiting outside before it opened. I was a little skeptical, but after quickly filling out paperwork, I was called back within five minutes (I'm not saying it's going to be this quick for everyone, but in my case since I came in early and was already on file, it helped). For new patients you can sign up online to make your trip quicker once you check into AFC.

After checking your weight, temperature and BP, they put me in a room and said the doctor would be in shortly. Within a matter of 10-15 minutes I was seen, given medication, and was on my way. 

Staff is very kind, office is clean, and they even offer coffee and cold water bottles in the waiting room. I believe they accept lots of different insurance providers and are open seven days a week.

Waitresses placed a soup and Spring Roll in front of me right after sitting down for lunch! Talk about fast! Thom yum Soup was good light broth, not too spicy heat wise. It had onions, mushrooms, tomatoes in it, the Spring Roll was hot inside and still steaming, crunchy wrapping gave way to soft vegetables. Three bites max lol. I got the Number 12 lunch special which is Padd Pak Rum Mitt with Tofu. Lots of vegetables: carrots, broccoli, onions, red peppers, mushrooms, baby corn served in a brown soy based sauce. Thai food is sweet and so was this sauce. All good.

An ice sculpture event on whyte Avenue. This year they had the event enclosed under tents to protect the sculptures from sun/ snow. The displays were nice and nicely lite with colored lights. There is also an inflatable igloo that offers ice craving Class - good for the kiddies. The igloo is also heated so nice to quickly warm up there too. There's also an ice bar. Overall, a pretty small space but in a convenient location on Whyte Ave where you can stop by if you happen to be in the area.
Admission is $7 per adult- we were only there for short time, so not too much time was killed there. But if you're in search of something to do on whyte and out of ideas, then worth a gander.

Besides the fact that it's always crowded and hard to navigate, Trader Joe's is the bomb.com.
I really wish there was a location in Slidell. They're produce is fresh and doesn't smell like it was transported through a garbage dump. I love the cheeses. Their brand of foods are top notch and affordable. I love their fresh flowers and herbs. The cashiers are cool people. They're chill and not overly bubbly, which can come off as fake. It's a vibe y'all. Stop by

This little gem on the south side initially strikes people as a quick take-out Chinese restaurant; however, they actually have some pretty satisfying authentic dishes to order. I highly recommend the beef brisket, the dry-fried green beans, and the beef chow fun. 

Currently, there is only take-out. Either pay ahead of time or bring exact cash (they aren't even letting people come up to the register).

For fast food Mexican food, El Guero Canelo is the place to try!
The menu has a few meats (pollo or carne), however they offer it so many different ways and cook it so well every way!
My personal favorite is the caramelos - the meat to cheese ratio is perfect, but the torta is also phenomenal. 
This is also one of my favorite places to grab a Sonoran dog!
They give a few salsas with meals that are varied in flavors and level of heat, so you're bound to find one you like!

Five stars for the incredible forward thinking beers that they have to offer, but curved lower with some of the food experiences that I've had. But on the whole Roy Pitz Barrel House is a perfect destination to hit up before a show at Union Transfer, Underground Arts, etc.

Roy Pitz call their beers liquid art for good reason, and before coming to the Barrel House I've been won over by the fancy names, well rounded brew selection that goes well beyond typical IPAs, and the detailed label art that they put into their cans and bottles. The art for beers like Ludwig's Revenge, Lovitz Watermelon Lager, and Laydown Stay Down could definitely be placed in a pop art museum. So when I heard that they were opening a brewpub in the Eraserhood I was instantly ready to give it a shot. And I love that the wacky murals, sports art installations, and even communal sitting arrangements play to the Liquid Art theme.

For beers the affordable flight deals have allowed me sample a huge variety. Fans of boozy beers will instantly be down with their rum barrel aged Captain Bill's Barleywine and the barrel aged Psychedelic Strawberry Belgian sour. IPA fans can't go wrong with the Step Up Your Game New England, Belgian Fans can Mind Your P's and Q's with a solid tripel, and regular beer drinkers can't go wrong with their Best Blonde lager. But they also have plenty of seasonals, and a couple of other brews from locals like Troegs and St. Benjamin's Brewing.

For food I've ordered right on apps, but had some mishaps on entrees. On my first visit I was craving the grilled cheese and tomato soup combo that was mentioned as a special, but soon regretted it after I was presented with not very grilled plain mozzarella cheese on a roll alongside some soup that was just decent. Things were slightly better with the chicken schnitzel sandwich with its delicious mulled apple honey butter spread, but just missed its mark on dry chicken. Apps have led me to some solid revelations however, especially with their incredible cheese boards, and their amazing buttermilk persimmons which might just be the best gluten free vegetarian alternative to fried chicken ever!

Add in options like a Cubano sandwich with sweet hot pickles, duck & roasted fig cavatappi, and coffee rubbed beer braised short ribs and I'm sure to find that better entree yet. And so long as the beers are good I'm ready for that challenge.

I had frozen yogurt for the first time in my adult life at Yogorino last night. Turns out, it's changed a lot since I was little and isn't at all like the stuff found in the freezer section at the grocery store. Creamy, slightly tart but still just sweet enough, I took one look at the plastic jugs of fake syrup toppings and instead opted for some fresh chopped nectarines. 

As a few others have pointed out, it is hard to distinguish what each topping is just from the sign on the wall. Meringue pieces looked like mochi, the sauces were unidentifiable from each other, etc.

The price points were fair, and I left satisfied but not too full from a small cup.

The train from Berwyn to Wynnewood was a pleasant way to arrive to this little strip mall eatery.  My niece and her fiance met us and was excited for us to try their favorite Brunch spot.  It is here where I input that fact that they do not have alcohol, so if you are a mimosa kind of person, grab a bottle of Champagne to bring with you.  

The vibe reminded me so much of the old skool Omelettry on Burnet Rd in Austin.  The place was hoping by 10am.  Fortunately, as an FBI Agent should know, she had called ahead and got on the wait.  And yes, she is a FBI Analyst.  Short wait and off to our table with a view of the hordes waiting outside.  Multiple menus were presented.  The walk to our table already made me realize, portions were very generous.  I went for the special Blitzkrieg Benedict on spinach, Canadian bacon and homies.  (Home Fries).  After shedding a quick tear due to not knowing they didn't serve alcohol, I tucked into my coffee.  It was quite robust.  Me likey.  

Brekkies arrived, huge portion as well as the short stack of pancakes, niece's fiance ordered for the table.  Poached eggs prepared perfectly, home fries crisp outside soft inside.  Munched my way through most of my breakfast as wifey enjoyed her breakfast.  I did get a bit of her black bean grits.. yeah I know what?  Very good as well.  

Service was very pleasant, on point, informative and quick.  She came by to check on the Coffee refills, removed plates and produced the check.  All done in a comfy manner, but not trying to cuddle up to us.  I certainly can see why my niece loves this place.  If we resided in Wynnewood, it would defo become on of ours.

The new location is a very pretty space, and it was nice to park in the garage and have parking validated.  We showed up right at opening time for lunch, and it was freezing!  I didn't warm up the entire meal.

Chicken Teriyaki Lunch Box = 5/5, Great value (rice, chicken terriyaki, California roll, vegetable tempura, shrimp tempura, house salad)

Tani Nigiri Combination = 5/5, My friend ordered this, I didn't taste it, but he really liked it, and again, the serving size looked like a great value for what we paid

I was so excited to try this place after seeing a story on them on TV. 

Tried red velvet, strawberry, vanilla and cookie dough and I can only recommended cookie dough of those. 

The flavors were OK but nothing special.

Red Velvet claimed to be a cream cheese frosting when it was really 1/10th cream cheese and 9/10 buttercream. Fine if you like buttercream, disappointment if you like traditional cream cheese. The cake itself was underwhelming but passable. 

The vanilla cake had the consistency of angel food cake with little flavor and then frosting was passable but nothing special. 

The strawberry was a watered down strawberry which looked cute but if I hadn't known it was strawberry flavored, I likely would have assumed a vanilla for a girl's birthday party. 

The cookie dough *actually* tasted like cookie dough and the cake itself had a good texture and flavor.

McDougal's has great chicken fingers (fried or grilled) and wings. The sauces are yummy, but don't seem to be from scratch. It's a great place to catch a happy hour, with a nice sized patio when the weather is right.

But wait - the best part: the french fries are AWESOME. They are hand-cut in the restaurant and have just the right texture and flavor. They go well with some tearjerker chicken wings or just a beer.

Oh yeah!! I love this place now. I'm addicted.
They make absolutely fabulous guacamole - I mean, seriously one of the best I've had, consistently. 
They make absolutely delicious chiles rellenos - I get mine with salsa verde and they are just amazing. Tacos are great. Flautas and sopes too.
Even their beans are super-tasty.
They have a nice outdoor patio for dining, but keep in mind it's pretty small inside so it could be crowded. It's not ridiculously overpriced like other similar restaurants, it's definitely not a tourist trap.

So I got here at 8:20am and after ignoring me and helping the regulars (Mr. Larry) and pouring coffee for people that came in 10 minutes after me, the waitress Tonya finally took my order at 8:38 am.18 minutes after I was seated. Once I got my food she never checked on me but again, went out of her way to help the regulars. Mr. Larry sat behind me and she asked him 3 times how he was going and then, asked the people in front of me skipping me completely. She literally was swooning over her regulars and ignored me the entire time. I usually tip 20-25% and this is the first time in at least 10 years- and maybe the 3rd time ever - won't be tipping.Food is always good but the service is questionable.

At first caliber collision was on it! Sending me notifications, keeping me in the loop, helping get my car towed to their shop. However, the longer my car was there the more issues I had. I had an estimated date of completion. Okay, perfect. The week of my estimated completion I was notified that the replacement bumper was damaged and had to be reordered. Again, no harm no foul. I get a message two days later stating it was in, and should be done at the beginning of the following week. Never got another update. When I called them they stated the bumper was on back order. So, which was it? Damaged or back order? Followed by we'll call you back. Never received a phone call. Call them two days later and they can't figure out where the wire goes for my day time running light after four people have looked at it. Finally I get my vehicle back without the light being fixed and stated they'd call me when their technician is in and can fix it.  In the meantime, there is grease all over the inside door on my tan interior. It's been a headache.

A truly vegetarian delight!  I took a Jewish friend here and I wanted to be respectable to his food needs.  Since I don't know which places serve kosher meat, I typically stick with vegetarian food which I know he loves.  

Every single dish had a lot of good flavor.  Any of these dishes could easily have been plain and so-so or not great, but Noodle 88 knows how to prepare these foods for a grand cuisine.  

"88" are lucky numbers and is traditional in Asian cultures for good luck. I've been to this restaurant many times and I feel lucky to continue to receive such delicious food!

I would give zero stars if possible!  They cancelled the day before our move this week and left us scrambling to find a mover the day before our closing!  I see this is a pattern after reading other reviews!  I will be telling everyone I know NOT TO HIRE THEM!

We've been here multiple times. First off, the bang for your buck is unbeatable!!!
Super clean on the inside, super friendly staff that are accommodating to your wants. The food is awesome, we range from tuna tatami to basic hibachi chicken. We have never been let down !!

Sprouts is a fun, fascinating and friendly place to shop that will be a welcome addition to my regular shopping rounds. 

The parking lot seems spacious enough although I have not attempted a visit during prime times but I hope that the availability of parking remains the rule and not the exception.

The interior is large with big sections of space given to bulk foods and the displays of fresh seafood and meat. The employees here seem eager to offer suggestions or help, whether it's to help determine how much to purchase to feed a crowd or to have a specific selection of sushi made on the spot.

I was surprised at the range of grab-and-go foods there that include sushi, baked chicken, turkey and port and heat-and-eat selections that offer vegan, vegetarian and gluten-free options. Well done, Sprouts!

While I have not yet bought any baked goods, it is only a matter of time because they look that good!

The wine selection is not excessive and there are some reasonable prices available but nothing that would make me go out of the way to purchase wine here (unlike Trader Joe's and its larger assortment of appealing prices for select wines).

A good chunk of the store is filled with personal grooming products, supplements and specialty drinks to replace electrolytes or enhance energy. While the pet food offerings were not extensive just about everything else seemed to provide a number of choices.

So many of the brands and products stocked here are new to me but I like forward to gradually making their acquaintance over the months ahead.

Sprouts is a welcome addition to the South Tampa shopping scene for its produce, for its prices (for some items) and for its personality!

Snuggled in the neighborhood of Northern Liberties you'll find this gem of a place. This is a tapas place, so don't come alone, come with some people to share in the small plates with you (I'd say the perfect party size is 3-4 or any multiple thereof). 

I've been here several times and have very fond memories here. The sangria here is awesome. I almost always get a pitcher of it. Someone almost always ends the night very tipsy and laughing.

As far as the food goes:
- Pulpo a la plancha - The octopus is great at pairs well with the acid in the grapefruit
- Manchego frito - I have gotten this every single time I'm there. I love the cheese, and that cold apple foam it comes with is kind of a surprise.
- Pollo y champinones empanada - This may be a little tough to share, but it's tasty.
- Any of the croquettes are good, I like the Jamon.

Well there you have it, this is a great place to have a good time.

Ventured out of our way to visit this lovely bakery on a Saturday rainy morning.  Love that everything is made with pasture raised cows dairy and local farms eggs.  So many baked good options with unique savory options.  Enjoyed the quiche, veg hand pie, oatmeal cream cookie sandwich, triple chocolate cookie.  The cortado was good also.  Cute "pint" size place.

We received a quote after about 4 hours of meeting the person. We liked the company because we hired them for our windows and our tenants bedroom windows. I have to say they are costly. However, after receiving many estimates and reading the others warranties, Power Home Remodeling covered more than any of them. It is transferable to the next owners (if we ever sell) for 50 years.  We had our home roof replaced, gutters and soffits replaced. Excellent job! They cleaned up very well and did it in a timely manner. I was disappointed with the high price. They can get annoying with calls. Maybe they can work on that. They also need to train their reps better. They get too personal and waste too much time talking. Needless to say, they get the job done right the first time and make sure. I've heard of people getting their roof done for cheap. Remember, you get what you pay for. Just saying!

This is one of those hidden gems.  Everytime I go I'm impressed. The fish & Chips a fantastic as are the Cajun entrees.  Friendly staff and fair prices. Great drink selection and live music on occasion.

Well .....it's not the same as the BBQ blues and brews fest this past weekend, but we had a "buy one meat plate get one free" coupon !  So for $10.95 off you can't go wrong.  I am partial to the sweet BBQ sauce, and I also treated myself to some fried okra which was crispy and not greasy.  I got the beef brisket plate and my husband got the turkey plate.

The quirky "Nawlins" atmosphere invites you right in. Great food at a decent price point. I had the lobster po' boy with spicy cajun fries $16.99 & the voodoo shrimp appetizer $13.99. Both were very good tasting & I will definitely be back! The only thing that bothered me was that as I sat in the patio area, there were so many flies around the tables. I think they can do a better of limiting the amount of them by either installing a bug lamp or fly tape.

If you are searching for a basic no frills grocery store, Safeway Foods has you covered if you are the Broad Ripple area.   I have been going to Safeway Foods for years and unfortunately, just like anything that gets old, a refresh is going to be necessary at some point in time.  Safeway Foods is a place in need of a do over. 

What I like about Safeway Foods?  I have found some unique items at Safeway Foods.   They are a bit pricey on their produce that is not organic so I recommend skipping the produce section unless you are in dire straights and do not feel like heading to the other grocery stores in the area.  

The cashiers are always nice that I have encountered and since there is no self-checkout lanes, you do get the opportunity to have a live person help you check out.   I personally prefer having a real live cashier any day of the week.   There is also ample parking for the small customer base that Safeway Foods gets.   They do have a decent dairy section as well as general staples so you should be able to find the everyday basics.  

If you just need some basic items and want to avoid the huge crowd that major supermarket chains typically have, Safeway Foods may be just what you need.

Freshest guacamole around. Love the extra lime juice they add. 

UPDATE FROM CHECK-IN:

This may not always be fast, but it is always good. Authentic Mexican cuisine is where it is at, y'all. 

The place specializes in fish and other seafood dishes and has some of the best ceviche around Indy. 

Other great dishes include their Pollo Mole and of course, great tacos. 

My usual quick pick me up is a steak taco and a spicy pork sope. This combo is under $8. 

With plenty of free, fresh salsa and their house-made chips I'm ready to go.

Located in quaint Irvington on the Eastside, you'll see plenty of local neighborhood folks eating there. They serve beer, but no hard liquor (it's an Irvington thing) and there are plenty of Latin soap operas to keep you entertained on the tele.

New posh frozen yogurt spot in the neighborhood. So, EXCITED!  

I think the place is really cute and it appeals to adults and kids. Colorful chairs and wall art. The color of the walls were played down which is a good thing since the accessories and furnishings are so vibrant. There are 4 wall stations that serve soft yogurt. Each station gives you 3 choices of self serve yogurt. After you get your desired yogurt amount, there is a topping station with multiple choices of candy, crushed grahams crackers, boba, syrups and plenty more. You pay based on the amount of yogurt in a medium sized cup which is weighed. Yes, the amount is $$-$$$ for yogurt but I am not surprised based on the location and its moderate high end yogurt shop styling & decor. I recommend they get a variety of sizes for the yogurt cups, especially smaller sizes for the kids.

The place not only serves yogurt but also, smoothies, breakfast sandwiches, coffee and sweet treats. I was able to sample the Tahitian vanilla and Caramel macchiato. The sample size was more than I expected and was almost filling. I decided on a mixture of Tahitian vanilla and expresso. Wow, they both were so delicious. I ate in,  sat at the front in a comfy brown leather lounge chair and watched some television.

My experience was very positive and hoping I don't gain too much weight since this place is in walking distance. Because I will be back here again , again and again.

My wife and I have been to Momo's many times now.  Their food is always fresh and is so good.  It is refreshing to have a healthy option in town that not a burger place or another chain.  My 7 year old and 5 year old love their dumplings and meatballs.  What really brings the meal together is their sauce (we love their spicy) which they make themselves and you can now buy locally.  We can eat a full meal their and not feel like we overate.  For first timers, just go in and order the combo and their staff will help you put together a wonderful meal.
misgendering someone on purpose is just disrespectful. katie i don't even know you but i'm ashamed. do better.

I have a home that is underwater, but I am current on it and have great credit.  I listen to Dave Ramsey frequently so I decided to give the new HARP program a try through his recommend mortgage company ELP.

Wow, what a mistake!!  I've owned at least 10 houses and have used many mortgage companies over the years.  I started the process in early August and we had received approval and the subordination agreement from the second mortgage by the first of part of September.  When they asked for some of the same information again in December I told them to close it or can it.

It was the most amazing process of stupidity I have ever gone through.  I have never dealt with an underwriting department that was so inept.  They constantly were asking for the same information over and over again.

I cannot for the life of me understand why Ramsey, who I believe is a pretty upfront guy, would recommend such a company.
Food is always cold every time. Always a bad experience. Temp never good. I wouldn't recommend this place for drive thru.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND! I have a specific request for very, very short acrylic nails since I play guitar. No nail salon in Metairie I've ever been to (and I've been to A LOT over the years) would help me out. They ALL would say it's too hard. I came here for the first time and without hesitation, gave me exactly what I wanted!!! I also came here without an appointment and it was getting late and they were MORE than welcoming for me to come. The women that work here are SO nice and you can tell they really care about their customers! I will 100% be returning. I noticed how sweet and attentive the workers were to their customers and knew them by name! Really appreciate them for helping me out!

Consistently one of my favorite places to grab breakfast when I am on the go.  I stopped in this morning, and as per usual, the service was outstanding and my Morning Classic on a Swiss Onion bagel was EVERYTHING.  We were "those" customers who had a huge order and didn't call ahead, but everything came out promptly and correctly.  The muffins are consistently on point (borderline life-changing), and I am a huge fan of their reward system which gives you $7 off or a free drink with every X amount of money you spend (I don't want to know what X is because it will make me think I need to re-evaluate how much money I spend on breakfast food).  Definitely worth checking out!

Had an overall positive experience. Went on a Sunday night so it wasn't super busy.  The food was good but took awhile for the pizzas to come out which was surprising since they're weren't a lot of people there. It seemed like there was a bit of confusion between the staff as to the logistics and operations in the cooking area of the kitchen.  Our first pizza came out and then we had to wait a few minutes for the 2nd one.  Another customer's pizza came out in between which was odd since we ordered both of our pizzas at the same time. We weren't in a rush so we didn't mind.  I would return and see if things had improved since our last visit.

Their kindness and understanding of my difficult problems with my prescription and their willingness to take the time and care to be sure I was helped was astounding!  I cannot thank them enough or give them a high enough review for making life easier with my stressful situation. They are a blessing. 
Caring service and wonderful follow up. They only want the very best for their customers. You could not ask for anything more

First off this place is in need of a major update, it looks as if it never left the 90's. Fortunately I was given a gift card to come here and didn't have to spend my own money on this experience. Everything seemed to be broken, the locker room smelled terrible I was scared to even take my flip flops off because of how dirty it was. Went to get a pedicure, which was laughable because nothing worked and they where practically out of nail polish colors. Had lunch in that outdated dining room. I decided to order a burger because I was too afraid too get anything else. I specifically told my server what I didn't want on my burger and I requested a sweet tea. She brought out the exact opposite and no sweet tea.... The massage I received was decent but I definitely wont be back. I'm surprised this place is still open and people actually come here.

We contacted John Schimon, owner of Adobe King, soon after moving into our 1963 burnt adobe home in midtown Tucson.  The presale house inspection revealed water damage/deterioration to some of the lower adobe bricks, needing attention.  

John came over and gave the home a pretty thorough going over, including the roof, with me in tow.  He has vast experience in adobe repair and restoration and concluded overall the house was in pretty good shape.  Over time, the adobe had been well cared for.  

John gave me some strong directions on how to repair the damaged adobe bricks on my own with a stop at Home Depot. 
 
Then, because he didn't "fix " anything, kindly refused our offer of payment.  What an unexpected gesture from a real Tucson adobe pro.  We are most grateful.

These people are thieves....they auctioned off a fake gold coin as if it was real gold ... they didn't advise the bidders on line ... some poor sap paid $1800 for a a gold plated fake coin... these people are crooks..

Also they do not ship anything bought at auction... normally that would be ok ... except this is an online auction ... in other words you win you lose cause you can't get the goods shipped...

This place is absolutely adorable! The aesthetic is incredible and the brunch menu was amazing. The warm burrata is messy but delicious. We got the French toast for the table and the shrimp Caesar salad. Huge portions and super kind service. Such a great spot

Dr. Winthrop was originally recommended by my husband for my own LASIK procedure. I was apprehensive at first; but a few other friends have also seen him for their LASIK procedures.

All had great experiences, and I can say similarly for myself. Scheduling was a breeze; and Dr. Winthrop and his team were very patient and helpful in answering all my questions and concerns surrounding LASIK.
Excellent philly gyro and gyro burrito. Falafel balls are amazing! Nice staff. Will keep coming back.

I've never been to the 104 Street Farmers' Market, but I'd heard about how good the Queen of Tarts baked goods were. I stopped by one afternoon just before they were going to close. Inside the bakery was very nice. I didn't realize it was going to be in a basement, but even still the area was really bright and cheery. There was a small seating area, and it looked like they had some savoury options if you were going for lunch. I grabbed a lime tart to go. It was delicious, nice tart lime flavour and a graham cracker crust. Considering the bakery is along 104 Street and close to the LRT I'm sure I'll be back. I only wish they stayed open a little bit later during the week.
Best pasta in Tampa. It's become a date night staple my girlfriend and I. Always super fresh and made with love.

3.5 stars. This is a no frills Chinese/Taiwanese restaurant in the Keystone area. Excellent value and we felt all our dishes were of quality ingredients.

Both trying to watch our calorie intake but tired of salads, I suggested we try out TTH for dinner the other night. 

We were bummed that TTH was out of the edame, so we settled on the crispy green beans as an app instead. They were crunchy and full of flavor! I would categorize them more as sauteed than fried, but they were seasoned with salt and garlic and were super fresh. Yum.

We also shard a pot of decent green tea and slurped some  miso soup (comes with most entrees). It was really tasty soup, and it was the right temperature! Perfect for a cold winter day.

We were happy to hear that for any entree, one can sub out the meat for tofu OR extra veggies! I ordered the Lemon Chicken, and my friend had... a tofu dish with a brown sauce. Buddha something or other. We enjoyed both dishes a lot. For less than 7 bucks you get a good sized portion of food with rice, 2 small crab rangoons, and miso soup. Great value.

Annnnd, unlike typical Chinese takeout, the veggies and meat/proteins weren't drowning in a syrupy mystery sauce. 

Things to improve upon: we were given the green bean app and our soups at basically the same time, and about 3 minutes after that our entrees were served. Needless to say, the entrees got cold as we tried to eat the app and soups quickly. Slow. It. Down. Thanks!

Second, our server was really awkward. Freakishly smiley, but barely spoke to us. He abrasively took plates without warning or communication, and gave us our entrees by yelling at us, "chicken?" and "brown?" 

Almost every one eating in the restaurant was Asian, which is always a good sign.

Personally, I like Convivo because their menu consistently offers something different than everyone else in town. Chef Peter McNee considers it a blend of "nomad" Italian with its Mediterranean influences and local California 'farm to table' ingredients. While I don't fully understand what all this means, everything is simply delicious. So delicious that it is always winning an award or being mentioned in the press (SB Independent Foodie Award, New York Times Places to Go, Zagat, to name a few). Don't get me wrong, the service, atmosphere, setting, and service are all spectacular. You're practically on East Beach for gosh sake!
Yet, they have one of the best Happy Hours in Santa Barbara daily 3:00-6:00 PM that features how it stands out from its competition. Between the Yellow Potatoes with Za'atar and Romesco sauce, tender Polpette lamb meatballs with tapenade and chickpeas, and Wood-fired za'atar flatbread with fresh accompaniments, I don't know which item tops the list. All of the Happy Hour items are tapas-style, or meant to be shared. Since Convivo is the restaurant for the Santa Barbara Inn, it's hours are extensive. 
P/S: Don't get tripped up by staring at the bar which has one side all windows and the other all mirrors. It becomes even more confusing with each glass of wine (worth mentioning, they have a great selection of wines available).

Beignets? Yessssss!! And they're so good! I can't wait to be back again. Their Cajun calamari is very good and don't forget to check in on Yelp to get a basket of yummy Cajun fries. We had the shrimp po boy..I expected it to be more buttery but it was still a great sandwich. I appreciated the establishment itself...everything was clean! Tables, chairs, decor, bar floor looked well-kept and clean and I didn't find any dust or stains. I would definitely visit them again when in Reno. They're a true gem!

First let me say the restaurant is laid out so well and has a beautiful decor. The menu is awesome! But after that things began to fall apart. Right off the bat the overwhelming Smoky smell reminds you of a dive Barbecue Pit restaurant. It's so heavy and permeates everything. We had to go straight home after dinner to change clothes and take showers it was so bad. Evidently the original strip mall contractor didn't consider restaurant ventilation for the future. Service was extremely slow. Only a quarter of the restaurant was full yet it took 30 minutes to get our drink orders and over 45 minutes to get our food order in. The server just kept bringing water to fill glasses as she was trying to keep up with other tables that were there before us. Everyone at our table agreed the steaks were under seasoned and the sides were overrated for the price and the taste. Not one time did a manager or assistant manager or an owner come by to check on us to see how our evening was going which speaks volumes. Last but not least the bathroom looks like it belongs in a dive bar. We were so disappointed! It was our first time and I think it will be our last time at Ludlow and Prime. There's too many other fabulous restaurants in the area that charge the same amount for a much nicer experience.

I'd give negative stars if I could.  I am CONSTANTLY getting mail for others and my mail is delivered to others at least three times per week.  This most recent incident was the icing on the cake... I ordered a package priority shipping.  Signature required.  The mail delivery person placed the Signature Required slip in the locked mail box.  I reschedule the delivery for today.... Guess what is in my locked mail box, the "sorry we missed you, you need to sign this to get your package"  Called and waited over 35 mins to speak with someone. The man that FINALLY answered told me I'd have to call back tomorrow and then hung up.  I may get a PO Box in another town or request delivery from the moon... it certainly wouldn't take as long to get my mail.  So over this mail man and his stupid jeep.
Great shrimp poboy.  Great service I enjoyed everything.  As usual.  Always good food

I give this place one star for the location. Fantastic location, short walk to everything. We recently spent a few days, three nights here. The front desk staff is miserable - I run a small business, I get that it's hard to be friendly all the time, but that's literally your job for eight hours. Don't make guests feel like a burden when they ask for toilet paper or towels for their rooms that housekeeping failed to provide. 

Bar staff is rude. No cold beer. Very slow service. Same with front desk staff. 

The rooms are dirty. Filthy. Gross. We had a corner suite with water views. Toothpaste marks on the mirror, dust everywhere, you could see piles of dirt and junk between the bed and bedside table, hair in the shower, etc. Very dim lighting in the room and in the bathroom especially (you will not be applying cosmetics in the bathroom), two small stained towels for two adults, no back up toilet paper, no liner in the garbage bin (that is inconveniently located outside the bathroom, instead of one in each room). Very small, poorly cleaned, unimpressive room. Stained towels, stained bedding, stained carpets. This place was a dump.

No WiFi. No cable. Some of the outlets don't work in the room. 

Extremely thin walls - we could hear the conversations of the couple in the room beside us, clearly, could have easily joined in. People in the halls carrying on all night. You're not going to get much rest here. 

My absolute FAVORITE part of this dump was the elevators. Oh the lovely, safe, updated elevators!!! At no time were all four working - this is a 23 floor hotel with only four elevators, and for much of our stay, only two were working, at times only one. I LOVED waiting in the lobby for more than thirty minutes to go up to my room on the 22nd floor. So much fun. And there's no bathrooms down there in the lobby - you can take stairs to the second floor bathrooms if you need them, but they're usually locked according to staff, and they were when I tried to access them after coming back to a line of almost two dozen people waiting for an elevator after we'd been out to dinner. Super convenient. Once, a group of us were stuck in the elevator and despite pressing the call button, no one picked up and no one came to assist. Two of the guys in the elevator eventually got the door pried open and we were able to exit. Super fun. When we told a guy who identified himself as maintenance he just shrugged and said he hadn't heard any complaints, the desk just said it happens and walked away back on their phones. 

I am extremely unhappy with the hotel, the cavalier attitude of the staff when we complained, the numerous safety issues, etc. I would NEVER recommend it and I would never go back. None in my group would. Absolutely a shame, wonderful location and you can tell that it was once a really nice place. This place was an absolute dump. We were a business group of more than two dozen, rented meeting rooms and all - we were all very unhappy with our accommodations and treatment. Our next trips to Nola, both business and professional, will be with another hotel and not this dump.

Kremp Florist gave me the option of having my order delivered on a Saturday. Then on that Saturday, emailed me to tell me it wasn't possible.  I could have made other arrangements or ordered from another company to assure my Stepmother received something ON her birthday. Don't they realize people order flowers for a special occasion and it's not special if it's delivered after the occasion!

Worst hospital I've ever been to in New Orleans. The staff is unprofessional when you walk in emergency, heartless and, no urgency regarding patient care!  We've  been here for hours.  The only friendly staff in admitting are in triage.
Tried to get an appointment for the Pulmonary Clinic. The clinic had no availability for two and a half months. Received another referral from my doctor and have an appointment at Oschner next week.

I came here with the recommendation from a local. The food was delicious ( Brussels sprouts and the Cajun Fries) but upon eating it and once I moved it there were like three small flies that came out of it. They continued to come around and come out as I tried to continue to eat. I tried to get a picture but it was moving to fast. Unfortunately I got grossed out and I didn't get to finish my meal. The bathrooms were also not properly cleaned. I hope it was them just having a bad day. And it's not normally like this. E

Oh wow the flavors are intense the price is right and you enjoy yourself immensely. King ribs barbecue is definitely fit for a king if your hungry for a good meal. You got to think who's ribs. And go to King ribs on 16th St. Check out their great daily specials.

OMG! I have dreams about the trap buttah sauces. We tried the shrimp sampler to try all the butters and all of them were amazing. I had a side of the seafood chowder and it was honestly the best I've ever had. I'll be heading back to try the crab legs next!

I have used Guaranteed Plumbing throughout the years and most recently for a water heater replacement. Jim, Gary and Harold were knowledgeable, professional and a pleasure to interact with. Thank u for another job well done. I highly recommend this company.

Extremely disappointing.  This was the best restaurant in Nashville in 2019 and it is definitely not that anymore.  The service was extremely spotty.  Our waitress demonstrated a COMPLETE lack of understanding of the menu.  She was unable to explain or describe any dishes to us, could make no recommendations and had to look at menu just to know what was in a dish.  She allowed two of our party of six to order a dish that they had run out of a long time before (the hostess told us they only had five to begin the night so it wasn't like the table next to us had just ordered the last one.)  They refused to accommodate a requested upcharge (not a substitution, just increase the portion size of the scallops and charge us for it).  The pork I received was extremely fatty and 30 percent waste as a result.  

The bartender is excellent - world class in fact.  The hostess and other staff were better than our waitress.  There is clearly an attitude that pervades the entire staff that they don't care if you're happy - it's an arrogance that comes with success and they don't care what your experience is now that they have your money.
My daughter took off work to wait for them. They never came. Never called. Complete fail. If 0 stars was possible, I would

After calling many places in hopes of making reservations for Mother's Day brunch, but being turned away as many of said places were booked, I finally came across The Oyster Bar. When I called to make a reservation, the hostess informed me that they do not take reservations for Sunday brunch/Mother's Day and that I was welcome to join them for Sunday brunch buffet. Relieved and happy, mom and I show up here on Sunday (the 8th) only to be told by a hostess (and a manager?) that we did indeed need reservations. I explained that I called a few days earlier and a hostess had told me reservations were not needed at all. Thankfully, this hostess seemed to be patient and understanding--even if reluctantly--and found a table for us despite the restaurant being completely booked. 

Our waitress, on the other hand, was incredibly kind and attentive. The selection of food was wonderful, however I was surprised to see that the customers themselves need to cut their own meat at the meat carving station should they want meat (in this case, ham). I had only ever had brunch at places where there was a trained and skilled chef/meat carver for the customers. Isn't it a bit dangerous to let potentially inexperienced customers handle those utensils unattended? Overall, I was completely satisfied with the tastes, selections, and quantities of the brunch food. 

I was able to see how this joint could be very versatile: fitting aesthetic for watching Monday night football at the bar with pals, fitting aesthetic for Wednesday night cocktails with the girls, fitting aesthetic for an intimate date night with a special someone, fitting aesthetic for Sunday brunch, the scenarios are endless.

We came here with a Groupon for 3 craft beers. They had a great selection, the bartender Allie was really cool and recommended great choices. The bar has a ton of games, and you can take cornhole outside to play in the street. 

We will definitely be back!
The pineapple fried rice and pad Thai are awesome.  A really great hidden gem. Looking forward to trying more in the menu.

Horrible experience. Waited 1.5 hours for our food, which was inedible. Ordered 2 of the $32 Filet Mignon, and could not even cut it. They offered to remake our dinners, which took an additional 30 minutes, and it was no better. Could not even cut it. We did not eat any of it, but they would only comp one meal. I even had to get up and get our steak knives, which had not been brought to our table. $35 spent, no dinner, 2 hours wasted. And I am still hungry. This was at the Clearwater restaurant.

We are in NOLA visiting from Austin. Came in hoping for some good oysters. Food was very meh. Got the red fish $32. Super bland ew. The oyster were the dirtiest oysters we've ever had. Fiancé had the chicken sandwich which I'll say was yummy.

First the positives : This is a lovely relaxed setting for a meal. The staff is great and service is very fast. Absolutely love the ambience and atmosphere. 
The food is good too. 
However very few vegetarian options which limits how often we can go there. I would recommend they add some more vegetarian options to the menu making this restaurant more inclusive.

Haven't had Indian food since moving to Tucson. Thought we would try this place. I drive by it all the time. The reviews are good. It was the worst Indian meal I have ever had. The palak paneer was especially disgusted. The garlic naan was dry and flaky. I don't remember the last time I left garlic naan on the table. I would add that the ambiance was really odd. The servers were really annoying in a bubbly airhead sort of way. When our server asked how the food, we told her it wasn't very good. She giggled and ignored our experience. Okay. We hold this isn't the best Indian food Tucson has to offer. Gross.


This is a response to the owner's response to my review posted on 11/22/2014.

So it took the owner 7 months to TROLL my honest review of the worst Indian dining experience that we have ever had. This suggests two things. First, the owner doesn't care enough to check public reviews of his restaurant. Second, the owner has no idea how to respond to public criticism. Here's a hint: trolling is not the answer. 

Ultimate Conclusion: Loser behavior from a loser restaurant.

Despite COVID, Dr. Whiting and staff always provide excellent service with a personal touch. They are caring, informative, and always make take the time to explain each procedure. 

Thank you Mesquite Vet Hospital!

I really love the product and we are very happy with it. Looks great and functions as advertised with no problems for he past 2 years. Easy install and maintenance free. Best part was the very quick install. However; the sales pitch was very aggressive and in the end the price was a bit higher that what we would have paid for actual granite. Overall very happy with the product and the company; just think that the cost was a bit too high.

First time here and it won't be the last. From the moment we sat down the experience was wonderful. Our waitress Olivia was very attentive and welcoming, we came in on Christmas just as they reopened. We ordered several small plates to share and a couple of drinks to start off and our food took no more than 10 minutes to come out, every dish was fresh and delicious. The Korean wings were my favorite, the dumplings were fresh and the Pork belly Bao buns were amazing. We ordered our main dishes and Olivia had it timed perfectly once we were finished with our small plates. Every dish was freshly made and delicious, we enjoyed our time and will definitely recommend anyone looking for a reasonably priced delicious meal with great staff and service to try Omiza.

TAKE OUT REVIEW:
Ordered takeout over the phone:
All that Jazz omelette ($18), roasted breakfast potatoes ($5)
Order was correct, service was prompt (though they quoted 15mins and it was a closer to 25), so this review is just for the food. 
I'll give them a little slack since it was take out so it's never as good as dine in, but honestly what I got for takeout wasn't worth the price. 

The omelette itself was fine. The eggs could've used a touch more salt or hot sauce, the filling inside was a pretty solid amount, but I'm not sure if it was from the fillings or the cheese they used on top, but there was a good amount of oil puddled underneath the omelette. The price is honestly a bit pricey in my opinion - $18 for the omelette and two pieces of toast.

Potatoes - super let down. There was only one photo on Yelp from like three weeks ago and that is definitely NOT what I got in my order. The amount given was good, but it's literally just fried potatoes with a side of ketchup. They didn't seemed seasoned at all and didn't come with anything. For $5, I wasn't expecting to get what could've been frozen breakfast potatoes (they didn't seem frozen, but idk for sure). The potatoes are also what made the wait time a bit longer. I wouldn't mind the wait if the potatoes were worth it, but they were not at all. 

Overall: maybe I'd come back? I've seen good reviews especially for other stuff, but this honestly wasn't the best first impression.
Love this place.. Unpretentious, good Italian food.  Great staff too!

What a wonderful menu!  What a wonderful breakfast!  My friend and I went this morning and we were on a tight time schedule. Our server, Kim, was AWESOME!!!  She was quick with our order and gave great suggestions. Always one step ahead of us...The best server ever!  Will definitely be back...many times!  Thank you!!

Probably the worst Indian food I've ever had. Ordered two different curry and both were the exact same with a thick layer of oil over and no flavor whatsoever. The irony was the tandoor item, which was anything but tandoor.. I was given a breaded fish that was not even warm. I usually try to not waste food..but my takeout from here went into trash can. I was really hungry, but not worth ingesting oil. At an average of 16$ with tax per dish...this is probably the most expensive trashy food. The garlic Naan wasn't terrible.
Great food, great atmosphere excellent service!   We chose this location over the ones closer to French Quarter and we are so glad we did! No wait and the food was one of the best brunches I've had!

‼Best Choice Plumbing is the worst HVAC company in the area ‼ They sent someone out five times to look at why my water wasn't getting hot in a tenant occupied apartment. Each time they badmouthed the last technician and rediagnosed the issue with something different. They kept leaving without validating the water got hot. Ultimately they ended up having me pay for a brand new water heater and had two technicians completely refurbish it with all new parts TWICE! They wouldn't provide me with a new one or refund me anything for my now refurbished water heater. My tenants had to vacate for the extended time it took them to fix the issue. I was extremely patient, but the customer service was terrible and they kept saying they would call me back and wouldn't. At the end they told me that it was just the electric connected to the water heater and I never needed a new one. I could go on and on. I just wanted to share my experience so you don't also go through the same stressful situation.

Why 3 stars? Because this was my welcome to St. Louis.

   ---   ---   ---

Loud music.

No people. 

Lots of colorful lights on a person-less dance floor.

Way too much space:human ratio.

Poor Beer selection.

Big Daddy - your 3-stars is because my time spent here was probably an unfair representation of your potential. I had never been to STL and wanted to check out the area. It was an interesting, brief experience. One that, I probably wouldn;'t replicate.

Beware!  I am a nurse and had surgery two days ago.  I received the worst treatment I have ever had in HCA South Tampa's post anesthesia care unit.  I was left alone literally sobbing in pain for most of my time in the unit. I couldn't even keep my legs still (FLACC pain scale, anyone?) because the pain was so horrific.  The nurse offered me a pill.  I was nauseous, so I asked for something IV, and she either did not have orders or declined to give me anything, and instead called the anesthesiologist to tell him that I was refusing pain medication.  There are so many problems with this.  When a patient is in 9/10 pain and nauseous, a pill is never an appropriate intervention.  Post Anesthesia Care Units should have standing orders for IV pain and nausea medications as part of protocol.  The anesthesiologist came back and told me that IV medication wears off quickly so to give it to me would be "pointless," and that his goal was to get me up and moving to go home.  My husband had to ask him to please give me something for nausea and I would agree to take the pill.  Unfortunately, by this time my pain was so out of control that whatever he gave me had little effect.  I cried nearly the entire time I was there and NO ONE cared.  My husband could hardly find a nurse to ask to help me.  They are so obsessed with not giving opiates due to the opiate crisis that they are not treating patients' pain.  Giving a patient IV pain medication within the few hours after having an organ removed is NOT going to make anyone an addict.  I wish I had the money to pursue legal action against this hospital.  Thankfully I am doing much better now and have been off all pain medications for more than 24 hours.  No one - not the hospital, not the surgeon - has called to check on me.  For all they know I could have died but they don't care.  As a patient I'm appalled, but as a nurse I'm even more so.  Please do not have surgery at this hospital.  There has to be better care out there.

Came here the day before Xmas eve... Decent amount of people there at around midnight. Drinks weren't too pricy but then again  I'm used to paying for $10+ for drinks since I live in Miami. Unfortunately I will not be back. The bartender double charged me 20 bucks (which ended up being $40) for 3 drinks plus a nice tip I left (which I obviously regret now). I called this establishment twice and left a voicemail regarding the charge. A girl called me back and apparently didn't even listen to the voicemail because she sounded very confused and proceeded to tell me that someone would call me back after Monday. A week later and still no phone call. Thankfully my bank handled it for me but a simple call back would've been appreciated but seems that they need to hire better staff and follow up with customers. I can only imagine how many people this has happened too but were too inebriated to even realize. If I do ever return I'll be paying with cash.

Best happy hour specials and prices! The French onion soup is out of this world! Probably one of the best I've had actually. It's so rich and flavorful, and one of my favorites I've had so far! The bruschetta, crab/salmon cakes, and reuben wontons are sooo yummy! Their beer and cocktail happy hour prices are also very reasonable. Love the atmosphere as well as the location right next to the river! No parking lot, but plenty of street parking right around the restaurant.

Wonderful to have a butcher shop so close by! 
When you walk in, it's surprisingly beautiful, almost chic. 
Modern but quaint. And extremely clean. No old butcher shop odor here. 

The choices are plenty from beer and wine to cheese and beautiful desserts, spices and veggies to cook with the dinner you're picking up. 

And did I mention the desserts...
They have a chocolate chip caramel cookie that is OUT OF THIS WORLD!
Rich enough for two, but you won't want to share.

I came here for brunch and wow! No regrets. Normally I enjoy a savory breakfast, but this time I was craving something sweet. They had a Frosted Flake French toast and it was amazing! It really hit the spot. The French toast was a thick Texas brioche, topped with Frosted Flakes and a berry compote topped with powdered sugar. It was perfect- it wasn't overly sweet but just right! And the Bloody Mary was exactly what I needed to end my weekend!! (My mouth is watering as I am writing this!) I can't wait to go back and try more of their items!!!

My husband surprised me for my birthday and we arrived at Lark the building itself was impressive ample safe parking 
The staff was warm nice and knowledgeable the decor gorgeous out door deck with fire pit and comfortable seating .. lounge area decor beautiful lighting beautiful .. bar ambiance fabulous Food over the top amazing each entrè was delicious and presentation beautiful.. wine selections great! they even gave me a birthday card signed by the staff and chef...LVE Lark and will be back.

What can I say? YATs is always phenomenal.   I used to always get white chicken chili over rice, but once I tried the chicken maque choux, that became my go-to every time.  It's sweet, creamy, hot, and delicious.  The food is always hot, fresh and prepared quickly.  I like adding sour cream to mine and sometimes I get the rice separate.  On this visit we were informed that there were minimal options left for the day, but they still had great choices and exactly what we wanted.  Also, the bread is fabulous - perfect amount of seasoning and a light crunch!  This location also has easy parking and friendly workers.

I ordered online (take out, to be delivered via SB Restaurant Connection). Order placed, delivery time of one hour estimated. But when driver arrived at restaurant to pik up food, he was informed my restaurant that "they were too busy" and couldn't fulfill order. Wha wha???! SUPER LAME.
Trust can only be earned. Frank and his dad run this neighborhood auto shop with passion and honesty; traits that trump any commercial chains. If you have any auto servicing needs - go no further.

A little pub type restaurant on the outskirts of Old City.  Very reasonably priced and a wide variety of items on the menu.  Portions were huge.  Waitstaff was not particularly friendly, but got the job done.  The Roast beef itself was kind of dry on a hoagie (a grinder or sub depending on where you're from), but my friend had the pork and loved it.

I ordered a communion cake last week and due to dietary restrictions it needed to be gluten free. I ordered a 2 layer 12 inch cake at a hefty price. One layer was chocolate- moist and delicious. The other layer was vanilla- it was hard, tasted like it was slightly stale. I called the business to give the owner feedback and whoever answered me told me it was probably over cooked... um, yeah, glad to know that my extremely expensive cake was so carelessly handled and they employees were so flippant about it.  I am going to head to another bakery next time and I recommend others to do the same unless they want a high priced over cooked cake.
Friendly service. Mike attended to us immediately and was up front on the costs for time ups and some repairs on my bike and my wife's . Great local store. We plan to support them for many years.

I'm so happy my friend found this place. I'm from NY and we love our museums, but this was another level of museum. It's probably one of the best museums I ever been to. His work was amazing and I'm glad there is place like this so everyone can enjoy it. I was mesmerized the whole time I was there. The architecture of the museum is incredible . The art work is a must see. I'm so glad I got to come here. Definitely a must do when visiting Tampa .

I've been coming here since I was 9 years old when the restaurant was half the size as it is now. This is my favorite restaurant, not only because of the many fond memories, but also the tortellini gorgonzola is my favorite dish in the WORLD! My family and I come here at least twice a year for my birthday in August and for New Years Eve.

Homemade style Filipino comfort food with warm, friendly service in clean, no frills restaurant.

I got the adobo pork, an empanada, and rice.  The pork was flavorful and fall apart-tender.  Not too salty, good balance of flavors--I could pick up on the adobo, black peppercorns, ginger....so satisfying.   The empanada crust was flaky and filled with the right about of meat and vegetables. 

I was so pleased I took dessert to go home--cassava cake.  Also very good.  A rich, dense slab of coconutty cake with thick shreds of cassava throughout.  Not too sweet.  

Oh, and everything was SO CHEAP; 5 stars for quality/quantity at this price point.

I can't wait to come back next time I'm in the area..seems the regular clientele love the fried fish and halo halo.  Gotta try those.

*You get your food, sit down, eat, then pay at the counter.

Best lunch spot for hearty salads and sandwiches!
My personal favorite low maintenance lunch spot.

How not to loose another $70,000 cash customer

Dear Sir or Madame,

My lovely bride of 32 years and I wanted to share our most recent customer relation experiences in dealing with the Jim Brown Chevrolet dealership with the hope that it will prevent others from having to experience the same inferior customer service experience that we have endured.

Being a born and raised resident of the Tampa Bay area, my wife and I had purchased a 2010 Chevrolet Camaro LT1 from this dealership when it was operated as "University Chevrolet" in 2011.

Approximately two months ago, my wife and I decided that we would set out in search of our "dream" vehicle, a 2015 Chevrolet Corvette.

As part of our search, we met with your sales representatives to discuss the Laguna Blue 2015 Chevrolet Corvette currently on display.

At the same time, we were facilitating the recall order for our 2010 Camaro through this dealership, as well as attempting to order a replacement knob/cover for the power control for the passenger seat.

Between the two of us, my wife and I have left more than several messages with both the service and parts department regarding our requests/orders.

To say that the staff of these departments was less than helpful would be an understatement, as no one has returned our phone messages, or responded to the parts "order" that we have placed online via the company's website.

On Tuesday, January 27th, my wife attempted one last time to speak with someone this dealership's service department regarding the replacement key (recall related) that she had ordered over a month and a half ago.

The operator answered her phone and transferred her to the service department.  After being on hold for 15 minutes and being in the area, my wife decided to drive to the dealership in an attempt to facilitate our recall order.

When she arrived at the service department, my wife was disheartened to see three male employees simply sitting down, doing nothing.

It was only at this time that she was informed that the keys "must have just come in" and that she'd need to return with our 2010 Camaro to complete the programming of our new keys.  This information would have been of great value if she'd been able to speak with an employee via phone in advance of her visit.

At the same time (3 days later), I was still waiting for someone in the dealerships Parts department to return my call or respond to my online parts order.

My wife and I stopped in to the dealership on Florida Avenue on 1/31/15 to pick up our new keys for our 2010 Camaro as well as the part for the electronic passenger seat control, which we had previously been informed would have arrived via special order.

While our keys were in fact ready (more than a month following order) the parts clerk could not locate the part that we/she had previously ordered.  After much effort, the parts clerk informed us that she had "forgotten" to order the part.

She was apologetic and offered to deliver the part to our home on Tuesday, February 3rd if someone would be home to receive, which we agreed to.

My wife spent the entire day on February 3rd awaiting delivery of the part (our home is located 2 minutes from the dealership).

As no one arrived by 4:15pm, my wife called the parts department to inquire about delivery.  It appeared as if someone had "forgotten" to prioritize our order, so while appreciative that the part was finally delivered, it did not arrive until almost 5pm, after a wasted day of waiting on our part.

Based in great part by this dealership's complete lack of customer service, my wife and I decided to take our business elsewhere in seeking to purchase our new 2015 Corvette Stingray.

We've ordered our "dream" car from Stingray Chevrolet in Plant City, using our paid for 2010 Camaro as a trade and paying for the remainder of the new Corvette in cash.

Additionally, we'll also be utilizing both Gordon Chevrolet and Stingray Chevrolet for the service needs of our new vehicle, as we've enjoyed outstanding customer service at both of these dealerships.

Regretfully, due to this dealerships complete lack of attention to customer service, we won't be patronizing a business located only 2 minutes from our home.

Respectfully,

Jeff and Coleen

Reviews of Mema's should come with the disclaimer: "I was loaded when I ate here."

I visited Mema's during the daylight hours and sober and it was disappointing overall. My vegetarian 'Alaskan taco' was mostly lettuce. Is the iceberg lettuce what makes it Alaskan or because it was simpler than Sarah Palin's thought patterns? 

I also had a vegetarian burrito. Decent size, not huge for $4.50, but it was cold like biting into tasteless salad inside a sticky, chewy tortilla. It also dripped like crazy. I brought it back so they could microwave it more but their microwave is defective and only one corner was warmed after another spin. 

Suggestions to Mema (if there is a Mema). 

#1 Use better tortillas that don't smack of rubbery bleached white flour. This is a latin neighbourhood, there just has to be better ones available. 

#2 Make the beans tastier, if I hadn't peeled back the tortilla from the taco shell I wouldn't have known it was there. Please don't do this by adding lard. 

#3 Spice it up. This is Mexican food after all, a little heat wouldn't hurt. 

#4 Speaking of heat, serve them warm. Putting burritos on the griddle in a foil wrap for 30secs each side should do the trick. This way it's evenly heated and it keeps the tortilla from getting that microwave goo-nasty.

The food here is good there's a auntie in the kitchen. Food is delicious don't get me wrong. The service is complete trash which cancels out the good food. 

I have visited this place oh I'd say at least a dozen times with one of my friends who loves it. The service has always been sparse and slow. Not a big deal, I'll wait. Today when I came in I didn't have any higher expectations than I normally do. 

The waitress showed me to a table. While she was taking away the extra dishes I asked her to leave 3 because there's going to be three of us. Myself, my toddler, and my friend. 

After my friend arrived she left us sitting there for at least 10 minutes before she finally came over and asked are we ready. I know now that she misunderstood me but I said "we have been ready". She popped off and told me that I'm rude everytime and some other things I didn't hear while I was trying to tell her we're having a misunderstanding that's okay....

She continues with the your so rude that I can leave. I'm sitting there with my jaw dropped, bc I feel like that was the first time I had been short-rude. 

Waitress walks into the kitchen and says B*ITCH. COMPLETELY UNNECESSARY.

I've come to the conclusion the pressure of being the only waitress and my being short caused an unnecessary situation.

If you want to enjoy the yummy food I'd suggest ordering takeout. And however long they tell you it's going to take at about 10 to 15 minutes, good luck

I under appreciated this place during the days that I actually had time to go to SB's many Indian lunch buffets. Then reality hit and I couldn't go to them anymore, so rather than hitting up TJs for a frozen Indian dinner, this was the better option. The concept of takeout Indian food is really neat, and this place is such a convenience when I'm realllly craving curry. They're not expensive either. Sometimes the food isn't consistent, it might be real oily, or the rice might be a bit watery, but it does the job.

The build your own pizza places are popping up everywhere and this is one that I seem to frequent only because they have an app and I get points towards a free pizza - oh, and they also have cauliflower dough - which is 5 stars - seriously really great - worth the upcharge. Service and cleanliness is what I would deduct points for. Sometimes, service can be great, there's some employees in there that care about their job and are really friendly and funny and some of the employees seem bitter and angry at the world. The ingredients are used sparingly - I get that there's measurements for everything - I've worked in food service for years so I get how big chains work but c'mon - I want big chunks of feta rather than feta dust - even if I asked for extra it wouldn't be enough. Maybe that speaks more to my feta addiction than anything though. ha! This place is alright, I'll continue to go because some days, like some Mondays, there's a discount if you get the code in an email and for that price, it's totally worth it.

Without a doubt this is one of the best hardware stores in the City.  I've come here for projects big and small- some where I knew exactly what i needed and some where I was going to be in WAY over my head.

Every.single.time I've gotten exactly what I needed, didn't get a bunch of crap I didn't need and a lot of helpful tips,tricks and advice along the way.

Screws, nuts, roofing product, window glass, paint, tools, screen screen and more screen.....gutter talk (haha - I crack myself up), right down to Mardi Gras float accoutrements ....  I won't go anywhere else if I can help it.  These guys are the best

Came here for lunch with a coworker. She's been raving about the all you can eat for $20 for months. 

First impressions - there's plenty of parking as this place is in a strip mall. The place is clean and you're greeted and seated right away. 

Looked over the menu and chose just a little more than we thought we'd eat. The menu for ayce was pretty standard. But when the sushi came, I was pleasantly surprised by the size and freshness of the rolls.  They were all delicious.  Honestly, for what we got, we should have paid $70-80 so $20 is a steal. 

I will definitely be back and recommend this place for lunch.
