Overpriced Korean food with a side of poor service. While many options are offered, the food is mediocre and overpriced. Unless you're in dire need of Korean food in the area, then come here. If not, I would recommend going to Chinatown, or Koreana in u-city for better Korean food, service, and price. They do deliver on grub hub though...

came here on Sunday for lunch. we got seated right away and ordered oir drinks and food . i was happy with the service no complaints from me on that part of our visit.
the food was only so-so i dont know what is going on with Applebees they used to be good it seems like they dont know how to cook their food anymore. It lacked seasoning on the steak and the broccoli was blan. I had to send the steak back to the kitchen because it was so tough and unable to chew. I wont be going back here i spent over 95.00 
not worth my money.

I was dreading wedding dress shopping, but it turned out not to be so bad after all. 

I am plus sized and I appreciate that they do not charge extra for plus sized gowns. It was also nice to be able to actually try on gowns in my size instead of having someone look at a picture and describe what it would look like on me. They have a great selection of many different sizes. 

I tried on about six dresses and ended up choosing the second one I tried on. The down payment and balance payment process was a breeze. 

I wish I would have gone with my gut feeling and ordered up a size. The sample fit me perfectly but didn't have much breathing room. My dress that came in didn't quite zip and my size had not changed, but samples are usually stretched out from being tried on. My sales rep assured me the size she measured would be the best. Alterations are being made so it fits, but it's just another thing to stress about. 

I did have two small issues. While paying for my dress, my sales rep asked me to write a Google review for the store "because they don't like Yelp". First of all, I hate being solicited by businesses to write reviews. Second of all, you are talking to the wrong Yelp Elite! And when I picked up my dress, the woman who helped me into the dress smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. That's not something I want to transfer to my dress.

We have had Comcast since 2012 have had nothing but problems but when we bought our own modem our service got better I'm mean great buy your own modem and all your problems will go away .Now we only have internet we have a magic jack and all is great so buy your own modem you will glad you did. Flex box is awesome Hulu and Netflix!!!!,

I have always wanted visit this bakery! It's been around since 1915 and are the ones that invented the Cuban sandwich! They are also the ones that made authentic Cuban bread....at least outside of Cuba!  This place is legendary! 
They've been baking Cuban bread using the same hand-made traditions since the early 1900's and each loaf gets a freshly cut palmetto leaf across the top to create the signature split down the middle.  Only authentic Cuban bread contains the palmetto leaf. 
Well both the Cuban Sandwich (roast pork, ham, Genoa salami, pickles, swiss, mustard on fresh Cuban bread) and the Media Noche ( a smaller sandwich on a sweeter egg bread similar to Hala with ham, pork, mustard, pickles and swiss) did not disappoint.  Dare I say, that they were the best sandwiches I've ever had!  Both nicely  toasted all melted cheese and delicious! We also ordered a 1915 Club (ham,turkey, Swiss, bacon, lettuce, tomato & special sauce on three layers of white bread-Hubby loved it) and a Continental (roast beef, ham, Genoa salami, Swiss, provolone, lettuce, tomato & special sauce on pumpernickel) Both were excellent!  It was around 3 pm, the place packed and by then they were all out of beef empanadas and papas rellenas (stuffed potatoes) as well as the full loaves of bread. I managed to snag a half loaf of fresh Cuban bread and the last 2 guava/cheese turnovers.  The plan was to pick up the food and bread and drive from Tampa back to Ft. Myers.  The bread was devoured as soon as we got on the highway.  If you are in Tampa and get a hankering for an authentic Cubano and cafecito, definitely stop in! You will love it!

Went the drive thru and ordered turkey provolone adding bacon and for it to be hot. Got back to my room to find out they did not add bacon or make it hot, but was charged for bacon. Damion I assume the manager took my information down and two days later went back and he took care of me.

Full disclosure - I am a beginning level climber. 

I really enjoyed my time here! The staff was friendly and effective. They taught me to belay well and then gave me plenty of freedom. 
The walls themselves are well maintained, well organized. I think there's a good variety of easy and more difficult. 
Also, great value! $12 for the entire day, including shoe rental. 

My friend had come with a groupon once and they have her free passes afterward. So one of my visits was free!

Had dinner plans that were postponed, so pop in to let the nasty weather pass and got some delicious Cream of Mushroom soup.  The employee was Richard; he was so kind and cared. The soup was prepared fresh in house and was velvety smooth and excellent with plenty of mushrooms. It was expensive at $4.48 after tax for the small portion, but with the quality and freshness makes it worth it. I decided to try another item since I hadn't eaten since 5 am and waited in a line of about 12 people and went to order the Carolina Pork with Cheddar and Onions, it is described as pulled pork with BBQ sauce American and cheddar cheese and grilled onions, $8.75+tax.​ Finally, getting to the counter, I ordered it, and they were out of it. I don't mind when a restaurant is out of something they make in-house. That's often an indication of it being fresh. However, when a restaurant has huge electronic menu boards with changing photos and items, I can't understand why they aren't able to quickly and efficiently either have a Sold Out on it but still have it there so you know what you may want for next time or have it off the menu until available again. If it were a way for them to make more money, I know they would know how to do it. Frankly, that is management's poor customer service, not the employees. With the amount of business they are doing, there should have been more than one employee at the counter and one cooking. For counter service, it was slow to get your food. This soup took 14 minutes for my soup to be ready after paying, and there were a lot of people standing to wait for their food in a congested walkway. There was a manager around that addressed none of the issues and didn't help with service or cooking. Because of the quality of the soup, I will recommend the place and will try it again now that I'm craving Pulled pork.

If you know me, then you know I love Vietnamese food. So naturally, I was super excited to have the opportunity to sample some of the menu items from the infamous Banh Mi Boys original location in Metairie, and let me tell y'all, they did not disappoint!

The Shrimp Banh Mi was delicious, full of flavor and a kick of spice from the fresh jalapeno. The real surprise here was the Beef Spring Rolls, which I've never seen on a menu at any Vietnamese restaurant I've been to. They were amazing, and paired perfectly with the provided peanut sauce. 

I ended up adding the Bulgogi and some Ramuné to my perk- because how could I not!? They offered some really unique Ramuné flavors that I've never seen offered anywhere locally- Lychee and Peach. Both were good, but the peach is definitely my new favorite. The Bulgogi was amazing! It was super tender and seasoned perfectly. I wish it would come with a side of kimchi instead of a side salad, but that's more of a personal preference so not a big deal.

I definitely will be back, and highly recommend giving them a try if you like Banh Mi or are a poboy lover in general! There is lots of variation in their menu, so I'm pretty sure they'll have something that anyone in your crew will enjoy. 

Huge thank you to Tomas, Yelp, and of course, the Banh Mi Boys for this tasty Elite Week event!

This is a cute restaurant in a nice neighborhood location making great hot dogs. 

I usually don't go out of my way to eat hot dogs, but my husband convinced me to try this place out. At first glance, their menu looks like there are a lot of options. I can be kinda picky, though, so a lot of the hot dog topping combinations weren't my thing (stuff with jalapenos, spicy mustard, raw onions, pepper jack cheese, banana peppers, etc.). I know you can probably ask them to leave certain ingredients off, but I feel that you wouldn't be getting the whole intended experience and flavors that they put together if you do that. 

Anyway, I ended up with the Stormtrooper, which has creamy rotini, alfredo, salsiccia, bacon, parmesan, and fried onions on it. It was so delicious! First of all, the hot dog itself is large and the flavor of it (even without the other stuff) actually tastes good, unlike the regular hot dogs you buy from the store (which is why I usually avoid hot dogs). The hot dog bun was also better than the regular kind; I don't know what they are, but they go well with the dog. Finally, the toppings on mine pretty much covered the whole dog! There was a lot of food and it tasted great on my hot dog, especially the fried onions. Mmmm! 

My dog was $6.99, so think of it as a small (fast food-ish) meal, not just a hot dog. If you're thinking the price will be akin to a hot dog stand kind of hot dog, you might be a bit surprised. However, this is much more filling than your standard hot dog, so you're getting your money's worth! 

I don't know that I'll come here a lot, but I wouldn't be opposed to it! Cute decor, quality dogs, and great toppings!

Its been great having a craft beer bar close to home! We've been waiting for a bar to open in the valleys that wasn't a dive bar, as another Yelper mentioned. Love the decor! Kelly is our usual bartender when we stop in and she's great - always friendly and welcoming, and she makes the best margaritas. Each time we visit 395 they have different beers on tap, so it's nice that they have a rotation. We're still holding out for Heretic Brewing Company to be added! We enjoy stopping in on Wednesdays for trivia night and I'm happy to see how much growth this bar has had over the last few months. It's definitely becoming a regular spot for us!

Three of us came in without reservations at 6:00.  We were seated immediately and Emily arrived for our drink orders.  This is a BYOB restaurant so we had a bottle of wine with us.  The restaurant is nicely decorated with several rooms.  The menu is extensive. It's quiet despite being crowded.  We started with the calamari app, excellent, crispy pieces with a marinara sauce.  My wife was able to order whole wheat pasta with sauce on the side and veggies.  I had the veal parm, two large pieces of breaded veal that were tasty and tender.  My brother had the fish selection which he enjoyed.  Emily was attentive and served us well.

The rooms are reasonably sized. The bathrooms are very clean and modern.

I ordered a chicken salad which took some time to come out but was very good. The apples give the meal a nice crunch and everything tasted fresh. I enjoyed it a lot.
Holy hell yes. So good! Fast service, fresh delicious food. Parking in the back. No wait, highly recommend!
Out of all the Brazilian steak houses I've been too this place by far surpasses them in every way ! Excellent service and Great tasting Food I will be coming back for sure

Came in for lunch with some friends. The building is beautiful and the interior is nicely decorated. We were given chips and salsa right away and started with an app of queso fondidto. I'm not a huge chips and salsa fan but their chips you could tell were definitely homemade and the salsa was great. The queso was also awesome! It came served in a cast iron and was nice and hot with green pepper throughout. We were literally scraping the cast iron by the time we were done with it it was that good. I ordered the lunch menu chimichanga with ground beef ($10) and loved every bit. My friends both seemed to enjoy their food as well. Only negative was service was a tad bit slow, as we were on lunch break. All in all though I loved it and I'll definitely be heading back to try their brunch menu soon!

This was one of the best dining experiences I've had in Reno! We took my out of town friend visiting from PA here as the basque dining experience is so unique to this area. We first sat at the bar to order a picon. The bartender (I forget his name but he had been there for 30 some years) was awesome. He made an terrific picon and provided a suggestion how how to drink it which was much appreciated as those buggers are strong! He also shared a good deal of knowledge about the basque community here and its history. 

Once we were ready to move from the bar, we took seats at one of the long family style tables. I let my friend know that he needed to prepare his stomach (I had been to another basque restaurant in town and know how much food you get) but what soon came even I was surprised by! 

You start with the softest yummiest bread and butter (I could literally eat the basket myself). You're served a large carafe of table wine and also out comes the soup. Split pea soup was the soup the night we went and it was enjoyed by all. Then comes a chicken dish which reminded me of chicken cacciatore. Wait, not done yet... then out comes salad... and a bean dish... THEN all three of us ordered the lamb as our entree and out comes a massive pile of perfectly cooked lamb chops. It was awesome. Somehow we managed to clean up. 

Great place to come and enjoy fantastic home style food. The quality and quantity you get for the price is unbelievable. If you come with a small group like we did, be prepare to sit with strangers but don't be shy. It's a great place to meet new people. We had a blast.

Being in a privileged town like Santa Barbara.. and having tried much better tapas places... it's hard to imagine this place calls them selves tapas place. Very bad potatoes. Very bad seafood. Everything has a fake smoked flavor and is very unsatisfying

ok i know, cheesecake with a snow cone? sounds absurd... but it isn't. i was leery and was trying to rationalize this. i couldn't, so i trusted my fellow yelpers. so now you will just have to trust me on this. 

this is located in the uptown area, lots of activity and energy. there are enough flavors to satisfy even the pickiest of eaters. can't name them all. but there is key lime, peach, wedding cake, strawberry, and of course king cake!

My fiancé and I came here on our original wedding date that was postponed due to covid as a way to treat ourselves. This place did not disappoint. The steak was medium rare and sliced like butter. The truffle butter was an amazing addition as well. The Brussels sprouts were good not great though. Besides that the braised pork belly appetizer and the warm breads were great starters to the meal. Highly recommend this restaurant and can't wait to go back with my soon to be wife

Forgot how much I missed this place until they re-opened today! Back and better than ever, Kuma's has taken lots of safety precautions to make those dining in feel comfortable including lots of sanitizing, taking temps, mask wearing (if you aren't sitting down and eating or drinking) and distancing tables. 

While you can still carry out, they have both outdoor, indoor and bar seating. The music was just as I remembered; the best amount of heavy metal. The menu has a fun theme with the burgers named after heavy metal bands with a different feel to each one. We ordered out favorite drinks to start - I love that they have plenty of cider and beer options. We also ordered the loaded bbq fries as an app. Then for my burger I got the YOB on lettuce (garlic mayo, bacon, gouda cheese, roasted red pepper) and homemade chips. 

Every time I leave here I am incredibly full, but in the best way. The portions are a good size and the flavors of each burger pair nicely together. Overall the service was even better than I remembered.

First off, the server was so funny and nice!!!! Never met someone so invested in if we are enjoying our food and if we needed anything else haha. This place had no music, no customers, the lights were off and it looked like it was closed. We decided to give it a chance and we were pleasantly surprised. Everything hit the spot!

I stopped and grabbed a sandwich before my flight departed and for a bag of chips and sandwhich it cost $16. I got on my flight and open my dinner and took a bite of my roast beef and cheddar and I had to spit it out. It was rock hard bread and the meet tasted bad. I don't know how they are in business. They should stick to coffee and pastries and not real food. I would highly recommend NOT eating here if you have a layover in Nashville

THE TALENTTTT!

Fabrika is definitely an experience and one I highly recommend!

For food - we really didn't get to try to much. We just got the hummus and meatballs small plates which were both good. Nothing to really rave about. Pretty average. (Tip - go early so you have plenty of time to eat before the show. They stop serving food when the show starts)

Drinks - amazing! I was sipping some spritzs all night and they were nice and refreshing 

THE SHOW - even better than I imagined... I really wasn't sure what to expect but I was blown away. It's like a mix of drag, acrobatics, burlesque, and musicians. The guy who played the violin was absolutely amazing. So much talent in that place. You really need to go check it out. 

In addition the overall decor and esthetic of the place is just really cool and different. It's a really cool experience and I already can't wait to go back

I have used Bree a few times over the years for special occasions and for vacation.  She is sweet, knowledgeable and on time!  She makes you feel at ease and explains the process so clearly and post spray instructions are great!  Reasonable prices especially since she comes to you!  Your home, hotel (out of town visitors) or I suppose Work if that's where you need her.  Super professional and brings everything she needs.

Boyfriend had an emergency tooth that needed to be pulled. 
His back molar was broken and in half. Pain started on a Friday and couldn't get into any dentist office over the weekend not even the emergency numbers. 
We came in first thing Monday morning and was able to get an appointment the next morning. 
The staff was so friendly and caring. They walked us through everything and went over the payment plans. 
I highly recommend this place to anyone. It maybe took an hour for everything. They truly care about you and your teeth here. They make sure you are comfortable and not in any pain. 

Highly recommend to anyone.

This is a true neighborhood restaurant. Small and comfortable with a table set up that invites some interaction with your neighbors. 
Service is quick,friendly and efficient -with specials listed on the chalkboard and serve-yourself coffee available as soon as you enter. Environment is warm and comfortable. Seems like prices have gone up a bit since they first opened but the food is quality and the service is excellent. Substitutes allowed on Avocado toast ;  the chorizo sausage is kind of spicy.

It is a fun place to run into people you know from the neighborhood. Plenty of free, convenient parking.

The atmosphere of Broadway oyster bar is enough to bring you back! When you walk in there are lots of lights and many things to make you feel like you're right in the heart of New Orleans! The Alligator Sausage Cheesecake Appetizer is to die for. I'm not a big "seafood" person, but this was something I couldn't stop eating. The catfish Poboy wasn't my favorite. I got catfish because it's usually not super fishy, but this one tasted extremely fishy. It was edible, the bread is really good, just not a favorite for me

It was worth the wait .. 

Their was a bug queue . But we made it in after 25-30 mins . The staff was really nice and friendly . They suggested some dishes which were good.

Took my ML350 there for oil change today and told them about the shifter sticking in park three times in the past two months. One expensive oil change later (albeit it is synthetic), and a few other quotes for things they said I may need that were overly priced, they found nothing wrong with my shifter. Got in my car and it wouldn't move out of park. They came out and almost an hour and a half later charged me over $100 just to tell me that the codes and bulletins were saying it was the battery that needed to be replaced which they quoted $699!  Just found same OEM battery for $200. I won't be going back to Eurofix. Super nice staff, thus the two stars, but way too expensive - and overly charged a diagnostic that they initially missed and should've taken ten minutes to diagnose. Steer clear.

A bit pricey but always well done! This becomes so convenient especially if you just got off of a rough vacation or you're about to go on a pretty vacation and just didn't have time to run around the city.

Enjoy yourself and look good while doing it. Let's do this

We went to eat after I was discharged from the Vanderbilt Emergency Room. It was around 1145pm when we got there. Although it's easy to have good customer service when it's not busy, but this was great customer service. We got a seat easily. We got our order taken quickly. We got our food and drinks quickly. Never had to ask for refills, our waitress just took notice and refilled them. They split our check very easily and without complaint. We were in and out of there in about 45 minutes. Great experience. And waffle House always has great food.
Bartender was amazing (Jessie)! We came from out of town and we loved our experience!

Looking for decent bar food? Try Bernie's out.

Went here for happy hour and was surprised by their wide Selection. From the happy hour menu we got the tacos the and the chicken barbecue skewers. From the regular menu we got the waffle sweet potato fries.

I love how The food from the happy hour menu Were big portions- it Definitely got us full! The only bummer was my barbecue chicken skewers Seemed a tiny bit undercooked. I asked the waiter to take it back (she had no complaints) and the manager brought me back another set of skewers that were warm and had Better texture. The manager said the chicken was cooked but he did agree that the texture was a little bit off- like a rubbery fake chicken consistency. The sweet potato waffle fries were amazing! Especially with that sweet mustard-y dipping sauce that it comes with. 

I'd go back to try their other selection. I love how it's also conveniently located in the heart of University City- maybe next time I'll try it for lunch.

Stopped in w my son for a quick bite. Turned out to be a REALLY tasty one too!

They had an amazing selection starting with brown or white rice, salad, or a sushi burrito followed with a huge assortment of proteins , vegetables, and toppings. 

I tried the spicy tuna and spicy salmon, both super fresh and not overpowering. Added every topping except raw onion. THEN I let them take it uptown with wasabi mayo and spicy mayo, ginger, crunchies, and scallions.

Washed it down with a crafted Thai Tea. The bowl easily makes 2 meals or fills you to the brim. 

The restaurant isn't fancy but the food is worth the stop. They even sell boba tho I couldn't fit one in :).

Definitely on my "I need a quick flavor boost lunch" list!

We dropped in for happy hour and can't believe what a gem this place is!! 

There's plenty of parking onsite and the inside is so cozy and well decorated- it was very inviting and the noise level was perfect for a conversation at the table. The staff were friendly, had great suggestions, and were always there when we needed them!

I tried the Blueberry Lemon Drop and the grilled pear sour and loved both. I like my drinks sweet and both of this hit the spot!

Since it was happy hour, we ordered an assortment of appetizers for the table. 

Pulled Pork Nachos- loved the crispy wonton chips, and the portion of pulled pork was VERY generous. I'd say eat this one quickly as the longer it sat in the delicious juice, the chips got soggy. Delicious overall!

Crispy green beans- crunchy, very fresh veggies, and had a delicious dipping sauce!

Surf & Turf roll- this was a HIT at the table. It had a great balance of flavors and I could have had another of these for sure!

Calamari- thicker than I'm used to for calamari but absolutely delicious, crunchy outside and tender inside and had a sweet chili dipping sauce on the side which was unique and a great combo. 

New Orleans Shrimp- only a few shrimp in this one but plenty of bread to soak up all of the flavorful sauce.

Wood Fired Cashews- this would be such a perfect snack to have as you're drinking a few beers, they were delightfully warm and the flavoring is incredible. I would buy a bag of these!

The menu itself looks wonderful too, we saw a few dinner items go to tables around us and everything looked and smelled amazing- we can't wait to come back to try dinner!
This place is open late night which makes it the perfect stop before heading home after a night of drinking. Must try the hot chicken pizza and the Newman!

A hidden gem. My mom picked Whiskey Business for her Mother's Day lunch and we were definitely impressed.

We ate inside since it was pouring down rain but we will definitely return so we can dine on the patio. The menu is large, featuring traditional bar food and burgers with unique toppings. My brother had the Hunka Burnin Love burger with bacon, peanut butter, and jalapeños. I had the breaded tenderloin which is definitely one of the best I've ever had. It was thicker and crispier than most tenderloins and definitely more appropriately sized for a bun. My mom had the bbq pork sandwich. Everything was generously portioned  and well-priced. We also shared the jalapeño poppers which came out piping hot.

Our servers (Drew and Chrissy) were attentive and helpful.

They have a small stage in one corner for live music.

The restaurant/bar was super clean which was the first thing I noticed when we walked in.

We'll definitely be back.

Donnie and staff at Liberty Collision took our Highlander that was damaged during a wreck (not our fault) and brought it back to new condition. The car only has 6000 miles on it, so it was still a new car, and Liberty Collision made sure it returned that way. They kept us up to date on progress, what they were doing, and how it all worked to ensure factory specifications were met. They even used a new machine to sanitize the whole interior of the vehicle, and there was no "shop" smell in our car whatsoever. The crew at Liberty Collision took pride in their work, and it shows as our car looks as good as the day we bought it. Thank you!

I'm the first to admit that Stephen Starr establishments are one of those things that I have more of a hate than love relationship with. But despite that I'm also first to admit that even though they're still laden with a plentiful number of imperfections, When Starr creates a winner he does it big time! And even though I was initially hesitant to envision it working out in Fishtown, I do have to admit that he delivered in a big way with Frankford Hall.

Much like the case is with El Rey for Mexican food; If you're looking for an authentic German beer hall do not, I repeat DO NOT come here. Go to Brauhaus Schmitz or Bierstube and do not pass go! But if you're looking to enjoy traditional German eats and steins of beer while playing games like foosball, Jenga, and then some; then Frankford may be that warehouse of possibility for you. Even better is the fact that you can do it either inside or out thanks to its HUGE interior, and courtyard that is loaded with plenty of tables and standing room (and heating lamps for when the weather gets colder).

For food I was initially confused by the ordering at the counter food court style and waiting for the food with a number. But such confusions were eliminated when I found the servers to be capable of seeking that number out like a bullseye. while bratwurst, spaetzle, amazing sounding burgers and other such delicacies were mighty tempting, I decided to go with a Bavarian pretzel w/ cheese dip (AKA the new crack) and a refreshing bowl of escarole soup. The soup was just the right cup of warmth that the doctor ordered and had tiny meatballs in it for a bonus. And for the small the pretzel was rather huge, and was one of the better soft pretzels that I've ever had.

The Beergarden was fully loaded with Franziskanar, Spaten, Paulaner, and other German brews by the 1/2 or whole liter. and there was plenty of other craft brews on tap and in bottles to compliment the selection beautifully. there's also one tap geared to a rotating draft that usually leads to something special. In my case it was a Dogfish Head brew that I've only seen there thus far (and you best believe I've looked!)

As a Starr spot its destined to be a place that I won't be going to all the time (we're kind of like Seinfeld and Newman - http://youtu.be/98dai6CC5BA). But so long as it delivers good brats and beer, and crazy events like Dunkel Dare hosted by Marc Summers; I know I'll be a fan deep down!

We booked a king size room and got a double instead. We didn't even check in late! Why would they give away our room? And there was no discount or special accommodations for this mistake. The double room smelled of mold, we asked them to move us to another room, but they couldn't until the next day. Then room they moved us to was worse than the first one! I ended up leaving and going to another hotel after one night. The staff could not care less about losing customers. Huge disappointment and an absolute shame for Le Meridien. I view their brand poorly as a result. I've seen some Best Western hotels that were better and nicer than this!

I stayed here in the Spring of 2016.

I wish there was a 6 star rating for this lovely breakfast/brunch spot. From the moment we walked up -- greeted warmly by the owner --  we knew it was going to be a great morning. And then the food came. Amazing! We had the hummus and eggs platter and the Le Chef egg white omelette with black beans, hummus and cauliflower. The omelette was superb and the potatoes were addictive -- especially with an extra side of spicy Lebanese sausage (great with the hummus and foul). We shared a salted caramel macaron for dessert and the owner brought a little bonus baklava. Wow.  If I lived in Philly I would be a regular :)

I have ordered take-out from Lotus twice, and I'll order at least another two times in the future given the wonderful variety of options and overall taste of    the dishes we've tried.  Just writing about this spot has me craving an order of Golden Rolls...

I've been here several times, and I just need to stop. The service is not consistent, the prices are expensive, and I mean, I have nail polish all over the place. I really was hoping it would just be on my nails.

Superb lunch!  It was so good that I ate here two days in a row!  
The fish was super fresh and cooked perfectly. Beautifully grilled and not overcooked. Someone in the kitchen knows what he/she is doing. 
I might go back tomorrow too!  Today's key lime pie was the weak link but I'm not a key lime pie aficionado like many people claim to be. Yesterday's brownie sundae was amazing.

I have a love-hate relationship with this place that, to me, averages it out to a 3-star rating.

This place will always be an end-of-night standby for me when my crew and I are standing around in old city and wondering "it's 12:45. Where should we go?"

Anyway, the mix here is actually pretty good - both music and people. Everyone is also here to dance, which is great. 

My only problem with the music is that three, four, even five times a night, this will happen:

Go shawty, it's your birthday, we goin' party like it's your birthday, we goin' sip Bacardi like it's your birthday, and we DON'T STOP BELIEVIN'! HOLD ON TO THAT FEEEELIN'!

To sum up my sentiment on exactly how that works, I have to say that even though Mad River attracts a fairly diverse crowd, it's runner-up for my "Whitest Club u Kno in Philadelphia" award. First place is Plough and the Stars, but we'll save that for another review. 

Let me be clear that I have no problem with this, and neither does anyone else in Mad River. We can dig it, Mad River DJ. We just want you to soften up those transitions a little more. 

Because when the white people music comes on, me, and every other minority in Mad River has to stop for a few seconds to scratch our heads.

It's all good, though, because by the chorus of any of these songs ("Pour Some Sugar on Me," "Don't Stop Believin'," "Livin' on a Prayer," "Sweet Caroline," etc), we're probably singing along with all the white oppressors.

You've won this time, whitey!

Now for my one (BIG) negative: 

Bachelorette parties - I still believe that there are some bachelorette parties out there that get crazy and are tons of fun. But THOSE bachelorette parties don't go to Mad River. The ones that come here are the anti-fun of the universe. You know, the kind that stand around, aren't drunk, and are in their little bubble judging everyone.

Specifically, the kind that has gotten my friends kicked out of the club for "causing trouble." Or, as normal people might say, "talking to them."

My condolences to the husbands.

Which leads me to my pro-tip: Don't come here anywhere around wedding season. It's not pretty.

PS
One of these days I'm actually going to eat here, just to see what it's like.

Great service, awesome happy hour, and dollar oysters. I like it.

I've been to a lot of late nights here lately because White Dog closes before 11, and New Deck and Mad Mex are always way too full. I had kind of held off on trying the place for a while because I'd seen it get middling reviews, but I can safely say I'm a fan.

Everything I've had here so far has been pretty tasty - the fish tacos, crab cake sandwiches, salads, lobster bisque, the lobster roll, and of course, the oysters. So, food is a win. So is drink, on the most part - they've got a respectable beer, liquor, and wine selection, so you can't really go wrong.

Where this place really shined for me was the service, and the crazy late night happy hour. Small plates (creatively termed - they're kinda large) of various selections for 5 bucks each, and then the dollar oysters and the beer and drink specials. You can get hammered and stuffed a the same time for 20-30 bucks. Who can argue with that on a Thursday night? Not I, my friend, not I.

So, if you don't like seafood, I suppose this place would be out of consideration. If you do, definitely check it out.

Talked to 5 different people in the last 2 months saying they could all do the service I needed done. Needless to say I do not have the service 2 months later. One time the guy came, said he couldn't do it without his supervisor and that he would be back in 30 minutes. Never came back as you probably could have guessed. No call or anything by the way.  Then got billed for the service that I never received.  Still waiting another month for my refund as well. While I talked to the lady in customer service, she told me I was wrong and that I was not owed anything. She had a little attitude while saying it. I had to point it out to her on the bill and take her through what had happened.  DO NOT JOIN COMCAST!! BEWARE! STAY AWAY! Customer service is horrible to say the least.

I moved to Camden NJ recently and unless you didn't know, there aren't a lot of places to get food there. Especially outside of Farmers Market season so Iovine Brothers gives me the option to pick up produce without needing to drive and at an unbelievable price. 

The first time I went there I was able to get a pound of the MOST AMAZING strawberries I have ever eaten for $1.00. I've been hooked ever since. I go during lunch and grab a few things and can easily whip up a healthy dinner for myself for under $4.00! 

I highly recommend this to any city-dwellers out there. They can't be beat.

We ate at Datz for this first time this evening and it was a wonderful experience. We sat at the bar upstairs and had Greg waiting on us (as well as bartending). His knowledge of the menus was welcome as we were from out of town and were eager for suggestions, both on the food side and on the local brew side. We started with the bruschetta flat bread, which was very good, especially if you're looking for something on the lighter side. The main course he recommended, the pork shank, was incredible. The light gravy with a hint of maple really complimented the entire dish. On the brew side- there was a great selection, and Greg aided us in the decision process by providing us countless samples of any beers we were curious about. Overall, a great experience. Makes it even better we found it via Yelp- nothing better than a full circle.

Having been in Idaho a few days now, everyone's skirted the issue of IDAHO POTATOES, and I'm too polite to bring it up.  (ie. Hey, you guys are known for potatoes, but I haven't seen a damn potato, except at WinCo!  Where are all the potatoes!?)  So when we went to Bittercreek after a disappointing dinner at Shige's I had to order the Idaho potato fries...

...which were meh... Very average - a little soggy, a little soft - a little country and a little rock 'n roll(??)  This is NOT the potato's fault, however.

Also ordered the Snake River Chardonnay, wanting to do a local wine, and my boyfriend a red.  The chardonnay wasn't chilled enough and was OK.  The red was OK as well.  Nothing to write home about.

Had to change locations about 3 times since the setting sun was following my boyfriend around like a bad disease.  The place was packed inside and out for a Thursday.  Service was friendly and attentive - and this is my favorite part about visiting Idaho so far.  Every person encountered in a restaurant, on a trail, out shopping, and possibly even stealing my money - absolutely friendly and sincere.  After changing our table we were under another server's "jurisdiction", so we decided to close out with our previous server, who provided us with great service.  The manner in which our previous server talked with our new one was so friendly, completely devoid of snark.  Must be the potatoes - or lack, thereof.

With a misleading address Koreana is hidden in a parking lot, crowded and with a diverse group of patrons (usually a good sign).  I got the bimbim bap and thai tea to go.  I found the bimbim bap to be very average, it had a fried egg, rice, lettuce, shaved carrots, shaved zucchinis, bulgogi beef and few noodles. Other than the spicy sauce and the beef, nothing in the bimbim bap was flavored. I would try a hot pot next time. The thai tea was great, I would get that again.

I have to say it's refreshing to go out in my mid 30's and have flashbacks of when things were happening in Nashville back in my 20's. It's a relatively mixed crowd. Of course there is your fair share of single 20 something women looking for a man. Overall, mixed bag. This place had an excellent DJ. The bar was packed, but efficient. I loved my Pink 75 and the rest of my crew loved their drinks. We moved down to the lower bar, which was a bit slower service. Only food I tried was the chicken biscuit, and it was pretty good and reasonably priced. Definitely nice to have small plates you can order at the bar to soak up all the alcohol before going home. Had a great time and music was fab. Looking forward to going back and trying the menu!

I have been wanting a massage for a couple months but with COVID numbers being what they are, I was uncomfortable going to a location. Luckily for me, Danika at Zerenity Wellness does in-home massages and is taking every precaution to stay safe. She was prompt in responding, arrived early, and gave a great massage. I would happily recommend Zerenity for a massage, whether in-home or at their location.
Great vegetarian spot. Lots of diverse food options (I highly recommend the burrito). It also has a sneaky good beer selection.

Went for an early dinner.  Love the extra large sitting indoors.  It's a little deceiving from the outside.  The woman that took our order was super friendly.
The two of us had the pulled pork and the pork steak.  The pork steak was the clear winner.  I LOVED the chunky/creamy potato salad!  The red cabbage slaw was disappointing.  
Can't wait to be back and try more!

I've walked by this store several times before and thought they only sold toasted nuts. Not so. This is the perfect place to get baking ingredients and other bulk treats for you pantry. I was getting sundae toppings for a large group and they had all kinds of nuts, candies, chocolates, and of course jimmies. I even got some dark chocolate covered/cocoa dusted almonds another reviewer mentioned. These are the best chocolate covered almonds I've ever had; real chocolate and real cocoa, not the shiny chocolate flavored coating you would normally find.

Everything is bulk and comes in 1lb bags off he shelf. You can however ask the staff to rebag it and buy in quantities of 1/2 lb for most goods. I came in 15 min 'til closing on a Saturday and the staff was very helpful and didn't try to shoo me out the door. I am pleased. The only other kind of bulk store I know in CC is the Heat Nut in reading terminal. This is similar type of store, smaller selection but better prices.

I lived on Hartford st. in tower grove east for a year, and the entire experience was a nightmare. I was supposed to move in at the end of February, but when I got my things moved in and actually tried to spend my first night there, I realized it was freezing even though I had turned on the heat. I couldn't sleep there that night so I went to my partner's place. 

I had the gas company come out to check on it the next day: the man told me the gas had been turned off due to some dangerous appliance installation and if he were to turn on the gas then and there it would have probably killed me in my sleep. I was horrified and told Frontier that my lease was now void and I would walk away now if they didn't fix it.

I couldn't actually live there until the second week in March because of this.

I also had a problem with my power the first week, and noticed that the breakers in the the basement were not labeled at all, so I accidentally turned off my upstairs neighbors' power as well... When I walked upstairs to mention it to them, my new neighbor accosted me and screamed and cursed at me. I was terrified. It was a simple fix, the power company came out and fixed it about an hour later, but I was shaking in my new apartment because I was afraid for my physical safety.

Every time I called the office throughout the year I lived there, it was a new person who knew nothing about what was going on. 

The day I moved out and had my final "inspection", literally as soon as I left the threshold of the front door two sets of prospective tenants walked in to tour the place. I wanted to warn them...

Horrible! hired them to manage my investment properties they never return your calls or e mails and they didnt' even know a tenant didnt' pay rent and ended up filing for eviction 2 months later.... then the house sat on the market 7 months they could not rent it out when everything else got rented out in the market within 30-60 days they also have hard time passing city inspections and keep failing and took average 3 months to pass inspection to get COO. At the end they just flat out stopped returning my calls and e-mails and i had to find someone else to manage my properties. They also did maintenance work without notifying me and charged me thousands of dollars at turnover one of the worst property mgmt company experience. Half the time i call and get someone on the phone they have no idea what's going on with tenants, rent collection leasing status or eviction process.

I chose Magazine Street Framing to handle my most recent acquisition, based on prior reviews and gallery recommendations.  Lindsey and Ann met or exceeded expectations in every aspect of the transaction.  The frame/glass selection and estimate was handled in a professional, but fun and friendly way.  The job was completed in a timely manner, prompting a call to let us know it was ready for pickup. The finished project turned out perfectly!  I'll be back!!!

Pretty disappointing experience. I ordered a hot chicken taco and the jalapeno ceasar and both were almost too spicy to eat. I couldn't eat the salad at all but managed to slowly eat the taco. The chips and guacamole were good! My husband liked his tacos so maybe I just ordered wrong. 

Also, my table was dirty when I sat down.  Considering the restaurant was almost empty when we were there with plenty of employees standing around doing nothing, they should have had time to wipe it down. 

Definitely not rushing back!

This is a great new addition to th Oro Valley restaurants. Not only does hubby love it for the beer, food and tv's but so do my kids. It's a win win for everyone. 

It's a pretty small restaurant but it's nice that there is sitting inside and out. My kids love the fire table that's on the side of the restaurant. 

My husband loves that he can make his own flight and he can sample a few beers at a time. It's nice that it comes in 5 oz so you can have more of a variety without getting too full or drunk. 

We love the pretzel. We have also tried the chicken wings and the first time we ate them I didn't think they were cooked, but my husband still ate them. The second time I let our server know and she let the cook know to cook them well done. The flavor is great. We always get the home made buffalo sauce. It's not very spicy but has a ton of flavor. The blue cheese and ranch are also made in house and are amazing. My husband loves the blue cheese dressing. 

We will definitely be back soon.

Cool venue, I really enjoy the size and intimate feel of the place. My hubby and I saw Katchafire there, and it was truly the best possible venue for the group.

My only real complaints are the seriously over-priced drinks (but its part of the House of Blues group so what do you expect), and there's no seating unless you pay for VIP. Also, despite clear no-smoking signs and security everywhere, there were still a ton of people lighting up. Sure, I know it's a reggae concert and it's expected, but when there is no good ventilation and you're an asthmatic, it can make the whole experience a bit uncomfortable.

See previous review. The only thing that has improved; they are now once again issuing standard eating utensils, and instead of shouting out your name, they give you a number that's placed at the end of your table. What hasn't changed; still no extra napkins without begging for them, still no artificial sweetener without begging for it, still no salt and pepper without begging for it. I asked the "manager" about that, and she said "I can't do it". Now let me explain why this makes no business sense. We ordered iced tea with lemon (by the way, I also asked for extra artificial sweetener, since I already saw there was none on the tables. I was given two packets of Splenda, and there was no ice in my tea). We were told they had no lemon at the beverage station. I would have to go up to the bar and get some. When I went up to the bar to get some lemon slices, the bartender dropped the rag out of his ungloved hand, reached into a bin, and pulled out a couple of lemon slices. At the beverage station, they have a dozen or so uncovered plastic cups of ice water. So, they can't leave salt and pepper shakers on the table, they can't leave a stack of napkins or paper towels nearby, and they can't supply artificial sweetener, but they can expose you to anyone and everyone's germs who passes by the beverage station with the uncovered cups of ice water, and it's okay for their employees to reach for lemon with their bare hand? What's wrong with this picture?!? Does anyone else see the hypocrisy in this?
Now to the food. Very disappointing today. I ordered the pulled pork shoulder tray. I requested Alabama White Sauce (2). It  arrived with one vinegar-based sauce. The pork was dried out, and had quite a few large, hard, black, charred pieces in it. I don't know this for sure, but we were there shortly after they opened, and I'm going to guess it was left over from the day before. 
I said with my last review I would not be back. However, a Derek Thompson, who said he was the manager, invited us back in, although some very unfriendly woman who brought our food (and never introduced herself) said SHE was the manager. I was stupid enough to go back. I won't be that stupid again.

Just had my Tacoma remote and key replaced ( due to a unfortunate encounter with my English bulldog !) they informed me there were a open recall and arranged a loaner and took care of everything ! The service department were so quick and efficient. All the service rep were super friendly and responsive ! Will go here for servicing from now on ! Great job

We were in Truckee and had to stay in Reno tonight. The Lamb burger was amazing. The blackened chicken sandwich was so full of flavors. Again, the lamb was awesome. Drinks were great!  I had the o ion rings. Wow. Real hand dipped onion rings. They were eaten in minutes. All of them.

Bite sized desserts with a variety of options to choose from is definitely a great concept but more importantly Tiny Bites delivers with fantastic execution as well. My wife and I got a box of 9, ranging from creme brûlée to mango sriracha. My personal favorite was the tres leches. The desserts are freshly made and it shows in the taste. Will definitely be back.

The Hi-Pointe Theatre is hands down my favorite place to see a movie in town. It has a nice retro feel. When I watch a flick there I feel like I am going back in time and seeing a matinee showing in the 1950's. They have a great selection at the snack bar, and the staff are super friendly. They have recently added a second screen in the Back-Lot but I have yet to go there yet. There are $5 showings on Wednesdays that are a particularly good deal. Any time I am going to see a movie I always check to see if it is showing at the Hi-Pointe before looking anywhere else.

PeRfect atmosphere. Cute and comfy. The coffee is amazing and you can also get the cheese toast made from fresh Cuban bread. This place is great for friends and family. A wonderful place to study as well.

Well this evening was a huge surprise as we came to pick up our wings and fries from this location. We walked in to see our take-out food sitting in from of the turned over trash cans on the COUNTER! I'm still beyond amazed that this could ever happen. We arrived at 9:35pm to find 3/4's the tables had their chairs on top of them so you couldn't sit at the tables. Though  it was 1.5 hours before closure. There was trash in the trash cans that you could see, since they were faced towards the takeout counter. The caucasian gentleman working the kitchen really messed up tonight!

Parked car, checked into hotel, walked to Deli.
CLOSED, EMPTY, SPACE FOR RENT!
Went to Boscos

Root and Bone doesn't disappoint.  The results over deliver on the words on the menu.  The Shrimp and Grits is the best I've found in town on their new summer menu.  Upon first glance, it seems too soupy... But then you taste the sauce and will end up drinking any residual sauce and licking the bowl.  Promise.

If it were not for Ian Froeb's STL 100 - 2018, I would have never discovered this place. Even though, I dine at Chava's around the corner and a friend lives down the street - it would have never dawned on me to give this place a try. This space has been so many things, that have come and gone, that I have stopped taking notice. I hope this one makes it and stays.

Since it was my first visit, I went with Ian's Must Order. I enjoyed a, Foulard Primer. It's hot, hand cut hickory & mulberry smoked prime-rib. The meat was super tender and served with a bone-marrow aioli spread. It was also topped with charred onion, arugula and blue cheese cream - all served on a french roll. This sandwich could of been two meals, but I managed to eat it all in one sitting. I couldn't help myself, it was surprisingly that good. 

All sandwiches come with one side and I couldn't resist ordering the Mac-n-Cheese. They use a cork screw pasta and a three cheese sauce. This one side was large enough for two to share. However eating alone, I managed to eat it all.  In my defense it was a late lunch and ended up being my only meal of the day. 

The space is compact and very crowded. If you're dining at peak time, you'll be sharing a table and making new friends. The service was average, the young lady taking orders could be a little more personable, but the delicious food made me a fan. 

I'll be back? Yes, I want to try the pastrami. 

When: March 7, 2017
Why: STL 100 - 2018

Oh my uni-goodness, can you say FRESH! We came here for happy hour and had a few drinks and pupus. My husband had a few mixed cocktails which were made to perfection and I had some Juneshine (hard kombucha) they have a great alcohol selection. But now for the good part, we order the uni, it was served over blood oranges and scallops. The flavor profile was amazing, a definite must try for the uni-lover!

Great Meat Sweats Batman!

When you are great at something you might as well name your restaurant after it.  We came here for my birthday and the food and experience was pretty great.

Delicious BBQ and smoked meat are all over the menu. We tried some brisket and sausage & chicken. Everything was delicious. They also have a good variety of house made sauces to accompany the meat of your choice. There are lots of drinks to choose from and desserts too.

When we went it was a pretty busy night but we didn't have to wait very long for a table. Seating is mostly family table seating so if you are looking for intimate date night this ain't the place. There are a few two seaters so if you want those you may want to make a reservation.

Noise level can be a bit high in here. Elbow room at the family style tables is a bit limited too. You will get to know your neighbours!

Prices are fairly average for this type of bbq meat centric restaurant. Parking can be tricky is it is in the heart of Old Strathcona. There are some Impark lots nearby though. There is free 2 hour parking by the Library and McIntyre Park though if you can snag it. There is bike stand and bike repair station close by too! Lots of great shopping and entertainment in this area too.

Best brunch I've had in a while.

- The Kitchen Sink - smothered in gravy, delicious biscuit, eggs, potatoes, smothered with cheese in a cast iron pan. Really? Does that not just SOUND awesome? It was amazing.

- Creme brulee french toast - A huge stack of french toast, deliciously sweet. Berries, chantilly cream custard, creme anglaise. Also amazing.

- Shrimp and grits eggs benedict - Gulf shrimp seasoned well, thick stone ground grits with cheddar, buttery toast, deliciously poached eggs, and classic potatoes. I inhaled this one.

Seriously a really great brunch in Philly. The portions are also gigantic, so don't leave your appetite at home. I am now determined to become a regular.

Very good tacos! Cash only but they do have an ATM in there. These are served Mexican style with cilantro and onions but they are very accommodating and will put whatever you want on the tacos for you. I got chicken and cheese tacos for my son. The chicken was not spicy so it was perfect for kids. They do have a spicy green sauce so people can kick it up if they want to.

Walking in, the place is clean, has a small eating bar at the window, but otherwise, relatively plain.

I was really looking forward to trying this place because I've hears so much about it from friends.  Unfortunately, they were out of several flavors.  I did try the snicker doodle cookie and it was warm, gooey, and tasted like delicious snicker doodle.

A pretty small establishment, not a ton of choices, but at least the ones they did have were really tasty.

All I could think of when I walked in the door was, "wow, this place is a lot nicer than I thought it would be." For some reason I had envisioned this new Thai/jazz joint to be a little less formal. But it turned out to be the perfect atmosphere. The smooth jazz playing in the background and the dimly lit lighting was just what someone needs from time to time. 

I ended up having pad thai (without peanuts.) Loved it! I'm not a big spicy food fan, so this entree was the perfect choice. And luckily I have leftovers for lunch tomorrow! ;) A friend of mine let us try the apple sake -- wowee, wow, wow, wow! Delicious. I would have never guessed it would taste as refreshing as it did -- and it was great. 

This new little joint is a perfect addition to the downtown Indianapolis food scene. I hadn't been to a Thai restaurant in awhile so I was pleasantly surprised with how nice they had made this one. Well done!

The appeal of this restaurant is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. A wonderful view of the beach especially if you are seated at the patio. So, one could say that the long line is worth the wait.

Talking about the food and drinks, they are also great! I agree with other reviewers when they say, this place is beautiful as it is delicious. Despite of the busyness, the waiters are attentive.

The beachfront view plus the great food and service, no wonder this is one of the best or highly- rated restaurants in Santa Barbara! Go visit this place, you won't regret it!

This place is strange/interesting, since it's in a patio/courtyard thing and it's never quite clear who owns which part of the space (or does one business own all of it? how much of it is Johnny Gibson's versus HighWire itself? or what?), but it's overall nicely kept, so props to whoever is actually in charge here. But that's also what makes it kind of weird, because it feels like you're patronizing three businesses in the space of like 800 square feet. So as somebody with introversion and generalized anxiety, it kind of keeps me on edge that rules and boundaries and stuff are not clearly delineated. But I don't think that bothers 90% of the clientele, so you're probably good. I've been here maybe six times in the past couple of years, always on a weekend night as far as I can remember, so it's busy and crowded, but not uncomfortably so like, say, Congress. Like, I'm not forced to touch other people all the time. So I do like that it's solidly staying in business but not overrun by patrons. It also attracts a slightly older crowd, and I like that, because I am technically Young by literal age standards (30), but I also am not trying to potentially run into my own U of A students by going to super young, ultra hip joints. It also means that they play tolerable (ie actually good!) music. I really like whoever is DJing over there. They are doing just the right amount of thinking about things and not overthinking.

I like a place that gets creative with its drinks, and as someone who used to give a lot of her precious free hours to Food Network and Bravo (Top Chef, not anything else on that channel), I've always been really curious about molecular gastronomy. So hooray! HighWire does that. But then I tried it and now I get why all the judges on food shows are like, ENOUGH ALREADY WITH THE MOLECULAR STUFF; WE DON'T NEED YOU TO BE ON A ONE-CHEF MISSION TO USE UP ALL THE PLANET'S LIQUID NITROGEN; YOU ARE NOT AS COOL AS YOU THINK YOU ARE. It's really all for show and not for the actual product/taste/mouthfeel. "Vodka caviar" sure sounds fun; it also tastes exactly like it sounds, which is to say it's like boba balls of straight alcohol, to the point that it feels like it may be isopropyl alcohol than stuff that is actually comestible. Cool stuff, bro, but I don't actually want to consume it. I let my friend taste some of mine and she knocked a good half of it over and onto the floor and there were still too many for me to handle. What do you do with them? Snack on one in between sips? Break them open with your teeth and let them sink into your drink? I don't know, and I'm not convinced the bar staff knows either.

tl;dr come for the atmosphere so long as you are not anxious about unclear structures/rules, but be prepared for a little pretentious a bar menu.

I was disappointed in the service and experience I received from Jeff Ruby's in Nashville. My sister and I came here for dinner on 1/16/22 to celebrate my birthday. Our waiter Justin was very inattentive, we had to ask other waiters and even the manager for things. At one point we sat at the table clearly ready to go, as we watched Justin ignore us and take care of other tables around us. The GM of Jeff Ruby's in Lexington KY is a family friend. He set up a birthday "surprise" for me at Jeff Ruby's Nashville. Needless to say, the cake board with sparklers I was supposed to be receiving never came. My $70 steak wasn't exactly melt in your mouth. I expected more, with this being a quality steak house. My steak was dry, and I tasted a whole lot of burnt. My sister's food was underwhelming as well. I was so ready to go, I ended up throwing my whole steak away. My overall experience here from start to finish was all bad. I am really disappointed at this Jeff Ruby's location. It is sub par at best.

OMG, if you have food on your mind, this is the place to go.  You can find ANYTING here and I mean ANYTHING.  The variety is overwhelming and it seems to never end....you can eat your way in and out,.  Fresh produce, jerky any kind, fish, meats, cheese, gourmet selections, breakfast, lunch, dinner, cheesesteaks, cookies, doughnuts, drinks both non alcohol and alcohol, you name it, I am sure you can find it here.

This is an amazing place to experience if visiting, we had the best breakfast in Philly here and a great cheesesteak as well.  The cheese selection we found was out of this world from fresh cow, to sheep to goat and the staff will give you samples to help you decide.  

I did not find anyone here who was not warm and friendly from workers to shoppers, all we very cool.  If we had more time or if we make it back to Philly in the future, this will definitely be a stop on our list to try some of the amazing items we saw but did not try this trip.

We did not find a lot of organic items especially in the produce stand but it all looked really good.  If you are in Philly and have the time, you have to put this on your list of places to experience at least once.

The big winners for Culinary Dropout were wonderful customer service and a fun atmosphere. The food was pretty good but could be much better. The fried chicken and ribs were really good but there are other comparable places.

Great atmosphere. Good food. Hospitable owner and staff. 

Went there for media preview and although I can't tell you EVERYTHING thing I had, I can tell you that none of it was bad. The dim sum and Peking duck were my favorite. Tried things I probably never would. 

Grab some friends so you can share. It's perfect for a large group experience. 

It's recommended to go on a weekday because the weekend are generally packed.

First time at this location. I used to go to the Nolibs location all the time to get the chicken and waffles benedict. The prices have gone up astronomically since then. I was not impressed with my $20 breakfast (Chicken and waffle benedict and coffee). The fried potatoes were a day old and then reheated, not fresh at all. Not only were they old, they were burnt.  Everything could use a little more salt and seasoning.

So, I'm around 40. My wallet was stolen, and I had to order a new license. I came in with my old expired one and a valid accepted 20 day extension while my new one ships. Issued by Tennessee Homeland Security. And they acted like they legally couldn't serve me, even though I'm clearly 20 years past 21. And had a valid license extension.

With a team of people that report to me, that seemed like an awfully unnecessary and humiliating precaution, given that I have a legal document, a gadrillion wrinkles, and green money.

Decent little Mexican food eatery that specializes in breakfast but also has lunch (haven't been for that yet). I have eaten here twice and my dad is a huge fan of this place and eats here a lot. I find the seat kind of cramped and it does get busy, so I often have people bumping up behind my seat. The wait staff seem quite helpful and everyone seems to pitch in on refills and such. You get paper cups for your drinks. They serve up some chips and salsa.  Prices are good- expect about $6.50 for a dish. I had chilaquiles and they were delicious, and it came with beans and two eggs (anyway you like 'em). Scooped onto a corn or tortilla, and it's yummy.

Saturday morning they had a buffet for $8.99 that included most of the breakfast menu items including pancakes. And hey I have to get on a soapbox- if you go to a Mexican eatery, why do you pile on pancakes onto your plate when you can eat things like Huevos and chilaquiles and other specialities? Save the pancakes for IHOP. Seriously. 

Don't blink if you try to find this place- it's tucked away in a tight parking lot.

Elmwood is easily the best gym in New Orleans if you like to do anything other than play tennis.  If they have tennis courts I don't know where they are located.  But Elmwood is a fitness resort!  Tons of equipment nestled amongst palm trees and juice bars.  

The fitness center itself is a surprise. It's hidden in a budget shopping center amongst stores like Kmart, TJ Maxx, and Big Lots.  So you wouldn't expect to see such an amazing gym.  The Elmwood sign is unassuming and the fitness center is actually nestled far back from the parking lot.

If you stay at the nearby Hampton Inn you can use Elmwood for free!  Normally it's $15 per day for guests.

The masters swim team only costs $30 per month and George, the Coach, is a really great guy.  Classes such as BodyPump are typically crowded and a lot of fun.

There are 3x lap pools: 1x indoor salt water pool and 2x outdoor pools...along with two expansive kiddie pools.  

Another highlight is the massive hot tub that sits next to a large cold dip kept at 55 degrees.  Moving back and forth through the cold dip and to the hottub has phenomenal therapeutic benefits.

There is massive kids area that I have never ventured into.  It has been recently remodeled to include active video gaming rooms that encourage kids to move around and get exercise.

If you are in Nola it's worth the drive out to Elmwood.

Just came back from Greece (14th trip with Gate 1). On my tour I met a couple that traveled with Gate 1 for over 25 tours! I was impressed!

I did the 8 day essential Greece and purchased it during a flash sale. It was deeply discounted at about $799 per person. The tour was so popular that they even included the optional excursion of the Greek cooking class (which was fun and delicious). My group was approximately 40 people and the age group was about mid 20s to mid 70s.

Upon arrival at the airport I was met by Stella who was very friendly and handed me my packet of info of everything I needed to know about my tour (including my pick up time for the airport on my departure day). It was all very organized. Later that night I met Evgenia who we called Jenny. Jenny was our tour guide the rest of the trip and I was impressed that she was an actual archaeologist that excavated Santorini before becoming a tour guide. In Greece, all tour guides are trained for three years and so she was not only our tour manager but also our local tour guide everywhere. It was awesome. She knew so much!

While in Athens we stayed at a hotel that was within walking distance to the Acropolis and the Plaka area.  In my opinion, Plaka in Athens has the best shopping out of all the cities we visited and the shop owners are nice. The restaurants in the Plaka area are also very affordable even though this area is popular. I was able to buy a gyro at a fast food shop for 2.40 euro! God's Restaurant was also very good and affordable (get the pancake w/mushroom sauce appetizer--I'm not sure if it on the menu but it was recommended by the table sitting next to us). The restaurant at our hotel (Athenian Carllirhoe hotel) was also very good. A dish of mussels for 10 euro! The tour also included a trip on the metro train. The metro is so easy to use in Athens!

There is a good amount of walking on this tour. There are cobble stones and unpaved areas where the ruins are. Places can also be hilly. You can opt to go explore with the group or stay behind near the bus if walking long distances or on rough terrain isn't what you enjoy. Jenny showed us a lot of areas of Athens and Gate 1 treated us to baklava and Greek coffee as well as candies and ouzo (Greek alcohol).

The hotels we stayed at were great. All had wifi and free hot buffet breakfast. I went to Greece end Nov/early Dec so the rooms were a bit warm because what Greeks think is cold is not actually that cold for Americans. They didnt have AC in the rooms because it was winter. Thankfully the windows opened to let in the cold air.

I didn't purchase any optional tours before the tour started. I was able to add the optional tours later but the Acropolis Walking tour required payment in Euros (which thankfully I had!) and not credit cards. Thankfully I was able to pay with credit card for the optional full day cruise to Hydra.

Stella (instead of Jenny) was with us the entire full day cruise in case we had any issues on the cruise.  The cruise offered a buffet lunch and it was really good.  It stopped off at three islands (Hydra, Poros, and Aegina.) At Aegina they offered a bus tour of either classical (27 euro) or panoramic (23 euro).  I think the tours were offered because during the time we were there it was siesta. You purchased the ticket on the boat with the cruise line and you can pay via credit card. I did the panoramic tour and I was not impressed. The windows on the bus were foggy so I couldn't get any good pictures. Aegina is also the island where the pistachio trees are and where many vendors sell pistachio products so buy pistachio stuff here not in Athens. The cruise boat served coffee/water/snacks for a fee and the seating was very comfortable. The boat allows for 800 passengers. Thankfully it was not a busy day when we went so we could spread out. The bathrooms on that boat were also clean and easy to use. The staff was friendly and offered a dancing show with free dancing lessons. I'm glad I did this optional tour.

As I've gotten older I've gotten more prone to motion sickness. We were told if the weather was bad then the boat cruise would be cancelled. Thankfully the weather wasn't bad on the day of our departure but the rocking of the boat still had my stomach feeling queasy. I was able to reposition myself in a way so I was rocking backward and forward instead of sideways which helped a lot. I never got motion sickness on the bus because our bus driver was awesome.

Greece is the best country in the E.U because the people are friendly, the food is delicious and cheap, the souvenirs are so affordable and the history/stories behind the ruins is so magical. You don't have to pay to use the W.C (water closet aka bathroom) at any of the places. The only downside is that you might have to pay in Euros because some restaurants don't take credit cards but you can get Euros from any of the ATMs here. I highly recommend this tour to Greece with Gate 1!

This was just a bit of a disappointment after the ratings on Yelp. It was a great value as we got a huge sandwich for the money, but it just wasn't as tasty as I would have hoped. It was nice and tender, and the sauce did help, but I didn't taste any smoky flavor.
It is self-serve so service is more of a non-issue. It is built from an old house repurposed for a restaurant, but I didn't feel particularly at home here. 
If a big sandwich is your priority for you rather than great bbq taste, this place is your cup of tea. As for me, I am going to be shopping for another bbq favorite.
This location is GREAT! They always know what we need for our pool!  I don't know the employee's name but the one guy who works there knows his stuff!

I have found a cure for claustrophobia. Reading Terminal Market. Crowded and bustling but everywhere you look there is something new to see and you are assaulted by mouth watering smells and temptations every few paces. It makes the volume of people jostling you entirely bearable.

My fave samplings:
Termini Brothers for tasty cheese cannoli, fig bars, sfogliatelle, pignoli cookies and biscotti.
Fisher's for Amish pretzels with butter
Lancaster Co Dairy for fresh squeezed lemonade
Salumeria for gourmet meats and cheese which made for an awesome midnight snack
Dutch Eating Place for food that is similar to Grandma's and a kick ass apple dumpling.

If I lived in Philly I would be in here all the time, the shopping looked incredible, super fresh products of all sorts. So sad to miss DiNic's though, I will have to return at some point. Thanks to Bobby P, Andrew T and Mira V for the suggestion.

Had a great first facial here! I was able to book it last minute but they took their time to explain the process and a skin care routine for me to take home after the facial. I purchased their full skin care line (they are 'about face' branded) and have been using them for a week and my skin has cleared up almost completely at this point. After having bought a ton of items over time from Sephora and other places, it was nice to just have a clear 4 step routine that is getting me the results I wanted.   Definitely go, they know what they're doing!

Another bar around the corner from me with a large following. I've been here about 5 times and while I suggest it to friends, it's pretty low on my list of places to go.

The good:
* Really great beer selection
* The mussels are as good as everyone says -- cheap and you receive a huge portion.
* A nice place to hole up during a cold winter day 
* Bartenders who know their beer

The bad:
* No windows, so its pretty dark in there
* Beer prices are somewhat high 
* Limited seating/cramped spacing so its a better place to go to eat rather than for drinks.

The worst:
Had gone with friends to eat at the bar. The bartender served us waters and beer. We got through most of our meal and then my friend noticed that there was a very large shard of glass in her water glass. Turns out a glass had been broken into the ice bin and no one had emptied it. The bartender was somewhat apologetic and comped the bill, but this incident stuck with me as we were worried my friend may have ingested a smaller piece of glass or that other people had done the same. All staff should be trained to melt the ice and clean the area if theres a glass broken in the bar area. Really dangerous and turns me off from drinking anything but beer from here again.
This place sucks. Everyone who works there is rude. And nothing is ever prepared.  Don't go here

Vegan? Check!

Tasty food? Check!

Delicious drinks? Check!

Vedge? Amazing!!!

I went here on a random Thursday when we were looking to try out the new vegan restaurant that the Horizon's owners had put together.  I was originally trying to find a reservation for three on a Tuesday, and found that there was NOTHING available, which was a sign that we were definitely in for a good meal.  The interior is gorgeous and huge. I didn't expect the restaurant to be as big as it is, and it's warm and inviting inside.  The space seems apt for veg friendly food, as it has clean, white touches and beautiful wood floors.  We were seated as soon as our party arrived, and we began our food / drink journey of awesomeness.  

We began with the purple carrots and crispy cauliflower from the dirt list as apps, they were both delicious.  The carrots were cooked and served with black eyed peas, and the cauliflower is amazing. I mean beyond amazing. The sauce they were served in was SO GOOD! I salivate as I am writing this in fact, as the thought and words describing it make me want it now.  

We continued to order the gojuchang tofu, the the grilled seitan, and the golden beets.  The beets were amazing, and fresh, and delicious. The dill that was served on the side was GREAT.  The gojuchang tofu has a great spice to it, and the grilled seitan comes with wonderful lentils.  The food was all just amazing, and every bite was satisfying.  There is flavor, freshness, and nothing is so heavy that you feel gross, but everything fills you up! 

To finish, we ordered the three ice creams and the chocolate pot.  The ice cream flavors we tried were popcorn (tasted like candy popcorn), root beer, and stout.  Each one was amazing, and creamy, and great.  The chocolate pot was our second dessert, and equally awesome. In fact we mixed some of the ice creams with the chocolate for a great taste. 

Finally, the drink list is interesting, but I stuck with beer.  My dinner companions weren't too sure of anything on the menu, and instead told the bartender / waitress what they liked, and the bartender made them drinks to order. They were GREAT. The bartender came out to see us at one point, and he's genius / friendly.  

Service was great, ambiance was great, food was great. I really can't say enough about vedge.  Really great choice in Center City!

Have visited twice since. Try not to get a seat along the booth side. It feels very claustrophobic there since the tables are so close together and there's a wall that sticks out and boxes you in.

Have since tried the truffle, and mais pizzas. Really enjoyed the truffle. The almonds threw me for a surprise. Mais was a bit overrated and -priced. I expected some sort of special corn, but it tasted and looked like regular corn.

Seafood stew has a spicy kick. Goes great with their breads. When I was there, they offered a nuts & seed bread in addition to the regular white. I think they're both unique and interesting, and I still love the white the best. They also sell their loaves for $8. Check their FB for deets.

Their cheese and meat plates have got to have 100%+ markup. One of our 3 for $18 selections was a cheese with black truffle in it. This was served as a thin slice of cheese! I think this was maybe too little value and I would not order again.

Lobster bisque was nicely executed. It had less of a creamy dairy broth and more of a creamy vegetable broth. The pepperoncinis under the lobstah meat gave it some KICK!

Get here early if you can so to snag a nice, roomy window seat!

I am very glad that I stayed here on my recent trip to New Orleans. Got a great room rate for myself and three other friends (we each had our own room).  Rooms are very comfortable (bed, bathroom, enough storage, etc.).  

Lounge and bar area was super convenient as we started each evening there.  Drinks were made well, music band was very good and crowd was pleasant. 

Gym is very adequate and was easy to use.  

Breakfast was ok.  I used the Buffett for convenience but was not worth the price at all.  For the same breakfast I ended up having,
Ordering off the menu would have cost a lot less. It's the Ritz I get it, but I suggest you order off the menu.
