One aspect I was not impressed with was the reservation system. When I called in I had a particular request for one of the rooms.  The reservationists said she noted it.  Then I called a few weeks ahead to confirm, no note.  OK I re-requested again. Called the night before to confirm, again no note!!  A bit irate I made them write in the request.  Sure enough we arrived and request not fulfilled!!  What's up with that? Isn't this the Ritz?

Besides that small annoyance, everything else was wonderful, and I would not hesitate to stay here again if the price is
Right.

Came here a few weeks ago. Outdoor dining is great, and the place was nicely scattered with tables. Food was delicious - but the bread a bit stale but flavorful. We also came on a Thursday, so I imagine the bread was last serving before the weekend hit.  Clams were delicious, and we enjoyed the meal overall. Service was excellent. Would definitely return, and I appreciated how safe the staff was. Dessert was phenomenal - it was a berry cheesecake thing (can't remember the name). Also note - I asked for the appetizers to have separate dips due to COVID and was dining with a friend. They were very kind and offered separate dips for our bread and potato chips. MUST ORDER THE POTATO CHIPS.

Went here for brunch on a Sunday. They mainly operate on reservations. I didn't make a reservation so we waited about 15mins to see if a reserved party would show. In the meantime, we saw several people were turned around due to being at capacity. I was wondering why their names weren't added to the waiting list should a party not show. 
After 15mins passed we received a text stating that our table was ready. 
We were greeted from our waitress with water. Complimentary pastries/ biscuits are not offered at this restaurant. 

Appetizer: 
We started off with the beignets, they were very light and flaky but also a bit on the greasy side. This dish is more of a dessert than an appetizer. 

Entree: 
For an entree we order the catfish and grits, this was delicious. The fish batter was fried to perfection with a slight lemon flavoring but not overbearing. The grits were the perfect consistency with a melted cheese on top. 
The other entree was the tchoupoutolas (spell check) omelet. This was huge and very thick. But the crawfish were just the right amount. It was accompanied by either a biscuit or toast. We decided on the biscuit. The biscuits didn't seem homemade, more like frozen biscuits, the size is very large. 
Service: 
The service was great, our waitress kept our drinks filled and checked on us enough not to become annoying. I will be back.

One of the best empanadas I've had in a long time. I was surprised to find this establishment in Santa Barbara. 
This little restaurant is located in Haley St. which is pretty close to the Downtown area. 
They have a nicely decorated outdoor seating area with patio lighting and a large size flatscreen playing some old Argentina soccer games.
I ordered three different types of empanadas (chicken, corn, and beef)
The good thing about this place is each flavor is made differently, so you can tell which one is which with ease. They give you a piece of paper which gives you the drawings of each shape and it's flavor.
Overall, the crust, and filling was tasty and I enjoyed every bite. It reminded me of my childhood local empanadas shop near my old house in Buenos Aires.

I so wish I could give more stars but not able to. I took my daughter & her friend there. We were all super excited, but the young ladies working that day were absolutely horrible to us. They ALL seemed put out when we walked in. I asked the counter girl what she would recommend, her response was "whatever".  And when I went to pay was scolded for not tipping...when indeed - I left a sizable cash tip in the jar. After I showed the counter girl that it was cash, she didn't feel the need to apologize nor did her co-workers.  Never been treated so poorly. I thought Boise Boba was better than this. 
If you want a nice place to get boba and where the servers will be helpful and nice...then head to Urban Fox!!

My wife and I had finished watching our grandson play football at City Park and decided to have a late lunch with him and our son before they headed home.  We picked Cafe Navarre and sat out on the patio since the day was so nice.  I ordered the Cuban sandwich while everyone else ordered the Dirty Bird.  Our grandson added an order of the gravy cheese fires to his meal.  The Cuban was one of the better ones that I've had in the city while they all raved over the Dirty Bird.  Service was acceptable.  It was a pleasant meal.

In my opinion, this is the best breakfast restaurant in Philly. Like THE BEST (can't emphasize enough). 

I bookmarked this place because of the high ratings and came here when my friends and I were visiting Philly on a weekend. We came here around 10:00 AM and there was a huge line. Didn't realize that this place was going to be super packed or was super popular. We put our name down (for four people) and they told us that it was going to be an hour wait. It ended up actually being like a 30 minutes wait total which was great! A lot of people left after they put their names down or people were done eating quickly. 

After we got seated, it took us a little bit of time to order because there were so many choices that sounded amazing. We ended up over ordering and ordered 6 different meals for the four of us. Everything was ON point and amazing.. especially the red velvet pancakes. That was my favorite!

Don't forget: CASH ONLY. They do have an ATM inside.

Absolutely the best pho in Indy! They use local beef, I feel like that's unheard of for pho places around here! They really take their time into creating a very unique and delicious broth. Loads of flavor but the star anise comes off the most and I love it. We also get their housemade sirachi to have at home. Just a really brilliant place!

I'm happy to have MEAT so close to home as it's an easy place to take people for a focused meal of meat, meat, and meat!

I've loved the fried chicken and the smoked brisket. I'd come back again and again for those. The pulled pork has been kind of dry for my taste, although I'd pick some off your plate if we went to MEAT together :-)

The tables are littered with bottles of sauces -- the whole reason for eating. Food is just a vehicle for sauces! The place is clean and spartan in decoration, with a pretty loud buzz, and sometimes a crowd. Worth the wait if you want meat, meat, and meat! 

One word of caution: Hipster Central. Just sayin.

The Dentist told me I had 30% to 40% rot under my back Crown.  That she would remove it and clean the area, and then we could decide on how to proceed with that area.  I go back for the appt. (2 mos. later) and NOW it is 70% rot and she wants to break the Crown in 4 pcs, clean area and re-do another Crown.  I do not need another Crown, since last tooth was going to leave area to just heal.  NOW she will not touch the area, and sent me to an Oral Surgeon in her group, who has TERRIBLE ratings and is 40 minutes away.  GO to a DIFFERENT DENTIST PRACTICE!

I was moving my daughter into a new apartment when I went inside for less than 15 minutes they came and towed our truck. It took us over 5 hours for them to acknowledge they had towed it and another hour and a half to pick it up. They're not just rude and dumb they're the rudest and dumbest people you'll ever deal with. Talk about a scam!!!!!

Food was really good.  Was it worth the wait- No.  Was it worth the price- No. Am I glad I tried it- Yes.  

This breakfast spot is SWAMPED on the weekends.   Get here early and expect a wait.  Limited seating and slow patrons add up to be a pain in the butt.  Large group... forget it.  I wouldn't try a group of more than 4.  6 is doable but expect some wait time.

The selection of food is great.  They have many many options for pancakes, french toast and omelets.  Be careful what you order from the pancake or french toast sections... you could go into diabetic shock.  But do not fear, they have plenty of savory options available on the menu too.

In addition to my breakfast I got a side of homefries... now potatoes are my favorite part of the breakfast experience but I was saddened when my $2 potatoes amounted to a few homefries in a small bowl.  Please, charge be double but give me some homefries!  Drink refills can be on the slow side but that is too be expected.

I will try on a weekday this summer to see if things are better when they are so backed up.

I rarely provide feedback but felt this is worth mentioning for any other patrons that frequent Omiza in Doylestown. My husband and I typically order takeout at the minimum, once a week and the food is always wonderful (no complaints there), a few mistakes in the past but nothing worth noting. We ordered take out on 04-Sept for lunch and we should have known an issue would transpire when the young gentlemen told us on the phone he is new and was struggling to take our 4 item order. We picked up the food shortly thereafter and when we got home we noticed what we originally ordered and was charged (Shrimp Tempura Supreme I - $14.00) was not included; in place of it was Shrimp Tempura ($6.00 list price per the menu). I was perfectly fine with the deviation of my order; however, I wanted the $8.00 difference in price refunded. At that point, I called back to tell them of the error and the young gentlemen who originally took my order picked up the phone, in which I summarized the issue. He told me he can't do anything about it right now, and I will have to wait for a manager to call me back to issue a void on my credit card, so I left my name and contact information. Two days passed and no call back and no void on my card. I then called again to which the young lady who answered told me she needs a manager to handle this situation; to which again, I summarized the issue and stated that I have indeed been waiting for a manager to call me back. To no avail, I called again this afternoon, to which I received the same answer...a manager needs to handle this. At this point I'm becoming increasingly frustrated with the young staff that don't appear to be understanding my frustration. I decided to drive to Omiza this evening (08-Sept) to speak directly to 'anyone' at this point, who can help me get my $8.00 refunded. I approached the young woman at the counter and explained who I was and how I've now left 3 different messages across 3 different days, to which no one will assist me. Her response was quite shocking, "The manager is managing 3 different restaurants, and you need to realize that." To my shock, she was EXTREMELY arrogant, obnoxious, and exceedingly condescending. She told me that a manager can only do refunds. I question this policy simply by stating, "If I were to order food at this moment, and you incorrectly ring me up, would you refund my credit card?" She simply stated "Yes, of course," to which I simply asked her if she sees the irony and asinine logic in the situation. At this point, all of the young staff (servers, and hostesses decided to crowd around her like a mob) are glaring at me as if I am trying to get one over on Omiza (I simply want my $8.00 which was Omiza's error in the first place). A server told me if I order food, they'll credit me next time, to which I declined and simply again stated, "I just want my money at this point." She decided to leverage the awkward silence and stare maneuver, as if she couldn't do anything more at this point. I told her I want my refund, period, and I'm happy to wait while she calls a manager, any manager at this point (I suggested refund the $14.00 and charge me $6.00, I don't care how you do it, but I want my $8.00). At that point she said she had to call her manager. Now the young staff are all talking in a circle behind the counter as if I'm not standing right there (again, extremely unprofessional, patronizing, obnoxious, and arrogant). She hovers over the phone without picking up the handset, and at this point an older woman appears from the kitchen and just tells her to give me the $8.00 out of the register...finally, some relief (thank you to whoever you are!). Surprising that a restaurant of Omiza's caliber would employ such young, arrogant, and obnoxious front desk staff. You would think I was trying to steal $8.00 from the pockets of the hostess/young lady at the counter. I've never felt a more condescending attitude from a restaurant than today. Again, I am truly shocked Omiza is OK with how their restaurant is apparently being run in the absence of management (apparently by obnoxious children, because that is how they act), and by default the face of Omiza when you call or walk in. (Remember, all 3 instances across 3 different days from early afternoon until evening, when I called, the front counter stated a manager was not there).

Also, I have a picture of the receipt and food to prove a point if I get questioned.

Yours truly, a former loyal customer.

Mix Bakeshop did the cupcakes and small cake for my wedding! I couldn't be more pleased with them. I went for two different tasting and decided on 9 different flavors, to have at my wedding. Everyone raved about how good they were, and wanted to know where I got them. My uncles stated it was the best carrot cake he has ever had!!

I loved the fact that you could rent out the serving trys/pieces, who wants to buy serving try/pieces for a weeding that your only going to use once. Just a waste of money if you ask me!
Mix Bakeshop delivered and did setup as well, which was nice and one less thing to worry about on your big day!!

Cup Cakes are a great alternative to a wedding cake, and so much more fun!! Plus you get way more options! 

Highly Recommend!

The food, drinks, and service at Osteria is phenomenal! We went here on a Saturday night and the only reason I didn't give Osteria five stars, is due to the ambiance. It's dark and loud on the inside and the tables are pretty close together so it's very hard to hear your group/not hear others. Therefore, I'd recommend going on a less busier night.

Back to the food, this was probably one of the best wedge salads I've ever had. I'd also recommend getting the carbonara in a jar. It's brought table-side in a jar and the house smoked bacon is to die for. If you haven't checked this place out yet, I highly recommend!

Also, for my gf folks, they've got GF pasta and a whole GF menu - incredible and super gf friendly!

Since I'm here, I told my buddies that  I needed to try some alligator. Since we were at the cigar lounge, they knew a spot near here, that serves good gator. We sat at the bar area, Brenden our bartender was the man. He definitely showed us some good hospitality with great service, good story teller as well. Ordered some fried alligator with fries with some spicy dipping sauce. Well, it was good can't deny that. Be back to check out the Gumbo....

Solid restaurant for Mexican food...but very slow service. 

I came here a couple of times with my friends and coworkers and...I am not impressed with anything, except their Table Side Guac. I think this place typically gets super busy and it seems like they're always understaffed. Came here for lunch and it was a big mistake. The burrito bowl I ordered was horrible. Too much sour cream and the mean tasted like jerky. On top of that, we never got the check so I was late going back to work. 

I want to like this place since this place is so close from my work, but I will not be returning anytime soon.

Thank you to these two wonderful women, Sam and Katie!  I took my sweet Ragdoll cat Diamonds into them this morning for her first bath and grooming.  I've normally taken her to the Vet for her yearly combout.  She had some mats on her hind-end along with needing a bath.  They were very kind, knowledgeable and most of all took wonderful care of my sweet 12 year old cat.  It's obvious they both love cats.  Diamonds came home smelling clean and they combed SO much hair out of her, along with taking the mats out.  She isn't even mad at me, and I will go back to Paw Spa from now on, along with telling everyone with a dog or cat to call them.  When she was ready to be picked up, I got a cute picture of her saying "I'm done!"  OH, and by the way, they have one day they only do cats so our little sweet babies won't have to listen to dogs barking ...
smart, huh?!  Trust these two gals!  Thanks, again.

Tired Hands is a place you want to stop in for a couple pints and a quality meal. Its ambiance is balanced well between a laid-back-chill-zone and beer-enthisiast-public-house. And one neat décor element were the welded copper tap handles.

I ordered a HopHands (Pale Ale), followed up by the Hurdy Gurdy. I wanted try their cannabis IPA, but unfortunately, it was 86ed before I had a chance to order.

Sitting at the bar, my friend and I started with a couple shared appetizers, including their thick cut candied bacon and their pimento cheese and crackers. Both the bacon and cheese were practically inhaled - very tasty.

The roast beef, aged cheddar, and caramelized onion paninis (we each ordered our own) were likewise delicisioso. The fact they bake their own artisan bread, and purchase their meats and cheeses locally (I believe within 100 mile radius) is really cool, and certainly not mainstream among other breweries. I also applaud the fact they offer 10% off draft beer to US veterans who present ID!

I've always been a supporter of this brewpub. With their diverse menu (typical bar fare + decent seafood/sushi), they cater to a variety of palettes. Home brewed selection is constantly rotating, and they offer some pretty mint weeknight specials (e.g. Thursday nights are $3 for most 12 ounce pours).

What brings this establishment up a notch is the ambiance. Among their amenities, they have an outdoor deck overlooking the Schuylkill for the warmer months, an area/small stage indoors to host live music, and a partitioned room/bar for private events. 

Bring a large group, your date, or post up solo at the bar. It's a good time.

Throughout the pandemic this restaurant has quickly adjusted to changing conditions and has been very attuned to the health and safety of staff and patrons. Yet while I followed all of their communication online, we still had not ordered from here. We did tonight and we'll be ordering much more in the future. We ordered carry out and the person who took my order was very courteous. The order was ready when promised and my hubs also noted the pickup personnel were nice. 

Now for the food. Our order was 100 percent correct. My hubs had the Cobb salad with chicken added. It was a very large dinner salad and the chicken was packaged separately to keep the lettuce from wilting. Hubs said he would order that again. I had the fish and chips. My portion was also huge-3 nice size pieces of fish and a large serving of French fries (I had about half the fries left over because I was stuffed!). The beer batter was light and crispy and the fish tasted great. I've only had fish and chips a few times in Indy and this was one of the best. I would definitely order this again, though there is more I want to try on the menu. 

I'm looking forward to spring/summer nights to take advantage of their outdoor seating and try more of the menu!

Have been waiting to try this place for a while! My only qualm about this place is it's too far from my house!

I went for the Cuban sandwich, they also said their big seller is the holiday Turkey which also sounded great. 

The Cuban was soo goood!  Soft bread lightly toasted with a horseradish mayo and pickles!  Great flavour!

Awesome sandwich and the prices are all under $10 for a big sandwich. Definitely coming back to try some other ones on the south side. 

The cookie was super chewy and amazing!

Had a great time at Mandolas for my sons birthday dinner 

When we walked in we were greeted by a wonderful woman who helped us find seating and even had high chairs out for our little ones that was nice, we ordered with Arina up front and she was super sweet she was so polite and nice to the kids she even repeated our order back to us to make sure everything was correct and after paying we went to our table.

Food came out in order and quick everything looked great I got the manicotti that was a special item that unfortunately the chicken inside had bone cartlige and huge fatty pieces but when I showed them what was going on they immediately apologized and got my a new dish other than that the table food was enjoyed  

Mandolas was nice enough to let us bring a cake that we lit outside because I bought a huge sparkler candle and got us plates and silverware to enjoy this moment. 

Thanks again

There is a BIG BIG BIG hype around this place. I've been hearing about it for a while now. When we got the chance to stop in, we did not hesitate. The restaurant is very Cuba like. Palm trees, Spanish music, wooden panels, cool chairs, overall awesome way to get away without getting away. 

When we were seated, our server was extremely nice and went over the menu for us. Decent sized menu with a good amount of options for dinner. I went with the ropa veja which was extremely tasty and hearty. My husband got the grilled platter which he and his friend split, its more like family style- the menu detailed this to be a massive feast, but for the price paid, they really didn't get much food. 

This place was okay. Nice ambiance, good service, and good food. The reason for 3 stars is due to price. Its really over priced Cuban food. Without many options for Cuban in the city, it kinda doesn't give anyone a choice. Ill fulfill my Cuban cravings in north jersey/ nyc.

I came in for breakfast and felt like I got a dose of the owner's left-wing politics the moment i stepped in the door with their big No Justice No Peace banner above the counter. 

I almost walked right out but figured i'd give it a try. Coffee and muffin were pricey and mediocre at best. I wonder why liberals like these folks think everyone who walks in their business wants to be exposed to their politics? I came in for breakfast not a dose of lefty politics. No Justice no peace is the rallying cry of looters and others who believe in lawlessness. 

If they had better coffee, i might hold my nose and patronize them anyways, but the combo of bad coffee, high prices and off-putting politics put me off.

I had never purchased anything from them before but they had two appliances for a good price. I normally go to the big box stores (I know, another kind of yuck) because of free delivery and volume pricing. I knew what I wanted so I purchased online. Called to ask about delivery. Got a disinterested sales person (I know, I could have gone to Home Debit for that) who explained that delivery is in the form of a rebate. So...
1) they listed the items as "in stock" - no, I had to wait weeks for them. 
2) they have a delivery rebate. You have to fill out a multi page form and then wait 12-14 WEEKS.

For all the high-end neighborhoods these people are located in in. I was not impressed.

Mexican food on a Saturday morning? Why not.

Me and my husband was making our way to Starbucks on 4th st; when we bumped into a waitress outside Tuk Tuk Real putting chairs / tables outside. Had to be about 10am. We asked if we could have a menu and even though they were not open yet she kindly went inside and handed us one any way. I asked what was one of her favorite entrees on the menu and she started ranting about the Mahi Mahi. 
Sounded amazing! 

Later that day we came back for dinner and she remembered our faces :)
I went ahead and got the Mahi Mahi burrito which was ammmmaz-ing. My husband tried the pork tamales and they were very dry but he loved those lamb nachos. Cinnamon Churros could have been a much larger portion but they was delicious.

Overall everything was great! This has to be one of the best spots on South street.
Honestly haven't had such great service like this since I've moved from Massachusetts. Thank you.

5 STARS.

I really enjoyed the food but wasn't a big fan of the experience we had. The wait time for a party of five was about an hour on a Sunday at noon and they accidentally lost our order and we waited an additional 45 minutes for our food after we ordered. They did bring out complimentary hummus with bread for our wait time. Food was really tasty and unique, but may be better to go there during a less busy time.

Wow wow wow!!! My husband and I enjoyed a delicious lunch from The Wild Cow and were blown away! I got the Buffalo Beans and green- the portion size was HUGE and all the flavors complimented each other so well. It was nutritious and comforting and just amazing.
My husband got the chipotle tacos with queso and chips. YALL!!!!! The queso is unlike any other vegan cheese I've had. It was one of a kind! We can't wait to go back and try one of the sandwiches!

We ordered take out based on a recommendation and weren't impressed. The parking at this place was crazy, that was my first impression. Our food was ready when I arrived. Food doesn't taste that great. The margarita pizza was pretty terrible, at $20 for a pizza I expected a lot more. We also got a large pizza with a few toppings and overall it wasn't great either. I like garlic, this thing was loaded with it, in fact that was pretty much the only flavor I got, like to the point that my tongue was burning a little. To pay $45 for 2 pizzas and a few garlic knots I expected a lot more! We probably won't be returning.

I LOVE SUSHI! It's literally in my DNA to love and eat sushi. I don't want to say I'm a sushi snob, but I definitely can say confidently what is good and bad sushi. And this is one of the good places. 

The one thing I always say is that the fish quality can be top notch, but if their rice sucks, it ruins the entire experience. I haven't had a bad experience here just yet, and I hope it stays that way. Their salmon is delicious and I love that most of their rolls contain salmon. They have your normal appetizer selections and you have to get their baked mussels! I think it's one of the best in town.

Sometimes their service can be slow, but I think their food makes it up for it. And their lunch price is only $18, and that's something I'm not going to complain about. They also have a bigger lunch selection compared to other restaurants, where they only serve certain items.

If you want sushi, come eat here!

I've never had a bad experience at Kuma's! Their food and service is always great. Honestly I don't know which burger to recommend as they've all been so good... the portions are gigantic, the ingredients are fresh, their drink menu is elaborate and accommodating, their food is skillfully crafted. Their (metal) music is typically played loud, providing Kuma's with its own special type of ambience. If I'm hungry and around Fountain Square, this is where you'll find me! (Kid-friendly)

My new favorite place in city market. I work in the office building next door so City Market is my go to at lunch. 

Duos has the best combo of simple ingredients in their bowls. I've tried all of them and they don't disappoint. They might look small but they are just enough food for lunch. 

My favorite is the Balance Bowl and I add avocado and get chicken instead of egg.

The location is great for a night out. We always start out here before going out for the night. This time I made a similar taco to the Lucy's Fire taco, but with chipotle crema instead of the cilantro-lime aioli. It is my favorite taco to date! I wish that I would've been hungry enough to order a second. I can't wait to come back and try the blue margarita, whatever flavor it is. We didn't notice it until after we ordered beer. We would've rather had that blue margarita than beer, but there's always next time. I just wish that the server had told us about it. So far, I have been lucky enough that I didn't have to wait to be seated. We had our own table this time, but that didn't really matter to us. We were both pleased with our experience.

****** WAY OVER PRICED AND PUSHY, PUSHY SALES. HAD I LOOKED OVER THEIR REVIEWS I NEVER WOULD HAVE SIGNED UP. ******
If I could give zero stars I would have. The focus here is not your health or well being...its about money. I caved and gave into the pressures of paying a significant amount for training that was lack luster. The trainers did not have patience with me as I was starting out injured; recent car accident and a work injury, which limited my ability to start out strong. Also, I work nights so my schedule was difficult to fit into their time frames. Overall, I would think twice before signing up. This gym was definitely not for me; I wasted a lot of money and time working on getting stronger and healthier with no results. Think twice before you sign up and just be prepared to pay minimum of $9000 for your membership.  Not happy with this place at all.

My fav nail place in greater Indianapolis area hands down (pun intended). Right next to Keystone mall, so about a 20 minute drive from downtown but SO worth it. As a very busy person I always make the drive! I like to ask for Jennifer, but all technicians are great. I have had multiple manicures last over a month (pics of my favs included). Super easy online scheduling and discounts send via email or text periodically! Go here for your

Pho is good although broth seemed oddly sweet to me. 

Slowish service but friendly. 

I would go back since it's close but washington Ave places in the city are one notch better

Yep, it's a burger.
A thick, somewhat dry, and too-small-for-the-bun shaped burger that will take almost thirty minutes to receive.  I have found that no matter how many customers there are, the wait time stays the same because the meat is cooked to order.

You can order the burger with Gyro style toppings to make it have a stronger taste.
Or, you can have the same patty sandwiched between two room temperature grilled cheese sandwiches with bacon.  
The fries are delicious, double fried--- the taste is fresh and somewhat sweet from the caramelized starch.

The drink specials are definitely a great value.  So to me, the burgers play a side role to the drinking at The Burg.

This place has yet to disappoint me. There have been burgers that I have constructed that I didn't like as much as others, but overall I am always satisfied when leaving this establishment. There are plenty of great burger establishments throughout the city. The overall quality and preparation of the food at Sketch Burger undeniably puts them on that list. When I think of a good burger joint three elements come to mind, burgers, fries, and milkshakes and Sketch Burger exceeds at all three. 
Are their milkshakes the best? That is certainly debatable but they are good, and one should treat themselves to one when dining here. They serve the standard Chocolate, Vanilla, Strawberry but check the board or ask about their specialty shakes. 
 
The fries are thick cut and lightly seasoned. The key to eating these is ordering a dipping sauce to your choice to dunk them in although the crispy goodness is good without any condiments. 

Some establishments try to extend themselves at times with an abundance of menu items and it usually doesn't work out... so when I saw pierogis on the board one day, I refrained but my dining companions didn't. No, they are not the best pierogis but they didn't taste like some menu item that clearly an afterthought or experiment. I probably should have ordered my own. 

Now we come to the meat of it all; the burgers. I stand by my opinion when I Sketch has some of the best burgers in Philadelphia. The meat patty itself is a generous size portion of meat. I like how they are able to cook it to my liking (well), while retaining the juiciness of the meat. Add a topping or two, or more and enjoy prepare yourself for a memorable burger experience.

I was catfishes into attending one of their recruitment seminars. I have adjuster experience from Canada before moving to the United States. They're practically a MLM scam, they want you to provide them with your relatives and contacts to pitch them into having "free reviews" and recruit more members to do the same. The clients are basically thrown to the side and the company takes half of their insurance payout then passes you 20%, your recruiter 5% after their 20th recruit filing of the month. You are required to sign a non-compete... do it right, take the course and apply to a legitimate firm. This will only destroy your family and friendships.

ZERO STARS, REALLY!  Suffered huge loss and looked to Metro to serve as advocate for us in collecting from insurance. They virtually promised us we would get a huge claim. What a colossal joke. They did nothing except string us along, promising more than sufficient compensation, when in reality we got NOTHING from insurance. I'm  glad METRO got NOTHING, too

Coincidentally I stopped into the Subway on Lindell twice in two days. The same two women were working quickly during both lunch rushes. I watched both women be courteous, clean, and speedy as they made these orders. 
I have never, ever seen such abuse by customers on both days as I saw here.
The women maintained their calm and worked professionally in the face of multiple people screaming at them and demanding ridiculous things from a fast food worker. 
No person much less a sandwich maker should ever have to tolerate this behavior.
I tip my hat to these employees and apologize on behalf of humankind. 
Some people need to work on themselves before trying to find therapy by belittling others.

The new ultimate steak sandwich is good too.

I have been coming to Carmelita's for good Mexican food for as long as I can remember. I love, love, love Carmelita's. I've only ever gotten their enchilada's - because they are so delicious! I just can't get past them! The sauces are always so tasty and the chicken is tender and flavorful. I also appreciate that they still provide free chips and salsa. This past visit we were using a living social deal, but we come here without one as well. They run pretty good specials throughout the week and that helps too. I think this is the best Mexican restaurant in St Pete.

I wanted to get braces for a 2nd time back in 2006.  So i visited Dr. Jaws, The DR himself is fine, he wanted to pull some teeth, and I wasn't for that. So I got a 2nd opinion, and have since had braces put on and taken off by another orthodontist, and no teeth needed to be pulled.

The issue I have is that his staff called me at least once a month almost hounding me to commit to them, and schedule and appointment. each time they called I told them No and I wasn't interested, but that didn't stop them.

The food at this location is horrible it's not all pizza huts but this particular location, ordered the dinner box which comes with 2 pizzas, cheesy breadsticks, mini Cinnabons, and chicken Alfredo pasta. Sausage pizza was just ok, pepperoni pizza was awful and dried out, Cinnabon minis was hard and over cooked and not edible. Chicken Alfredo taste was there but noodles partially covered in sauce other half dry. Cheesy breadsticks were the only thing that were good, severely disappointed paid $37 they forgot to give me marina for the breadsticks wasn't sure if it was supposed to come with it so I called not once but twice and was left on hold both times I found out later that It was supposed to come with marinara sauce, never again, I ordered this box from a different location New Year's Eve it was so good and I thought I ordered from the same place but accidentally ordered from here, never, never again.

Went on Saturday with an appointment for my twin sister and was highly disappointed. The lady working with her rushed the entire experience and process of trying on gowns. It was uncomfortable seeing her constantly look at her watch and when we wanted my twin to try on a dress from earlier, the lady said she was "out of time". While trying dresses on, her comments were "you have time to try on about two more dresses". Didn't make it a memorable experience for such an exciting and important day for the bride to be. Sadly, I wouldn't recommend this place based off the service regardless what dresses they have to offer.

Close it down! As I was waiting (for awhile) on my order, a roach was crawling all over the counter near the restates, near the kitchen! It's unfortunate, I crave a whopper every so often and every location in St. Pete is dirty and the service is always so slow. There's staff there but they seem to be on vacation. I don't recommend!

What a great find!  It's small but bright, clean & sweetly decorated. This is a place with lots of regulars so you know it must be good. Service was friendly and fast. We came Sunday at 8:30 for breakfast & it was already bustling. They also do lunch Mon-Sat 11-2. Breakfast all day every day. Coffee was good & they leave you the pot. I had a combo w/eggs, ham (which they make & sell for holidays), wheat toast & pancakes. The pancakes were great - fluffy but golden & crispy on the outside. Best of all, the butter is room temp so it's actually spreadable!  Hubby had homemade biscuits & gravy - very good. Bacon is finished off in the oven so nice & crisp. They also have specials. Portions were large & prices low, yet quality high. Will def be back!

Mountain lions, prairie dogs and bears, OH MY!

These are just some of the things you will see at the Arizona Sonora Desert Museum. 

Don't miss: 

The prairie dog exhibit  - if you have small kids they will love trying to get these cute little guys to pose for a pic.

The hummingbird aviary - these amazing little winged things look tiny, but according to docents, don't get too close to their nest, or they will attack. I don't think I would want to stick around for that.

Our very own Sonoran Desert flora and fauna nestled against the natural backdrop of the beautiful Tucson Mountains. It's definitely a place we take for granted that's right in our own backyard. Naturally, you spend a lot of time outdoors, walking. Plan your visits seasonally, because deserts can be, well, hot, during the summer months.

I'd give ZERO stars if possible.  They left a door tag under my condo door, the tracking number is illegible.  The QR code goes to a website in Chinese, and the location to pick up the package is blank.  I've emailed and they want a phone number to track the package.  I believe this is an Amazon package and I've verified my Amazon account has no phone number - so I don't know how they'll track with a phone number.  They quite responding.  I'm not sure I'll ever get my package.  Also, I was home when they left the tag - there was no knock at my door. They did not buzz my unit to get entry to the condo.  The time is wrong on the door tag, and the location I can pick up my package is blank. Terrible customer service.

I don't live anywhere near this new location, but I was in the neighborhood today so I consulted Yelp! for the location and made an effort to drop in. The location in the strip mall meant plenty of parking. When I visited there were only a few folks inside, all on computers so I assume the wifi works well. 

Service was fast and friendly. They offer a standard coffee and espresso menu and baked goods as well. I decided to put them to the ultimate test and just ordered a cup of black coffee. Paid my $2.25 and was handed a cup; there were two blends of coffee to choose from - serve yourself. I asked which was the lighter blend and was told the Ethiopian. Gave it a try and it was simply delicious. Exceeded my expectations. 

They offer a new way to brew coffee I've never seen before, something called a siphon. It was not cheap - $7.25, but is supposed to produce several cups of coffee. I asked the guy about it and he explained how it worked. Got me so curious that the next time I am in the area I will stop in and give it a try. 

Great produce and service. Highly recommend!

I ventured here for restaurant week with some co-workers and I have to say- I can't wait to go back! The space was beautiful and the staff was wonderfully attentive! I'm always hesitant about trying a place during because I hear from my service friends that it's PIA for them but it was probably one of the best services I've had in a while!  We chatted at the bar for while and then finally seated off in an enclosed dining space. The 6 ounce filet was presented beautifully and the portion was delicious. I'm going to be picky and say that I wanted my steak a 'cool' rare but it arrived to the table as a warm rare- not the end of the world but I thought a steak house would have gotten it right! 
Our server Jason was very attentive and knew when to check on and when to give us time to chat Kingston ourselves! My co-worker got the salmon and it was a piece of art! I really want to come back  and try their Sunday brunch- there are so many choices on the menu- I can't wait to try them out!

Overall, your experience at any given Starbucks mainly depends on the quality of any given barista that may make your order; the food and drinks are consistently pretty darned good across any of the chain's locations that you may visit. And for this first visit, my greet tea Frappuccino is as delicious as any that I have gotten before at other Starbucks.

So let's talk about what is unique about this particular Starbucks location.

Starbucks moved to this much more spacious location, formerly a nice Cosi, from the smaller one it had across the street at 1201 Walnut. Starbucks leveled the entire floor, from the step-up dining area that the former Cosi had. This is a great location within Philadelphia's bustling "Gayborhood", through which a lot of customers funnel throughout the day.

There is plenty of space to move around within the restaurant, which actually is the one big fault I have of it. There is not an ample amount of seating here, especially when you take the cavernous size of available space here into consideration. Starbucks could easily seat many more people, if it bought more tables & chairs to reconfigure a denser dining area. I was here just before the dinner hour on a Sunday, and I was lucky someone moved so I could have a seat.

The restroom area is sizable, and interesting that each restroom does not have sinks inside them - the hand-washing sink area is on the outside of each restroom. It's a pretty cool setup, until you consider that you will be touching other people's urine and feces on the door handle when you exit the room. Having the sinks on the outside of the restroom is fine, if you have door-less walk-in restrooms (which this location does not have). So there's that.

There doesn't seem to be any outdoor seating, and the weather has been nice for the past few weeks that this location has been open. Cosi used to have to deal with a lot of less desirable types of people lingering with its outdoor seating; perhaps Starbucks just doesn't want to deal with that element at all, by forgoing outdoor tables and chairs?

Otherwise, Starbucks should be applauded for moving to this larger location. It should allow greater amounts of people to get in and out quicker.

This is tied for the best service we had in NOLA. We sat at the bar and just had drinks and an appetizer which were great. The bartenders were very attentive and conversational. They made sure we were not missing anything.
The food and drinks are amazing. Try the calamari. You will be amazed. Also had the full sized lobster roll and Seafood Pasta. Filling and hits the spot.

food isn't bad but when I was sitting there with a friend a girl walked up to me and shoved my bill in my face. She was not my waitress and I wasn't done eating. Then she stood over me and waited for me to finish. When I told her I wasn't done eating she was upset and stormed off. She came back with my dessert I asked for then stuck the ticket back in my face. Her attitude really made me wonder why I came at all. I live in walking distance but this is one place I won't be walking to anytime soon...

Have been following on instagram for awhile and just had to get in to try. Took a friend for taco Tuesday and amongst us got one each of the taco varieties. They were soooo good. Service was great. This is a small location and seats only about 4 or so people. 

Oh almost forgot the chips and guacamole which I would drive by and pick up alone. 

Going back in a few weeks with friends to try something new.

A solid 3/5. Came because we had never been and had no idea what we wanted to eat. Bucket of beer was $10, normal pricing. We weren't going to eat because the reviews we saw here on Yelp but did the ultimate nachos. Really good nachos, Hormell chili, melted cheese, tomatoes, lettuce and some chicken. I was worried to be honest about the quality but they were good, no complaints from me or my wife. So we said screw it and ordered food. She got the mushroom Swiss burger, frozen burger a little lite on mushrooms but it was good for bar food. I got the chicken tenders and they were fine. The chips were really good. The waitress was really good with keeping the table clean and being very prompt with service. We got here at like 5:30 and within an hour people just came pouring in for poker. So far everyone has been fine, no crazy drunks lol. We were talking about coming back and we will. Overall 3/5 will be back at a later night to see if everything stays the same. Bucket of beer, entree, and two meals was only $38.

Best museum I've ever been too. Architecture was amazing, seeing the progression of Dali's art from young to old was insanely cool. All the staff was super helpful. By far the best cafe on site as well. Fun watching boats and planes leave from garden.

For me this is better than average Chinese fast food. Honey garlic chicken and chili eggplant are my go to dishes here. Price has gone up in the past year, but where hasn't it. Good food and fast service.

Mediocre food + awful service = first and last visit to this establishment

The hostess simply stared at us when we walked in the door instead of saying something along the line of, "Hello and welcome to Timothy's." This should have been a red flag to turn around and leave immediately, but we had never been here and figured we'd give them a chance. Then it was as if she were required to solve a calculus equation before she were able to seat us in the nearly empty restaurant-she seemed befuddled. 

Once seated, we waited, for a loooong while. While we waited, a couple of servers waited on their respective tables, but wouldn't dare make eye contact or answer my calls for assistance. Only once I went to the hostess and told her to get someone to our table did a server appear. We had our server take our drink and food order since we had had plenty of time to make our decisions. 

Our drinks were brought out and as other customers filtered in, we watched as the other servers brought their tables complimentary nacho chips with their drinks. Fortunately, one of the other servers asked if we were doing okay and I suggested we would like some chips while we waited or our food, to which she acted surprised we had not been offered. Then we also noticed the other customers had been provided linen napkins with their utensils while we had paper napkins (not a big deal on any other day, but by this time every little thing felt like a slight). 

When our food arrived, mine came with a side other than what I had requested. I pointed this out to our server and she said she would be right back. Well, the side I had originally requested (macaroni and cheese) arrived by the time I had finished my sandwich, so I guess her idea of "right back" is a bit different than mine. The food was mediocre at best.

Then, we had completed our meal and waited about 10 minutes or longer before our server reappeared. No check-in from her during our meal, just a visit after a rather extended period of time after dropping off my corrected side dish. We immediately asked for our check right away before we were delayed any longer and had a chance to become more angry. 

I do not recommend this restaurant and am disappointed this relatively new establishment will probably not survive long if their service and food does not markedly improve.

What a great little bar!!  It was a little hard to find but it's right next to Coop's place.

We came in late on a Sunday and the place was pretty empty except the bar filled up after a while.

The cocktails are unique, the mixologists serious about their craft and mood was easy and laid back.

You can have any drink served in a pineapple for $5.

We throughly enjoyed our time here. The drinks were great, we will be back.

There are almost no words for how lovely Lark is and our experience there but I will give it a shot. First of all, after frequenting the Landing Kitchen many a time, the location is great for anyone either on the Main Line or in NW Philly and not far for anyone father flung to get to. There is ample parking and in the daylight it's a cool place to walk around and hang our. Lark is on the the top floor of the Residence Inn and there is a private elevator to get there.

The decor in the restaurant is lovely and it's spacious enough that, for someone who has only had a handful of indoor dining experiences in the pandemic, I felt comfortable (all staff was masked). 

But the main event - the food - is the stuff dreams are made of. We had 4 small courses, 1 pasta course, 1 main, 1 dessert, and 2 drinks between 2 people and spent $100 pp including tax and tip which for a nice night out is very reasonable. What we had:

Gnotto Fritto - Basically a savory donut with ricotta and prosciutto, it was diving.
Red Snapper tartare - So good with the fried sunchokes on it.
Burrata with beets - Even I, a non beet lover, enjoyed a decent amount of this.
Devilled Eggs - So, so good also I, a non olive lover, loved the tapenade on the top.

Squid Ink Pasta - OMG so like, homey but also so upscale and tasty which is a rare Venn diagram of amazing.

Duck Breast -  Perfectly cooked and seasoned.

Coffee Budino - A delight, perfect to share.

I feel the need to make my next reservation ASAP and figure out the babysitter + scheduling later because it was so good. We will definitely be back!

I've been wanting to give Banh Mi Boys a try for a while, so I was really excited about this elite event.

I placed my order by phone at around 4:30 and was so bummed to find that they were out of all of the starters except  for the crab rangoons. I was hoping to try their spring rolls, but I guess it wasn't in the cards.  The rangoons were a hit with my crew.

I chose the rib banh mi as my perk, and ordered a couple of grilled pork banh mi's for my daughter and husband. The  rib banh mi was my favorite by far. And their bread is amazing.

This is a cute space on the side of a service station, so it might be easy to miss it. I'm so glad this Elite Perk was available because now I know exactly where they are and will make my way back again.  

I think I've heard that they are opening another location on Magazine.  I can't wait.

Thanks Banh Mi Boys and Tomas for a really nice perk!

Completely COVID-19 compliant! 
Our server Jerry was fantastic! Such a personality!!!! Made us feel right at home and like we were long lost friends. I really enjoyed my grilled Grouper tacos and Hubby loved his Local Caught fresh Fresh blacken Grouper dinner. 
Location is great, right on the harbor, fun to watch all the boats pull in to enjoy cocktails and food. Did not feel touristy despite being in the heart of it!

Love love this little nail salon in my hood. Laquita is a miracle worker - I routinely offer her sad little nubbins of nails and she transforms them into cute little nubbins of nails. Nice atmosphere and very clean.

Man does this place piss me off. The thought of stepping in here makes me mad. This is my neighborhood grocery store and I have lived in neighborhoods with small grocery stores like this Safeways size, but never screw over their customers like this Safeway. +$3.70 for a gallon of milk? Only stocking the fanciest (most expensive) of ingredients?! Where are the affordable staples? Come on. Just makes me so mad to even have to make a last minute run here. Cashier service is great. Accessibility is awesome, but the dilapidated building stocked with the most expensive inventory to squeeze it's customers of $$ rather than stocking with affordable staples to ensure I return constantly is just really bad business.

Nestor was amazing! I called him to come and give me a quote and he got back to me really quickly and came out to do the job within a week . He refinished my limestone countertop and it looks  incredible its much better then I imagined and you can tell he really takes pride in what he does. He made sure I was happy with the job and even took the time to send me a thank you letter in the mail, I will highly recommend him to all my friends and family and use him in the future if I need to!

Food is ok but has no spice or real flavor. It is obviously catering to a specific type of white person that lives in this area. Bland flavorless food with mediocre service. Depending on the day you will find the staff less than friendly. We all have bad days but it seems they're just bitchy a lot. Definitely don't consider this Mexican food but more of a white man's TexMex.

Love this restaurant! The food is flavorful and interesting, but not too fussy.  My husband and I happened to find this little gem on a night when they were having a trivia contest.   Our waitress was terrific, friendly and caring.  The customers were having a blast.  They have a glass display case full of Bavarian Chocolates that ship in from Europe so that's yummy. There is a full service bar with TV / sports. It was festive during the holidays too, which was fun (Halloween & Christmas).  Good place to go for a date or family dinner.  For some reason this place is able to combine different crowds and it works great!  Outdoor dining available.  Whenever we place a to go order they have it ready in about 20 mins.   Coming back with friends on Trivia night because people have so much fun doing it.  I think you can win prizes too!

Nice little Mediterranean joint. Atmosphere is bright with very clean lines and comfortable cafe seating. A great place for people watching.  I stopped in as soon as they opened for a quick lite lunch. I ordered Hummus and Babaganoush. Both came with fresh warm pita wedges in ample supply. Paired with nicely brewed iced tea. Service was fast and courteous.
Recently got lash extensions from Sharon and I love them! They are exactly what I asked for and were fairly priced. Not to mention, she is incredibly nice which made the whole experience better :)

We got the POG and the brown butter donuts. The icing was tasty and the donuts looked pretty but the donuts tasted old. We got there at 830am and expected fresher tasting donuts than we got. They tasted like they were a day old, dry , tough to chew and not fluffy like a raised donut should be . Major disappointment. My wife's stomach was pretty much messed up until the next day.

I love that this hotel is not labeled as such from the outside.  When you pull up, it's somewhat confusing as you think you've arrived to the wrong location.  There is no label outside at all to let you know you're at the right place.
However, once inside the beautiful courtyard, you see the check in desk and the staff is friendly and helpful.  We were even able to check in 2 hours early!  We had #4 which was first floor level and so very nicely decorated!  
The hotel is quiet which is a MUST in New Orleans!  It is close enough to the action of Bourbon Street and shopping on Royal, but nestled just a few blocks away that you're not right in the heat of things.  Perfection!
The 2 complaints I have is that 1-the AC could not keep up.  We had it cranked to 66 and it never got below 70 in our room.  Not terrible but after both of us had showered, it was like a sauna/rainforest in here for a few hours which sucked. 2-The front desk has funky hours.  It seemed like every time we had a question that nobody was around.  They do leave a number to call but when you just need a piece of tape for example, you're not going to call and bother someone for it.
Anyway, if you are staying one night or 6, I would definitely recommend this place!  It's beautiful, safe and quiet.
Even though they're website and door to the restaurant says they are open all afternoon. At 3pm, a group of us were told that they were closed until 4:30.
I find this to be a wonderful store of great choices and helpful personnel! Their clothing is just a little different from what u would find in a department store. They have fantastic jewelry also!

I would come to this Toyota dealership often cause I trusted them with my Toyota & not this current oil change but the one before they said next time i'm gonna need a part on the driver side by the engine & engine filter but I went a week ago to get my current oil change & they said I needed none of that which is odd (figured they were money hungry) & they gave me a list of what my car "needs" (pictures) & they said my brakes need changing & that they were 3mm & in critical condition (they lied I got them checked & they were 6mm) & cabin air filter doesn't need a change yet cause it's still white, they lied & the rest of the inspection too, they tried getting money from me & thought I was naïve. never trusting this dealership again or recommending this dealership unprofessional & fraudulent. I also 
called the service manager & I told him about every & said he was gonna call back & never did. Be careful with these scammers never trusting again

How are you going to call yourself the "vegan Butcher" and have meat on the menu. It was super disappointing to get there and find out that you have to pay extra for the food to be vegan.

The banh mi was ok, but overall the aforementioned facts made this overall a regrettable experience. Maybe don't false advertise with your name so people don't get dissatisfied when they get there and find out the name represents something far from the truth.

There is a First Watch restaurant in the area we live and it's always packed. We were here in Florida on vacation and decided to give this Largo location a try. Glad we did! The staff were warm and helpful, and the food is great.

Walked in here for a pickup order just now. One employee was very loudly cleaning the fountain machine, and when the other employee asked her to ring up a customer, she threw off her gloves with an attitude and stomped behind the counter... After never notifying me before I show up to pick up the food, they tell me after waiting 15 minutes in the restaurant that there is an hour wait for chicken. 

One hour wait for chicken? At Boston market? Lmao get your act together. Maybe not wait till your chicken runs out before you put your next batch In. Poorly managed and awful customer service.  


Edit: the person at the register never even cancelled my order. I had to reach out to the area director to get my refund.

Ever been to a 7 Eleven?  If you answered yes, then I'll tell you that this is the exact same experience........but instead of sign that says "7 Eleven", it says "WaWa's".  And that's all I have to say about that.

Great new Italian spot! Here for soft open they we doing very well.  I tried the lasagna and garlic bread. The lasagnas was great only suggestion would be cut the salt in the added dark red sauce it was way too much. The taste would shine through even better with a lighter hand on the salt in that sauce. Complementary bread and Olive oil. was delicious I also ordered the Italian bread on the side which had cheese on it as well it too was very good! They have  wine on tap and bottled. Mamma said "Friends really are like macaroni if they're not warm they are not good!! " They are good and I hope to eat here often! Bakery counter look delicious and they also have gelati!

Do not go here!  This gym is shady, unprofessional and hustled me.  When I tried to cancel my membership (because the conditions of the gym are dirty, maskless, overcrowded and unsanitary), I was told if I wanted to cancel, I had to pay for an entire year up front in order to "buy out."  This was never communicated to me when I signed up for a monthly membership. It's a racket, and I've received better customer service from the likes of Comcast. Avoid this place and find somewhere that values their customers.

The Collision Center at Jim Browne Chevrolet is without a doubt the worst business I have every dealt with. I am totally understanding of changes to a completion estimate, it happens. My repairs were at a standstill for a back-ordered part. When asked, they had no idea when it would arrive. All it took was a 10 minute call from my adjuster; he found the part IN STOCK at a local dealer, as well as at least one other source The parts department at Jim Browne clearly failed to even make the effort to get the part. I am NOT forgiving of poor communications. They were to make status calls twice a week, which is right in their paperwork. They never did so until it was brought to the managers attention the poor job that was being done. Every time I had to call for any information, but more than 1/2 the times, the call was not returned and I had the call again or ended up having to drive to the shop just to know how my repairs were coming. In the recoating of a damaged wheel someone failed to even notice the poor work. It was clear as day the second I saw it. So my adjuster agreed to my refusal and approved a new wheel. The wheel was delivered, yet they were unable to complete it in an afternoon. Was told the next morning, still not done. So to mount and balance a tire has taken over 10 actual hours but it is still not done. Given their poor communications, I called to see if the vehicle was done. Yes, the receptionist claimed. But then as I am getting ready to leave I get a call back saying your car is still not done. The manager seems to be solid there, just needs to fix these issues as it was very unprofessional.

I stopped in this little store to get lunch. 

I was  surprised I spent $10 on vegetables and rice. But I have to say it was the most generous portion, and the best healthiest meal I've ordered in a long time. 

So my apologies for making a comment about the price to the staff, and I will be back! 

Good job!

My wife and I contacted Mike to find out what options we had for refinancing our home loan.  He provided everything in a simple to understand presentation and we never felt pressured to go in any particular direction.  Once we decided on the option that worked best for us, he took the time to walk us through everything we needed to complete our refinance.  The software system they used was easy to navigate and made delivering the paperwork seamless.  He stayed in constant contact with us all the way up to the time our loan funded.  If you are looking for help with a loan, Mike is your guy.

I stopped by for lunch here while I was out shopping in the Keystone Crossing area. It's a very convenient and quiet location. Most Thai restaurants I go to are culturally decorated in Thai decor, but this place surprised me with a very rustic chic ambiance. It had comfortable booth seating options, nice sturdy tri-fold menus, nicely folded cloth napkin utensils, American pop music playing and a bar counter with wooden bar stools. All of these aspects make for a closer fine dining experience which is not as prominent with Ethnic restaurants in Indiana. I'm very excited to see that they are moving towards this and are proving that they can provide a fine dining experience as well. 

I ordered the Yum Wun Sen salad with shrimp. If you are a salad lover and want something a bit different, I would definitely give this a shot! There are onions, cucumbers, tomatoes, and silver noodles mixed with a sweet and sour sauce. The only thing I didn't like about the dish was that they did not remove the shell off the tail of the shrimp. 

Glad I happened to run into this restaurant while out shopping and will run into it on purpose next time!

The only place I'll go! Staff is friendly and engaging. The owner and a few of the staff always ask how my Mom, who moved 6 months ago (and drives over an hour to keep coming here) is doing. 

Mani/pedi combo is $40. Pedicure amenities include a heel treatment, calf massage, and hot stones . Manicures can't be beat. They do a quick back massage with hot stones while you're nails dry. 

Do yourself a favor and add some kindness and pampering to your regular pedi or mani!

Artisans has great customer service and it was our first stop when we were shopping for a print to finish off our office decor because what else is there to do during a pandemic besides making the home office more livable. 

They made us feel safe while we shopped and adhered to all the rules to keep everyone socially distant and well. 

We ended up purchasing a red Aussie print and thought to go back downtown to pick it up once it arrived at the store, but we forgot it. They were nice enough to text us...and we forgot again as it was near Thanksgiving...so they texted us again...and we forgot a third time...and a fourth time.

After being patient with us since October (Thank you Jeni!) we finally were able to pop-in and get our print. When I walked-in I told them who I was and they immediately said, "You have the red Aussie print!"  Indeed, I had finally came to claim my purchase after three months.

Great store, friendly staff, unique products. We stop by whenever we are on Mass Ave...just not as often as we'd have liked in the past three months. :-)

Warm, gooey cookies when you want 'em.
Insomnia comes to my rescue when it's past the time Rittenhouse bakeries close, but my sweet tooth yearns.  I can vouch for the double chocolate chunk and s'mores.

Only downside is I find these cookies to be just average when they're cold.  So do eat them soon after you buy.

Probably one of the best car washes and detail places in the Brandon/Tampa Bay area they offer many type of packages for your car, truck and SUV. The guys and ladies are very nice and friendly which is nice to see if you see any problems that exist please tell the guys or ladies about the issue and they will fix it they can't fix the problem/issue if they don't know what's wrong after car wash or detail. 

I've used many different car wash/detail places in the area I am happy with Florida Car Wash I am happy to say that. I take my Truck and other vehicles to get it cleaned and detailed.  They do a very good job on the vehicles that come to get washed and cleaned to make them look brand new again.  You can't go wrong with Florida Car Wash!

I've only been to Ruby Slipper on two occasions. The food was good both times but was particularly memorable the second. The waits here are indeed long. It's probably justified depending on how you order, so order well and maybe you won't mind it so much. Put your name on the list and go for a walk. If you just want biscuits and gravy...eh, it may not be worth the wait. 

Let's talk about the bananas foster French toast. This was the best French toast I've had in my life. I had BFFT at another establishment a day or two later and it was also very good. But it was better at Ruby Slipper. I think my only issue with it was that they use baguette for the bread, which has a high crust ratio. So even with all the rum syrup/sauce, it can be kinda hard to cut. But this is me being a little bit nit picky. If you've got your heart set on sweet, it's worth the wait for this French toast. Shoot, it's worth a another trip to Nola for this French toast. Oh, but get the pig candy too. So flippin' good.

Such friendly staff. Had the best sandwich maker ever- so personable. Soda machine was out of Mountain Dew and Dr. Pepper and dining area needed some attention but I'd return just for that friendly face.

The bar is Christmas themed. I got the Grinch shot and another drink in a Santa boot. Paid about 35-40 bucks for both and that's including the tip I added for the bartender. Both drinks were very sweet not enough to get you tipsy. If you're looking for a fun place to meet your friends to start the night Tinsel is it. The staff was friendly and the holiday chair was the perfect instagram photo spot. If you're worried about Covid no one wears masks inside. It's very crowded on the weekend and they do check to confirm everyone has been vaccinated. Better late than never but happy holidays.

I'm visiting Reno, and everyone told me that I had to try the Awful Awful, and how good it was, and everyone suggested the Nugget since it the original home of the Awful Awful. It didn't disappoint, the burger was really good. The burger was pretty big but manageable, the meat was really juicy, the bun was fluffy. This place is great to go with friend and just grab to grubs.

This is probably the best Thai restaurant in Brandon (not the best that I've tasted in my life though). I've tried a few, and this one never dissapoints when it comes to flavor. Their spice is very hot, so I always get it on the side and add it myself. The owner and cook is very kind, and everyone who comes in there are practically regulars because she stops to talk to them. They also all know each other by name. This can make a new customer feel a little out of place, so to speak. I've been here three times, and she or anyone else in the restaurant have tried to have that personable customer service interaction.

My last visit wasn't so pleasant. I called to place a to go order a few minutes before 8pm. I was told 45 minutes my food would be ready, and that they close at 9pm. I was already en route to the restaurant, so I arrived maybe around 8:20pm. When I got there, there were two people waiting for orders to go, and there was a table of four already seated. There were two employees there. The cook (owner) and a waitress. The waitress was taking the money from one customers to go order and I was next in line. When it was my turn to pay, she said she would be right with me. She then went to go take the order for the table of four that was seated. No biggie, since I knew my order probably wasn't ready yet. After I paid, I sat and waited. While I waited, the two others who were before me received their orders and left. There were also two other people who came in while I waited, and received their to go order. AND the table of four received all of their food while I waited! Now remember, they had just placed their order while I was standing in line to pay. At this point my order was already placed almost 30 minutes prior. While I waited, the owner gave me a Thai Tea and said it was on her and she appreciated my patience. She mentioned that she had a call off. However, I feel as though the orders should have been made in the order they were placed. Especially since I called and was already there waiting. Finally my order was ready around 9:15pm. This was 15 minutes after closing.

This most recent experience put a bad taste in my mouth regarding this restaurant. Since the owner knew all of the other patrons, it seemed like their orders had preference. This method won't last long with new customers.

I traveled a lot I mean a lot for work , and some towns you look forward to and some well whatever .
I always look forward to certain towns because of the food and new orleans is one of them of course, 
 with the work I used to do it was do a show all day and then entertain clients at night, most of the time the clients are from out of town or even out of the country and have no idea where to go have a great meal , so it is up to me to find great spots to eat , ( and of course act like I am a regular) 
Well this is one of my go to places when in town to take clients to, and the clients are always impressed ALWAYS

The best deal for your dollar!

I have enjoyed a turkey hoagie and a cheesesteak from Carmen's and they were both great.

-Easy to order either on the phone on in store with friendly service
-Great prices
-The sandwiches taste great
-Quality bread
-The sandwiches are filled generously with ingredients (ie. meats, cheeses, no filler toppings)

Brian and the crew make such great looking creations. No disappointed deliveries to recipients of the arrangements. The deliveries completed on time keeps customers happy and coming back. It feels good having and seeing a local business growing.
I like this place, you can drink and have even more fun when you leave by hitting downtown. I usually come here about once a month, always an enjoyable time.

A gem of Tampa. You can get a taste of the Cuban culture that has helped mold Tampa and Ybor City. This place has hands down the best Cuban sandwich I've ever had (I've had many for comparison). The cafe con leche was delicious. My wife had a breakfast sandwich that was also delicious. We grabbed a rice pudding to enjoy later and it didn't disappoint.

Dan was honest and reasonable for me when I took my car to get inspected. I don't drive much and they were slammed with business so it took a few days turnaround but that was totally fine with me. Planning on going back as needed as its also very close to my home.

This hotel was great! Staff was on point at all times, very friendly, approachable and readily available. The rooms were clean, roomy and we had 2 adults and 3 children in our party and we didn't feel cramped at all. Bed was super comfortable, bathroom was roomy with plenty of hot water for all of us to shower and take our time. Breakfast was very good, well organized and staff kept food buffet areas full and in good rotation. We will stay here again.

The amenities try very hard to be a 10, but the basic rooms themselves are arguably about a 3. For one, they are STARTLINGLY small. It appears as though they took a standard room and cut it in half. The depth is normal, the width is not. It's genuinely difficult to maneuver between the bed & the dresser with the TV on it due to how narrow the room is. The bed itself was nice, big and soft, but was also covered with what appeared to be tiny pieces of styrofoam? They were circular, about the size of the head of a pin, and the same color as the bedding, so it was impossible to see until my significant other and I woke up COVERED in them. 

Speaking of waking up- we were jolted awake very early by what sounded like construction of some kind? It was an EXTREMELY loud buzzing/vibrating that I took for a chainsaw or hedgeclipper, but as we saw nothing outside, my SO suggested maybe it was some kind of pump issue above us? Whatever the case, I wear earplugs, so it's hard to wake me up unless it's something VERY disturbing, which this was. Our #1 itinerary for the day had been to sleep in, which was unfortunately shot to hell. 

There were also some issues with the restroom...it was tiny, the door was very tough to close, and there was a lingering...odor. I ran the fan and tried to air it out, but there was a distinct, underlying "outhouse" smell that made it difficult for me to even stomach being in there for the ~10 mins each day that it took to shower.  

Basically, I would recommend this hotel if money is NO object. If you can upgrade to a larger room, get an ocean view, pay the exorbitant prices for good food/spa treatment/beach equipment, you should! But if you're trying to be at all frugal, skip this place and get a Holiday Inn or somewhere that is just a room, at a reasonable price, and explore St. Pete's that way. 

I'm still leaving this review as an above-average because there were nice aspects (like the bathrobes! Mmmm) and amidst the staff that seemed insanely stressed there were ones who obviously valued customer service. The Don is within reach of being great, but unfortunately, it has fallen short.

This has been a staple of my Reno nights out since I moved here a year and a half ago! It reminds me of Death & Taxes but larger, brighter and less stuffy. 

The cocktails are very tasty and change with the seasons. I've yet to have a disappointing one yet whether it's the winter hot coffee cocktails or a classic old fashioned. 

The seating is somewhat limited with a few long tables and the seating at the bar. On busy nights, it can be a pain to squeeze in at the bar to get a cocktail. But I suppose that's the case at any popular bar and a choice people make when they seat there. People will order over you. ‍

There is outdoor seating on both sides of the bar which provides additional space. In summer, they'll open the garage door and let the fresh air which I enjoy. 

If you're visiting Reno, this is a must visit bar in my opinion!

We were actually looking for a different Japanese restaurant when we found Volcano. I was unsure...There's been some nasty reviews for this place.

We had a near perfect experience, from the rich, flavorful tea to the clean and but quirky washrooms, which have a pretty laser radio thingy in the mirror and stalls the size of airplane bathrooms.

We split a bento box, had a couple salads and sashimi, and all were delicious. The sashimi was sooooo fresh. It was well chilled and like silk on my tongue, exactly how I like it.

Service was fantastic! Paige was friendly and efficient. Our tea and water stayed filled. It was just one of those dining experiences where everything went right. We'll be back.

I REALLY hate to do this because my husband and I love(d) Sabrina's. We arrived around 10am and were seated immediately - which is great because Sabrina's is typically packed with a wait. So we sat, and sat, and sat. Maybe 15 minutes had passed and not one single person acknowledged us. I understand that a lot of businesses are short-staffed, but as I looked around at the not-so-busy restaurant, I began to get frustrated. I would've settled for "someone will be right with you" ... something! I told hubby we would give them 5 more minutes before we left. Well, this lady was sat at the table behind us, and she was greeted IMMEDIATELY! At this point I was done, so we grabbed our things and we left. The woman who was working the front and who sat us, cheerfully said "bye, have a nice day" as if she didn't just see us walk in. Wouldn't you have wondered why we were leaving so abruptly??? Hubby caught the manager on the way out and expressed our disappointment. He (the manager) apologized and asked us if we wanted to sit back down, and we politely declined. We're now dining at Minella's - which is crowded and we've already been seated & served! 

P.S. Sabrina's is BYOB - I bought 2 bottles of champagne (not for nothing), but I'm annoyed nonetheless. K thanks!

Yesterday had my front windshield replaced.  I was very very pleased with the service I received.  My appointment was at 2:30 and I was done by 4.  It was not super long at all.  They changed the windshield, cleaned out the car, and did everything very very well.  I paid for this myself and it was only $219 for this service!  I cannot begging to say the great job they did on my car.  

In the waiting room we were greeted, taken out by our technician, talked to about the procedure and we got the job done!  It was quick and easy and they even steeped the floors!  My car looks better now than it has ever looked!  I highly recommend this place to anyone needing full replacement or just a chip fixed!
