Great burger and fries. Had a burger with cheddar and green chili. Fries are good. Small place but nice atmosphere. The manager was nice . She was very friendly and helpful

If you're looking for a unique menu well located on Mass. Ave. downtown, I would definitely head to MESH. It has been open for quite some time now and all the times I've been I've always left impressed. 

The menu items are nothing boring and they specific labels for the menu items such as vegan, vegetarian, and so on. You can ask you waiter in other dishes can be made vegan and they are always super good with going and asking the chef. This is highly appreciated by anyone that has a dietary preference and/ or restriction.  

The menu prices are slightly high but that's usual for all of the restaurants located on Mass. Ave. My option is that this restaurant is a little more fine dining than some of the other restaurants on Mass. Ave. 

Parking can sometimes be tricky to find so make sure to plan accordingly. 

I ordered the curry that was marked as vegan on the dish and WOW, I was delighted. The dish was filled with absolutely stunning vegetables of all colors and the sauce paired perfected. I wouldn't have described the dish as a "curry" dish though in which it didn't taste much like an Indian or Thai dish. 

I believe their menu may change every so often ( I'm not positive on this though). 

However it seems this always have vegan and vegetarian options that are far from boring.

We spent our first dinner in New Orleans at Cafe Sbisa and it did not disappoint! Definitely make a reservation as this place is fairly popular and for good reason. While the restaurant has an upscale classic decor, the vibe is laid back- live jazz and authentic New Orleans flavor packed into every dish. We started with the crab cakes which were phenomenal! The best crab cakes I have ever had! I had the Courtbullion for an entree- it's a spicy seafood stew served with rice and was so memorable! I have never had anything quite like it- and it was delicious! My best friend ordered the fish of the day- which was a filled red fish over jumbo asparagus. She loved it! The service and the food were a highlight of our visit. We will definitely recommend this place and hope to be back during our next visit to New Orleans

Not really a good experience at all. As far as the service I felt as if every other table was getting checked on periodically except our table. We were the only minorities in the restaurant so not sure if it had to do with that or not. We had to flag down our waitress for everything. Our water was empty for 15 minutes, my friends wanted another drink but by the time the waitress actually came to our table she didn't even want one anymore. Our waitress literally would check on the tables across from us every five minutes and walk directly past ours not even looking our way. We watched her do this several times and finally had to wave to get her attention. 

As far as food it was a limited menu, and despite being hungry I barely ate - the food was not good at all. We ordered buffalo chicken dip which was literally huge chunks of chicken way to big to even put on a chip. I also got the impossible burger and literally I have had plenty of those and I am pretty sure it was not an impossible burger, more tasted like a regular veggie burger. So the only thing I ate was the fries. I understand they just opened back up due to Covid but also feel like if you are going to open your business don't half way do the job, you are doing a disservice to the patrons. 

So no I won't be back because I did not receive nearly the treatment of the other dinners, and the food was not good.

FYI: the attached pictures are from when I dined over a year ago and the service was good. The most recent visit the food was not presentable at all and not worth a picture.

Party City saves the day, again. One of the best services Party City has to offer is call-ahead ordering Rolf balloons!

I needed a last minute balloon order and called Party City right before they closed on a Monday night. The woman I spoke with was super helpful and my balloons were ready and waiting for me when the doors opened to the store. 

Thank you to the super helpful staff - I'll be back! :)

Sooo impressed with Ceviche's happy hour menu! Came in yesterday and sat in the bar area for HH. Started with Tempranillo, which was really good and only $5 for HH. For apps we order baba ganoush, papas bravas, casa ceviche, and chicken/ham croquettes. Everything was FANTASTIC!!! I was soooo impressed, never having been here before I will definitely be coming back asap! 3 wines, and all those apps totaled $40 for HH #mindblown sooo good! And the service was excellent - the bartender took care of us and she was very efficient and timely. All the food came out super quick and  not all at once which was nice

I liked this place when they was food truck, and visited here on the grand opening day. Today was the third time
I ate bahn mi here and it's still so good. Especially, I love this restaurant because the owner(a guy) is very kind and always welcome customer with big smiles. I might go this place tomorrow again.
I ordered catering for an office lunch and Brakemans delivered a soup kettle and tray of sandwiches. Everyone loved the meal, especially the roasted red pepper soup and roast beef sandwich!

This place is pretty small. When I walked in, I noticed the ambiance right away. It has a very modern atmosphere. Alright, here's the downside to this place. It is quite pricey for Affogato. $8.25 is quite steep for Affogato. AYE, but if you trying to get a good pic for THE SNAP or INSTAGRAM, this is the place to go! It is definitely something worth trying out, but definitely not something I would come to all the time.

This company is NOT requiring its employees to be vaxxed. I know one who's had COVID twice, as recently as New Year's, and she's still allowed to work there. in other words they're allowing her the freedom to infect her fellow employees as well as any customers. Beware. They had to close down and quarantine twice recently probably because of her.

I'll start by saying the hotel is very clean and well kept.  The first night in our room, the refrigerator went out.  It took quite a while to have a new one swapped into the room.  The second night, our television kept cutting out while trying to watch a movie with the kids.  Also, the indoor pool was advertised as heated and it most definitely was not.  The pool was freezing!!  The staff merely said "sorry" when all of these issues were addressed.  That was disappointing.  Also, the valet fee is very expensive.   Overall I would probably stay here again just due to the cleanliness, but service has to step it up.

First time here and was not disappointed.  A quaint little place just off Prytania in uptown. Was greeted at the door by very friendly faces behind the counter. Had questions about the menu and they were very helpful. I chose the Roasted Cauliflower Curry soup with a chicken pesto panini. Perfect for a miserable rainy day like today. The soup was simply delicious and the house made panini bread made the sandwich. Bring a friend when you order it. Definitely enough for 2. 
They also preserve their soups so you can stop by and pick up a jar to take home for dinner. I bought the Fiery Shiitake Mushroom & Barley for tonight. 14$ for a mason jar size. Plenty for two.
Will be returning soon to try more of their menu.

On a hot NOLA day, this place is a savior. Their affogato flight was amazing and was the perfect thing to share so you can enjoy other New Orleans delicacies as well! I also got the banana foster affogato and that was also really yummy  LOVE HOW BEAUTIFUL THE CAFE IS AS WELL!

This place is so worth your money, stomach space, and time! There might be a wait though. We waited 25-30 min on a weekday lunch around the holidays.

The food portions here are absolutely ENORMOUS. One dish is good enough for two people, but the red velvet pancakes are probably good enough for four people. We ordered 4 dishes for 6 people and had so many leftovers :(. I'd recommend 3 dishes for 6.

Red velvet pancakes: sooo good! It's basically like a cake, but not too sweet and the cream cheese filling was a great addition. The pancake was fluffy and filled with melted chocolate chips. It's MASSIVE though, so worth your money.

Steak and Eggs: very good savory choice. Steak was pretty good, scrambled eggs were a little bit disappointing in presentation but didn't taste bad, and spinach was well seasoned. 

Pecan pie French toast: tasted good, but very sweet and dense! I'd recommend only getting one sweet dish because two was overpowering for us. There's essentially a pecan pie stuffed in between two pieces of French toast haha

Cure skillet: macaroni and cheese, brisket, and French fries! I don't eat cheese, but my friends said the macaroni and cheese were "meh", the brisket was really good, and the French fries were alright. 

Overall, great meal and it was so cheap after sharing! We paid around $13 per person after tax and tip and there was still leftover food. Service was fine and interior looked fine as well.

Update:
Due to covid , they closed all gyms  and stopped auto billing.  I appreciate it, it s only fair.

I am so very grateful for all of the care Fishers Veterinary Hospital has given my cat! I have not had one bad experience here and I've been taking my cat here for over a year. The staff is always friendly, will answer any questions you have, and truly adore your pets. They have multiple locations located in the area and they even have Saturday hours! 

I have a Bengal cat and he is the craziest (and coolest) little dude you'll ever meet. Due to his natural instincts he gets into everything and is super active. Whenever I've had an emergency come up Fishers Vet had a bet on-call to help answer my questions and make sure my cat was okay. Recently my cat has decided that I'm not allowed to trim his claws anymore so luckily they're also here to provide services like that too. 

I specifically want to call out Dr. Collins. She has gone above and beyond! My cat was diagnosed with asthma and she did tons of research to find options for us to manage it. Draco and I really appreciate everything that Dr. Collins and the rest of the staff do for us!

This small tavern made for a fun and chill night for my husband and I on his birthday. The bartender was helpful and attentive and the bar food was delicious. They have this dipping sauce that is made in house that I continue to crave! Drink specials, good food, good company!

We stopped here for the hot chicken week burrito. It did not disappoint! The heat was strong but the flavor was still amazing! The restaurant is small.. very small. But in the warmer months there is a lot of outdoor seating. I can't wait to come back and try some tacos.

I cant speak to the sushi since i dont eat it, but the wife seemed to enjoy it and left full and happy. As for me, RAMEN! I had the black garlic ramen and it was fantastic. Huge bowl that is sure to fill up anyone. Maybe my favorite ramen ive had yet. Cant wait to come back and try a different bowl!

So this little gem is focused on improving self-esteem and self-image of all their guests. Every employee greeted us in their store today and were so kind and helpful. The store itself is beautifully lit, decorated and packed full of positive messages, clothing and gifts. One of the staff members explained 10% of all proceeds are donated back to the community to help feed, clothe, educate and shelter kids around the world. What an amazing story and what an amazing store with a great staff!!!

On Saturday evening, one of my dear friends drove from NJ for dinner in the city. We decided to give Porta a try as both of us were in the mood for pizza. We were greeted by a hostess who informed us of the wait time and directed us to the bar. We each ordered one of their signature cocktails- the Red Door and the White Door. The drinks were delicious and before we knew it, our table was ready. We opted to split the Formaggi cheese plate and the 14  1/2 pizza. The cheese plate had a variety of Italian cheeses, however, I would have liked more bread. The 14  1/2 pizza was an excellent recommendation by the waitress, but was a bit spicy so have your water ready! I certainly would dine at Porta again- trendy atmosphere, tasty food, and friendly service.

The Animal Den prides themselves in that they value quality of pet care over everything else. On face value, this image holds up. Overall the facility is clean, and the MAJORITY of the staff treats the pets like their own. However, in the time I have worked there, I have grown all too aware of the selfishness and greed that allows this company to prosper, all thanks to owner Will's prioritization of money over quality of care.

Some of what goes on behind the scenes both makes me uncomfortable as an employee and sorry for our customers and their pets, because when it comes to an extra penny here or there, honesty and quality of care are sacrificed. This is especially the case during holidays/travel seasons, when the owner deliberately overbooks the facility, meaning more pets are in the facility than there are dens to hold them. Your pet may be spending their stay in a small drying den meant for temporarily holding bath dogs, yet you will pick them up believing that your money was going towards your pet staying in one of the actual, full size dens with an indoor and outdoor area.

Worse yet, if your dog is booked for the more expensive Deluxe Suites, it is very likely that they will not be in here at all, but that instead your pet spent their time in the standard kennel or one of the smaller drying dens I mentioned, never to be refunded or even notified. Deluxe suites only holds 4 dogs, but again Will overbooks to the extreme.

I have seen him go as far as 9 dogs over holding capacity.  

The owner goes out of his way to cover this up and puts staff in the uncomfortable situation of deceiving customers. This ranges from "walk their dog around the  outside of the building so it looks like they are coming from the direction of deluxe suites" and "move their dog out into a real den in case the owners ask to come back."

Busy holidays are not the safest time for your pet to board, which is incidentally when most people need to board. Cleaning is often forgone and mistakes are made due to lack of staff, such as dens left dirty with old water because of how quickly dogs are being shuffled in and out.

I strongly advise that you board your pet here with caution, and look into other options.

Always have enjoyed Bella Milanos in Edwardsville and even Springfield. 

We have visited for dinner and lunch since the pandemic.  Haven't has to wait for tables either time. Lucky us. 

Servers at this location aren't as personable as Edwardsville but the food is the same delicious food.

This store always has everything in stock and is covid friendly and clean . My literal favorite meal ever is the sushi burrito from the sushi bar. You are doing it wrong if you go there and don't get it. It has salmon, avocado and some spicy sauce. Sooooo good.

Still awesome.  Normal weekend day, still busy though not as busy as during an event.  The bartender was friendly and helpful, the mussels and fries were delicious and reasonably priced, and we got to try some really delicious things on tap.

I think they have about 12 taps total, plus a decent bottle list.  Anyway, if you're in Philly and you love beer, you've probably heard about this place so you owe it to yourself to stop in.  Parking is kind of rough, street spots only.

Picture this... Rosemary flatbread with whole roasted cloves of garlic, drizzled with olive oil and served hot with a cambozola cheese.  Each bite has you feeling like you have died and gone to heaven!

Forget it, because you are not going to get that here or anything even resembling it.  Oh they do have flatbreads, but they are so boring!

This location is directly across from the Acme that I do my regular grocery shopping at.  I will say, the breakfast sandwich is good and they do crack the eggs to order. I like the Vermont white cheddar and the warm Ciabatta combination.  I do not ever order coffee out, as I am not into anything other than a good cup of coffee or espresso and usually it does not live up to my discriminating taste for a great cup of Joe!

They do have a tasty drink made with  fresh strawberries and organic low-fat vanilla yogurt.  They make their own bagels and offer a variety of flavors and spreads.  They also have a menu of Egg Souffles, I have tried the Spinach and Artichoke once and it was quite good.  It had some zip to it, plus the sweetness of red bell peppers.

They serve quite a few soups and I am not thrilled with their Broccoli -Cheese soup, but the NE Clam Chowder and the Baked Potato soup are good.

I make a lot of sandwiches at home.  I have never been inside of a Quizno's, a Lee's Hoagie House or a Subway.  Maybe because I grew up on famous Sub sandwiches and do not want the let down.  Therefore, I have never had one of their sandwiches, other than the breakfast one.  

I do like the few breads that I have tried, but you have to get there early enough in the day for the fresh, warm loaves.  I love the Stone Mill Rye, with the whole seeds and the Focaccia, sprinkled with sea salt.  My favorite is the Ciabatta, but I do want to try the semolina with the sesame seeds, that would make a great tomato sandwich with some mayo.

The boy across the street works part time at this Panera's and often fills hubby's tummy with their sweets.  He is always thrilled when he knocks on our door!  They offer a variety of salads, which I have yet to try, but I'll be back!.
Hands down the best sushi around. Their specialty rolls are fresh and delicious. The staff is wonderful and attentive, the owner is frequently there and is fabulous

Had a wonderful foot massage at YouCol Nails and Spa. Me and my friends went went to see Philly, on a very hot day. We were tired after walking around so we went in for a quick foot massage. The place was very clean and all social distancing measures were taken. The massage chairs were clean and well sanitized before and after. The ladies were very welcoming and nice. The massage was very good and relaxing. It was great to be out and about after a long time and the nice massage made our day.
Got a new Q8 in 24 hours, staff were very professional and friendly.  Big thanks to Jeffery K. got me the best deal compared to all the other dealerships.

Aaaah the Franklin.  Franklin, Franklin, Franklin.  There are a lot of pluses about the Franklin for sure.  I am a fan of the dark European-ish aesthetic.  Although we were there around 5:30 and it was still light for the two hours we are there.  I could imagine it being spooky dark when it is dark outside.

I love that the bar has the purse hooks. I LOVE that they serve Hemingway Daiquiri and although the first iteration was a little bit of a bust the other two were quite nice.  My friend also had a first drink (something with orange bitters) that was just meh but switched over to another and enjoyed that.  

We ordered the pork belly appetizer even though it wasn't part of the very affordable appetizer list.  I will admit that I don't know really what pork belly is.  I always think of it as fattier bacon.  What we got was like fat with bacon.  It is entirely possible that is what it was supposed to be.  We were able to cut and navigate around it and enjoy the yummy red beans that accompanied it but it was a little off putting at first.

We ate at the bar so we had the opportunity to interact with the bar staff and they are "kicks".  Very delightful while efficiently manning the bar which was full by the time we left.

Overall, there was enough right to afford a second look.  I will just stick to the more mundane happy hour fare of fries and wings the next time.

For a health market, I found the vegan and gluten-free options to be quite limited. That said, the market is big, very clean and has plenty of free parking attached. 

Grabbed a small cup of vegan pumpkin soup that was downright delicious and 100% crave worthy. Also some quinoa salad with cranberries from the deli counter, which was just okay. A little too sweet. 

They definitely need more vegan options in the prepared foods section, and there was only one coconut layer cake made of almond flour that was wheat free but not vegan.

If I want to treat myself to a tasty, sweet, warm and fresh treat, I'll be sure to stop into Federal Donuts to see what flavors they have that day.

I stopped in this morning and picked out two donuts - Pumpkin Maple Pecan and Strawberry Lavender. I felt bad because this was the first time I visited FD and there were other people coming in that were pros and already knew what they wanted. The warm donuts were placed in the bag and I was off to get to my building so I could devour them!

I didn't have a long commute but the donuts were still warm when I bit into them. The pumpkin maple was so good and not overpowering with pumpkin spice. There were plenary of pecans on the top to get some with every bite. The strawberry lavender was good too although I didn't really get much lavender flavor.

I can't wait to go back to check out their chicken!

Fiancé and I were in town for the day and since we are escape room fanatics, we just had to do one before we head back to LA. 

We booked it at the very last minute. Our host Asel was super accommodating and friendly, she made it happen for us although they were about to close for the day for maintenance. She even honored extra time since we were a 2 people team. We were very grateful for that. 

We did the Psycho Dentist room. We enjoyed every minute although most of the time, we were scratching our heads trying to put together puzzles and clues. We needed countless hints indeed, every time when Asel sees us struggling, she knew we needed help before we even spoke. Did I mention her voice in the speaker sounded like a computer? We did many escape rooms all around the world, from Asia to U.K. We can easily say this was one of our favorite. The time and the work they put into the rooms just makes the whole experience better, you definitely wouldn't leave disappointed. We did make it out in the end, with our "extra minutes" and the help Asel provided. It was so much fun. 

One thing though, it was very hot in the room so it kind of made it a bit difficult for us to concentrate but since we didn't have a heat stroke, I'm not taking away any stars. They did however, had AC towards the end. Hooray! 

Definitely come check them out. Have fun!

I was really happy with Adobo grill. Stopped b for Devour Downtown, and devour I did. Here it was more of a 5 course than 3, because in addition to an app, entree and dessert, you also get quac and a marg, both made table side. 

The guac was really good, and of course very fresh. The margarita was your standard plain margarita, so it was fine, not a big tequila fan myself. 

My appetizer was a ceviche, but it was made with trout and had some sort of mayo based dressing from what I could tell. This was my first go around with ceviche, so I'm not sure, but it didn't seem very traditional.

For the entree I got the flank steak. It was cut in short strips and served with tortillas, so that was a fun way to eat it. It was really tender and perfectly cooked.

For dessert I had the corn cake. It was tasty, king of like a sweetened corn bread.

Overall I had a good night, the service was good and the decor fit nicely. Even though this is a chain it didn't seem like it too much.

I tried to go another time and was deterred by the line. No matter what time it is, there is a long a$$ line!! Now I know why!!! This is my favorited pizza in Nashville, hands down!

They have a parking lot next to and behind the building. You walk up and get in line. You become friends with the people in line because everyone is so happy and friendly. The people who own the place and work there come out and offer pizza samples and answer questions about the menu while you wait. They hand out laminated menus for you to peruse. Once you walk in, there is a bar past the pizza line that you can order some local brews and wine while you stand in the short line to order pizza. The anticipation is so KILLER!!! So many smiles everywhere. The vibe in so infectious. EVERYONE working there has swagger because they love what they are doing. 

Now, for the food. We ordered the Smokin' Herb pizza with smoked chicken and added bacon. You know what was not added? Cost. Their flat prices encompass as many toppings as you want for a pizza. Just be careful of how many you add because it may compromise the crispiness of the crust. All these ingredients are so fresh and local. The other pizza we made up with spicy red sauce as the base. Once you are finished ordering, the pizzas are passed through an oven Quizno's style. You are handed tokens and you bring the tokens to the bar where you pay and purchase more delicious beverages. There is a cooler with non-alcoholic options (FANTA in so many flavors!!!) next to the bar. Then you go to the front and pick out 1 or 6 different drizzles. The jalapeno ranch was good enough to drink!! 

We grabbed a seat at one of the family style tables with round suspended stools that are so comfy and space saving. We loved what they did with the space. Old episodes of Fresh Prince of Bel-Air projected onto the wall. Quotes from 90's movies with 90's jams blasting on the sound system. Chatted with the people that are veterans and their love for the place was apparent. Again, they were so happy. They call out our number and we gladly grabbed our pizzas. We could not believe how delicious, fresh, and different this place and pizza was. One of the staff walked around to make sure everything was delicious. Great customer service from beginning to end. We cannot wait to come back! 

Lastly, if you could not tell, I loved how happy the place was and could not get over the community feel that was in the air. It was nice to see diversity. I felt at home. I have been looking for years to feel this way in Nashville. This is the first place that has done this for me. I love the back story about the owners and how they chose where they were going to put this place. They are giving back to the community that made them who they are. Beautiful. They have blown it out of the water. It was so refreshing to come to place that was not pretentious and cares about every aspect of your experience. Amidst all the farm to table, stuffy, expensive places that are opening, this is a breath of affordable yet delicious fresh air. Thank you, Slim & Husky's!

These guys are all great they are super friendly and make the experience pleasant every time! Teylor is always friendly and does a great job with the 'sticks'! And Veronica and Brittany rock too! Highly recommend CSL, you get paid to help people!

Edit: Updated based on the owners response to my review.

I hope we can all learn from this post, especially Noe, who is not accepting responsibility for posing a threat to the animals who come into the store.

I had an all around positive experience here with my little doggo, Lloyd. The adorable shop dog hung around all cute and happy while Lloyd and I did our shopping. And then came the cat. 

The woman behind the counter had an alarmed look on her face when I announced that I had seen the cat. I immediately told her that though I don't anticipate and issues, I don't know how Lloyd is with cats because he has never met one in his time with us. She immediately looked a little nervous and said that the cat "isn't always great with dogs".  

Ummmm.  Is it just me, or am I in a dog shop?  Why on Earth would you have an animal loose in a dog store who doesn't get along with dogs?

Lloyd froze and stared at the cat (cause he's a wimp and that's what he does when he's scared). The cat's back curled up, it hissed, and it charged at Lloyd. I got between the bully cat and Lloyd and we were both very upset with the interaction. My heart was pounding and Lloyd was definitely distressed. I do not know what would have happened had I not put myself between Lloyd and the cat, but I do now know that the cat has a history of attacking dogs and that the owner is in no way accepting responsibility for this, nor is she doing anything to protect the animals who come into the shop.

We bought our toy, said goodbye to the cute shop dog and went on our way thinking that this must have been an isolated incident. But I couldn't stop thinking about it because I was so upset and when I got home I decided to look through the reviews to see if anyone else has had similar experiences, only to find out that the cat attacked a dog in the shop 4 weeks ago.

This cat attacked a dog a month ago and is still in the shop. 

A few weeks later, it hissed and charged my dog. 

The cat is still in the shop and the owner wrote me a message today basically saying not to come back if I don't like it.  Cool, Noe, I definitely won't, but I will also not be quiet and not try to warn other customers that they are endangering their pets by walking in to your store. 

This is not ok. How many dogs need to get hurt before they take the steps to ensure the safety of the customers and their animals? While I understand based on the shop's response to the injured dog's mom that the cat is a rescue and is working on issues - my little Lloyd is a shelter dog, too - it's not unreasonable to assume that dog boutiques are safe for dogs. You shouldn't worry that there is an animal with a history of violence lurking behind the food aisle.

Had I read the other review before I went shopping, I never would have stopped in. Luckily Lloyd wasn't hurt, but the cat is bigger than Lloyd and could have caused seriously injury.  Hopefully this will reach more people and we are able to prevent future incidents, or better yet, that the shop removes the combative cat and allows everyone to have a positive and safe shopping experience. Based on her quick and nasty response to both me and the other customer whose dog was attacked, I would say that is not going to happen. 

Lloyd is NOT the only dog who was put in danger by simply entering BONeJOUR.  You and your animals will also be at risk and Noe is placing the value of having the cat in the shop over the value of the safety of our pets.  Again, this is not OK.  Enter at your own risk, but I certainly don't recommend it.
The fish tacos and the steak salad were flavorful and fresh. The cheese fondue is my favorite, especially paired with a glass of Moscato. Reasonable priced. Excellent service.
The meal was perfect bar!  Ambiance was great a no @Bre was a rockstar and made our experience fantastic!

Let me start by saying that this place is fabulous. Every facet of our visit here was thoroughly executed from the food to the drinks right down to the service. 

Oh the comfort of the food. Can you say duhlicious. Short ribs, better-than-mom's brussel sprouts, homemade pierogies, and chicken pot pie like you've never tasted. 

The Calamari was so good we ordered another round. Very lightly breaded with a very fresh, perfectly seasoned chunky marinara sauce. 

The Buffalo Wings are surprisingly good and rival most wings in the city.
The Corner Cheeseburger was perfectly cooked medium-rare and tasted super fresh.  I think we may have tried almost everything on the food menu and found it real hard to find a single disappointment.

Onto the cocktails. We sampled a bunch of them. Mother's little helper and Burning in water, Drowning in Flames both stood out.  They have a nice variety of unique and classic cocktails.

For dessert, we liked the candied-walnut bread pudding best but also thoroughly enjoyed the Chocolate cake with the caramel sauce and peanut praline.  Can't wait to return to try the Creme Brulee that was unfortunately sold-out when we were there.  

The Corner makes an amazing addition to an already eclectic row of fabulous restaurants in it's own unique way.
A must destination and a sure-fire return.

My friend called me recently and was like OMG I found this ADORABLE little shop near me with GREAT novelty stuff, but I don't remember where it was, OR what it's name was! 

Helpful right? 

Well one day I passed by Omoi, and after remembering what she said, and remembering that she lived in this neighborhood, I used my awesome powers of deduction to assume this was it.  AND she was right.  It is great.  They have ADORABLE, humorous gifts, and stuff you may want for yourself.  Also have great cards, and the staff is super friendly and helpful.  Totally think you should be going here.  I am.  Soon.  When I have more money to spend on things I don't need, but desperately want.

Finding the right person to fix your hair, much less simply keep it looking good and looking good on you, is never easy.

One person's perfect stylist can be another's hair disaster.

So I was really taking a chance booking my first appointment for cut and color (#fearless) at this salon located just outside of downtown Tampa.

I didn't even have a referral for a particular stylist but closely read through the website descriptions of each staff member and decided Via could be the right fit for me.

The salon is large, faces busy Kennedy Boulevard and is located in an area where parking in the lot behind the building can be tight and parking on the side streets can be a challenge unless you time it just right.

Tia asked all the right questions, took time to really take a close look at my hair and then explain what my options would be to achieve my hoped improved color and cut.

She has a real feel for fine hair and hair that is short to mid-length which described me to a "T."

My dark blotches were banished and the too-thick chunks of hair tamed. I left feeling better about my hair and excited to have it working for me instead of fighting me.

She spent a couple of hours on getting the color and cut just right and the price I was charged, I thought, was quite reasonable for the services she provided.

It is a great boost to feel good about how you look and to find someone who has the right skills to help get you to that goal.

Looking good, feeling good and looking forward to my next appointment!

Large, lovely, lively and lots of great items on the menu would be how I would sum up Vuelo Mexican Grill. 

It really has a great look and feel that goes well beyond the more fast in, fast out sorts of places that seem to abound around New Tampa.

There is a spacious bar area, sectioned off seating areas that give you a more intimate dining experience and large tables that are great for groups.

The salsa bar is a nice touch and I can attest to the degree of heat in the sauces marked hot. That was a definite plus for me.

I started my meal with Oven Roasted Shishito Peppers, a new obsession of mine, and Cast Iron Cauliflower, a new favorite - and possibly only - way to eat cauliflower for me (not a fan of cauliflower). The meal could have ended there and I would have been fine filling up on both of those dishes.

But I did not stop. Instead I ordered a bowl brimming with charred vegetables, green rice and pinto beans. Oh my goodness what a big bowl it was. And with a touch of the aforementioned hot sauces, what a delicious dish it was. 

The menu offers selections from meat and seafood to chicken and pork plus vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free and some just for-the-kids items.

Great place, great space.

Tasty, well prepared and well presented food in a casual, comfortable setting makes this a delightful spot to dine.

Plenty of seating options indoors and outdoors under cover. The weather was ideal for an alfresco experience on a recent Saturday afternoon, so we choose to dine outside.

Parking may be a little bit of a challenge but our mid-afternoon arrival provided a spot and, as the afternoon passed, more spaces became available.

Service was pleasant and the pace leisurely. The food arrived pretty promptly and everything ordered was greeted, and eaten, with pleasure.

There are a fair number of options for any non-seafood fans in your group but seafood is definitely a good recommendation for guests dining here.

Note that there is a Happy Hour discounted food and drink menu which may be a good way to go for light bights plus beverages.

Dunedin is such a great place to spend time and it does not lack good places to eat, great craft beers to try and excellent outdoor activities, like biking.

When seafood is what is craved, keep Hog Island Fish Camp in mind any time you find yourself heading to or through Dunedin!

Very delicious chocolate shop. I would buy truffles from here as a gift for me (-; and for others. Loved the chocolate raspberry truffle...Shh don't tell or there may not be any left for me (-:

Small interior, spacious enough only for a few guests. $10 CC minimum.

They should shut this place down. I work in the neighborhood and have come here 3 times and all 3 times the food was wrong, disgusting, staff unsanitary. Waited 18 minutes for a Mcchcicken sandwich! And it was burnt and dry. I threw it away and left.  I lunch for me today. Management rude and yelling at customer. Entire lobby filthy. Merry Christmas. Disgusting every single time.

Wow! Aerial yoga is a mix of deep stretching, strength building, and an "I'm going to die" feeling. I finally worked up the courage to attend my first aerial yoga class and I'm so glad I did. It was my first time in the studio and everybody was friendly right when I walked into the door. Even though the class I attended was for all different levels, Bob took extra care and time to make sure I felt safe and secure with the hammock. I felt bad for all the other way more advanced students in the class for slowing them down, but they were all super nice and encouraging as well. I already signed up for two more classes next week - one that's a more basic class so I can learn some fundamentals and one that's a yin yoga class since sitting inside the hammock was so relaxing I wanted more of it!

I hate to admit it, but the only thing I knew about the Grand Ole Opry before I visited was that it existed. But as a cultural touchstone for so many musicians and their fans, I felt the need to go and see what it was about. It was a moving experience to learn about the history and the importance of the venue. It was one of the slickest tours I've ever been on, with an amazing pre-tour video to an excellent tour guide to an opportunity to stand "in the circle." I was also fortunate to be able to visit on the first day that the Opry was opened again after the coronavirus shutdown. I definitely recommend the tour and, of course, a stop at Ryman Auditorium before or after.

Its a OK place. Ambiance is not extraordinary . We ordered Chicken tikka and Garlic lamb.

Garlic lamb was very good. It was on spicier side was nice. The nans were also soft and was good with the lamb.

Chicken Mailai Tikka was bit on sweeter side. 

Overall, decent Indian cuisine with affordable prices.

Chapman Volkswagen has the kindest employees that really take care of you and get you the best service for the best price. I've worked with Wendy twice and she is the kindest person I've ever met and really cared about me and the quality of service I got. She also tried her hardest to get me the lowest price for the service I got done. Highly recommend!

Okay...most ridiculous random night ever. Came here with my friend Friday night around midnight for my birthday. We were planning on going to Ladder but the line stretching the length of Sansom, nah. 

The bouncer offered us a drink on the house when we were walking on Sansom, so we thought, hey why not? He promptly handed us a "second drink on the house" card. Which, by the way, is only valid for well drinks/beers or equal value to your first purchase. Thought I could snag some top shelf drink :/ 

But the music was top 40 stuff, the DJ was HILARIOUS. The craziest DJ ever! What drugs was he on! He was jumping around the street, inside the bar, screaming, anything and everything. But I enjoyed it! He was happily willing to play any song someone requested. Interactive DJ is an understatement. I wouldn't come here if you were just trying to chill though. 

The bartenders were very nice and available as well. $6 well drinks/soco lime shots. Not bad. 

I also met the owner, Willie, at the end of the night and he was very nice also! 

The crowd was a mix... groups of 3-4 friends. Plenty of space at the bar. People in their 20's mostly. Decent  amount of dancing space. 

Seriously, you guys should just come here one night for shits and giggles! You will surprisingly have way more fun than you would have imagined!

Great authentic food, tasted as good as it looked and smelled. I enjoy that they also have bubble tea as an option as a drink, I wish more Thai restaurants did this! 4/5 because of the ambiance...had a food-court feel to it even though it's a restaurant. Either way, tasty and would love to come here again!

Have eaten here before, but it's been a few years ago. On my way back from a trip, I was looking for a good brunch spot and remembered this place. Thought I'd try it again and see if it was as good as I remembered.

It absolutely was! Since having new dietary needs, (no carbs and no sugar), sometimes it's kind of dicey to find delicious food that's still fresh & healthy. The server was great at suggestions. I had the Cali: scrambled eggs, chargrilled chicken, bacon, Swiss cheese and guacamole. I Substituted the potatoes for a bed of kale. The chicken was seasoned great and not overcooked. Delicious!

My friend had the big hungry breakfast.... See pics. The pancakes were delightful, soft and fluffy on the inside and crunchy on the outside. I wasn't a fan of the potatoes ...the seasoning was slightly off and not very tasty. He liked his dish and the overall experience was very enjoyable.

By the way, they also offer outdoor seating and a patio area that has big, beautiful trees and a person playing music (on a Sunday). Very nice, as the weather gets cooler.

We stumbled onto Kuma's  on our Cultural Trail bicycle ride.  My first experience at a heavy metal bar was a pleasant one.  My husband and I were the oldest people there, no surprise, and are not into that type of music, but we came for the food.

The burgers are named after bands and the music is loud inside.  We sat on the patio where it was quiet and we could enjoy a beautiful day.  Our server was delightful and prompt.  We ordered a kanji burger, with bacon, crispy carmelized onions, and crumbled bleu cheese on a brioche bun and was served with house made chips.  It was so delicious!

I also had a craft cream soda made by Sprecher's.  One of the best I've ever had!  House or Caesars salad are also on the menu.

Lots of posters and graffiti inside, Kumas definitely fills a niche if you like hard rock.  But it also serves great food and has a friendly staff.

Went to this place on a Saturday night after dinner with friends. It was a total disappointment. In the pictures online it appears to be a high-end cigar lounge. When we got there we were in shock it was basically unkept and not at all what we expected. We were extremely disappointed after having paid $10 to park down the street. Believe me looks are deceiving. The website shows this beautiful lounge that looks very impressive yet its basically a dive bar with hookah and a few cigars. I do not recommend going there if you're expecting a classy cigar lounge.

Supper cute grocery store, a chic step up from food city. Displays are cute, nice variety of drinks and food while your shop or take home. Enjoyed my bowl warning the green salsa is spicy... but good!

Made the drive into NJ for this little Philippino restaurant. With rave Yelp reviews, it was on the Yelp bucket list for some time.

First, what I loved the most about the experience, is the lady behind the counter. She was extremely polite, funny and very giving.

We ordered two combos. The first, white rice with oxtail in peanut sauce, and chicken Adobe. The second, noodles with pork stew, and beef stew. The lady was kind enough to give us a small portion of another beef  curry dish to sample.

We ended the meal with halo halo dessert and 2 pieces of fried plantain.

Each dish was flavorful, so I wont comment much on those. Unfortunately, there were a few things I disliked. 

1) The white rice was hard,and probably cooked much earlier in the day or previous day. We were there around 3pm on a Saturday.
2) I'm used to oxtail made Caribbean or Indian style, and not in a peanut sauce. I didnt care much for this dish. To each his own, I guess. It just didnt bring the flavor of the oxtail out.
3) Lastly, it was my first experience eating halo halo. The ice cream was absolutely delicious (tried mango and jackfruit flavors). The rest of the dessert, again I didnt care much for. Under the ice cream was some kind of ice mixture. Under that was jello cubes and a couple different types of beans. This must be a Philippino delicacy?

Overall, good experience. One of the best bang for the buck places out there. So much good food for so little.

I finally got to try this place out.
I really like how you order at the counter , as you come in. I didn't like that the menu ,didn't 
Have any descriptions of what was in the tacos.
My girlfriend and I had the briscuit tacos, very good. The briscuit had a good flavor, and had a fresh style.  We also had the chips , and salsa very good.  Also the chips were made with flour, and they were nice and crunchy.

Just a few things

1. Get a new board , that describes more in detail , what's in the food. This will speed up the ordering process.

2. Even though the tacos were substantial.
I kinda feel that they should of came with a small side. Like a small little salad, or beans, fresh cut salsa, something.

3.  How about a little more choices for the non alcoholic drinks. 

I liked the place they did a good job with the remodel. I liked the food a lot. The staff were good.

The End

Hello there chicken burrito with extra pico and loads of guac!

My cravings for chipotle come and go in waves. It usually hits me around 9:30pm when I realize I forgot to eat dinner...which means my experiences here are usually all 15 minutes before they close. 

I came here the other day and was expecting that the food might not be super fresh, but I was hangry and just wanted to eat, so I was okay with that. To my surprise, I arrived to find a long line of other late night patrons, as well as the staff grilling up fresh chicken. I was impressed! They weren't trying to close early, but they were providing a top-notch experience right before close. Kudos to you, Chipotle employees!

My burrito was yummy and oh-so-filling, as always! My only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is those super fatty pieces of chicken that sneak in there. Maybe I'm a little too picky, but when a bite of burrito bliss is interrupted by chicken fat, it just throws me off. Either than that, great experience for a late night bite!

I have only had their donuts, but just going by their namesake I don't really get the hype. All of the donuts I've had from them have had a lingering taste of old grease, were REALLY saturated in oil, and just had a soggy, falling-apart texture. I still have to try their chicken, but just going off the donuts Federal is mediocre at best for me. 

Additionally, unless you swing by for breakfast, it's almost impossible to obtain chicken past 11:30AM.

I come to this sonic with my mom somewhat regularly when I visit her.   Sonic has some pretty great tasting fast food burgers when they are hot and fresh, however this is pretty hit or miss.   The last two times we've gone we had to send cold food back and got cold food again twice each time.  Not only that, but last night was the second night I ordered a bacon double and got stiffed on the bacon.   I'm not one to complain and it's only a few cents difference that I let it go, however my mom is a real stickler for fresh, hot food and her burger was room temp.  We sent it back only to have another cold burger sent out.   The kid I spoke with over the intercom working there sounded either high or about to fall asleep as well.   Just disappointing as they have a lot of potential and their food is great for fast food when it's fresh.

If I could give a 6 star rating I would. Trader Joe's is one of my favorite go to grocery stores in the city. I can always find just what I need and also find new, amazing items that I will end up falling in love with. A few of my favorites are the mandarin chicken, vegetable spring rolls and hold the cone ice cream cones. I love how organized the store always is, and there is almost always a wide selection of items. TJ provides quality produce, food, flowers, wine, snacks, and toiletries for an affordable price. Lastly, I appreciate how they maintain a clean and sanitized store. They ensure the store is not over packed with people and they are constantly wiping and sanitizing surfaces. I love Trader Joe's and I hope to see another location open in city.

I LOVED these donuts. I'm not a big donut person because they're often oily / heavy / you can taste that it's been fried in old oil / all of the above. But these donuts were so light and fluffy and all the flavors were delicious. My favorite was the everything donut. Still dreaming about it today 

Would definitely recommend & return

Visiting from out of town and loved our time here! Very homey and comfortable atmosphere, great drinks (with seasonal specials), lots of seating, and very friendly staff. One of the staff even came over to us when we'd been here a bit and asked if she could take any dishes/cups out of the way or could heat anything up again for us. That's customer service! I also like that there are a lot of plugs so if you come to work, you'll be set. 

The only thing I didn't like was anything with oat milk was $1 extra (even just putting a little bit in my americano), which seemed like a lot. I'm used to it being free or 50¢, but obviously not a huge deal.

I like this place. We usually come out with at least one thing. But not today. Lol. 
Some great info about shopping at Goodwill:
1. The prices are pretty decent. 
2. They color tag their clothes. So sometimes there are discounts by the color. 
3. The location in Oldsmar has a great furniture selection. 
4. It's easy to get in and out. Don't let the fact that it's on a busy street fool you. 

Overall... always a great experience when we come here.

My husband and I were having a very difficult time getting any landscape companies to return our calls. We have a smaller sized backyard and needed weeds pulled, some xeriscaping, and a dog run. It must have been too small of a job because not one major landscape company, not a single one, would commit to even showing up for an estimate. We were treated with a "we'll get back with you" type of dismissal and that would be the end of their communication. 

So as I'm working one day in my home office, I see our neighbors having work done in their backyard. It looked so good when completed and I was pleased to see the workers treating the backyard with care. We chatted with our neighbors about their thoughts and they were happy to give us contact information for The company - Hernandez Lawn and Landscape. Of course I checked Yelp, and saw some very mixed reviews. We decided to meet with them anyway and after a very reasonable cost estimate, we hired them. 

I am very pleased with the work Gabino and his crew did with our backyard. His pricing was fair, they stuck to their completion timeline, and his workers always cleaned up after themselves. They did exactly what we wanted in a relatively short amount of time. I would recommend!

Worst customer service ever! I called to book an appointment and the lady asked for my credit card, I asked her why do I need to pay her before going there? She yelled at me, that I waisted her time and even called me a b****!

Eh. I had the ham egg and cheese muffin and it was hella plain. Only go here if there are no other options. I only went because it was the closest place to the hotel I was staying. Cashier wasn't that friendly but I think that's just a philly thing.

In these times of crisis, there's nothing better than quick service to get your fried chicken fix. There was approximately 4 vehicles in front of us at the drive through and we were only in line for a matter of minutes. Food was extra crispy and perfect for getting a fried food craving. Fast service, good food and friendly workers.

This place has the best food! I thought I knew a good paella until I came here. A bit on the pricey side but well worth it. We shared it with some sangria. The sangria was perfect, but too sweet or too tart. The service was quick and simple. We'd definitely come back here the next time we're in the area.

We've been contacting you for over 24 hours about not having any hot water in our apartment and have not yet heard back! Our property flooded over two feet yesterday and no one from your company has contacted us. Please find our multiple emergency maintenance requests submitted on your website, as well as with your weekend answering service and contact us immediately! You'll find which property we're contacting from in the many maintenance requests submitted.

Dr. Monty Morales at Pima Heart treats my wife and me like family. Very professional and knowledgeable not to mention a GREAT heart surgeon. Whenever I have a question the operator puts me through immediately to someone on Dr. Morales' staff and if they don't answer the question immediately I always get a "call back" within 24 hours. 
BOTTOM LINE. I trust my heart to Dr. Morales and Pima Heart

I stopped here for dinner, hungry like a haunting hyena. I can tell you, this place left me crazy insane for a stampede of galloping gazelles. The waitress led me to a table and left me with the menu but no offer for drinks. I was ready to order after a few minutes, and waited for her to swing back. Five minutes. No one. Ten minutes. Still not a server in sight. The place was somewhat packed, but not what you would call rush hour dining. Fifteen minutes passed, and I saw the servers fooling around with each other and on their phones unprofessionally. I was very disappointed and left the place and went to the noodles and company across the street which had 50 times better service than this place!

This has to be my favorite Italian restaurant chain yet.  They always walk you though the kitchen first so you can take the tour.  It is very easy to get lost in their many rooms that all look the same, kids love it because there are always groups of them running around and screaming.  It is best to go with a large group to get the full experience, since everything is family style in large platters.

The food comes with a cold partially sliced loaf of terrible soda bread, and possible some olive oil on the side, depending on your server.  Never expect to review good service here or you will be very disappointed.  Plus, do not come here if you are in a rush, even for a pick-up order, because everything takes forever.

I read the menu three times and looked all over the table for a drink menu and did not find one.  I love Italian Cream Soda and just happened to ask about it one day, so the waitress named off the flavors.  I always order it now in raspberry, it is really good, but I don't know the price because they always forget to charge me for it with their high level of organization at this place.

The dishes come in large and small sizes, small feeding 2-3 people.  Expect to pay $13.99-27.99 for a small, depending on if you order pasta or seafood.  They now have a lunch menu with on person servings, so you can get some pasta dishes for $8.99-11.99.  I, of course, have to order the largest thing I can find.  My favorite is always the Quatro Forno, which is 4 large ravioli, 2 stuffed shells, and 2 manicotti.  Any of their dishes with their spicy Italian sausage are excellent too.  Don't get the $7.99 basket of garlic bread, what a rip off.  

All of their sauces are really good, and all of their pastas are cooked al dente.  The food is gooooood, otherwise I would not keep braving this place for a new adventure every time.  Go here to get salty/cheesy food, delicious tomato sauce, and so full you want to vomit.

I had been craving biscuits for about 2 months before I got to fulfill that craving at Biscuit Love. It was well worth the wait. 

We shared the bonuts (like munchkins but with biscuit dough) and chronic bacon. The bonuts were okay but the chronic bacon was DA BOMB. Sweet and spicy. 

Hubby and I also shared the East Nasty which was really good. A hearty portion. 

I also left with an awesome "resting brunch face" mug.

When I was famished for the entire day, this salad fast food restaurant worked for me. I ordered the combo - half salad and half soup and bought a sandwich. It's easy to order because the salad variety is displayed at the counter, you just have to name what you like.

I have wanted to try this restaurant for years and with my friend making a reservation for her bachelorette party the time had finally come! We were able to set up a family style meal for eight with a set price before we went with drinks a la carte.

The food was amazing. I loved everything that came out. We had brocollini and beets for our first courses. It was then on to pasta and pizza which was top notch. Next was steak and fish which weren't my favorite but were well cooked but a bit under seasoned. Lastly was dessert my favorite of which was the panna cotta like cheesecake.

My concern and why I chose to write a yelp review was that the server did something very sketchy and something I haven't seen before as a former waitress myself or in other restaurants. At the beginning of the meal I ordered a wine and where my red flag went up is when I had 1/4 of a glass left and he refilled 1. Without asking if I'd like more and 2. It wasn't a fresh full glass of wine so I only got a 3/4 pour. This was very strange to me but I thought maybe the other girls had gotten a bottle and he forgot which wine I got.

At the end of the night it turns out he was doing this to every lady at the table who had gotten wine. Our bill came back with 9 wines between two ladies which was very high. We complained to the server with him being rude about it. The manager ended up taking a wine or two off so while appreciated I just want the server to be trained as well. It was a very sketchy practice and while I don't personally blame the restaurant I would most likely not go back knowing this server was doing this. 

I have the servers name if management is interested but won't post it publicly here.

Our server this 4th visit was amazing her name was Cynthia. She was extremely accommodating and full of smiles and energy. We fell in love with this place years ago while in NJ with our then middle school age girls in which one was turning 13 and we searched for somewhere near our hotel to have dinner and stumbled upon this place. Fast forward to the past couple of years we've made it our business to stop here when on the road driving from NYC to the DMV and beyond down to the Carolinas (in the rare chance we decide to drive as we prefer the flight life).

Our go to is BRUNCH as the morning reads are amazing and we've had different flavors at various locations however we've had two type at this location one being the Orange Cranberry and Lemon BlueBerry. Today's visit we experienced the Lemon Blueberry which was amazing and I wanted more and more LOL. Another perk of brunch is complimentary mimosas as long as you are of age and would like some = SCORE as long as you are not driving (Glad my husband is driving and doesn't drink).
Our youngest girl LOVE the Buffalo Shrimp small plate with a side of fries, our baby boy enjoys the grill cheese however you MUST specify Cheddar cheese otherwise it's made with American which I believe is something people like (not my family), my husband orders the rotisserie flatbread mostly or the steak and egg whites with potatoes, I usually end up with a Salmon burger or margarita flatbread to go with my mimosas :-)

The ladies up front could take some pointers from the servers when it comes to how to speak to someone or how to greet paying customers which is why I can't make this a 5 star review...
Check out this Yelp review for Unique Restaurants! https://www.yelp.com/biz/unique-restaurants-tampa?hrid=bAsTozs1Q9ZRSvAU9tc52w&utm_source=ishare&utm_campaign=ios_review_share_postreview

Friday, after searching, from one end of Tucson to the other, post lock-down, looking for something which might feel like a normal restaurant experience, I called or visited 11 different restaurants before it occurred to me, Guadalajara Fiesta Grill is one block that way, so I decided to give it a try. I was pretty discouraged, cynical, and less than hopeful I would ever be able to enjoy a memorable Mexican Restaurant experience again, this year, and it had just started to rain. 10 minutes later, I was already being seated, and, aside from every other table being empty, I found the sounds from the kitchen, the background music, and the salsa server bee-lining toward the table, were all singing to me, "everything is gonna be all right". That's when the hostess suddenly apologized for the restaurant having JUST run out of margarita mix. That's when super Daniel came to the rescue. Daniel, without even blinking or flinching said, "Don't worry, I can make a margarita". I went from hopeless, to hopeful, to ecstatic. I didn't have to look any further. I was finally where I had been looking to be for months. Don't lose Daniel!!!

The micheladas preparadas look amazing But they are not good they are pricey too, I ordered one anyway to try it, the chips were stale, the ceviche was not good and the michelada itself was very disappointing. I ordered the birria pizza, the broth was good but the pizza was only alright. I wouldn't recommend this place. I give 2 stars only because the waitress was friendly.

The last few times I took my car to the service department, I've had to bring it back because of something they did on their end. Every time I leave the service department, I leave irritated and frustrated. If you want your car serviced the WRONG way, take it to their service department. They do an amazing job in messing something up, and you end up having to bring your car back. I'm NEVER bringing my car back to them. I also bought my car from them. Everything went well with the purchase, but the service department -- STAY AWAY!

This was my first happy hour visit!! What fun!! Happy hour is from 4-6 with various apps and drinks on special! Since it was Tuesday, they also, had tacos and margarita. 

We did sit outside, even though it was hot, we found a table in the shade. Luckily for us, it was earlier in the afternoon and when the sun moved, we moved to a table that was in the shade. If you are planning on spending any time there in the afternoon, keep in mind the sun will move and you may not start out in the sun you will probably end up in the sun or moving tables. 

The margarita was amazing. I also, tried the house wine. The server said they switched the house. I wasn't super thrilled with Cabernet Sauvignon they had that week. It was super blah and no flavor.  I switched over to a lovely Tempranillo. They really have a nice wine selection. 

With us starving, we decided to order a few dishes to share. Many of the menu items have 2 prices. One price is for a single serving of that dish and the next price is a larger serving. We ordered a couple of apps and the larger dish of the scallops. The food came out super fast, again, they weren't very crowded. Food was so goooooood!! They really have fresh and tasty flavors. We got the brussel sprouts with bacon. The brussels were a little under cooked and while they had a good flavor it wasn't super good. We also, had the calamari which was totally amazing, super fresh and still hot, the calamari was super tasty. The scallops were on bed of spinach and sweet potato rounds. DIVINE. So good.
Our server was super attentive and really nice. He took time to help us make some choices and make sure everything was ok.

This charming, disarming restaurant serves as a reminder how pleasant and polite dining can be. 

There are plenty of tables within the compact space plus a bar with seating and an enclosed patio area. 

We arrive early evening but tables were filling up quickly as we left so reservations are recommended.

Parking is plentiful thanks to the spaces alongside the building and the large lot that is used for the nearby Publix, Starbucks and Target.

This is not a formal restaurant but the level of service was comparable to what most formal restaurants provide. 

And the food was quite good with the lasagna ordered at our table the hit of the night.

This is such a lovely setting and the overall experience was just right for a relaxed, weekend dinner. The menu and specials made it difficult to make up our minds but I sense just about anything ordered would meet with anyone's approval.

Oh RTM, how do I love thee!


My wife and I have been here multiple times!  We love strolling through the aisles, looking at everything that is for sale. Seeing if they have anything new!

On our most recent trip (during covid), it was sadly very depressing...  We went on the Friday after Thanksgiving.  About 20% of the shops were closed...  There was no indoor seating...  If you did manage to find a chair that wasnt removed, security came along fast to move you along...  My wife is 8 months pregnant, so they let her be for the most part.

So since the last trip was a little dismal, I will post what we have come to love about this place.  We LOVE the cookies from the PA General Store.  OMG soooooooo amazing!  Soft and chewy.... such a delight.  After the first time we only bought 2 cookies, now we know to get 2-3 dozen! hahahaha!

I am a huge fan of Corned Beef and Pastrami, but as a NYer, we know Jewish style is the best!  Places by us are $30-40 per lb, or 20+ a sandwich, but good ol Hershels is a normal price!  $10 per sandwich, and $14 per lb!  Its worth it to drive down lol!

Since we arent locals, the produce isnt that big for us, but we love getting spices and seasonings from the Head Nut and the Herbiary.

We also love getting unique items from Amys place!  Highly recommend!

They also have several butchers that you can get fresh meats from.  We really love getting sausages and so many other items like steaks and sometimes fish.  Dont forget a cooler!

They also have about 10 stores that are direct from Lancaster Amish country!    Fresh butter, fresh eggs, fresh produce!  Make sure that you stop at Beilers for a donut and cake!  Millers also does amazing pretzels!  Make sure that you like butter.

If there is something that you are looking for, and do not know where to get it, 99% of the time, you can find everything that you need here!

Seems like this restaurant has been here forever, and yet it wasn't until a co-worker recommended this place to me that I've finally checked it out. And in fact, our conversation that day was centering around good local places that offer up vegetarian dishes, which was exactly why I hadn't tried Happy Dragon before, because I didn't see any vegetarian option on their paper menus that sometimes ended up attached to  our mailboxes in the neighborhood. 
She told me that she discovered that they will substitute tofu for any other protein in nearly every menu item they offer. And even better, they won't upcharge you to do so! Needless to say, she had my full attention as we continued our conversation.
The next time the rest of the family decided they really wanted Chinese takeout for dinner, I said I was willing to try Happy Dragon, and they couldn't believe it. We all grabbed our devices of choice and pulled up their menu on Yelp. I made a bold choice and ordered the General Tso Tofu. I'm pushing 50 years old and I've never ordered General Tso's anything, because it's always meat-based. I was so excited to try it!
All of the takeout containers were really good sized. You definitely got a lot for your money. For a person like me, that means that I've got a meal today and definitely a lunch tomorrow too!
The General Tso's Tofu was piping hot when I opened it up. In fact, everyone's meals were piping hot. And I don't know how much you know about tofu, but it retains its specific heat quite well. My container of white rice was hot too. The General Tso sauce was sweet and tangy, and had just enough of a kick in it, that it made my nose runny after a few bites. My whole plate had an electric orange glow to it as I was eating. 
This menu item doesn't comes with any sides, which is just fine, because I was stuffed after eating only half of the portion. 
COVID-19 UPDATE:
After having a positive first experience here, we decided to order again to support local business during this pandemic. However, when we went over there, the signed says they are closed. We have no idea the scope of this closure, but we hope they are able to open back up when things are in a better way and safer.

Cute little AYCE sushi place in Reno that does delivers decently good sushi. My boyfriend and I came here for lunch on a Wednesday and this place was packed! Luckily, we were only a party of 2 so we were immediately seated at the bar. The menu is not too extensive and does not have the option of sashimi only. It's primarily only nigiri sushi, narrow choice of appetizers, maki rolls, and desserts. However, they do have uni on their menu! (only one serving per person).

We tried almost all of their nigiri sushi options, salmon, maguro, squid, scallop, hamachi, uni, unagi, mussels, fried calamari, snow mountain, and spider roll. The items that stood out more in terms of quality and taste were the squid, uni, salmon, and unagi sushi. We both agreed that the squid was the winner that day, it was creamy, sweet, and savory. The one we didn't like the most was the scallop. It was not fresh, tasteless, and tasted like it was just defrosted from the fridge not long ago. The dessert choices were limited to only one per person. We got the green tea ice cream and mochi. The mochi outer layer was hard and not soft. Both didn't have much of a green tea taste unfortunately. 

The service was attentive and we really liked our sushi chef. There were a few ones that he forgot, but overall, we were impressed by his memory of our sushi orders. We managed to have a good time here as this was our last stop of our Reno trip!

Pretty good BBQ located on Wells.  

I don't have a lot of check-ins here as I usually hit them up via their mobile restaurant at events.  

The service at this location is always uber friendly.   They always make me feel like they remember me.    I'm sure it's all in my head but it works.   

The food - 
Brisket plate is my usual go to meal -- perfectly smoked and tender.  If you're a fan of sauce, the house sauce adds a nice sweet tang.   Want something hotter the habanero sauce packs a punch.  

I broke traditions and had -- 
The loaded baked potato.   Healthy option (sure) -- the biggest spud I've seen in a while topped with pulled pork and smoother with cheese.   

If you're in the mood it's worth checking out Brother's.

One egg, some cheap tasteless bacon, and some dry homefries and a cup of coffee came to 7 bucks. $7 bucks too many. The service was friendly and quick.
Will not ever go back.

Was in Missouri for the week during Thanksgiving and wanted some Asian pastries. I Yelped this place and looked at the pictures and wanted to try their strawberry matcha. It had a nice consistency throughout the drink and the tea wasn't overpowering all the other flavors. They also had lots of different types of pastries to choose from and the owner was nice enough to let me know what the popular ones were. 
Since I've never been there, I grabbed 1 of each for my boyfriends family to try. I had the taro globe and it was delicious. It wasn't too sweet and the texture was just right. 
I definitely recommend trying this place out and having their strawberry matcha! Oh and get the large, you'll regret it because you'll finish it so fast and wished you got the bigger size. It is a hidden gem located away from the city.

Today was the second cookie visit to Crumbl in Clearwater. I'm not a fan of their cookies nor their slow service. 

Chocolate chip cookies are ho-hum on the flavor scale. They don't have a buttery taste but more specifically, these lack a rich chocolate punch. I assume this is because they use milk chocolate chips for a mellow cookie instead of semi-sweet chocolate chips, which is what traditional chocolate chip cookies are made of. 

Today we tried the pumpkin pie cookie and it was a huge disappointment. It was a overly sweet pumpkin filling on top of a sugar cookie. Instant headache after a few bites. 

The pumpkin pie cookie is a huge fail. Using quality ingredients produces a superior end product. It tastes like sweeteners and sugar was added to compensate for subpar recipe ingredients. 

As for service, they perhaps are still perfecting the timing of orders being placed vs pick up. No matter what, there's always an extra 5-10 minute wait from your pickup time. 

I'll continue to drive across the bridge to Insomnia Cookies for nighttime snacks.

This is a review for the happy hour mussels - get them. I'm not sure where else you can find a large plate of white wine butter garlic mussels with lemon and basil for $7. They could have been slightly hotter in temperature but overall we were satisfied with the deal. Our waiter was very nice and the restaurant was pretty quiet on the Monday evening we went. It feels like a classic Philly establishment - complete with Philly-themed art, sports paraphernalia, and old friends catching up.

I came to the business during posted business hours and the door was locked. I called the number on the sign and spoke to a gentleman that explained he wasn't open because his son had an appointment. He assured me that he'd be open the next day. It's now the next day during posted business hours and guess what?... the door is still locked. It's a 15 minute drive here one way for me, so I have wasted an hour of my life trying to do business here. Hopefully you'll see this and avoid wasting your time like I did by going somewhere else.

I feel sorry for this buffet because before covid, it was a pretty decent buffet w decent pricing.  Now it's a subpar buffet w horrible pricing. Went on 1/15 around 2pm. They had what was a seafood buffet for $50 a person. Trust me, this was no seafood buffet, at least nothing you should pay 50 bucks for. No lobster. Crab legs were Jonah crab legs and didn't look great. No fish except for tilapia. Most of the food looked pretty old. Even their bbq station which used to have great brisket is now just not good. Tried some of the ribs and wow, it was nothing what it should be. Meat stuck to the bone. Looked like it'd been there a while, not hot. The guy at the pho station forgot to put pho in my PHO It's just a bad experience foodwise. Maybe for $20 it might be ok, but I wouldn't even pay $20 for that food. I just couldn't believe it, a ghost of its old self. GSR, fix your buffet ASAP.

There really are pulling all the stops here for precautions due to Covid. You can tell they were trying. They only let a certain amount of people in at a time. Unfortunately when we went it was scolding hot on a Sunday. And they did have a tent for shade which was nice. They have proper signage everywhere to show you where the waiting line is and also blocked off 6 feet boxes so you are safe the social distancing.

Very small customer area, no sitting.

All the display cases took up a lot of room which was nice. A lot of options!

It was national Cuban day and I had to find the best place and it came highly recommended here.

We bought two Cubans and a scacciata. 

The Cubans are divine. Get it warm. I am almost speechless to write how delicious it was. I would definitely get it again.

The scacciata was okay. I've had the one at Alessi so kind of ruined me. 

We will certainly continue to come

We went there a few weeks ago looking for a quiet place to spend the evening, chat and have some good wine. We were not disappointed. The wine selection is huge. We ended up chatting with the ladies next to us the bar and sampling each others wine. We even got a few bottles for our house. The place is cozy and intimate. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. They did their best to track down some wine that we have been looking for for a while. The place was not that busy for a Saturday night. Nice atmosphere appropriate for conversations, not loud. We  were hungry but thneiy only had cheese and bites and I needed real food. I was nice to learn that you can order food from the neighbor restaurants. We tried that, unfortunately it was taking to long to place phone orders. So we we had to cut our stay short to go eat.

Camp is the place to go if you're looking for a well rounded workout. They offer strength training classes, spin and yoga which makes it a gym for everyone. Awesome staff and instructors! The parking can be a little hectic, but they've managed to provide several parking lots for their members. The biggest downside is how quickly some of the classes fill up, making it nearly impossible to get into prime spots unless you sign up immediately.
Amazing!!!! Worth the wait when their a line!!! Great service!!! Owner is working with employees their all friendly!!! Fresh food large portion

Been meaning to try it out because it's so close to home so we finally went last night. For a Saturday it wasn't crowded but still a great atmosphere. Very nice layout. Pool tables, really big bar, open floor space. We each got an order of wings and split the baked Brie and old bay fries. The wings were so amazing I highly recommend. They were huge I could only eat about 5. Garlic parm and spicy jalapeño are both amazing flavors. The fries were the highlight for me tho. I love shoe string fries and can't seem to find them anywhere. These were cooked perfectly and served with old bay and American cheese -- better than chickies in my opinion. The baked Brie was different but a nice start to our meal. Our waitress was very nice. Will def be back for some of their happy hour or eagles game day specials !!!

So good. I've been here twice now, once at the communal table outside in warmer months, once inside. Both times I was blown away by the food and drinks and the friendly, knowledgeable service. 

First off, you need to get the mushroom and egg pizza. It does not mention its most exciting ingredient: pickled mustard seeds. Perhaps this is so you are surprised and delighted when you first taste it; perhaps it is so you feel that you are in an exclusive club who knows to order this. (Must mention the divine wood-fired sourdough crust, too.)

Other items on the menu are similarly coy. Potato soup gave little indication of how flavor packed it would be other than "smoky." Grilled cabbage had "who knew?" sauce and buckwheat. If you trust the chef (which you should!), it's an exciting way to eat, and inspires your server to be your guide, which they are well qualified to do.
