Now the drinks: I had a red (which was actually a rose?) that defies description. It was light, not tannic, but bursting with fruit flavor. One of my tablemates had an Austrian white she described as smelling like it would taste normal, but then surprising you with layered flavors. The other had a cider from Normandy that, I kid you not, tasted of blue cheese--and it was a good thing. We brought home a number of bottles from their wine shop. Can I just say how ecstatic I am that I can buy wine in Pennsylvania from someone who knows about it--and it's natural wine that is not a concentrated pesticide bomb? This is heaven.

My one complaint is that the bass inside was cranked up so high that I felt a bit nauseated. I am admittedly very sensitive to this kind of thing, having been raised by an audiophile, but it did seem pretty extreme for dinner time not at a club.  I probably could have asked them to turn it down, but no one likes to be that person.

We stayed when we were in town for a New Years Eve wedding.  The wedding was at the Tampa Theater and this hotel was in a great location that we were able to walk to and from the wedding.  The hotel has a small bar, restaurant, pool and gym.  We had a king room which was just your standard room that overlooked the pool.  The staff were very friendly and when we got there before our check in time the woman at the front desk was able to find us a room which really made our stay since we had an early flight it allowed us to nap before the wedding.  The only complaint I would have would be that the gym was not much to be desired.  It had two treadmills, an elliptical and some weights but all of the machines seemed to be out of date.  If you're looking for a place just get a little workout in this place is fine for a free gym.
The food here is pretty delicious. Highly recommend the seared tuna and duck poutine for appetizers.

I made the mistake of getting the Vernon on gluten free. The manager assured me the crust was delicious. It tasted like cardboard. Not enough sauce for the meatballs either. I tried to just scape off the toppings but it didn't taste any better. Considering I barely ate it I'm surprised that I walked away with such heartburn and nausea. Why didn't I go to California pizza kitchen? Never again.

I love this place for clothes, but the staff is rude every single time I go in there. The prices are fair for the clothing and you can often find good pieces. I would give five stars but the staff if just so hateful. I wish they would hire all new staff and train them in guest service!

Recently opened in Westmount Mall so I had to check it out.

Staff is friendly, and the store smells and looks clean. If you're a dog lover, their selection for food, beds and toys is pretty impressive. The selection for cats is significantly smaller.

They DO have a couple of kitties up for adoption. Two sweet little grey and white babies. The cages they were kept in were clean and staff would bring them out and socialize with them. I even got cat kisses. 

Their prices are about the same or higher than than other places, but the quality of the cat toys is pretty good. I'll give this place a 3 1/2 star. It's above average, but just no 'wow' factor.

Very nice restaurant. Home cooking style serving, plates of food like sautéed lamb over rice

The flavors are excellent, we had the Jamaican chicken and lamb strips. Both were delicious

The staff was friendly, but the cook times were fairly long

Overall, recommend this place to try something different. Would gladly come here with friends or family

To start, this office is incredibly rude and unprofessional. I would NEVER recommend this place, they do not respect patients and should not have the business of anyone.

I scheduled a new patient appointment and was not able to get in for a month due to their limited availability. As a full time employee my "free" time is scarce so I wanted to assure an on time appointment, the receptionist recommended 1:30 as they require new patients to check in a  1/2 hour before the appointment and they got back from lunch at 1:00 so assured me they would be caught up with patients and on time. 

I showed up at 12:50 and waited until 1:25 before any of the unfriendly staff decided to come back from lunch. They gave a pathetic apology and continued laughing amongst each other while ignoring the 2 patients who had both been waiting over a half hour. 
I immediately went to

 the front desk as now I was on a tight time crunch with a meeting at 3:00, I asked the receptionist if I would be able to get right in and she informed me that new patients need to be there 30 minutes before their appointment so I would have to wait 30 minutes. Are you kidding me, I had been waiting nearly 45 minutes while they took their time at lunch!!!!! She proceeded to let me know that the doctor was not even in and she didn't know what time they could expect her, again are you kidding me, my actual appt was at 1:30 so why would the doctor not be in the office when she had an appointment.

I left after they continued to tell me they could not estimate what time I would be able to get in and they did not know where the doctor was. It was so disheartening to know that the office staff did not care one bit about their patients. I respected their time by showing up when told, and they hardly had a thought about leaving us waiting outside. They never tried to be polite and understanding, in fact, I got the feeling they didn't want patients so that they could continue gossiping.

I feel weird giving this semi-casual, surprising little place in the heart of Whitestown five stars. A good friend of mine lives in Lafayette, so this is the perfect place for us to meet that's not too far for either of us. That's the end. No expectations except to maybe get a burger that wasn't awful and split a dessert that had been taken out of a box in the kitchen. 

But hold on. Could it be that this place is... FANTASTIC? Noooooo... but YES. 

The staff is friendly and accommodating. They go out of their way to make sure you have a good experience. And the food. THE FOOD. For real, it's perfectly prepared. The fish is wonderful, the steak is exactly as ordered, the vegetables were yummy. Their pasta game is on point. The side salad was fresh and crunchy and they didn't skimp on the non-lettuce items. We had a bread pudding dessert that was to die for. 

We've met here twice and both times, for real, we had an outstanding experience. At lunch it's more casual--grab a sandwich and you're on your way. At dinner they fancy the place up with candles and white tablecloths. It's so nice. 

So, yeah. I can't believe it either. But the five stars are well deserved.

Great staff, great food, great music and atmosphere! Worth the wait...appreciated the outdoor heater!  Play the beer in a bag game...great fun and great beer!! Can't wait to go back and bring our friends!!

Stopped for lunch here after biking to Broad Ripple from Fountain Square. It is a fun, casual spot! Got the poutine and the juicy Lucy, which was perfectly cooked to order. Split the meal with my boyfriend, and we still couldn't finish all the fries!

This is a review for our stay at this hospital. We came in and quickly got checked in and moved over to a delivery room. The  nurses here were amazing and quick to respond to any need. For this particular floor I would give them 5 stars. 

On the other hand, when we got moved up to the 8th floor the nurses were not so attentive. From a professional stand the nurses on this floor don't present as welcoming which is extremely frustrating especially when running on 1 hr of sleep. Asked for medication and our nurse completely forgot and did not do her hourly rounding as stated on the wall. However we now have a beautiful and healthy baby girl!!!

Best Mexican on the Main Line. I have been here at least 4 times since they opened and tried various dishes. My cousin and I went here tonight and had two cocktails plus 2 apps to split and one entree each (we were hungry). Cocktails were good although I thought mine tasted different from when I had it before (killer bee) as I missed the brown sugar and it just tasted like tequila on the rocks. Lol. Platanos app excellent but not a fan of the street corn as I expected it to be charred and on the cob. If they serve it off the cob some charring/roasting of the corn and a dash of cilantro would do a bit of good. Both of our entrees were phenomenal; we got the combo.  Best Chile rellenos ever! Will be back again and again. Great service and ambiance.

Absolutely my favorite burger place. The burgers are cooked to how you like it. If you want well done, make sure you specify because they typically like cooking them to medium well.

Juicy hamburger, and doughy buns with the side of tater tots - this is my favorite meal that leaves you content and in a food coma.

I wasn't too impressed with their collection of pop - I had the ginger and mint, and both times, it was well-made with quality sugar and didn't taste too processed, but the flavor was just not doing it for me.

We went there for lunch from Highland Lakes. We got there for lunch it wasn't busy, Our drinks took awhile to get don't know why. We got some chips and dip while we waited. The dip  we got looked and tasted like applesauce.Ugh! We got 2 burgers I got the TT signature burger. Ok for a frozen patty. Cheese was sliced so thin you could see thru it. Tomato chutney I scaped off, just tastless. Fries were mushy.Server was very accomadating on a positive note.

Umm did someone say Boozy Coffee? Ruby slipper did. And they NAILED IT!!!
Loved Ruby Slipper. Loved the vibe, loved the service, loved the drinks, loved the food.
Definitely recommend trying the boozy coffee and mimosas. Great portions for the price.

So I was dying for BBQ In Nashville and came across Edleys. It was amazing.  The bread was so soft.  The chicken on the chicken. Sandwich was perfect with the bbq sauce and coleslaw.  One of the best sandwiches I've had!

Best. Day. Ever!! After spending the week standing in line and fighting traffic and crowds we decided to end our trip with A Boat Day. My kids and husband said it was their favorite part of our vacation. Our captain was awesome, laid back and knowledgeable. We had nothing to worry about but relaxing and enjoying family time. We booked for 6 hours and our captain made sure we did everything on the wish list my 10 year old gave him that morning: island hopping, shelling, site seeing and wildlife watching. The highlight was the dolphins that hung out with us for over half an hour. We were comfortable on the boat and everything was clean and in great shape. If you want a nice family day where you can truly relax this is the thing to do!

Tucked away right outside the Penn campus,, Kilimandjaro is a place to get yummy, filling Senegalese food. I'd never tried it before so I came with a friend who frequented the place and was very pleased I.

I ordered the poisson (tilapia) which is grilled or fried, and following our servers recommendation got it grilled. It came out as a whopping whole fish topped with a delicious slightly spicy and tangy chopped onion sauce (ok that might sound a bit nasty but it makes the dish, trust me!). For being grilled it was still really crispy on the outside with the meat still juicy, and such a great deal at only $12! Every entree comes with one large side so I got the Senegal fried rice, which was pretty good, not flavorful enough to be a main dish but a nice complement to the fish.

My friend's poulet Senegal (Senegalese chicken) was a giant portion of well spiced, tender chicken topped with a fantastic caramelized onion sauce (honestly it was even better than the chicken!). I don't like fried plantains but objectively they looked good and crispy. 

While the menu is small and there are distinct lunch or dinner only options, the food is unique and filling.   Just a head up though, I'm pretty sure it's cash only and service was quite slow.

Yaso is hands down one of the best Jamaican food experience I have had in Indy. It's a must try. My food came out fast and hot! I ordered the jerk chickenand it was cooked perfectly. They were a little lite with the cabage so I ended up buying more... But it was worth it...

Cute brunch spot right off Howard in south tampa. Great location and close to other bars and restaurants. Me and my friend came to brunch and I'm giving this review 3 stars because they cap you on bottomless mimosas during brunch and food was just okay. A long time ago when I came here they didn't have a limit so we were upset when we got there and got kicked out for being there for too long. Bottomless mimosas are $20 a person but again it's not bottomless. They bring you a pitcher of mimosas which was nice so you didn't have to wait for refills but they limited us to one pitcher each and they put a limit on how long we could be there.  That is so annoying! I live in Spring Hill and when I make the drive down to tampa to brunch with friends, we like to sit and chill at one place, catch up and we will drink and eat all day. The longer you allow us to stay, the more money we will spend, I get having to get people in and out but it just sucks when your rushed.  The pretzel was fantastic and the candied bacon was meh. Prices were decent too, probably one of the cheaper spots in the area. They also had a DJ during brunch which was nice and food was decent but honestly, probably going to find a new brunch spot for the future.

AMAZING food! Every time I come in I get the shark attack and it's made perfectly. The reason I'm giving a 3 star review is the manager. She made this visit VERY uncomfortable. Yelling at your employees from across the restaurant in a rude manner isn't the best look for your business. These poor highschool kids look terrified and on edge. At one point she was yelling so aggressively the whole restaurant went quiet and it turned into a show. I will return for the delicious food, but the blonde manager with glasses has to stop

I have been so busy and so behind on all I have to do that I'm just now getting to writing my review on Daily Buffet & Grill. After church Sunday Tony and I decided to eat out and then head straight to the grocery store. We enjoy eating at the Daily Buffet & Grill because of variety they offer. There is a medium size salad bar which has peel and eat shrimp, marinated baby octopus, and your normal salad items. They have a sushi bar that is done beautifully, but it isn't too big. Right by the sushi is a hibachi grill that I dearly love! You fill your own plate and hand it to the grill master and he gives it back steaming hot. You can pile your plate with shrimp, pork, steak, two kinds of noodles, snow peas, garlic, hot peppers, and all kinds of veggies. If you get the things I've mentioned you already have way more than your monies worth, BUT-there are still the 5-6 rows of oriental/American buffet tables. Don't forget dessert and the 6 types of ice cream that you hand dip yourself. The Hibachi is still wonderful, but unfortunately the quality of the other rows of food were either room temperature or just plain cold. Some of the flavors were way off too. For instance the crab Rangoon filling just wasn't right. There were three of us in agreement. Another example was the Hot And Sour Soup. It's normally very good here. It should be a little bit spicy and a little bit sour.  It looked so good, but was only Salty!! I'm afraid that we have decided not to eat here for a long while.

I had to do some lab work that my doctor ordered.  I wanted to get in and out quickly so I could head to my job.  It was busy at the hospital registration area, so I had to wait in line.  But the woman checking us in kept her cool and kept us moving through and stayed warm and friendly throughout.  The person who did my actual registration was friendly and efficient and the lab worker was excellent at quickly drawing my blood with no discomfort on my part.  From start to finish, the whole process of registration and labs only took about 15 minutes!  I was delighted and very appreciative with how quick it was so I could get to my job on time.

We ordered the avocado smoothie and oreo milk tea, which both of them were a bit disappointing. The avocado smoothie was smooth but lacks actual flavor as not sure if the fruit used was not ripe enough. The oreo milk tea was disappointing as it was just chocolate cookie bits inside a regular milk tea; doesn't taste like oreo at all.

Brunch on a Sunday has always meant waiting in line and then your food for so long you wonder whether it's time for dinner. I was shocked that I was seated within seconds of arriving at this popping brunch spot, and that our food came out five minutes after ordering! 

Sorcery surely??! It must have been because the food tasted MAGICAL. The "N-Liberties" was an exciting assortment of flavors, my favorite being the Sausage crumbled on top of the hummus. I can't even properly describe the array of unique flavors on the plate, but let me tell you that this is a must order. 

Equally exciting were the Baklava Pancakes. The rose water infused syrup was  chef's kiss. The mascarpone cream layered between the blue pancakes and bananas was wonderful, although the pumpkin flavor was lost on me. I wish there had been more baklava in these pancakes, but the pistachios and rose water syrup were so delicious that I forgive their absence. 

Also, shout out to the super attentive staff. They would swing by every few minutes to refill our water and they were so patient and kind, despite being so busy. So many times at brunch places I feel like the staff are irritated, trying to get us in and out as quickly as possible, but I never felt rushed as I relished this wonderful meal. 

I came to Philly hungry, and I left more than a little Filly. Thanks for an incredible meal!

I will only say, RUN away.  Our experience has been a nightmare.  If I could take one page to go over our experience I would, but it would take about 5 pages.  Terrible, terrible customer service.  No return calls, no return emails.
Without a dishwasher for over 4 months!  Filed a claim with Better Business Bureau and our credit card.  Please go anywhere else!  Horrible experience.
We will NEVER, EVER use them again.

First time visiting the Manayunk Brewery since moving here and this place was recommended from someone we bought furniture from. Not the most solid source but turned out to be pretty nice. The entrance is down a little alleyway off of Main St and you walk right into a big open area with a little stage for live music off to your left and a sushi bar just behind the hostess stand. Considering this is a brewery we were a little confused about the sushi, but also being people that love sushi, we were happy about it. We asked to sit outside because we saw they had outdoor seating and boy do they. A short walk through the indoor seating brings you out into the outdoor but half covered bar and seating area. The bar itself is covered but when you walk a little bit past the bar there is additional outdoor seating, as well as a countertop to sit and overlook the Schuylkill river flowing by. 

We sat at the bar as we wanted to try out the happy hour (4-7pm, 1 dollar off all drinks and discounted food). I started off with the Monk from the Yonk and it was very good, tasted almost like a Golden Monkey from Victory Brewing if you are familiar with that. My girlfriend got the Moscow mule which was also delicious and my sister got the Brew Cider Sangria which was interesting but good. The bartenders were very nice and answered all of our questions we had. 

As for the food, we ordered the wings, the chicken quesadilla, and the pizza, all off of the happy hour menu. The wings were wonderful and almost comparable to a wing restaurant, although we aren't really sure what flavor we got as we were never asked, it was very good regardless. The chicken quesadilla was awesome as well and they definitely did not hold back on the ingredients like some places do for quesadillas. Finally the pizza, it was alright but just tasted like a frozen pizza you would make at home.  

Overall, it's a great scene and I definitely will be coming back to check out the rest of the beer and the large menu.

We love this place and I had called around 11am on Christmas Day to make sure it was open. The young woman on the phone ensured me they were open until 9pm tonight. Pull up at 4:45pm lights off and not a soul inside  ‍

This was one of the first meals we had during our first visit to Philadelphia.  The wait was around an hour and a half so it had to be good right??  Well luckily for us, it was def worth the wait.  Our group got everything from the pastrami lox to the kitchen sink skillet and everything in between.  The food was honestly amazing(I sampled everyone's dishes) but it was a richness overload.  The bloody maries and the bellinis def helped wash it all down though.  I'd highly recommend this place for brunch.

Second time coming to Jimmy's bbq and I can tell you that it's one of the top spots in terms of taste for bbq in Philly. My favorite item is the brisket because of how tender it is. It break apart so easily and also they add some seasoning after ontop too. The chicken leg and thigh is also really good, especially for that price. Definitely my go to spot in the Malvern area every time I come through.

Also the BBQ sauces they have are excellent. They have a sweet sauce, spicy, and vinegar based one. I personally like the vinegar one the most, followed closely by the spicy.

This became our morning stop for breakfast. The menu is so eclectic that anyone can find something. They take classics and put Ruby twist to it making it to-die-for! The coffee there was amazing. The grits were delicious. The biscuit was too good to leave behind. The portions were definitively sufficient. Now fun fact, don't just show up! Get on the waiting list on your way. And if you're impatient, you can order your drinks while in line! Yes, a bloody mary before stepping a foot inside!
Wedding day, hair and makeup.  Very accommodating. Exactly what was quoted.  I was hungover from the night before and I left there looking like a new person. Thanks for everything

Really convenient, great quality, great service. The staff is friendly and the trendy atmosphere is really comfortable as a stop on your morning commute. I love the breakfast wraps here and their iced coffee is almost rival to their neighbor, La Colombe.

Tip: the serving sizes aren't very large, but I was told the Quesadillas are the biggest quantity-to-dollar there is.
Absolutely great food! Had the burger on the lunch menu and it was THE BEST! Will was a fantastic server, and the atmosphere is chill & comfortable. Readily going back again soon!

Fast, great variety, including fruits and vegetables.  I stop here for breakfast, and get a sandwich for lunch later..

Could go to dinner too, but I gotta take it easy :-)
It is neighborhood restaurant, family owned. Sushi are always good quality. And always more fun when having friends cooking on the table.

We have a tradition of going out for NYE Eve, or the 30th. Brothers, cousins, aunts and uncles; all varying ages. So, we try new places every year that can appeal to our large group, while being interesting to those of us who are lucky enough to be frequent diners around the country. 

Pesto, in the heart of South Philly blew it away. First, Connie at the front of house, as well as reservations confirmer is a sweetheart who adds to the positive experience by greeting your table and discussing the menu. 

Our large group had appetizers served family style, calamari, stuffed mushrooms in rose sauce and bracciolettini which were all devoured by eaters from elementary school through collegians and everything between. 

Lightly fried calamari ranks among the very best I have had, the bracciolette is new to me and many at the table. Thinly sliced beef, grilled, and rolled with mozzarella like pillows of flavor. Pro tip from Connie, dip them in the rose sauce of the mushrooms...just....delicious. 

The two dishes I tried both are calling me back. The Veal mare and monti are medallions topped with shrimp and prosciutto in a mushroom Demi glacé. Texturally and taste make this an experience as well as dinner. 

The entrée that the 15 yo raved about is the house made cavatelli with crab, lobster and shrimp. Unsurprisingly the cavatelli won a national award on a tv show and it shows. 

Desserts included cakes to gelato. Wine here is so reasonably priced you'll be shocked. 

Couple more things. There is a hospital parking garage across Broad street. Safe, 24 hours, staffed lobby, park after 5 pm for $6 bucks. 

Carrots: Connie had the waiter bring a gratis carrot salad in balsamic that NONE of us ever had and we are now figuring out how to make ourselves. 

For center city denizens, come to this South Philly standout and experience a true Italian dinner experience

I wanted to get a full night's sleep before writing this review. As a result, I raised my opinion to the 2 star status. 
My brother, his child , and I went to the Arnold location for dinner Friday 1-14-11 night at the last minute. As we walked through the door at 7:10 PM, we both felt relieved the restaurant was only about half full. The three of us were seated quickly and given menus. A perky and waitress came to our table quickly, took our drink orders, and explained the menu to us. This is where the good vibe stops. 
Once our drinks (lemonade, Coke, and a Smitthwick's) were brought to the table we lost our waitress for fifteen minutes. 
I was able to get the server's attention and tell her we were ready to order. I also, without attitude, asked if she was really busy tonight because we wanted to see more of her. The four of us spoke and joked around in a friendly manner and we asked for more drinks. 
After another fifteen minutes of searching for our server, we resorted to going to the bar to refill our drinks. 
Another ten minutes went by and the waitress was directed to our table, we let her know the drinks were paid for at the bar and should not be on our tab. We also asked if the kitchen was alright as it had been quite a while since we ordered (chicken strips, hamburger, and steak sandwich). The waitress didn't believe we went to the bar and offered no explanation or apology for the lack of attention. 
Sensing our mounting displeasure, a second waitress brought our food to the table and dropped the plates without a word or even a smile. 
My medium-rare burger was nearly well done and the fries on all three plates were over fried to the point none of us ate them. Food must be fairly bad for my family to turn away. 
The chicken strips were not eaten and I could only get down about a quarter of my dry sandwich. After another 20 minute wait, our waitress came to the table to see how we were doing. 
We told the server we were not happy with the time nor the food. WE asked for the check now, because, "Who knows when we'll see you again?" 
We paid in cash, fearful to leave a credit card number with the place, and left an appropriate tip. 
It takes a lot for me to leave a poor review. I'm usually understanding about off-days, crowded nights, and complicated orders; but there was no excuse for this meal to be this bad and take this long! 

On the plus side, the staff was extremely attractive and the outfits leave little to the imagination. If I had to do it over again, we would not have brought a child to this restaurant. NOT CHILD FRIENDLY and not a place to take Grandma.

This was my first time here. The place I ALWAYS go to was too busy so I checked out the closest nail spot with 4+ star rating. Pur spa is so so nice. Super client. Super super friendly. U could tell they wanted to do a good job and took their time. I got the candle wax pedi per recommendation of a past reviewer. Omg so wonderful. This will now be my go to place for my pedis. Yay!

We visited olio pizzeria after days of delicious food and this restaurant was definitely another spot with great food.

I, unfortunately, didn't feel great when I was here, but I did get to enjoy the pizza bread (delicious, cooked in a wood burning oven!) and some sparkling wine.  Everything looked amazing, from the calamari to the meatballs. If I could have eaten more, I would have definitely tried one of their pizzas.  

Service was good for us, but I have to say that I found the staff very unprofessional.  I would typically downgrade a spot for this, but since I was somewhat amused, I let it slide (note, others  may NOT have been amused at some of the discussions).  Just a few tidbits of what we heard...waitstaff/host staff begging to leave early (with a full restaurant), serving staff talking about their extracurricular 'exploits' and a general feeling that I was in a frat bar.  I am not sure if they thought that the customers couldn't hear them, but this went on for quite a while and as we were leaving, some of the staff seemed to be starting their partying early...

A spot with great food and a fun atmosphere, but I would recommend to the staff to take their conversations elsewhere in case there are other customers who are not quite as forgiving with the rather inappropriate discussions.
Spacious, clean, and comfortable rooms. Pool and hot tub with a lazy river! And very friendly service from all staff, with a special shout-out to Blanca at the front desk.

Update: I tried to give them another chance twice. The first time, at 7 o'clock, I pull up and go through the drive-through and was told "sorry we're closed." Strange since it was during their normal business hours. Tried again today and with a line of cars circling the building, I decided to go in to the store. Doors locked. No sign letting you know that the lobby is closed. This truly has to be one of the worst locations anywhere.

I need to bring my man here. There are very wonderful things about the POPE that check off boxes in his bar's requirements list:

- Bad ass beer list (CHECK)
- Chill, not over-hip or over-preppy atmosphere (CHECK)
- "Good lighting" (CHECK) (i.e. no overhead blaring lighting, not too bright, easy on the eyes)

POPE delivered. I can't wait to come back and try the noms and generally make this place my home on East Passyunk.

They stole a painting from me.

I had thought that they did a good job - they were polite, fast, and efficient.  But I noticed after the move that the only piece of art they moved for me is missing.  It is a gray painting of Peter Pan facing a pirate ship that my sister made for me a few years ago and is completely irreplaceable.  It was in my son's room and one of the crew specifically asked me if I wanted them to put it on the truck, which I agreed to.  I looked everywhere for it in every location it could be, and it is not a small painting at about 18x20.  The office says they looked everywhere for it and that they would check with the crew, but clearly it never made it off of the truck.  The crew disappeared for an hour between leaving my first location to dropping off items at the second location, even though the locations are only 20 minutes apart, so go figure.

I cannot replace the painting.  I just want it returned, but there's nothing I can do but warn future customers.  If it's returned to me, I'll delete my reviews.

I have been to Oregano's a bunch of times. I can't believe I have not reviewed them yet. 

One thing you can count on from them is HUGE  portions. My wife was happy to find that they offered a half on the meatball sandwich. No such luck on my Mardi Gras chicken sandwich. It was the size of a wine bottle and weighed about a pound and a half. Yes, I did eat the whole thing and suffered the rest of the day. My wife said her meatball sandwich was "ok".

While my sandwich was obviously tasty enough that I ate the whole thing , there was something off about the flavor combination. Was it a hot sandwich? Was it a cold sandwich?  It was like this sandwich did not know what it wanted to be when it grew up. The bread was toasty but the filling was lukewarm. I think I kept eating because I just could not make up my mind if I liked it or not..

My wife found their waffle fries to be a little spicy, but I love spicy things, so they were just perfect for me.

As I said, I have been there many times and there are some things on the menu I do like. Their wings are really good, Their stuffed pizzas (when they don't run out) are a great deal at lunch.

This is the only Oregano's in town and, as others mention, the wait can be long.Time your visits accordingly to avoid long waits. Midday on the weekends are good times. Their menu does have some high spots but most of the food on their menu is not worth the long wait.

The experience I had regarding Aronda Denise's hair salon was far from competent to say the least. I'm currently transitioning from permed hair to natural hair, therefore I wanted a professional opinion regarding which route I should take to achieve maximum results. Upon calling the 'Natural Hair Glam' establishment I was greeted with a less than enthusiastic response. An employee addressed me:  A FIRST time customer with an abrupt and rude 'Yes?'. As if I was supposed to know for sure I was calling the right place. I was immediately turned off by this and questioned their professionalism. I called back in order to make a complaint to a supervisor. All of my calls were forwarded until I used a different number to get through. I finally reached the salon and requested to speak to a manager. I finally did and found out the employee I was disrespected by was the owner of the establishment. The owner was extremely confrontational and proceeded to justify her actions. This is not a place I would recommend spending a dime of my money. Respect and courtesy goes a long way especially when attempting to run a successful establishment, which is something the Natural Hair Glam Salon by Aronda Denise sorely needs to consider in the immediate future.

Wild Earth Bakery and Cafe on 99St is an awesome little bakery and coffee shop.  They have some great seating inside and during the warmer months some outside spots as well.

I have tried many of the muffins, croissants, bread and non-coffee drinks (sorry can't comment on the coffee as I don't drink it) and have always been impressed with their products.

You can buy fresh loaves of bread here and they have always been fantastic!  They also have vegetarian and gluten free options if you need that.  At the front till they usually have a basket of dogs treats as well that you can pick up for your furry friends.

If you are on 99 St. and want to stop for littler food or coffee break this is a great choice!

If you need a kitty fix, this is the place. 

We had our four beloved cats die within 15 months of each other. We had to move because our landlord sold the house. We are temporarily living with some very kind friends until we can find a place in which to live. So in the meantime, we've been without a kitty and we have withdrawals. We decided to pay El Jefe a visit. 

It satisfied. We enjoyed visiting with the cats. My only beef is that most of the older cats weren't all that friendly. They were definitely interested in the treats! But as far as being loveable, not this batch. The kittens were fun. There was one who just purred and purred when I first touched him and just loved the pets. Now that's what I was really looking for. Most of the older cats didn't even want to play. They must be bored with everyone trying to play with them.

Reservations were easy and very reasonably priced. They provide a free drink: bottled water, soda, canned coffee. So that is a nice touch. They also sell ice cream, I think it was either Brushfire BBQ's or the Hub's. Maybe neither.

Masks are required, but then you do have that free beverage...

5* = A top favorite. Mind-blowing good. I will definitely return and I will go out of my way to go here. Worth every dime of my money.

4* = Outstanding. Tucson-top-tier. Some elements not quite as good as it gets, but it still is worthy of my regular business.

3* = Good experience. I might do repeat business if it is convenient, the only option, the only one in its category, or on a whim, but would not be among the first thing to come to mind. Would definitely recommend you trying it to get your own take on it.

2* = Not so good. Would not recommend at all. Waste of money.

1* = How are they still in business? Stay away at all costs!

If I could give zero stars I would. My family ordered approx $170 worth of food and was missing several items. We called the restaurant 20 times before they would answer. We tried to explain that we were missing two orders of gumbo and a gallon and a half of daiquiris. They were no help. They kept referring us to door dash. Door dash told us to call the restaurant. The shrimp and grits smelled spoiled. The cabbage was not fresh. Chicken wings were cold and bland. I never leave bad reviews but this was by far the worst food ever. After going back and forth with door dash, we were able to get the money back. I'm glad because no one should pay for food with low quality. I highly suggest that my fellow yelpers stay away from this place.

55 minutes later (1:20pm) my 2 po-boys are still "coming right up". No advanced warning I will need to wait for longer than expected. Just 3 dine-in orders in front of me, so apparently they prioritized something else or their cook has been sleeping the entire time. Not a recommended place no matter how good the po-boys turned out to be.

My wife and I have just started ordering our meds. from express script this year.  On several occasions, we have ordered meds and it has taken 10-14 days to get our order.  I've called them and they said it must have missed the conveyer belt.  When I complain, they says, well you can fill a grievance.  Which is a WASTE of MY time. Would NOT recommend express script, especially if you have important meds that you can't miss a dose.  The savings are not worth the hassle.
Worst experience ever. Long lines, incompetent staff have set a new follow for McDonald's. Starving is preferable to eating

My experience here was superb! From the ambiance, to the food and drinks, everything was phenomenal. I definitely see what the hype is about. I was invited here for a friend's birthday dinner, so our party size was fairly large. However, our server was patient and attentive despite the crowd. 

Drinks: most of the table started off with a lemon drop (my obsession)! This was the MOST POTENT lemon drop I've had!!! Whew. It had to be slowly sipped with caution. It was well crafted and cute, just how I like them. 

Food: As an appetizer, a friend and I shared the crab cakes. They were packed with crab meat, soft, and flavorful. My entree was the stuffed chicken. It is such a unique stuffing that is almost too good for words to describe. I loved it! And the chicken was not dry at all which was amazing. My side dish was au gratin potatoes. They were decent, likely could have used a bit more seasoning but not horrible. 

In conclusion, I had a great dining experience here. The perfect place for a celebration or date night, as the ambiance is very intimate.

Delicious, cheap, and simple.

Reminds me of the Soup Nazi on Seinfeld at times...but that only adds to the charm.

Cash only.

Great service and great food. The wait staff and owner were very friendly, professional, and checked on us several times. They were very accommodating to my food allergies (gluten and dairy). Would definitely recommend and will be returning!

The Sinking Ship is your one stop shop for excellent food (that happens to include awesomely vegan choices!), great beer and bad ass punk rock vibe. Great place to hang out and be among the hipsters.

Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Location: 4/5

Biscuit Love is where the most important meal of the day intersects with one of the top sandwiches in the nation (The East Nasty, according to a recent food network article) and my love of biscuits.  That's a combo I simply couldn't ignore while in Nashville for a show this week.  

Fortunately, I caught them on a weekday morning, so none of the long lines I expected to see.  In fact, we stepped right up to the counter, ordered and was seated immediately.  The restaurant is surprisingly modern with a hipster vibe, but they do put out an awesome breakfast, with a superb cup of coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice.  Tbh, the sandwich, as good as it was, left me a little underwhelmed.  Possibly because my expectations were off the charts, based on other sandwiches I've tried from that esteemed list I referenced earlier.  Or maybe it's just that I'm not a huge fan of chicken thigh meat.  I'd much prefer a big ole juicy breast.  I found the biscuit to be a little more dense and not as flaky as I'd like, but still damned good.  The sausage gravy and aged white cheddar cheese did pull it all together and make for a unique combo.  

The service was very good but felt a little rushed.  Our food actually arrived at the table ahead of the coffee and orange juice.  Not a big deal, but it felt a little off.  Same thing happened to the table next to us, so maybe it's their thing?  But just for the record, I'd prefer to get a few sips of my coffee before the food arrives.  Too picky?  Maybe.  

I'd go back, but would stick to a simple order of biscuits and gravy, served interestingly enough, with a side of kale salad on the plate.

Back when I was a gaucho in the 90's Jerry's Pollofino was the bomb. It was an incredible deal, and the food was excellent. We came back with our children (all teens) to show them the campus and to reminisce about our younger life together. 

The place has changed a bit, and I don't know if "Jerry" is still there, but the food is fantastic. Back in the day, it was only chicken but has now expanded to include tritip and ribs. Along with those changes, the prices have increased as they should have, and I still think it's a great value for what you get. 

I didn't give the fifth star due to a couple of reasons. First, my meal was a combo with chicken and tritip. The chicken quarter was really small and the amount of tritip was not what I expected. Additionally, the prices as stated on yelp are vastly understated and need to be updated.

For an establishment to be true to itself, weather the storms of business, and to survive for three decades is nearly a miracle, and I hope it's around in 30 more. I will be back the next time I am in town and you should visit as well!

Good beer-- I had the lime lager and enjoyed it. The bartender seemed pretty annoyed when we were trying to decide and asking questions even though there was literally no one else in line (11:30am). 
Pizza was great, but highly highly do not recommend the boneless wings. I'm pretty sure they were a part of a microwave dinner. Considering the execution of the pizza I was pretty disgusted- especially what they charge for them.
Staff was attentive. Came to our table often. 
Just pretty put off by that chicken though. It was GROSS.

Amazing. I came in really wanting meat but I very soon forgot about that craving! I'd come super hungry with a willingness to make this a splurge meal because you'll want and should get as much as you can! Here's what we got for two:

Vedge Bar: 
- Portabella Carpaccio - I had my doubts on the Portabella, but wow, it blew my mind! It was cut wonderfully and tasted as you would hope carpaccio would taste. 
- Stuffed Avocado - a must get. 
- Fresh Hearts of Palm - the purple potato causa was to die for but I surprisingly longed for the Trader Joe's jars of hearts of palm while trying the name sake. I'd pass.

Hot Kitchen:
- Braciole - tastes quite meaty and like loose sausage. If you're seeking that flavor, this is a great choice!
- Asparagus Crepe - for asparagus lovers,this is a must have. 
- Grilled Seitan - some of the best seitan that I've had at any vegetarian/vegan restaurant. 

Dirt List:
- Seared Broccoli Rabe - wonderful set of greens if you're looking for that.
- Nebrodini Mushrooms - if you're a mushroom lover, these are to die for and you HAVE to get them.

Dessert:
- Saffron Cheesecake - the rhubarb ice cream is freaking fantastic as is everything about the cheesecake.
- Togarashi Milk Duds - unfortunately, I was not into this. It is a more savory dessert so if you're looking for a not sweet and dryer dessert. 

Finally, the service was really great. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and will take your tastes into mind when offering recommendations. Go!

I recently had my front brakes replaced at this location and was impressed with their attention to detail and professionalism. I received a phone call after my vehicle was inspected and was not subjected to the typical 'upselling' that occurs at some shops. Joyce was to the point and factual with the status of my brake system, and let me know that while the rear brakes were noisy, they did not require replacement at that time. Its nice to find an honest repair shop you can trust.

I came into this experience with very low expectations. I fully expected this to be a hood movie theater but it surprised me. :-) 

Everyone on staff was friendly and attentive. The environment was pretty clean the place was filled with a diverse group of people. We enjoyed our movie date night and we'll be back when we don't feel like treating ourselves to Movie Tavern. :-)

Was visiting downtown Boise and went to the lounge that said there was food; they stopped serving and were out of what I wanted anyway (old menu on Yelp). I was told to try Reef which was around the corner. The bartender was super friendly and got me a drink quickly (simple vodka soda). I ordered the nachos with chicken, guac, and beans. Only complaint is that the nachos were so big!! It was enough for a group. But they were delicious. I enjoyed the environment and the people. The DJ, unfortunately, turned down and off at 11 pm which was early but I guess that's Reef's jam. Very welcoming environment. Late night bites.

Pretty neat spot with the type of artisan donuts you can't find elsewhere in town. 

I came in this morning for a browned butter and an eggnog creme brûlée. There was only other one patron inside on a Saturday at 9am, but the donuts looked as pretty as ever. I paid $7.25 for the two (one cake-style, one filled) and while this is the going rate for a dozen at the typical donut shop, these should not be included within that same echelon. Rather, I'd compare these confections with the artisan pastries you'd find at your local bakery or coffeehouse. 

Both donuts were very good. The browned butter had the perfect sweet/savory combination, and the eggnog creme brûlée was perfectly crisped on the outer shell just like the real deal. The eggnog filling was particularly tasty as well. 

Will this spot last in Santa Barbara? I sure hope so. If the prices were lowered a bit, there's no doubt that this place would be a winner.

1 star b/c fewer isn't an option.  Terrible.  Loews is not a "resort" & barely a hotel.  Planned to have a spa vacation with a friend.  We are both native Arizonans and were coming back for a little R&R.   It was early October, still warm, therefore the "slow" season.  We got a good deal on the room, but the rest was downhill.

Arrived, the valet was overly chatty. Told us we could either park ourselves or valet depending on where our room was and our preference.  Didn't mention that it was $9/day either way.

Porter wouldn't stop talking as he brought our bags up.  He wouldn't leave either.  So we finally shoved $10 in his hand & showed him the door.  A larger tip than deserved, but we just wanted him to leave.

That night we spoke to 3 different people about the Ventana hike (on the resort property).  Each of them told us something different:  "12 miles round trip,"  "6 miles round-trip and you should plan for several hours,"  "I think it's about 4 miles, but here's a pamphlet on it, all the details are in it."  The pamphlet was just as confusing as the descriptions from the hotel employees.  So, we figured we would just start out on the trail and go as far as we could until we felt like turning around and coming back.

Dinner the first night was ok, but expensive.  

I had my lap top, tried to figure out how to connect to the internet.  The message that comes up is "applicable charges may apply..."   Really?  Seriously?  Well, ok, if you insist on nickel-and-diming me, then what the hell is the fee?  It was vague enough that I just turned off the computer.  Didn't want to risk being charged $20/day for internet access when I could do the routine stuff on my iPhone.

Reading the hotel guide in the room trying to figure out which spa treatments to do, then realized there was a daily fee to use the hotel gym.  Seriously?

Next morning, had breakfast.  It was fine, portions were big, but nothing spectacular.  Went to the spa to make reservations for the afternoon... lady at the counter was a horrible person.  The fake salesperson.  She listened to my friend and I discuss the treatment options, she told us which massages were the most popular, which ones treatments were no longer offered, etc.  We were entertaining the idea of purchasing a package, $250 for 3 treatments.  She said, "well, you'll have to do all the treatments in one day, we can't split them up..."  Seriously, the resort is empty, is it such a big deal to split up the treatments?  We were only there for 2 days.  Fine, we each picked a massage, we scheduled our time.

Went for the hike.  Dry season, not the best AZ hike, good exercise, but not very pretty.  Came back to the "resort" through the back, walked by a t.v. monitor that was advertising things for the resort, on the monitor in a flash we see something that says, "Spa Happy Hour..."  Waited for the loop to go around.  Apparently there are spa deals to be had.

Went to the front desk to inquire.  That person had no idea what the Spa Happy Hour was.  Bellhop, had no idea.  Went to the Concierge who had no idea.  Finally she called the spa... multiple treatments offered during the slow season for 1/2 price.  The bitchy lady at the spa never told us there were specials.  May have changed our minds on what we scheduled for that afternoon.  We were pissed.  We rescheduled our treatments for the Spa Special Massage.  

1.  Why don't the people at this resort all know their facts?
2.  Why wouldn't you tell people about spa specials, isn't the point of having a special  to have more people sign up for things?  Afterall, it's the slow season.
3. Why would a "resort" nickel-and-dime the customer.  It's unbelievably irritating to be charged $5 for this $10 for that, just add it into the price of the room.  Seriously, the Holiday Inn offers free wi-fi, so WTF?

Dinner that night was fine, not great and not worth the money.  I live in NYC now, so when I pay $60 for dinner, I want it to be really good....

Next day, went to have brunch.  My friend ordered the fish tacos, asked the server if the tortillas were corn or flour because she has a gluten allergy.  He said, "pretty sure they are corn."  Our food arrives, he sets the tacos down in front of her and says, "oh I was wrong, they are flour tortillas, is that ok."  I finally said, no it's not okay.  She has an allergy.  his response, "it's no big deal we can make them with corn it will just take a couple minutes..."

So many things wrong with this interaction:
1.  Why wouldn't the server come back out and ask beforehand if flour was okay.  Why would he bring the food out and then ask?
2.  If it's so damn easy to make them with corn, then make the f***ing tacos with corn tortillas
3.  The correct tacos were brought back by a manager.  We never saw the server again... (chickens**t, he was probably afraid we would rip him a new one).  Manager offered us a free dessert.  How lame.

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER.

The best place to start the day with a great drink but better staff and customers.  A real joy to begin the day with a smile, someone says your name and acts like they are really happy to see you.  Can't eat all that I want but the baked goods are excellent.  We even special order cakes and pies for parties.  Easily the best coffee drinks from real experts.

Horrible service. My server was Oreo, she looked a mess and  disheveled. She shoes were not even in dress code she was wearing flats with brightly colored socks...Her uniform didn't match the other server's. She had a cotton shirt on while other server's had button down shirts and blacks pants. I don't know how they would even put a girl on the floor looking as she did. She never came back for refills or to ask how the food was. I had complained to Kendra the manger who looked like she could care less about my option. After I had complained to Kendra I saw her and my server talking and laughing Clearly my compliment went in one ear and out the other.  Stay far away from this place.

For the amount of money that I spent the customer service was lacking at the store and the presence of management. I enjoyed the variety and the arrangement of the store. The prices were a bit exorbitant compared to other brands in the area such as whole foods and fresh market in particular the meat section. I was especially disappointed in the service that I received at checkout from an elderly clerk by the name of Sydney. His attitude was extremely nasty and very unwelcoming which prompted me never to return to that turnip truck location. I had a better experience at the Charlotte Pike location which was much bigger and the customer service was extremely inviting.

This location closes at 9 pm. I got in their line that was wrapped around the building at 8:38 pm. I made it to the order window at 9:03 and was told they were closed and wouldn't take my order despite me having been in their line for almost half an hour. I was honestly stunned at how poor their service is. Maybe take a class from Chick-Fil-A. They can move their line efficiently, and would never refuse service. Absolutely horrible service.

I preordered an order for curbside pickup.  I texted back to cancel my order due to not taking my baby out in the bad weather.  I received a text back asking for my address and they would deliver my order.  I thought that was unbelievably nice, and when this awesome lady came to my door, she refused to take my credit card.  She simply said she didn't want me to be stuck without dinner.  This is the nicest thing someone has done for me in a long time and so greatly appreciated!!!

A great place to listen to some jazz and blues.  The bar is tiny.  It maybe sits 7 people, with 3 or 4 tables.  Dollar bills stapled all over the bar.  An awesome mural of Louis Armstrong.  One of those no cover, but buy a drink at the bar places.  Also attached to a great restaurant upstairs (can you say Adolfo's).  Everything is cash, so be prepared.  A great, down to earth place for some music.  The bartenders are great and very personable.  I really love the place.

Came here last week for drinks and it was a pretty chill experience. The bartender was as attentive and the drinks were cheap, nice selection of beers on tap. The food wasn't much to be excited about, the apps came out luke warm and barely ok. I expected more as the menu notes everything is made fresh. We even got food to go which was again below par, don't expect much from this place in terms of food. Definitely a good drink spot tho.

I usually go to Bayfront Urgent Care but decided to try Doctor's Express. The wait time was so much faster than Bayfront. The staff was great! X-rays took no time at all and the wait time for the doctor was minimal. I would definitely go back there again.

Yummy burger. Yummy beer!! However, when you walk in the place, the waitresses working the dining area looks at you weird and doesn't greet you (maybe it's their thing). I'm not offended because my loud ass will ask if I have a question right away lol. Overall, a chill spot when I don't wanna go to the SPTR. I like sitting outside (only when there isn't mosquitoes!) and chatting away with my guest without having to yell over loud music.

Went with family on the Food Tour and had a great time. Brad, our tour guide and local fire fighter was awesome. He was dun to be with and knowledgeable about the area and its history and gave us fun insights about the local restaurants, the ones we went into and some that we didn't. It seemed that his primary concern was his guests on the tour. He wanted to make sure you were being taken care of. The service everywhere was great; they were happy to see us but I can't say the same at the Batch. We visited several great restaurants and the stops progressively became more filling. We started with perfectly made cold brewed coffee with a wonderful heavy grained bread with jelly at Sparkroot. Next was the Hub where we sampled several of their wonderful ice creams we all loved each flavor we tried and had some of their famous corned-beef with was lean and tender along with very tasty filling, crispy cheese curds. Then to Empire Pizza and had a slice of great Margarita pizza. On to Reilly for brussel sprouts (a little greasy) and bruschetta with prosciutto. At La Cocina we had a Thai peanut quinoa salad; very good. Then the famous El Charro for tamales, I tried the pork it was good but a little spicy for me. All alcohol was on our own dime and at El Charro I had a Margarita and it was amazing, perfect combo of sweet and sour. Last stop was the Batch known for it donuts and boubon. The donuts were very good but waitress seemed to be purposely ignoring us at the bar where several of us were looking to purchase drinks and never got to. But despite that glitch the tour was a lot of fun and we met a lot of great people. Definitely a worthwhile excursion!

New nail place in Kingsway. Went here on April 23rd as a walk in client and was greeted right away. The place is new and very clean, two ladies who also came in mentioned how clean it was. The nail tech did a great job, didnt cut my cuticles and shaped my nails nicely. Took approx 30 minutes. Total came go $42.00 which is average for getting shellac polish done. I'll definitely be going back.

Have shopped here for years not sure if recent manager change over but the owner's son was the rudest most unhelpful person to the point where we will never shop here ever again. The owner's son knows nothing about customer service. We went to Beck's and bought $400 worth of shoes and sandals.

I have lived in Nashville for almost 4 years, and I have just had the honor and pleasure of dining at Cafe Margot!  How is it that I have missed out on the incredible deliciousness all this time.  Cafe Margot is like no other Nashville restaurant I have eaten at.  Romantic and cozy featuring thoughtful dishes with high quality ingredients.  Cafe Margot changes their menu daily which means there is always something new to try.  I have eaten at Cafe Margot 2x times in the past month and cannot wait to return.  This place gets 5 giant stars in my book!

Decided to try out Bru Burgers devour indy menu and it was pretty good! The menu has plenty of burger options  to choose from the bourbon burger is a popular choice.. very very good. My friend got the salmon burger, if you're looking for a meal on the lighter, healthier, side but still lots of flavor definitely give the salmon burger a try. It was delish. I grabbed the bourbon burger! I brought the leftovers home and GONE!! So everything was delish. You're I'll enjoy bru Burger. It is your typical burger so the combos are delish and different which makes it fun and different. 

Bru Burger is apart of Cunningham restraunts and you can't go wrong with Cunningham!

Enjoy your burger!

I searched happy hour near me,and I was led to Convivo's facebook happy hour menu.  $5.00 margaritas and $8.00 flat bread sounded awesome.  Also $5.00 drafts.  When I got there, the menu didn't match the advertised prices.  $7.00 margaritas and $13.00 flat bread.  I address with the waiter and he said sorry.  I also showed the manager pictures of the Facebook post, and he said- let me speak to marketing.  This restaurant does not operate under the fair in advertising laws that the rest of us need to follow.

Pretty much what everyone else says in their reviews: great comfortable environment, kind staff, and a killer Cafe Borgia. Didn't even know what that was, but all I know now is that it is an addictive coffee drink that makes you feel all warm and fuzzy inside.

I thought the pizza was excellent, nice thin crust, great sauce, and the cheese was great too, just enough oil to make it tasty without being greasy.  I am looking forward to having this pizza again whenever I am in the area.

My first dining experience at WabiSabi was amazing and I encourage everyone to come visit them as chef/owner Buck and the team won't disappoint you. 
The restaurant is located inside the Santa Barbara Public Market, with open bar seatings. I notice the bar seating is very roomy with brand new spacious counter top, I prefer it to tiny tables at traditional sushi place. 
The food is fresh and amazingly delicious. I had bluefin tuna and salmon nigiri, spicy tuna roll, avocado roll. Every bite was tasty and you won't see sauces drizzling all over like other sushi places. I also tried tuna poke salad, it was delicious, flavors were great, and the crunchy noodles on top was a nice touch. I also like their tempura, the batter was light, veggies were really fresh and they were fried perfectly. The garlic shishito was also a nice appetizer, I liked the bonita flakes that chef added on, more umami flavors. 
Their alcohol license is coming soon. I purchased a bottle of sake at Wine plus Beer prior to dinner and they were happily serving you there. 
The chef and the staff were super nice and friendly. I had a really good time and delicious dinner at WabiSabi. I can't wait to come back!

First Chruch's Chicken in Alberta! So awesome that they have picked Edmonton to be the first city to open this franchise.

Our meal was hot and fresh. We went a little bit earlier than lunch time to try this. It wasn't too busy because I think it's still the soft opening.

Chicken- we had two choices of flavours: original or spicy. 

We picked both to compare and the spicy wasn't all that spicy; nonetheless, the chicken was crispy and delicious. The spicy flavour was more of a black pepper spice.

Honey Butter Biscuits - were really delicious! It reminded me of pancakes and syrup.

Jalapeno Cheese Bombers are my FAVORITE!! 
These croquette looking things were actually spicy and it was filled with movie theater nacho melty cheese. These were so good that we ordered it again when we finished the first bag lol $3.99 for the medium, it did not disappoint.

Lastly, the fries dipped in gravy was manificent. 
If you love crinkle cut fries then you'll love the fries here.

I will definitely be making my way back to the north side of Edmonton to eat this again . I am very interested in trying their burgers.

Talk about intense... Standing in line is scarier than the actual ride though. 

While you ascend it's easy to forget what's about to happen. I usually look around and admire the view. When I feel it start to slow down and start moving towards the face down position, my adrenaline kicks in and I can't help but feel like I'm about to fall out of the seat. 

I've ran out of air in my lungs while screaming before I reached the end of the drop. I wasn't really sure what to do so I just enjoyed the rush till we reached the bottom. 

I have ridden this ride over and over again. So awesome. It's a 300 ft + tall tower.

My group and I visited Liberty Common for brunch and it set the bar incredibly high for the remainder of our trip. Everything about our visit was wonderful! Chicken sandwich (hot) was delicious and the fries were perfect! I love the decor and vibe of this place. We might return for a second time this weekend!

Michaels is the best. They have the friendliest staff ever and everyone at this particular Michaels has been so helpful!!! They have everything you need from glitter to custom framing (although in this area I love Poets for framing more!), but they have it!!! The shopping center is super convenient and has lots of other great shops for staples like Five Below, Petco, and TJ Max. 5 stars, highly recommend for all your art/craft/quelling boredom needs.
Best BBQ around.  After eating here more, I have a deep craving for it.  The pulled pork Caesar is a highlight, as are the ribs.  The fries are also BOMB.

Excited to find this unusual cuisine in Philly. Sort a mix of Indian and South Asian. Cozy, small, attractive, with efficient and friendly servers. BYOB. Reasonable prices. A little too noisy tho; could use some carpet to dim the noise. Get the momos! Steamed dumplings with chicken, veg or pork. Yum. 
Only take reservations for 6 or more, but we had no trouble getting seated.

Grab a slice of the tomato pie while you wait for your sandwich. The roast pork with the broccoli rabe is as good as John's in Philly.  Has the gravy that I got on the side to make it wet. This place is takeout only, old school and worth a trip from anywhere.

I'm not gonna lie when I say I literally NEVER gamble. I've lived in south jersey for a very long time, and I had no idea SugarHouse was located in Northern Liberties. 

I'm used to the AC Casino lifestyle, so it felt kind of weird being here. The lowest table minimum was $15 whereas in AC, they have $5 table minimums which is great for those non-gamblers like myself. While $15 is not a lot, I was still too nervous to try my luck. The blackjack tables were all full with experts and people who come probably everyday. So, I tried my luck at a roulette table and lost $15. All in all, I don't really like the vibe. I would still choose AC over SH any day.

The food here is great for a buffet. There are many varieties to choose from including Mediterranean. 
My husband and I come for Sunday Bruch and ask for Pudi each time.  She is the best. Very on top of things and super friendly.  Great service all the time. Love the Pho.
My one real complaint would be they only serve poultry gravy.  No brown gravy. Who wants poultry gravy with prime rib and mashed potatoes?  The slot for the gravy is big enough to split between the two.
Overall the place is great to sit and relax and have a wonderful time!

Love love love First Watch for non alcoholic brunch!  This is the first time I have visited since the menu changed.  It appears that they are trying to offer healthier options.  The omelettes now come with a side of greens.  I love greens but here is the problem!!! I love First Watch potatoes even more!! They did substitute potatoes for me but I did not get the heaping portion they normally provide. Not sure if they changed the menu because customers wanted healthier options or because it helps their bottom line.  In any case, still a great brunch spot. I think it is absolutely genius that they give free coffee while you wait. Makes waiting so much easier. Wish more brunch restaurants with long waits would catch on.

This place has major coffee shop hipster vibes. I ordered their seasonal coffee called the "Hoodie." This latte was made with cinnamon and honey. I loved it as it wasn't overly sweet and gave me my caffeine fix! 

For breakfast I ordered their lox bagel on an everything bagel. I personally have never tried this and something inside me told me to try something new. 

While the coffee came out fast, it took longer than expected for my lox bagel to come out. If it would have came out faster, this would have been a five star experience. 

The lox bagel was delicious and I have zero complaints on that. It was visually pleasing with the vibrant colors from the salmon, onions and capers. The cream cheese was a nice contrast of sweet and smooth to the savory onions and salmon.

This place should be outlawed! Fried chicken and donuts? I was puking for three days!! There is no way this food combination should be allowed. It is just nauseating thinking about it. I had the fried chicken with a blueberry pancaake donut. Who makes that? Never again. WAAAAY too many healthy options in this great city to be consuming this thrown together mess.

Hands down favorite vegan spot in Tampa. Everything on this menu is amazing and cooked/flavored to perfection. My go-to is always the pepper steak/brown rice with a watermelon smoothie. The family owned business is always welcoming whether it be on the phone or person and the food is always fresh and ready to go for pick-up.

I couldn't be happier with Dr. Lloyd and his staff. I am an adult who was terrified of getting braces but he has made my treatment a breeze. Affordable payment plan was offered, making it a lot less stressful. I appreciate him and his staff so much!!

We came here for my mother's birthday. We called ahead of time to make a reservation and asked if they do anything special for birthdays. Turns out they do! They actually decorated the table and had a special menu with my mother's name on it. For dessert, they brought my mom a plate with a piece of chocolate truffle and happy birthday written on it. For reservations of 5 or more, they require that you call to make your reservation instead of doing it online. Beware there is a $20 charge per person if you don't show up to your reservation. The interior of the restaurant was unique and definitely had the feelings of a upscale restaurant. Since we came during coolinary month, they had a special going on that offered an certain appetizer, entree, and dessert for the price of $39. There were 3 appetizers, entrées, and desserts to choose from. As appetizers for the table, we had the tempura fin wings and the barbecue shrimp. People in our party who did coolinary had either lobster bisque, tuna tacos, or the royal red shrimp as their appetizer. As entrees, we either had fried soft shell crab, wasabi crusted wahoo, or the mackerel. For the two individuals who didn't do Coolinary, they had the New Bedford sea scallops and chicken breast as their entree. The desserts that we had were pecan pie, carrot cake, and sorbet. Everything was amazing! I loved how certain dishes had a Southeastern Asian flare to it. We all really enjoyed the food. The seafood was super fresh. Soft shell crabs were a very good size. Food portions were solid. On top of all this, service was definitely one of the best I ever experienced. The waiter and the others who helped always made sure that we had everything that we needed. Waters were constantly refilled. Empty plates were always picked up in a timely manner. I cannot rave enough about this place. It definitely can get expensive but I would definitely recommend it for anyone who is celebrating a special occasion and are in search of fresh seafood in the downtown area!

P.S. If you are looking for Cajun/Creole food, this would not be the best option to go to.

Feel like I should preface this with saying before a career change, I was a manager at a 5-star 5-diamond Ritz Carlton so I know very well what a hotel of this caliber should look/feel/smell/etc like. 

I'll start with the reasons why I'm taking away two stars and unfortunately they all have to do with the restaurant. When we got in, I had two drinks at the bar. The next day while at breakfast, I checked my credit card statement and I noticed my card was never actually run. Weird. So I mentioned it to the restaurant manager. Part of me thought she would have done what I would have done back in my Ritz Carlton managerial days: thank the guest for their honesty and tell them not to worry about the charge. But she actually never once thanked me for my honesty and for bringing that to her attention and instead went out of her way to charge the card. She asked what I got and I told her. She couldn't find these particular wines on the menu in the restaurant at which point I was sure she would say 'hey do not worry about it, just come back and see us.'..Or something to that effect that you'd expect from a four seasons. Instead she and the host went on a search in the bar for the menu I had ordered from to figure out exactly how much to charge me. In the end, she did charge me for the two glasses of wine I'd had the night before. 

Onto breakfast - oomph. I was pretty thrown off by the fact that it seemed like 5 different servers interacted with me during my meal. Who was "my server"? It seemed a little too much. I ordered English breakfast tea and the chia pudding with fruit and it was all great. No complaints about the meal itself. The fruit on the chia pudding was particularly delicious and you could tell it was fresh. I would definitely order this again! However, while the food was a hit, the service was a miss for me. When I'd asked the server if the chia pudding was vegan, he did not know. You'd think, again because it's a Four Seasons (!), that they would be extremely knowledgeable about their menu. Of course he did go check for me and assured me that it was. THEN, about halfway through my meal, I had told a server (again, it really was not ever clear who "my server" was) that I was going to use the restroom and be right back. I'd taken my wallet and phone with me but had made it clear to him that I'd be returning. When I got back from the restroom 5 minutes later, the entire table was cleared. What?! To make a long story short, a couple minutes later they brought back out the same exact meal I'd been eating and I continued on with breakfast. Maybe something you'd expect from your run of the mill Hilton? Not what you expect at a Four Seasons. Did not receive any apologies for clearing the table either. Again, I put myself in that situation as a server (or manager) at a 5-star property and I 100% would have brought the guest an entirely new meal. The chia pudding cost them maybe $3 to make and they charge somewhere around $16 for it...this is called simple service recovery. In short, was not impressed with the dining experience overall. 

Onto the good. Aesthetically, this place is to die for and the location couldn't be beat. Maybe 20 steps from the ocean. The grounds of the hotel are just immaculate. The property is extremely well taken care of from top to bottom and every inch is just beautiful and everything seems exceptionally clean. The entire vibe of the place made me feel like I was on the  Amalfi Coast - particularly the pool area and the tile in the bathrooms. The rooms (and closet especially) are spacious and well done. 

Overall, I would definitely come back here but would probably choose to eat out rather than dining at the restaurant again.

This is one of my favorite go-to pizza places. I wish they were open later on weekends for post bar/late night pizza cravings. We usually get the Old World Pizza which is very good. Their pizza is thicker crust but not too chewy. I also like how big their menu is so we can easily throw in some apps or wings when we feel like it.

Stopped in because Justine was closing and they recommended. Service at the bar was great, my sister said her gumbo was good (not great compared to some others), mom loved her chicken sandwich but my Cuban sandwich was amazing. I don't usually order Cubans but dang, guys! I thought it looked burnt at first but it was amazing and glad to be able to order just the sandwich without fries which can be too much food. I'm surprised but I might be comparing other sandwiches to that one for a while.
I like round table pizza but wow 30 bucks for a medium pizza ouch.. and on top of that they charge for ranch.. don't think that should ever happen.. maybe if you want extra.. yikes

I felt so spoiled from the moment I walked into Art Plus Science. From awesome staff greeting you (the gentleman at the front desk is so sweet!), chair massage, head massage while watching footage of the beach, being offered fancy drinks.... I felt like all that, and a bag of chips. 

It was such a lovely experience...

As for the haircuts... fantastic. I've seen both Jasmine and Kim... and let me tell you, both are exceptional at what they do. Both gave me the cut and style I wanted! 

Most recently I saw Kim and I'm in LOVE with the layers she gave me. She made my natural hair feel like silk it is so smooth and healthy looking. She gave me what I asked and more!

I also want to note I got my eyebrows done by Kimberly! She was so much fun to talk to and I could hardly feel a thing! Perfect place to go if you have sensitive skin. Kimberly was extremely knowledgeable and gave me great advice on different product lines! 

I'll be sticking to this salon for as long as I live in Philly! If you're looking for a place to pamper yourself and look amazing, it's time to make your appointment at Art+Science!

We were told when in St. Louis you have to try Imo's. After a long day at the Magic House (look for review) we grabbed lunch here. The parking situation is very confusing and was hard to get into. It's behind the building on a steep side incline. Once inside I asked for a menu but they don't have printed ones so I took pictures of the menu sat at a table and decided what we were going to order. 
The space is pretty comfortable small and is more of a take out vibe than a seated restaurant. 
The lady who took our order was very friendly and honest in regards to portion and sizes so we didn't order more than we needed I appreciated that. 
We order pizza, wings, and a salad. Everything was great in regards to flavor, portions and sauces. The pizza is extremely thin, I didn't expect it to be that thin, it felt more like eating pizza toppings on a crepe. If you don't care for thin crust pizza this is not the place to eat. 
The wings were sauced a lot. I love super saucy wings were as my husband doesn't so that's a personal preference thing. 
The salad was a typical garden salad with olives and cheese, it was pretty big for a half size. 
We would definitely recommend and go back.

TLDR: Cheap delicious korean food in a low key, casual setting. Some dishes are hits, while others are misses.

Tips: get the bulgogi burrito or bento box special, the wings and the fried rice are disappointing.

I've gotten Koreana around 5-6 times by now (through delivery and in person), and the only thing stopping me from visiting more often is the distance. This is the cheapest I've seen korean food (compared to other places in Boston and Philadelphia), and the portions are very generous. The bulgogi burrito is my go-to, especially since it's a two-mealer and I think it's a more interesting concept than traditional Korean food. The stone pots are very good as well, although it comes with the fried egg on top fully cooked (I think the norm is sunny-side-up style instead). The pork fried rice is pretty generic and flavorless--I'm not a fan of the cubed carrot and pea mix they use. I was looking forward to the wings, but they're TINY and totally not worth it. I don't believe we received any banchan (side dishes) when came in person, and definitely not through delivery

The decor is pretty no-frills, and there's some picnic tables for outdoor seating. No complaints with the service.

Overall, if you stick with the stuff they're good at, then you'll enjoy Koreana!

This is my favorite Juice place in town!

2 great locations! One downtown with indoor seating. One in Broad Ripple with outdoor seating.

Plenty of options to choose from Juices, blended juices, smoothies, and Acai bowls.
