Friendly, helpful and willing to go the extra mile for you. They get the bottles for you, fill them and put them in your car. And, the water is exceptional! Great taste, clean and crisp!!

It took them 7 hours to sell me car. They supposedly had it "detailed" but it was dirty when handed over. I paid for it to get detailed elsewhere and somehow they were magically able to get the stains off the seats that Subaru couldn't. 

The salesman was nice. Not pushy. I appreciated him- honestly if he wasnt there I probably wouldn't have purchased from this dealership. He made the bullcrap 7 hour wait a bit more tolerable. 

It's also worth noting that it was everyone's first day. Literally. In my experience that means management sucks.

I wish I could give zero stars, if you want to be lied to on more than one occasion def go there to work!  Lied about when I would get paid, even asking multiple times. Even asking HR, it wasn't just 1 person but 2 and these people are totally brain dead. Monique is awesome too bad you can't just deal with her. Zero stars!!!! Go work for Home Instead!

First time eating here with my family and friend. Came because the pic on IG for the quesabirria. One of the those expectations vs reality moments. What I received wasn't like the pic. Plus they over charged everything. The menu said $3.75 for aqua Fresca but charged $5, beer on tap $6 but charged $9. I didnt even get a chance to see what they charged me on the food because was so upset with the total price $120 for 6 people! The excuse was they have new updated menus but haven't received them, how convenient. They took close to $20 dollars off but even then by doing the math off the menu prices my bill should have been $82 before tax but paid $106. I dont mind paying for anything if I know what the price is but absolutely hate getting ripped off. Gave it a try because of the IG pics but never again. Checks your receipts if you do decide to eat there.
Walked in and the horrible fish bad oil smell made me gag !!! Had to turn around and leave !!

Deceitful !!!!! Worst company I have ever dealt with ! Quoted one price and over charged by hundreds of dollars on moving day  and there was nothing I could do about it ! They showed up with a HUGE moving van for my tiny one bedroom apartments belongings that I initially told them I required moving ... not much stuff ! Chris the owner was rude and obnoxious he said he emailed with possible "up charges" that could impact the price but I never received them ! I was quoted $200.00 ... but that number went to $800.00 !!!
Shocking !!! They should be ashamed of themselves ... judging by a lot of other reviews I see they keep doing it to people !!! Horrible !!!

Fantastic fellows here, Trevor, Mike, Jeff the technician, fixed my daughter's 2014 Jeep Wrangler Sahara--had a broken heater & had to go over frigid Donner--They took it in same day, diagnosed problem & fixed it w/a blend door actuator in less than three hours--felt so grateful, organic Pacific Redwood pinot to celebrate these three amazing auto amigos! They don't just do air & heating either. They do it all, w/care & humor & Wrangler finesse. Thank you, guys!

Yu De. Thai is the absolute best Thai food in Reno/Sparks area. I have tried a few Thai places now and this is where ill continue to come definitely the winner. I love their yellow curry, the portions are awesome for the price. The chicken satay and tofu satay are amazing. the flavor is incredible. I also love the fried rice and the orange chicken. these dishes are full of flavor and quite large portions. 
The restaurant feels so homey and the tables are perfect for families! 
love this place so much!!! 10000/10 definitely try it out!

An amazing place to eat and drink. We had a wonderful experience with Andrew and mary. They were knowledgeable and helpful. The experimental brews were awesome and deliciously different. Very unique experience. The beers were great and they had wonderful food. We had the cracklings and piemento cheese dip and great fried  cheese curds with a pepper jelly.  Omg good.  Wonderful space not to be missed. They have wonderful outside space just right for beer drinking.  Hard to find use Waze. Loved it.

A few visits in now, here's my rundown:

What I don't like:
The bar stools -  they are attached to the ground. If you're not normal sized (like me) sitting at the bar is VERY uncomfortable.

What I like:

The vibe -  cornhole, ping pong and other activities to entertain you while you partake of the beverage of your choice and hang with family or friends.
The service -  we've gotten our food fast and last time they forgot to sub my salad for the requested soup. They rectified it by giving me a cup of soup for free.  
The food - My wife and I ordered different burgers so we could split them and try both... the Pub and the M.A.C. The Pub burger was supposed to come with havarti, BBQ sauce and bacon... only they forgot the bacon. Huh? How does that happen? Once it was added it was a good burger. The M.A.C. is a shameless reincarnation of the same thing as that place with the golden arches... only CD's version is WAY better. My wife and I agreed if we go back, that's what it would be for.

What I love:

The pretzel bites with provolone fondue. . You have to be extremely careful not to fill up on these if you order them as an appetizer. I'm also pretty fond of the beer selection and drinks in general. Their cocktails are creative and tasty.

All in all, there's little to complain about here (except the bar stools). It'll definitely be someplace that stays on our radar when we're looking for someplace outside our usual rotation of places.

Always excellent dining experience when we eat here. The food and service are great. They are usually packed on the weekend but we lucked up because of the holiday and got a last minute reservation.  I ordered the sea bass and my wife had the scallops.  Both were excellent along with the sautéed shrimp we started with.  Make sure you order the Maduro Relleno.

The Reverend Dr. Steak and I happened upon this restaurant after dropping the Young 'Un off at one of his 10,000,000 activities.  We're always game for a new breakfast spot.  

We weren't game with Mrs. Marty's.  The space is clean, well lit and reasonably comfortable with many 2 and 4 tops available.  Service was decent, if a little scattered and disjointed (it was not overly crowded though there were others there).  The food was just...underwhelming.

First, pet peeve.  Hot Chocolate served with "whipped topping (AKA Cool Whip in an aerosol can)" is disgusting.  Pile of white grease on top of my cocoa.  Ugh.  Spend the extra twenty cents to buy real whipped cream, would ya?

French toast was fine.  Belgian waffle was...chewy.  Rubbery. Not interested in absorbing butter or syrup.  Odd.  In a not really appetizing way.  

No SOS on the menu either.  That's fine.  I don't think this place will make the rotation of breakfast spots for us.  It really was just, well, 'meh'.
Got the tampa two and am OBSESSED. Eating in is fine but they only have outdoor seating. Staff is always kind and helpful in recommending things.

These dinner devours come from the golden oldie @saloonphilly . This south philly restaurant is 57 years old and have been around since 1964. The establishment has a parking lot and two floors . It's fill with antics and a great staff. It's a traditional restaurant with a lot of older folk. Bathrooms were really clean  and made of nothing but ivory . While here i was seated at the bar and my wonder dope bartender/server Gigi aka Giana. She was very easy to talk to and she walked me through the menu. I ordered the salmon  fruitti di mare with crab meat, topped with lemon capers and fresh tomato. The menu has changed so i was unable to be the mussels, clams, and shrimp. I was very disappointed in this but it was after i devoured the delicious fish! The salmon was excellent and the crab meat was phenomenal! If your ever in south philly and want some great veal or seafood please check out  @saloonphilly and ask for gigi and tell her Mr. Julian sent you!!!  #philly #philadelphia #food #foodphotography #foodpics #foodporn #foodie #fish #salmon #crab #lemon #capers #butter #garlic #water #shrimp #mussels

3 beers for $6! I was so excited about that "special" until I saw everyone else on Bourbon Street offers pretty much the same deal. So what sets this joint apart? Probably depends on when you wonder by. We wondered by on a Sunday afternoon right after the Saints won, so it was probably a good time to stop in.

They were playing some bumpin' music and the hype woman was getting people up on stage to dance for shots. It ranged from the amazingly good twerker to the incredibly old lady who flashed us her boobs. So I guess the entertainment value was pretty high for us.

Were the floors sticky? Yes. But was the people watching worth it? Absolutely!

First time at Tokyo Sushi, first time I was at this location was back when it was Sushi Boat, over ten years ago. Big upgrade from the way it used to be, the new layout makes it look much bigger. I like the decor and the space. Now onto the food, pretty good tasting sushi, they have a lot of variety, my favorite one was The Lion King. They also have a lot of appetizer options, I like how they have two types of mussels, both of them are pretty tasty. The tempura banana dessert was also pretty good. Good service too, everything we ordered was brought to our table very quickly and the staff was very pleasant.

I kept seeing this cafe pop up on my Yelp options as an advertisement, so I finally made my way over to try it out. Don't go Monday, they're closed. 

Spacious seating with distinct areas. There is the upper floor, which has sofas and tables, the area by the door, allowing for passerby viewing, and a bar to chatter with the employees.

They offer soups and sandwiches along with teas and coffees. The cookies are incredible, especially the ginger cookies. 

I also tried the lavender latte iced, but I didn't taste much of the lavender.

Overall, an okay experience, but there is definitely room for improvement. The quality could have been better, as well as the service. With so many new coffee places opening, you need to set yourself apart somehow. Maybe focusing on quality, unique flavors, and local artists.

LOVED IT!!

Took my teen-aged son and step-son to New Orleans for Spring Break. I was planning on taking them on a Swamp Tour but when we passed by the Segway shop, they both begged me to do this instead. So glad we did!

The staff was very professional and prompt.  The staff on site and our guide, Mark Rowland, took their time, being very patient in teaching us how to operate the segway.  

The tour itself takes 3 hours. The guide takes you on a journey starting with Jackson Square and the French Quarter and then moving slowly up to the Treme' neighborhood, stopping at multiple locations along to way to show you different landmarks and to tell fascinating stories about those landmarks and the city, in general.  

About halfway through the tour, they will stop and have a coffee break and then resume the tour by taking you up to Marigny and Bywater and then finally along the banks of the Mississippi River.  

If you have a choice of guides, request Mark Rowland.  I learned more about New Orleans and the Quarter from him in those 3 hours than all my previous (and numerous) visits combined.  Really a great guide.

The BBQ chicken came to the table, not just undercooked but bloody still on the inside. Since the outside had such a well done grilled look to it makes you wonder if its just painted on. Had it replaced with the dry rubbed ribs which were not under cooked and good.

The interior is clean and modern looking. It was a nice evening, so they had the windows open to the street which was ok as long as the wind didn't blow the occasional city stench into the restaurant.  Would have a much better experience on a different street. 

Even without the raw chicken experience it would be hard to give this place more than 3 stars.

I have had two visits here with both being enjoyable for the bar and one being a disaster for the food.  My first visit here was during Veteran's day when they had a nice discount for military vets so I really appreciated that gesture and had couple of beers and enjoyed the amazing rooftop bar view. 
I then decided to sample some of the food and got the duck confit grilled cheese sandwich which arrived cold and the duck was so full of gristle it was inedible then to add insult to injury I was given a paltry amount of fries with it.  My next visit was as a part of a Yelp Elite perk and this visit went much better and the bar seemed to be far better organized than during my first visit.  I told the manager about my last experience and he comped me another duck confit sandwich that was delicious and the complete opposite of the last one I had been served.  The only other thing that seems a bit off to me here is that they don't offer parking validation for customers of the bar which is standard practice at most of the other places like this in the area.

Overall the view alone is worth the cost of a visit here and that view does come with a premium on the price of the drinks here.  My food experience here would give me some caution but they did make up for the initial bad experience I had and the crab beignets were also very nice.  The portion size of the "sharables" section of their menu here I also would say are NOT sharable for the normal appetites of most men I know but maybe they would be for some ladies enjoying snacks and cocktails at this establishment.  I would emphasize "snacks" as I don't think most folks would make a full meal out of most of the "sharables" menu selections here.

My video review is here:

https://youtu.be/jV7y9oeKjxk

A solid 4 star experience! The wife and I were craving Chinese and our 'go-to' wasn't open so we had the opportunity to try something new. The food was wonderful so we really enjoyed our experience!
I opted for the General's Chicken, it had a great, unique flavor I really enjoyed, not too much heat either. The major let down here was that it didn't come with rice, we had to pay extra for a side dish. The wife chose the house pan-fried noodles, the sauce had the perfect amount of flavor but could have used a bit more chicken as far as the meat goes. Had they included rice this easily would have been worth the extra star. The service was very friendly and there wasn't a wait for seating during our visit. Food came out hot and didn't take long to prepare. Prices were reasonable, we will easily go here again in the future!

This is the only major pen store in Edmonton and I am very disappointed. 

The staff need to be retrained. Or they could just restaff the store. Unfortunately, I find this to be the case with many pen stores, but Stylus really takes the cake. The employee who "helped" me did seem to know her pens, but she does not know her sales. Maybe this is how they are trained, but she had the same delivered lines over and over again. In order to simply hold the pen you're interested in and see if it feels right to you, you have to bring her over to the display case, have her remove it, and then go sit at a special little desk and the employee will sit on the other side and hand you the pen. This is the only way they will do things. This is a nice set up for actually testing the pens, but as someone who knows fountain pens, sometimes I simply want to hold the pen quickly - for 2 or 5 seconds - and establish whether I am comfortable with the pen's weight and barrel width. I don't need it inked up, I don't need paper, I don't want to sit down; I just need to feel the damn pen. You know right away whether you like the feel of the pen and want to try it out, or whether it's not for you. It's really irritating to have to walk back and forth to this little desk. Especially because by the time I've walked to the desk, sat down, waited for her to sit down, been handed the pen, held it, handed it back, and gotten back up... I'VE FORGOTTEN WHAT I WAS LOOKING AT. If you test a pen, they take it behind the desk to clean it right away, which makes me feel bad when I want to test it again 5 minutes later to compare it beside another pen. Normally I would simply pick the pens I want to examine further (AFTER HOLDING THEM) and have them all inked at once, but the layout of the store prevents this. Honestly, if you had a really nice, friendly, personable sales rep, this layout wouldn't be 100% horrible. But throw in an awkward, kind of rude salesperson and you have a recipe to not sell anything because people are afraid to ask to try the darn pens.

I understand the "boutique", studio style look. You've tried it. Great. It doesn't work. Please redesign your store like a normal pen store, with jewelry-style counters.  That way, the sales attendant can be on one side, I can be on the other side, and we can hold pens happily all day long. Also, when the pens are being displayed horizontally in a row (stacked), it doesn't make sense to place the price cards in front of the rack left-to-right. They should be stuck beside the pen, or tied to the pen. It does me no good to know that Parker has a range of pens from $80-$800, and they're all on this one rack... it needs to be clearer which pen is which price. And, like most pen stores, the pens should go from cheaper (the cheap Asian brands, Lamy, Conklin) at the front of the store) to more expensive (Sheaffer, Parker, and eventually Mont Blanc at the back of the store). This way I'm not wandering around looking for a mid-range pen, getting distracted by $4,500 Mont Blanc limited editions and missing a display I might like because it's sandwiched between two rainbow racks of $28 Lamy Safaris.

If you're looking to go in and spend less than $40 on a cheap plastic fountain pen, and your main criteria is that it's got a double-digit price and bright colours, go here and buy the second pen you try. There's NOTHING wrong with that; we all start somewhere, and I encourage you to do this so that you eventually get hooked on fountain pens and give the manufacturers reason to keep producing pens for me to buy. If you're already a serious pen enthusiast, and you might want to handle and test a dozen or so pens, then go.... I don't know, I guess you'll have to move somewhere that has a decent pen store.

PS - I also want to note that when I asked she had a recommendation for a pen with a nib that would bleed less, I was told I would have to use a higher quality paper. I know that paper is the biggest factor when considering ink bleed, but obviously I can't write on $18/package paper all the time (especially when I'm filling up 3-4 100 page legal pads per week), and a dedicated pen salesperson should be able to come up with SOMETHING.

This has got to be the most frustrating business to deal with.  You rarely get to talk with anyone except the receptionist and the person you call never calls back. The same is true when you call national customer service.  When you do get to talk to someone, he will tell you he'll call back, then doesn't.  The worst post-purchase service I have EVER seen.  And I'm just trying to get the second key to my RV that was promised more than a month ago, again 3 weeks ago, and as late as 2 days ago.  I would not recommend buying from Camping World in Nashville to anyone.

Great environment, food cook well and service was ok! I recommend go with a big group. It's more of a vibe place to me. I like the ribs and Brussels sprouts the most. Not to many places you can actually go that have meat on the bone. I think the food was kind of cold when I got it but I guess you don't want the meat to dry out either. Again it has a nice concept and vibe maybe next time I'll have a drink!
I love them!! They always treat me and my best friend very well and my nails always come out fantastic :)

This place was okay. I ordered the Chinese Lunch Special with Ma Pao Spicy Tofu, Miso Soup, and White Rice. I took my order back to my office - when I opened it, the rice was missing and I was given the wrong soup. The employee who answered the phone was very apologetic and helpful, I felt taken care of even as a to-go order. When I finally ate my food, the tofu was unfortunately just not the best. It had what I believe were frozen peas and carrots in it, and when I ate them they just tasted hard and undercooked. I have ordered this dish at other restaurants and I have never seen this type of veggies in it. The sauce itself tasted more like a spicy tomato sauce. Maybe if there were higher quality ingredients it would've tasted better but I just couldn't enjoy it. Usually I dip my rice in the sauce but I barely finished the dish. Certainly not something I would order from here again. The tofu itself was perfectly cooked and my miso was delicious. The rice was made exactly as it should be. Overall, it was not an awful experience and for $8 I certainly got a bang out of my buck. If I came back I would probably choose something less adventurous.
Love this place great burgers drinks are different my sons favorite when he's in town love the shakes deliciousness

Who doesn't love the Heritage festival.  I have been to "cultural celebrations" in other parts of the country and in other countries, and none hold a patch to what goes on in Edmonton of the August long weekend.  It's like a tour around the world in one day.  Every year a few new countries are added, plus you can go see the old favorite sites.  I have a couple of food that's I count on each summer and then I plan on trying out one or two new tastes.  The food, the dancing, and so many people from so many places all getting along just makes me hopeful for the future.

While it's done for this season be sure to stick it in your calander for next year!

It goes without saying that the collection of the Barnes Foundation was world-class. Once in the galleries, we were surprised and delighted to be invited to a brief, incisive lecture in which a staff member presented her research on a fragment of an altarpiece, in which she also noted some open questions that she was in the process of addressing. It was a completely new experience to encounter emergent work as a casual visitor. When we had questions, though, she asked us if we wouldn't mind following her to the main gallery, as she needed to assume a security function, which she explained was an experiment to try and improve visitor experience. I must say she did a beautiful job of speaking with while having to intercept people from stepping too near the paintings--but what a horrid misuse of resources! Yet to offer impromptu lectures is brilliant, and we hope that the Barnes enhances this feature rather than turning its art experts into guards.

Normally when you go into Neiman's or Saks the staff treat you like you're beneath them or like you can't afford anything in the stores. But Kyle took care of me and made sure that I got everything that I needed and treated me like a valued customer! She went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and even wrapped my item for me so that it would look presentable for my boyfriend (This was his Xmas gift). She was by far the best sales associate I've ever encountered at Saks and if you ever need to go shopping there ask for her!

This is my third visit. I must say you will always get a great Latin meal. I only gave it three stars because after three visits not one time has the price been accurate according to the posted signage. It is great food but the pricing is very fluid. I am always charged at least $0.50 more for Deli or hot items.

We stopped for the taco special. They were kind of bland and didn't have cheese or sour cream. The side of beans and rice was yummy. Sat by the waters edge and watched the boats go by. Relaxing. Will come to try more dishes.

Who in their right mind pays $20 to just get into a bar at 11:00pm? Probably would have been fun, but not paying that much to just get in. Never thought I would love to a day where straight bars are cheaper and more fun than gay bars.

There's a reason it took 193 calls to get through and place an order. Absolutely delicious pizza that has plenty of pepp and crunch! The weight of the upside down jawn pizza box alone told me this place was going to be good...and it truly didn't disappoint. Highly recommend to all of my pizza lovers around Philadelphia and those visiting the city. Don't bother waiting until you get home to eat, just eat on the curb or in your car because it's that good. Absolutely fantastic!!!

I came here only because it was the closest nail salon to the airport (I was on a 7hr flight delay). Am I glad I did though!!! Honestly I wasn't expecting much but now I'm sad that the guy who did my nails doesn't live in Dallas to do them regularly  his attention to detail & overall skills are 12/10. Wish I would've gotten his name but all I remember is that he's tatted up haha. GO TO HIM! You won't regret it
Place has restaurants, no health codes at all.  Food expensive, vendors sell old stuff like new.  Bathroom very nasty.

The new staff member is a great addition.  I don't have her name, but she recently transferred and the receipt says clerk 6!   While a male employee in the lobby was busy on his cell phone, she worked efficiently, with wit and was very helpful.  Please continue to bring in more great additions to this location.

My husband and I do an instagram date on weekends we both have off. We decided to go to Tokiwa Ramen and really enjoyed it! My husband ordered the spicy goma and I had the regular goma goma! We both enjoyed the soups and the ramen noodles a lot! We laughed at the challenge to eat ramen with chopsticks in a bowl of broth with also a very large wooden spoon but we made it work! I enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant even though it is very tight but nice to hang out with fellow Edmontonians and would recommend this restaurant !

Top of the line‼ I have placed orders with them on a few occasions and wow! Their food is mouth watering delicious and the portions are plentiful. They may be a little costly but believe me, well worth it. Should you order their large rib platter, come with an appetite. I got three portions out of the platter. Bon appétit‼

This is a follow up from my previous Review....Worked out great that I no longer will go to this office. The idiot Dr wanted to pull 3 teeth and never gave me an option to save them (probably makes more money pulling them). My new dentist, Dr Jolly is saving two of them and only pulling one.  DO NOT GO TO FAMILY DENTAL CARE ON ROOSEVELT BLVD!!

My friend changed our brunch plans at the last minute, and I'm glad he did!

I had the California omelet, a Bloody Mary, and a couple of mimosas. The food melted in my mouth and the drinks were A1. The prices were reasonable and the service excellent. 

I didn't see a parking lot (could've been on the other side, perhaps?), so if you plan to go during peak hours be sure to go as early as possible.

There are a few stores in Indianapolis and adjoining areas stocking frozen food, groceries, snacks, household, and staple items from the Indo-Pak subcontinent. We found this store a good place for Indian groceries and sweets, especially for their samosas. It is not very organized but that's typical of most Indian grocery stores. It looks like a popular store because there were many customers busy buying the foodstuff. The store has a wide selection of spices and Indian ethnic food. However, the variety of vegetables were limited. It is highly recommended to check expiry dates. Our favorite items were samosa chat, paneer paratha, and pani puri. Occasionally, we tried their Indian sweets and found them fresh and flavorsome. The staff is helpful and friendly. For any event requiring sweets/snacks in bulk, an order can be placed with them.

Incredibly subpar food here... every. time. The joke is really on me for continuing to return. Do not get a salad here - the lettuce has been bad 2/2 times. The chicken salad sandwich has multiple problems with it (found a chicken bone in the sandwich but whatever), it wasn't cut at all on the bottom so that was fun, and it was just not possible to eat without making a mess (way too thick slices of tomato). The positives about Café Quiquiriqui is that (speaking about the café ONLY): it has a gorgeous aesthetic, good plantain chips and a friendly cashier. 

Moral of the story: Grab a coffee here (but can't vouge for that). That's it. Don't eat here.

The Flor Fina bar has delicious cocktails fyi. Have not eaten there.

Ordered a 40 piece McNugget.... received 20. Upon asking why I received  20 i asked if i could have my additional 2 10 piece boxes. The manager preceded to ask me if i knew how to count..... i showed her one two and no additional boxes. She then went on to say that my momma was a bitch snd the reason i didnt know hoe ti count is because she was a dumbass.


I guess my college degree doesnt allow me to count in multiples of 10. This place is trash, the workers are trash, and the manager is scum. The fact McDonald's still allows this franchise to me open is a joke. Do not go to this place unless you want to be treated poorly and your food spit on!

Usually get pretty good pizza from Papa Johns but omg!!! this time the pizza tasted like they put stale cheese on a piece of cardboard. My dogs wouldn't even eat it and that's saying something. The absolute worst pizza I've ever tasted. I have deleted my papa johns app and will go elsewhere from now on.

I had such a lovely experience here. They are so friendly and professional. They don't use dremels on bare nails so you never have to worry about paper thin nails after you get gel or acrylics. My gel nails have last 2 weeks with no chipping or cracking so far. Also they fixed my nail shape so I have a "C" curve. I suggest adding the strengthening gel to your manicure because it makes a world of difference. Absolutely love them! They are amazing!
Wings are delicious.  We order extra crispy and they are the closest thing to Anchor Bar in Buffalo. New York!  The corn is also delicious!

She's the best. Very professional and reasonable price. Made my daughter's 7th unicorn theme
 birthday the best. Made the cutest unicorn face paint. Definitely will use her again and recommend to all my family and friends.

I had a great experience here!! The dental team is very professional and I liked how they explained everything they were doing. I got laser done for the first time and it was great! The staff was very. Cautious with COVID protocols and made me feel safe. I highly recommend this dentists office.

DO NOT DO NOT DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. My hands are shaking as I type this. I just hung up the phone with the manager of this company. After my cleaning guy left I glanced at my bill and the numbers didn't make sense. 
First of all, I bought a Living Social voucher, the $39 one. This states it will clean the hallway and 3 bedrooms. On the phone I asked the receptionist about a deep clean for a spot the dogs had urinated on and she told me it would be 20 cents a square foot. I"m talking the size of a beach towel. That's it. So I naturally thought I'll probably spend $20 more or so.
The man shows up in an unmarked white van. That doesn't seem very professional to me. I led him upstairs to the hallway and bedrooms. I'm alone in my house with a man as he is talking super fast in my bedroom, about how I need this added on: Deep clean, sanitizer, and scotchguard to get a 2 year warranty (where I'll only need to spend $70 to have this all done again) He also suggested doing the stairs at $2 a step which would be $60 for my steps.
He's talking so fast about what I need that I finally stopped and I said, "Wait sir, what is my total at this point?" He responded over $200+ and I said, "I just can't do that." So he said, "Ok, I'll throw this in for free, and do this..." as he scratches the board. He goes downstairs and begins. 
He told me the carpet would dry in 12-24 hours. It did not. More like 36-48. He also soaked my wooden floors near the front door and did not wipe up with a towel or even ask me for a towel. I am human. I know we make mistakes, but just ask me for a towel. I"m also not writing a review over THAT. It gets worse.
After he left and I looked over my bill, I noticed the numbers didn't add up, that my voucher was NOT subtracted from the total (it was added back in to the total) and that nothing made sense. Next to the "total" line it said $199. But if you add up the numbers in that particular column it totals $213. Then off to the left he has 2 other columns of numbers equaling 180, 190 with a 44 and $234 and $205. Could YOU make sense of this?!?!
THAT is why I wanted to speak to a manager. So, I started researching this company which I can't believe I didn't do in the first place because I research everything!!! That's when I knew I was in trouble. Including the reviews about what a prick the manager is. So I was prepared to be super nice in explaining my confusion!
When I called the receptionist I told her I was confused about my bill and she simply told me the manager would call me back in 3 days.
When we spoke,I honestly have never been talked to so badly in my life or so poorly mistreated by a company that has been in MY house and I paid a total of $234 to!
From the moment the manager answered the phone, he was an a**. His words were slurred so bad I couldn't understand half of what he said unfortunately. I told him very politely I was calling him about a voucher I bought from Living Social for $39 and I didn't even get to explain I was confused about my bill. 
The manager starts his rant about how basically he had no clue what my carpet looked like and how most people can't even get their carpet cleaned for that price and what a joke if they think they can! (umm...then why do you sell a voucher for $39 for a $79 deal stating we do???) He started his mocking, screaming, accusations at me immediately.  He then proceeds to mock me that I was upset about doing negotiations for the carpet in my bedroom, alone with a man and that is why I bought everything.
That is when I said, "EXCUSE me sir, I NEVER said that and I am so appalled that I've not gotten in ONE word to explain why I've called (confusion over the bill) and all you have done is talk over me this entire time, slur your words..."
And that is when he started screaming, laughing, telling me, "yep and this story is over, THE END."
He went on and on and on. I couldn't get in one word. He just laughed, mocked, screamed, and laughed some more. Horrible, distasteful man of a human being.

Best Mexican tacos in town. It's a small family business and you can tell they take great pride in where they work and doing the best job they can for their customers. I can't praise this place enough for how great they are. We will be back often.

This place is local to me. I haven't had a chance to eat inside but I've had delivery a few times. Good selection tastes great fair price and faster delivery than most other places near by. I got one kid and a wife that doesn't like sushi. If these guys could turn them around they would be perfect. Until then me and the other 2 kids will enjoy all the food.

Kelly helped my husband and I buy our first home. She was EXTREMELY organized, knowledgeable and helpful throughout the entire process. She made the buying process easy and fun. We wanted an older home with character in the Meridian-Kessler area and Kelly was the perfect realtor. She knows the neighborhood extremely well and understood exactly what we were looking for. Kelly has a passion for her job that is evident from the first time we met with her. We are so happy with our choice to choose Kelly as our realtor and would highly recommend her to anybody in the Indy area!

I have had several massages at this place. They do a greatjob. The massage therapists are Asian and do not understand that much Englist. But they are great and every massage has been very good. I call beforehand if I want a massage that evening but you don't need an appointment. I have had a lot of 90 minute massages and love it. 

Sometimes, you have to wait but it can be a little weird. No one at the desk and the massage therapists are in the rooms. But I don't think I have had to wait more than 15 minutes. I have had more expensive massages that have not even come close to the massage I have had at this place. If you want the same massage thereapist that you have had before, you will need to call beforehand.

Was disappointed to learn the vegetable ramen I picked up for take out tonight isn't vegan. I've ordered and enjoyed eating this in house many times after confirming with my server it was vegan as is, only to read on Yelp that it is not vegan unless you order it with gf noodles. As a strict vegan this is very upsetting! Also, my drink was left out of my order tonight and I unfortunately didn't realize until I was already home. Love this place but this is disappointing to say the least.

Roy-Pitz is another place I have had bookmarked for some time. Last Saturday night my daughter and I were looking for a place near her apartment and we decided to give Roy-Pitz a try at long last. We could have walked the mile to Roy-Pitz, but I had my car and was able to find free parking right in front. Always a good omen.

This section of Spring Garden, as with some many other sections of the city, is really evolving. There are apartments opening up above Roy-Pitz and also across the street. Win-Win, Sazon, Bufad and Prohibition Tap Room are all close by and of course Union Transfer.

Roy-Pitz is a really cool, unique and industrial space. It was larger then I expected with a lot seating at tables and also a good amount of bar seating. I ordered the Psychedelic Strawberry Ale - Barrel Aged Sour Belgian Strong Ale. This was very good and not too sour and it was strong as advertised. My daughter tried the cider. We of course had to try the Bavarian Soft Pretzel and that was huge and awesome. I preferred the mustard sauce over the cheese sauce. We also tried the Roasted Beet Salad, Barrel House Burger - 8oz short rib & brisket blend burger, gruyere, roasted beer onions, Zayda's sweet hot pickles, bacon, rosemary porter aioli and the Beer Battered Cod Sandwich Lettuce, tomato, onion, giardiniera aioli. Everything was very good and the menu is varied and eclectic for pub fare.

For dessert there were three items to choose from but the Pound Cake Bananas Foster with vanilla ice cream was the one we found most appealing. This was a very good dessert and more like a bread pudding. It was large enough to share for two people easily.

The atmosphere is great, our server was excellent. Both of us were so full so we walked around a little on Spring Garden. We will definitely be back to Roy-Pitz.

Eat here for dinner.  Had the calamari, French onion soup and a salad.  

Started with the French onion soup and it was delightful. Tasted great with just the right amount of cheese.  

Went to the calamari and frankly - I was very disappointed.  It was so salty I couldn't finish it.  The waitress offered go get me something else but I felt bad since I ate half of it.  

The salad was just ok.  The lettuce didn't have the crunch I expected - almost like the lettuce was a bit dated.  

Would I eat here again?  I don't know.  For the prices you're paying I expected better.  In their defense, I think they just opened so maybe they need to get up to speed.  

The waitress was great - bring this from a 2 star review to a 3 star.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Overpaid for a mani/pedi that lasted ONLY 3 days - when trying to resolve the issue, the manager was not accommodating what so ever! Also bought some product while checking out, four days later the salon called me saying that they made mistake and they under charge me - gave me the option to either pay additional $$ or return the used product back to them - NEITHER OWNER OR MANAGER WANTING TO DO THE RIGHT THING BEING THAT THIS IS THEIR ERROR. 
Seems like they need to get it together on their end - would not recommend this salon to anyone!!

I used to go here all the time. Even then, the job wasn't great, but enough to get most of the dirt off. I bought a new car in July. The last time I brought this car in, one of my back car seat floor mats was missing. I didn't notice this until I got home that evening and because of my work schedule across town, I didn't go back to let them know until my next day off, which was 1 week later. I talked with the manager and he looked for it and couldn't find it. I requested to speak with the owner and initially was told he wasn't there. When I insisted I talk with someone who could help me, he left and came back about 10 minutes later with an index card I was to write my name and number down for the owner to call me back the next day. I never received a call back and when I have called or stopped by to talk with the owner, he is never there and still won't return my calls. It is only a car mat, but a new car mat and you can't replace just the one. I will never go back and believe the previous review, this place has thieves. Beware, you might have something besides a missing car mat!

Zushi always has very fresh sushi and amazing customer service. However, they pack too much rice on the rolls which takes away from the flavor of the sushi. They also packaged the sushi rolls on top of the ginger and wasabi for our Togo order which is a hard flavor to get off if you don't like it.

I know COVID has limited capacity for restaurants. Stopped by this Waffle House on Saturday morning and server came out and yelled across parking lot that she didn't have room for us. Continued to yell things but with traffic on US Hwy 19 we couldn't hear a word. We got in our vehicle and left. She handled that situation badly. Could have waited until we were near the door to tell not yell that they were full. Didn't offer to take our names for waiting list. Poor customer service that makes me not want to go there again

OMG! Whatever you do don't call in a take out order. Only the bartender takes the order. I waited 10 minutes for him to answer, so I called back and he had an attitude with me. I don't care how busy you are. I'm a customer too. I own a restaurant myself and if I employed someone like that he would be fired. We're done with Chevy's!

Got email saying order delivered to my apartment mail slot.  Went to get mail.  NO ORDER DELIVERED.  Tried calling local (Oro Valley, AZ) Post Office ALL DAY.  THEY WOULD NOT ANSWER THE PHONE-  ALL DAY.  Had call the 800 number and wait in the "telephone line" to file a case electronically.
Holiday business aside-  NOT ANSWERING THE PHONE-  Failure #1 for customer service.  Need to do better OR at least let us leave a message. 
SOMEONE USE A BRAIN AND INSTALL AN ANSWERING MACHINE SERVICE.

Very disappointing Christmas Eve dinner.  We have had dinner here several times.  I made reservations several weeks in advance for Christmas Eve.  When I called to confirm they didn't have the reservation.  So I made it again.
I called that day to confirm, this time they had it.  When we arrived we found out there was a special menu for the evening, abbreviated.  I don't mind that but I think you should be advised ahead.  Our waiter who we had had in the past thanked us for coming and wished us a Merry Christmas after we were seated.  They also had a $75-7 fishes dinner on the menu.  
My wine glass had lipstick on it.  Our waiter informed us that no veal dishes except the veal parm were available.  So that was the only meat dish on the menu.
We ordered Penne with peas and prosciutto and a chicken dish.
We noticed the owner/manager stop at several tables.  We think it was the tables that ordered the $75 meal.  Did not stop at ours.  They were not slammed as we heard from the waiter they had several cancel.
The prosciutto was small hard pieces.  The chicken was fine.
Upon leaving while the owner stood at the bar where he was most of the evening we did not get a Merry Christmas or thanks for coming.

I came here to get a full set and unfortunately Tracy was my lash tech. She was not very friendly.. I have sensitive eyes and heard her sighing and puffing because my eyes were twitchy. It was my first time so I thought she'd be more understanding! I decided to go somewhere else where the lash tech was so nice and made me feel comfortable. How was I supposed to feel comfortable here when all I could hear is Tracy sighing and puffing and didn't even get a friendly vibe from her.

Employees are suppose to comply with the regulation for Covid-19 and wear a mask. Under the impression that PetSmart was safe to get my dog's nails trimmed. I was shocked to see 2 out of 3 groomers NOT wearing a mask. 

We had to cancel, not compliant, not cool.
Please follow the safety procedures as you advertise on your website.

I had to have my windshield replaced (for a second time within a year) and after a poor experience my first go around with another vendor I decided to try Tri County Auto Glass. The experience was AWESOME! The office was very helpful with processing all the details with my insurance, including asking for OEM glass instead of aftermarket, which I forgot to request. The installation service was also great, quick, informative with post installation info and they were able to schedule me in for replacement very quickly after the part arrived. Very pleased with the outcome, would return for future glass work but hopefully won't need to!

I wish I could give this place zero stars. My 10 year old daughter wanted macaroni and cheese so went here so she could get her side of Macaroni and cheese and I could get a side of spaghetti because I was going to fry fish at home. My daughter wanted to be a big girl and go in herself and since the parking area is small I said ok. I gave her $18 to pay thinking it was way too much for two sides. My daughter comes out and says the lady said I need to just get a plate because it's cheaper, she spent $21 the $18 gave her plus $3 of her own money. She got a sloppily made plate with the smallest leg quarter I've ever seen with over salted canned green beans and macaroni and cheese. The spaghetti was extremely sweet as if it had been doused with sugar. The spaghetti sauce was not freshly made it was store bought so there is no need to add sugar. The macaroni and cheese was disgusting. We will not try this place again. The lady who waited and scammed my 10 year old daughter had short dreadlocks. Definitely not worth the money or the time.

My husband and I have both been here several times for the live music and awesome food. Have to give two stars for the service though. It seems every time either of us have been there, one bartender in particular is always there and is too busy smoking, eating, or chatting with a grumpy older waitress to tend to the bar. We also often find her screaming at customers and sometimes coworkers. It changes the whole atmosphere of the bar whenever she does it. I would give more stars if it wasn't for her. I know there are staff shortages everywhere, but a bartender like that is just awful to be served by. We've had to leave early a few times because she had such a bad attitude and was so rude to us and everyone else near us. We try to go when the younger gal with tattoos is working behind the bar because we are always served immediately with a smile, we're checked on often, and she maneuvers the bar like a dream making sure everyone is taken care of. I don't remember her name, but I'll get it next time we come in and update the review so people know to request her when they come in.  I definitely would give five stars for the food alone if I could, though! The breaded tenderloin, beef tips, and nachos are our favorite things to order and they're always fresh and delicious.

This is a Lego lovers dream. SO many Lego sets of all types, tons of random bricks in bins, other Lego merch,  extremely knowledgable staff, and of course, MINIFIGS in a quantity that is unfathomable. The staff can help you find something for your Lego loving friend or family member. I went recently to get some Ninjago minifigs for stocking stuffers, and the employee helped me pick out some great ones for my son as I have no knowledge about the show and which characters  are popular, etc. I'm always happy to support this local biz!

First of all, thank you fellow yelpers, because that's how I discovered this place while I was out in New Orleans for Mardi Gras. Verti Marte is a local cornerstore market/deli in the French Quarter. Luckily we went after the lunch rush hour, around 2 in the afternoon and didn't have to deal with any lines or rowdy drunks. It's a tiny place and a bit cramped for space; a large person would have some trouble walking down the aisles, so it's a good thing they deliver ;) 

     Their menu is exentsive- a long list of Po Boys , entrees and sides. I went with what was at the top of the list.... a delectable creation called All That Jazz- a pile of turkey, ham, fried shrimp, mushrooms, tomatoes, Swiss & American cheeses, all topped with some secret sauce on a French Roll. It was one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten in my life, and it was worth the newly occluded artery I probably developed after eating it. As promised, it tasted delicious cold, just as the girl behind the counter said it would; my boyfriend and I shared the second half while waiting for our next plane in Atlanta. The potatoes au gratin and creamed spinach were also yummy. My boyfriend had the meatball sandwich and said it was one of the best he'd ever had. 

     Not good for my waistline, but deliicious in my belly. If I ever go back to New Orleans, I Will go back to Verti Marte.

We loved eating here. Based on looks and the menus we were a bit worried about how the food would be but it was incredible. Everyone who worked here was extremely kind and very friendly. 

The red snapper sandwich and the chowder were our favorites. And don't forget to order hush puppies! 

This was our favorite place to eat on our trip and we want to come back again.

Great for a nice, fancy Sunday morning breakfast. Was not as busy as I expected at 9AM. Lots of empty tables so it felt extra roomy and we were seated immediately after showing proof of vaccination. Food took a good 15min to arrive. My sausages were smaller than I expected but the portion of fruit was Massive and Extensive. The buckwheat crepe was delicious - soft, moist, and fresh. The sausages were nothing special. The fruit was all fantastic - ripe, juicy, and Such a large variety it was much more than I expected (but considering the price I guess not). My friend got the Benny skillet and it was good. Egg was cooked well, everything was hot, hollandaise was as expected, portion was good for the price.

Service was okay. Ran out of water with no offer to refill at the end of the meal. Bathroom was clean and well-kept. 

All in all a very nice place to eat but quite pricey.

The Hilton Riverside is huge and the layout isn't ideal. With multiple buildings connected by landings and crosswalks and escalators, it can be a bit confusing. 

The room was spacious but it needed updating and cleaning. The ceiling paint in the bathroom was peeling, there was hair on the floor of the bathroom and the carpets had stains on them. 

The service was mixed. The housekeeper came in and emptied the trash and then fluffed the pillows...hmmm. Perhaps the order of things should've been reversed. It didn't appear that she'd done much in the bathroom aside from refreshing the towels. On the other hand, when I called the front desk about my TV, someone came to fix it within 10 minutes. 

I was there for a conference and the ballrooms were chilly as most hotel rooms are but the staff was pleasant and the buffets were well stocked. The main restroom was large and it was kept very clean throughout the day.

Located in the central business district, the Hilton is within walking distance from the convention center and the riverwalk and there are many restaurants at various price points nearby. The french quarter and Bourbon street are a short walk away. 

Hilton Riverside certainly has a great location but for the price, other area hotels may be a better choice.

I get it, Biden-flation, but $2.50 a wing is ridiculous. $50 for 20 wings. They also forgot about our order and we have two kids who were going wild. The only reason it's not a one star is the food was at least hot and the chicken was crispy.
I loved the brisket! Also, the collared greens were fantastic! The atmosphere was perfectly chill and ambient.

Since this year, the owner changed to a Taiwanese couple. They really try their best to make this a better place. Disregard the older comments about this place. I got a clean room, nice bathroom and good shape parking lot. The service is pretty good and owner try to do the maintenance by himself since he really cares about the costumers. I recommend everyone give it a shot and it's worth for the price to stay a night or two.

I love this grocery store! 
I will only go here.  I didn't really think it was a real thing to have a preference when it comes to supermarkets but I love this one. They are really reasonably priced and also they give you points towards gas.  Once a month or so it seems like I get 50 cents off per gallon of gas which is really nice for someone who travels a lot for work.
They have sushi too!  It's not terrible either.

Love this place!! Super chill & great selection of booze & food. Have been here about three times and every time it has been a great experience. I am definitely doing my best to work my way down the menu. It has such a great amazing amount of things for seriously EVERYONE. Vegetarian & vegan options galore. I personally have had the Italian hoagie (that spicy spread tho - noms), a charcuterie board, jerk spiced sweet potatoes with coconut rice (ummm, to die for), some kind of savory waffle jawn (we ordered the tomato pie but ended up getting served this but it was a beautiful mistake) & the spicy noodle soup- tasty but not something I would order again- just my own personal tastebuds. 

Our favorite drink is hands down the slow boil (basically their version of a hot toddy) especially during these cold nights. It's just super good and goes down very smooth- love the orange rind with the cloves in them. The old fashioned is good as well. 

The ambiance is real chill- pretty dimly lit. Bartenders are super chill as well & friendly. I haven't been out to the patio section but I'm sure it's great when the sun is out & shining. 

Can't wait to come back & try more fewds!!

I have been coming here since I was a little kid and the donuts have always been spot on. We used to get the box of day old donuts and resell them at our yard sales with coffee & people loved them. They were also a morning staple when I would head to Disneyland with a good friends family on the way out of town. Lots of fond memories and glad the donuts are still delicious.. I recommend the fritters (apple, blueberry) even my picky husband liked them. I have never got the Thai food here and probably won't, so I can't say anything about that. However the donuts are my favorite in town. Also the family who runs it is very friendly and always slips in some complimentary donut holes & a day old or two with your order.

I've heard about Hopdoddy for awhile. Every time I visit Austin I see the line and I'm always told that I should eat there so I was excited that one was opening in Nashville. It took me awhile to give it a shot, hamburgers aren't my favorite food so it takes awhile for me to crave one. We ended up here after church one night and it was pretty empty so we got in, ordered and got our food pretty quickly! First off, I love that they have Maine Root sodas, which I don't even drink soda very often, but those are some of the best! I got a bacon cheeseburger and my husband got the caesar salad and we split both. The burger was okay, it had a decent flavor, the bacon was burnt little pieces, which isn't my favorite but it's still bacon and i still happily ate it. The problem with the burger is that Nashville has a lot of burger places, so many that some burger places have shut down because there's so much competition so a burger has to be awesome or I'll just go to my favorite spot and this didn't beat it. The caesar salad was big, they don't offer a small side caesar salad and had a decent flavor. I think if I were vegan, this would be my go to spot since they have the impossible burger, but since I eat meat, I'll come here only when someone else really wants to go.
Service is fine but their new stuffed crust is not good. Ordered it last week and ended up throwing half of it away. Pizza was undercooked and cheese in crust was gross. Stick to their regular pizza.
Fine little neighborhood bar a couple blocks from my house. Cheap booze, good staff and some good people watching. On the outside it looks like a scary biker bar, it's not. Staff is very friendly.

Was in store on Dec 31.  Server got order totally wrong.  

Cathy who was working up front as hostess saw what was going on. She stopped what she was doing took food back to kitchen and has them cook it correctly.  She is commended for a job well done and is an asset to your establishment.

Recommend if you in First Watch ask for Cathy

I came back about a month later so the next paragraph is my update.

I arrived before opening so no crowd issue.  The menu has been updated with less options but I think that's fine as long as they actually have the items advertised. They were out of Sapporo so I had to get a lager on tap. Less of a big deal. They had karaage and it was fresh out of the fryer. Excellent although I found myself wishing for more of the sauce that came with it. As for the ramen I hate to say this but they still aren't firing on all cylinders yet. Ramen to broth ratio is improved but I want half a cup more broth in the bowl. Also there was more, uh, oil in this bowl and I'm not usually accustomed to quite so much. The egg made into the bowl but still is just barely turning into a hard boiled egg. Pork was more hefty so I have less of a complaint about that. Waitress tried hard to please, I think the negative reviews have had an effect.  Again, even the worst ramen restaurant is still pretty good and I'll stick by that assessment but bump it up to 3 stars. Hopefully they have fixed the problem with the gyoza which is quite truthfully unacceptable.

I was there for lunch on opening day so the chaos was unsurprising. They covered up with tape the menu options that were not yet available but there were other items that weren't covered up and STILL weren't available. No booze because no liquor license yet but it was also on the menu uncovered. Waitress knew very little about the food. I've eaten ramen at good and middle of the road restaurants (menchanko-tei and ippudo in NYC, samurai and muto in Seattle) and the flavor of my shoyu was good, as was the tonkotsu my wife ordered. Noodles were consistent with what I've come to expect from every ramen restaurant I've been to.

Aside from the menu mistakes and service foibles, my biggest critique of Ramen Sho is what Horix has written: the noodle to broth ratio. That's a real but solvable problem, and it shouldn't be happening. I shouldn't have to press my spoon down into the noodles to get into the broth for heaven's sake.

Other things: the low quality of pork belly. It looked like a few half slices of bacon were slid in there. My egg (which initially wasn't there, the waitress noticed and gave me a whole egg, nice touch!) was a little over cooked with the yolk starting to get chalky around the edges. Also these are fixable. I hear this place is super crowded now so they don't have an incentive to fix their problems... yet. Let's see if they fix them, or if they concentrate on raking in the dollars.

And could they please please please put some tsukemono on the menu!

We had a nice stay at the Westin while visiting from Seattle. We just stayed for one evening but wish we could have stayed longer. It's true that the hotel does seem a little more dated than your typical Westin, but we found the hotel clean and the staff friendly. 

The location is right on the water and we had a nice view from the 12th floor. The staff at the front desk offered us a late checkout at 3PM which was nice. Parking, whether valet or self park, is only $5 which is much cheaper than other area hotels. 

We didn't try the restaurant attached, but it looked good and seemed to have a nice crowd. The location of the hotel is nice and close to many shops and restaurants. The Starbucks in the lobby was tasty and convenient. 

We will certainly be back for another stay upon our next visit!

So I got to this Walmart location around 9:30 pm and there was nobody at the electronic section. I asked an employee that was near by named Daniel, if he or someone can help me unlock an electronic device so I can purchase it. He responds saying, "I don't have the thing(walkie talkie) to call over anyone so that's too bad, I don't know what to tell you." So I ask politely, "Well can you try to get someone that's in charge of this section to help me?" He didn't even try to help, horrible costumer service. He shouldn't be working in the costumer service industry. Another employee named Alan seemed to be getting off work and heading to the exit, stopped where I was and was more than happy to help, immediately says, "Of course, let me grab someone to help you ma'am." Alan deserves a raise.

Next thing, the wheel of the cart I was using breaks and falls off.

They only had one line open for the cashier because they were "understaffed." The line had about 15 people and took 15-20 minutes to check out. The employee that checked me out states that there was two others earlier but they went home...

Two stars, I've experienced better.

Uhhhh... this place is so delicious! This brought me back to our love for Mediterranean food when we lived in Glendale, CA. Pretty much the mecca for Armenian/Mediterranean dishes! We used to order or pick up shwarma plates at least twice a week when we lived there. So glad we found this place! 

I ordered the chicken shwarma with hummus and tzatziki....YUMMMMM!!! The rice is on a whole 'nother level and I am not a huge rice fan. And Im Asian! Weird 

Super clean and more than friendly staff! My little nugget made best friends with one of the lovely ladies up front. 

Wish we didnt have to travel so far for this delicious food but it is worth it! 

Highly recommend if youre looking for some delicious Mediterranean to satisfy your craving!

Great breakfast spot, staff is super friendly and to my surprise it was a legit breakfast joint! Huge menu and lots to pick from and honestly I had a hard time, which is a good thing. I ended up with the bacon egg and cheese bagel. It was pretty solid and a coffee with this hit the spot. Really neat place to check out for a good breakfast.

Never heard of this place until a local took me here. Came late night & there were people inside but we called our order in so it would be ready. I got the regular philly cheesesteak and my friend got the vegan buffalo chicken "cheesesteak". I tried his & both were out of this world! I am SO happy I know about this place now because I LOVE CHEESESTEAKS. This place is nothin fancy but has an inclusive menu for vegan, vegetarians, gluten free people & carnivores. 10/10 in my book!

I continue to come back here I LOVE IT! If you ask anyone who knows me, I don't eat red meat and you wouldn't catch me at a swanky burger joint EVER. But one night my mom and I came in here during a snow day because I was hangry and impatient. 

Thus, my Hopdoddy experience. They have vegan options and were able to accommodate my diet restrictions too (I just wanted grilled chicken)

THE FRIES ARE AWWEEESOME!
NO STARS if I could....Don't do it if you want a long-term rental...just increased my rental to $84 a month. I will be moving very soon.

I had the crab Rangoon (delicious) and the grilled shrimp banh mi - it has a bit of a spice to it. This wasnt my first time here, so I already know their food is good. Their service is great as well - everyone working inside is very sweet. They even brought my food out to me at my car when It was ready.

Very good informal place for breakfast or lunch. Typical coffee shop type of menu. Food was very fresh and portions were a good size. And the prices are very reasonable. 

I had a chef's salad. All of the ingredients were very fresh. And it was a very filling meal.

Sophia had a breakfast sandwich with egg, cheese and bacon with a slight upcharge for fresh fruit on the side. She loved it.

Iced tea (both sweet and unsweet offered)  was good and reasonably priced at $1.95.

You can tell Golden Bear has loads of repeat customers. The servers seemed to know everybody. That's always a good sign when you chose a place to eat lunch.

After being afraid of giving blood for a while, I finally donated for the first time this fall and since then I have been trying to donate every 8 weeks! 

I made an appointment for this location on the app for the next day and filled out the rapid pass before I got there. Everyone was super friendly and the location was very clean. Once you're done giving blood, they had a ton of snacks to pick from. Overall, I was probably in and out in under an hour. 

I will be back again. Donate blood!

Ordered take out through their website - 100% satisfied. We ordered the Curry Chicken, Mongolian Beef, Vegetable Egg Foo Young, Chicken Lettuce Wraps and Crab Cheese Puffs. Husband is thrilled with their style of the Crab Cheese Puff! They threw in some extra goodies too. Absolutely our favorite Chinese spot.

So, tried a few different spots for rolled ice cream already, and I must say, this was my least favorite. For being in a prime location in C-Town, they need to step up their game just a tad. We came on a weekday night, and although it wasn't busy, we waited, and waited, and waited. I couldn't believe that there was no line to order, but getting the ice cream took FOREVER!

The perks of this place - they have tons more toppings than the other places. However, I'm not a fancy person, so I stick to the standard fruits and toppings. I don't need cereal or other items that are available here in my ice cream.

Downfall - as stated above, wait time for ice cream, ran out of a majority of their toppings listed, didn't look as nice once completed, and the ice cream itself wasn't really creamy and kinda too hard.

Overall: I think I'll stick to my other spot.

I am so impressed! Let's just start there!

I move to the area this week and I'm looking to find some great coffee spots. Found this one on the same exit as Target and figured I'd give it a shot while I waited for Target to open.

I LOVE that they have a drive-thru! So easy and convenient! With that being said... I didn't get to see the inside of the shop because it was a quick stop.

I pulled up and asked the lady if they did their toasted marshmallow latte iced and she said yes, so I ordered a medium. It was a great price, very quick to get to me, and the lady working was so nice.

I didn't get a picture of my drink because I guzzled it down so fast! Haha It was just that good! I will say though, it was like a sweet treat so if you're not in to sweet I may add an extra shot or go with an unflavored latte. 

The espresso was very smooth and creamy, just like I like it! And the drink was not heavy! 

I will definitely be frequenting this shop!!!

I have tried dealing with Wedgewood Pharmacy numerous times over the years and the customer service is PATHETIC.  Everything with Wedgweood is a One way street and dealing with Wedgewood has made me miserable more times than I could count.  Try another pharmacy and not this company your pet will thank you and your therapist will as well.

Tim Lucas

this is the best rescue i have ever donated to. she works hard personally to fund her mission by working several jobs and posts what these poor sick older dogs LOOK like from day ONE to the magic that ensues as they heal and get adopted.. i met her and she is FAR from rude. her heart is kind .i wish i had her faith.. her patience ... she is my heroe. i have NO clue how ANYONE so far away made such a negative review on someone who is amazing. not many take old sick dogs that have zero chance.. and lay in cages suffering. what dog in a rescue situation is NOT imperfect? what a horrible review that will hurt the dogs she loves so much.. shame on them... with people being this unkind now i know why animals end UP where they do.. i love PPPR!!!!!!!!!!!!!

LaScala's is soo delicious!

I came here for Mother's Day with my family at 11 am on the dot. We were seated very quickly which was great. Since we were starving, we decided to skip out on apps and ordered 4 pizzas - Margherita, Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke, and Mushroom. All of the pizzas were DELICIOUS. 

I would love to be back to eat some apps & drink as well. I noticed they have an upstairs, so I can imagine that the place definitely gets busy. Our waiter was so attentive and nice. I recommend 100% and I can't wait to be back again!

Not very impressed. After hearing about shake shack forever I was wondering what all the hype was. So finally I went to a location. First off the young lady working here was a mess. I asked her what's good and her reply was nothing. I asked her is the shroom burger good she said I don't like it. What is the shake sauce, she replied it's nasty. Lol worst company ambassador ever! So after all that, I got a shroom burger. It was gross. Filled with hot fake cheese wiz that pops in your face and burns it. Not a fan. Never again.
The store was full and the sales girls NEVER addressed anyone who was shopping. I picked up a couple pieces of clothes and put them back because of the sales associate

My family and I have been coming to Buona since 2015.

Each and every time, we have enjoyed nothing less than incredible food and friendly service from Buona.

I hesitate to "glorify" this place, because it just means they will be even more busy the next time I come here!

They have a small inside dining area, but you also have the option to dine outside on their front and back patios.  This is a huge bonus, as we often have a small dog with us.

NOTE:  Buona is located in one of our busiest tourist areas!  So if you plan on a visit during peak hours?  Expect this place to be PACKED!

I love me some biscuits and I love the way Biscuit Love incorporates biscuits into all of its dishes! It is a really cool concept and a must when visiting Nashville!

I had the pleasure of trying the bonuts, the lily, and the east nasty (without gravy for dietary reasons). The bonuts are fried biscuit dough topped with lemon mascarpone and served on top of blueberry compote. It's like a donut hole, but the best donut hole you'll ever have in your life! They are AMAZING and I loved that they weren't overly sweet. The blueberry compote provides a great touch; I definitely recommend getting it into every bite. The lily is biscuit french toast topped with lemon mascarpone, blueberry compote, and syrup. I think if it had been just the biscuit french toast with syrup, I would have loved it. They prepared the french toast very well, but the lemon marscapone made it too sweet. There was a bit too much going on for my preference, but I can't deny that it was tasty. The east nasty was pretty good as well and I imagine that it's much better with gravy. Unfortunately, I had to get it plain, but it's still a solid chicken biscuit.

Be sure to check out Biscuit Love when you get the chance and do yourself a favor: ORDER THE BONUTS. They were definitely the highlight of my breakfast.

My favourite place for lunch. While in University I used to always be scared to come here as everyone said the prices were so high. I would walk by at night and see all the people inside and think, "I wonder what it tastes like?" Let me tell you - it tastes great! As for price, although their dinner menu seems a little high their lunch menu is just right. 

We have been here a number of times and have always been pleased with our dishes. I tend to go for the Sawadee Combination which shows up under their appetizers. Don't be fooled! It is a lunch special that includes a small salad, appetizer and a half order of an entree. It is the perfect amount and you can have them surprise you or ask for your favourites from the menu. I always ask for the Poppy Shrimp as the appetizer. Lightly battered shrimp served with a curry mustard dipping sauce. It makes the meal! I let them choose the rest. Last time it was Pad Thai and a Mango Spinach salad. All for an amazing price. You can't go wrong. 

We like it here so much that we recommended it for a friend's special celebration gathering. They had almost 30 people and only one out of the entire group didn't absolutely love what they had. They merely liked it. That's pretty good for a large group. Service was prompt and helpful. Overall my friend was very pleased. 

Please do yourself a favour and go here for lunch. Oh, and ask for the poppy shrimp. You'll be glad you did.

This place is impressively focused. They don't bother with other elements of Japanese cuisine. Ramen, with a few supporting sides, makes for a clean menu and quick dining experience. As I sat at the bar I was able to watch my Ramen prepared. (Kind of reminded me of piecing together a subway sandwich.) I thought it arrived quick yet the cook still apologized for the wait. No need. 

Now for the food. This is where I felt it stumbled a bit. The broth was bland. I have had Black Garlic elsewhere but found because the base was so weak that overall the taste was too bitter. Noodles were flavourless and missing that homemade feel. Although it grew on me by the end I didn't even bother emptying the bowl. That's not normal for me. 

Nice atmosphere, quick service, the cook served me directly over the bar which was nice touch. Really fun to watch them prepare the dishes in their busy little kitchen. Sadly, food was just OK.

I'm quite shocked to see the high ratings.  This was the worst Italian meal I've ever eaten.  I would've rather had McDonald's.  The chicken for the chicken Marsala was undercooked and flavorless and the sauce was watery and also lacked flavor.  The chicken wasn't served over pasta as stated in the Grubhub menu.  The pasta was separate and had marinara sauce on it.  The garlic cheese loaf didn't seem to have any cheese on it and wasn't cut all the way through so it was difficult to tear apart. My son's pastrami sandwich was just okay; he said he'd definitely had better.  This was a waste of money.  Everything was a greasy mess when it arrived.

The best healthy place downtown Edmonton. 

The girls at the counter are ok but could be nicer.

I had the Acai bowl (8,95$). Very good but not so filling. Good selection of meals and smoothies. Smoothies are expensive at 9$ each. 

Will return since they are not many good healthy options downtown.

I am eternally grateful for people who save and preserve history. This house has some pretty incredible stories to tell and our tour guide was well versed in their details. This is a worthwhile way to spend a few hours and the gift shop is well stocked. I had to drag my boys out or they would have stayed asking questions and buying things all day.

Great service -Great Food- When you happy and you know it clap your hand lol 
Often times you have to wait for a table but it's always worth the wait. I always have super great service when I go here I mean wow perfect every time. My favorite is the All Star Breakfast and that nice fluffy waffle.

Five Palms is within a few minute walk to the beach, and less than 0.5 miles to the main Clearwater Boardwalk area.  We easily walked to Frenchy's Rockaway and Clear Sky Cafe, both great spots. 

We stayed here for the first time in November 2018, renting unit 204 through VRBO. The unit was well maintained and well stocked. 

One note: Five Stars is not reflective of the unit management. We suspect some issues with the management company, as the office was rarely open during advertised hours and our calls about an alarm clock going off in the empty unit next to us were not returned (meaning the alarm clock went off nonstop for three days straight).

This location has really come a long way. They don't have a drive through so you have to go in but personally I don't mind that because they are located in Berry Hill and it's a great central location to grab a healthy meal or catch up on your emails in between appointments. 

Going in allows you to inquire about the ingredients on the salads, which is important to be able to do if you have food allergies due to them not being listed. No photographs of the food are available so it's best to just try something and get a few go to favorites. My favorite is the Greek salad without quinoa or chicken. The veggies are fresh and they have clean, high quality ingredients. 

Ever since Vanderbilt came to the shopping plaza, it's been a little hard to get a seat around here, but they've remodeled and made it nice, and they have great outdoor seating without having to wait in line. 

They staff is friendly, and the service is fast, but don't go if you're trying to save money. Ordering A le cart will add up pretty quick so pay attention to the total because when everything looks so good, it's easy to get carried away. I guess that's why it's good to become a rewards member. 

The WiFi isn't that strong, I'd like to see them work on this because that's the main appeal of coming here other than a well known healthier option for the area.

DIAMONDS ARE A GIRL'S BESTFRIEND!! It's hard not to be awe struck when you walk through the door's and see all of the beautiful jewelry in this store; but what I love most about this place is the Customer Service. Hand's down the best I have ever received in any store. This place goes above and beyond to accommodate, and help out in any way possible.  You feel welcomed the second you walk in the door. They have an incredible selection, anything your heart desires. 

I've come here on many different occasion for many different things, and have always left a satisfied customer.

The car was fine. Pickup was confusing and they don't answer their phone when people call to find out where to get shuttle.

Pushing it for 2 stars since when we dropped off vehicle we waited 40 minutes to get a shuttle back to the airport and finally called Über to get a ride so we would catch our flight. The 11 other people were probably glad we did since we were the 2nd ones in line for shuttle.

This is by the old airport, poorly maintained and poorly staffed if the have 3 vans and one driver in a busy Sunday afternoon.

I heard the phone ringing over and over without anyone picking up, probably people looking for a ride to get their cars.

Insane. Best food i've had the pleasure to inhale. If I could give it 6/5, that would be doing it a disservice. Had the steak frite sandwich and couldn't believe it. Also, if size matters, these portions are not to be messed with. The lunch menu provides a healthy amount of options that tackles everything under the sun from shakshuka to tiramisu pancakes. BYOB as well. Only holdback? Kinda a small place that obviously doesn't take reservations.
