If you grew up in Sparks, then you know Pizza Plus is where it's at. 

Not the best pizza in town, but definitely my favorite wings in town (if I want them classic style- i.e. not Wingstop). 

This place is comparably priced, has THE BEST ranch, steak fries can be hit or miss, pizza is good (just not the best but will easily satisfy your pizza craving), and the wings are absolutely wonderful. The sauces are so good. I usually get the spicy flavor. It is spicy enough to add some heat to the wings, but not too spicy that your lips burn and have to eat them slow. 
Besides the fries, the quality of the food is consistent. Sometimes you can get fries that weren't fried enough or over fried. I've gotten mine under cooked more times than overcooked. Their pizza is better than all the fast food chains (Little Caesars, Dominos, etc) and not too greasy. Their wings are top notch. I only eat wings from here or Wingstop, depending on my mood. I only recently started going to Wingstop. Growing up, I only ate wings from here. They're that good. 

This place is usually busy, so I suggest calling ahead to place your order and pick up. On average, the wait is 25-35 minutes. The atmosphere is busy. I wouldn't come here if I wanted to relax. There are usually lots of families with loud kids or groups of friends eating here so in general, the place is loud. It's a great environment if you are looking for a place to eat with a large party (family or friends). Whenever my friends and I get together, we order from here. 

Overall, if you're craving pizza and wings, this is easily your best choice.

I posted this on the JW Marriott FB page since they didn't have one a while ago, but this place deserves to be directly called out even if it has been a while since this happened 


Tonight my family came from Chicago and Louisville to Osteria Pronto celebrate my 22nd birthday AND my graduation from college. Not only was this the worst service we have ever had, but nothing was done in honor of what we were celebrating. We told them when we made the reservation and then again the waiter. Nothing, not even a congratulations. The waiter had to be constantly reminded of everything, including refilling our waters. Also added $100 extra onto our bill and if we hadn't reviewed it, we would have been over charged. The place was completely empty to the lack of service was inexcusable. I am so ashamed that I brought my family from out of state here to celebrate the biggest moment of my life. The JW Marriot overall is great but Osteria Pronto is by far the worst restaurant I have ever been to and JW Marriot should be ashamed to have them apart of their organization. I am so sad my special day was ruined thanks to this.

Went here last year to celebrate my sister's birthday for brunch and I can't believe it's taken me this long to write this review! While we waited for our table, we got bloody marys which tasted amazing. Once seated, our view during brunch could not be beaten, we were right next to the beach on a sunny day The service was great. I got the crab cake benedict sauce on side. Again, that tasted delicious too. I forgot what everyone at the table ordered, but no one had a single complaint about the food and plates were cleared! They also came out with a birthday treat for my sister which really made the experience even better! I cannot wait to make my way out to Santa Barbara again to visit this place again.

This was my first year and it won't be my last!
From the music to the vendors to the performances....we were in heaven. 

First let me say I'm so happy they kept going rain or shine. Saturday it rained most of the day. But I was determined to experience what other natives call Tucson Eat Yourself. I bought an umbrella just to enjoy. 

Food: 

First place we hit was the Venezuelan food truck. Those arepas were worth going out! Throughout the day we experienced the food of Japan, Columbia, Tohono O'odham Nation, Greece, and one other amazing place I missed the name of. 

Sunday, my brother in law loves the Bosnian food. He and my sister reported they enjoyed their day. 

Vendors:

We purchased alcohol, chocolate, honey, and prickly pear juice. It was nice to enjoy local products. 

Side note: 

I wish I memorized business names. I won't lie I was amazed yet overwhelmed by all of the things to see and enjoy. We went back on Sunday but it was packed with people. Which was overwhelming. 

This was a great event for all. We brought the baby on Sunday and she laughed and cheered at the shows. People brought there pets and were respectful of cleanliness. 

I can't wait for next year.

We have been anticipating the grand opening of Condado for a while now and it definitely did not disappoint! The host staff was very welcoming and got us seated immediately. Our server was especially friendly as she took her time to explain the menu to us and to ensure that we were all comfortable. The management staff was also very welcoming and stopped by to make sure we had everything we needed. I highly recommend ordering the jalapeno margarita as it was the perfect mixture of sweet and spicy. 10/10 for food, drinks, and service. Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely be back!

I have been to Juicy's a few times, over the past 5 years. I never had a bad experience, that's why I am giving 3 stars. But I should just be giving 1 star after my last order.

I ordered 3 double cheeseburgers, to be well done. I expected them to be well done. If I wanted medium rare, I would have asked for it. One of the sandwiches was still pink inside. I was concerned about food poisoning, so I told my business partner not to eat it. It was a disappointment because he had looked forward to it all day. But no one needs a hospital bill right now.
Again, if I asked for medium rare, it wouldn't have been too bad. But we did request well done.
In addition, I also did not receive the fries I ordered. I was still charged for them but the driver did not deliver them or give an explanation of why they were not available.

I know Juicy's can do a good job. I have been satisfied with them before.

On December 3rd, I ordered from Golden Corral on Door Dash, and my order included a 24 ounce of macaroni salad. When I received a 24 ounce container of macaroni and cheese, I immediately called the restaurant and spoke with a manager who apologized and told me to come in for the replacement. I went to the Golden Corral this evening to get some dinner to go from the line. When I went up front to pay for my food, I told the cashier about what happened with the macaroni salad, and showed her my order on the Door Dash app. The cashier was new, but kind, and she quickly went and got the manager (Joe). 

When the manager walked up, I started to tell him the story and he immediately became defensive and confrontational. First, he interrupted me and said, do you know the managers name. Then he interrupted me and said they don't sell macaroni salad there, as if he thought I was lying about the entire thing. Then he told me that I need to contact Door Dash because they do not handle any Door Dash issues in store. I continuously tried to explain that the manager of their restaurant never told me they didn't even sell macaroni salad and he asked me to come in, which is why I was there. Finally, he became frustrated and said, even if we sold macaroni salad, I would give it to you. I became upset, because I felt like he wasn't listening to anything I was saying and he came to the conclusion that I was some liar or cheat who was looking for free food. I then said to him that he was being disrespectful to me and that I did not even know if I wanted the food I had in front of me at the register. He then said, "If you take the food without paying for it I will call the police and you will be arrested for theft. I then said, I already paid for my food, I was referring to getting a refund. He then said, I can make that happen. We started going back and forth about his threat. Then I asked the cashier to call Joe's manager. 

While I was waiting for Joe's manager, another customer walked up to Joe and said that he had been waiting for over 20 minutes for Joe's manager to come to his table because he received raw meet. Joe turned to him and said, "well, he's busy." The customer then said, "he's too busy to speak to a paying customer about an issue." The customer was standing the proof on his plate in his hand. Joe then told him that if he did not calm down he would call the police and have him arrested. The customer increasingly became upset because of the unwarranted threat, then Jose came out and calmed the customer down. The customer was still upset. He continued to yell at Joe as he made his way to the door. He said, "whats your problem? You need to learn how to talk to customers. Your'e not supposed to treat customers like this." Jose then walked up to speak with me. I explained the matter to him, and he immediately apologized. He told me that they no longer sell macaroni salad, and if I reach out to Door Dash they should resolve the issue. He basically said the same thing that Joe said, but with respect and sincerity. I then explained to Jose that Joe is rude and disrespectful and he does not know how to treat customers. I am a business major who has extensive restaurant experience, and I have never seen or dealt with a person like Joe. I felt offended by how Joe treated me. I felt the need to log in to my bank account to show Jose that I have a substantial amount of money, and that I was not looking to con anyone out of macaroni salad. Jose told me he believed me. 

Joe took a small issue and made it worse. Joe is emotionally unstable, he lacks customer service skills, but most importantly, he lacks people skills. He does not know how to effectively handle conflict, and he is actually skilled in escalating matters, not deescalating them. Joe is a liability and he visibly makes Jose's job harder. Jose had to calm both myself and the other customer down after Joe's failed attempt of resolving basic issues. Because of this experience, I will never eat at another Golden Corral again!

The spot that used to be Capriccio house's a new coffee spot so I decided to check it out on my way to Rittenhouse Square. It's a little less indie and a little more fancy pants and overall it offered a lot of good and a few things that could be bad.

On the good they got rid of Capriccio's awkward booth set up it favor of more chairs. So it was a lot more roomier and comfortable. They also had some cool photos of the Eiffel tower and other landmarks. The dessert selection looked absolutely decadent, and they had a well rounded selection of lattes and sandwiches.

On the bad the staff looked kind of befuddled. there were 3 people working the sandwich area, 2 working the register, one working the coffee area, and 2 stocking the exterior of the service counter. The number was pretty close to outnumbering the amount of customers being helped at any given time and bordered on the excessive. The register also looked to be ran on an awkward card system (scan a card in before placing an individual order). It's only been open for 8 days though so these are some kinks that can be worked out.

The latte that I picked up was pretty misleading. I ordered the Milky Way which was named for the candy bar, So I was expecting smooth and caramel flavored. It was anything but and totally bitter. On the plus side that means you might be able to order the Snickers if you have a peanut allergy (McThrill does not recommend this). And after checking out the menu I saw no evidence of Iced Coffee. I sure hope I'm wrong!

I'll admit it, sometimes I'm a complete flake. Drove by my corner mailbox to drop off some bills and threw an envelope with concert tickets in there too. Tickets to a sold out Black Crowes show that night. What's a girl to do? 
Rather than try to stick my hand down the mailbox and risk getting arrested or just plain stuck, I headed to work and Googled the USPS to find my local Post Office. Got in touch with the manager almost immediately (no red tape or secret passwords at this office) and he was incredibly cool about the whole thing. Apparently I'm not the first person to dump non-mail into the mailbox. Pfew!
He had me wait at the mailbox and radioed a carrier to meet me down there. I didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes. The carrier was super sweet and we found the tickets right away. She even wished me a belated happy birthday! 

Who says that you have to be a jerk to work at the USPS? Certainly not at the Tower Grove office! Now if their courteousness would rub off on the DMV then the world would be a happy place!

Gris-Gris Ratings: 4.4/5

Food: 4.25/5 - Made a reservation at Gris-Gris for our last meal at New Orleans. I heard many great things about this place, and it definitely live up the hype and high reviews. The food was delicious and creative, and we all had a great time and loved the ambiance. The descriptions of the dishes we ordered are listed below. 

- Oyster BLT [GET]: Our appetizer, which was fried gulf oysters, with smoked pork belly topped with their homemade tomato jam, micro arugula, and sugarcane vinegar. Oysters was fried perfectly, juicy, and tasted like it just came out of the sea. Pork belly was a tad bit of salty and dry; I think they may overcooked it, but their tomato jam and sugarcane vinegar were BOMB. 

- Shrimp & Gris-Gris Grits [GET]: If you're in NOLA, you must try the grits. The gulf shrimp was tender and fresh, smoked sausage was high-quality and you definitely can taste all the meats in it. The cheery tomatoes was a good addition, change of flavors from the acidity. Lastly, the ground grits was soaked in a nice broth. Very well-cooked and super delicious. I just wish there was something crunchy to change up the texture of this dish, because overall it was a mushy and soft dish, but taste-wise it was amazing. 

- Double Cut Pork Chop [GET]: Fire-grilled pork chop with creole spices paired with greens. The highlight was the smothered new potatoes. It was wonderful, literally perfectly cooked, cannot ask for better potatoes. It was packed with flavors and spices, definitely one of my favorite thing of the night. The blueberry pork jus also elevates the potatoes and the pork chops a lot. The jus was sweet and pork chop was salty, I love the combination. Only downside is that pork chop was a bit well-done when we ask for it to be cooked medium. 

- Mississippi Rabbit Fricassee [GET]: This is braised local rabbit seared trinity topped with Louisiana popcorn rice. The rabbit had the texture of a chicken thigh, but with more or almost only lean meat. It was well-cooked and definitely juicy, loved the sauce with it (wonderful NOLA base). Make sure to soak the rice and the blackened sweet cornbread into the sauce; made it a bit easier to eat, otherwise it would be too dry. Overall, it was incredible. 

- Loa Sangria [SKIP]: Got the sangria with fresh apple, pear, orange, and spices soaked in red wine. I was not a big fan of the sangria, wasn't sweet or able to taste the fruits. It was a weird combination with the spices. I think the red wine wasn't strong enough either. Would not recommend, just go for the cocktails. 

Ambiance: 4.75/5 - I love the atmosphere here, because everyone seems so so happy here. It is in the Garden District of NOLA, full of amazing restaurants and shops in the area. We sat at the balcony, and the weather is perfect for outdoor seating, and there's amazing Christmas songs playing, super festival vibe. The decorations is super chic. The bathroom is huge, with a couch in it. This is the perfect spot for a date night. 

Price: 4/5 - The sangria was $9, and we got an appetizer for $14. We ordered three entrees: shrimp & gris-gris- grits, double cut pork chop, and rabbit fricassee for $26, $28, and $27, respectively. The total came up to be around $130 after taxes and tips for the three of us. 

Service: 4.5/5 - I made a reservation on Resy, and got seated as soon as we arrived. The service was outstanding and friendly, especially our server. She was quick and efficient. Gave us great recommendations and was super patient with us, and also warned us about the kitchen being backed up. The food did take a while though, but she kept us company by constantly checking in with us. Great experience for sure, many laughters with my siblings. 

BLUF: Refined Southern cuisine owned by Chef Eric Cook (a great look guy, and make sure to read his profile on their website). An unbelievably experience, excellent twist on Southern food, cool decor, and wonderful service. This is a not to miss place in NOLA. I recommend the Shrimp & Gris-Gris Grits and the Mississippi Rabbit Fricassee.
God this place was disgusting. The soup tasted like straight up dish soap and ruined my appetite and made me sick. Don't go here.

This was quite a dining experience. I was informed that Alpen Rose offers  a unique, and unforgettable dining experience; if one is capable of securing a reservation, which is the reason why I stalked OpenTable all day Friday, to secure a 5:30 dinner reservation the next day. It was no easy task as this place is booked solid for months. 

The interesting and unique begins at the door upon arrival. Patrons ring the doorbell for entry and then they are greeted by a hostess through a panel on the door to confirm your reservation before being allowed to enter. I unfortunately did not get the opportunity to experience this prohibition style entry as previous diners were leaving the restaurant, and I walked in with my friend to join the other half our party.

Upon seating we were greeted by an awesome waiter who was more than happy to explain the concept behind the restaurant, made great suggestions, and made everything on the menu sound heavenly. Service kicked off with an amazing round of cocktails of their prohibition style drink menu; numbers only. We moved on to appetizers including 1/2 dozen of Japanese style oysters and bone-marrow toast. This was my first time sampling bone-marrow. I didn't think it was horrible, but I probably should have ordered more oysters. 

It was now time for the entree portion of our dining experience. My wife and I decided to go with a special our waiter sold us on, a over 40 day dry-aged Porterhouse for two. Based upon our experiences at other steakhouses this was not quite what we expected in regards to portion size. I could have eaten the porterhouse on my own. In regards to flavor, this quality cut of meat had a rich flavor that just melted in your mouth. My friend is a lobster lover, and orders it every time we dine out. She enjoyed it but it left her feeling a bit underwhelmed. The accompaniments were spot on; especially the roasted carrots...they were absolutely fantastic. The mashed potatoes... creamy and delicious! Onion Rings...creamy and delicious! 

We usually get dessert at another location but we planned on ordering the baked alaska before we even set foot inside the restaurant and it did not disappoint; in presentation or taste. We also ordered the chocolate cake. No disrespect to the prominent dessert at this establishment but the chocolate cake stole the show. We also ordered coffee with dessert. Okay it's coffee but, the entire set up with the French press, coffee cups, saucers, and sugar cubes had Alpen Rose style written all over it. 

I have already been stalking OpenTable for reservations for my birthday in a couple of weeks but there are is no availability, in addition to no baby sitter. This experience has me wanting experience the quality this establishment has to offer again.

I visit Buddy Brew every time I come to Tampa. I wish this company was other places because it's so good, but I also love that it's unique to Tampa. 

There are multiple locations, but we went to this fun free-standing one. The decor was super cute. The space was nice, airy and bright and I could definitely see myself coming here to get some quality work/studying done. The staff were also super sweet and helpful! 

My fiance ordered the cold brew, which was super strong (of course) in a good way. The brew was super tasty and not too bitter. 

I ordered an iced caramel latte with oat milk (half sweet). It was absolute divine perfection. Half sweet was the perfect amount of sweetness. And I could definitely taste their divine blend of espresso underneath the flavor. Can't wait to go back to Buddy Brew soon!

Who doesn't love ice cream?! Cold stone has been one of my favorite since I was a little girl, and now I get to take my kiddos! The staff is friendly takes all safety precautions for COVID and makes sure every customer is helped efficient! You can tell the staff dynamic is good. They're a team. The way they communicated and handled online orders in between each customer in line was impressive. 

We ordered 2 like it sized chocolate filled strawberry ice creams with a marshmallow mix it, and then their holiday creation: cake batter moose tracks. It has chocolate sauce, cake batter moose track ice cream, yellow cake, strawberries and sprinkles. That one was a love It size. We all enjoyed our ice cream in their indoor eating area, and enjoyed some quality time together! I wish there was more to say but it's ice cream. It's very straight forward, and delicious.

This place is always super busy so if you plan on going-plan on waiting. The service is great though and the food is nice pub food. Definitely a great place for a beer and fish and chips after a rough day. Servers were EXTREMELY busy but super nice and on top of everything.

Listen to all of the reviews - the Dan Dan noodles are a MUST TRY. They were so good! Some other things I liked:
1) their funny signs at the entrance ("This location sucks. So we're moving." HA)
2) the craft beers on tap
3) Dan Dan noodles
4) Leftover rice mixed with the Dan Dan juices
5) That I could make a reservation
6) They sat my husband and I before the other couple we were meeting arrived - some restaurants won't do that so I appreciated them allowing us to get comfy and read the menu before they got there
7) spice levels can be adjusted.

Of course, there are very few restaurants that are perfect so some cons of our visit - originally, we were going to be seated in downstairs/basement area. That would have been fine except for the fact that there was NO ONE else there. The hostess said "It'll be packed in an hour" but it would have been awkward for the hour until people arrived so we asked to be moved upstairs where there were still open seats (which they allowed us to do). Not sure the rationale to put us there to begin with when there were open seats upstairs...eh, no big deal though.

The garlic chicken was good, but not great. I would return for the Dan Dan noodles again though.

We stopped at this establishment after a long day. We aren't from around here so we decided that an IHOP was a pretty safe option. We sat down and our waitress took our drink orders, and someone in our party asked for coke when they only had Pepsi products and he waitress never even bothered to ask if Pepsi was okay. Such a small and petty thing but it's the fact that the waitress had no desire to confirm. 

We ordered our food and it wasn't anything fancy, but had to wait a slightly over average time wait time for your typical IHOP food, but it sat nicely and was well prepared. When we get our food the waitress basically throws it at us and had our food slide all over the place and all she had to say was "oops." Then, she doesn't check in with us until we're done eating as if the place was actually busy. 

During our stay I could hear the waiter tell the table next to us that they had checked the freezer and all out of biscuits, assuring the quality of our food. The place wasn't bad overall, just the waitress brought down the quality of our visit.
Small place in Clayton but oh so worth it!  Best donuts in STL and I'm coming from the best in Chi.  Will be back for more.

I needed to redownload yelp just to talk about what an amazing establishment naan stop is. Literally not only is it the best place to eat in IV its just got a warm spot in my heart. Food is always delicious and served by the kindest and most dedicated people. I just cant say enough good things. I think comparatively to any place in IV its way better to spend your money on things that arent just frozen and fried for you. I feel good eating here and it's really a pleasure to interact with all the people behind the counter. Just so f'ing good!! Everything is worth trying

Damn good burgers, cooked to order. (Get the superburger if you can!)

Super huge and tasty reubens. Fries that are crispy and salty on the outside, reminiscent of homemade mashed potatoes on the inside. 

They've got a mean fish and chips if you show up at the right time.

Go to Marble's hungry or don't go at all.
Customer Service was excellent, food even better. Great atmosphere, Highly recommend. Definitely will be back. Support local!

I made reservations a week in advance due to the weekend being New Years Eve weekend. Checking in was smooth, the host sat us early. It took a while for the waitress to take our order but it wasn't a huge issue since we weren't in a rush.

The restaurant had a special NYE menu that day so we weren't able to try the other dishes which is shown in the other customer's images. That was disappointing since there wasn't a huge selection of dishes that night. So I felt a bit robbed. Anyway, I ordered a half dozen oysters, gator bites, and the Louisiana sampler (jambalaya, crawfish Étouffée, red beans and rice, and gumbo), and for dessert the Bananas foster bread pudding. Everything was delicious. I highly recommend the fresh oysters. 

The service was okay. Our waitress came off a little rude, slightly impatient, but I didn't want to hold it against her because it was a busy night. I just hope she doesn't act like that towards customers everyday. 

I do plan on returning in the future hoping that I'll get to try a full menu, instead of a limited menu.

This place would get five stars, but the greeters need a little reminder in customer service.  It might have been just normal as I did experience this at every place in New Orleans.  Maybe the freezing cold temps just made everyone bitchy?  Well, not everyone.  Just the greeters of every place I went.

******Now for the review*******

I settled at the bar after a long morning of touring New Orleans.  It was a cold day, and I was happy to sit at the bar next to where they cook the oyster.  The warmth was wonderful!

Now, I hate to be called 'Sugar', 'Babe', or 'Honey'; however, the bartender did it in such a way that made me a little giddy.  The outstanding service probably helped with being okay with the nicknames; but after having the greeters roll their eyes to me when I asked if there were open seats, maybe I was slightly easy to impress.

I ordered the hush puppies, and was not impressed.  It was my first time ever having hush puppies, so maybe they aren't for me?

Next the Pasta Orleans. OMG.  All the flavors with the JUMBO shrimp hit the spot that it was my only meal for the day. I knew nothing could compete for the rest of the day. 

THE BEST PART was the DEAD MAN MULE.  Order it, become obsessed with the strawberry mint flavor and the liquor used.  The liquor is made and only sold in New Orleans.  You will fall in love with it, and find a liquor store to bring the bottles home.
Looks like a little hole in the wall with a great bar and outside patio. Great atmosphere with friendly waitresses. I had the crawfish enchiladas OMG. THE BEST!! Highly recommend 11 out of 10.

I've been using this CVS location ever since I moved to Fishers, which has now been about a year and a half. To be honest, I've not once had an issue with customer service, timelines or professionalism. I typically stop by for the pharmacy, but I've definitely purchased my fair share of other odds and ends. (Like ... Sour Patch Kids and other Sarah necessities.) I appreciate the promptness when going through the pharmacy drive through. I typically swing by during my lunch break for work and I'm never worried about them taking too terribly long. The only thing that bugs me is that this location isn't open late enough ... haha. I'm a night owl and find myself running errands late at night or early in the morning before work. I've come here a couple of times and am quickly reminded that they aren't open 24 hours a day. Even so, it's a great spot and I will continue to bring my pharmacy needs to this CVS. :)

Writing an update on my initial review as we have now sold our first home (big tear). When we first new we had to do this, there was no question that we needed to contact Josh. 

With a looming transpacific move including a dog and toddler and working full time, there were many components in the home selling process that Josh patiently and kindly walked us through. His guidance was an incredible relief because we knew and were able to trust that he was going to do everything well.  

Now that we're having to go through the home buying process again, I wish Josh were licensed in this state so that we could continue to work with him!

How is this parade not 5 stars from everyone? Seriously, this is the best parade of mardi gras. Don't get me wrong, there are several others that are definitely not to miss. While some might have flashier throws or more elaborate floats - Zulu combines history/tradition and a party all in one. Highlight this year was a cop dancing the cupid shuffle with a group of people (not the viral video, but another dancing cop- gotta love New Orleans!). 

Flat out, coconuts have to be my favorite throw. Well... they are more tossed or handed out rather than thrown. This is good since they would probably cause at least a few injuries if they were chucked. Each is decorated so that no 2 are the same. It's fun to yell and wave in attempts to be rewarded with a coconut. And how can you resist the black and gold theme colors? They are the best beads for future wear at Saints games or home decorations. The only throw I could have done without this year was the bf getting a naked woman in a folded position... haha. 

Waking up early is worth it. Libations in the street (in plastic cups of course) make things warmer while you wait for the parade to start. Yes, it doesn't really start on time, but what in New Orleans actually does?  

If you'd like to learn more about their roots, please read: http://www.kreweofzulu.com/history

This is your typical Midwest Mexican restaurant. They have a patio, so you can sit outside, which is a bonus. They also have a kids menu with things on it that are not Mexican food, which comes in handy because kids are fickle and picky. My child got the personal pepperoni pizza, which he really enjoyed.

Anyway, we ordered a bean, rice and cheese burrito, with the instructions: no sauce or anything on top! Just beans, rice and cheese inside the tortilla. We wanted a burrito: The kind you eat while holding in your hands. 

We get our takeout order, and it was a container of rice and beans with a tortilla on top. Ta-da ... Midwest Mexican food. This has happened to me many times at many Mexican restaurants around here, so it's not just particular to Cancun. And by "this," I mean giving me a plate of rice and beans with a tortilla folded on top when I order a burrito. 

Bless their hearts. I'm sure they thought they are were making me a burrito.  But I'm starting to feel like I need to carry around a laminated picture of a burrito, so that I'm prepared the next time I order at a Midwest Mexican restaurant. I'm thinking on one side of my laminated card will be a picture of a person holding a burrito in their hands. On the other side will be a burrito cut in half, to show the beans, rice and cheese inside the rolled up tortilla. That way there's no confusion.

I was happy to see a nopales taco on their menu, which I ordered and enjoyed. Cactus is not my favorite, but I like to order it when I can to encourage restaurants to continue providing things like nopales on their menus.

Must

Reading terminal is a must. Everything you're looking for in the philly food hunt is here. From cheesesteaks to canoli's and dumplings in between. 

Bagels to gourmet coffee and pastries to Thai food. Anything and everything is here. 

I'm a sucker for termini's!

I have mixed reviews regarding this Dobbs location.  I have had standard oil changes and timing belts replaced without difficulty.  The work was done on time and for a competitive price.  I have to admit every time I have been there, the staff is very nice and cordial.  

Recently I had both axles replaced.  Unfortunately as I pulled out of the lot with my vehicle the axle promptly dislodged within 50 feet.  It was towed back in and we found that the axle that was installed was too short.  Seemed to be a warehouse issue as the wrong axle was in the box.  It was replaced without questions.
Subsequently transmission fluid began to leak.  The seal was replaced once and it leaked again.  The seal was then replaced again with a OEM part.  Leak fixed.  But then the axle began to creak and make noise again.  
Subsequently the axle and seal was replaced once again.  All in all 5 bounce backs.  
Each time however the staff was easy to work with and took care of it under warranty without question.  There is a lifetime parts and labor warranty which helps but makes me wonder a little if they are prepared to work on certain vehicles with confidence.  

Would be nice if they offered a little discount for all the trouble that we have gone through.  That being said I have been very happy with the hospitality and service.
They do have a Dobbs shuttle that will transport you within a 5 mile radius.  

I would consider giving them another chance but likely with a more simple service task.

Just drive a few miles and go to the chilis in Jenkintown. The service was absolutely terrible, one thing after another. No eye contact, no asking if everything was okay. Our appetizer was super late and we had to ask him to check on the kitchen. 

My group at the bar was told by the bartender when we complained about lack of service that "we were not her guests, She is not getting a tip from us so she did not have to ask if anything was okay." The same one repeatedly flipped her hair and ran her fingers through her hair behind the bar. I find this disgusting when I know she will be touching lemons and limes, making drinks and carrying plates. Hair floats and sheds and it was very unhygienic.
Cute place, nice and calm, delicious food. Would def go back to try more pizza. Highly recommend the artichoke pizza

Get the Scalibut!!

We wandered in here for a late weeknight dinner while touring New Orleans and were pleasantly surprised. Fairly unassuming off of Bourbon street, might be pretty easy to miss if you weren't looking for it. We originally thought they might not seat us because we arrived pretty late in the night - about 8:45 but they actually gave us a reservation for after 9pm. We started with the salmon crudo - delicate, light, and not fishy or loxy at all - and then I got the scalibut - flaky moist buttery halibut coated in a thin layer of perfectly seared scallops. I'll be talking about it for months to come I am sure! My husband got the drum which was also good, moist, and buttery but I think mine was the winner. Our waitress was so friendly, frequently checked in, and was very knowledgeable about the menu. My only criticism of the place is that the wines were pretty expensive for not that high quality, but otherwise we were blown away!

My VW JETTA got hit and Precision handled the entire process from beginning to end! Arranged pre-payment for the damages caused to my car by the other driver and did a FANTASTIC job repairing the  side panel and even arranged having the alignment checked on the car. The car looked brand new when I picked it up today! Big thank you to Gabe and Louie and the entire crew at Precision. Streamlined the process and all had a very professional attitude and were sincerely nice! Highly recommended!

Awful, we are from out of town, went in for breakfast and we were not greeted as we walked in. We saw many waitresses walking around and talking to each other. We finally got sat at a table and 10 minutes went by no one came to us to get drinks or anything and we left. Very disappointed.

Every time I visit the Tampa/Clearwater area, I make an effort to stop by here. I love the rich Greek culture and the history behind this area. The Greeks setup shop here back in the day and made a living by diving for sponge! 

The sponge is a live organism but they once they bring it up to land, they dry it and sanitize it to use as a bathing tool. I've actually went on a boat tour with a sponge diver and man, seeing what they did for a living was thrilling and inspiring. It's not easy work and the diving suit is super heavy with pretty much a hose feeding the suit with oxygen. The bottoms of their boots are lined with weights so they can walk down at the bottom of the sea and collect the sponges. It was a booming industry back in the early 1900's but not so much today since synthetic sponges are made in place of the live sponges.

There's quite a few restaurants and shops on Dodecanese Avenue; I've been to a couple of the restaurants and the food was excellent. The shops are pretty neat; I've bought a few souvenirs and soaps made from goat milk from them. Definitely stop by if you're in the area and do one of the tours, it's fun!

Very yummy ice cream! We got the flight and it was so beautiful, I almost didn't want to eat it. ALMOST. I loved each affogato flavor!

I took a star off because the wait was very long to get our flight. This place seems quite new and there were only 2 people behind the counter cranking out all the orders so hopefully the iron out the kinks soon. Also, buying the flight actually doesn't save you any money than by just purchasing 4 a la carte...so I'm not sure why you'd get a flight when you can get 4 of whatever flavors you want.. oh well!

I am wavering between two and three stars. I love the location, love the space and ambience, and  have always been happy with the results when i get my brows done (particularly with Rachel - she's awesome). But after going 10+ times, and always having to wait 10-30 minutes to get my brows waxed, I'm decidedly disenchanted with the overall experience. It doesn't even take 30 minutes to wax my eyebrows - I shouldn't have to wait longer than the activity itself. I always have an appointment, and on two ocassions, I've had to walk out because i have other appointments to get to. 

I definitely recommend this place if quality is your main concern and time is of no importance to you.

I've been there twice, both for dinner, once in 2018 (there are no other 2018 reviews) and once in 2019.  The first was a charity dinner with many people paying over $100, some of which went to charity.  The second was a corporate function with each head costing $75 or so.

You should know that Carriage House has a banquet kitchen that can keep things cold, hot, or reheat them.  It is not a full restaurant kitchen!  The food is prepared next door at chef Wilder's real restaurant.

At the first event the air-conditioning was undersized or some units were not on.  The staff kept lowering the thermostat setting, unaware that when the unit can't 'satisfy' the requested temperature, lowering it more does nothing other than annoy those of us who see you doing nothing useful.

At the second event the room was still a bit warm but the staff did not turn the air-conditioning units on at all.  The tables had been arranged in a pattern I can't really describe... it's like they threw out frisbees into this large room (and it IS a large room) and there they landed they put out an eight-top.  

The dishes were brought out by banquet servers, not professional restaurant servers.  ONE dish per hand, usually on both hands.  That's right, no stacking of dishes, only serving two customers per trip back to the banquet (think "keeping warm and reheating") kitchen.  The service order was random.  At one point the ladies were served first --  this is correct.  At another point the dishes were brought out and one side of the table was served first, ladies and gentlemen, and at another all but one of us were served and then the server went off to other tables.

Neither the plates (nor the table) had any form of sauce, dressing, or condiment.  The meat was free from sauce, etc.  There were two different fish dishes but not more than a dab of sauce underneath. There was no bread nor was there butter.   We can all avoid the carbs, but that should be our choice.

The food, being reheated was lukewarm, prepared all to the same temperature ("medium+"), and of no significant quality that stood out.  The fish appeared to have come from a frozen batch, evident since all the orders were the same size, shape, and consistency.  Unless you're running your own fish processing plant you'd never get this uniformity... unless... you bought frozen.  

Now with all that over two dinners you might ask well why did we come back a second time, and why not leave.  The servers.  Their attitude was remarkably cool, calm, and professional.  While they only carried two plates at a time, they didn't drop them.  They delivered the right food to the right people.  They kept waters filled (chef Wilder doesn't provide bussers at these events) and plates cleared and were as prompt as they could be given the two-plate at a time constraint.  They smiled, they engaged in conversation, and when one of our guests said she couldn't eat the [I forget what] they found her a substitute asap.

My recommendations:
1. Don't go in the heat of summer.  The cooling system is inadequate and cannot keep up.  
2. When you preorder your food or order your food remember it's not "made on site" so use the same criteria as if you'd  order something delivered from a restaurant with a 40 minute delivery time.  Fried foods will be soggy.  Saucy foods may have the sauce separate or get sopped up by other foods.
3. Expect to wait a long time.  Be patient.  If that's not what you're thinking that night, don't go.

E

I love LA cafe. The food is amazing. The ribs are spot on! Not a very expensive place and the food is very very delicious. Great for all ages. They do have some front spot parking but have additional parking in a lot across the street

This Dunkin'/Baskin combo is always slow with a 20+ wait time almost every single time. I used to go twice a week but now hardly ever because they can never make the drink I like to order (cappuccino blast from the Baskin menu). They don't have the mix, the "frozen machine" is broken, or they don't know what I'm talking about. I wish they would learn their own menu and carry the stock to make the order.

Ordered delivery which arrived in 45min. Entrees on the pricey side for the quantity/quality. $13 each for vegetarain food in a medium container.  10% off if you order on their site + pay cash. 

Malai Kofta-generally not my favorite Indian dish, but this was creamy and big chunks of kofta. 
Makani Paneer-The paneer was that fake paneer that I hate. I felt like it was baked tofu. Tough to eat when paneer should be creamy.. it's a cheese! There were a few huge chunks of it. At least the gravy was good. 

Neither were oily! ++ 


Rice to curry ratio terrible! Barely got any rice! Disappointing because the rice was good. 

I think this place is pricey for delivery. Glad it wasn't oily and heavy, but the paneer dish was womp womp.

This is one of my boss's go-to bakeries, and for good reason!

We had a vanilla-vanilla birthday cake today at work today.  Since I'm "behaving," I only had a sliver!

Both the cake and icing were exceptional - in taste and in freshness.

In looking at the other Yelp pictures, I see that the bakers are truly talented artists as well.  BEAUTIFUL work!

I definitely would order a cake from Randolph's for a special occasion!  

YUMMY!  :)

5/5 for authentic greek take out food and 1/5 for COVID precautions and moreover, 0/5 for transparency about COVID precautions.  

This is a small mediterranean grocery with a deli, a limited selection of take out and prepared food and a few tables. This is all in a packed space of roughly 700-800 sq ft.

I was SO excited to try it in hope that I could get some authentic Greek-American food, some good feta (stored in water in many greek groceries), and maybe some Italian imports. 

I love ALL things Mediterranean, especially greek, between growing up with a lot of Greeks in Queens + a few visits to Greece, my authenticity meter is pretty on point. No Italian imports but recognized some greek ones and feta in water. I ordered 1 gyro pita (delish w/ fresh pita), 1 greek salad (w/ that goood feta), 1 spanakopita (YAS - authentic and even good room temp), and baklava (man, this was good too - walnuts and pastry were fresh w/ right amt. of honey).  

So, why 2 stars?  Let me tell you why.  

Because there is a sign on the door that says masks are required (SEE PIC) but NONE of the staff were wearing masks (1/3 had a face shield) and 7/9 patrons (assuming the 7 were regulars or perhaps some family because most were going in/out of back door).  There was no social distancing. There was even a greek orthodox priest that entered at the same time as me (wearing a bandana as a mask) but actually pulled it down over his chin after entering?!  Folks, including 2 elderly women were walking around, maskless, yapping across the store and one was coughing up a lung. I really thought I was on candid camera for a minute. 

I said I would wait outside given the lack of masks and when I went back in, 1 of the patrons + priest were wearing masks.  I picked up my food (quickly) and said how excited I was to try this place but was concerned that there was a sign on the door about masks that wasn't being followed.  The employee (face-shield) just sort of gave me a grunt and one of the elderly patrons, still maskless and now sitting, sort of heckled me, as I walked out and said she was eventually going to eat. 

Ultimately, if a business doesn't require masks, patrons can choose whether or not to visit that establishment, but when you mislead patrons, by putting a sign on the door saying that you require masks, and then do not follow or enforce it, that is not only negligent but deceiving. Be better.

Rumor has it, Biscuit love is a top-rated spot in Nashville. I had to know, is the hype real? Well, we pulled up on a Sunday morning at 9:15am, line down the building and its raining. Is it really that good to wait in line in the rain?! 
Verdict...

Hell yesss!
The biscuits are flakey and baked to perfection.
And oh boy, the BONUTS, the bonuts, the bonuts are mind blowingly good. Biscuit dough topped with mascarpone, good lord!!
I also loved the S.E.C. which was a biscuit with sausage and egg, delicious!
Menu decently priced from $7-$15 and the lattes are so good! Heads up, cocktails aren't served until after 11am.

Overall, this spot was a fan favorite of the trip and the wait for an hour in the rain was ever so worth it!

Terrible food. It taste like cheddar cheese with spaghetti. The spaghetti is not al dente. It's hard. There is no capers taste. The shrimp is very minimal. It taste almost as mac and cheese out of the box. The worst pasta I've ever had in my whole life for $18.99.

The female stylists are great listeners (especially Brandi) and gave me the type of cut I wanted each time. The male stylist, however, seemed to go his own way both times I let him cut my hair. I have short, thick, curly hair. The first time, I figured I'd just let it grow and I'd get over it, as the curls will cover any unevenness. The second time, however, he completely butchered my natural part and the way my hair lies on its own. This was over 6 months ago and my hair is -still- an uneven mess. I am trying to let it grow out before I go see one of the more high-end stylists in the city to fix the mess on my head. Very displeased. If you're particular about your style, it's worth it to pay for better service elsewhere.

The atmosphere is beautiful and centered towards anyone ready for a good happy hour. On the other hand, a lot of noise comes with the territory where it became hard to hear my company. I don't believe it's the norm though.

I would give negative stars if i could..

Hello Yelp'ers!! I wanted to put my recent interaction with Hyper Cleaning & Restoration up in hopes no one ever uses them, and if you are signed up, you switch services.  While I can't say I'm happy I even engaged in this conversation, I was blown away the founder and owner would engage.  You'll see him make assumptions about my income level and then even share personal name and address information of another customer in his efforts to make fun of me.  (I've blurred personal info for the person's privacy)  I found almost every competitor to be more cost friendly.  Warning: I do curse in here, but im not sorry, about it, I've blurred them out, but if you don't drop a few f*bombs here and there you might not want to read this.


Background story to the texts: I did an online quote request via their website and received a text with a quote from Mitch, the founder and owner, with $495 for something like 10-ish vents then $25 for each additional vent, and that they could get me in that week.  I ignored it.  Received another a few days later with similar advertising.  I ignore it, and deleted the text chain.  So when I woke up to the first text in the posted pics I was thinking....who tf is this???  I actually thought it was from someone I used to date or a long lost friend, from the way it was written.  I Google the number only to find it was Hyper Cleaning & Restoration.  I was surprised they would take such an unprofessional approach, so I respond in efforts to get them to quit texting me, and while that worked, it was pretty messy to say the least.

We had trouble finding a place to stay near the UC for the weekend of freshman drop off. The Sunset Motel had one of the few available rooms in town for 2 adults/2 teens The photos looked OK and the reviews I read weren't too bad. Big mistake. 
They price gouged us ($400!) for one tiny, unclean, shabby room, with 2 queen beds. The room and carpet were dirty, bedding was funky, beds were ancient and very uncomfortable. We had a stairwell spotlight right outside our window so the room stayed lit up, even in the middle of the night. The toilet lid was broken off completely and the towel rack was hanging on one side. 
They proclaim a free "breakfast", but edible food like substances do not make a meal. And who uses styrofoam cups anymore?! What a joke. Don't even consider it.

I would give lower review if allowed.  Took money for job and never completed it. No longer returns phone calls or text messages. Paid over $11,000 for sod and irrigation and may well be one of the worst jobs ever
Possibly the best Cuban Sandwich I've ever had. Wonderful bread, juicy pulled pork, with ham, salami, cheese and tangy pickles. Don't forget to ask for the homemade hot sauce.

This place has fun vibes. The cookies are massive and as a cookie lover, they past the rest, especially when warmed up. The cookies are $6 so I knocked the stars from 5 to 4, but overall I will definitely return

We had an awesome time at this place. We all ordered different items and all were great. The service was spot on and looked in on us frequently. Very engaging!  We live in Somersett and are so happy such a great place is in our hood!  I can't wait to go again and again and try other items on the menu!

My wife and I were there recently and loved it!  Seriously we keep talking about it so i had to write it up!  We live in Atlanta with plenty of good restaurants but Margot is a unique must-go that seems like the original place that a lot of new restaurants are trying to copy. 
We had an 8 o'clock reservation on a friday night, and it seemed pretty busy but the place isn't very big so hard to tell.  Almost right away our table was ready and we sat upstairs at a small table for two right next to the rail overlooking the bar. Even though it was small and there was another table close to us we loved it. It felt kind of like a bistro in Paris, small and crowded but in a good way. The server was wonderful. A tall, tattoed guy named Adam(ask for him). Maybe I've just never had good service in a restaurant, but this guy could not have been better. He was funny and helpful and gave us the perfect recomendations for food and wine. My wife was ready to leave me for this guy! So anyways, now that I know what good service is like, on to the food. Adam asked if we had been there before, we said no, he offered to tell us a little about the menu.  The menu changes every day, and he quickly went over the basics of it. He pointed out the marinated olives and said he liked them, so we got some and my word, they were great.  Naturally we asked him what was good and what we should order. The lamb and the seafood were the top picks for the night, but he also mentioned the steak because it was from some special cow and very good. My wife asked about the chicken and (we loved this) he said something like "well, its chicken, but it is the best chicken I've ever had, so if thats what you want, get it" and it was really good. I had lamb, and it was also great. We were too full for dessert, and i regret not getting something. We live around lots of supposedly good restaurants, but Margot is something else. The food is more about tasting good than fancy presentation. It wasnt overpriced at all, and the service was a whole new experience for us. Definitely go there, we cant wait to go back!

I have had my car serviced at three different Carx locations in Indianapolis and was always pleased with the service and reasonable prices. I started patronizing this location because the company I worked for, relocated to Plainfield. 

This shop is exceptional! The service writers and mechanics are friendly, polite, professional, honest, and efficient. I have been very pleased with the service I received during every visit.

Thank you to the women and men who work at Carx Plainfield for always providing a great automotive service experience.

I've had an awful experience with this dealership. I had been a loyal Nissan customer purchasing a new Nissan after 2 leases. They were dishonest in what they "promised" and would be "taken care of" when I turned in my leased vehicle. I stopped and asked about this during the process and they assured me to not worry about wear-and-tear and disposition fees because I was sticking with Nissan. A bill for over $1000 shows up in my mail a week or so later. I have been trying to contact them about this through phone, email and even going into the dealership to no avail. An absolute nightmare to deal with, would NOT recommend to anyone.
I love getting sandwiches from waskos. They never disappoint!! Highly recommend the pork and broccoli rabe!!

The service is terrible. When you first sign in the man asked, "What do you want?" I told him I would like a nail overlay. A lady finally came to get me and asked me what I wanted done,I told her the same thing. When I sat down another lady came and asked me what I wanted done and I told her the same thing I told the other 2 people. She made me move out of the seat they sat me in and had a man do my nails. He immediately glues nails on my fingers. I didn't protest, my nails were really short so I went with it. 
I ended up getting french tips. He polished them and kept messing up. Later on when I got home I noticed the imperfections from his rush job. My hair would snag when I ran my fingers through it and there were gaps. 
I'm going to have them removed and done over at a better place. This was my first and last visit.

Passing through Indy & slept in Carmel. Headed here for breakfast, what a treat. Great food & fast, good service. Thank you Harrison! 
Really enjoyed the Frittata & the coffee (Lavazza) was wonderful! We'll stop here again!

Outstanding!! The food was the best , most authentic Korean food and bbq we have had. The service was top notch and attentive. Clean, and beautiful decor. Will be on our frequent restaurant list going forward !
We eat there every Saturday and or Sunday morning. Never a bad meal. We highly recommend. Service is very good. Service with a smileThe owners are the sweetest people

Here is a very condensed summary of my experience so far: Right Now Heating and Air Conditioning sold me a 2.5 ton central air conditioning unit, coil, two additional vent supplies. Shortly after the system was installed it couldn't live up to the standards the salesman guaranteed it would. 

Multiple different technicians and a service manager have been out to troubleshoot the system, all with different theories and solutions that should have fixed the AC, but nothing has worked. Right Now is unwilling to stand behind the stated performance expectations boasted by their salesman and is in direct violation of their advertised "100% Client Satisfaction Guarantee". 

I have had 2 independent HVAC companies assess the AC system that was sold to me by Right Now and both of them said they would have never increased the size of my AC to 2.5 tons without replacing my existing 2 ton furnace with a bigger one. I also have a written quote to duplicate the work Right Now did and it came to $1,300 less than what Right Now charged me and they refused to honor the price match guarantee because "it doesn't make much business sense". 

They offered to rig my furnace with a new blower motor to increase the airflow, but I would have to sign a waiver that would give up my right to the satisfaction guarantee. That is the most devious business practice I have ever witnessed. The owner should be embarrassed that was even offered to a customer. 

The moral of the story is the salesman sold me something he shouldn't have and did it using the satisfaction guarantee they advertise everywhere on their website, and the company is not standing behind that guarantee. Instead of fixing the problem they created in the right way, they insist on trying to blow me off or rig my system just enough to make me forget about the real problem, which is airflow from the now undersized furnace! 

Here's the crazy part: They even exacerbated the airflow deficiency they created by telling me I had to purchase 2 new duct supplies for over $1000. Adding more ductwork without adding airflow takes away airflow from the existing ducts. The purchase was completely unnecessary but I was told it was mandatory.

I'm completely unsatisfied, and Right Now is refusing to honor their money back guarantee or fix the problem. I have requested to escalate my issue to the owner. I was told "I'll pass it on" but haven't heard anything from the company. If I can't get a response in a timely manner I will further advance my complaint to the BBB and small claims court.

I have never seen a company with such disregard for its customers after the sale, which demonstrates their true intention. I've seen your comments Jeff, so I know you're reading this. It's unfortunate that Yelp reviews are a more effective way to communicate with the owner about a problem with his business than a phone call. Call me and make this right!

We were recommended to try Mazzah and it did not disappoint.  I really liked that they have vegan options as well as a menu that allows guests to create their own menu inspiration  My wife ordered the chicken kabob with rice and I ordered the stuffed grape leaves, dolma, and hummus as well as the Za'atr  bread.  The staff member who took our order was so patient with us and really helped us navigate the menu and choices.  We were not sure if we would be able to dine in but after confirming with the staff, we were able to have a date night inside a restaurant. Another staff member stopped by and let us know that the kabob would be prepared to order with a 15 minute wait time. It was not an issue as it allowed us to spend more of our date night in a restaurant together.  NOTE:  At this time, about a month ago or so, we wore our masks until our order arrived, and when our order arrived and shortly after our server left, we carefully removed and stored our masks to begin eating.   All of the dishes arrived and they were stunningly presented.  The chicken kabob over the bed of rice in the bowl was aromatically pleasing and the rolled / stuffed grape leaves were perfectly presented.  The hummus was freshly made and the Za'atr bread was the most mysterious.  I went for the Za'atr bread first as it really intrigued me.  The spices were an overload but not in a bad way, just in a new way.  It was sparks and fireworks in my mouth all at the same time.  Crazy and ridiculously tasty.  The hummus was just right.  It was not overly lemony but it was not dry and the pita bread was warm and crisp but not burnt.  The rolled grape leaves aka Dolma were sticky sweet on the outside and stuffed with spices and flavors inside.  They were my absolute favorite of everything we tried.  My wife really like her kabab and rice.  The charred cubes of chicken and onions were just right.  

Throughout our meal, multiple staff came over to check on us and visit.  

Afterwards we each had some Turkish coffee and some baklava.  The coffee is out of world experience.  There's chicory and other spices.  It's strong to be sure but the perfect after dinner drink.   My wife gently savored the baklava and commented on its sweet sticky notes with its crunchy pastry crisps. 


It was a date night to remember and we're looking forward to coming back soon. Thank you Team Mazzah. 

Görüşürüz!

Sang Kee's original location is in Philadelphia Chinatown and recently decided to enter the South Jersey market since there is a large Chinese population, and the options for good Chinese restaurants are extremely sparse. If you're not in the mood to drive 20-30+ minutes across the river to Philly Chinatown, Sang Kee is your next best thing.

They were smart to open in Cherry Hill, and the location is great, but the layout of their restaurant was not so great. When you enter, there is a small area for tables, and as you walk further in, there are seats around a sushi bar and a narrow hallway in the back leading to the bathrooms. Sang Kee's focus and specialty is Chinese food, not sushi. Why would you have a huge sushi bar that takes up valuable space for dining tables?

Although the floor plan of the restaurant was well thought out, the decor is nice. It is classier than most Chinese restaurants with dark wooden tables and simplistic, modern wall sconces that keep the restaurant well lit.

The last time I went, I ordered the wonton noodle soup and added beef tendon for pick-up. There is an equal balance of fatty beef tendons and actual lean meat. The wontons had a nice thin skin/wrapper (like they should), and the stuffing was pleasant with the taste of shrimp. If you simply order the wonton noodle soup, it is $8, but the addition of the beef tendon is $2. Ouch! We also had the stir fried flat noodles with beef and Singapore rice noodles. All of the dishes were as they should be. No complaints.

I commend the food for not being Americanized. A rule of thumb for Chinese restaurants: if you see lots of Chinese people, that means it's good, and it's legit Chinese food. When I went, my mom and I bumped into at least 3 other families from my old Chinese school. However, the prices are steep -- if they were located in New York City, then I would understand, but we're talking about Cherry Hill here.

After all that hype since they first opened in Edmonton, I finally tried Jollibee for the first time a few weeks ago.

I order the 6 piece fried chicken, peach mango and ube pie, and I also decided to get their spicy chickenwich.

The fried chicken, definitely huge pieces, but I think it could have been crisper on the outside. It was pretty juicy, wasn't greasy at all, and I thought it was seasoned pretty well.

The spicy chickenwich was my favourite! You get this nice thick crispy juicy piece of hand breaded fried chicken breast with sriracha mayo spread and fresh jalapeno slices on a toasted brioche bun.

For the peach mango and ube pie, I really enjoyed the flakiness of it on the outside. Both pies tasted really good, but my favourite was the peach mango over the ube.

Another great option for the next time I crave some fried chicken.

Stay away!!!  They have no idea what they are doing. I live in Arizona, tried them because of Dave Ramsey. They are a joke. 
I have purchased several homes. They drag you thru a long process and have no clue about the mortgage business. 
I was the easiest, cleanest deal they could have. 
I withdrew and decided to pay cash. 

This company structure is a mess. 

Dave Ramsey principles work. Dave, you need to get real brother. Your ego has taken you off course. His ELP s are terrible.  Follow the money. Stay away!!!

The food was fabulous. In particular,  the jackfruit steam buns were incredible. Shockingly, though, more than half of the staff were unmasked, creating an incredibly unsafe environment. We opted for takeout because of it.. They'd get 5 stars if not for their total disregard for public health.

I understand that it's Valentine's Day and you have tons of orders and its very stressful, but do not be rude to your customers who are spending lots of money to get flowers from you! I am in another state and wanted to have my mom pick up flowers. I ordered them late last night and got a confirmation call at 7am this morning about how they ran out of roses in red but I was very nice and told them I understood because I ordered last minute. I said I also understood if pickup time had to be moved back due to my last minute order and they said no, come at 11am. My mom just showed up and they told her infront of the busy store, that she had no flowers. She was upset and called me, as I am at work and paid $40 for them to be ready by then. I had to take time away from my work day, to show them that she did have a pickup and once she went back in and showed them that I talked to someone on the phone this morning and my order, it magically appeared and they weren't nice about it but extremely rude. If you can't handle the stress of Valentine's Day as a florist, you shouldn't take more orders then you can handle. I am always disappointed in the picture she just sent me, sloppy and thrown together.

In NOLA for business. Decided try Ruby Slipper on my day off. The line was out the door and an hour wait. Decided to have breakfast at the bar. The bartenders were great and attentive during a business football Sunday. I had the Bananas Foster French Toast and cranberry mimosa. Definitely will return!

My friends and I had a delicious succulent dinner at this elegant restaurant,the tomahawk steak we ordered  was incredibly tasty....the service was splendid,,,,the desserts super delicious..my friend ordered stuffed salmon and it was excellent..the onion soup was phenomenal..it was worth it to take this trip to Reno...My  friends and I are already planning our next visit,we definitely want to go back and dine here.....

For personal reasons I'm giving this establishment 1 star... but mostly it's because a very tall young man was incredibly rude a very sweet young couple.  I'm disappointed in how some folks are behaving during this time.  It's sad.  I won't be back.

I love taking classes with Miss Anita. She is a very talented ,fun lady! I have taken classes with her for many years ! And i will continue to do so for many more.

She is has so much patience with kids and adults.
With her classes ,it doesn't matter if you have never decorated a cake or painted you will not leave her classes unhappy.
She is Amazing!

I was treated by Eastern dental in Cinnaminson New Jersey and Hamilton New Jersey
This is the worst dental practice I have ever been to In my entire life!!!
The staff are very rude and the dentist do bed work
On top of everything else the waiting room is so full of dental patients 
that you end up waiting for several hours before you are taken back to see a dentist
I would not recommend that anyone go to Eastern dental Center anywhere ever
I now go to a different dental Center Where the staff is very polite and the dentists know  do good work!!!
I would never go to Any Eastern dental Center again If they were the last dentist in New Jersey
Eastern dental centers are like a dental factory
Please do not ever go to any eastern dental center anywhere!!!

I came to Mario's to get some pants hemmed and it only took 24 hours for him to get the job done! So efficient with the time and responsive when I communicated! The pants look amazing I am definitely returning with any other needs!

So I get it's New Years eve and all, but when you order a pizza at 6:07pm and it arrives to your door an hour and a half later, that's a problem. The delivery driver seemed nice enough saying something about no one wanting to work on New Years. The pizza was cold and had to be heated in the oven. It wasn't cut all the way through so we had to recut it. The 5 cheese stuffed crust looked like a Delissio thin crust frozen pizza. Even with the $10 daily special it's not worth it. The best part though was that when I tried to submit feedback on their website, the link was turned off or it wouldn't let you enter a postal code through your mobile device. I would not recommend pizza from this location unless you like being disappointed.

OMG! I had a wonderful first time experience! I work in Canal Place so this is the perfect spot for me. Mimosas were flowing, great conversation with my nail techs and the receptionist. The overall atmosphere was very relaxing and fun. Lan and Sabby I will be back in 2 weeks!! I would suggest this place to everyone! Affordable prices, great work and a wonderful experience. Thank you Nail Bar Nola!!

My dog has been going to LWD since it opened in July, and he absolutely loves it! The daycare center is really great, with a large indoor and outdoor space with a puppy playground for him to play in.  The staff is always really friendly, and they treat my dog like their own.  Highly recommend!

My grandfather suffered from a stoke and was referred to this facility. I called their office and asked if I could set up a tour. The lady on the phone told me there was no appointment necessary as they are available for tours all the time. I went after work and stood at the front desk for about 10 mins watching employees walk right past me. I finally asked if someone can give me information and the nurse told me to call back in the morning to set up a tour. I was annoyed but called back in the morning to find out they declined his referral and they couldn't give me a reason why! So not back to square one.

I went in to apply for an apartment today on 03/21/2019, I walked in and there wasn't anyone in the front  office, there was a lady in the office off to the side, after standing there for about 2 to 3 min she finally said can I help you, this is where the whole ordeal gets irritating, she was very short with me hardly any eye contact, I was told 3 days ago I could pay the app fee and admin fee with a check, she said with an attitude if you were told that then I guess so, at this point I'm still willing to apply, but now I'm just gonna take my business somewhere else, If they act like this now how will they act when I move in.


Thanks but no thanks

Beautiful view especially on a sunny day. Limited menu - only a handful of items. No vegetarian options except maybe the cheese side of the charcuterie board and French fries. 

Service was painfully slow, even with 3 employees and only 5 occupied tables.  Not a single smile or upbeat greeting from anyone. Could tell the staff didn't want to be there. 

Go for the view and a drink, not necessarily the experience. BEWARE of the bees. They are everywhere. 

** side note: hotel staff extremely friendly and nice. Front desk lady greeted us and talked about the pumpkin contest. Valet guys were funny and quick.

I haven't tried anywhere else for the floating experience but this place has a very friendly owner and staff that adds to the pleasure of doing something great for our health!  If you can afford the time and money, this is such a healthful experience:)

I will give you five stars when you remove the NOPD officer with the bad attitude from the front desk.  seriously.   

this is a glitter dome, and somewhat of a ghost town for now.    no one on the weekends at any of the desks to help you, so make sure you know where you are going before you arrive.

yesterdays visit was great.  I found my friend, the info desk people in the main lobby were really helpful and assigned someone to take me to where I needed to go.    once there, to check on my friend who was having a triple bypass operation, the next counter was a bit of a wait.   I was greeted by miss audrey, who was above and beyond gracious.   she took my info, and gave me the info on my friend.   I knew it was going to be an all day affair, so I didn't stay, rather she took MY number and kept me updated throughout the day.   very informative and reassuring.  she is a blessing.   patients advocate.  great.

I then left and went home to wait.

today I went to visit my friend and its a ghost town.  the information desk has a police officer sitting there flirting with young blonde ambitious hospital workers.  he didn't even blink an eye or acknowledge me until he felt he had flirted enough with these two ladies.

he didn't smile, he didn't care.    he cut me off halfway into my question and told me to call someone who MIGHT help me.       I knew where my friend was so I got my info and proceeded to go visit with her.   I will never understand why people with absolutely no personality or empathy are allowed to interact with the public.   I was not the only one he was rude to.   next visit I will put some balloons in my shirt and a blonde wig on, and see if he notices me.  seriously.   big mistake putting this guy in charge.   

once upstairs I found my friend, but again no one around, so I ignored the sign in at front desk sign, cause there is no one at the desk.   once inside I found my friend, and her doctors and nurses were above and beyond helpful.   

what a great place.   I can't wait to see you up and running for reals.  please make anyone who works your information desk take a test to see if they are compatible to work with the public.    when you apply for work at a hotel, you have to take a test.   same should apply here at the hospital.   adding to peoples misery just because you can and your wearing a badge?   makes you a jerk.

it leaves a bad taste in a person's mouth.  I can only imagine what my mother would've said to that loser at the desk.

please remove him.   there are many people in this city looking for work who have better demeanors than this guys taste in bedside manners / blonde's only.

and congrats for finally getting your doors open, even if your not totally staffed.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about Ana Pesce!
I know she knows skin care, so I felt comfortable going back to her for laser hair removal.
 
I have been wanting to do my bikini line but I know you have to be careful with which kind of laser is used especially on African American skin.
I have heard horror stories but trusted Ana. 
 
First, let me say that I have had my under arms and legs lasered before in another state and was ready to be in agonizing pain. I was still ok with that because laser hair removal is sooooo worth it. I cannot stress how much smoother your skin becomes and how nice it is to not worry about pickly hair and bumps anymore.
 
This laser that she uses from Israel is unlike anything I have experienced. It hurts so much LESS than other treatments and covers a large area at one time. I was a little worried that it would not thin the hair. But after just one treatment, I already notice a big difference- some hair hasn't even grown back and that was almost a month ago.
 
I will look forward to my other 5 treatments!
 
I def recommend it.

Worst experience ever. First I went to his artist Jennifer who didn't even finish the tattoo and her lines were choppy and faint. After being put off by one artist or the other for 2 years I finally get my tats fixed... I decided to let him take a try and after him trying to get me to cheat on my husband with him being a married man himself I told him no flat out I'm not down like that, I thought we were cool and even asked if things were weird I'd go elsewhere and instead he proceeded to do the worst tattoo job and his touch up was ridicules! He gripes about his employees and then treats them like crap and passive aggressive abuses them publicly. I wouldn't get another tattoo from little leprechaun Stu if he paid me!  Most unprofessional shop I've ever been to. Talks about nudist colonies and three ways with his wife... if you want drama by all means stop here... you want a real tattoo go else where!!

We needed a quick repair to replace some flashing after our home inspection while selling our house. We had a very tight time frame. Romano roofing was able to come out the next day, gave us a very reasonable quote, and complete the work the next day! They were very understanding of our situation and very responsive every time we contacted them. I would definitely use them in the future for any work we needed!
Wow  the chicken fingers were spot on!!!! Juicy and big chicken fingers made to order!! Hand cut fries the only way fries should be served right????

I have mixed feelings about the place.  I think their prices are consistently high.  I like the variety they offer, but have to watch myself because of the costs.  That being said, I have found some really beautiful plants here.  I recently found something I had been wanting for some time.  I also like that they have a section of native plants.  I wish more paces would do that.  They also have multiple areas with a variety of gifts.

During COVID, they are limiting how many people can enter the building.  It didn't seem to be a problem.  Everyone is asked to wear a mask (they also have a selection of masks for sale) and keep socially distant.  People were great about it.  They are not allowing use of carts, which made things a little tricky as one of my plants was a good size.

Another diner that didn't even come close to making the cut. Look, There are some things we can all agree with... Diners make amazing sandwiches, well they should make amazing sandwiches. 

My bowl of matzah bowl soup was very very good. In my opinion, their soup was better than 4th street deli in Philly. 

The service was pretty good. The server could have visited the table a bit more,  wasn't a big deal. 

As you can see, the sandwich looked like something I could have made from home. The bread tasted like it just came out of a bag. There was nothing at all special about my sandwich. 

My GF's salad wasn't any better. She said the lettuce wasn't fresh, the chicken wasn't warm and tasted rubbery. I guess the cucumbers were soggy as well. 

Hey, we tried, right?

I had THE PLEASURE of hiring this service.  They removed two trees by my newer pool; were so careful to protect the pool decking.  Fantastic clean work, removal, and clean-up.
