I can not say enough about them!  They really care for your project.  Look no further than this company and crew!  Fair price, great work, professional in every way!  Right on time, they answer all questions, what more?  Place was cleaner than when they showed up!

They never ever answer the phone. You have to drive there and deal with them in person. There is no other way to contact them. I have tried everything. It always ring right to a national call center where you have to sit on hold for an hour only to not be helped at all. This has happened multiple times to me since July. I have told them about the problem. No one seems interested. No one in my family will ever deal with this place again. I am going to have to get my daughter a new exam now and start all over somewhere else.

As a veteran, critical care nurse and deputys wife i am applaud. I was at a friends residence on 6/16 at 1430 to drop my daughter off for a small birthday gathering. When i went to leave at 1445 my car was gone. I called the Pinellas County Sheriff's department at 1452 to locate my vehicle.  The sheriff's department had no record at this time of who the towing company was that picked up my vehicle. They sent a deputy out just to make sure everything was ok. My friend called her HOA whom let her know the tow company is Black Jack towing as they do not allow parking on the street. (But 15 minutes come on, this tow comany was trolling the neighborhood) Once finding out the towing company and calling to find out where it was towed (that it is an 18 minute drive to pick up my car) and that it is going to be $130. My purse with my wallet and license and my ID badge for work is in my car. And to mention i was just at the store with $83 of perishable groceries in my car. I am a Critical Care Nurse and must report for duty with my badge and on time and was a must i get my car back asap. Upon arrival to get my car, i pulled out my credit card, at which time they stated its cash ONLY. It was 1702 the banks were closed and i did not have a debit card. They did not reference paying cash at anytime. Lucky the my friend had $150 in cash. Then they tell me they dont give change.  Meanwhile I have my younger 8 yearold daughter standing in the hot sun. I had to go across the street to get change. Needless to say i got my vehicle.

Still a great place to take people who are new to the city and looking for a nice introduction to traditional New Orleans cuisine and culture. 

We ordered the crawfish cornbread, fried alligator, raw oysters, charbroiled oysters, 3 fish entrees and the shrimp pesto risotto. Obviously, we had frozen drinks at the bar beforehand. 

The cornbread is always consistent and it was delicious. The guys enjoyed their oysters and I was slightly jealous that I didn't get to dip my bread in the leftover sauce on the charbroiled ones. The fried alligator is good but I was more impressed by the dipping sauce it comes with. Sorta like a Cajun aioli. Everyone enjoyed their fish entrees which is what I usually get but I wasn't feeling the sides that night so I went with the shrimp risotto which did NOT disappoint. The flavor wasn't as powerful as I expect from a pesto but paired well with the shrimp...so well that unless there's a special that catches my eye this will be my regular. 

Service was great, our server was a pro and even split the starters between the couples without us asking.
A bit pricy but worth it! I like the Chicken Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan... Very rich creamy taste. Good service too!

Came in for dinner and drinks with some friends, food and drinks were awesome and the service was even better! Our waitress Maddi P was super attentive and gave us great recommendations! Can't wait to come back again soon

This place is one of my favorite place to go for lunch. Been here more than once. My favorite food from Ijji Noodle are more than one. Love their spicy tonkatsu ramen and their takoyaki. 

Well, Recently I tried something else from their menu out of my usual ramen. 
I ordered the tan tan ramen and it came so beautifully bright yellowish with red chili color from the ground pork. I tested the broth and I tested little bit salty. But hey it was deliciously good, so I kept eating it and finally after few bites I realized this tan tan ramen was way too salty. I told the server and she told me that other customers also said the same, and  tan tan is quite like that. I was amazed, thinking why they keep this menu then? I think it wasn't the broth that too salty, it was the ground pork made the broth also became salty. I don't dare to order it again because it will be a waste of money. Well I hope they can cut a bit of salt for this one. 
The noodles always cooked great. 

I also love their fried rice. It was so delicious. The kimchi one was the best. The spicyness was perfect, the pork also so good. The other ijji fried rice also delicious. Chicken, shrimp were cooked perfect. 
The appetizer, I tried takoyaki, chicken karage and wings and all of them are yummy but their takoyaki is the bomb. 

The bulgogi bowl was okay. Too many veggies for my taste. The pho number 1 combination also good stuff. The broth was rich flavorful and the meat cuts were nice. 
I need to try their other menu from the Vietnamese menu section.
Service from the guy was always great and friendly. 
Sorry no photos, and hopefully my review won't goes to not recommended folder because no photos hehehe, next time will take some photos

Hello,

I usually do not complain or write bad surveys but I feel like I have to in this case. I was really excited to try Drybar for the first time and had an important weekend and wanted to look my best. When I arrived both the front desk girl and my stylist were very nice and accommodating however I could tell right away that my stylist looked exhausted. She proceeded to tell me how her young son had kept her up the night before and she did not get any sleep. Now I do not have children and I am sure it is not an easy job at all but I do not really believe that is an appropriate thing to say to a customer especially when you are about to style their hair. 

I explained that I was looking for a straight look with a lot of volume. I told the stylist that my hair is very fine especially at the crown and that a lot of product will weigh it down. Also I told her I was going away for the weekend and needed the blow out to last at least three days to which she said would not be a problem. As soon I sat in the chair she started pouring product onto my roots, now I am not a hairdresser but even I know that when someone tells you they have fine hair you should never put any heavy styling product on their roots!! I I again reminded her that I wanted a lot of volume and even suggested her putting rollers on my crown, she didn't. She proceeds to start blow drying my hair, yawning the entire time and telling the other stylists and myself how tired she was and again how she did not get any sleep the night before. Ok if you are that tired go around the corner to Starbucks! Don't complain if front of your customer and not pay attention to a word they say. She stops in the middle and asks if the curls at the end are enough or too much?? I told her that in the beginning I had said I did not want any curl just straight with a lot of volume. She told me she was sorry and said she should have asked in the beginning how much curl I wanted....ummmm I told you no curl! She then started putting more product in my hair which I assume was to straighten out the curl. By the time she was "finished" there was no curl however my hair looked like I had not washed it in four days! I kept asking her to try and put more volume  in the top because it was basically flat to my head at this point. She said she did the best she could and suggested I get a haircut since that was obviously the issue not all the product she put on my roots. 

When I got up to the front desk and looked in the mirror I was almost in tears. I told the front desk girl that I was not happy with my result and that my hair looked dirty and un-styled. She told me she thought it looked "ok" but could she my point and would fix it if I wanted. Wait a minute why would you ever let a customer leave when you know they do not look their best or more so when you know their hair does not look good??? I asked her to please try and fix what she could since I was running late already and would be gone all weekend.

When I sat back down in the chair I felt my hair and again almost cried. It felt awful! All the product made it feel sticky and dirty. The front desk girl did her best to try and fix my hair but it really was no use. I wanted to just wash everything out and start over, which I did the next day,  because I could have done a much better job myself. I am so disappointed with my experience and the fact I spent so much money to only have my blow-out last one day before I could take it anymore and washed it all out.

Disappointing. Finally got around to trying this place and was really looking forward to a great experience. Had the beef gyro. Beef very salty - and I'm one who enjoys their food salted.  The pita bread isn't big enough to hold the meat and lettuce and tomato so the food is falling out all over the place even though you're eating it out of the tin foil wrapper. We ate in the store to get the maximum freshness of the product and the music was blasting loudly the whole time.  It wasn't horrible, I just thought this would be authentic food and it's really like a McDonald's version of a gyro and they don't offer it made with lamb, which is traditional. The sandwich was loaded with salty beef- which was part of the problem. A gyro should be a balance of bread, meat, veggies and dressing.

I just want to put it out there that I ordered a pizza, salad, and breadsticks today from this location and everything was perfect in the order. It was ready in less than 20 mins. Pizza is good, salad is good, they remembered my condiments I ordered, a fork and napkins. It's the day after thanksgiving and it appears to be one dude working there by himself today. So bravo.

Rich is condescending as hell, repeatedly. Not sure who hurt him in his life, but every time I've been here and there's a minor snag with a package, he's rude. No reason to treat people that way. Go to therapy, Rich.

Love the food, love the vibe while dinning in. BUT the heavy duty plastic To-Go containers are a travesty! Literally the most wasteful to-go containers I've ever seen! I'm not kidding when I say "it's practically Tupperware." It's such overkiIl! I hope this review encourages them to DO BETTER and makes them consider their ridiculous environmental impact. We all need to do better. Please, Honor Bar, get some bio-degradable to-go containers.
This place is so cute and has great coffee. I got the pumpkin spice mocha and it was delicious. They also have a wide range of baked goods, including gluten free donuts.
Very popular brunch spot. Italian themed food that is light, fresh, and terrific. Try a frittata with a latte. Consistently good and locally owned. Crowded on weekend mornings.

I'm not a person to leave a bad review but I will no longer come here due to lack of hospitality, lack of kindness, and hostility. I have gotten several piercings here and I have had to take out all of them due to lack of quality of jewelry and sanitation. I received bumps that swelled and released pus. I have attached a picture to show you one of the worst issues I dealt with. In addition, I went there to grab forms so that I could donate plasma but when I walked in they were very hostile with and the owner didn't want to give me the forms because he was getting tattooed himself on work hours which I found very unprofessional. He gave me a disgusted look, a lot of attitude, and seemed very bothered by me. My sister also went here and her very first piercing she receiver got extremely infected because that lack of quality in jewelry and sanitation. I do NOT recommend this place. I would recommend either Black Hole or Fondue. Goodluck to you all! Be aware!!!

I recently stayed at the Renaissance Nashville for an overnight.  I checked the reviews after the reservation was made and braced myself for what seemed to be an inevitably disappointing stay.  We made our way from the parking garage to the hotel in the pedestrian bridge that connects the two over the street.  Turns out that it also happens to be a fancy, schmancy hotel bar.  Not the sad kind of hotel bar that no one goes to, but one that was alive with people having a good time.  We checked in late, and I was immediately hit over the head by the hospitality of the staff.   Ok, dare I get my hopes up about this place? Our room was comfortable, modern, and clean.  I was pleasantly surprised that they had a charger with various adapters so you could pretty much charge anything.   And then there's the obvious perk of this hotel. Location, location, location.  It's prime to downtown Nashville.  Minutes from several cool parts of town and very walkable to any downtown spot.  You can't beat it.  

The only con reared it's ugly head, a couple of times actually, in the middle of the night.  Long after I had fallen asleep, a couple of parties finding their hotel rooms weren't quiet.  And why should they be, this isn't a library.  The walls seem pretty thin.  I didn't notice it nearly as badly as others have noted, but I was awoken a couple of times in the night.  No biggie.  That's hotel life, right?!  I would easily stay here again.  Thanks for the positive experience, Renaissance.

You can find some cute stuff here sometimes. But I recently bought an item that didn't fit right. I went to return it only to find out that all costume and resale items are final sale. There's no sign indicating this rule. The salesgirl did not inform me of it when I checked out. And generally every time I come here there's a grumpy girl behind the counter scowling as if customers are an inconvenience. They have some all right stuff sometimes but there are similar shops on magazine where you can have a much more pleasant experience. Now I'm stuck with this overpriced, ill-fitting top and the salesgirl didn't even pretend to care.

Wow. This is a really nice Rouses. I love the layout and it feels like a real fresh market. I stopped in here with a friend to pick up some things to make for dinner. Everything here is really fresh and seems to be well priced, just like any Rouses. They have a huge deli selection and a large cheese case, which you know I'm a fan of.

Pretty respectable beer selection. Found a few rare bottles here and a huge walk in fridge with 6 packs and cases. Super convenient for anyone who lives uptown.

Pickles and Swiss was so darn amazing, I left Santa Barbara and the first thing I did was look for one around LA. Luckily to my utter surprise, there's one in the valley for me to endure world's worst traffic to have me some of their pressed paninis. 

I had the hamperini and swapped brioche for baguette. The baguette really gives the panini an extra crunch for those who love having crunchy foods (ie wonton strips in salads anyone??)

Price is just about right, I would say the only thing I recommend is coming with a lot of patience. They're good and busy, which is great! But that can mean your sandwich won't be ready for a good 20 minutes or so.

Walked by the internationally known chef Aàron Sanchez when we got seated and knew it was going to be worth the walk from our hotel on St Charles.  We started with a dozen Grilled Oysters and they were awesome.  Order them if you go there!  Our server Nathan was attentive, polite, and knowledgeable.  Pasta dishes were delicious, chicken sandwiches were tender, well seasoned, & moist, and the chicken & sausage gumbo was tasty too.  We brought our 3 kids and 2 of them ate off the kids menu.  The kids food was just as good as the food on the regular menu.  We can't recommend this place enough.

Once again, a wonderful experience. I showed up with a disturbing sound, worried about what was causing it. I jokingly asked them to find something small! Well, they did. They diagnosed a random rock was bopping around, making all that noise.  With it removed, I was on my way, no charge, immensely relieved. It's my third visit, and I will definitely return. John is friendly and knowledgeable, and I didn't have to wait long for my good news!

I love Jersey Fitness. I was never a gym person and had been afraid to go to gym. But the culture of this gym is warm and friendly. The staff is genuinely interested in everyone and very helpful. There are so many pieces of equipment even when it's busy. There is still space for you. 

The owner is very kind and truly appreciates his customers. The value is amazing too. A basic membership is only $10 a month with no commitment. This entitles you to use all of the equipment. I had this type of membership for a very long time. I upgraded to a full membership for $20 a month. There is a 1 year commitment. I wanted to try a spin class. It was a lot of fun. I also like to bring friends with me and the full membership let's me do that for free. You also get free daycare for up to 90 min and free tanning. I don't use these. Both are a great added value. 

It's the type of gym that makes you want to go even when you haven't been in a while. They were super kind when I started last year 60lbs heavier than I am now. I had never exercised and now it's part of my lifestyle. If I miss in the morning I can go at night. The open super early. I think 4:30 ( too early for me) but they are open until 10 pm. I now go 4-6 days a week. 

Great place. I highly recommend it.
Awful customer service, get stuck in contracts and impossible to cancel. Hated the atmosphere, not a good place for anyone who is shy or has any anxiety when working out.

Terrible service from the manager Antonio. Waited 15 minutes just to get water, the table behind us was complaining also and when I spoke to the manager was told to mind my own business. Walked out of this place.

I'm sorry to say that the experience I had in the South County store was less than positive. I have never sold to a Plato's Closet before and wanted to try to get rid of some items that I no longer wear. Some of the items were older, however no holes, or stains on these items. However, some of the items were brand new and others had only been worn 1-2 times; all from name brand stores. I was disappointed in the fact that none of my items were sold, however, I was even more disappointed in the level of customer service I received from the young lady that helped me. I went to the store on a Wednesday evening, when there just happened to be no customers in the store. 

From what I could tell, there were approximately 4 young ladies working in the store, one was on the phone when I walked in. I was carrying a rather large box that had all of my items, and as I walked in, the young lady that ended up helping me yelled across the store, "Are you selling items today?" When I replied "Yes." She continued to yell something that I didn't understand. I walked up to the counter where I thought she had beckoned me with words, and placed my items down. As I stood there, she said to me (still having not moved from her original location) "I'm going to have you go ahead and fill out some information on the computer." I continued to stand there and wait for direction, and she said again, "I need you to fill out some information on the computer." When I asked "Where?" she pointed and said "On the computer over there." As I looked around for a computer, I asked her, "I'm sorry, where?" She stated again, "On the computer, and pointed." "Where?" I again asked. At this time, the other young lady that she had been conversing with when I entered the store, stated "The IPad over there." Ah, now I understand. After filling out the requested information, while she was going through my items, I walked over to her, and she told me that it would be about 10 minutes while they went through my items, while she taped up my large box of items, and that I could shop around. Literally, 30 seconds later, she said "I'm all done, and unfortunately, everything has too much wear." I thanked her, gathered up my items and left. 

The level of customer service I received was extremely disappointing. Given the fact that I was the only customer in the store, and I clearly wasn't sure of what the process was, I thought I would have received a little more assistance. As I was once a young worker, I understand that it was a large inconvenience for this young lady to stop her conversation with her workmate when I entered the store; I find the experience extremely disappointing to the fact that it took so many times for any other workers to join in to assist, when I clearly was not able to communicate with the other worker. 

My first and last experience at this place of business was an extremely poor one. I hope the store manager is able to use this as a coaching situation for how one ill experience can taint a potential seller and customer.

15 years of having Michael do my hair says it all! If only I was given a dollar for every time someone asked me  "who does your hair?"  I'm at the salon writing this, marinating in the cool vibe, surrounded by amazing people, great music, sipping on the best coffee in town. Thought I should shout out so you too can have this incredible experience and leave here with amazing hair!
Pick up - Greek chicken pita did not taste right. I was supposed to get a lemonade and got home with a water. Very disappointed

Luis did a beautiful job!! He was courteous, pleasant, and on time!!
Please tell Ryan that Luis is a great employee. Danielle was a delight to deal with and made the estimate and scheduling of the job painless. Ken, the estimator, was fun and engaging. I will definitely use these guys again and would highly recommend them to friends and family.

Such a hidden gem. I think their food is fantastic. Especially the sides. My go to is rice and gravy, green beans, and dressing. Today I decided on a little cobbler. I wasn't disappointed! I have also had the meatloaf and macaroni. It's really great for a short lunch break! Food is always fast.

If only I were a bleach blond stripper....
I booked a 4pm manicure and pedicure for my daughter and I. We got our toes / feet done only over the course of 1.5 hours. That's not the issue. The issue is the guy who couldn't take time to do our nails Droped what he was doing for two bleach blonds who openly discussed the fact that they were going to Vegas this weekend to strip... can't make this crap up ! These girls two of them were almost done with nails and toes in under 40 mins while my 12 yro daughters eyes filled up with tears knowing we only had a limited amount of  time and she really wanted her nails done for graduation! . Shame on you !!! Pathetic. And PS the foot massage sucked. We lefts after almost 2 hours  with only pedicures.
The wait here is unfortunately really, really long. Drivethrough line over 1 hour wait. The staff are a bit poorly managed, lots of standing around. Maybe a franchise improvement opportunity?
Great store, great service. David was great! Prices were great as well! Perfect I really like it this place thanks

This place took me by surprise. We were looking for the Toffee To Go pop up shop and just happened to find this new café. We had just had lunch, but wanted some coffee and a small bite of something sweet. This was perfect for what we wanted.

So, here's the story. This is there second location. The original location is in Port Richey where they make all of their Italian cookies and pastries. It's family owned. Their coffee is imported from Italy. They sell other imported items as well. They have this new espresso machine that came from Italy. I just couldn't pass up having a well-made cappuccino. 

We both started with a cup of cappuccino. It was piping hot & frothy. Just like a cappuccino should be. I could definitely taste that this was not your typical Americanized coffee. It was a very good roast. Nice & strong, and creamy. I would definitely order this again when in Hyde Park. I was also very happy with there chocolate/walnut flourless cookie. I can't remember the Italian name for it, but it was chewy & chocolaty (not too sweet). Just like the real thing. I think it's made with merengue, but I'm not totally sure. Mom and I also shared one of the homemade biscotti. It was soft enough to split in half, and was perfect for dunking into the coffee preparation.

We'll have to go back to try more items. They had various NY style cheesecakes, and cakes as well. For now, I recommend it for coffee and a quick bite of something sweet. Will update my review on my next visit.

Where shall I begin with this review.. 
I have been working with this company for 1 simple order for over 3 months now. It has taken that long to attempt to get the order correct with no avail because I'm still missing cabinets. 

It started with a highly incompetent designer, who had no clue what he was doing. After many explanations on my end of how the kitchen should be designed we all agreed on the design. After my client and I signed off and approved the design the cabinets were ordered. However, they decided that we didn't need 3 of the cabinets that were part of the design. So began our nightmare. 
I had to approach my customer and let them know that the original quote we had already paid for was incorrect by over $1500 Because of the cabinets they missed so as a courtesy I paid for half of that mistake, which was not mine to begin with. 
Then, when we finally received the first order one of the boxes was completely destroyed, so bad so that there was absolutely no doubt the cabinet itself would be destroyed. Well, the representative that I spoke with to file the claim asked me to take out the cabinet and take fotos, as if I had the time to do all that, as if the destroyed packaging wasn't enough for them. Not to mention that I absolutely was not accepting the box in that condition. It should have suffice for me to say I'm not accepting it, and good business practice is to send a new one. 
Through all this, we are still missing 3 cabinets they finally are shipped BUT to the wrong house. When I told them I didn't received the cabinets they called UPS and had them ship the cabinets back to the manufacturer in OHIO!! So 4 weeks later I'm STILL waiting for these cabinets which are holding over $50k of my income up because I can't complete the job. 
Their customer service is awful to say the least. Nobody seems to even have a clue where they're standing when you call; and it seems like they've all learned the same script to convey to theirs than pleased customers because the way they run their business I'm sure the only customers they do have are very unhappy! 

I don't understand how companies like this stay in business..

Came to Yamato on a Saturday for a date night with my wife. It's next to our favorite Indian place in town, Sher-e Punjab so we thought we'd give it a try. We arrived around 6:30p and were quickly seated. 

The restaurant was about half full. I like that you could choose between a table or sitting at the sushi bar. The service was somewhat lackluster. I don't know if they were having a bad day, but our server was grumpy and off-putting. We ordered some hot sake, nigiri sushi, an eel roll, tempura appetizer and beef udon noodles. 

The sake and sushi (roll and nigiri) arrived after 5-10 mins and were tasty. I got the octopus and they gave generous portions. After that it took an additional 25-30 mins for the tempura and udon to arrive. And there was a strange burning smell coming from the kitchen.

The server apologized and told us the wait was because they were so busy, but the place was half empty. From other reviews it seems like our experience was not an isolated one. I wish them the best of luck, but we're not planning on returning any time soon and will probably stick with our usual spot at Sushi on Oracle.

I placed an order at 10:41 pm fully expecting it to not be accepted as it was close to closing time. At 11:15 pm, my food was at the door. I ordered a chicken dish with rice, salad, and baklava. It was so delicious. I will be ordering again at an earlier time.
They always do such a great job with my nails! I get acrylic fills and I'm always out of there at a reasonable time and they also have very reasonable prices...and they're super nice there!

YUM YUM YUM!! It's been a few years since I've had the food here and man it's still delicious if not better. I work in the area and I ordered lunch with my coworkers for pickup. The food was excellent, fresh and well seasoned. The portions are great and prices fair. I had the Thai basil fried rice with shrimp, papaya salad (ask for peanut dressing), and spring rolls. Everyone loved their food and had leftovers. Bala, keep doing what you're doing. The lady who took the order was friendly and the order was correct which is a big plus. I'm a customer for life.

Sad to say I was genuinely unimpressed with this particular location. First off the Service was very slow... We ordered and they claimed to be out of bread but one minute later a different sever walked by with bread for his table. We ordered our Cheesecake Factory usual and then finally bread was delivered. Our server was nice enough at first. When our food arrived we noticed that the pastas seemed very watery. And the more we tasted our food the more we saw that it was extremely watery and lacked taste. We waited for a full 10 minutes for our server to reappear.  We explained this to our server and said our daughter wasn't going to eat the watery Alfredo and asked for it to be taken off the ticket. We showed her that you could literally stir the sauce like it was milk.  This is when the server developed an attitude. Instead of being apologetic and asking if our daughter wanted something else or offering to get her another one she took the plate and became extremely standoffish. She could clearly see that the food was not right but somehow offended that we returned it. We went on to order cheesecake to go and she continued to have an attitude.  They did take my daughters meal off the ticket but she also went without dinner and they didn't seem to care. Extremely disappointed in the Tucson Cheesecake Factory!

I had the pleasure of visiting Tampa Bay Brewing last time I fly into town for some fun in the sun.  The key draw for me here was seeing them on Diners Drive-ins and Dives on Food Network and they really seemed to be a hometown kind of place.  When we arrived nearby we were not sure whether we wanted to stick around because there was a tremendous amount of less than desirable folks wandering around, which made it a bit uncomfortable.  We decided to take our chances and park anyway.  When we walked up, we noticed a fairly substantial outdoor space with a fair number of people indulging in some tasty looking beer and the food looked to be not only plentiful, but also seemed to be making everyone happy that was eating it.  

We went inside and were greeted right away; waiting on a few minutes for a table for four.  Once seated, our waiter was eager to answer any of our questions and bring up a couple of small samples before we decided on some local craft beers.  We ordered straight from the TV show since Guy Fieri though the dishes were noteworthy.  My "moose killer meatloaf" was really an amazing dish. which was a generous portion wrapped in bacon (who could go wrong with that), and a mushroom gravy and deep fried onions on top.  I have to say that the smell was absolutely amazing as it was presented to me.  My wife had a "bomb" burger which was another DDD item.  This was a nicely prepared burger that was wrapped in pizza dough and baked.  I'm not sure if I liked it nearly as much as my meatloaf, but the concept was pretty cool.  The kids had some house made root beer and the server was pretty generous with the pours so that made the kids happy.

I would return here again, but if the neighborhood was a bit less shady, it would make the experience all that much more desirable.

We came here twice in one week...just to make sure it wasn't a fluke that we had such a great experience. 

Pro's:
Flavour 
Quality ingredients 
A free margarita 
The place is clean 
Prices are very reasonable
Bathroom was clean

Con's:
Parking 
They don't take reservations solid you come during prime time, prepare to wait...but it's so worth the wait!

Brought my mom and mother-in-law (both picky eaters) for dinner. Never saw them so quiet. They just kept shovelling food in their mouth. That alone is worth double the cost. It also speaks to how good the food is. 

They have 6 or 7 locations so if this isn't close, I imagine the other locations are just as good. Oh and get the guacamole...get lots of it. It's delicious.

Lol, this Wendy's is a disaster. But let's be real: what fast food restaurant existing within city limits isn't?

Junkies littering the place, yelling over one another, all spun out and spitting conspiracy theories between three teeth. Trash: everywhere. Sticky floors, unclean tables, staff usually doesn't have a clue what's going on...

The only redeeming factor about this place? It's a nice little ego boost. I walk in, look around at all the mutants loitering in there, and think to myself: huh. I'm really doing alright.

My girlfriends and I had the absolute best time on captain Jack's tour! Meredith is so sweet and made us feel like we could just sit back and enjoy ourselves. I will never go wine tasting and not use captain Jack's tour- they made everything seamless and fun. Thank you for making our girls trip so memorable!

Let's be honest... the hype is real. I called ~50 times before getting through but ordered a pie and it was ready in 20 mins. They pump these pies out like wizards, I swear, and somehow they're still insanely delicious. Crust is crisp and chewy, and there's the perfect ratio of cheese to sauce. The basil leaves are just the extra special touch. I am from New York and therefore was born a pizza snob, but Angelo's is one of the best pies in Philadelphia and could easily match up with the better pies I've had in NY.

Someone made a suggestion to me about calling on off days/hours, and it worked. Good luck getting a pie Friday-Sunday - if you do, please reach out to me with your magic.

If at first you don't succeed, pay someone to do it for you. I'm just saying, I personally could not paint my nails to save my life. Their is always bubbles, bumps, or polish leftover all around the house. Never as relaxing as it should be, which is why I no longer bother, and head over to Lovely Nails.

This 5 star review is 100% due to the fabulous work of the owner, Kim. She puts so much dedication and precision into EVERY SINGLE manicure. She is requested the most of all the nail techs, and her schedule tends to fill up, so book ahead of time! 

She takes pride in her work, and it is apparent in every manicure you get here! She never rushes, and makes sure they're perfect before you leave. I get gel each time, but have seen her do acrylics, french, and more! She even does a great job at the little designs I find off Pinterest and bring in (such as Jack Skellington for Halloween or little eyeballs - see pics!) , and I always leave very happy. Not only is she extremely hard working, she is also kind, and makes sure her staff is also extremely good at what they do.

I will never visit another nail salon in Tucson, as long as Kim has Lovely Nails open!

Even though I lived in Collingwood for a couple of years I never tried this place. Pretty sure it was because it didn't seem "authentic" with merchandise for sale and didn't have a real Italian name. I should know by now not to judge a restaurant by the name or location. 
  We ran across a Groupon and decided to try it one night when we were in the area but never having been there we didn't think to look if reservations were needed. The hostess made room for us after only a 10-15 minute wait even though the place was crowded. We luckily were seated next to an older couple that had some connection to the place and mentioned that the gnocchis were what they were known for. Of course every place claims to have the best "insert dish here". But having no real craving my gf tried it and it was....the. best. gnocchi. EVER!!! It was so light and fluffy I felt like I was pac man chomping on the clouds in the sky. I have no idea what I had (it was good) because I was so focused on stealing her meal. 
  Also the couple next to us really weren't pulling our leg about being involved in this place since they told the waiter to give us a free dessert. We  talked about that gnocchi everyday for at least a week...I shit you not.

We tried them again after our 1 star again because we wanted to try their sushi burritos with mixed results. We ended up getting yellowtail and chicken Katsu burritos along with pork kyoza. The gyoza was quite good, my gf loved her chicken katsu but my yellowtail sadly was trashed after two bites. It wasn't the quality of the yellowtail but the jalapeños in it wasn't bits and pieces but slices and man thy were HOT. I grew up with Cajun spice but after one bite (only part of jalapeño) my tongue burned for at least 20 minutes and even after taking them out and having a second bite the residue was still there so I couldn't eat it. 
  If you want hot then the yellowtail sushi burrito is for you. Word of advice is suck on a lemon or drink/eat dairy instead of water to help ease the pain. We will most def try again and are happy we can see why people enjoy this place but no japapenis next time.

Fantastic place! Great food, with a dog-friendly patio that's heated and semi-enclosed. Definitely a sanctuary in the winter time! Service was fast and courteous, even though we came in within an hour of closing. They had water bowls for our tired pups, which was much appreciated. 

Nice beer selection and a knowledgeable bartender. 
Brussels and the burrata salad were delicious, and the pork was tender and juicy, while the fat was well-crisped. 

Very impressed.

This wasn't a bad experience, just sort of average. The service was okay. I will say that ALL the servers are friendly, and greet you with a smile no matter if they're your server or not. The place has a very good vibe, like everybody is happy working there.

I guess my issue is with the menu. Prices are a little high for ordinary bar eats...Their idea of dressing them up seems to be adding various kinds of peppers in half the items. Which is great if you like red peppers, jalapenos, habeneros, banana peppers, etc.

I had the stunningly beautiful Pacific Rim bowl, with noodles, chicken, shrimp, fresh veggies and red peppers. It was nice, and a pretty big portion, but it tasted mostly of the red peppers. Hubby had the Double dog with mashed potatos and caeser salad. The told me it was average, sloppy and filling. He feels it could have been deconstructed a bit, that the dogs should have been separated. He wasn't that fond of the banana peppers because they were pickled.

Maybe it's just us. I'd probably come back for drinks, but not the food. To each their own peppers, I guess.

What a great new bar located on Mass Ave in a historic building. There is a lot of parking near the Mass Ave area which cost money however if you park a little bit further away you can sometimes get free parking near the residential areas.

Upon arrival there was a little bit of a wait but it went fairly fast especially if your party is small. It felt safe because people are spread out and all of the servers were wearing a mask. The environment was very relaxing and fun. The music was great and as the evening it got later they even turned up the music. The bartender appeared to be enjoying his time as well which was fun to watch and added to the environment. Do you like whiskey this is your place to go as they have a plethora of options to choose from. However on this time I did not have any whiskey and said I had two different cocktails on the regular menu. They also have a holiday menu that appear to have a lot of delicious tasting items as well. 

I will admit that the drinks are a little bit steep but I would say that due to the environment that this place is trying to accommodate an appeal to it makes sense that the drinks are priced they way in which they are. In addition I genuinely felt like the drinks were prepared well and they did not cheap out on the amount of alcohol they put into the drinks. 

Both of the cocktails that I had were flavorful and tasted of good quality. 

Please appreciate the beauty of the bar as I felt that it was very well displayed and they did a wonderful job with that. I'm sure that over the course of the next year this place is going to continue to see growth and have a great outcomes in Indianapolis. As always support local as much as possible.

Cheers!
This is a perfect place for brunch in NOLa. Our waitress was so friendly and the food was good! I would recommend their Bloody Mary, but skip their mimosa.
Such a cute place! It's like walking into a wonderland of plants. They have a great selection and reasonable prices. The staff are very friendly too!
A fun spot for a Friday night out! Great location right of the trail. I loved my fish tacos which I highly recommend!

This Aldi is new and awesome. Since it's new, everything is very up-to-date and spacious. Overall, Aldi is a very affordable grocery store. You can't necessarily get named brand items, but if that's not a concern then you should definitely go here. My husband and I have shopped at Aldi for years. We save so much money by shopping here!  You do need a quarter to get a cart, so don't forget that. Also, you'll want to bring your own reusable bags.l

***This place is going through a soft opening***
Recently saw the Mummy, and then this place shows up on Yelp?? Alright, never had Egyptian food before, and I'll try anything once. (I managed to snap their whole menu)

+++ Sheesh Tawook chicken kebab.  The chicken was obviously never caged and super tender.  There is an abundance of bell peppers and onions, and they were grilled perfectly. 

+++ Hawawshi.  Not only is this fun to say, it is like a pita sandwich stuff with whatever meat was in there. I have no clue what was in there, but it was AMAZING. 

+++ environment.  The setting has a light hue of blue.  There are hieroglyphics in the entrance and there is so much detail that it adds authenticity to it....PLUS...they play regional music. They played Syrian music while we were there, and that also adds authenticity, which really scores points with me. 

+++ garlic dip.  I went with the spicy, cause I have already built scar tissue amongst my guts in recent days...and the pita slices are warm and very tasty. I managed to dip my sandwich in the garlic dip...not only did I dip...I dipped and swiped. 

+++ cucumbers & yogurt.  Its chopped up pieces of cucumber in a watery, yet thickish, yogurt. It is such an odd combination, but it was so damn good!!!

What an unreal place that I went to tonight. I seriously never thought I would ever try, or even have the option of, Egyptian food.  Get down here and there is no need to thank me.

1. Friendly service.
2. Lots of delicious options that are plant-based. Take a look at all the different specialty Taos.
3. And no up charge for nondairy milk crate I love that. It's so great that they don't penalize people who are lactose intolerant. Or if you choose not to contribute to the dairy industry.

A few of my girlfriends suggested doing a girls night here so we decided to try it. We had a fabulous experience. The staff was very friendly and hands on and they provided easy, simple and clear guidance in making your dishes. The cool thing is that your group can take turns so that everyone can participate. The allow you to bring your own WINE and that makes it that much better. The only suggestion I have is not to go super hungry into this. The portions are very small and they provided a bite size appetizer so just be sure to eat a light snack prior to attending.

Ok I have changed my tune after close to 10 visits here. They are so consistent everytime!!

I love street style tacos and have tried many all over Boise. Hands down they have the best flavor! My favorite are the pastor and asada tacos however I recommend you try what ever appeals to you, you won't be disappointed. They offer great sauces as well as sauteed onions and a huge hot pepper. 

The staff is super friendly and you can even phone your order in ahead of time.  Even if you order on the spot they get stuff out in a timely manner. 

They have a covered eating area outside if you choose to eat on site. 

*Tip: They only accept cash so come prepared.

If I could pick ZERO ...I'd want to choose a negative number. So I have a friend who is 83 years old and has been in business for 50+ years. His payables clerk quit ..and incidentally the monthly payment for his property was always done manually. My friend unknowingly missed two payments and received a nasty call from Servus. 

He went in and paid the two payments within a couple days. Shortly after a Claim to foreclose was served on him...for arrears. Not correct at all there were none. Then Servus decided to reissue a claim to foreclose even though he was current on the mortgage. 

Over the last 9 months he has paid every month...yet they are foreclosing because they say they can because he makes less than 10 years ago. Yet he pays every month. No body at Servus listens ..nor cares.

 Certainly an 84 year old who is not behind shouldn't lose his property or be forced to sell "just because they CAN and argued with him on the telephone a couple times" 

Servus Credit Union you are disgusting, your customer base I hope will disappear and deservedly so. 

When you steal equity from an 83 year old man it's time to let everyone know...classless and shameless to someone who deserves far more respect. 

I have been buying foreclosures for years ...this is perhaps the lowest move I have seen ever.

Please quit the Credit Union if a member, never ever deal with Servus CU as they will do the same to you when you are older. Please boycott Servus Credit Union, 

Age discrimination is not permitted in Canada, the fact the mortgage had a absolute out clause was news to my friend. Regardless they take his payment every m

The brunch cocktails are fire, but the food included with the $50 per person bottomless brunch is not sufficient to sustain the amount of alcohol you will consume. All of the cocktails were good but the Kali Krush was my favorite. 

They provide a pre-prepared charcuterie board and sushi assortment. They could not provide more crackers for the charcuterie or make modifications to the type of sushi rolls provided. The sushi rolls are miniature and we didn't care for 3 of the 5 rolls included. The charcuterie was mostly veggies and hummus with about 10 crackers, 2 small cheese wedges, and 3 kinds of meat. I saw some pictures others posted also included pickles and fruit but ours did not. 

We bee lined down the street to Shake Shake the minute our 2 hour limit was up at Leda & The Swan.

On a mission for the community... I arrived in Tucson early. Three hours earlier then my scheduled meeting. I felt a hunger pangs and was told that Tucson had some good vegan eats. I also needed a spot to hunker down and get some work done. To my surprise I was parked across the street from Cafe Maggie! I got a message from a local Comrade that it was tight and right so I ventured in! 

Upon first viewing of the menu I saw that they had biscuits and gravy. I had to question the viability of vegan biscuits and gravy but I gave it a whirl. IT. WAS. FANTASTIC!

I will be back and I'll Bring reinforcements . 

PS: the atmosphere and all that was good. I got work done. I watched Tucsonians doing their thing. I got a ticket for parking on the street? What Evs. The staff was awesome and I enjoyed my morning on 4th Ave.

What an awesome store!  Spice blends, assorted loose leaf teas, oils, and a tea bar in the back!  

Took me a bit to write this after my visit, because I wanted to try all of the items I got. 

KEY TAKEAWAYS-

TESTING THE MERCH - 5/5 You can open jugs and smell all of the teas and spices. The truffle salt hit me with that aroma and I absolutely had to buy (It's delish and well priced)!  

You can also try any of the teas sold by buying an iced or hot tea at the tea bar. 

SPICES - 4/5 Got a few spice blends including a Tuscan blend and a greek seasoning blend.  The blends are tasty but they do all have salt in them. I really prefer to add my own amount and type of salt, so much prefer spice blends do not include salt. Just learned however that there are certain blends that do not have salt, so will check those out next time!

TEAS - 3.5/5 - Some of the teas have organic ingredients and some do not. You really have to look at ingredients. Tried a herbal white tea in store and didn't love it but that is because it was very light and think I need to stop buying white tea because they all seem to be too light for me!  

The Hazelnut cookie tea is nice hot with a little milk. Great for dunking!  It also makes my whole cabinet smell really good.  I've just run out and will be buying more! 

REWARDS PROGRAM- Every $100, you get $5 off.  Also get a free .5oz spice blend or tea sample when you signup.

Like others, I too was under the impression that this was affiliated with the Chop House chain. We thought we were a little pressed for time as we were attending an event at The Franklin Theater (or is it Theatre?) Anyway our original intention was to go to The Cheesecake Factory. I was hoping Kaley Cuoco would be our waitress, but....

My wife works a little south of of 96 and Cool Springs is north of town and it was rush hour, Christmas season, growling stomachs that could not wait so here we are. Walked right, sit right down, baby let your mind roll on - sorry - it had to come out. There was a little concern about the server as he did not seem too into the job, but turns out he was actually good. The one thing he didn't do was mention the "Blackboard Specials". We were sat in the bar area which was fine as there was no one else there for a while and the TV's were muted. After we had almost finished I look over the half wall and see about half of the aforementioned blackboard. I would have made a better choice had I seen it. As it were I got the pot roast and as another reviewer mention it was unlike any pot roast I have had. WAY to salty and to me it looked like shredded BBQ without the smoke and without the flavor and without the low price. The mashed potatoes were good as was the gravy. The glazed carrots were too sweet, but not bad. My wife ordered the beef medallions which were cooked in garlic - a lot of garlic. It completely overpowered the meat flavor plus they were overcooked and a little tough. A baked potato subbed for mashed was a one dollar upcharge. She also got the spinach which was good - not Demos' good, but good.

After tip for this underwhelming meal, decent slice of cheesecake and a glass of wine the total was almost $50. Yeah - and did I mention it was our anniversary? When we got to the theater and got our tickets it turns out it did not start until 7:30 - I COULDA HAD CHICKEN MADERIA AFTER ALL! I will cringe (again) when I make this entry in our checking account...

This place is pretty cool. This was my second visit to smash social the first one was during their grand opening and I was impressed by its energy then. This time I came during the day to get some studying done and they have perfect little study spots. They have 3 study nooks with doors and a hidden upstairs that is cozy too. The avocado toast was amazing, never thought about putting red pepper flakes on it but it was delicious. 

My only complaint is that the cookies were decent but they definitely should be bigger for $3 a pop. I was disappointed, and they didn't seem to be soft like I would expect a cookie to be for that price.

We decided on this restaurant after reading several very positive yelp reviews and we were not disappointed. Due to the current pandemic we are still not comfortable eating indoors so any restaurant that offers not only outdoor seating but potentially excellent food is on our radar. This unassuming eatery located within the Mercantile center offers a wide variety of tacos and burritos in different flavors representing several "culinary regions" of Mexico. To order, you place your selection at the window and it's delivered to your numbered table. My pescatarian wife had the mahi-mahi tacos, which she pronounced  superb. I had the Poc Chuc; an achiote marinated chicken, a Birria, and and Al Pastor. Each was equally amazing with a great range of flavors. Their cilantro rice was a bit bland but they offered several different sauces which enhanced the flavor. Each table had a heat lamp to keep us cozy during this cold rainy night. We plan to return here on our next visit to Tucson and I recommend you visit as well.

A tragedy that this bought out the Flipside. I heard horror stories of how they treated the wait staff of Flipside after the bought it. 

Then a friend chose it for a birthday meal and I begrudgingly went. My food was as cold as the atmosphere. There are a lot of great places to eat in and around 12 South. I wouldn't recommend spending your money and time here.

I love Nom Nom Bowl! When I came here for the first time a few months ago, I was immediately struck by how the ambiance, decor, and quality of food were reminiscent of the places I had been to in Japan. 
For appetizers I always go with the pork buns. They stuff the buns with meat and it is so tender and juicy. My go-to entrees are the Goma tuna poke bowl and the pork kakuni bowl. The tuna poke bowl is flavorful with great textures. The pork kakuni bowl is amazing, especially over the mazeman noodles which are worth the extra $2 splurge. My drink of choice is definitely the melon soda, tastes like pure candy. One time the chef was kind enough to give us a complementary dessert of black sesame ice cream in a sweet pancake bun which was delicious. 
After coming back from Japan, I longed for a place in Philly that could rival the amazing flavors and presentation of Japanese food and this is it for me. The food is a little pricy but worth it for the quality.

Ok so my brother had to have an emergency surgery on a Saturday.  Now keep in mind I am a nurse with hospital experience so I am quite aware of how things SHOULD go. However.....the place ia beautiful.  It is so clean. Unfortunately we were shown to the waiting room. We sat there for about an hour and no circulating nurse. I walked around on the 4th floor hoping to see anyone. 

I ran into a male dressed in green scrubs and I politely asked "is there a circulating nurse?" He replied "There ia but I don't know where ahe is." Never once did he say "let me help" or ñwhat pt you looking for"

I stood in the moddle of a desolate hall and another male in burgundy scrbs passed and I asked again "is there a circulating nurse?" He said I know there is supposed to be someone but I am not sure......

As a fellow health care professional,  I came from a hospital that believed in let mw show you. We never said i don't know or pointed ppl into directions. We always walked them where thwy needed to be or at minimum bought them to whwre they could get the help they needed. 

Thisbwas uterly ridiculous. They should know that people are concerned about thwir loved ones
Excellent local food truck!!!!  Best chicken and smash burger  . Great service and bright cool looking truck

I know that Planet Fitness is supposed to be a judgement free zone...but I am judging it...To Be Awesome! First of all the location in Belleview is new and has not had time to get sweaty and dirty yet, so everything is sparkling clean. So Go now or you might miss it! You walk in and the staff is friendly and professional! Happy to help while spending the time to over the information with you. I felt very taken care of! 

It was only 6 months ago that this place used to be a Michaels and it hasn't quite had time get busy yet. That's good for me though because after a long workout I don't have to wait long to relax in the luxury massage chair at the end before I go home. What a treat. To tell you the truth  I go just for the chair. But while I'm there, I might as well work out! I would gladly welcome any workout friends that want to start coming here. As long as they mind they keep to themselves and keep my chair free when I need it to be available.  Other than that, c'mon!
This is an awesome place to get your sun tan on! The place is always clean, the staff is super friendly, and I'm always in and out, no wait times.

I got the bulgogi with rice cake dish and it was pretty good, exactly what you would expect from those two items, though I was hoping the rice cake would've come with a little more flavor. Every thing came with rice, miso soup and the typical Korean side dishes, which I loved. I wasnt able to finish the meal in one go due to how chewy and bland it got after a while, but I just took the rest to go and finished it a later day. 

The reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars and not the average 3 is mainly due to the service. The waitress we had was really friendly, gave me an "Asian mom" vibe, and made me feel as though I were eating dinner at home with family. She always made sure that we felt the food was good, whether we needed water, and so on. All in all a comfortable and nice eating experience.

We finally tried this new gem in downtown carmel. We loved the esthetics inside, and the service was more then amazing. However, there is no distancing between the tables..if you're tying to stay away from eating inside - I don't recommend going here! Even though I understand Indiana is on Stage 5...

The food was average! We ordered the margherita pizza and roasted chicken and both were OK - morning new. The bread pudding was also average. Over all, I'd check this place out once but probably not go again.

DONT EAT HERE DONT GIVE THESE PEOPLE YOUR MONEY!! I worked here for a couple of months and the management is DISGUSTING. Manager (Jay) would text young female employees (18-20) asking them to go get drinks together. Extremely unprofessional behavior! Would pull me aside during work hours (I only worked in the kitchen) to tell me I needed to "smile more". Smile at what? The blenders??? This man is extremely creepy and I hope he no longer works here. If I could give this place a negative star review I would. Food is barely edible and honestly the "meat" here looks and tastes like plastic. Just save yourself the time and go somewhere else

I was pleased with the pedicure I got here. Came in around 3pm on Saturday, only had to wait about 15mins to be sat. They had 4 nail techs working. Chairs are nice and new with lots of different massage settings available. I feel like the gentleman doing my nails cleaned them up really well. A lady came over to paint them since the gentleman had an appointment come in. 
All the polishes look brand new and are either OPI or China Glaze. Hopefully the pedicure lasts a few weeks!

So good! Not your average cafe. Didn't have any of the sweet stuff but the Mediterranean dishes were great. A little higher on the price tag for breakfast and brunch but I definitely got what I paid for! Gotta come again!
Sorry no pics. Ate it all lol.

So I am the proud first reviewer of the new Homegrown Pizza restaurant in Gentilly, which was most recently the home of the much beloved Munch Factory. Tonight was part of their soft opening, so our expectations were tempered.

Homegrown is about everything local: locally sourced ingredients, breads (Gendusa's) and drinks (Big Shot, Fest Cola). So, don't expect to find national brands like Coke and Pepsi. I only thought to take a picture of the mirliton spread, but we had a pepperoni pizza, cheese pizza and cheesy bread. The pizzas were good and we enjoyed the sauce. They were hot and...well, cheesy. The mirliton spread didn't work for us. The portion size was small with only two shrimp and then it had too much lemon. The owner politely comped that appetizer. 

Our waiter Jimmye provided great service. He was very friendly, fast and knowledgeable about the menu. He recommended the Chicken Strut and Rocket pizzas, but our kids only like two kinds of pizza, cheese and pepperoni. So we'll have to try the others next time like on date night. 

The restaurant was clean and quiet, but for some reason didn't smell like pizza. 

The owner told us about the Big Class program, which is a pizza poetry project. The restaurant is donating 10% of the April sales to the program. We loving supporting local and we will definitely be back.

Move over Eagle -Duke's Indy has THE best fried chicken in Indianapolis. It's hot, crispy, juicy and oh so flavorful. I was a little skeptical of what the good would be like when we first pulled up to the bar. Duke's is fairly unassuming from the outside and once inside it looks like your hometown honky tonk hangout. Live music, beer on draft and friendly faces. 

The menu is written on a chalkboard on the back wall and SPOILER: you're having fried chicken. You can order "the whole damn thing" which includes a whole fried chicken and all three of their sides. Bacon roasted Brussel sprouts, jalapeño Mac and cheese, and a tatertot waffle. While the options are limited, the saying "if it ain't broke don't fix it" comes to mind. For dessert they freshly bake massive sheet pan-sized chocolate chip cookies with sea salt. You really can't beat it. 

Pro tip: if you're in the mood for a game, ask the bartender for a deck of cards!

Love this quirky bookstore and make sure to stop here every time I'm in Reno.  I was looking for a very specific local book and they had it on hand! The selection is fantastic and there is something for everyone.  The store is in a fascinating old house with some interesting history.  All staff was helpful and polite and were COVID compliant with mask wearing and signage.  Make sure to wander around and soak in the ambiance.

Holy crepe these are good. We tried the beignet crepe which is butter and brown sugar on the inside with powdered sugar on the outside. It was so good we had to return the next day and got a beignet one as well as a salivator which is bacon and cheese. Unfortunately when I returned to get the beignet crepe I forgot again like I did the first time to take a picture because I couldn't hold it more than a few seconds without taking a bite. The crew  stoic as they made each one to Perfection and they only took a few minutes for each even with a large crowd.

ITS BRINGING SEXY BACK. New bar, 5th and Broadway, a variety of music, ENOUGH SAID. My favorite things- the menu is eclectic with their different items like pork belly dumplings, all day egg sandwich and Anson Mills grain bowl. Now, do me a favor and don't be boring by not ordering one their cocktails made by Kayla.
The ladies here have a bad attitude. I'm really sad because they used to be good workers. When something was wrong they'd fix it but lately the food had been cold ans everyone is rude

We have been coming here for 3 years now and have not had one bad experience. Ok, so they were out of Tres Leches Cake on one occasion but I've forgiven them for that! My favorite meal is the fajitas. They are always so hot and fresh with all the fixings and fresh handmade tortillas. The fresh thin chips with house made salsa and sauces alone are worth the trip. Save room for dessert because the Tres Leches is the best I've ever had and I've tried tons of places!

TWO stars are for the server we had and the wings. we had a hard time finding somewhere to get in, seated and eat fairly quickly in order to make it to the arena on time for a concert. luckily as we walked by there was NO LINE to get in a packed place.
We waited just a few minutes before we were acknowledged and told they would be with us. They cleaned off a table. Several more minutes and finally greeted by our server.  We knew everything we wanted before he got to us. We each ordered a pizza and wings to share. The wings were dry seasoned and perfect! taste was great. 
The pizzas - nothing special there. was a huge let down. the center was not cooked all the way and the pizza was squished through the mesh wire pizza rack it was cooked on. it was STUCK in there so much that I had to use my fork to scrape it out.

one pizza is enough for 2 to share if eating 3 pieces of pizza is your normal. We each left about 1/2 a pizza uneaten. The crust is super thin. you'll get flour all over you too. Was not worth what we spent.

We came here for the first time (we moved to the area 6 months ago) with our newly adopted rescue dog.  There are TWO outdoor areas (out front is covered, in the back is bigger and uncovered).  Even before before eating, we were hooked by the friendliness and warmth of the wait staff and the hostess, and the other patrons with dogs out on the back patio.

Then we had drinks!  Fabulous!  My husband had a Reef Donkey pale ale, which was SO refreshing & delicious.  (All hail Tampa microbreweries!)

I had a Dunedin Spritzer (SO good!):  Wheatley vodka, muddled fresh strawberries, a dash of OJ, simple syrup with a champagne float.  YUMMMMMM!  (I had two!)

Then came our meals: my husband had the salt and pepper hogfish, a very light batter-fried fish, very fresh, with a side of their fabulous citrusy cole slaw (I want the recipe for that), and very delicious French fried with the potato skins still on.  SO good!

I had the broiled hogfish, which had Panko crumbs with grated Parmesan on it.  Again: SO delicious!  I also had the cole slaw, which is the best cole slaw I've ever had, so much better than any other recipe I've tried.  And I chose the garlic mashed red potatoes, also fabulous, again with skins on.

Ev-er-y-thing here was delicious. We are DEFINITELY coming back, many times!

So, good for dog people (they have a dog menu and brought us a dog bowl of water for our sweet boy), but THE FOOD!  THE DRINKS!  Come for the dog friendliness.  Or come for the food and drinks.

Then for those of you who are foodies AND dog people?  This. Is. The. Place.

P.S.  Our waitress was Danie.  She was awesome!!!

Wish I had read reviews before coming here. 

I saw a used vehicle online and made an appt to see it. 
Upon walking in, nobody seemed interested in helping us and it took a couple times asking to get someone to help. 

We ended up purchasing the used vehicle which supposedly included (and we paid for) a 126point inspection that was not done. 
We had issues driving the vehicle home after dark noticing things that we wouldn't have seen in the day time. 

Calling back the very next day, nobody is interested in making this right. Someone called me to tell me to make a service appt which I did and went to, only to be told I had to drop off the vehicle. I had my 2 kids and I can't drive 2 vehicles at the same time, so I was turned away and advised to contact my sales guy who was Isaiah. I searched around the dealership and couldn't find him, so I called the dealership and was hung up on. 
Sent a text message to the automated thing they sent me for Isaiah to pass me off to a sales guy named Corey who we didn't even deal with. 

Now they are telling my husband that they don't even know if they will fix the issues half of which are on the "WE OWE" form from the dealership. 

PLEASE do yourself a favor and find a dealer that actually has some integrity.

I just had a hoagie from Jack's after not going there for a while and it was as great as I remember.
Jack's Place in my opinion makes the best hoagies I in Philly. The highest quality meats, freshest veggies, and the tastiest roll hands down. 
Jack has passed on, but the ladies that run the show really know what they're doing. The quality hasn't changed on bit! They take so much care with the food. My favorite is the Italian hoagie and the Italian tuna hoagie. Realness personified. The wings are superb, and so are the onion rings, roast pork and beef sandwiches and they have a great antipasto station.
When you call ahead your order is always ready. They take a lot of care how they wrap your sandwich and they are very efficient. You can't go wrong here without a doubt.
I'm a little sad that I can't run into Jack at his place or at the racetrack, but I know I will never forget him.

The Bunker is a retro style storefront coffee house, just on the outskirts of the Ybor strip with mostly street parking.  The interior is basically is a house... or a home away from home, maybe that suits it more.

If you get there when they are not crowded, you can practically set up an entire office.  I've come here to study, to work online, and even had a job interview here with an infamous company that we are all too familiar with.

The staff  has always been friendly and welcoming, and have never rushed me.
If I lived and in Tampa and worked independently, you would find me at The Bunker at least once a week.  Since they only keep office hours.

I waited an hour to see my doctor for my scheduled appointment...Really? The waiting room was not even full. I had to wait a 6 weeks to get an appointment. Not worth the waste of time!! The drs are ok but waiting that long for my appointment that lasted 2 minutes and they seemed frustrated when I had questions and that I even came for a mole check (which was referred by my doc) really?????

November 1, 2013 1-hour Photo center, between 4 &5 pm.  

The Tall, scraggly, VERY hairy, & almost middle aged guy.  You know who you are.

  I tried to purchase photos for a friend, but was rudely, and uncomfortably questioned  "Did you take these?"  when some of them "looked professional".  I was not the photographer, however, my knowledge to purchasing these photos was 100 % legal and my right to purchase was taken from me.  I was refused purchase unless I could show proof of copy-right of the photos. 

I was trying to surprise a friend by decorating her apartment with photographs of her and her family.  I was given copies of these photographs to print.  There are only 2 cases here.  

1. The photographer was not a professional so, no copy-right receipt exists, thus making it impossible to convince this dim-witt employee that its legal for me to buy the photos.

 2.  The pictures were from a professional, but the photos were not proofs & they had no copy-right restriction printed on the photo.  And since my friend's family has other copies and prints of the photos they share at home and facebook, my guess in this case the copy-right has been purchased.

Ultimately, I shouldn't have to feel uncomfortable or be treated rudely when it comes to purchasing photos.  I was doing nothing wrong but trying to be thoughtful for a friend.  I was wrongfully accused of trying to commit a crime.

DO NOT PURCHASE PHOTOS FROM WAL-MART!  I WENT TO WALGREENS IMMEDIATELY AND HAD NO PROBLEM RIGHTFULLY PURCHASING MY PICTURES.

While my review for the restaurant portion of BL still stands, the bartenders have clearly upped their game in the last year.  Even on a crowded Thursday night, the time between an empty glass and a full one has been greatly reduced.

This place has a good vibe. It's my Irish pub of choice in Rittenhouse. Much more Irish-y than its neighbor, the Irish Pub. The latter isn't a bad choice in itself - I just prefer the Bards.

Anywhoo, it's your standard bar set in a Philly row. They have a good selection of local beers on their northernmost tap, and a kitschy whiskey dispensing tap mounted on the wall that looks like it was DIY'd, but with talent. They've also got your light beers on tap closer to the dart board, you pansy.

The food here is always changing. I've had a rotation of pub grub standards (chicken fingers, fries, etc) here, and between the breading changing, the fries being spiced/unspiced, and the curry being awesome/mediocre, the food averages out to 3/5. Tasty and satisfying enough to order, but nothing you should feel compelled to try.

Here's to the Bards staying chill.

Pro-tip: 3 dollar Yards pints at Happy Hour and late night (I think). Basically, every time I'm here (usually late night), Yards is almost always on special.

Bonus points: the jukebox has Michael Jackson's "The Lady in My Life." HUGE plus for me. The song doesn't really fit the mood of the place, but it's good to know it's an option if I want to feel pretty.

I was in the area, so I decided to go into the dollar tree because I needed a baby/ birthday bag.... I was a little disappointed with the store! The store was a mess, there was plastic on the floor which can cause a fall, some of the shelves were empty and they had things every where in the isles!!!! 

The coworkers were very nice and I found my gift bags that I needed!!!

For a karaoke box - this place was great. Our room had great acoustics. Took me some time to figure out how to do a search properly on their device, but once we got that down we found most songs were looking for - I would say generally a LOT of newer music and most of the classics!

Went a few times to deal with my asthma and allergies I've had all of my life but I never got it resolved. Honestly who is this doctor (Dr.L) to judge someone based on their gender, weight, look and wth would he only talk about how you need to lose weight and no talk about the reason your there for?!?! NEVER EVER GO HERE!!! They're always behind and will cancel appointments without notice even

This is one of my favorite hibachi restaurants in the city! I ordered takeout for lunch. When I went in to pick up my order it took about 5 minutes for them to acknowledge me standing and waiting. It was only myself and another person in the restaurant so I'm sure they saw me. Once I was acknowledged I paid for my food and left. 
I ordered the hibachi chicken and Shrimp along with noodles and rice. My mini and I split it and given it was fairly good size portions for a lunch plate. I truly never can decide between the noodles and the rice because they both are so delicious. We also received clear soup and salad with our meal. I didn't like that they kept both the soup and the salad on a cart by the register, so we didn't eat it.
Will I be back of course. Hopefully they can be a bit nicer to customers.

Everything here is quality. From their breads to the pastries to their cookies. You could tell there is some high level expertise and attention to details in how they craft their food offerings. Also, they've got a great selection of market goods. They've got kewpie mayo too!

5 stars - Chili oil. In the fridge they've got this chili oil that is soo good. The flavor profile is complex, it doesn't shy away from a nice spice level, and it has these fried onions in it that make it the perfect pairing to fresh steamed rice. And the chili oil is good on their bread too. 

5 stars - Bread bake. Their bread is exactly as described. When they call it a baguette it's the texture and crisp you expect. Any of their sourdough loafs are what you'd expect, a good chew and the air bubbles from a fermented dough. 

5 stars - Cookies. Their cookie flavor combos are so complementary. Depending on the cookie type, they can be crispy or chewy, so it really gives options to different type of cookie eaters. 

5 stars - Pastries. With the standard pastry options, they have different savory and sweet options too, and are unique from what you'd find elsewhere. I really appreciate that. Every time I go I can try something new. 

5 stars - Farmer's market. They can also be found at the Broad Ripple farmers market. Their goods sell out fast there, but it's nice that they go a little north so it's not too far of a drive for me to their downtown location.

We recently purchased a new HVAC system from Williamson's Heating and Cooling. I can't say enough about the quality of the product we received and the exceptional customer service. The installers were not only competent but we were totally at ease having these nice guys in our home. COVID compliant too!

If we could give it no stars at all, we would. Whoever is answering the calls tonight at 7/26/15 at 7:13 pm, should never work customer service. My boyfriend was on the phone with her first, he literally had to repeat his phone number more than 7 times. She kept asking the same question over and over and he was on the phone with her for probably 2-3 mins already and still hasn't gotten to say our first order (we wanted to order 4 different items). Then he hands me the phone, and she starts naming off things we didn't even ask for or wanted. The first order was a medium pizza with creamy garlic ranch sauce with chicken, bacon, and pineapple. She was literally stuck on the creamy garlic ranch part for over 3 mins. Kept saying different sauces that I DIDN'T WANT. Then I say with chicken, bacon, and pineapple. She starts to say, "Okay..so medium pizza with..." So I say, "chicken, bacon, and pineapple." (For the third time by now.) Then she goes, "okay....so medium pizza with..." At this point I say, "I really need to repeat myself again?" So I ask if there's anyone else that can take my order and they're so busy so I just hung up. 

We've ordered from here plenty of times and have never had this much trouble. Over the phone for over 7 mins at least and never even got more information than just our phone number. Whoever that girl is, should never work in customer service.

It's definitely outdated, simple new carpeting or some paint on the walls would do so much for this place! 
The staff are nice and definitely go out of there way to make sure you have what you need. 
The chef at the breakfast buffet went out of his way to make my son eggs the way he wanted them. He is autistic and they where very kind.
The inside pool is super cloudy. The outside pool was definitely better but it was to cold for me. The towels for pool aren't that great either.

This has become my FAVORITE pizza place in Boise/Meridian. I love the high quality ingredients and the fact that my 5 year old can design her own pizza at the table is so fun! I have eaten here a few times and never leave unsatisfied. The waiters are friendly and the service is efficient and high quality. They have a great drink menu and answer any and all questions you may have about the menu. The lunch special is an amazing deal and you can't go wrong with any combo! Eat here..........you won't regret it, I promise!

Very Rude they don't take cards over phone forcing you to pay extra five dollars to wait 50 mins for wrong order when ppl can just order and walk to pick up their order Horrible place pick up 25min ordering 45 to 50 mins never ordering from there again And or J&P SEAFOOD RESTAURANT as well owned by the same ppl ON spruce st

Tai Ke is a bit hidden on Olive Blvd and McKnight. But there was a buzz about this new spot, and my friends wanted to check it out. The restaurant is small but decently sized, but it's big enough to bring a group. I had a group of eight with me for a weekend lunch. 

I am pretty unfamiliar with Taiwanese cuisine but was lucky to have few Taiwanese friends in our group to explain the items on the menu. However, don't hesitate to ask the server questions since the menu doesn't have much detail. The servers are pretty friendly and are willing to help you figure out what you're craving.
